The possibilities of action are limitless.Regardless of the origin of any given action, it will never be entirely dissipated. It may pass beyond or through the system in which it originated, but its existence will not cease.所以说，为什么一个行动会影响其他所有行动，关系密切到基本上不可能单独谈论一个行动的程度，原因明显可见。张力是行动的前提，也是行动固有的性质，行动的可能性无可限量。不管任何一个行动的起源如何，永远不会完全消散，它有可能会越过或经过它源自的系统，但它的存在不会终止。
Tension is infinite.Your time system is indeed the result of tension as it is distorted within your own system, yet the distortion itself, as you see, creates a new reality.And that reality then continues to operate, forming like realities of the sort that can exist within the given conditions already set up by the original distortion.张力是无限的。你们的时间系统其实是张力的结果，因为它在你们自己的系统之内扭曲了，可是如你们所知，这个扭曲本身创造一个新的实相。然后那个实相又继续运作，形成可以在原本的扭曲造成的既定环境之内存在的类似实相。
Distortion, in this respect, has a different meaning than the sort of distortion arising from a misreading of information.Yet in some respects it is similar.An original action can never repeat itself in an identical fashion. Its attempts to do so, never successful, result in a kind of distortion, and this distortion then becomes the basis for a new reality.在这方面，扭曲的意义不同于误读讯息造成的那种扭曲。可是在某些方面却又类似。最初的行动永远不会以一模一样的方式重来一次，它这样做的企图从未成功过，反而造成一种扭曲，然后这种扭曲就变成一个新实相的基础。
The reality then tries to recreate itself in identical fashion, fails, and is again distorted into a further facet of basic reality.This holds true under all circumstances and under all conditions.Recall here the material concerning identities in general.这个新实相接着设法用一模一样的方式重新创造它自己，结果失败，再度被扭曲成基本实相的另一个面貌。这在所有的环境、在所有的状况下，都是如此。这里回想一下讨论本体的资料。
(Among others, see the following sessions: 136 to 139 in Volume 3.)(其中包括下列章节：第三册第136至139节)
A very simple analogy will arise as an artist attempts faithfully to reproduce a landscape.The attempt is obviously doomed to failure, since the necessary actual perspectives in which the landscape exists are denied to him as working materials. He cannot create an actual reproduction of a living landscape.这里非常简单打个比方，就像一位画家企图忠实复制一处风景。这个企图显然注定失败，因为这处风景存在所需的实际视角，无法成为他的创作素材，他无法创造出一片活生生景观的实际复制品。
Such a landscape would have to take up as much physical space as the original.But more, it would have to take up an identical amount of physical time, in terms of past physical existence, which is clearly impossible.这样的风景画占据的物质空间必须和原景观一样多。但是就过去的物质存在来看，它也必须占据数量完全一样的物理时间，这显然不可能。
Such a landscape would have to be composed of the actual elements that compose the original landscape.The artist would have to assemble mountains of rocks, an infinity, that is infinity of molecules, all equally impossible.The best he can do is create a distortion of the original landscape—a creation of an approximation that can comfortably exist within the limited perspectives with which he can work, and using the materials that are at his own command.这样的风景画必须由构成原景观的实际元素组成。画家必须组合漫山遍野的岩石，无穷无尽，那是无穷无尽的分子，所有这一切同样不可能。他能做的充其量只是创造原景观的一个扭曲——利用他可以自由支配的素材，创造一个近似物，让其能够舒服地存在于他所能运用的有限视角之内。
The painting that results is a new reality, but it is also a distortion of the original landscape.The artist may hint at time within his painting, but he cannot capture the physical eons that might be contained in the mountains themselves, which he wishes to reproduce.因此而成的画作是个新的实相，但也是原景观的一种扭曲。画家也许想在他的画中留下时间的线索，但他无法捕捉可能包含在群山本身之中极长的物质时间，而这正是他希望能够复制的。
However his painting contains new realities, and distinctive ones, that would be alien to the original landscape.The actual trees, had he really been able to reproduce them, would then undergo their seasonal changes.The trees in his painting, being artificial reproductions, do not undergo the same physical changes, even while the atoms and molecules that compose the canvas itself, and all the pigments, constantly themselves change.纵使他的画包含了新实相，特别的实相，但仍有别于原景观。实际的树，要是他真的能复制它们，就会经历季节变化。虽然构成画布本身，以及所有颜料的原子和分子一直不断改变，但是他画作中的树是人工复制品，并不会经历同样的物质变化。
The painting, therefore, is both a distortion of reality, and the creation of a new reality.Likewise all realities are formed.因此这幅画既是实相的一个扭曲，也是一个新实相的创造。所有实相也是这样形成的。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:07.Jane was well dissociated. She had spoken at a faster rate.She also said that as she spoke she had received the feeling of a concept from Seth. It was difficult for her to put into words. It had something to do with her perception of two identical masses of landscape, one being meant to duplicate the other.At the same time, she said, the duplicating mass would have to displace another equal mass to make room for the duplication.(10:07。珍顺利出离，说话速度比较快。她也说，她在说话时感觉接收到来自赛斯的一个观念，她虽以将它形诸文字，这是有关于她对两幅一模一样的风景产生的感知，其中一幅要复制另一幅。她说，同一时间，复制的那一幅必须移开另一幅相同的风景，才能为复制品挪出空间。
(Jane remarked that whenever she receives a concept she always will remember at least the gist of the material she has been delivering, even when she has been deeply dissociated.(珍指出，不管何时，每当她接收到一个观念，都至少还会记得她所传述的资料要点，就算她深度出离也一样。
(Jane resumed in a normal voice and at a slower rate at 10:20.)(珍在10:20继续，声音如常，速度较慢。)
Mankind is to some intimate degree acquainted with this attempt of action to recreate itself, for human reproduction is here a case in point, each individual attempting to create a replica, the attempt doomed to failure, but the attempt itself resulting in a distortion of the original action; that is, a distortion of the original individuals, and in the creation of a new reality, this process then being repeated indefinitely.人类对于再造它自己的这个企图，有某种程度的熟悉，因为人类的繁衍在这里是一个很贴切的例子，每个个体都想创造一个复制品，这个企图注定失败，但它本身会产生原行动的一个扭曲；也就是说，一种原个体的扭曲，而且在一个新实相的创造中，这样的过程无限期一再重复。
The distortions are then creative.The nature of action itself is such that tension is one of its positive characteristics, and the tension is the element that causes action to seek expansion in terms of an attempt to duplicate itself.因此这些扭曲具有创造性。行动本身的本质就是如此，所以张力是它的正面特性之一，而就自我复制的企图而言，张力就是导致寻求扩展的要素。
We come therefore to the fact of creative tension.The individual in his psychological state is familiar with creative tension, often in its pure state.So quickly however is the tension transformed into a distortive creation that the sensation of creation is mistakenly accepted as the tension itself, rather than seen for what it is.Creation is the result of tension, though instantly new tension is set up, since tension is a characteristic of action.And each creation, being action, will instantly set up new tension.所以我们要来谈创造张力这个事实。在个体自己的心理状态中，对通常处于纯粹状态的创造张力并不陌生。张力如此快速地转变成一种扭曲的创造，以至于让人无法辨认，于是将创造的觉受误以为是张力本身。创造是张力的结果，但是新的张力会不断发生，因为张力是行动的特性。每一个创造，就是一个行动，会立即产生新的张力。
It is possible, with some discipline, to become familiar with this state of tension from which new creation will so quickly arise. Familiarity with this brief state of tension will allow an individual to use it more efficiently. He can ride it like the crest of a wave.经由一些纪律，有可能熟悉这种张力状态，在其中新的创造会快速产生，熟悉这种短暂的张力状态之后，个体得以更有效率地利用，他可以趁势而起，有如冲上浪头一般。
The act of creation occurs, itself, not at the peak of the wave of tension, but as the wave dissolves into the fulfillment of itself.The exhilarating sensation is the tension.The sensation is usually mistakenly applied as if it accompanied the creation itself, but the creation is the final act, so to speak, of a given tension.创造这个行为本身并不是发生在张力的浪头上，而是在波浪瓦解而完成它自己之时。这种令人振奋的觉受就是张力。这种觉受通常被误用，仿佛它伴随创造本身出现似的，但创造可以说是一个既定张力的最后行动。
The creation is, therefore, the relaxed fulfillment of a tension. This can have practical results, for you will be able to recognize and use the tension itself toward purposeful goals. It can be dissolved or set at rest in any action.Recognizing the tension itself will allow you to choose the action that will result, to some degree.所以说，创造是一个张力的松懈完成，这可能会产生实际的结果，因为你们会有能力认出张力本身，并且利用它达成重大目标，它可以在任何行动中被解散或平息。认出张力本身，让你们或多或少得以选择会产生结果的行动。
Creative distortion, in its relationship with action, affects therefore the creation of thoughts.The principle of creative distortions is mainly responsible for the fact that no identical thought is ever transmitted from one individual to another.Here the material that I have given you on telepathy should be considered.就创造扭曲与行动的关系而言，创造扭曲会影响思想的创造。从一个个体传递到另一个个体的思想之所以不可能一模一样，主要原因就是创造扭曲的原理。这里应该思索一下我给你们的心灵感应资料。
(See the 136th and 137th sessions, among others in Volume 3.)(见第三册第136节和137节等等。)
The thought received in telepathic communications will not, therefore, be the exact thought that was transmitted, but a close approximation, a creative distortion, actually created by the receiver.There are, as I mentioned, no duplication of identities.因此，在心电感应通讯中接收到的思想，不会是原本传输的思想，而是一个非常接近的思想，其实是接收者创造出来的一个创造扭曲。我提过的，本体无法复制。
Now.Compare a thought, an original thought, with our original landscape.The problem would be then the same problem with which our artist was concerned.现在。就拿一个思想，一个原思想，与我们的原景观来做比较。这个问题和我们的画家涉及的问题一样。
Say for example that our individual “A” wanted to transmit this thought to “B”. The thought is as much a reality as the landscape. It is as much a part of individual “A” as the landscape is part of the physical earth.Our imaginary artist could not rip the landscape out of the earth, or bring it to his studio.He could not create an identical landscape because he did not have at his command the perspectives or materials necessary.比方说，我们的个体A想要把思想传输给B，思想和景观一样都是实相，它是个体A的一部分，就像景观是物质地球的一部分。我们充满想像力的画家无法把景观从地球上剥下来，或把它带到画室里。他无法创造一幅完全相同的风景，因为他没有所需的视角或材料可借支配。
Likewise, our individual “A” cannot rip the thought out of the context of his own inner electrical system. He cannot send it to individual “B”. He can send an approximation of it, for the attempt to transmit the thought automatically changes the thought itself.He sends an approximation of the original thought, and this approximation is further changed by “B’s” action as he attempts to receive it.Have we this clear now?同样的，我们的个体A无法把思想从他自己内在的电子系统背景中扯下来，他无法把它传送给个体B，只能传送一个近似物，因为传输思想的这个企图自动改变思想本身。他传输的只是原思想的一个近似物，而当B试图接收时，这个近似物又进一步被B的行动改变。我们这样说清楚吗？
(“Yes.”(“清楚。”
(Seth asked the question because I fell behind in my notes on the above paragraph, and had to ask for its repetition.)(赛斯之所以问这个问题，是因为上述这段我来不及做笔记，不得不请他复述。)
In a like manner for example, the act of dreaming itself changes both the dreamer and the dream.The act of doing anything at all automatically changes the doer.The reality of any action automatically determines that the action will change.同样的，例如做梦这个行为本身既改变做梦的人也改变他的梦。做任何一丁点小事的这个行为，都会自动改变做事的人。任何行动的实相自动决定了该行动会改变。
The creative dilemma, the creative distortion, is of course itself an action that is resolved in further acts.These are basic principles concerning the nature of action, principles that are carried through within any system.They are valid therefore within your own system, within the electrical system, within the dream system, and among all others.创造的两难之局，也就是创造扭曲，本身当然是个在进一步的行为中分解的行动。这些是行动本质的基本原理，在任何系统之内都存在的原理。因此，在你们自己的系统之内、在电子系统之内、在梦系统之内，以及其他所有的系统之内，它们都是有效力的。
The action involved in these sessions, for example, changes us all, yet truly none of us perceive the nature of the entire action of which we are a part.I, for example, cannot perceive the entire future consequences of any one action.I may perceive the entire consequences of any given action within your system or my own, but it is impossible for me to perceive a given action’s consequences as it is felt within all systems, for each action occurs within all systems simultaneously.举例来说，和这几节有关的行动，改变了我们大家，可是我们其实都没有感知到这整个行动的本质，虽然我们是它的一部分。比如说，我无法感知任何一个行动的整个未来结果。我或许可以感知任何一个既定行动，在你们或我的系统之内的整个结果，但对我来说，不可能感知一个既定行动在所有系统之内的结果，因为每个行动同时发生在所有系统之内。
I may use the word future, but I use it only to express that which is beyond my present perceptive limits.It is almost impossible to speak of a single, simple action, though I may do so for conveniences sake.我使用“未来”这个词，但我使用它只是要表达超出我当下感知范围的事物。要谈论一个单一、简单的行动，几乎是不可能的，但是为了方便起见，我可能会这么做。
You may if you prefer end the session; or I will continue, after a short break, into some further material along these same lines.要是你们想要的话，就结束这一节；不然，短暂休息之后，我再继续，进一步谈谈这方面的资料。
(“We’ll end it then.”)(“那么我们就结束吧。”)
Our next session then will be concerned further with the nature of action, and I will speak concerning the complexity of what may appear to be a single action.那么，我们下一节会进一步讨论行动的本质，我会谈到看似单一的行动具有的复杂度。
My fondest regards to you both.I expect you will both get quite springy with the spring. I am in fine fettle.向两位致上我最深情的祝福。我预期两位轻快度过春天，我感觉神采奕奕。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at approximately 10:50.Jane was well dissociated.She said Seth felt very good, and could have carried on indefinitely.)(10:50结束。珍顺利出离。她说赛斯感觉非常好，本来可以一直继续下去。)

SESSION 154 第154节 行动的本质 “看见”声音“听见”视象


MAY 12, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年5月12日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Jane has begun her psychological time experiments, though she is still not on a regular day-to-day basis.Her experiment mentioned by Seth at the opening of the session was not a spectacular one by any means.It involved what Jane calls merely her “good state”.In more exceptional cases this escalates into her version of ecstasy.(珍已经开始心理时间实验，但她尚未每天固定练习。赛斯在本节开头提到的那次实验，绝不算出色。那一次珍说只是她的“良好状况”而已。在更不寻常的状况中，这会逐渐上升到忘我的境界。
(This state is one of thrilling or tingling, or of a singing sensation, that can either suffuse the whole body or perhaps locate itself in one side of the body or in one limb.Both of us have experienced it in varying degrees during psychological time, sometimes intensely. I have also experienced it outside of psy-time.It can indeed be a thrilling experience, making one feel about to be swept up and away.We have been aware of its relation to sound, since we soon learned while in the state that any sound, be it of running water somewhere in the house, or a robins call, would momentarily impart an upsurge to the sensation within the body.Thus sound, even though detected by ear, would act also as a stimulus to the body's detection of the same sound via feeling.(这是一种兴奋、震颤或歌唱的觉受状态，可能弥漫全身，也或许只在身体的一侧或四肢的其中一个部位。我们两人在心理时间中，都有过程度不一的这种经验，有时候很强烈，我也在心理时间以外的时候体验过。这种经验真的可能让人非常兴奋，感觉好像快要被席卷而去似的。我们知道它和声音有关，因为我们在这种状态中很快发现，任何声音，比如屋内某处的水流声或知更鸟的叫声，都立刻增强体内的这种感觉。所以，虽然声音是由耳朵侦测到，但也是一种刺激，促使身体透过感觉侦测到同样的声音。
(For some material on this sensation on Jane's part, see the 39th and 50th sessions in Volumes I and 2, and the attached notes.For the same thing on my part, see sessions 24 and 35 in Volume 1.There are many other accounts of it scattered through our psy-time notes preceding various sessions.(有关珍的这种感觉，资料见第一册第39节和第二册第50节及其注释。至于我这边的同一件事，见第一册第24节与35节。其他很多这方面的记述，散见各节开头提及心理时间的注释。
(Yesterday, deliberately, I mentioned to Jane that Seth had not given us any more material on the inner senses for many sessions.What I meant of course was that he had not catalogued the later material under the various inner senses, as he had originally designated them.I felt that he would eventually do so.Checking the various categories of material against the original list of the inner senses, it was usually easy to see where the two fit together.(昨天，我特意向珍提起，赛斯已经很多节没给我们更多内在感官的资料。我的意思当然是他没有把后来的资料归类为各种不同的内在感官，像他原来那样表明。我感觉他最终会这么做。依据内在感官清单核对各种不同的资料类别，通常可以轻易看出两者的一致之处。
(Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her pace was average, with pauses, her voice quiet.)(珍一边坐下来一边说话，眼睛闭着。她的速度不急不徐，间或停顿，声音轻柔。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
If you recall, many sessions ago, [the 24th] we discussed feeling sound.如果你记得，很多节以前，(第24节)我们讨论过感觉声音。
Ruburt experienced this in his psychological time experiment this afternoon, and it reminded me that more material definitely was needed here.鲁柏在今天下午的心理时间体验到这一件事，提醒我这里肯定需要更多资料。
Basically, the physical body has the potentiality for perceiving stimuli on a generalized basis.I mean by this that although the eyes are for seeing, the ears for hearing and so forth, the potentials of the physical body include the capacity to hear, for example, through any given portion of the bodily expanse.基本上，肉体有潜力感觉广义而言的刺激。我的意思是，虽然眼睛是用来看、耳朵是用来听的，但是肉体的潜力不仅止于此，透过身体延伸出的任何部位，都有可以听见声音的能力。
The same applies to seeing, and obviously to feeling or touching.It goes without saying that this potentiality is very seldom realized, but it is part of the human heritage.It is the learning process that conditions you to translate a given stimuli into data that will be picked up by a given physical sense; that is, translations always occur in any case.这同样适用于看，显然也适用于感觉或触摸。不用说也知道，这个潜力少有人知，但它却是人类天赋传承的一部分。你们之所以会认为，一个既定肉体感官才能接收来自既定刺激转译的资料，正是受到学习过程制约所致；也就是说，不管在任何状况下，转译工作一直都在进行。
You may see an automobile for example with your eyes, and hear its sound through your ears, but it is also within the human capacity, ideally speaking, to hear the sight of the car, and to see the sound of the car.Practically speaking these capacities have been overlooked in human development simply because the ego hit upon the present method of perception, and clung to it.比方说，你们可以用眼睛看到一辆汽车，经由耳朵听见它的声音，但是理想上来说，听见车子的视象、看见车子的声音，也在人类能力范围之内。实际上，这些能力在人类发展中之所以被忽略，只因为自我无意间发现目前的感知方法，就一直坚持不放。
In other species within your field, however, some of these various methods have been chosen and utilized.Many animals for example literally see through the sense of smell. They quite literally perceive what you would call the sight of another animal, through the use of the sense of smell.不过，在你们的场域之内，其他物种则选择这些不同方法的其中一些。举例来说，很多动物真的可以透过嗅觉看东西，它们透过嗅觉的使用，名副其实地感知你们所谓另一只动物的视象。
They build up multitudinous variations of odors to build the likeness of a structure complete in its translations as to size, weight and so forth.Sound, then, can be felt as well as heard, although you might say in such cases that the sound is heard in the depths of the tissues.This however being an analogy.它们累积众多不同气味，建立一个完整的架构，以将气味转译成大小、重量等等。所以，声音可以被感觉到，也可以被听到，虽然你们在这种状况下可能会说，声音是在组织深处被听到。不过，这是一个比喻。
Now for a moment we will return to our material on action, and you may perhaps see why this fits in so well here.No action is identical to any other action.An action is never entirely dissipated, though it may pass beyond its particular field of origin.This transference, incidentally, from one system to another, necessarily changes the action itself; but for simplicity’s sake we may say that an action has its reality within many systems simultaneously.现在，待会儿我们再回来讨论行动的资料，你们或许就会了解为什么这一部分这么适合放在这里。没有任何一个行动和其他任何一个行动一模一样。行动也许可以越过那个特定的原发场域，但它永远不会全然消失。附带一提，从一个系统到另一个系统的这种转移，必然会改变行动本身；但为了简单起见，我们可以说，行动同时在很多系统之内有它的实相。
The sight of our imaginary automobile, therefore, is perceived by you as a visual stimulus, because you are conditioned to perceiving it in such a fashion.But it is also possible to perceive our automobile in entirely different fashions within different realities, and from various perspectives.因此，我们想像中的那辆汽车，它的视象被你们感知为一个视觉刺激，因为你们受到制约，以这样的方式感知它。不过，在不同的实相之内，也有可能以全然不同的方式，而且是从各种不同的视角感知我们的汽车。
It is even possible for the physical individual to train himself to change the nature of his own perception of such objects.It is not a question of the car having certain properties, being real to one perceptive view and therefore necessarily unreal to another.To a very large degree, the portion of any reality that you can perceive is determined largely not by the given, so-called real object itself, but from the perspective, and because of, the senses with which you perceive it.肉身个体甚至可以自行训练，改变他自己这类物体的知觉本质。问题不在于车子具有某些属性，对某个感知观点来说是真实的，因此对另一个观点来说就一定不真实。在任何实相里，你们可以感知的那部分，很大程度主要是由视角，而不是由既定的真实物体本身决定，此外也是你们用来感知它的感官所致。
The scent image built up by the animal is every bit as real as the visual image.Action cannot be caught and held, and the nature of perceiving an action changes the very nature of the action itself.It is indeed, here again, that tension causes such a change.动物建立的气味意象，和视觉意象相比毫不逊色。行动无法被抓住和掌控，去感知一个行动，这件事本质上就会改变该行动的本质。这里再一次，张力确实会导致这样的改变。
Ruburt, in feeling sound, merely experienced the sound from a different perspective. You have had this experience more frequently perhaps than Ruburt, Joseph.鲁柏感觉到声音，只不过是从一个不同的角度体验到这个声音而已，约瑟，你的这种经验可能比鲁柏还多。
While we are somewhat on the subject, I have not forgotten that we have left behind our discussions on the inner senses, and really with good reason.When we return to the inner senses again, we will be able to discuss them in further depth because of the material that we have covered in the meantime.虽然我们谈了一点这个主题，但我并没忘记我们暂停讨论的内在感官，而且真的有充分理由。等到我们再度回来谈内在感官，就能够更深入讨论它们，因为我们的资料同时涵盖了这部分。
I suggest your first break.我建议你们第一次休息。
(Break at 9:26.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery.She resumed in the same quiet manner at 9:37.)(9:26。珍的第一段传述一如往常出离。她在9:37分继续，同样轻声细语。)
Since perceiving an action is itself an action, the perceiving must because of its nature to some extent distort the object of perception.由于感知一个行动这件事本身就是一个行动，因为感知的本质，所以必然会扭曲感知对象到某种程度。
Again, in this distortion we see the creation, however minute, of a new reality.The universe is cohesive, but it is also more various than you know even now.The nature of our object, our automobile for example, is indeed largely determined by those who perceive it, for it is different things in reality, and not one thing.Electrically it has an identity, and would be perceived as an entirely different phenomena from within an electrical system, where there would be no perceptors of physical data.再一次，在这种扭曲中，无论多么微小，我们都会看见一个新实相的创造。宇宙是向内凝聚的，但即便现在，它的多样化却也超乎你们所知。我们的物质本质，以汽车为例，确实大部分取决于那些感知它的人，因为在实相中它是许多不同的东西，而不是同一个东西。在电子层面上，它有一个本体，但在一个物质资料感知者不存在的电子系统之内，可能会被感知成一个完全不同的现象。
Within your field the automobile is perceived mainly as a physical object.Within some systems the same automobile would appear to be no more than a shadow.Within some systems the automobile would not be perceived at all, unless it were in motion.In other systems it would not be perceived at all, unless it were not in motion.在你们的场域之内，汽车主要被感知为一种实物。在一些系统之内，同一辆车看起来只不过是一个影子而已。在一些系统之内，除非这辆车在动，否则根本不会被感知到。而在另外一些系统中，除非它不动，否则根本不会被感知到。
These various conceptions of the automobile would also apply of course to the perception of any physical beings within the car; that is, their reality would also be perceived differently, according to the perspective systems which viewed them.当然，对这辆车的这些不同概念，也适用于车内任何物质存在体的感知；也就是说，它们的实相也会以不同的方式被感知，根据观看它们的感知系统而定。
You must indeed for practical reasons pretend as if the automobile had no reality except the reality with which you are familiar, but this is not the case.I mentioned feeling sound because this is a capability that lies latent within your own physical system, but this same sort of a juggling of perspective data is what happens, generally speaking, when inhabitants of a different system perceive realities that also have an existence within your own system.基于实际所需，你们的确必须假设，好像除了你们熟悉的实相之外，这辆车没有其他实相似的，但实情并非如此。我提过可以去感觉声音，因为这是潜藏在你们自己的肉体系统之内的一种能力，但是当不同系统的居民所感知到的实相，也存在于你们自己的系统之内，此时一般而言，这种感知资料的戏法一样会发生。
It is really a building up of idea into a whole pattern that can be perceived by the camouflage senses.Any reality therefore will be variously perceived, and the nature of the reality will necessarily be distorted in the very attempt to perceive it.Here again we have our creative tension, whereby a new reality is formed as a result of the distortion itself.Within your system colors may be perceived as sound. Their connections with human moods is only too apparent.伪装感官能够感知的，真的是意念累积成一整个模式。因此任何实相会以不同的方式被感知，而且实相的本质，必然会被这个想要感知它的企图扭曲。这里再说一次，我们有创造张力，扭曲本身导致了一个新的实相成形。在你们的系统之内，颜色可以被感知为声音，它们和人类心情的连结，再明显不过了。
They may also be tasted, as well as sniffed, and these experiences are actually to some fair degree carried on continually beneath awareness, all adding up to the individual’s perception of a given color.Colors may even be perceived through an inner sense of balance.Their stability or instability is, therefore, subconsciously appreciated.它们也可以用嘴巴来尝，用鼻子来闻，这些经验其实或多或少是在觉知之下持续不断进行，全部累积成个体对一个既定颜色的感知。颜色甚至可以经由负责平衡的内在感官来感知。因此，在潜意识可以察知颜色的稳定或不稳定。
Emotions may even cause a color reaction.Any reality, regardless of which system it originates within, will appear to some degree within all systems.Even within your own system, though perhaps on a subconscious level, all emotions have a reality in color.They have, as you know, a chemical reaction which is sniffed by other animals.情感甚至可能引起颜色反应。任何实相，不管源自哪个系统，某种程度都会出现在所有系统之内。即使在你们自己系统之内，虽然或许是在一个潜意识层面，所有情感在颜色上都有一个实相。你们知道，它们有其他动物嗅得到的一种化学反应。
From your odor, an animal instantly builds up an image of the state of your psychological condition.动物从你们的气味，立即建立一个你们心理状况的意象。
I am not going to hold a very long session this evening. Rather than give you fairly frequent short vacations, I may at times close a session early.We still come out ahead in terms of time.We are heading here indeed, slowly but surely, toward a thorough discussion of the inner senses, which could not be given until you had a good background in the nature of action itself.For you should be able to see now that the inner senses allow a more faithful perception of basic reality than the outer senses could ever give.今晚的课我不会上太长，我可能偶尔会提早下课，而不是经常给你们短期的休假。就时间来说，我们还是很有收获。我们目前的确朝着彻底讨论内在感官的方向前进，虽然进度不快但很确实，等你们对行动的本质有十足的基本认识之后，我才会给你们这部分的资料。你们现在应该能够了解，比起外在感官，内在感官更能够让人更加如实感知基本实相。
Reality is indeed not necessarily that which is constant within the various appearances of reality through all systems, as it is the perception of the whole picture of reality, or the sum of all reality as seen within the various systems.This involves quite a complicated point, and implies a complicated position; for true reality would not be completely either the reality of an automobile, say, as it appears within the physical system, or as it appears within the electrical system.It would not be that which appears identical to the two systems, but it would be indeed the sum of the realities of all systems, as applied to our weary automobile.在所有系统当中各式各样的实相外观之内，实相其实不一定都一致不变，因为感知到的是，在各个不同系统之内所见的整个实相画面，或所有实相的总和。这涉及到一个相当错综复杂的重点，而且隐含着一个错综复杂的位置；因为真正的实相，既不完全是出现在物质系统之内的汽车实相，也不完全是出现在电子系统之内的汽车实相。真正的实相在两个系统中看起来不会一模一样，反而真的是所有系统的实相总和，我们这种累坏了的汽车也是如此。
The inner senses, by being free of camouflage information, are more or less (in quotes) “pure” perceptors, perceiving with but little prejudice of many realities while being imprisoned by none.不受伪装资讯束缚的内在感官，或多或少是纯粹的感知器，在没有任何桎梏之下，对很多实相的感知几乎不带任何偏见。
I suggest here a short break.我建议现在稍微休息一下。
(Break at 10:05.Jane was well dissociated.She resumed at a somewhat faster rate at 10:15.)(10:05。珍顺利出离。10:15分，她以稍快的速度继续口述。)
Concerning Joseph's point about sound; sound alone, entering the body, instantaneously changes it.至于约瑟对声音的观点；光是声音本身，在进入身体时就立刻改变了。
Any perception instantly changes the perceiver. It also changes the thing perceived, and this we will discuss at a later session, for it involves the other side of the coin, so to speak.任何感知都会立即改变感知者，也改变被感知的事物，这我们改天上课会讨论，因为它是一体的两面，可以这么说。
Any action, any reality, irregardless, constantly and instantaneously changes.There are no exceptions to this rule.Any appearance of permanence is illusion.任何行动、任何实相，不管怎样，一直都是瞬息万变。这个规则没有例外。任何永久的表相，都是幻相。
I will indeed now close our session, the reason mainly being that Ruburt has been oriented in a quickened fashion toward our work since he began his book again, and he has used additional energy in doing so.I am always conscientiously aware of his condition at any time.It is only the transition here that has caused the additional use of energy, and he is readily adapting himself so that he will not be under strain.Our sessions have been highly compact as of late also, and intensified in energy content.我现在真的要结束我们这一节，主要是因为鲁柏从再度开始忙他的书以后，就快马加鞭，鞭策我们的工作，而且他这么做也使用了额外的能量。无论何时我对他的状况向来都有意识觉知。这里之所以会使用额外能量，只是转变所致，而他也很快调整了自己，摆脱压力。最近我们的课非常扎实，能量的浓度也增高。
As always, my heartiest good wishes to you both, and one small note for Ruburt's edification:a beef bouillon in mid afternoon would serve him well.Incidentally, his system automatically as a rule seeks those foods that tend to build up the particular sort of energy that he uses in the main.As a rule therefore, proteins are indeed a most beneficial food to him, and it is for this reason that he automatically seeks them out.一如既往，我向你们俩致上最衷心的祝福，也要给鲁柏一个小注以便启发他；下午三点左右喝碗牛肉清汤，对他会很有帮助。附带一提，他的系统通常会自动去寻找的那些食物，都会增强他主要使用的一种特定能量。所以，原则上蛋白质对他而言真的是最有益的食物，这也是他自动找出这些食物的原因。
Other personalities do not benefit in the same way from proteins, and should not use them as a main portion of their diet.This however does not apply to you, Joseph.其他人格不会以同样方式从蛋白质获益，也不应该把它当作饮食的主要部分。约瑟，无论如何，这种方式并不适合你。
I will now close, my spring pigeons.我现在要结束了，我春天的鸽子们。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:25.Jane was dissociated as usual.)(10:25结束，珍一如往常出离。)

SESSION 155 第155节 ESP书合约　摆钟


MAY 17, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1964年9月16日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Jane has received her contract for her ESP book from Frederick Fell.For several days she has been debating over the terms it contains, liking some and not too fond of others.We have discussed it together also.(珍已经收到弗雷德里克·费尔[Frederick Fell]出版社寄来的ESP一书合约。这几天她一直在斟酌里面的条款，有些喜欢，有些不怎么喜欢。我们也一起讨论过。
(This evening Jane checked with her pendulum technique, and learned that it would be best for her to sign the contract as it stands. Mr. Fell has already made some changes in the contract, as requested by Jane.The pendulum also advised her against a trip to New York City at this time.I asked myself the same questions with my own pendulum, and received the same answers.The upshot of all this was that by session time we had about decided to sign the contact.(今晚珍利用摆钟技巧求证，得知她最好一字不改就签约，费尔先生已经按照珍的要求在合约上做了一些修改。摆钟也建议她此时不宜前往纽约市旅行。我用我的摆钟问了相同的问题，得到的答案也一样。这一切最后的结果是，上课前我们几乎已经决定要签约了。
(Again Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed, in a normal voice with some pauses.)(再一次，珍闭着眼睛一边坐下来一边说话，声音正常，停顿几次。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening. Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯”。)
The relationship with Frederick Fell will be a good one, although the present contract reflects the publisher’s caution, as well as the money already received reflects an impulsive belief in Ruburt on the publisher’s part.你们和弗雷德里克·费尔出版社会有不错的关系，虽然目前的合约反映出版商的小心谨慎，但是收到的钱也已经反映出版商那边对鲁柏出自冲动的信任。
The caution can later work to Ruburt’s advantage, in that Fell is usually cautious in business relationships.The impulsiveness caused him to forward the money already received, however.Undoubtedly Ruburt could receive better clauses if he pressed for them. At this point however, it will be to his advantage to leave matters as they are.这种小心谨慎以后对鲁柏有利，因为费尔对于业务关系通常态度谨慎。然而，冲动促使他将收到的钱转交出去。如果鲁柏去争取，肯定可以得到更好的条款，不过，在这节骨眼上，顺其自然对他比较有利。
A later trip to New York, perhaps when the manuscript is completed, may however prove most beneficial.Also a lively concern shown by Ruburt in his letters as to publicity matters and promotion, with mention later of other books in the field that he plans.稍后再去纽约，也许在手稿完成的时候，到头来可能证明最有帮助。鲁柏在信上对宣传和促销表现出强烈的关切，后来还提到他在这个领域计划出版的书。
He could indeed press for better clauses now, but in one way he would lose a certain advantage.He is an unknown quantity to the publisher to a large degree. His letter, however, did make an impression upon Mr. Fell.Ruburt is the underdog at this point. He has however gained several advantages, as you know, in altering the terms originally offered.他现在的确可能争取更好的条款，但某方面也会失去某个优势。对出版商来说，他是个很不确定的未知数，不过，他的信确实让费尔先生印象深刻。鲁柏这时候处于劣势，但是，你们知道，原来的一些条款变更后，已经让他得到许多好处。
The book will be successful in terms of beginning to establish Ruburt in reputation, and also successfully in financial terms.Because this contract is less than Ruburt could press for, the next contract will be a much better one, since the publisher will then feel rather embarrassed concerning this contract.这本书将会成功，不但会为鲁柏树立声望，也会获利。虽然在这份合约上，鲁柏争取不到太好的条件，但下一份合约会好很多，因为到时候出版商会对这份合约觉得很不好意思。
Ruburt of course should make his own decision, with your help. I am stating simply what I see.鲁柏当然应该在你的协助下做出自己的决定，我只是把我了解的说出来而已。
(Jane now took a very long pause, sitting quite still for well over a minute.)(珍这时候停顿很久，安静端坐超过一分钟。)
A trip now would not be nearly as advantageous as a trip later.Ruburt's concern should be with his manuscript.After this book he will be in a much better bargaining position.The added worries involved are not now worth the mental and psychic strains that they would cause.现在去旅行不会比晚一点去旅行好。鲁柏应该还是挂心他的手稿。在这本书之后，他的谈判筹码会好很多。现在不值得为了此徒增烦恼，承受其带来的心理和心灵压力。
This could reflect in the book itself.In one way he will not be making as much money as he could if he insisted upon changes in the contract.On the other hand the important thing here is that the book be completed with full psychic and creative powers, without distraction.The book will be an important one, and in the overall the money difference will not be great enough to tip the scales.The experience in the business will be invaluable in any case.这可能反映在书本身。一方面，如果他坚持变更合约，他赚到的钱就会比较少。另一方面，这里重要的是，他心无旁骛，运用充分的心灵和创造力量完成这本书。这将会是一本重要的书，而且整体来说，金钱的多寡不是关键。无论如何，在生意上的这个经验弥足珍贵。
The most important clause, the option clause, has been settled in Ruburt’s favor.He has done very well, actually, in maintaining fairly decent equilibrium.最重要的条款，也就是选择权条款，谈定的内容对鲁柏有利。事实上，他把两方之间的平衡维持得相当合宜。
There suggest your first break.我建议你们第一次休息。
(Break at 9:18.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery, remembering some of the material in a general way.She resumed in the same quiet voice at 9:34.)(9:18。珍的第一段传述一如往常出离，大体上记得一些资料，9:34以同样轻柔的声音继续。)
This endeavor, the book, should be carried on now unceasingly, with periods of complete relaxation or change weekends. But the work should be intensive during the week.这份努力，这本书，现在应该持续不断进行下去，中间要有完全放松的时段或周末休息，但是平常应该密集工作。
There should be no vacation unless Ruburt takes the manuscript with him and works upon it.This would work out very well both for him and the book.His natural energies will carry him along here, and these energies will be reflected and caught in the book itself.除非鲁柏随身携带手稿创作，否则不应该度假。这对他、对这本书都非常好。这里他的自然能量会带着他走，书本身也会反映和再现这些能量。
It is to his advantage that the earlier publisher did not take the book.It is the subject matter of the book that intrigued both publishers, plus Ruburt’s belief in the book.But it was also the subject matter, to some degree, that made Mr. Fell cautious, and that finally caused the earlier publisher to turn it down.之前的出版商没有接受出版这本书，对他是有利的。引起两家出版社兴趣的是这本书的主题，加上鲁柏对这本书的信念。但是，让费尔先生小心翼翼，以及最后导致之前的出版商拒绝，某种程度也是因为这个主题。
(Jane now began to cough.She had been sipping some Jbiit juice at break.The coughing was not violent but it became persistent.She sat with her eyes closed for a minute or two while she tried to control it.)(这时珍开始咳嗽。她在休息时喝了一些果汁。咳嗽并不剧烈但一直反复不断。她闭眼坐着一两分钟，设法控制它。)
I suggest a break.我建议休息一下。
(Break at 9:39.Jane had been dissociated, but toward the last realized she was coughing.Seth, she said, took a break so that she could rest.She drank some water, remarking that as far as she could remember this was the first time she had ever so interrupted a session.Without checking each session, I agree.(9:39分休息。珍已出离，但到最后她发觉自己在咳嗽。她说，赛斯为了让她休息，所以暂停。她喝了一些水，说就她记忆所及，她还是头一遭这样中断一节课。我不必回头确认每一节资料，就同意她说的没错。
(Once again Jane resumed in the same quiet voice, at 10:44.)(10:44分，珍再度以同样轻柔的声音继续。)
A paperback edition will indeed appear.平装本真的会出现。
I wanted this evening to discuss these matters, since you have both been concerned with them.I am aware of the work done on the book so far, and find that it is indeed quite remarkable.今晚我想要讨论这些事情，因为你们两个都和它们有关。我知道这本书目前的进度，觉得它真的相当出色。
The Seth book will be finished at the correct time.赛斯书会在对的时间完成。
Ruburt may trust the pendulum, although care should be taken as far as predictions are concerned, though with training the pendulum will give valid answers to predictions.鲁柏可以信任摆钟，虽然经过训练，摆钟就可以为预测提供有效答案，但是就预测而言，还是要多加小心。
Our Wednesday evening session may well be somewhat longer than usual, since for this one I was mainly concerned with discussing the practical problem at hand, since it is important that the air be cleared in this respect.Do you, Joseph, have any questions of your own concerning the book?我们星期三晚上的课不妨比平常稍微长一些，因为这一节我最关心的是，讨论眼前的实际问题，理清这方面的疑虑很重要。约瑟，你自己对于这本书有没有任何问题？
(“No, I think we've covered everything I had in mind.”)(“没有，我想我挂虑的事我们都涵盖到了。”)
The main points, I believe, have been taken care of.我相信，主要的重点都照顾到了。
I will here again suggest that Ruburt return to a definite scheduled psychological time habit. The walk to the river is an excellent idea for you both.And your suggestion, Joseph, concerning suppers there, is a very good one. You will both find it effective and refreshing.我在这里要再次建议鲁柏，恢复明确的定期心理时间习惯，散步到河边对你们两位而言是极好的点子。还有，约瑟你提议到那边吃晚餐，也是个很好的主意，你们两位都会觉得不但有效，又令人精神大振。
Ruburts predictions and his dream records will again improve.To some degree he was tied up in knots, although his condition is far superior to what it would have been under the same circumstances at any time in the past.For short periods, sunbathing will be restful for him.鲁柏的预测和梦记录将会再进步。虽然他的状况远比过去在相同处境下的状况好，但某种程度上，他已经陷入困境。日光浴可以让他得到充分的休养。
(“How about the way we use the pendulum to check our predictions, after the event?Is that a valid use oft it?”)(“在事件之后，我们使用摆钟查验预测的方式，你觉得怎么样？这样用法有效吗？”)
The pendulum can be used to check predictions, although such a study will involve long-term experimentation.Any material proof of this sort is extremely difficult, since oftentimes you pick up a generalized picture of coming events, so to speak, and the words that you use are so literal that they cannot convey the whole picture sufficiently enough so that validity can be proven, in your terms.By all means continue.摆钟可以用来查验预测，不过这样的研究需要长期实验。任何这种的物质证明极为困难，因为你们常常为即将来到的事件挑选一个整体的画面，而且你们使用的文字不够精确，因此不足以充分传达整体画面，按照你们的说法，也无法证实效力。不管怎样，继续吧。
Ruburt now is in a very relaxed state.I will leave him in it, and close this short but most fruitful session.Wednesday’s session however will be a long and compact one. Longer perhaps in time than usual, and even more compact in terms of material delivered.鲁柏现在处于非常放松的状态。我会让他留在其中，结束这节简短但成果丰硕的课。不过，星期三的课会是一节既长又扎实的课，时间或许比平时长，甚至传述的资料也会更扎实。
Our spring and summer sessions should be particularly enjoyable to us all.If you have any questions, however, I will answer them.我们春天和夏天的课，对我们每个人来说应该都特别愉快。不过呢，如果你有任何问题，我会回答。
(“How come the pendulum will sometimes say Jane or I made valid predictions, when we don't see any connection consciously?”(“有时候摆钟会说我或珍的预测有效，为什么我们在意识上却看不出任何连结呢？”
(For many months now both Jane and I have followed a practice of making perhaps half a dozen predictions for the following day. Usually each one consists of three or four words at the most.On the day the predictions were made for, we check them against what we can consciously remember of the days events.It is great fun to make them, and was Janes idea originally.(好几个月以来，我和珍每天都固定为隔天大约做6个预测，通常每个预测最多包含3或4个字。到了我们预测的那天，会依据我们在意识上能够记得的当日事件，核对它们。做预测非常有趣，这是珍先想出来的点子。
(Lately we have begun using the pendulum to “verify” the validity of our predictions, and our interpretation of them.To our surprise, we have discovered that the pendulum does not always agree with our conscious interpretations.At times it will agree with our predictions and our interpretations. At times it will not agree with our interpretation of what it calls a valid prediction.And at times it will state that a prediction is valid, when we can see nothing during the following day's events to tie to the prediction.)(最近，我们又开始用摆钟来“验证”我们的预测以及我们的解读是否有效。出乎意料的是，我们发现摆钟不一定同意我们有意识的解读。有时候它会同意我们的预测和解读，有时候不同意我们对所谓准确预测的解读，又有些时候它会说某个预测有效，但我们却看不出隔天究竟哪件事和预测有关。)
The range is very large, oftentimes too large, for the conscious mind to perceive a particular segment of it.Clairvoyant material comes constantly. Some of it is used and acted upon. Other portions are discarded simply because the particular information is not pertinent.对意识心来说，若要特定一个片段，范围非常之大，通常太大了。千里眼的资料持续不断进来，有些会使用到，并采取行动，其余部分则被抛弃，只因为那个资讯不相干。
Tell Ruburt that he can now rest assured concerning the book.告诉鲁柏，书的事他现在大可放心。
My best and fondest regards to you both.Ruburt has used much energy in worrying about the contract in general.For this reason I wanted to discuss it this evening, and because his energies were momentarily depleted I am holding a rather short session.向你们两位献上我最好最深情的祝福。鲁柏已经用掉很多能量在担忧整个合约，为了这个原因，我今晚想要讨论它，而且因为他的能量很快用尽。所以我才会上了这么一节相当短的课。
We will return to our regular sessions, and to a continuation of our discussions.You will both be better off however for this evening's session, and I think you will notice an assured, calm, yet sure increase in Ruburt’s energies.You are doing very well, incidentally.I bid you now both a fond good evening.And if Ruburt does not watch out, then I will charge him 10 percent as his agent.我们会回到我们的正规课，继续讨论。无论如何，今晚的课会让你们两位的境况好转，我认为你们真的会看到鲁柏的能量确定、平静但又稳健地增加。顺带一提，你们做得非常好。现在我祝你们两位有个愉快的夜晚。如果鲁柏不多加留意，我就要跟他收取一成的经纪费用喔。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:06.Jane was very well dissociated.)(10:06结束。珍非常顺利出离。)

SESSION 156 第156节　自我的重要性


MAY 19, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年5月19日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Jane had no idea of the material for the session.She spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed, in a quiet voice, and with pauses.Her voice was very amused as she began the session; she smiled as she spoke.)(珍对于这节的资料没什么概念。她闭着眼睛一边坐下来一边说话，声音轻柔，中间偶有停顿。在开始这节时，她的声音乐不可支；面带微笑说话。)
Good evening—晚安——
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
—my springtime robins, though you are not as plump as springtime robins, nor is your chirrup quite as melodious. Nor, for that matter, is my own.——我春天的更鸟儿，不过你们不像春天的知更鸟儿那么胖嘟嘟，叫声也没有那么悦耳，就此而言，我自己也一样没有。
I have watched with some amusement the proceedings of the last few days, as Ruburt involved himself with his contract, hemmed and hawed, worried it and clucked.我看着最近几天的发展，觉得很好笑，鲁柏陷入合约的困扰中，犹豫不决，担心害怕。
I am not one to say I told you so necessarily. However, I did tell you so, not only concerning the book sale, but also concerning the fact that it would be advantageous for Ruburt to leave his gallery position.His ability to focus direction of energy in his writing has vastly improved, due to the last months’ labors, and will show in his book.我可不是事后诸葛亮，现在才放马后炮，我的确跟你们提过这本书的买卖，也曾提及辞掉画廊的工作对鲁柏有利的这个事实。因为上个月的努力，他把能量关注在写作上的能力大为提高，这个能力也会展现在他的书里。
(Seth suggested Jane leave the gallery job in the 82nd session, August27,1964, and she soon did so.In the 92nd session, September 28,1964, Seth predicted the sale of Janes book on ESP by name.Today Jane signed her contract for the book, and will mail it to F. Fell tomorrow.)(1964年8月27日第82节，赛斯建议珍辞掉画廊的工作，而她也很快付诸行动。1964年9月28日第92节，赛斯对于珍卖出这本名叫ESP的书做了预测。今天珍签了这本书的合约，明天就会寄给费尔。)
Now, we will speak again concerning action.现在，我们再来谈谈行动。
Our material on the fifth dimension seemed almost infinite to you at the time.That is, the fifth dimension appeared infinite in its complexity, but you see that it is but one dimension within an infinite number of dimensions.For there are infinite possibilities in the patterns which action can of itself form.我们谈过的第五维度资料，此时对你们而言几乎是无限的。也就是说，第五维度的复杂度看来是无限的，但你们也知道，它只不过是无数个维度之中的一个维度而已。因为在行动可以自行成形的模式中，有无限的可能性。
(See the 12th session for Seth’s first discussion of the fifth dimension.)(见第12节，赛斯首次讨论第五维度。)
I do not intend to number indefinitely, or list, an endless number of dimensions of actuality, though we will go into this later to some small degree.I am much more concerned for now that you understand the dimensions of action as they exist within the dream world, within psychological realities, and within other scopes with which you are yourselves somewhat familiar.我不想要算出或列出数不尽的现实维度，但是这我们以后会稍微讨论到。我现在更关切的是，你们了解行动维度，因为它们存在于梦世界之内、在心理实相之内，以及你们自己有点熟悉的其他领域之内。
Your experiments with the pendulum are quite helpful to you, in that the subconscious is allowed, through its own action, to make itself more readily available.Your own conscious awareness is increased because you are then aware of inner actions with which the conscious mind had not been familiar.Here we have a coming together of actions, a joining and an immersion of one action within another:the action of the subconscious in answering questions put to it by the conscious mind, (use brain rather than mind), and the acceptance, which is itself action on the part of consciousness, of the answers received.你们的摆钟实验对你们很有帮助，因为透过它自己的运作，潜意识得以更容易被触及。你们自己的意识觉知升高，因为你们届时对意识心不曾熟悉的内在行动有了觉知。这里我们有了行动的聚合，一个行动加入和浸没在另一个行动之内；潜意识采取的行动，是回答意识心(使用头脑而非心智)提出的问题，而意识心采取的行动，是接受得到的答案。
Here the self, by becoming part of greater action, increases its own ability to deal with action.The principle that action acts upon itself is extremely important when we are dealing with psychological action.The principle that action is self-generating, and that it cannot be withdrawn, is also vital in connection with psychological action.在这里，自己借由变为更大行动的一部分，增加了它本身处理行动的能力。行动会对它本身起作用，这个原理在我们处理心理行动时极其重要。在与心理行动的连结中，行动是自行产生而且无法撤销的这个原理，一样具有举足轻重的地位。
Energy cannot be retained. It must be discharged.The very attempt to deny an action automatically changes the nature of the action, and also changes the nature of the individual who attempts to deny it.All energy seeks to materialize itself, which is another way of saying that action must act.能量无法保留，必须排出。想要否定某个行动的企图，会自动改变那个行动的本质，也会改变那个企图否定行动的个体所具有的本质。所有能量全都想化为具体，另一种说法就是，行动必须行动。
In the psychological realm it goes without saying that a repressed emotion is never really repressed, since action cannot be retained. It must change.The cause of such difficulties lies not in the repression of an emotion, for this is impossible.The emotion in one way or another, will out, but the difficulty lies in the attempt to repress the emotion. This attempt is itself an action.在心理界域中，不用说也知道，被压抑的情感从来没有真的被压抑，因为行动无法被阻挡，它一定会改变。造成这类难题的原因不在于情感的压抑，因为这是不可能的。不管用什么管道，情感都会找到出口，但是难题就在于压抑情感的企图，这个企图本身就是一个行动。
There is a term used occasionally to the effect that an emotional block is like a wall. The analogy is an excellent one.I have told you earlier that there are other kinds of structures beside physical structures. Emotions and thoughts have their own structures, that may be manipulated in the same manner that physical objects are manipulated, generally speaking.有个偶尔用到的说法是，情感的阻塞就像一堵墙，这个比喻太棒了。我之前告诉过你们，物质结构之外还有其他种类的结构，情感和思想有自己的结构，一般来说，操纵这些结构的方式，与操纵物体的方式相同。
An action has reality, as you know, within every possible field of activity.An emotion has an electrical and chemical structure. This is extremely important.It is not a structure that takes up space as you know it, obviously, but it is a structure nevertheless, and could be compared to the appearance of dream locations.你们知道，行动在每一个可能的活动场域之内都有实相。情感的电子和化学结构，这一点极其重要。显然，它不是占据你们所知空间的一种结构，即便如此，它也是一种结构，可以比作是梦地点出现的地方。
(In Volume 2, see the 44th session for material on dream locations.)(有关梦地点的资料，见第二册第44节。)
Emotions are a quite natural portion of action, and left to themselves are fluid. They have electrical validity, and shape.When an attempt is made to reject an emotion, this does not affect the emotion half as much as it affects the individual involved.The act of rejection in itself is detrimental and doomed to failure.情感是行动当中相当自然的一部分，在不受干扰时是流动的，它们具有电子效力和形状。如果试图抗拒情感，这影响情感的程度还不到影响当事人程度的一半。抗拒情感的这个行为本身不但有害，而且注定失败。
I suggest your first break.我建议你们第一次休息。
(Break at 9:30.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery.She resumed in the same quiet manner at 9:39.)(9:30分休息。珍的第一段传述一如往常出离。9:39分，她以同样的轻声细语继续。)
You may perhaps come closer to understanding how these psychological structures are manipulated if you consider the same sort of structures as they exist as dream objects in sleep.如果你们把这些结构，想成是在睡梦中存在的物体，或许就会更加了解这些心理结构如何被操纵。
If you toss a ball in a dream, neither the self that tosses the ball, nor the ball, exist in any space structure as you know it.In somewhat the same manner are emotion structures handled.A refusal or a denial, an attempt not to handle a particular emotional structure involves action.The refusal itself is an action.如果你在梦中抛一颗球，抛球的自己和这颗球都不是存在于任何你们所知的空间结构中。情感结构也以差不多相同的方式处理。拒绝或否定，试图不处理某个情感结构，也涉及到行动。拒绝本身就是一个行动。
(Jane now took a very long pause.)(珍这时停顿很久。)
What you have here is an attempt to objectify, or stand apart from action in such a refusal.This is not the fault of the subconscious, but a fault of the ego, which refuses to assimilate or accept a given action.As you know, it is the ego who exists as a result of such objectivity.All the qualities that make up the ego are objectified to that degree, but they are collected about the ego with the ego as center.When the ego however refuses to accept an emotion as a part of itself, it tries one of two actions.这里你们有的是，在这样的抗拒中，想要客观化或远离行动的企图。这不是潜意识的错，而是自我的错，因为它拒绝吸纳或接受一个既定的行动。你们知道，以这种客观化结果的形式存在的是自我。形成自我的种种性质全部被客观化到那个程度，但它们都以自我为中心而聚集在自我周围。话说回来，当自我拒绝情感是它自己的一部分，就会尝试下面两个行动的其中之一。
Either it attempts to return the emotion to a subjective state, or it attempts to objectify it further away from itself.In either case the ego is at fault for not assimilating or accepting the emotion.It is easy to see then that the ego is itself a series of actions, that it is a collection of more or less similar actions, selected from a larger mainstream of other actions.自我不是试图让情感回到主观状态，就是试图把它客观化而远离自己。不管是不吸纳或不接受情感，任何一种情况都是自我的错。显而易见的是，自我本身是一连串行动，就是从其他行动更大的主流中，挑选出或多或少类似的行动，然后集结在一起。
You will recall that the ego, while disliking change, is nevertheless dependent for its identity upon change.The ego to a large degree, therefore, chooses during its development those characteristic actions which will form its nature.Because the ego necessarily changes however, actions or emotions which at one time it chose as acceptable, at a later date so to speak it may attempt to deny.你们会记得，自我虽然不喜欢改变，但又得依赖改变以维持它的本体。所以说，自我在发展时，特别去选择那些将形成其本质的典型行动。因为自我无论如何一定会改变，那些它曾一度选择接受的行动或情感，稍后可能又会被否定。
The habitual pattern or characteristic nature of the ego may then be led to refuse to accept an emotion, at the same time that a pattern has already been set to receive the particular type of emotion.Here the ego fights against itself.Such an emotion may of course be given release through dreams, but this is of limited value to the ego involved, since the ego does not accept the reality of dream existence.自我的这个惯常模式或特质，可能会倾向于拒绝接受一个情感，在此同时，又建立起另一个接受这种特定情感的模式。自我在这里对抗它自己。这样一种情感当然可以透过梦得到释放，但对这个自我来说，价值有限，因为这个自我不接受梦存在(dream existence)的实相。
The strength of the ego actually depends on the flexibility with which it can accept and assimilate ever more complex actions, and give them a unity of its own.An action or emotion not accepted by the ego, but nevertheless a part of it, will always drain energy from the main core of the ego, despite the ego’s denial, and energy that cannot therefore be used by the ego for the purposes of its own purposeful action.自我的力量其实是取决于它的弹性，亦即它能够接受和吸纳更多复杂的行动，且与它们合为一体的程度。自我所不接受的一个行动或情感，仍然是自我的一部分，不管自我怎么否定，一定都会耗尽自我主要的核心能量，也让自我无法将能量用于达成自身重大行动的目的。
The rejected emotion, in other words, will express itself in any case, but it will do so then as a rebel, outside of the organizational directives of the ego itself.Hence for example, actions that appear senseless to the ego are often the results of such unassimilated or denied emotions.At one time or another such emotions were acceptable to the ego. There was an attraction, or the emotion would not have been permitted to enter into a realm close to ego control.换句话说，被排斥的情感无论如何都会表达它自己，但届时会是以反抗者之姿而这么做，不听命于自我本身的组织指令。因此，举例来说，在自我看来毫无意义的行动，往往是这类未被吸纳、未被承认的情感造成的结果。这样的情感对自我来说曾经是可以接受的，而且具有吸引力，否则不会允许这个情感靠近自我控制的界域之中。
Inclinations with which the ego has very little liking, for example, are very seldom a problem for the ego, since they remain generally outside of the ego pattern, never having been chosen by it to form a characteristic part of the ego pattern.Obviously, to some degree every conceivable sort of inclination is latent to the ego, but it is apparent that each ego has its peculiar set of adopted characteristics, its set of characteristics that it sometimes accepts and sometimes rejects; and it is obvious that some characteristics simply seem alien to any given ego.例如，某些不怎么讨自我喜欢的倾向，对自我来说很少是个问题，因为它们通常一直都在自我模式之外，从未雀屏中选，形成自我模式的一部分特质。显然，每一种能想得到的倾向，多多少少都潜伏在自我里，但显而易见的是，每个自我都有自己已收纳的一套特质，一套它自己有时接受、有时排斥的特质；而且，明显的是，有些特质对任何既定的自我来说似乎就是格格不入。
It is therefore with the second alternating group of characteristics that most such problems arise.An ego who can, and has at one time or another accepted as part of itself a violent and unruly desire to kill, for example, will not automatically reject the emotion of hatred.He may dislike it, but he will recognize it as a part of himself during whatever period it is assimilated.An ego which once accepted such an idea of violence, and knew it as a possibility of action, such an ego, if he then rejects the conception, can no longer afford, ever, to recognize this once acceptable emotion, for he is only too aware of the action that could have at one time developed.因此，这样的问题大部分都是由第二组替代特质引起的。比方说，要是一个自我能够，而且曾接受一股暴力又难以控制的杀人欲望，也是它自己的一部分，就不会自动排斥“恨”这个情感。他也许不喜欢它，但不管何时，只要在它被吸纳期间，他都会承认它是他自己的一部分。一个曾经接受这样一个暴力意念，也知道它是一个行动可能性的自我，如果他后来排斥这个概念，就永远再也没本事承认这个一度可接受的情感了，因为他实在太清楚这个从前本来可以发展的行动了。
It is in this area that such conflicts arise.The man, or ego, who has never really accepted such violence as a part of his action pattern, will usually have no conflicts in this particular line, simply because the inclination was never a strong part of the ego’s inner image, and is more or less discarded automatically, along with all those other characteristics or inclinations which are not in his ego pattern.这样的冲突就发生在这个领域。如果一个人或自我，从未真正接受这样的暴力是他行动模式的一部分，那么在这方面通常没有任何冲突，只因为该倾向从来不是这个自我内在形象的一个重要部分，而且或多或少都会被自动舍弃，连同所有其他那些不在自我模式里的特质或倾向也会一并剔除。
This is obviously somewhat simplified, in that the ego constantly changes, and the above examples must be read carefully or their meaning could be misinterpreted.Actions may appear to be separate, but they are all part of other actions, this being of course the basis for all organization, including that of the ego and the inner self.这显然有点简化了，因为自我持续不断改变，上面的例子务必仔细阅读，否则意思可能会被错误解读。行动看来可能是分开的，但它们却都是其他行动的一部分，这个当然是所有组织——包括自我和内我——的基础。
Again, it must be remembered that no real boundaries exist, only diversity of function.再一次，一定要记得，没有真正的界限存在，只有多元的功能。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:17.Jane was dissociated as usual.She resumed in a very slow manner, taking many pauses, at 10:30.)(10:17分休息。珍一如往常出离。10:30分，她以非常缓慢的方式继续，中间停顿很多次。)
All boundaries, therefore, are apparent boundaries, boundaries in appearance only.因此，所有的界限都是外显的界限。纯属表面的界限。
Groupings of actions of any kind merge into other groupings, both within the physical field and outside of it.All apparent units are merely formed by functions, the functions of action.In this context the ego is also a function of action. There are of course also functions within functions, which should be obvious.任何类型的各组行动，融入另一组行动之中，在特质场域之内和之外都一样。所有外显单位都只不过是由功能、行动功能形成的。在这个背景下，自我也是一个行动功能，在功能之内当然也还有功能，这应该明显可见。
The ego itself attempts as its function to be the director and center of other functions.The ego, while considering itself apart from action, is obviously not apart from it.As dreams allow the inner self great freedom, and as in dreams great perspectives of time are available, and great freedom in space, though no space as you know it is involved, so it is possible for the ego itself to achieve the experience of freedom from time and space, if it would only allow itself for a short while to relax the intensity of its objective focus.自我企图让自己的功能，成为其他功能的指挥者和中心。自我虽然自认为脱离行动，但显然没有脱离。就像梦给予内我很大的自由，在梦中可以有很大的时间视角，在空间上也有很大的自由，但是并不涉及任何你们所知的空间，所以只要自我本身能允许自己削弱客观聚焦的强度，就有可能获得不受时间和空间的经验。
It could still do this and retain its own nature, merely by allowing into its awareness the reality of other actions as a part of its self-image.There is for example no basic reason why the subconscious and the ego cannot communicate to a much larger extent than is now usual.Such communication would result in the acceptance of additional energy and action by the ego, and an expansion of the ego's self-image.自我可以在这么做的同时保有自己的本质，前提是只要它能把其他行动的实相，觉知为其自身形象的一部分。举例来说，根本没有理由说潜意识与自我之间的沟通程度，不能够比现在的一般状况高出很多。这样的沟通会促使自我接受额外的能量和行动，也会扩展自我自身的形象。
It was necessary for the ego, in its origins, to objectify itself as much as possible.Now however the stability of the ego, generally speaking, as a part of the human personality is established.It can now afford to be much more elastic, to include, in other words, more and more of reality within its awareness.Such an inclusion would be most beneficial. It would of course however to some extent change the ego, and any change is resisted by the ego.在其源头中，自我以前是有必要尽可能让自己客观化。不过，一般而言，现在身为人类人格一部分，自我的稳定性已经建立。它现在经得起大很多的弹性，换句话说，足以把越来越多实相涵纳在它的觉知之内。这样的涵纳非常有益，但是，如此一来，当然也多多少少会改变自我，而任何改变都会遭受自我的抗拒。
Nevertheless the course of future events will move in this direction. It must.The ego must change in this rather basic manner, including other realities within its scope of awareness.There is no basic reason why it cannot add its directive energies to other aspects of the personality, and if it could so expand it would, theoretically, be possible for the ego to become aware of many experiences which have been impossible for it in the past.虽然如此，未来事件的演进还是会朝着这个方向走，非得如此不可。自我必须以这种相当基本的方式改变，把其他实相涵纳在它的觉知范畴之内。根本没有理由说自我不能把它的指引能量，加到人格的其他面向中，如果自我能够如此扩展，那么理论上，自我就有可能觉察到很多它过去不可能有的经验。
The hope and the possibilities here, as well as some of the dangers, lie in the fact that the ego does indeed change, and is not one specific reality but a series or group of actions, with direction, that have the potentiality for unlimited value fulfillment.The ego will never be less than it is now. It may very well be more.Possibilities for development here are very great, but most such possibilities lie still in the future, and only, so far, as possibilities.There is nothing that will force the ego to enlarge the scope of its awareness.这里的希望和可能性，以及一些危险之处，都建立在自我的确会改变的事实上，自我不是一个特定实相，而是一连串或一整组有方向的行动，有潜力实现无限的价值完成。自我永远不会比它现在少，很可能还会比现在多很多。这里发展的可能性非常大，但这样的可能性大部分静静地躺在未来，到目前为止只是可能性而已。没有任何东西会迫使自我放大它的觉知范畴。
Ruburt may now, if he wishes, work on his psychological time in the morning.I wanted that particular routine broken up for a while, but now if it is more convenient he may return to his old schedule; that is, that same time of day, but twenty minutes should still be the limit.如果鲁柏愿意的话，现在可以在早上做心理时间练习。我之前想要暂时打破那个常规，但是现在要是更方便的话，他可以恢复旧有的时间表；也就是说，一天中的同一时间，但仍然应该以20分钟为限。
We will shortly launch into a new discussion, though there are still some matters to be cleared in our material on action.I will now close the session, or if you prefer you may take a short break and continue.我们很快就会开始一个新的讨论，但是我们有关行动的资料还有一些事项需要理清。我现在要结束这一节，如果你们想要的话，也可以短暂休息一下再继续。
(“Well close then.”)(“那我们就结束好了。”)
My best regards to you both, and a most fond good evening.向两位致上我最好的祝福，也祝你们有个非常愉快美好的夜晚。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:00.Jane was dissociated as usual.(11:00结束。珍一如往常出离。
(Seth referred to Janes endeavors with psychological time because she has been having trouble establishing an effective routine for it in the afternoons.She always found it natural to try it between eleven-thirty and noon, after she had put in her mornings work writing, and before I get home from work.)(赛斯提到珍在心理时间上的努力，因为她打算在下午时段建立有效的常规，但一直有困难。她总觉得在11半到中午之间尝试心理时间才自然，也就是她早上写作之后，我下班之前。)

SESSION 157 第157节　每一个实相对每一个个体绝对是独一无二


MAY 24, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年5月24日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(Before the session began, Jane said she felt much more restless than usual.Once again she spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was average, her rate of delivery average also, but with pauses.She actually began speaking at 9:02.)(这一节开始前，珍说她感觉比平时更坐立难安。她再度闭着眼睛，坐着说话，声音一般，传述速度也不急不徐，但停顿了几次。她实际上从9:02分开始说话。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ’’)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
The nature of action cannot be altered.行动的本质无法被改变。
I am speaking now of the basic nature of reality, and not of any particular action, for particular actions can indeed be altered by other actions, and no given action occurs in a solitary manner.This last is extremely important.Actions are perceived as realities according to the nature, not of a given action, but according to the nature of the perceiver.His viewpoint and his field of reference will at all times color to some extent or another the nature of the reality which he perceives.我现在说的是实相的基础本质，而不是任何特定的行动，因为特定的行动实际上都可以被其他行动改变，没有一个既定的行动是单独发生的。最后这一点极为重要。行动依据本质，被感知为实相，但不是依据一个既定行动的本质，而是依据感知者的本质。感知者的观点和参考场域，随时都多多少少会渲染他感知到的实相本质。
This may sound contradictory.We have stated that a reality remains as it is, unchanged even though the perceiver, because of his sense apparatus, may perceive it in a limited or distorted fashion.While this is to some extent true, we can now delve into the matter somewhat more fully.In our later sessions for example, we have mentioned that the desire for duplication must always result in a distortion, but this distortion is also the basis therefore for a new reality.这听起来或许互相矛盾。我们说过，即使感知者因为感觉器官的关系，可能以局限或扭曲的方式感知实相，实相仍然维持它所是的样子，不会因此被改变。虽然某种程度是这样没错，但我们现在还是可以更彻底一点来探讨这件事。举例来说，在我们最近的几节提过，想要复制的欲望，必定造成扭曲，但是这种扭曲也是一个新实相的基础。
Now, putting these two statements together, you see that an individual will perceive basic reality, in the main, only from his own reference point, and through his outer sense apparatus.His perception of basic reality in one way does not change the nature of that reality or of that action, as it exists independently of his field of reference.However, the very distortions that occur in his attempt to perceive this reality results in a new reality.What he perceives then is legitimate, for his very perception of it is the basis for its existence.现在，把这两项陈述摆在一起，你们就会看到，大致上，个体只是从他自己的参考点，经由他的外在感官来感知基本实相。他个人单方面对基本实相的感知，并不会改变那个实相或那个行动的本质，因为它独立存在于他的参考场域之外。然而，他在企图感知这个实相的同时，所产生的这些扭曲，又会形成一个新的实相。所以，他感知到的实相当然合情合理，因为他对这个实相的感知，正是它存在的基础。
Would you like a break?你们想要休息一下吗？
(“No."(“不用。”
(My head had been bothering me today and yesterday.The effect was something like an allergy or cold, although the pendulum told me it was neither.The condition was very annoying.)(我的头昨天和今天一直困扰着我。感觉像是过敏或感冒，可是摆钟告诉我都不是。这种状况让人很烦。)
Any individual reacts to a reality as he perceives it to be, and he perceives it to be since he has himself created it from basic reality.The very distortions therefore form many of the characteristic differences which for him gives his reality its peculiar nature.Those whose actions set them apart drastically from others within your system, and who seem in one way or another mentally unbalanced, are often told that they must relate themselves more clearly with reality as it exists.任何个体对于自己所感知为如此的实相都会起反应，而且因为是他自己从基本实相把它创造出来的，所以他才会如此感知它。因此，这些扭曲便形成很多独特的差异，对他而言，这些差异赋予他的实相特有的性质。在你们系统之内，那些把他们的行动与其他行动彻底切割开来的人，以及那些某方面似乎心理不平衡的人，经常被告知，他们必须要与既有的实相更清楚连结。
This however is not their problem, for like all other individuals they perceive a reality that they have created. Their problem therefore is a distortive one. It is not related to their attitude toward reality as a whole, but it is intimately connected with the reality which they have created.They are indeed relating to that reality very well. The reality, however, is much more distorted than usual, and this is one of the main problems.不过，这不是他们的问题，因为他们和所有其他的个体一样，感知到他们自己创造出来的实相，所以他们的问题是扭曲的问题，与他们对整体实相的态度无关，而是与他们创造出来的实相密切相关。他们的确与那个实相连结得很好，可是，那个实相却远比平常更加扭曲，这正是主要的问题所在。
It is only because their realities are so distorted that the difficulty is discovered.I mentioned many sessions back that your physical universe, so taken for granted, is actually at least as diverse and multitudinous as the dream system.Within the physical universe you merely focus upon similarities and ignore the vast differences that exist.Each reality is completely unique for every individual, and through his own actions he attempts therefore to communicate the nature of this reality of his to his fellows.就是因为他们的实相太扭曲了，才会出现问题。我在前面好几节里提过，你们理所当然认定的物质宇宙，其实至少和梦系统一样多元、多重。在物质宇宙之内，你们只聚焦在相似之处，而忽略天壤之别的存在。每一个实相对每一个个体来说绝对是独一无二，而且透过他们自己的行动，他试图向同类沟通他自己这个实相的本质。
We have discussed the ways in which telepathy operates in this respect, and we have to some extent discussed the ways in which the appearance of cohesiveness is maintained.In many cases the individual who is called mentally unbalanced is simply one whose individual reality is so composed that it is impossible for others to find in his expression of it any similarity with their own.The error is one of inadequate idea construction.我们讨论过心电感应在这方面的运作方式，也多多少少讨论过如何维持聚合的表象。在很多案例中，被称作心理不平衡的个体，只不过是因为他构成的个人实相与其他人不同，其他人从他表现实相的方式中，根本找不到与自己的实相有任何类似之处。这种错误是一种不恰当的观念建构。
I suggest your first break.我建议你们第一次休息。
(Break at 9:29.Jane was more dissociated than usual for a first delivery.At times during the delivery her voice had risen a bit in volume.She resumed in a good voice, still with pauses, at 9:35.)(9:29休息。在第一段传述中，珍比平常更出离。传述时，音量有时候会提高一点。9:35分，珍以不错的声音继续，仍然有几次停顿。)
I will now direct my remarks to you, Joseph.约瑟，我现在要讲的话是针对你说的。
It is not advantageous for you to work with the pendulum over a half-hour per day.A daily routine involving a half-hours work with the pendulum will do you good.每天使用摆钟超过半小时，对你没有好处。每天固定使用半小时，才会对你有益。
Further work with it at this time turns to an introversion with the personal subconscious, and an over-involvement with it as far as overall focus is concerned. The half-hour is sufficient and beneficial.A deeper involvement however at this time serves to focus your energies in a bunch, so to speak, in the personal subconscious, blocking creative energies that come from deeper layers of the inner self.The half-hour however will allow you, in a smooth manner, to communicate with this important area of the self in a way that will not block other energies, and that will be beneficial.这个时候过度使用它，就会往内转向个人潜意识，而且就整体焦点而言，也会太过投入其中，半小时已经足够也有益处。这时候太深入其中，将你大量的能量关注在个人潜意识上，会阻碍来自内我更深层面的创造能量。总之，半小时就能够让你和自己的这个重要区域顺畅沟通，既不阻碍其他能量又有好处。
I would also suggest for the present that you deal with other matters than your health; then you may return to the subject, and I will be glad to further elaborate upon what information you receive.My further suggestions are that you return to painting or sketching, and you will find that your energies will now be allowed much more freedom.我也建议，目前你先处理其他事情，而不是你的健康；之后可以再回到这个主题，到时候我会乐于进一步细说你收到的讯息。另外我也建议你重拾绘画或素描，你会发现你的能量现在得以享有更多自由。
What you have been in danger of doing is using too much energy oriented toward the past, and this will also show itself in your physical reactions.Your trouble of yesterday and today does indeed originate because you have not been painting, but one of the reasons that you have not been painting is that energy has been used as a searchlight into the past, searching for certain origins.你一直以来的一个危险做法是，将太多能量投注在过去，这也会显现在你的身体反应上。你昨天和今天的烦恼的确发生，因为你一直没作画，但你一直没作画的原因之一是，你将能量用来当成聚焦过去的探照灯，以搜寻某些东西。
The quest is a good one. You have simply concentrated upon it too deeply.You have learned much, both in relating yourself to inner reality and to outer relationships, and the error is understandable.The outer relationships are serving you well, for you are already storing up many ideas for your work, for your painting, that have at least partially come as a result of your perception of others.这样的探究是好事，只是你专注太深了。在连结你自己与内在实相，以及连结你自己与外在关系，这两方面你学到很多，而错误是可以理解的。外在关系对你很有用，因为你已经为你的工作、你的绘画储备很多点子，这些至少有一部分是你感知其他事物得到的结果。
It is in your nature to use much of your energy in artistic creation. You must then turn it outward in this manner.From the wealth of inner data your nature demands that you form new gestalts, and in painting them you automatically relate them outward.You need the inner data and the journeys inward, but these must always be of a disciplined nature, and not overdone.在艺术创作上使用你大部分的能量，是你的本质，你必须以这种方式把它转向外界。你的本质要求你用丰富的内在资料形成新的完形，而且在为它们作画时，自动使它们向外连结。你需要内在资料和内在旅程，但这些一定要节制，不能过度。
More energy indeed can be held in the personal subconscious in such a manner than can be used in studying other areas of the inner self, for it is in the personal subconscious that energy blockage most frequently occurs.This does not mean that you should cease in that direction.A smooth and disciplined schedule will serve you well here.I would indeed suggest however that this half-hour schedule not include your weekends.以这样的方式保留在个人潜意识里的能量，实际上可能比用来研究内我其他领域的能量还要多，因为能量的阻塞最常发生在个人潜意识里。这并不是说你应该停止往那个方向走。一个顺畅和节制的时间表对你非常有用。不过，我确实建议这个半小时的时间表不包含你的周末在内。。
And now I suggest your break.I am with you however quite strongly this evening.现在我建议你们休息一下。无论如何，今晚我相当紧密地跟你们在一起。
(Break at 9:55.Jane was well dissociated. The restlessness was still apparent to her, also.She said she felt at times like getting up rule and pacing about as she talked, even with her eyes closed.(9:55分结束。珍顺利出离，依然明显感觉坐立难安。她说她有时候在讲话时，就算是闭着眼睛，也想要站起来四处踱步。
(Actually, I have been painting for the last two weeks, following my final recovery from my illness of late March and early April.This apparently had not been sufficient to satisfy the literal-minded personal subconscious, hence my cold like symptoms.I have also been investigating with the pendulum to some extent, and can say that usually the periods did not last more than half an hour a day.(事实上，打从3月底4月初生病，最终复原之后，我最近两周一直都在作画。这显然不足以让呆板的个人潜意识满意，于是我有了类似感冒的症状。我也一直使用摆钟来做调查，而且可以说每天通常不会超过半小时。
(Jane resumed in the same manner at 10:06.)(10:06分，珍以相同的方式继续。)
You should find the above material most helpful.你应该会发现上面的资料很有帮助。
You have indeed been trying too hard with the pendulum, which sets up its own kind of resistance.At your present stage of development with the pendulum you get a reaction that could be compared to a closed circuit, where the energy is directed into the past, into the personal subconscious too abruptly, and too intensified, and is not yet allowed the release of discovering full causes, which would then release not only that energy, but the energy that has in the past gone into the formation of various physical ills.你的确过度使用摆钟了，因而形成它自己的一种抗拒。在你当下使用摆钟的发展阶段中，你遇到一种可以比拟为封闭回圈的反应，能量被过于鲁莽、过于猛烈地导入过去，导入个人潜意识，而且还不能从寻找所有病因的禁锢中得到释放，若是如此，得到释放就不只是那股能量，还有过去参与身体各种疾病形成的能量。
At a later time, you see, the difficulty will automatically be passed, there will be a freer flow of energy, and a quicker release of it.Even in your desire to discover such original causes of physical ills, a part of you sets up resistances, new ones, which take additional energy.你知道，改天这个难题会自然而然过去，到时会有一股更自由的能量，释放它的速度也会更快。甚至在你探索身体疾病的这类根本原因时，一部分的你就开始产生抗拒，新的抗拒，耗掉额外的能量。
The half-hour schedule will allow for a disciplined, smooth and automatic self-discovery which will not drain your energies. You have indeed additional energy at your command, but the focus in the personal subconscious prevents you from using it.You will find that your condition is now improving and will continue to do so.And all of this also involves a practical lesson in the nature of action.半小时的时间就可以进行有节制、顺畅又自动的自我探索，不会耗尽你的能量，你的确有额外的能量供你自由支配，但是，聚焦在个人潜意识却妨碍你使用它。你会发现你的状况正在改善中，而且会继续改善。这一切涉及了为行动的本质上了实际的一课。
Enough cannot be said along these lines regarding the nature of your expectations, for according to the manner in which you expect your reality to behave, in that manner shall it be.关于你的预期本质，说再多都不够，因为你预期你的实相会以何种方式运转，它就会根据那种方式运转。
Out of the goodness of my heart, Joseph, I will bring the session to a close.约瑟，出于我心中的好意，我要结束本节了。

(“Alright.”)(“好啊。”)
These incidents in the past, that appear as the original initiation of an illness, they represent points, or kinks, where energy is not smoothly used, but tends to bunch up because of a resistance.Now obviously the particular energy does not bunch up, but a pattern remains in the personality where energy is spent in resistance, and not in efficient action, and not in effective idea constructions.过去以疾病的原发起点形式出现的这些事件，代表某些点或结，能量在此未顺畅运用，反倒因为抗拒而倾向集结。现在显然这股能量不集结，但是有个模式留存在人格里，能量耗费在抗拒上，而不是用在有效率的行动上，也不是用在有效的意念建构上。
The ego, for reasons of its own, does not want to accept an action which has already occurred, and does not want to admit it within the framework of its own reality.The point of resistance becomes woven into the personality framework, the problem being not of the subconscious, but again of the ego’s denial or attempt to deny a portion of its own reality.自我基于自己的理由，不想接受已经发生的行动，也不愿让它进入它自己的实相架构之内。抗拒点被织入人格架构里，问题不在于潜意识，而是一样在于自我否定或试图拒绝自己一部分的实相。
The event is not assimilated. It becomes to all intents and purposes a dead end, isolated from the acceptance of the whole ego, and the most advantageous solution here is, of course, that the ego in one manner or another is made to accept this particular portion of its own past.事件没有被吸纳，实际上它在每方面都陷入绝境，孤立于整个自我的接受之外，这里最有利的解决之道当然是，设法让自我以某种方式接受它自己过去这个特别的部分。
We have this evening been somewhat led astray, indeed, ourselves, from the main nature of the subjects at hand.We will however closely examine the nature of action for a brief time further.You have for now a sufficient basis in its characteristics so that we can begin with other discussions, and shortly we will do so.今晚我们自己有点从手边这些主题的主要本质离题了。无论如何，我们会更进一步花一点时间详细探讨行动的本质。现在你们对它的特性已打下足够的基础，好让我们可以开始做其他的讨论，而不久后我们再来谈它。
I will now end the session, or you may take a break as you prefer.我现在要结束这一节，不然你们想要的话，就休息一下。
(“We'll take a short break then.”(“那我们休息一下。”

She said the restlessness had subsided somewhat, yet still lingered.She resumed in a somewhat louder voice.As she sat back down and closed her eyes, she remained quite motionless and quiet for perhaps two minutes before she began speaking.Resume at 10:39.)(10:25分休息。珍一如往常出离，她说坐立难安的感觉稍减，但尚未退去。她以稍微宏亮的声音继续。闭着双眼回座位之际，她静止不动而且保持缄默大约两分钟，才开始说话。10:39分继续。)
Ruburt should also now find that he begins to recall his dreams once more, and his predictions will also begin to show their validity.鲁柏现在应该发现，他又开始回想起他的梦，而他的预测也将开始应验。
In his case, extra reserves of energy have been used in practical concerns over his book, although to deal with them he has drawn upon additional energies.There is still here a certain holding back, with which we must all contend.Unfortunately the knowledge that his book will be published, while bringing him much satisfaction, has also served to remind him of the manner in which he fears many might look upon both our sessions and his past endeavors in this field.就他来讲，多余的能量库存已使用在他对书的实际关注上，纵使他已经汲取额外能量来处理它们。这里仍然有某种阻碍，我们全部都必须全力以赴。遗憾的是，得知他的书将会出版，虽然带给他很大的满足，但也让他想到心中的恐惧，不晓得其他人会以何种方式看待我们的课以及他过去在这方面的努力。
We are largely over this hump now, and the actual writing of the book in its entirety will actually serve to strengthen his confidence in this respect, since the validity of our sessions will be stressed as he reads material for his book.At its completion he will be much more committed than he is now, and indeed our sessions will attain added depth through his acquiescence.目前我们大半度过这个难关，整本书的实际写作其实会加强他这方面的信心，因为当他为他的书而阅读资料时，就会加强了我们这些课的效力。书写完之后，他会比现在投入得多，而在他的默许下我们的课也将更有深度。
There will never be on my part any attempt at any sort of invasion.We may indeed take time out shortly, not only to go into our own relationship more thoroughly, but also to discuss other such relationships in general. You should both find such a discussion rewarding.Other aspects of Ruburt’s abilities will also let themselves be known within the near future, when he himself lets this come about. His own book will allow him to reassess the nature of our sessions.It will do neither of you harm, and might do you both good, to discuss our sessions personally with some other persons whom you have mentioned.在我这边，绝对不会试图以任何一种方式入侵。我们真的可能不久就会抽出时间，不只为了更彻底探讨我们自己的关系，也为了大致讨论其他这一类的关系，你们两位应该都会发现这样的讨论很值得。如果鲁柏愿意的话，不久的将来，他在其他方面的能力也会出名，他自己的书会让他重新评估我们这个课的本质。与那些你们曾提过的人私下讨论我们的课，对你们两人不仅没有害处，可能还会带来好处。

SESSION 158 第158节　蓓、比尔在场、课的转折


MAY 30, 1965 11:06 PM SUNDAY UNSCHEDULED1965年5月30日 星期天 晚上11:06 临时课
(Our regularly scheduled session for last Wednesday, May 26, was not held because Jane had developed a heavy cold.The pendulum told her this came about because of her concern over the contract and money matters involving her ESP book.Since then Jane has received her signed contract from the publisher, with money due, and now feels better.(上星期三，5月26日的定期课，由于珍得了重感冒而取消。摆钟告诉她，因为她担心ESP那本书的合约和款项问题，所以才会这样。自从珍收到出版社寄给她签定的合约，连同应付款，现在感觉比较好了。
(Peg and Bill Gallagher visited us sometime before 9 PM this evening.Peg is a reporter for the Elmira Star-Gazette, and will do the news story about the sale of Jane's ESP book.After the conversation had turned to matters psychic, Jane played the tape recording of the Father Trainor episode of last February 11.In Volume 3 see the 131st and 132nd sessions, and the notes on pages 261. 63.(今晚差不多9点前，蓓[Peg]和比尔·加拉格[Bill Gallagher]夫妇来访。蓓是《埃尔迈拉星报》[Elmira Star-Gazette]的记者，她会为珍的ESP书销售写篇报导。在谈话内容转到通灵方面的话题后，珍播放了今年2月11日崔诺神父的录音带。见第三册第131、132节及相关的注释。
(Jane said later that listening to the tape did not “bother” her very much, although she felt some emotional and psychic reaction.On the tape she manifested many voice changes, while reading G. K. Chesterton’s narrative poem Lepanto, that were quite reminiscent of the way the deceased Father Trainor had read it.Afterward Jane endeavored to answer a question of Bill’s by reading a few lines from the poem aloud.Because of her cold and her still impaired voice, she thought she could get through a few lines at best.(珍后来说，听这个带子不太“困扰”她，但是她感觉到些许情绪和心灵的反应。在录音带上，她朗读切斯特顿的故事诗《雷帮多》时，出现很多声音的变化，让人联想到已故崔诺神父朗读这首诗的样子。事后，珍借由大声念出这首诗的几行，尽力回答比尔提出的问题。因为她感冒，受损的噪音还没恢复，所以她认为自己顶多也只能这样念几行而已。
(This was her last conscious thought. Immediately the same voice effect again manifested itself in no uncertain terms, and Jane then swept through the long poem without pause.Her voice did not bother her; indeed it became very loud and powerful and dramatic, very vibrant.She remained seated.She held the book in her right hand, and used many gestures with her left hand that were unlike her usual mannerisms.Almost at once it became apparent that the psychic phenomenon taking place, whether or not it involved a medium 's contact with Father Trainor, was much superior to the version already on tape.(这是她最后一个有意识的念头，同样的声音效应立刻再度清楚显现，珍于是一口气念完这首长诗，没有停顿。她的声音并未困扰她；说真的，声音变得非常响亮、有力又戏剧化，充满活力。珍仍然坐着，右手拿着书，左手比出很多手势，一点都不像她平日的举止。接着几乎是立刻，心灵现象就明显发生，无论是否涉及灵媒与崔诺神父的接触，都比之前录音带上的版本更胜一筹。
(Since we had been taken by surprise by this development, we had made no plans to record the reading.I hesitated to interrupt, remembering Seth’s comments about the value of spontaneity.Janes eyes were open, but much darker and more luminous than usual.At times the almost deafening power of her voice, and its emotional content, were indeed thrilling.At the end of the reading Jane closed her eyes; when she opened them again she was out of the trance. —of a gullible, pseudo-mystical type of temperament.Nevertheless I cannot help but grow annoyed when I am literally besieged with the protests meant to insist upon his sanity, the point being that if he is sane, then I must be some nefarious seven-eyed monster.He does indeed give acquiescence for these sessions, and I am indeed fond of you both.I have been aware that you do not care, particularly, for the opinion of your fellow men.But our Ruburt. who has never cared for the opinion of his fellow men, now rises up in great worry.What is he afraid of?——容易受骗、假神秘的性格类型。虽然如此，鲁柏为了坚持他的神智健全，用团团抗议把我包围住，意思是如果他神智健全，那我一定是穷凶极恶的七眼怪兽，对此我无计可施，只是越来越火大。他确确实实默许了这些课，而我的确也很喜欢你们俩。尤其是，我了解你们不在乎人类同胞的意见。但是我们的鲁柏，之前从来不在乎他人类同胞的意见，现在却忧心忡忡，起而反抗。他怕什么？
Indeed the answer is only too obvious:the great writer fears to be found out; and why?Because the words he speaks are not his own.He knows only too well the importance of these sessions, and I am not afraid of his ego, for even his ego knows.其实，答案太明显了：这位伟大的作家怕被发现；为什么？因为他说出来的话不是他自己的。他太清楚这些课的重要性，我不怕他的自我，因为连他的自我都知道。
(Seth/Jane's voice was loud and scathing.)(赛斯/珍的声音响亮又严厉。)
I will now suggest your break, and I will discuss to some greater degree data concerning your guests.And if I took time out for this discussion, it is indeed because for once I have grown impatient.For much of this on Ruburt’s part is indeed pretense—not conscious pretense, but pretense.He knows full well not only the importance of the sessions, personally, but he knows the far- reaching consequences of these sessions, and he is indeed quite able to deal with the consequences.我现在建议你们休息一下，接下来我会更详细讨论你们访客的资料。如果我为这个讨论抽出时间，那是因为就这么一次我越来越不耐烦了。因为这在鲁柏身上其实大部分是假装——不是有意识的假装，而是假装。他个人不但完全知道这些课的重要性，也了解结果影响深远，而他的确相当有能力处理结果。
Tonight’s session, Joseph, is a rather important one, and the woman who is attending our session is also quite important, in that her abilities are helping me to come through with, I might say, crystal clarity.约瑟啊，今晚的课是颇为重要的一节，那个来参加我们这一节的女人也很重要，可以说，因为她的能力帮助我晶莹剔透地传过来。
