I am quite capable of continuing on without a break, but out of the goodness of my heart, Joseph, I will give your fingers a rest.You may take a break. If you and your guests are agreeable I will continue.Or if you are fatigued, you of course may be excused.我有相当能耐可以不休息而继续下去，但由于我的好心肠，约瑟，我会让你的手指休息，你们可以休息一下。不过如果你们和你们的访客都同意，我就继续。或是说，要是你们累了，当然就可以告退。
(Break at 12:21.Jane was indeed fully dissociated.She was not aware that she had been taking herself to task so vehemently.Her manner had quieted somewhat just before break.(12:21分休息。珍确实完全出离。她不晓得她一直非常强烈地责备自己。她的态度在休息前才稍微缓和下来。
(Bill Gallagher's ulcer was not bothering him.He said he felt fine, and that it was a most welcome situation.I had not observed any change in Jane's features, the few times I had managed to take a look.Bill however remarked that he thought he had detected a change; he thought Jane's lower jaw line had become more rounded, losing a little of its angularity.As it happened Bill could see Jane full-face from his position on the couch.I sat beside him and saw more of the left side of Jane's face, and Peggy from her position was looking at the right side of Janes face.Peggy also thought she noticed some change.(比尔·加拉格的溃疡不再困扰他。他说他觉得身体很好，而且是一种令人愉快的情况。我有几次想办法看珍一眼，并没有发现她的容貌有任何改变。不过比尔说他觉得看出一个变化；他认为珍的下巴轮廓变得比较圆，棱角稍微小了些。在它发生之际，比尔可以从他的沙发座位看到珍的全脸。我坐在他旁边，看到比较多珍的左脸，而蓓从她的位置看到的是珍的右脸，蓓也认为她注意到一些变化。
(In Volume 1, see the 68th session for some material on facial changes in Jane.(珍的脸部变化，有一些资料见第一册第68节。

It is obvious that the ulcers are at this time serving a purpose for the personality.The purpose must be uncovered. It will be beneficial if we give, if you will forgive the term, and if Ruburt will forgive the term, a life reading.显然，溃疡此时为这个人格达成一个目的，这个目的必须揭露。如果你原谅我用这个字眼，如果鲁柏原谅我用这个字眼，要是我们来做个“生命解读”，会很有帮助。
Such a life reading would involve incidents from both past and present lives, including circumstances which, taken all in all, tended to bring about the illness.Such a malfunction is very seldom the result of circumstances that relate to one existence only, but you see they do involve—are you ready?这样一种生命解读涉及从过去到现在各世的事件，包括整体来说容易导致生病的境遇。这样的机能失调很少是只和一世有关的境遇造成的结果，但你知道它们的确有关——你准备好了吗？
("Yes."(“是。”
(Once again I had to ask Seth to slow down.)(再一次我不得不请赛斯放慢速度。)
—a characteristic method, and an unwholesome one, of satisfying needs, a characteristic method which has been built up through personality patterns that have been adopted through many existences.For example, in one past life you attacked quite forcibly the female physical organs: an ovary with which you had great difficulty.——一个满足需求但不健康的独特方法，一个透过很多世采用的人格模式而建立的独特方法。举例来说，在过去某一世你相当猛烈攻击女性身体器官：一个让你颇为棘手的卵巢。
(Jane had pointed to Bill. Her eyes remained closed.)(珍指着比尔，她的眼睛依然闭着。)
We find here a swing between aggressiveness and dependency.In the female existence of which I am speaking, it was the aggressiveness which the personality found distasteful; and in this existence we find the dependency, which you see does not fit in with the personality self-image.我们这里发现一个在攻击和依赖之间摆荡的状况。在我目前谈到的女性那一世，这个人格对于攻击性感到厌恶；而在这一世我们发现依赖感，你看到它和这个人格的自我形象不一致。
If indeed it is understood that this personality, as with many personalities, has been materialized in feminine form, then these perfectly natural dependent feelings are found to be merely residues from previous personality patterns.And a word here should be said, indeed, concerning the distortive ideas that arise concerning dependency and passivity.这个人格和很多人格一样，被物质化为女性形式，如果确实了解这一点，就会发现这些十足自然的依赖感，只不过是先前的人格模式残留的遗迹而已。而且，这里有句话应该要说，其实是关于依赖感和被动(passivity)的扭曲观念。
Am I going too fast?我讲太快了吗？
(“Just a bit？“)(“有一点点吧？”)
—for we find in all cases that creativity rises first in what you would term passive terms. The aggressive reaction is actually but the termination of a passive creativity.It is your confusion of terms, and the distortive nature of human understanding concerning sexual give-and-take, that makes you think that dependency is weakness.For in many cases dependency is a passivity that leads to creation.——因为我们发现不管在什么状况下，创造最开始是来自于你们所谓的被动，攻击的反应实际上只不过是被动的创造而已。你们在字词上的混淆，以及人类对于性方面施与受的了解有着扭曲的本质，才会让你们认为依赖是软弱。因为在很多案例中，依赖是一种通往创造的被动。
What appears to you as aggression in these terms is merely the tail end, or the apparent manifestation of creation.The male personality then finds himself unable to accept so-called passive subconscious manifestations with ease, this being in part the result of feminine existences.在这些字词当中，你们看来的攻击，只不过是创造的末端，或创造的表面显现而已。这个男性人格后来发现，自己无法轻易接受所谓被动的潜意识显现，这有一部分是女性前世造成的结果。
However, the personality does not seem at this time able to realize that this inhibited passivity is indeed the basis for all resultant aggressive behavior.不过，这个人格此刻似乎无法明白，这种受到抑制的被动，其实是后来所有攻击行为据以发生的基础。
I can hardly in one evening undo the distortive errors of a lifetime to date.It would be most advantageous if other sessions were held for the particular purpose of delving into the problem, but this session alone has already prepared the self to know the self, and here the personality will take strides forward.The condition will improve. Of this I am certain.我不太可能一个晚上就消除一生至今的扭曲错误。如果能够举行其他的课，来特别探究这个问题，最好不过了。但光是这一节，就已经让这个自己做好了认识自己的准备，而且这里人格将会迈开大步往前走，情况将会改善，这一点我确定。
I myself am in fine fettle.However I realize that I am somewhat freer than you, and I will indeed, my Joseph, end the session at your request.我自己精神抖擞、神采奕奕。可是，我晓得我比你们自由一点，所以，我的约瑟，我真的会应你们的要求结束这一节。
(“All right.”)(“好的。”)
I am most pleased to meet with you both, and I have no doubt that we shall indeed have other communications in these sessions.There is, Joseph, an importance here that you have not seen, but perhaps at our next session I will make it clear.和你们两人聚在一起，我非常高兴，而且我们在这些课里真的会有其他的沟通，对此我深信不疑。约瑟，这里有个你没看到的重要性，但是在我们的下一节，也许我会把它说清楚。
My best and heartiest regards to you all.I found this evening’s session most enjoyable. My fondest good evenings.送上我最好、最衷心的祝福给大家。我觉得今晚的课让人非常愉快，我满怀情意道晚安。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 12:47 AM.Jane was again fully dissociated.It now took her a few seconds to open her eyes and keep them opened; they flickered several times first.Seth had been by far the most active yet since Jane had begun to speak while sitting down and with her eyes closed.(凌晨12:47分结束。珍再度完全出离。此时她花了几秒张开眼睛，并持续睁着；起初眼睛眨了几次。打从珍闭着眼睛坐下来开始说话，赛斯今晚显然最为活跃。

My dear friend, we have been in the immediate past involved in a low point, involving Ruburt's psychic activity.我亲爱的朋友，我们最近卷入一个涉及鲁柏心灵活动的低点。
It is partially due to characteristic seasonal variations on his part, and it is because this evening happens to represent the upward thrust of his abilities that I am taking advantage of the opportunity involved.一部分是因为他有特别的季节性变化，而且因为今晚刚好体现他的能力向上突飞猛进，所以我利用这样一个机会。

(Jane had been staring steadily at me while she spoke, and this in turn impelled me to look at her as often as I could while I wrote.Her posture in the chair was an easy one except when she leaned forward to make a point, yet the feeling I had of another personality being entwined with hers persisted.I was discovering that it took some getting used to.(珍讲话时一直紧盯着我看，而这又迫使我在写笔记的同时，尽量多看她几眼。除了为了强调重点而向前倾身的时候以外，她在椅子上的姿势一派轻松，可是我仍然感觉她和另一个人格缠绕在一起。我发现这要花些功夫去适应。

When I badger him it is for shock value, for in that way I can get through to him.If I take so much of your time this evening, it is only because I know the effort on your part will result in beneficial aftermaths that will more than repay you for this weighty schedule.我为了震撼效果而缠着他，因为那样我才能够与他连上线。如果我今晚占用你太多时间，完全是因为我知道你的努力将会产生有益的结果，而这繁重的时间表会让你成果丰硕。

(Actually time plays an important role here.To type up notes from a recording means I have to spend as much time, again. listening to a session.This expenditure is then increased each time I have to stop and rerun a section to pick up a missed word, or because the dialogue simply runs so rapidly, etc.(其实时间在这里扮演一个重要角色。用打字誊写录音稿，意味着，我必须花一样多的时间，再听一次课。然后为了找出漏掉的字句，或因为对话实在太快了，我就得停下来，倒带重听那个段落，那又会花费更多时间。
(I thought of recording this evening's session earlier, as stated, but did not do so in the interests of spontaneity, a quality to which Seth attaches great value.To be ready to record an unscheduled session we would have to have the recorder set up and ready to go at a flick of a switch, constantly.To date our unscheduled sessions haven't been that frequent by far, and there are actually few unusual effects to be noted.)(早先我想过要录下今晚的课，如之前所述，但为了赛斯评价极高的自发性这一个品质，我没有这么做。如果要录下临时课，我们就得随时把录音机准备好，按键一按就能够开始录音。截至目前为止我们的临时课并没有那么频繁，实际上需要记录的不寻常之处也很少。)
You still have simply no idea, Joseph, of the benefits that you and Ruburt receive through such communications.And unscheduled sessions are apt to be more important at times, in certain ways, than other sessions.约瑟，对于你和鲁柏透过这样的沟通会得到什么好处，你仍然毫无概念。在某些方面，临时课有时候往往比其他的课还重要。
My energy, unfortunately from your viewpoint, is comparatively endless.可惜的是从你的观点看来，我的能量相较而言是无穷无尽的。
(“Yes.”(“是的。”
(Seth/Jane made this statement with a grin.)(赛斯-珍咧嘴笑着说这句话。)
Perhaps if you continue I will take care of your precious fingers.In any case, come to a halt.或许你要是继续写，我就会照顾你的宝贝手指。不管怎样，停一下好了。
(Break at 2:45.Jane was well dissociated, and remembered none of the material.Her eyes closed, then opened again as usual.(2:45分休息。珍顺利出离，什么资料都不记得。她闭上眼睛，然后又一如往常张开。
(My writing hand was tired, but since I had decided I could go on if necessary I said nothing more about ending the session.(我写字的手累了，但因为我决定必要的话我可以继续，所以我没有再说要结束这节课。
(Jane's voice had been quiet for some time now, and it remained so as she resumed at 2:46, again with her eyes open.)(珍的声音到现为止已经安静一段时间了，在2:46分继续时仍然维持这样，她的眼睛同样睁开着。)
I will indeed close, but you will find that the benefits of this session are more long-lasting than either of you can now suppose.我真的要结束了，但是你会发现这节课的益处，比你们两个现在能想到的还要持久。
I would not, Joseph, take advantage, either of the hour, which is later, nor of you, nor Ruburt's willingness this evening, if I did not know that the action so involved would more than repay you.And the emotional qualities that we have achieved are also more important than you know.约瑟，要是我不知道这样的行动会让你们获益良多，今晚我就不会利用这么晚的时间，也不会利用你，以及鲁柏的意愿了。而且我们得到的情感品质也比你们知道的还要重要。
(“Good night, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
(End at 2:48 AM. Jane was dissociated as usual. Again she closed her eyes briefly to bring herself out of the trance. Her eyes had been very dark and luminous all evening.(凌晨2:48分结束，珍一如往常出离，她再一次短暂闭上眼睛让自己回神，双眼整晚都非常乌黑明亮。
(And even now, at the end of the session, I had been still strongly aware of something different about her, of a strong emotional involvement and immediacy.Her voice, her mannerisms in speaking, the steady way she stared at me, all contributed to this feeling.(即便现在，在这一节的尾声，我仍然强烈感觉她不太一样，有种强烈的情感投入和即时性。她的声音、她说话的调调、她盯着我看的坚定模样，在在都让我有这样的感觉。
(And once again, let it be noted that Jane suffered no aftereffects of any kind from this long session.Her cold was not affected either for better or worse. She had no voice fatigue. The next day she was not tired, etc.(这里再提一下，珍并没有因为上了这冗长的一课而有任何不良反应。她的感冒没有受影响而变好或变糟，她的声音未显疲态，隔天也不觉得累。
(It can also be noted that in the second half of the session Seth made no reference to my watching out for physical changes in Jane, as he had when Peggy and Bill Gallagher had been present.Bill and Peggy had seen changes. I observed my own set of changes later.It is my thought, at least at the moment, that Bill’s observations and my own would not coincide.This may be explained later.)(另外值得一提的是，在这一节后半段，赛斯不像蓓和比尔在场时那样，提到要我注意珍的身体变化。比尔和蓓先发现变化，之后我自己也观察到变化。我的想法是，至少在当下，比尔的观察和我自己的观察并不一致，这可能以后再解释。)

SESSION 159 第159节　比尔的溃疡 影响疾病的因素


JUNE 2, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年6月2日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Due to the very long unscheduled session of last Sunday, May 30, our regularly scheduled session for the next day, Monday, May 31, was not held.This was more to save me work in finishing up notes than because of any tiredness on Jane's part.She had no ill effects from the session.(由于上周日5月30日那天的临时课时间很长，所以我们隔天5月31日星期一的定期课没有举行。主要是为了节省我完成笔记的时间，而不是因为珍那边有任何疲惫的关系。那一节课并没有为她带来什么不良后果。
(Jane has been back on a regular schedule of psychological time now for a while, on the restricted twenty-minute schedule set by Seth.She experiments just before noon. She usually achieves what she calls an excellent state, and this is as far as the experiments have carried her.(珍恢复固定心理时间的练习已经有一阵子了，遵照赛斯严格设定的20分钟时限。她都在中午前做实验，通常可以达到她所谓的绝佳状态，实验最远就只能带她到这里为止。
(Janes cold still lingered to a lesser degree. She was coughing, but made no mention of not wanting to hold a session.Her cold had been worse when she held last Sunday 's long unscheduled session.(珍的感冒减轻，仍未痊愈，还是会咳嗽，但没有说要停课。她举行上周那节冗长的临时课当时，感冒更严重。
(Jane had no idea of the material for the session beforehand.For variety’s sake she wanted to hold the session in our living room again, as we used to do regularly.I was somewhat concerned about interruptions but as it developed there were none.(课前珍对这一节的资料毫无概念。为了变化，她想要照我们以前的习惯，在客厅上课。我有点担心会受到干扰，但后来并没有。
(Jane spoke while seated in the Kennedy rocker, and with her eyes closed for this first delivery.Her voice was rather quiet, although easily heard above the traffic noise.She coughed briefly occasionally and used pauses that were not very lengthy.She opened the session with a smile.)(在第一段传述，珍闭着眼睛坐在肯尼迪摇椅上讲话。她的声音虽然相当安静，但在车流噪音中仍清楚可闻。她偶尔小咳，也会停顿，但时间不长。她带着微笑开始这一节。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I was not certain, after our last so-lengthy session, that I would be greeted with open arms this evening.在我们上过一节那么长的课之后，我不确定今晚是否会受到热情的欢迎。
I know that indeed our last session so involved you, Joseph, in lengthy note taking, and typing chores.I do regret the amount of such work that is necessary.In the last section of our previous session in particular, I attempted to make a more direct emotional communication, and to some extent succeeded.约瑟，我知道我们的上一节确实让你做了好久的笔记和打字工作。这么多不得不做的工作，我真的觉得抱歉。特别是上一节的最后一段，我试图进行更直接的情感沟通，而且或多或少成功了。
We also of course experimented to some degree with Ruburts state.He carried on for me very well, and his abilities have once more shown a good degree of advancement.I tried again to speak with you on a much less formal basis. To some extent there must always be some barriers here, but we can with practice overcome many.我们当然也或多或少实验了鲁柏的状态。他为了我非常顺利进行下去，他的能力再次显现长足的进步。我再度试着用比较不正式的样子和你说话，这里多多少少一定都会有一些障碍，但透过练习，很多我们都可以克服。
There is a certain knack necessary on Ruburt’s part, a difference in the way in which energy is used, a variation of method between sessions in which rather objective material is presented, and in those sessions where we attempt to make a more personal type of contact.在鲁柏这边，必须拥有特定的技能，他要以不同的方式使用能量，这种在定期课与定期课之间的变换方法，有助于呈现相当客观的资料，好让我们在那些临时课里，企图进行更私人的接触。
The guests of the other evening were most advantageous, their attitudes objective; not gullible people, nor on the other hand were they the type who will not admit the results of their own experience.The woman has a large store of energy which she is using with above-average efficiency, but she also has abilities which are not being used.那天晚上的访客大有帮助，他们的态度客观；不容易受骗，另一方面也不是会拒绝承认自身经验结果的那种人。那个女人的能量丰沛，而且她的使用效率高于一般水准，但她也有尚未利用到的能力。
The man is using his own energies less effectively, since so much of them are being consumed in nervousness.He has not learned to conserve his energies, but to use them at all it seems that he must allow them almost to explode, so that there is little reserve.This is unfortunate, but can be corrected.那个男人使用他自己的能量比较没有成效，因为太多能量都消耗在紧张上。他还没有学会如何保存能量，一旦用了，就好像他非让它们几近爆炸不可似的，因此库存少之又少。这很可惜，但是可以改正。
Both of these personalities however are basically constructive, creative, and a relationship between the four of you should work out very well, not only on a short-term, but on a long-term basis, with advantages for all.不过这两个人格基本上都是建设性、创造性的，而且你们4人之间的关系，不只短期，还有长期应该都会发展得很好，对大家都有利。
The ulcer problem can indeed be solved by the personality himself.An attempt however should not be adopted by the personality, if possible, on an intense or desperate level.This, or any such too-intense effort will tend to make additional drains upon needed energy.该人格其实自己可以解决溃疡问题。但是，如果可能的话，该人格不应试图采取强烈或孤注一掷的行动。这类或是任何这样过度强烈的努力，很容易额外消耗必需的能量。
The ulcer simply can be cured, but this will involve on the part of the personality a disciplined program of self-understanding.Certainly such a program will be worthwhile.We do not want, for example, the personality to plunge into a solution. Instead what is advisable is a gradual but definite program that will result in a legitimate and a long-lasting cure.溃疡完全可以治愈，但该人格要有一个有纪律的自我了解计划。当然这样一个计划将会很值得。比方说，我们不想要这个人格栽进一个解决方案里，反之，建议采取一套渐进但明确的计划，如此将会产生合理且持久的疗效。
I will suggest a brief break, and with your consent we will speak a while longer on this particular matter.我建议稍微休息一下，如果你们同意，我将会针对这件事再多讲一会儿。
(Break at 9:21.Jane was dissociated more than usual for a first delivery.She said she felt like opening her eyes a couple of times, or rather that Seth did.Her voice was rather dry and hoarse at times but was not strained, and became no worse during the session.She did not appear tired.(9:21分休息。第一段传述，珍比平时更为出离。她说她感觉有一两次想要张开眼睛，或者确切地说，是赛斯想要。她的声音有时相当干涩沙哑，但没有过度用力，课间也没有恶化。她看来不累。
(I was a little tired, however, from the extensive typing involved from the last session, and reminded Jane that some of her comments regarding this were not good suggestions.She agreed. She had lit a cigarette during break, and now when she resumed speaking she held the cigarette in a hand.I thought this meant she might be getting ready to open her eyes while delivering material.But she resumed with her eyes closed, in the same quiet dry voice, at 9:27.)(不过，由于上一节的打字量庞大，所以我有点累，并提醒珍，她在这方面的评论有些不好的暗示，她同意。休息时她点了一根烟，现在她手上拿着烟继续说话。我想这表示她可能准备好，要在传述资料时张开眼睛。但是，她却闭着眼睛，用一样安静干涩的声音，在9:27分继续。)
Now indeed we will overcome our Ruburt's poor suggestions.现在我们真的会克服我们鲁柏那些不好的暗示。
There are many aspects of our sessions, some that we have developed well, others that we have only begun to develop, and others that are yet to be developed.我们的课有很多面向，有些我们发展得不错，有些我们才刚开始发展，还有一些尚待发展。
All of them will be important, and all of them will serve to add dimension to the reality which the sessions involve.This could indeed be thought of in terms of value fulfillment.The sessions also will be helped in general by variety, always of course within our framework.这些面向全部都很重要，也都能为这些课涉及的实相增添维度。这其实可以从价值完成的角度来思考。一般而言，变化也会为这些课带来助益，当然这一切都在我们的架构之内。
(Jane now smiled again, then opened her eyes.They were again dark and luminous as she looked at me.This however was not the intent stare of the last session, but a more conversational and quiet one.)(这时珍再度微笑，接着张开眼睛。她的双眼注视我时仍然乌黑明亮，但这种注视并不是像上一堂课那样坚定地直盯着我看，而是比较温和、健谈的样子。)
I will help you and your poor fingers when it seems advisable.You yourself are learning to substitute good suggestions for bad ones, and it will help you further to keep this in mind.等时机恰当时，我会帮助你和你可怜的手指头。你自己正在学习以好的暗示取代不好的暗示，而这会帮你进一步将这一点谨记在心。
I did indeed wish to experiment, though not on a spectacular basis, along the lines that we are using this evening.I now and then enjoy sitting at a comfortable table with you, with his eyes open, and it is good training for Ruburt.我真的很希望以我们今晚的内容来做实验，不过并不会以很夸张的方式。我有时候很享受跟你一起舒适地坐在桌旁，张开他的眼睛，那对鲁柏来说也是很好的训练。
I intend to speak more concerning your friend, we can initiate a program for him. It will perhaps seem like a conservative program, and he will do all of the work.我打算多谈一下你们的朋友，我们可以为他开始进行一项计划，那项计划，那项计划看起来或许比较保守，而他也将全程参与。
We may not expand this program this evening.When we do he will see that only good can come from it. It will not involve medicines or drugs. It will involve perhaps more than anything else the task of slowly changing the focus of his attention and energies, of turning energies that are being used in a self-destructive manner into constructive channels.我们今晚也许还不会展开这项计划。等到我们进行这项计划时，他就了解它只会带来好处，不会涉及医疗或药物的问题，而也许只是牵涉到逐渐改变他注意力和能量的焦点，将能量目前的使用方式，从自我毁灭导向建设性。
This is the main problem.The reason that these energies are being used against the self must and will be uncovered.I will also have, if I am asked, suggestions for the woman in their relationship, that will be most beneficial.I mentioned that the reason for the difficulty had been built up.这正是主要的问题。这些能量之所以会用来对抗自己，必然有其原因，一定要找出来。要是有人问我，我也会提供一些极为有用的建议，给他们那段关系中的那位女士。我曾提过，引发问题的原因早就形成了。
(Jane, now, looked at me but occasionally. Her voice remained quiet. She used pauses less often and they were short ones.She spoke while looking casually ahead for the most part, and performed such ordinary chores as putting out her cigarette, sipping from a glass of wine, sometimes rocking back and forth, etc.)(这时珍偶尔注视着我，她维持轻柔的声音，暂停次数比较少，时间也比较短。她讲话时大多是不经意地往前看，同时带着一些惯常的小动作，如熄掉香烟、举杯啜点小酒、有时还前后摇晃椅子等。)
The personality in the past, in past existences that is, had a history of hitting out at the organs of the various physical bodies that were its home, as other personalities sometimes have histories that include turning destructiveness outward against others.Such tendencies again are of long standing, and adopted for various reasons having to do with characteristics of the underlying personality.这个人格在过去，也就是在过去的存在里，曾经对自己身上各种不同的肉体器官猛烈攻击，而其他人格在同样的情况下，有时候却会将破坏力向外，攻击外面的人。再者，这种倾向持续很久，而且潜在的人格特质，基于各种相关因素也接受了这种倾向。
These cannot be recounted, again, in one evening; nor would such a performance serve any purpose at this time; listed, so to speak.There are considerations that connect them that must be discussed, if any good will be done.The need for the ulcer was aggravated in the fairly recent past, but the personality is basically flexible enough so that adjustments can be made.这部分同样无法一个晚上就讲清楚；可以这么说，这样的现象此时也不能达成什么目的。有一些相关的考量因素，必须加以讨论，或许会有所助益。在最近这段时间，这个人格对溃疡的需求增加了，但基本上这个人格颇具弹性，足以调整此种情况。
There will also be suggestions given as to needed adjustments on the part of the personality during his business hours.In other words, there are small but important adjustments that can be made within the framework of his present working life.Also perhaps an adjustment here on the woman’s part that will aid him.对于这个人格在工作时间内必须做的问题，这里也有些建议。换句话说，在他目前工作生活的架构中，可以做些小幅度的重要调整。此时如果这位女士做点调整，或许也可以帮助他。
I am going into this because the problem has obviously become an organic one.As a beginning I would suggest that your friend read our material concerning the formation of physical matter in general, the formation of the physical image, and the physical organs.If he can see that he is indeed responsible for the condition of his physical body in the most practical manner possible, then it will be much easier for him to picture his own cure.我就来谈谈这一部分，因为这个问题显然已经变成器官上的问题了。首先，我会建议你们的朋友读读我们的资料，以便对实体物质、身体形象，以及肉体器官的形成，大致上有个了解。如果他尽可能以最实际的方式，领悟出自己的确该为身体状况负责，那么要他想像出自己痊愈的样貌会容易得多。
I will now suggest your own break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:50.Jane was well dissociated. She blinked several times without closing her eyes for any length of time, then she was out of her trance.(9:50分休息。珍出离得很好，眨了几次眼睛，但都没闭上，之后就回神了。
(It remained a quiet and easy session even when Jane's eyes remained opened.In a slightly louder voice, she resumed at 9:55.)(即使珍的眼睛一直都开着，课堂气氛仍然宁静轻柔。她以稍微大一点的声音，9:55分继续口述。)
I am not going to hold a long session, feeling that I have indeed taken much of your time already this week.我觉得这一周真的占用了你们太多时间，所以这节课不会太长。
I am going to take this instance of your friend’s illness however to make a few points of my own, some that may not be too well received.A cure of any kind will never depend upon any given treatment. It will in all cases depend upon the belief on the part of the sufferer that he can be cured. It will depend upon his desire to be cured. It will depend upon the strength of the purpose that an illness serves.It will depend upon, in the last analysis, the individual's own ability to mobilize his own energies, for only these will effect a cure.不过，我要举你朋友生病的例子，来提出我自己的一些观点，当中有些观点可能接收得不太好。要疗愈任何病痛，从来就不是仰赖施予的医疗方式，不管在什么状况下，都要仰赖患者认为自己可以痊愈的信念上，仰赖他对治愈疾病的渴望，也仰赖疾病所欲望达成目的的力量上。总而言之，仰赖个人本身启动自己能量的能力，因为能影响疾病疗愈的因素就只有这些。
Any physician of any kind can only help a sufferer mobilize these energies and direct them.A sufferer has adopted an illness into his own self-image, through suggestion, which to a large degree he himself has given.He has caused the illness, whether it be organic or otherwise, and only suggestion will rid him of it.任何种类的医师都只能帮助患者启动这些能量、引导这些能量。患者透过暗示，把疾病置入他自己的自我意象当中，而这个暗示多半都是来自于他自己。是他召唤出疾病，不论是器官上或其他方面的疾病，只有透过暗示才能让他摆脱疾病。
It is indeed quite time for us to discuss the true nature and reality of what is so loosely called suggestion.We have indeed spoken much concerning the focus of energy, and a sufferer is truly entranced with the idea of his illness, and it is only this which basically allows the illness to continue.He focuses upon it both consciously and unconsciously.我们现在来讨论广义而言所谓的暗示，其真实的本质与实相，的确正是时候。我们实际上已经谈过很多关于能量焦点的问题，也提过真的是患者自己让疾病意念进驻，基本上，也唯有如此，疾病才得以继续存在。他的意识和潜意识都聚焦在疾病上面。
An illness is a failure to solve a mental or psychological problem in the correct manner.As long as the illness continues the problem remains unsolved, and a vicious circle is maintained because of this unwholesome balance. The sufferer focuses upon the illness, therefore avoiding his task of functioning upon the problem.疾病代表着未能以正确的方式，解决精神或心理问题。只要疾病继续存在，就代表问题尚未解决，而这种不平衡的关系就会一直恶性循环下去，患者将焦点集中在疾病上，因而逃避了他解决问题的任务。
The energy that would be used to solve the problem instead is spent maintaining the illness.It is therefore necessary that an attempt be made as soon as possible to solve the problem, which of course must first be discovered by the ego, which has avoided it.原本该用来解决问题的能量，反而却用来让疾病继续存在。因此这时该做的是，尽快努力解决问题，当然首先，自我必须找到那个他之前逃避的问题。
This first attempt to discover the problem, automatically and because of its nature, immediately aids the sufferer in changing the focus of his attention away from the symptom, which he has himself formed, and already the symptom is weaker.这种一开始想找出问题所在的企图，本质上立刻可以自动帮助患者，将注意力焦点从自己形成的疾病症状移开，进而让症状减轻。
The trouble with many health programs for recovery is that they cause the sufferer to focus upon his illness more than ever. The unsolved problem is therefore pushed further away.Our program for your friend will almost immediately include a brief but effective suggestion that should be given before sleep, and at various times during the day.许多健康复元计划的问题，在于让患者比过去更聚焦于疾病上，待解决的问题因此被推得更远。我们给你朋友的计划，差不多就是在睡前以及白天各个不同的时间，给自己简短而有效的暗示。
We ourselves will be concerned for a while with the nature of suggestion in its relationship to action.It should be most beneficial material, practically speaking, and will also add to your knowledge and carry our discussions toward certain directions that I have in mind.我们将花点时间，关注一下暗示的本质，以及暗示与行动之间的关系。实际上来说，这部分的资料相当有用，也会增加你们的知识，并让我们的讨论朝着我心中某些特定方向前进。
If I am, myself, subdued this evening in contrast with my activities in our last session, it is only because I would give you both a needed rest.I particularly enjoyed the session myself. I will now give you a break.I will end the session if you prefer, or I will continue.如果我今晚的活动，比起我们上次课堂中来得节制一些，那只是因为我要给你们俩足够的休息。我自己特别喜欢这节课，现在就给你们休息一下。如果你们愿意，我就结束这堂课，否则就继续。
(“Well take a short break then.”(“那我们就短暂休息一下好了。”
(Break at 10:15.Jane was again well dissociated. She said that when speaking with her eyes open she is not as sharply aware of the transition from a trance state to a nontrance state.Now, she felt as though she could quite easily slip back into a trance, although she did not feel Seth.(10:15分休息。珍的出离状况依旧很好，她说，张开眼睛讲话时，无法敏锐知觉到从出神状态到回神状态之间的转换。现在她虽然感觉不到赛斯存在，但觉得好像可以轻易快速回到出神状态。
(Jane resumed with her eyes open, in an average voice and at a faster rate, at10:20.)(珍张着双眼，音量普通，但速度较快些，10:20分继续口述。)
So-called suggestion causes not only sickness but health.所谓的暗示，不仅会带来疾病，也会带来健康。
The term itself is a very poor one. We will go much more deeply into this as the whole discussion continues.Needless to say, suggestion operates as strongly and as realistically and as practically within an atom, or a toad, or a leaf, as it does in man.暗示本身是个非常糟的用语，随着整个讨论继续进行，我们会更深入探讨这一点。暗示对原子、对蟾蜍或对树叶而言，都有强烈、真实、实际的作用力，不必多说，在人类身上也是如此。
Our material concerning the construction of the physical universe and of physical matter in general may now, perhaps, give you an idea of how important suggestion is.Also consider our material on expectation, for indeed expectation comes closer, as a term, than does suggestion.我们的资料曾提及物质宇宙和物质建构的一般状况，这部分现在或许就可以让你们知道暗示有多么重要。也仔细想想我们有关期望的资料，因为就用语来说，期望这个词真的比暗示更为贴近。
Our focus of energy is vital, both yours and mine.Expectation to a large extent determines the manner in which we will use this energy, and the types of constructions that will be formed.Your friend’s ulcer for example is his problem in its entirety, constructed into the physical matter of his own organism.我们能量的焦点极其重要，你我都一样。期望大幅决定了我们使用能量的方式，以及即将形成的建构类型。举例来说，你朋友的溃疡完全是他的问题，他建构出自己身体上的实体物质。
This is to be taken literally.这是按照字面上来说。
The problem, as a mental manipulation, has not been settled. The resulting construction, therefore, is a faithful replica of this distortion.这个问题是心理运作的问题，尚未解决，因此，建构出来的实际结果，就是这种扭曲的忠实复制品。
(Jane's eyes now closed.She continued speaking without interruption, and her eyes remained closed for the balance of the session.)(珍现在闭上眼睛。继续讲述没有中断，为了这节课的平衡，双眼继续闭着。)
In some types of illnesses such distortions are mirrored or reflected, so to speak, many times within one organism.We will have much more to say along these lines.就某些类型的疾病而言，这类扭曲会在一个有机体内，多次反射或反映出来。在这方面，我们还有很多东西要说。
I will indeed now close our session. For Ruburt's benefit, may There add that in my remarks of our last session, I was speaking of our sessions only, and did not mean to take credit for any of Ruburt’s own creative work.I am saying this in gentle tones, to avoid upsetting him further.我现在真的要结束我们的课，为了鲁柏好，我这里或许可以再补充一下，我上一次在课堂中所说的话，都只是针对我们的课来说而已，无意将鲁柏自己的创作，归于我自己。我现在以轻柔的语调来说明，以免又让他觉得不开心。
(Jane spoke with a smile.)(珍带着微笑说话。)
Again, my heartiest and most fond wishes to you both.Ruburt incidentally would do well to be even more aware than usual, since he is at a peak now of psychic activity.再次送上我最衷心、最深情的祝福给你们俩。顺便一提，鲁柏会做得非常好，甚至比平常还更有觉察力，因为他目前正处在心灵活动的最高点。
Your painting will now spur you on.你的绘画现在会为你带来激励作用。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:32.Jane was dissociated as usual. She did not realize that she had closed her eyes before the end of the session.My writing hand felt little fatigue.)(10:32分结束。珍的出离状况如常，她并不知道自己在这堂课结束前闭上眼睛。我写字的那只手觉得有点酸。)

SESSION 160 第160节　暗示就是期望 暗示的重要性


JUNE 7, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年6月7日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(Again we held the session in our living room, as we used to do. There were no interruptions.Jane had no idea of the material for the session before she began speaking, on time.She sat down as usual, with her eyes closed for this first delivery.There was quite a bit of traffic noise even at this hour, and Janes voice had a stronger edge, as though to cut through it.)(我们同样依惯例在客厅上这一节课，中间没什么中断。珍在准时开始上课前，并不知道这一节要谈什么资料。她一如往常坐下来，闭上眼睛准备第一阶段的传述。此时车声仍相当吵杂，珍的声音变得比较尖锐，仿佛要压过吵杂声。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I would like to make a few remarks concerning such spontaneous sessions as we have had, and particularly concerning our last spontaneous and witnessed session.关于我们举行过的那种自发课，我要做一些评论，特别是针对上次那堂有人在场见证的自发课。
In the past we have held few such spontaneous sessions.When Ruburt’s condition is such that a particularly good trance can be achieved, and when the emotional climate surrounding you is advantageous, then we can do much.过去我们举行过几节这样的自发课。只要鲁柏的状况特别能进入不错的出神状态，再加上你们的情感氛围也处于有利状况，这些课就可以多多益善。
It is advantageous to take our opportunity when possible at such times.I have been strict concerning our schedule, since conditioning must be set up, and while we always allowed for some spontaneity, it was necessary that Ruburt develop greater efficiency in his handling of the trance state.我们要把握这类可能的机会，因为那相当有益。由于必须营造上课的状况条件，所以我一直严守我们的时间表，但我们一向都允许某些自发性出现，因此鲁柏必须更有效掌握好出神状态。
There are obviously many occasions when his condition is unusually suited to hold a spontaneous session, but when the emotional climate is not for one reason or another correct, or when other elements, practical ones to you, may prevent a session.他的状态显然有很多机会非常适合举行自发课，但如果因为某些理由而使得情绪气氛不适合，或是受到你们其他实际因素的影响，那么课程可能就无法进行。
As a general rule a spontaneous session will be an excellent one.It goes without saying however that discretion must be used, and I will not come through without your consent.The consent however on your parts may be conscious or unconscious. If however you consciously do not want a session, and express yourselves in this direction, then no session would be held.按常理来说，自发课是相当棒的课。然而，我必须考虑周详，如果没有你们的同意，我也不会透过来，这一点不需赘述。不过你们的同意，有可能是意识或无意识的，如果你们意识上不想上课，而且也表达了这个意向，那么课就不会上。
When no conscious decision has been made, I would be following your subconscious wishes in such a manner.如果意识上没做决定，那我就会以这样的方式，遵循你们潜意识的意愿。
Now, to return to an earlier discussion. What you call suggestion is indeed expectation.You should understand by now how the physical image is constructed. This construction is from the inside out. The inner self attempts to construct a physical image in line with its own self-image.Any errors of construction have their origin not in the inner self, but in either the personal subconscious or in the ego.现在，回到之前的讨论，你们所谓的暗示其实就是期望。你们现在应该知道身体形象如何建构，这个建构是由内向外，内我试图建构一个与自己的自我意象一致的身体形象。如果有什么建构上的错误，其源头并非来自内我，而是来自个人潜意识或自我。
(The traffic noise was now even heavier.I thought it was bothering Jane, since she seemed to be sitting in a rather tense position in her rocker.Her voice grew a little louder.)(车子的吵杂声这时变得更严重。我想珍已经受到干扰，因为她坐在摇椅上的姿势好像很紧绷，她的声音变得大一些。)
As errors and mistakes creep into the physical organic system, bringing forth mutant genes and distortions, so also these mutant genes and distortions are, on a smaller scale, the result of inner distortions within the consciousness of the individual genes.错误和失误悄然进入身体组织系统，导致了基因突变或扭曲。个人基因意识里的内在扭曲，在比较轻微的情况下，也会造成这些基因突变或扭曲。
The same sort of distortion occurs on another scale, in the duplication of any given illness or destructive organic or gross malfunctions.What you call suggestion should ideally come from within the self, and not from outside the self.在严重的情况下，同样的内在扭曲会演变成任何疾病、严重的器官功能丧失或全面的功能丧失。你们所谓的暗示，理想上应该从自己的里面而来，而非从自己的外面而来。
I suggest your first break.我建议你们第一次休息。
(Break at 9:16.Jane was dissociated, but not as well as usual for a first break.She said the traffic noise bothered her, but that she would make an effort to see that it didn’t continue to do so.(9:16分休息。珍在第一次休息出离，但不像平常那么好。她说车子的吵杂声干扰了她，但她会努力，看看能否不再受到吵杂声干扰。
(Janes eyes had remained closed for the first delivery, but they opened soon after she began speaking again.She was also smoking. As during the last session she looked at me occasionally, but for the most part looked casually ahead without staring fixedly at anything.Her eyes were dark, her voice a little heavier and louder.Resume at 9:22.)(珍在第一阶段传述时，眼睛闭着，但等到她又开始传述，马上睁开。她也抽着烟，就如上节课一样，偶尔看看我，但大部分时间她都随意向前看，并不会盯着任何东西看。她双眼乌黑，声音低沉些，也大声些。9:22分继续。)
I can indeed arrange our evening in such a manner that your traffic will bother us not a bit.实际上我能以某个方式安排我们的夜晚，好让你们车子的噪音一点也不会吵到我们。
When we have gone into the nature of action still much more thoroughly, then you will be able to use such knowledge for quite practical purposes, and to your advantage.For as you know, you do not perceive all aspects of action by any means, and it can indeed to some extent be up to you to choose those aspects of action with which you will be concerned, and those which you would ignore.如果我们更加彻底探讨行动的本质，那你们就能使用这类的知识达成相当实际的目的，并获得助益。因为如你们所知，无论你们用什么方法，都不能感知到行动的所有面向，但就某种程度来讲，的确可以由你们来选择哪些是你们想关注的行动面向，而哪些又是想忽略的面向。
This in no manner affects the nature of those actions which you ignore.However, to all intents and purposes it changes action in so far as you are concerned with it.This would therefore imply a choice on your part, in a manner that you do not now enjoy.For you can then choose to perceive advantageous action, as well as you can choose not to perceive action which for any reason or another you choose to ignore.这不会影响到你忽略的那些行动本质。实际上来讲，它改变了你们所关注的行动。因此这当中隐含着你们自己的选择，至于选择方式你们目前并不喜欢。因为你们可以选择去感知有益的行动，而那些不管基于什么理由你们决定忽略的行动，也可以选择不去感知。
This obviously implies powers of discipline and discretion.The ability therefore will not come until you can handle it.这明显暗含了自律和自由的力量。因此，这个能力要等到你们能掌握时才会出现。
Suggestion would of course play a part in the development of these abilities.It is difficult, even though we are so far into our sessions, to give you any full understanding yet of what is involved in the basic nature of suggestion, but as we go deeper into the subject there will be experiments that you both can try.在这些能力的发展中，暗示当然扮演一定的角色。即使我们的课已进展到这个程度，但还是不容易让你们完全了解暗示的基本性质为何，不过等到你们更深入这个主题后，就会有一些实验可以让你们俩来试试。
I have often mentioned that the divisions in our subject matter are often arbitrary, and for practical purposes of discussion only.The word suggestion is in itself so bound in your minds with other matters that even I find it difficult not to let the subject matter become suggestive of matters that do not really belong under discussion.我常常提到，我们资料主题的划分往往很武断，那都只是为了方便讨论而已。暗示这个用语本身，在你们脑海里跟其他概念绑得非常紧密，所以要让人在看到这个主题时，不会联想到那些真的不属于讨论范围的东西，连我都觉得不容易。
(Jane leaned forward to tap on the table for emphasis. She smiled.She now acted as though immune to the traffic noise, and I realized that at times I too had forgotten about it as I wrote along.)(珍身子往前倾，敲着桌子加以强调，她面带微笑，此时似乎已不受噪音影响，我也发现自己振笔疾书时，偶尔会忘了噪音的存在。)
You think for example in terms of good and bad suggestions, and I have on occasion used the terms myself, in order to make a point clear.However what you call suggestion, left alone, is a part of the inner impetus of action, which is translated in all areas of consciousness outward.举例来说，你们会以好暗示和坏暗示的观点来思考，而我自己为了把观念解说清楚，有时也会使用这样的用语。不过，如果单独来看，你们所谓的暗示是属于内在行动冲力的一部分，可以向外转化到所有的意识领域中。
What interrupts this inner impetus could be compared to what you call poor suggestion. It is indeed distortive. It represents a blocking of impetus.It interrupts what should be a simultaneous and easy flow of inner impetus outward, in your case outward to physical construction.The particular negative words spoken or thought are but indications of this break of impetus.The break occurs first, and it is for this reason that what you call negative suggestions therefore are acted upon.会阻断这个内在冲力的东西，可以比喻为你们所谓的坏暗示，它实际上是扭曲的，代表冲力的阻塞。原本那股内在冲力，应该同时且轻易向外流出来，以你们来讲就是向外形成身体的建构，却受到了阻断。那些已说出口或脑中想出来的特定负面暗示，只是显示出这股冲力已遭破坏。破坏先行发生，接着基于这个原因，你们所谓的负面暗示才表现出来。
The negative suggestions therefore are symptoms of an inner block of energy and impetus. They represent a rift that has already occurred.It is rather important that I make this point clear.It goes without saying that these which you call negative suggestions are in themselves actions. They represent however dead eddies, the motion that means nothing in dead waters. They are impeding actions.因此，负面暗示是内在能量与冲力阻塞显现出来的症状，它们代表已经有裂缝产生。这一点很重要，所以我要理清。不用多说，你们所谓的负面暗示，其本身就是行动，不过它们代表的是死漩涡，是死水里空无的动作，阻挡了行动。
Many, many occasions arise when action could be so impeded, and is not.在很多很多的情况下，行动本来可能会遭到这么严重的阻碍，却得以幸免。
(Now Jane's eyes opened briefly. She looked at me, then closed them.Her eyes had been closed for the last few paragraphs.)(这时珍短暂张开双眼，看着我然后再闭上眼睛，在最后几段时她的眼睛一直都闭着。)
What you call a negative suggestion is never acted upon unless the inner block of energies has already occurred.Suggestion, as I understand it, is the culmination of the inner voice that urges action into ever more diverse and creative patterns.除非内在能量已经发生阻塞，否则你们所谓的负面暗示不会表现出来。就我的了解，暗示就是内在声音的最高点，催促行动要呈现出更多变化、更富创意的型态。
We will have much to say concerning impediments; and impediments, incidentally, are what you call negative suggestions.And yet remember that these impediments are themselves action.关于阻断的问题我们还有很多要谈；另外，阻断就是你们所称的负面暗示。还有，要记住这些阻断本身就是行动。
I now suggest your break.我现在建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:45.Jane blinked a few times, then came out of her trance. She said she had been a good deal more dissociated for this delivery.She had not been conscious of traffic, nor had I.(9:45分休息。珍眨了几次眼后就回神了，她说，这一段传述的出离状况比平常要深沉得多。她早就不再意识到车声，我也没有。
(When Jane resumed dictating her eyes remained open.She was smoking. Again, her glances at me were casual.She had used pauses before this break, but now she spoke quite a bit more rapidly.Resume at 9:50.)(珍继续口述时，眼睛张开。她抽着烟，再度不经意地看看我。在这次休息前，她暂停了好几次，不过现在她以快得多的速度讲述。9:50分继续。)
What you choose to call suggestion operates unceasingly within all aspects of action.你们选择称之为暗示的东西，不断在行动的所有面向中起作用。
It is this that allows the body its physical manifestation. It is this that allows for all change.It can be called on one level instinct, on other levels it is much more.When it operates at its most efficient level suggestion is indeed the inner affirmation.Without the ego we do not have what you call negative suggestions, for when action is left to itself it flows unimpeded, seeking its fulfillment along its numberless unimpeded ways.这种情形让身体能够以物质方式呈现，这种情形让一切变化得以发生。就某层面来说，可以称为本能，在其他层面来说，可以称呼的就多得多了。当暗示以最高效率运作时，它实际上就是内在肯定。没有自我，就不会有你们所谓的负面暗示，因为只要行动不受干扰，流动就不会被阻断，会以无数种未受阻断的方式，寻求价值完成。
Your own experiments in psychological time have allowed you, to some extent, to experience within yourselves such unimpeded action.You know now that the ego, because of its nature, attempts to set itself aside from action. It obviously cannot do so.The ego, being part of action, nevertheless affects the nature of action as seen in the various manifestations of the whole self.你们做的心理时间练习，某种程度已让你们在自己里面，体验这种未受阻断的行动。你们现在也知道，自我出于本性，会试图让自己与行动脱离，但它显然无法做到。自我身为行动的一部分，仍然会影响行动的本质，就像全我会有各种不同的表现一样。
The personal subconscious can be thought of as a threshold between the ego and the inner self; not only can glimmerings of the inner self be glimpsed through the subconscious, but also the diverse characteristics of the ego touch this personal subconscious.When the ego, therefore, becomes too overbearing it attempts to impede the flow of action.It cannot so impede action directly, for the very act of forming such impediments involves action.Nevertheless such impediments often set up actions that block the overall movement or direction of the action that composes the whole personality.个人潜意识可以想像成自我和内我之间的一个关口；透过潜意识不仅可以隐约瞥见内我，而且自我各式各样的性格，亦可接触到个人潜意识。因此，要是自我变得太强势专断，就会企图阻断行动之流。但是它无法直接这样地阻断行动，因为形成这种阻断的行为，本身就是行动。然而这样的阻挡往往会采取一些行动，以冻结整体行动的发展趋势或动向，而整个人格正是由这些整体行动的发展趋势或动向所组成。
The delicate inner mechanisms by which inner reality should be constructed into physical reality therefore become seriously affected.Distortions occur almost like mutant mental genes, which are then faithfully and duly reproduced.内在实相本该透过这个微妙的内在机制，建构成物质实相，但却因此受到严重影响。扭曲的现象于焉产生，几乎就像突变的心理基因一样，确切且忠实地复制出来。
What you call negative suggestions represent discordant actions.Unless the main reasons are discovered, the distortive actions will keep reoccurring.In many cases quite a simple exercise will almost immediately begin to make an improvement.With these exercises you are familiar, for in your psychological time the self is momentarily in connection with its more extensive portions.你们所谓的负面暗示代表了不同调的行动。除非找出主要原因，否则扭曲的行动就会一直重复发生。多数情况下，只要一项极为简单的练习，几乎就可以立刻改善状况。你们对这些练习并不陌生，因为你们在心理时间时，自己很快就会与它更广阔的部分连结上。
A clear and undiverted and unbroken electrical circuit and connection is hereby made.Growth within the physical system is the result of suggestion. Without it there would be no growth.You will see here that we are beginning our discussion in the simplest of terms, and we will lead further so that eventually suggestion can be understood for what it is.透过这个方式，可以形成一种清楚、直接且完整的电路与连结。物质系统里面的成长，是暗示所造成的结果，没有暗示就不会有成长。此时你们会知道，我们正以最简单的用语开始讨论，接着会进一步引导，好让你们最后可以了解何谓暗示。
It goes without saying that each newborn consciousness within your system carries within it the capsule comprehension of which I have previously spoken; and if you recall, each atom and molecule, each and every smallest particle that can by any stretch of the imagination be called physical matter, contains within it its own independent capsule comprehension—inherent suggestions in coded form, in not one but several codes, that give complete instructions for development and growth.不用说，你们系统中每一个新诞生的意识，自己之内都会带有我之前提过的浓缩理解；如果你们回忆一下就会知道，透过想像力的发挥，每个原子与分子、每个最小的粒子都可以称为实体物质，在其中都包含各自的浓缩理解——也就是已编码过的内在暗示，不只是一个码，而是好几个码，用以提供发展和成长的完整指引。
If your fingers tire you may take a break, and we will continue.如果你的手会酸，可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 10:11.Jane was well dissociated throughout the delivery. Her eyes had been open all the while, but she had no memory of this.Traffic had not bothered her, and her delivery had been rather fast.(10:11分休息。珍整段口述都出离得很好，眼睛一直都开着，不过记不得这些资料。车子噪音并没有吵到她，传述速度相当快。
(She resumed with her eyes again open and very large and dark, in a normal voice and with a few pauses, at 10:22.)(10:22分珍继续口述，仍旧张着乌黑的大眼睛，音量正常，但有几次停顿。)
There are translations of intent constantly made.意图不断被转化。
The innate comprehension of which we have spoken is a basic portion of all atoms and molecules, about which the physical matter is formed, and without which the formation of physical matter would be impossible.我们曾提过，内在的理解(innate comprehension)是所有原子与分子的基本成分，它与物质的形成有关，没有它就不可能会有物质的形成。
You recall, I am sure, the material concerning the gestalt of the physical body.Here suggestion constantly plays its part in the formation of the tissues, and in all other such areas of development and growth.There are various manners in which these inner suggestions are translated from inner pure energy form into the electrical and chemical systems which compose the physical organisms, and it is possible for errors of translation to occur along these lines.我敢说，你们应该记得有关肉体完形的资料。在组织形成，以及所有其他这类发展与成长的领域当中，暗示持续不断扮演一个角色。这些内在暗示会经由各种不同的方法，从内在纯能量的形式，转化为组成物质有机体的电子与化学系统，而在这个过程中，可能会产生转化上的错误。
Recall here also the cooperation that exists between the smallest particles and the cells and organs.Each molecule has its own self-image, without which it could not exist as a physical construction.The subconscious has its own self-image, the ego has its own self-image.这里也回想一下最小的粒子与细胞和器官之间的合作关系。各个分子有自己的自我意象，若非如此，分子就无法以物质建构的方式存在。潜意识有自己的自我意象，自我也有自己的自我意象。
When action is allowed to flow unimpeded, the cooperation that is necessary to maintain the efficiency of the gestalt is maintained.It is most frequently the error of the ego, who upon many occasions attempts to deny its dependency upon this cooperation, that sets up impediments, and sets up counter suggestions that can be somewhat considered cancerous, in that if it had its way the ego would envelop all other aspects of the whole organism, and run riot.只要行动能流动，不受到阻碍，维系完形效率所需的合作关系就得以保持下去。最常见的错误是来自于自我，在很多情况下，自我会想办法否认自己对这种合作关系的依赖，因此形成了障碍，也形成某种程度上可以被视为恶性的反暗示，在其中，如果自我能为所欲为，就会封锁住整个有机体的所有其他面向，然后胡作非为。
It will refuse to assimilate certain experiences. This very refusal is in itself an action. It will attempt to construct itself on a physical level, since it is within the physical system of reality.The cooperation is broken down to some greater or lesser degree.This conflicts with the inner data in the case of illnesses, and the illnesses are actually the result of conflicts of data.It is obvious that the body is equipped to handle many such distorted actions, but a conflict is hereby brought into play, where constructive energies or actions are not given full reign, and patterns of distortions are set up within the system. If they cannot be overwhelmed they are assimilated, and faithfully reproduced.自我会拒绝接收某些经验，这个拒绝本身就是一个行动，它会想办法在物质层面建构自己，因为它就在物质的实相系统里。这个合作关系或多或少就遭到破坏了。就疾病来说，这就与内在资料有所冲突，而疾病其实就是这些资料冲突所造成的结果。显而易见的是，身体有能力处理许多这类扭曲的行动，但冲突也会因而产生，在这当中，建设性的能量或行动无法获得足够的支配权，系统之内就形成了各种扭曲的模式。
There are methods whereby you can indeed help your own system, and to a large measure determine the constructive nature of action as it operates within the system, and protect the organism from such distortions before they occur.如果无法全力压倒这些扭曲，它们就会被吸纳，如实地复制。在这种情况下，实际上你们可以用许多方法协助自己的系统，有效决定系统内行动的建设性本质，而且可以在这种扭曲发生前，就事先保护有机本。
I will give you instructions along these lines.Ruburt’s habit of requesting before he sleeps that his system effortlessly continue its healthful and natural cooperation is a good one.But this is, while helpful, only a very basic and beginning aid.我会给你们这方面的指引。鲁柏睡前会请求他的系统，能轻松地继续维持健康、自然的合作关系，这是个不错的习惯。虽然这种做法会有好处，但只是一种非常基本、非常初步的帮助而已。
This whole subject is much more complicated than you may at first suppose.这整个主题比你们原先想的还要复杂得多。
Until we had discussed action to some degree, a discussion on suggestion would have meant little to you.We will continue along these lines for some time, even while the subject leads us into others.要等我们讨论行动到某种程度之后，再来讨论暗示，对你们才比较有意义。虽然这个主题会引导我们到其他部分，但我们仍会花些时间继续探讨这方面的问题。
Since suggestion is used constantly, and by every cell in your body, then it is not a question of whether or not you can use suggestion, but of how to use it more effectively.And this will involve a balanced personality, for in such a personality action will be allowed freedom of expression. The ego will gain and not lose in the process, but we will not have an autocratic and willful ego, but a reasonable and even disciplined ego that is aware of its position, aware of its own dependency, as well as of its own peculiar and unique perceptive apartness. For the apartness is dependent upon its being a part of the whole gestalt.因为暗示持续不断地用在你们体内的每个细胞，所以问题不在于你们能不能使用暗示，而是如何更有效率地使用。这会牵涉到一个平衡的人格，因为在这样的人格当中，行动会获得表达的自由，自我在这过程中会有所得，而不是有所失，但我们的自我不会独裁专制，而是通情达理，甚至有纪律，不但明白自身的处境，还知道自身的依靠，也能深知到自身特有的孤立现象，因为这种孤立取决于它是整体完形的一部分。
Are you fingers tired?你的手会酸吗？
("No. ’’)(“不会。”)
We find it most frequently that the ego impedes action by refusals. It attempts to maintain a stability that is indeed illusion.The emotions, as you know, are action. When they are allowed their mobility, then they free the personality from resistances. They actually allow for great stability, since their free expression makes it possible for action to be fulfilled in the manner most constructive for the system as a whole.我们发现，最常发生的状况是自我以拒绝的方式阻断行动，自我会想办法维持其实是幻想出来的稳定性。如你们所知，情感就是行动，如果允许情感流动，那它们就会将人格从抗拒中解放出来，实际上允许很大的稳定性存在，因为情感得以自由表达，才能以对整体系统最具建设性的方式来落实行动。
When the ego impedes such expression, then the emotions are translated into other actions, and can turn into impediments.It is only because the ego blocks freedom of the emotional expression, out of fear, that it appears to the ego that emotions are indeed fearful characteristics. Dammed up, they are indeed.一旦我阻断这样的表达，那么情感就会转化为其他行动，而且会变成阻碍。只因为自我出于恐惧而阻挡了情感的自由表达，才会觉得情感实在很可怕，情感真的是被压抑了。
It is, again, the ego's misguided attempt to stand apart to gain stability, that makes the ego react in such a manner.It fears loss of control and of discipline.But all appearances to the contrary, the emotions are natural controlling devices that in themselves aid discipline, since they allow for the spontaneous flow of energies outward.It is only when they are denied that they become explosive or dangerous to the personality. Then indeed they result in explosive barrages, ranting and shouting, organic and psychological illnesses, and of unfortunate manifestations.就是由于自我被误导，才会企图跳脱情感，寻求稳定，使得自我采取这样的回应方式。它害怕失去控制、失去纪律，但事实完全相反。情感本身的设计，就是可以自然控制，而且有助于纪律，因为它们允许能量自发性地向外流动。唯有情感受到否定时，才具有爆炸性或对人格造成危险，然后才真的会导致猛爆攻击、怒吼咆哮、身心疾病，以及各种不幸的遭遇。
I believe that I have kept you long enough for one evening, and I will here close our session.My fondest regards to you both, and until you master some of the rules for recognizing or ignoring certain portions of action, you can always stuff your ears with cotton.我想今晚已经占用了你们太多时间，在此我要结束我们的课。送上我最深情的祝福给你们俩，在你们能掌握一些规则来辨识或忽视特定的行动前，可以一直用棉花塞住耳朵。
My frisky friend Joseph, I will now, with due regret, say good evening until our next session.我活力充沛的朋友约瑟，我很遗憾现在得跟你道声晚安，下次上课见。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:55.Jane was well dissociated. She blinked, then was out of her trance.Her eyes had been open for the whole delivery, and very dark. Her rate of speaking had been rather fast.She had not been aware of traffic, or any other distractions for that matter, since the first delivery of the evening.)(10:55分结束。珍出离得很好，她眨了眨眼后就回神了。整个传述过程中双眼都一直开着，而且非常乌黑，讲话速度也都相当快。从今晚第一阶段的传述以后，她对车子吵杂声就没什么感觉，也没有因此而分心。
(Sunday night, June 6, I had a vivid dream which was clairvoyant, and came to pass the next morning while I was at work. Complete records are in my dream notebook.Before the session I made sure to hope aloud that Seth would discuss the dream, but as can be seen it was not even mentioned.This is not an unusual happening, however.I may ask definitely about the dream during a future session.)(6月6日星期日晚上，我做了一个千里眼的梦，栩栩如生，而隔天早上我在工作时就真的发生了，完整的记录就在我的梦笔记本里。上课前我信心满满，大声说赛斯会讨论这个梦，但事实摆在眼前，赛斯并没提到。不过，这也不是什么大不了的事，未来我或许可以找个机会在课堂上问个清楚。)

SESSION 161 第161节　再次谈比尔的溃疡


JUNE 9, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年6月9日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(For the record: On June 1,1965 I mailed to Dr. G. H. Instream a letter explaining something of Jane's ability and the Seth material plus a list of the inner senses, a list of the basic laws of the universe, and copies of sessions 138, 141, 142, 149, 153 and 154.The letter was sent do Colgate University, Hamilton NY.(值得一提的是：1965年6月1日那天，我寄了一封信给殷斯翠姆博士[Dr.G.H.Instream]，说明一些有关珍的能力和赛斯资料的事，还附上内在感官项目、宇宙基本原则，以及第138、141、142、149、153和154节资料的复印本。这封信由纽约哈密尔顿[Hamilton]的哥盖德大学[Colgate University]转交过去。
(On June 8, we received an answer from Dr. Instream, expressing interest, and inviting us to a symposium at State University College, Oswego, NY.Publicity material on the symposium wasn’t enclosed with the letter as stated, so on June 9 we wrote asking for this.(我们6月8日收到殷斯翠姆博士的回复，他对那些资料表示有兴趣，也邀请我们参加纽约奥斯威戈[Oswego]州立大学的一场讨论会。不过研讨会的文宣资料并没有附在那封信里，所以6月9日我们写信跟他要。
(Jane and I wondered whether Seth would mention the letter from Dr. Instream during this session, but he did not; just as he did not discuss my recent clairvoyant dream.See above, this page.As it happened Bill and Peggy Gallagher, who witnessed the first part of the 158th session, were again witnesses.(我和珍很好奇赛斯这节课会不会提到殷斯翠姆博士的回信，不过后来他并没提；就像他没提到我最近千里眼的梦一样，见前面的叙述。比尔和蓓曾来见证过第158节第一部分，今晚他们跟上次一样，再度前来见证。
(Because of the witnesses the session was held in our living room.Again traffic noise was quite audible, yet it did not bother any of us unduly as it had during the last session.Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed, in a voice a little stronger than usual, and at a fairly fast rate.Her manner was quite expressive and she used many gestures.)(由天有人见证，所以这节课就在客厅举行。车子吵杂声还是相当大，不过就如同上节课，我们大家都没受到太多干扰。珍闭着眼睛坐下来开始说话，声音比平常还有力些，速度也相当快，表情非常丰富，运用许多手势。)
I now bid you a most fond good evening.我以最诚挚的心跟你们道声晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I see that we have visitors, and I also bid them welcome.我知道今晚有访客，我也向他们表达欢迎之意。
We will not this evening give a broad outline to our friend, concerning his health. We are indeed, instead, going to progress in a very slow manner, and give him tidbits.If we outline a whole program, then he will plunge into it, and we will have him go more slowly.For the problem already has to do with the fact that he plunges into both dilemmas and solutions, with a desperation that is born from anxiety, if not pure panic.关于我们朋友的健康，今晚我不会笼统地说明，相反地，我真的要以非常慢的方式，提供一些详细资料给他。假如我们提出整个计划大纲，他就会一头栽进去，那我们又得叫他慢慢来。目前的问题在于他会出于焦虑，或是单纯的恐惧，而不顾一切栽入进退两难的困境和解决之道里。
Nor will anything be gained by a patent and speedy program that is not solidly based on understanding, both understanding of the self in particular, and what you may call the mechanics involved in the creation of the illness itself, and in an understanding of those elements which caused the personality to develop the illness.一个明确而快速的计划，如果不是建立在透彻了解的基础上，也不能让他获得任何助益。这里的透彻了解，特别是指了解自己，以及了解你们所谓疾病本身形成的机制，此外，还要了解那些导致人格生病的因素。
Nor do we want to rid him of one illness so quickly that he still feels a need for it, for in such a case he would indeed very promptly develop another.So, though he would wish that we go quickly, we shall go slowly, for the nature of his own reactions causes in some degree the necessity for the illness.我们也不想让他的病好得太快，而导致他对疾病仍有需求，在此情况下，他一定又会很快得另一种病。所以，纵使他会希望我们加快脚步，我们还是要慢慢来，因为他自己回应事件的天性，多多少少造成了他对疾病的需要。
We have in the past discussed in full the manner in which physical matter is formed. We have also discussed the ego, and our friend would do well to read the sessions dealing with the ego, and the ego’s relationship to action.For one of the basic reasons for the difficulty lies in the fact that the ego of the present personality does strongly attempt to stand apart from action. It attempts to force action, and to fight action which it does not initiate.之前我们已经充分讨论过实体物质形成的方式，还探讨了自我，如果我们的朋友去读有关自我，以及自我与行动之间关系的上课资料，身体状况也会改善。目前遭遇的困难有个基本原因，就是在场这个人格的自我确实极力想办法与行动脱钩，只要不是出于自我本身想法的行动，自我会想办法压制和打击。
Here we have a blockage.The personality, the present ego, will not acquiesce to action, will not go along with it as part of it, but attempts to force it along its own directions.This will become clearer when passages concerning action and the ego are read.这时我们就出现了阻塞现象。这个人格，在场的这个自我，并不会默认行动，不会把自己当成行动的一部分，与它好好相处，而是想办法逼行动跟随自己的方向。这部分如果阅读行动和自我的相关章节，就会比较清楚。
There is an involvement that would seem, would seem, intense. The ego appears to be extremely intense, but to a large degree this is a deception, for the intenseness is caused by the attempt of the ego not to become involved with action, unless the ego can dominate action.There is no basic trust of the inner self.The personality does not basically recognize or trust the ability of the inner self, and this results in an intense inhibited fear.会有一种看来好像是，好像是，热切投入的现象，自我显得极为热切，但这很可能是场骗局，因为这个热切是来自于自我试图让自己不要投入行动，除非自我可以主宰行动。对内我没有基本的信任。基本上，这个人格并不承认或信任内我的能力，而这也导致了挥之不去的强烈恐惧。
The ego of the personality does not trust its own inner organisms. It must attempt to stand apart from them, and keep an eye on them. The ego does not believe that they are treating it right.The ego is therefore in its present circumstances because it fears itself so solitary, since it has to a large degree cut itself off from its inner self; yet not entirely, for the intuitive still speaks.这个人格的自我并不信任自己的内在组织，自我必须设法远离它们、监视它们，不相信它们对自我的态度得当。由于自我必须将自己与内我切割开来，但这完全不可能，因为直觉仍然会说话，而且因为自我害怕自己会非常孤独，于是就处在目前的情境中。
It has not been drowned completely by any means. Attempting to cut itself off, however, from the wholeness of the whole personality, the ego must strain for its reserves of energy; for in a large measure, it refuses to accept the energy of the whole personality that is available to it.自我无论如何都不曾完全被压制过，它在设法将本身与整体人格切割开来的同时，也必须使劲保持本身的能量，因为它会强烈拒绝接受来自整体人格唾手可得的能量。
(Traffic noise had been increasing past the front of our house.Jane's voice rose to some degree of loudness for the rest of this delivery.Her eyes remained closed.)(车子噪音一直变大，就在我们房子前面。在剩余的传述时间里，珍稍微提高了嗓门，眼睛仍然闭着。)
It will be our concern here, therefore, to aid the personality to discover and use these resources.I will have more to say concerning the manner in which the organic illness has been accepted by the ego, as a part of the ego’s self-image.This acceptance does indeed take place in that area of the personal subconscious that is closely allied to the ego.因此，此时我们关注的是，要协助这个人格发现这些资源并善加利用。关于自我如何接受身体疾病，且将其视为自我意象的一部分，我还有很多话要说。这样的接受确实出现在与自我关系密切的个人潜意识范围内。
But this illness is not so accepted by the whole self, or by the deeper layers of the personality, although certain general tendencies from past lives have aided the personality to strike out physically against his own organism in such a manner.但是这个疾病并没有被全我或人格的更深层次所接受，虽然在过去几世当中，特定的一般习性，以这种方式协助人格猛烈回击自己的身体。
I will now suggest your first break, and as I have said many times, do not break up, for then I should have to pick up the pieces.我现在建议你们第一次中段休息一下，我说过很多次，不要断成碎片，不然我又得捡碎片了。
(Break at 9:18.Jane reported that she was quite a bit more dissociated than usual for a first delivery. She did not remember being bothered by traffic noise.Bill Gallagher said he agreed in general with what Jane was saying about his case, as far as he could follow the involved sentences in dictation.)(9:18分休息。珍表示她第一阶段传述的出离状况比平常要深沉得多，她不记得车子嗓音的干扰。比尔说，在这段传述里就他所能了解的相关语句来说，他大致同意珍对他状况的描述。)
(Still with her eyes closed, Jane resumed at a good rate and in a good voice at 9:25.)(9:25分珍继续口述，双眼仍是闭着，速度与音量都很不错。)
It is precisely because the inner vitality is not accepted by the ego, that when it is acknowledged by the ego it seems so explosive.The ego attempts, this ego attempts, to stand aside and to deny the inevitability of change.The ego in this case, as in many cases, attempts to maintain stability and permanence at all costs.就是因为内在活力没有被自我接受，所以一旦受到自我认可，似乎就具有相当大的爆发力。自我试图，这个自我试图，逃避与拒绝无可避免的改变。这个个案的自我，如同其他个案一样，不惜任何代价，一心想维持住稳定性与耐久性。
This ego in particular, and many egos, consider that the self is the ego alone. The ego considers that therefore it must maintain stability and permanence. It therefore attempts to become rigid, because it considers itself the main representative of the self.It attempts to deny the inner emotions because the changeability of these emotions would seem to threaten its own permanence.It does not want to change. Therefore any seemingly small incident will tend to bring forth the explosion of these emotions quite against the egos inclination, precisely because the ego denies them so vehemently.特别是这个自我，以及许多自我，都以为自己(self)就只有自我(ego)而已，因此自我认为必须保持稳定与耐久，于是设法变得僵化，因为它将自身视为自己的主要代表。自我会想尽办法拒绝内在情感，因为这些情感的可变性似乎会威胁到自我的耐久性。自我不想改变，结果任何看似微不足道的小事，都很容易引爆这些严重违背自我意向的情感，这正是由于自我强烈否认它们所造成的。
The harder the ego attempts to hold down the emotions, the more explosively will they show themselves upon the least provocation, and the more the ego will attempt to hold them down, and the worse the ulcer becomes.This need not be.自我越想严厉压制情感，这些情感就会在最微小的挑衅上，以越爆发性的方式展现自己，而自我又越想要再把它们压制下去，结果溃疡就恶化了。这没有必要。
This is why there appears to be two such diverse tendencies that show themselves.The personality is indeed divided. The ego fights the inner self, which means of course that the self fights against itself.这就是为什么会出现两股如此不同的势力，而且各自力图表现。这时人格真的分裂了，自我攻击内我，意思当然是指自己在攻击自己。
Reactions will therefore appear to be intensified. Nevertheless this intensification is a pretense that one part of the self plays upon the other part, for the very intensity of the emotional reaction on the part of the ego to even small stimuli, allows the ego to say to itself “I feel deeply, therefore I know the depths of myself.”And this sham allows the ego to continue denying those inner emotions in an effort to maintain its permanence.反应因此变得更激烈，然而这种激烈是假象，自己的某部分玩弄另一部分，因为自我甚至对微小的刺激，都有激烈的情绪反应，于是自我得以对自己说：“我深有感觉，所以我了解我自己的内心深处。”这样的骗局就使自我可以继续拒绝那些内在情感，努力维持它的耐久性。
What the personality must be led to see is that any real permanence would indeed be the death of the ego and the personality.For as we know, the ego is not the same today, in your terms, as it was yesterday, nor yet as it will be tomorrow. That “I” continually changes.必须引导人格了解的是，任何真正的耐久性实际上就是自我的死亡和人格的死亡。因为如我们所知，就你们来说，今天的自我跟昨天不一样，也跟明天不同，那个“我”一直在改变。
(Janes manner had been active even with her eyes closed, and her voice strong. It now became somewhat stronger.She gestured often toward Bill.)(珍虽然一直闭着眼睛，但活力充沛，声音也很宏亮，现在又更宏亮些。她经常对着比尔做手势。)
The ego is indeed but one part of the self that speaks for the other portions of the self, but when it tries to speak for itself only, then indeed its words become meaningless, and the words become threats to the rest of the self.The discipline required in following our program as it develops, that discipline will itself represent the first steps to recovery.自我实际上只不过是自己的一部分，本应替自己的其他部分说话，但如果它只想替自身说话，那说出来的话真的就变得无意义，而且这些话会威胁到自己的其他部分。我们接下来的计划当中，会要求在这方面有所节制，这种节制本身就代表疗愈的第一步。
In other words the apparent intensity of the egotistical reactions is a sham on the part of the ego, to hide the fact that it refuses to become involved with action as a whole, because it fears for its permanence.When the ego understands, and it will, that it is a portion of the whole self, and itself a part of action, then indeed it will not fear for its own permanence, for it will realize that being a part of action, its very nature is dependent upon change, and vitality, and value fulfillment.换句话说，自我表面上的激烈反应只是一个骗术而已，为的是要掩盖它拒绝涉入整体行动的事实，因为担心耐久性不保。一旦自我了解，而它也会了解，它是全我的一部分，也是行动的一部分，此时真的就不会担心自身的耐久性，因为它会了悟到，身为行动的一部分时，它的本性就建立在改变、活力与价值完成上面。
The passages will become clear as the personality becomes better acquainted with other portions of our sessions.There are here indeed other psychological and surface reasons for the illness, and also deeper reasons for the tendency toward this particular type of illness.如果这个人格对我们课的其他部分较熟悉，就会更明白这几段话的涵义。这个疾病确实有其他心理及表面上的原因，但也有更深层的原因，导致他容易罹患这类疾病。
I now suggest your break, and I do myself indeed enjoy your pleasant summer evening.I would like to make it plain here, however, that on a surface psychological level, the personality plunges into activity, and it is for the present this portion of the personality with whom we must deal.Nevertheless, beneath there is a denial of involvement, and a strong desire for permanency, both of which are repressed, and the stronger the efforts put forth by the ego to repress these tendencies, then these tendencies will explode with inadequate stimuli.There will be an over action on the part of the ego to compensate for the refusal to accept involvement on deeper levels.我建议你们休息一下，事实上我自己还真的蛮喜欢你们夏日舒适的夜晚。不过在这里我有一点要解释清楚，就表象的心理层面来说，这个人格一头栽进行动里，目前我们必须处理的就是这部分的人格。然而在这之下，还有拒绝涉入，以及强烈渴望耐久性，这两者都受到压抑，自我越尽力压抑这些意向，这些意向就越会爆发出不适当的刺激。于是自我会过度反应，以做为拒绝涉入更深层次的补偿。
Now indeed take your breaks.现在，的确要休息一下了。
One more point. The ulcer for example has reality upon many levels, and must be dealt with in a like manner, for it is not enough to handle it even from the viewpoint of the present ego; for indeed causes are involved of which the present ego must necessarily be mainly ignorant.The inner self however has at its command all these reasoning’s, and all these causes.还有一点，以溃疡为例，这个病有许多层面的实相，都必须以类似的方式处理，即使从目前这个自我的观点来看，尚不足以处理；因为这实际上牵涉到一些原因，而目前的自我必定大都不太清楚。不过在内我的指挥下，有其全部的论据和全部的原因。
(Break at 9:51.Jane was very well dissociated, she said. Her eyes had remained closed.Toward the end of this delivery her voice had increased in volume, and at times almost boomed out.(9:51分休息。珍说她出离得很好，双眼维持闭着。传述快结束时，她的音量变大，有几次几乎是轰隆而出。
(She resumed in the same active manner, still with her eyes closed, and in a somewhat quieter voice, at 10:05.)(她的精神仍然充沛，双眼依旧闭着，声音稍微温和些，10:05分继续口述。)
If the illness did not exist on so many layers, then indeed it would not be so tenacious.如果这个病不存在于这么多层面上，真的就不会如此顽强。
The very journey involved in self-discovery, the very self-questioning involved, is indeed part of the process of recovery.The energy being used in the maintenance of the ulcer will already begin to take new channels.The thoughts and anticipations of the personality have already begun to stray from the all important ulcer to the causes behind it, for in this case, as in many others, we find a strange phenomenon.自我探索与自我分析的这个历程，实际上是康复过程的一部分。用来维持溃疡的能量，会开始走新的管道。这个人格的思想和期望，也开始从原本的以溃疡为重，转移至其生成的背后原因，因为我们在这个案例中，就如其他案例一样，发现一个奇怪的现象。
(Jane now pointed at Bill, her eyes still closed, then made a passing reference to a discussion we had had at break.She smiled and spoke quietly.)(珍这时指着比尔，她仍闭着眼睛，然后顺便提到我们休息时的一段讨论内容。她面带微笑，温和地说话。)
It is you, not I, who have been speaking of secondary personalities, and I will not here waste your time and mine in a discussion of why I am not one.一直在谈次人格(secondary personalities)的是你，不是我，我不会花费你我的时间，来讨论为什么我不是次人格。
(Now abruptly her voice became strong and loud.)(这时她的声音突然变得强而有力。)
However, we have among us this evening indeed a secondary personality, a strong and savage one.We have here this evening a secondary personality that attempts to rule the complete life of the personality of whom we have been speaking, and its name is ulcer.For where lies the difference?The personality literally lives its life about the existence of the ulcer. It is hardly worth it, for the personality must be led to see that it itself has created the ulcer, both psychologically and physically, in most actual terms, and that it itself can indeed cast it out.不过，今晚我们这些人当中，确实有一个次人格，一个强壮野蛮的人格。我们今晚这里的次人格，设法要掌管我们一直在讨论的这个人格的全部生活，它的名字叫做溃疡。不同之处在哪里呢？这个人格一丝不苟地过着有溃疡在身的生活，完全不值得，必须引导这个人格明白，不论就心理或身体而言，是自己创造了这个溃疡，以最实际的观点来看，自己的确也可以摆脱这个疾病。
The personality can survive well without the ulcer.If this sounds like a foolish statement it is not, for in many such cases the ulcer is so concentrated upon, and so much energy is used in its maintenance, and it is used as such a scapegoat, that the personality is loath to be rid of it.没有了溃疡，这个人格一样可以活得很好。这话听来好像很可笑，但其实不会，因为在许多这类的情况下，溃疡受到太多关注，耗费太多能量支撑它，已经用来当成代罪糕羊，致使这个人格不想甩掉它。
(Jane's eyes opened, and she looked directly at Bill. Her voice had been loud and emphatic, and it continued so until break.)(珍张开眼睛直视比尔，她的声音变得响亮，加重语气，一直到休息时都维持如此。)
It is however excess baggage, and can be cast aside, and will be.It is not a part of you like your arm. It is not a part of you like your legs. You can navigate without it, and indeed you shall.It is not (Jane's voice became even louder) part of the image that the inner self gave you. It did not come to you in your chromosomes for duplication.无论如何那都是不必要的包袱，可以丢开，也终将会丢开。溃疡不像你的手臂一样，是你的一部分，也不像你的脚一样，是你的一部分，没有它，你一样可以趴趴走，你真的可以。它也不是(珍变得更大声)内我给你的意象其中的一部分，不会跑到你的染色体里去复制。
It has been added for the purposes of the ego, and it can be discarded.It did not come to you as an organ like your heart, and your existence is not dependent upon it.The purpose that it served it no longer serves, and it must now be discarded.它是为了自我的目的才附加上去，可以丢弃了。它不像心脏一样，是你身上的器官，你的存在并不依靠它。原本过去借着它达成的目的，已经荡然无存，现在应该丢弃。
I will here suggest a short break. We will then continue the session at your convenience, or if you prefer we will close it.我建议这里休息一下，待会儿我们再继续上课，就看你们方便，如果你们愿意的话，也可以就此结束。
(“We can continue.”(“我们可以继续。”
(Break at 10:15.Jane was again “way out, "as she puts it.Her eyes closed, she blinked several times, then came out of her trance.She said her eyes felt heavy when break came.Her delivery had been fast toward the end.)(10:15分休息。套句珍的话，她再度“彻底出去”。她闭上眼睛，眨了几下就回神了，她说休息前眼皮沉重。接近结束时，传述速度加快。)
(She resumed in a quieter voice, with her eyes closed, at 10:27.)(10:27分，珍闭着双眼，以较轻柔的声音继续。)
When the ego becomes so rigid, it immediately begins an insidious attempt to block off stimuli, to limit the reaches of perception, to enclose itself in what it considers a safe world.如果自我变得非常僵化，它立刻开始暗中设法阻绝刺激，以限制感知的触角，将自己封闭在自认为安全的世界里。
It begins to reject stimuli, because stimuli must be reacted to, and it rejects action because action must be reacted to.Therefore it chooses areas of rejection. The areas it chooses to reject are determined by characteristics that are unique to the particular ego.它开始拒绝刺激，因为刺激一定会引起回应，它也拒绝行动，因为行动一定会引起回应。所以它选定拒绝的范围，至于所选定的拒绝范围为何，则视每个自我独特的个性而定。
It begins to travel down safe paths, and out of fear it continually enlarges the scope of limitations.In the particular personality’s case, perception becomes also limited, and rejections occur.In this as in many such cases foods are rejected.In many such cases the ego itself chooses to perceive only within those areas where it feels safe, and it rejects more and more any involvement that it can avoid.And now the ego has the self-created ulcer to blame, and it rejects many foods, for foods are symbolistic of involvement.它开始顺着安全路径前进，而且出于恐惧，会继续扩大限制范围。就这个特定人格来说，感知也变得受限，于是出现拒绝的现象。在此情况下，这个人格跟许多这类的安全一样，拒绝了食物。许多这类个案的自我，只选择在本身觉得安全的范围内去感知，而且对于能躲得掉的任何牵扯，就尽量躲掉。现在这个自我可以责怪自己创造出来的溃疡，于是拒绝了许多食物，因为食物象征着牵扯。
(Jane's eyes again opened briefly and she looked at Bill. Her eyes were large and very dark. As she spoke now they began to open and close periodically.Her delivery was faster, and her voice was becoming more emphatic, and louder at times.)(珍再度短暂张开眼睛盯着比尔看，她的眼睛又大又黑，现在讲话时，眼睛开始时而张开时而闭着。她传述的速度变得比较快，也加强了语气，有时候还会拉长大嗓门。)
When I said earlier that the ulcer was not a part of you, like a leg or an arm, I meant this literally.Because you believe this literally, literally you have allowed the ulcer to become a part of your self-image, in the same manner that an arm or a leg is a part of a self-image.And it is this connection that we must, and we will, cut.前面我说过，溃疡不像手脚一样是你的一部分，我是当真的。由于你真的如此相信，才会真的允许溃疡成为你自我意象的一部分，就像你将手脚当成自我意象的一部分一样。而这个连结就是我们必须切断，也将要切断的。
When you see that the ulcer does not belong to you in these terms, then indeed you will have no purpose in using your energies to maintain it.It is not part of your heritage.It is not part of the whole self; and now, we will see the purpose of the ego in all this is to protect what it considers the self, for the ego considers itself as the only self.从这些用语中，只要你了解溃疡不属于你，那么你确实就没有必要使用能量来支持它。它不是你天生资产的一部分，也不是全我的一部分；而现在，我们就会了解自我一切的目的，就是为了要保护它认定是自己的那个部分，因为自我把它本身当成唯一的自己。
But in its overzealous behavior we find that it is instead threatening the self.Secondary personalities are caused by repressed emotions on a psychological basis that attempts to maintain an ascendancy.Your ulcer is indeed the same sort of growth, but on a physical and not on a psychological level.但是从自我过度热衷的行为当中，我们发现它反而威胁到自己。心理上试图要维持优势的那些情感，受到压抑，而引发了次人格。你的溃疡实际上是以同样的方式生长，只不过是在身体层面，而非心理层面。
I am going to suggest, first of all, that the material which we have mentioned be read, and then for a beginning that psychological time experiments be taken.Joseph and Ruburt, I know, will be glad to take the few moments necessary to explain them.我首先要建议的是，阅读我们提过的那些资料，要开始做心理时间练习。我知道约瑟和鲁柏也乐意花些必要的时间来稍加解释。
The very involvement of the ego with the inner self will be of great benefit.Nothing would be gained if I told you now that the ego would allow the ulcer to vanish, for there would still be a definite need on your part to understand. And it is indeed the understanding itself which will allow you to let it vanish.让自我确实与内我打交道，会带来很大的好处。如果我现在只告诉你，自我会让溃疡消失，对你也毫无益处，因为你确实还需要了解，真的也唯有透过了解才会让你摆脱溃疡。
(Jane was speaking most emphatically and quite rapidly.Her eyes were open.She stared directly at Bill.)(珍话话的强调语气极重，速度也非常快。她张着双眼，真盯着比尔看。)
I am an educator, and I have been one in various respects for perhaps more centuries than I am willing to admit, and I do not believe in giving easy solutions, for they are worthless.The direct experience in this procedure will indeed be your own, and because it is your own it will bear fruit.我现在是教育家，我一直以来在许多方面都是教育家，追溯起来年代久远，应该超过好几世纪。我不认同只提供简单的解答，因为那没有价值。过程中直接的体验才真正是属于你自己的，由于是你自己的，才会开花结果。
There is more that I will say along these lines, as you wish.You may again at your convenience end the session, or take a break.I am indeed fond of you both, and if I behave in my own fashion it is because my experience directs me, that solutions must come from within, for problems come from within.Very easily, through suggestion, I could cure, so it would seem, your ulcer.如你们希望的，这方面我还有很多要讲。你们可以结束这节课或是休息一下，就看你们方便。我真的很喜欢你们两人，假如我的表现带有我自己的风格，那是因为我的经验告诉我，解决之道必须来自里面，因为问题正是来自里面。我可以透过暗示，轻而易举地治好你的溃疡。
You still would have done the curing. But while the need is there something else would develop, and so we will show you the way out of the need.For the need is a sham.你本来就可以治愈溃疡，不过如果生病的需要还在，那么依旧会长出别的东西，所以我们要让你知道如何摆脱那个需要。因为那个需要就是一种幌子。
(Break at 10:45.Jane was well dissociated. She ended the delivery by staring at Bill again, and speaking in a loud and positive voice.(10:45分休息。珍出离得很好，结束时双眼又盯着比尔看，讲话时声音宏亮，语气肯定。
(Her delivery had been fast, and it remained so when she resumed, in a quieter voice and with her eyes closed, at 10:55.)(她传述速度一直都很快，10:55分继续，双眼闭着，速度依然那么快，声音稍微温和些。)
We will then bring our session to a close.我们即将结束这节课。
I will say definitely that if my suggestions are followed faithfully and systematically, both the suggestions which I have given, and those which I will give, then indeed we will find that the problem is no longer a problem.我敢肯定说，如果能确实有系统地遵照我的建议，包括我之前给过，以及之后将会给的那些建议，那我们就真的会发现，问题不再是问题。
For in the very quiet and discipline required to follow the problem, those reactions on the part of the personality will set up actions which will of themselves solve the problem; and we will find that also there will be suggestions given, and very important suggestions, whereby a systematic effort will be made on the part of the personality to enlarge the scope of his action, in spite of the ego's anxiety to limit them, and this itself will seem to work a miracle.由于觉察问题需要高度宁静和节制，人格的那些反应就会采取行动，由这些行动自行解决问题；我们也将发现人格会得到一些暗示，非常重要的暗示，尽管自我会出于担心而想限制暗示，但人格还是会透过暗示，有系统地努力扩大行动范围，而这种做法似乎会创造出奇迹。
(Jane's voice was now louder and softer alternately.)(珍这时的声音时而宏亮时而低沉。)
I will here close what can be an extremely productive session. Whether or not it is an extremely productive session will be determined by the personality involved.我这里就要结束可说是最有收获的一节课，但这节课是不是最有收获，要视涉及到的那个人格而定。
I would suggest for the psychological time experiments, fifteen minutes to begin with, along the lines of the directions which Joseph has given.You will find here an intimacy with portions of yourself which you would tend to ignore, which the ego would tend to ignore.You will find indeed refreshment and release.I would suggest that the directions, Joseph, be more specific. You can do better than you have done.我建议做心理时间练习，从15分钟开始，并按照约瑟所提示的说明进行。你们这时会发现与你们自己的某些部分非常亲密，而那些部分是你们容易忽略的，也是自我容易忽略的。你们确实会觉得更清晰、更放松。约瑟，我建议你这些说明更明确些，你可以做得比先前更好。
(Jane looked directly at me.She smiled.)(珍面带微笑，直视着我。)
I find myself once more literally blackmailed by your human limitations, since I could indeed go on much longer.But I am indeed in sympathy with your precious fingers, and the fatigue of the present group.With Ruburt presently, only presently, I have no worries.我发现自己真的又被你们人性的限制给勒住了，因为我实际上还可以讲很久。不过我的确很同情你的宝贝手指，以及在座各位的辛劳。目前只要有鲁柏在，我就不担心。
I will however, since I presume it is your wish, end the session, though regretfully.My fondest wishes to you all, but you are all indeed like nervous birds perched on a peaked roof, in the midst of a high wind; at least this evening, and if I treat you with less politeness, it is only because I speak with the license of an old and trusted friend.虽然会感觉不舍，但无论如何我就要结束这节课了，因为我猜测这应该也是你们所愿。送上我最深情的祝福给各位，你们大家真的都很像栖息在尖耸屋顶上的小鸟，饱受疾风吹袭，紧张兮兮；起码今天晚上，如果我对你们比较不礼貌，纯粹是因为我以值得依赖的老朋友这种身份在讲话。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:03.Jane was well dissociated again. Her eyes had been closed except for the one instance noted.Bill Gallagher said he thought he had noticed a change in Jane's features, at least in terms of expression, during this last delivery.It was hard for him to describe, he said.(11:03分结束。珍一样出离非常好，除了那个我特别注记的场合外，她的眼睛一直都闭着。比尔说他发现珍在最后阶段的传述时，容貌产生变化，至少在表情上是如此。他说他很难描述这个变化。
(For her part, Jane said she had been quite aware of Seth's emotions, as her very active, smiling, and at times quite loud delivery had indicated.(就珍来讲，她说她对赛斯的情绪早就了然于心，从她传述时充满活力、面露微笑、时而宏亮的声音，就可见一斑。
(The four of us were discussing the loud voice effects when Seth came through again.The conversation had turned to holding a session at the Gallagher 's home in the country, where we would not be concerned with bothering neighbors, as I had been so acutely concerned during the 158th session.Jane resumed at 11:10.)(赛斯再度透过来时，我们4个人正在讨论珍表现出来的宏亮声音。接着就讨论到是否要去比尔乡下的家上课，在那里我们不用担心吵到邻居，像我们上第158节课时，我就非常担心。珍11:10分继续。)
Joseph. I will not continue this session, as I understand your reasons for ending it.As I believe I suggested over a year ago, the present witnesses are most beneficial, and I would suggest on some evening when the time is available, that we take advantage of their help, and hold a session under circumstances that allow us both larger scope in terms of quality and in terms of time.约瑟，我不会继续上这节课，因为我了解你们想结束的理由。我相信我一年多前提过，眼前这些见证人极有帮助，所以我会建议，时间许可的话，找个晚上我们借由他们的协助来上节课，让我们在品质和时间方面都更有弹性。
(As far back as the 63rd session, Seth had remarked upon the fact that Peg Gallagher would make an excellent witness, since she had well-developed subconscious abilities.See Volume 2.(回到第63节课，赛斯曾提到，蓓•加拉格会是极佳的见证人，因为她的潜意识能力发展得非常好。见第二册。
(Jane's voice had again begun to turn loud, and I wondered whether we would have more voice effects like those of the 158th session.She began to speak more rapidly, and upon occasion let her voice boom out. But these periods were brief, and were quite a bit short of the almost deafening volume she obtained in the 158th session.Strangely enough, her eyes remained closed for most of this closing delivery, opening but once or twice.)(珍的声音又开始变大了，我怀疑会不会再出现第158节那样的声音表现。她讲话开始变快，有时还会轰降而出，不过都很短暂，也几乎没有出现第158节那种令人震耳欲聋的声音。结尾的这段传述中，她的双眼大多闭着，只张开一、两次，真是奇怪。)
For with such witnesses we can indeed do very well.I remember most regretfully your worries the other evening, and I will therefore endeavor (louder) not to give any demonstrations that may be embarrassing to you personally, or indeed that will cause you any uneasiness.有了这样的见证人，我们真的可以做得非常好。我记得你那晚很担心，实在是很抱歉，所以我会努力(更大声)克制，不再出现任何可能会让你难堪或确实会让你不安的举动。
