The personality has a logic of its own.We will be involved for many sessions to come with these problems, for they are of basic value, and practical value.We will, then, later discuss the manner in which the difference can be seen between a beneficial illness, and a severely detrimental one.We will see how a temporarily necessary illness can be greatly lessened, and the symptoms minimized, while the illness is still retained as a temporary emergency measure, and then gradually allowed to disappear when its presence becomes unnecessary.只要原始行动的路线打开，管道也开放，疾病就会消失。不过，你瞧，在某些情况下，受阻的行动可能会带来重大灾难，而疾病或许可以预防这个灾难的发生，人格有自己的逻辑。我们会花许多节课来探讨这些问题，因为这些问题有基本的价值与实际的价值。至于疾病带来益处还是危害严重，我们后面会讨论如何区分两者的方式。我们将会了解，为了让疾病充当临时紧急手段，仍然得留住，此时如何大幅舒缓这个临时需要的疾病，并减轻症状，等到不需要疾病的存在了，如何让它逐渐消失。
We will also see how an unnecessary and detrimental illness, that does not serve such a purpose, can be dismissed.至于那种没必要、有害、并非为了临时需要的疾病，我们也会知道该如何去除。
I will now end the session, but it will indeed serve as a basis for many discussions, concerning the relationship between action, suggestion, personality, illness and health.我现在就要结束这节课，但这节课的内容，的确在行动、暗示、人格、疾病和健康之间的关系方面，提供我们许多讨论的基础。
My fondest regards to you both.送上我最深情的祝福给你们俩。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:00.Jane was again well dissociated.Her delivery had been fast, her eyes closed all the time, her voice good.)(11:00结束。珍的出离状况还是很好，传述的速度一直都很快，双眼从头到尾都闭着。)

SESSION 165 第165节　人类人格的本质及其与行动、疾病、健康的关系


JUNE 28, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年6月28日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(It was a very hot and humid night, but in order to avoid interruptions we held the session in our small back room.I was affected by the heat much more than Jane was; as usual, she seemed almost impervious to such distractions while she was in trance.(今晚天气很热，也很潮湿，但为了避免受到干扰，我们到后面的小房间上课。闷热的天气对我的影响比对珍的大得多；跟往常一样，珍在出神状态下，这些易使人分心的事几乎都不会对她造成影响。
(Jane's eyes remained closed for the whole session. Her voice was quiet, her delivery rather fast.She used a few pauses, none of them very long.)(珍整节课都闭着眼睛，声音温和，传述速度相当快，停顿几次，但都不久。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I would like to continue with our discussion concerning the nature of the human personality in its relationship to action, and in connection with the matter of illness and health in general.我想继续讨论人类人格的本质，及其与行动、疾病和整体健康的关系。
This will be, I trust, a quiet and peaceful session.我相信这将是一堂安静祥和的课。
It must be thoroughly understood that under no circumstances is the personality a static or motionless construction.It is, instead, a collection of spontaneous actions.Only when it is viewed in this perspective can you begin to understand how it forms its own health.All basic adjustments to the personality, in a basic manner, must come from within, through regroupings of characteristic actions about unifying principles.人格不管在什么状况下，都不是一种固定或静止不动的结构，这一点必须彻底了解。相反地，它是各种自发行动的集合。唯有在这种观点下，你们才能开始明白人格如何形成它自己的健康。所有对人格根本性的调整，基本上都必须从内在做起，透过重新组合与统合法则相关的特别行动。
The personality itself exists in many dimensions, as you know, and it has its reality within many other fields than the physical field, and is indeed basically not nearly as allied with the physical field as you may imagine.These unifying principles of which I spoke are themselves main, dominating groups of actions, about which the main energies of the personality group themselves.如你们所知，人格本身存在于许多维度，不只在物质领域，也在许多其他领域之内有它自己的实相。而且基本上来说，人格跟物质领域的连结，其实不如你们想像得那么密切。我讲过的这些统合法则，本身就是好几组有主导力的主要行动，而人格的主要能量就聚集在这些行动周围。
These unifying principles themselves, however, constantly and imperceptibly change. Upon another occasion we will consider the ways in which these unifying principles may shift.In many cases it may appear as if exterior circumstances formed such inner shifts, changing the whole unifying structure of the personality, and shifting the personality into what would appear to be entirely uncharacteristic activities.然而，这些统合法则本身在不知不觉中持续改变，我们会找个时间，仔细思考这些统合法则可能的变化方法。在许多状况下，似乎是外界环境形成了这样的内在转变，改变了人格整个的统合结构，才让人格看起来好像出现完全异常的行为举止。
In such a case, however, the shifting still come from within.The active gestalt of the personality is indeed so complex, the actions that compose it are so intertwined, that only the deep, interior intuitions of the personality involved will ever come close to a complete understanding of the workings of the particular personality system.不过，在这种状况下，转变还是来自内在。由于活跃的人格完形真的非常复杂，组成它的行动相互交织在一起，因此只有该人格内心深处的直觉，才能比较完整了解这个人格系统的运作状况。
Such understanding simply cannot follow logical lines.The intellect may indeed grasp some of this understanding from the intuitions, but the intellect itself is aware of only minute portions of the whole personality.Again, this is not meant to minimize the value of the intellect. The fact remains that answers sought by a personality can only be found through a traveling within the actions that compose the self.Within our last session, I explained some of the basic psychological heritage that resides within the action makeup of the personality. There is no escaping this heritage, and it is so important that without it the personality system could not be built up.这样的了解完全不能遵循合逻辑的路线。理性或许真的可以从直觉中掌握到一些讯息，但理性本身只能觉察整个人格的一些细微部分。这么说并不是要贬低理性的价值，事实依然是，人格所追寻的答案，只能在组成自己的那些行动之内全面搜寻，才能找得到。我在上一节课曾解释过，有一些基本的心理资产就存在于人格的行动结构当中，这个资产不会流失，而且极其重要，要是没有它，就无法建立起人格系统。
I spoke, for example, of the acquiescence of action at certain levels to any kind of stimuli, indiscriminately, whether painful or pleasurable.Without this basic acquiescence, actions would not have been given the freedom to break patterns down and evolve new ones of them.This is not necessarily a more primitive aspect. It is simply a basic characteristic of action at certain levels, and the human personality, with its complicated ego structure, is nevertheless composed of many actions that operate at this level.举例来说，我曾提过，行动在某些层级上，对于任何种类的刺激，不管是痛苦或愉悦的，都会不加分辨地予以默许。如果没有这种基本的默许，那么这些行动就没有自由去打破各种模式，并发展出新模式。这不见得是比较原始的面向，只是行动在某些层级上的一个基本特性，而具有复杂自我结构的人类人格，则是由许多在这个层级上运作的行动所组成。
In a most basic manner, a denial of stimuli is a negative action, if any action could be called negative.I do not, of course, speak in human terms, where every stimuli for example should then be followed or sought out indiscriminately.This is not my meaning. I am talking of deeper biological levels, and indeed of levels that are buried within tissue itself.以一种最基本的方式来讲，如果真要把任何行动称为负面的话，那么拒绝刺激就是一种负面行动。当然，我并不是说就人类的观点来说，在人类来说，举例而言，每个刺激应该要不分青红皂白接受或找出来。这并不是我的意思，我现在说的是更深的生物层级，实际上是埋在组织本身之内的层级。
The very nature of the ego and of the personality is formed by the ability to choose between actions or stimuli; but life as it is not connected to a highly differentiated ego, rejoices in all stimuli, as sensation, whether it is pleasurable or painful, for these distinctions do not exist in your terms.In the beginning of our sessions I spoke in a general manner, for example, saying that trees and plant life had a consciousness, but not a developed ego system.The tree, therefore, is conscious of the pain connected with, say, the severing of a limb.自我和人格的本质，由是否可以选择行动或刺激的能力所形成；但是因为生命跟高度分化的自我并没有连结，所以对所有的刺激都感到欣喜，就像你们而言，愉快或痛苦的感觉都没有差别，因为这些区别并不存在。例如在我们刚开始的课程里，我曾以概要的方式说，树木和植物的生命都有意识，但并不是已发展成的自我系统。因此，树木可以意识到树枝被砍断的痛苦。
(See the 18th session, in Volume 1.)(见第1册第18节。)
It does not fear destruction however, as the ego does.It still fights for survival, of course; but the consciousness of plant life involves a consciousness of self as it operates within action. It sees or feels itself as a part of continuing action, and because of this inner atomic knowledge it does not fear destruction, basically, knowing that it will be changed into other kinds of action.然而，它不会像自我一样害怕毁灭，它当然还是会为生存奋斗；植物生命的意识包含了它在行动里运作时的自我意识，它了解或觉得本身就是持续行动的一部分，而且因着这种对内在原子的认识，基本上它不害怕毁灭，它知道它会变成其他种类的行动。
Its identity is within action. To say that its identity and its continuity or sense of continuity is within action, is not too far off, although the word continuity in this instance would be misleading.它的本体就在行动之内，它的本体和它的延续性或延续性的感觉，就在行动之内，这么说并不会太过分，虽然这里用延续性这个字眼可能会误导。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:26.Jane was dissociated more than usual for a first delivery. She had been quite comfortable on this hot and humid evening.She resumed in the same quiet and fast manner, with her eyes closed, at 9:36.)(9:26分休息。珍第一阶段传述的出离状况比平时还要深，她一直觉得这种闷热潮湿的夜晚很舒服。她闭着眼睛，以同样柔和与快速的方式，9:36分继续口述。)
It is only lately that your psychologists have even begun to understand the connection between biology and personality, and they understand it in only the most simple of terms.直到最近，你们的心理学家才开始了解生物学与人格间的关系，不过他们只以最简单的角度来了解。
To begin with, not enough is understood about the biological structure, for the nature of the atoms and molecules that form the biological structure is still largely misunderstood, and very little has been done in this field.首先，他们对生物结构方面的了解并不够多，因为形成生物结构的原子与分子，其本质仍然遭到严重误解，他们在这方面的努力还是非常少。
(“Not too fast.”)(“不要讲太快。”)
The personality exists in a diffused fashion within the physical system, and it therefore is most basically composed of those biological heritages, and those heritages that are a property of cellular structure, long preceding multicellular existence.人格的存在遍及物质之内，因此，究竟来讲，它是由那些生物上的遗产所组成，而那些遗产是细胞结构的特性，比多细胞的存在还早很多。
We have to some extent explained the reality of the personality within the electrical system. We have to some extent explained its basic origin within inner reality.We have explained the fact that the potentialities of the personality and of the self are basically unlimited.But during its alliance within the physical system, it is diffused within the cellular structure, and interrelating actions between the biological system, the electrical system, and the personality structure actually form the reality of the human individual.我们或多或少解释过人格在电子系统内的实相，我们也或多或少说明了人格在内在实相里的基本起源。我们还阐述过一个事实，就是人格的潜力和自己的潜力基本上都无穷无尽。但人格在与物质系统结盟的期间，会遍布于细胞结构之内，也会遍布于与生物系统和电子系统相关的行动之内，人格结构实际上就形成了人类个体的实相。
(See the following sessions in Volume 3 for material on the electrical system: 122 to 128, 131, 135, among others, and 162, 164 in Volume 4.)(有关电子系统的资料，见第三册122至128、131、135以及本册第162、164等相关章节。)
You cannot probe into the one system without affecting the others.It is basically meaningless to consider the personality as separate from the simultaneous actions of which it is composed. The personality, as you know, has also a reality within the dream universe.It should be obvious that in a most basic and practical manner the personality however is not involved with physical time to any degree.Only a part of the personality, the ego, is so involved.It is obvious of course that the personality system will react to stimuli that seem, to the ego, to be far divorced in time.That is, the personality may react to a stimuli in the present that occurred originally twenty years ago, to the ego's understanding of time.你们探索某个系统时，必定会影响到其他系统。将人格视为与组成它的那些同时存在的行动分开，基本上没什么意义，如你们所知，人格在梦宇宙之内也有一个实相。然而，以最基本也最实际的方式，人格显然与物理时间毫无牵连。只有一部分的人格，也就是自我，跟物理时间深深牵连。显而易见的是，那些对自我来说，在时间上似乎已摇不可及的刺激，人格系统却会对它们起反应。换言之，就自我的时间概念而言，一个发生在20年前的刺激，人格可以在当下对它起反应。
But past, present and future as such simply do not have meaning to the other aspects of the personality. The idea and reality of physical time parallels the development of the ego.Consciousness of self, alone, is unaware of your physical time.The physical time idea is a product of the ego’s tendency to make finer distinctions in order that it can classify and categorize, and therefore identify and give permanence to its own sensations.但是，对人格的其他面向而言，过去、现在与未来都毫无意义，物理时间的概念和实相，与自我的发展相互平行。单单只有自己的意识，并不会知觉到你们的物理时间。自我倾向于精细的区分，于是造就出物理时间这个产物，如此一来，自我才能归类或分组，进而辨识自己的感觉，并赋予感觉耐久性。
In most circumstances the arrangement is an excellent working operation.However, when the ego carries its categorizing tendency too far, it may reject whole areas of significant action which has been experienced by the whole personality.It may choose to reject whole areas for various reasons, usually out of a mistaken fear that the actions involved threaten the permanence of itself.大部分的情况下，这种安排是相当棒的运作方式。不过，如果自我过度分类，可能会拒绝整个有意义的行动之区域，而这个有意义的行动是整个人格曾经体验过的。它也可能会选择拒绝所有的区域，其原因五花八门都有，但经常是出于对错误的恐惧，因为它害怕这些涉入的行动，会威胁到本身的耐久性。
Such a rejection is definitely an impeding action. It is this rejection on the ego's part that is the basis for so-called neurosis in many cases. The fault is not that a particular action has been buried by the subconscious.The fault is that the ego has refused to accept the action from the subconscious, therefore impeding the natural flow of energy.Naturally, all actions are not recognized by the ego, nor is it necessary in any case.It is when significant actions, important to the whole personality, are so rejected that the difficulties arise.It is also true however that these refusals to assimilate action on the egos part are also an integral part of the characteristics of the personality as a whole action.In each individual, certain categories of action may be habitually denied. As the characteristics of a personality may be somewhat deduced from those actions which the ego accepts, so also much may be learned about any given personality by a study of those actions which the ego habitually denies.这样的拒绝就肯定是一种阻碍性行动，在许多情况下，自我的这个拒绝就是所谓精神官能症形成的基础。这样的错误不在于某个行动被潜意识埋藏住，而在于自我拒绝接受来自潜意识的行动，因而阻碍了能量的自然流动。所有的行动自然而然就不会被自我所承认，不管什么情况下这都是不必要的。如果那些有意义的、对整个人格很重要的行动，也被如此拒绝，那么问题就来了。然而，自我拒绝去同化行动，这些拒绝本身就是整体行动，也是人格特质中不可或缺的一部分，这一点也千真万确。每个个体或许都会习惯性拒绝某类的行动，从那些被自我所接受的行动，多少也可以推断出人格特质，同样地，对任何一个人格而言，借由探讨自我会习惯性否定哪些行动，也可以得知这个人格的很多东西。
As a rule, secondary personalities are given their energy as a direct result, so to speak, of a too-rigorous and rejecting ego.In many, though not all instances, such a secondary personality may represent simply the whole personality’s quite healthy attempts at expression that have been too long denied.You get a regrouping of unifying principle actions, and a division of energies about two different ego systems.一般而言，次人格之所以可以获得能量，通常是一个太过严厉、太爱拒绝的自我所造成的直接结果。在许多情况下，虽然不是全部，这样的次人格可能只代表了整体人格那些很健康的表达欲望，因为这些欲望长期被否认。你们可以重新组合统合法则的行动，并为两种不同的自我系统分配能量。
It should be obvious that in Ruburt’s case no such habitual rejections by his ego have backed up in this manner.The secondary personality, however, is of course a reality in many circumstances.It can be considered as an impeding action in the same manner that an illness can be considered, but its overall value, or detrimental effects must be judged, again, as with an illness, on the overall service or disservice which it performs for the whole personality.就鲁柏面言，他的自我显然没有这类习惯性拒绝的现象。不过，次人格在许多情境中当然是一种实相，可以想像成是一种阻碍性的行动，就像疾病一样。但它整体的价值或危害程度，也跟疾病一样，必须由它对整体人格形成的全部贡献或危害状况来判定。
Without such a secondary regrouping of actions for example, a much more serious open breakage, a deep personality cleavage, might in some cases result.In some cases the secondary personality is, again, an emergency measure that will eventually tide the whole personality over, allow for the expression of actions before their explosion completely disrupts the personality system; and then the secondary personality structure may be dispensed with for all practical purposes, to be recalled however upon another emergency.举例来说，若没有这种次要的行动重组，有时候可能会产生更严重的开放性破坏，也就是深度的人格分裂。某些状况下，次人格还可能成为紧急手段，使整体人格到最后可以度过难关，让各项行动得以表达出来，以避免爆发而导致人格系统全面瓦解；接着，基于所有实际的理由，可能会将次人格结构解除掉，而等到另一个紧急状况出现时，再召唤回来。
In such a case the secondary personality may represent the best of the available alternatives that can be practically taken by the personality to maintain itself.The impeding action, then, would have a survival value.这种状况下，次人格或许就代表了最佳的可用选项，让人格可实际选用，以维持它自己。于是，这个阻碍性行动便具有了活命的价值。
In some cases of course the secondary personality would be a severely impeding one, stealing away the main energies.However, it must be understood that from the whole personality’s viewpoint, a strong ego, that is a dependable one, and one that will also allow necessary expression, is a necessity.Therefore from the standpoint of the whole personality, the adoption of a new ego, so to speak, with a more practical grouping of unifying principles, could be the best solution of the previous ego, the previously dominant ego, (if it) had been an incapable one.当然在另外某些情况下，次人格会是一个严重阻碍的人格，窃走了主要的能量。不过，必须了解的是，从整体人格来说，一个强壮的自我、也就是一个可靠的自我有其必要，而且这个自我也要能允许必要的表达。因此，就整体人格来看，可以这么说，以一种更实际的统合法则为组合方式，来接纳一个新的自我，这可是之前那个自我的最佳解决方案，因为之前那个自我很专断，而且(可能它)早就很无能。
In this case the so-called secondary personality would express the whole personality to better advantage, and actually reinforce its permanence and identity.After your break, we will discuss the purposes of the ego to some degree.这种情形下，所谓的次人格会为整体人格做更有利的表达，实际上也会增强它的耐久性和本体。你们休息过后，我们会稍微讨论自我的目的。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:11.Jane was well dissociated.She had thought she was speaking slowly, whereas in reality her delivery had been rather fast and quiet.(10:11分休息。珍出离得很好，她一直认为自己讲话速度慢，但实际上她的传述速度都相当快；也相当轻柔。
(The parentheses near the end of the second paragraph above indicate that the two enclosed words are missing from my notes, for whatever reason.Jane was speaking quite rapidly at the time; I could have missed them.(上面倒数第二段末尾括号内的字，我在做笔记时不知什么原因漏掉了。珍那时讲话速度非常快；我可能因此漏掉这几个字。
(Jane resumed in the same quiet manner, with her eyes closed, at 10:21.)(珍传述的声音跟之前一样轻柔，闭着眼睛，10:21分继续。)
The personality must be understood from all these viewpoints, and it must be understood as an action gestalt.必须从所有这些观点理解人格，并且，必须要把它作为一个行为完形来理解。
The ego must be understood as having certain general necessary characteristics.Again, it must attempt to see itself as apart from action, even though basically the attempt to do so must fail.The attempt however allows the ego to act as a front man, so to speak, an organized and disciplined agent to deal with physical environment for the whole personality.自我具有某些一般的必要特质，这点也必须理解。此外，自我必定会试图把它本身当成与行动分离，纵使这个企图基本上注定会失败。不过，这样的企图让自我得以成为一个代表人，可以这么说，成为一个有组织、有纪律的代表人，来替整个人格去跟物质环境打交道。
A very delicate netwo0k of imbalances is here maintained.The ego must not be too rigid, or too much a disciplinarian, or it ceases to speak for the whole personality, and becomes a warden, imprisoning the main expressive urges of the deeper self.It must not on the other hand be composed of too disorganized a system of actions, for in this case it is not capable of maintaining a consistent sense of identity or purpose, and is not strong enough to act in a magnetic manner, that will attract or hold the basic energies of the personality.一种非常微妙的失衡网络此时于焉形成。自我必然不可以太过严厉或过度执行纪律，否则它就无法继续为整体人格代言，而变成了一个看管人，把更里面的自己最主要的表达欲望给禁锢住。另一方面，组成自我的行动系统也不能太松散，因为这样一来，它就无法维持住本体或目的的一致感，同时也不够强壮，无法以一种具吸引力的方式，吸引或留住人格的基本能量。
As far as Ruburt's personality structure is concerned, we are extremely fortunate.The ego is secure enough, and strong enough, as an organizing agent, for the basic personality energies, so that it can allow me to communicate without fear that the personality structure will be in any way disrupted.就鲁柏的人格结构来说，我们极其幸运。对于基本人格能量而言，他的自我在担任有组织的代理人时，够安全也够强壮，所以让我得以在跟他沟通时，不用害怕人格结构会遭到任何方式的破坏。
Indeed as you may have observed, the personality continues in a rather unruffled fashion, considering the circumstances.This is why valid communications can occur between us, and it is also the reason why such communications rarely occur, generally speaking.In the case of an insecure ego you have two immediate problems, and are involved instantly with difficulties:确实就像你们观察到的那样，人格在考量环境后，会以相当安稳的方式持续。这就是为什么我们之间的沟通效果这么好，也是为什么这样的沟通通常很难得。要是自我缺乏安全感的话，你们立刻会碰到两个问题，也会马上面临困境：
The basic personality would be fearful of such communications, knowing instinctively the weakness of the ego. The ego would be extremely insecure.On the other hand, the personality would almost welcome a strong organizing force, regardless of its source, and could tend to latch onto it as much as possible.A study of secondary personalities is most fascinating, since such a study would give you an excellent idea of the manner in which the ego in general is formed, for it is but a unity of energy under auspices of the strongest actions characteristic within the given personality system.基础人格在直觉上知道自我的软弱，对于这样的沟通会感到害怕，自我也会极度缺乏安全感。另一方面，人格几乎都会欣然接受任何强大的组织力量，不管它的来源为何，而且很容易尽其所能地抓住不放。次人格的研究极其有趣，因为这样的研究，会让你们对于形成自我的一般方式有更好的概念，因为这只不过是在任何人格系统之内，由最强的特色所支持的一种能量统合而已。
These energies are naturally drawn from within the whole personality.What is not generally recognized is the fact that the ego itself constantly changes. It is only when the change is unusually vivid, and definitely perceivable, that you speak of secondary personalities.But the main characteristic drives of any given personality shift continually; for all its attempts in the opposite direction, the ego must change just to exist, and its very permanence is dependent upon its flexibility.这些能量自然会从整体人格之内吸取出来。一般所不了解的是，自我本身会持续不断变化，唯有这些变化异常活跃且确实可以被感知时，你们才会论及次人格。但是任何人格的主要特质驱动力会持续转变；为了相反方向的所有企图，自我必须改变以求存在，而它的那个耐久性就取决于它的灵活性。
The ego, then, is as much characterized by those types of action which it habitually denies, as by those types of actions which it habitually accepts.It is not the only organizing aspect of the personality, however. It is simply the organizing aspect of the personality in its dealings with the physical environment.The inner ego is another organizing feature of the personality in its dealings with inner environment.习惯性接受某几类行动，或习惯性拒绝某几类行动，都可以视为自我的特点。不过，自我并不是人格中唯一善于组织的面向，它只是人格与物质环境打交道时，善于组织的那个面向而已。内在自我则是人格与内在环境打交道时，善于组织的另一个面貌。
You may take a break, or you may end the session.你们可以休息一下，也可以结束这节课。
(“I guess we'll end it then.”)(“我想我们结束好了。”)
I will then bid you a fond good evening, and we will for a time be concerned with the various aspects of human personality. You should find these discussions of great benefit.I enjoyed our quiet session.祝你们有个愉快的夜晚，我们会花些时间关注人类人格的各个面向，你们应该看得出这些讨论很有帮助。我喜欢我们这一节平静的课。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:43.Jane was well dissociated, as she had been for most of the session. It took her several moments to open her eyes.My writing hand was tired from the fast pace.Apropos of this, Jane said that subjectively the session had seemed about fifteen minutes long to her.)(10:43分结束。珍出离得很好，一如这节课大部分时候，她花了一些时间把眼睛张开。由于传述节奏快，我抄笔记的手会酸。至于这部分，珍说主观上她觉得这节课好像只有15分钟而已。)

SESSION 166 第166节　人格的本质 约翰私人课


JUNE 30, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年6月30日星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(John Bradley of Williamsport, PA, was a witness to the session. John has witnessed quite a few sessions and read much of the Seth material.Indeed, John was the first to witness a session, on February 18,1964.The last session he witnessed was on February 24,1965. See Volumes I and 3.John was in an excellent mood tonight.(来自宾州威廉波特的约翰·布莱德利是这节课的见证人，约翰见证过好多节课，也读过很多赛斯资料。实际上，在1964年2月18日，他是第一位见证我们课的人。他最近一次见证的课是在1965年2月24日那天，见第一册与第三册。约翰今晚的心情相当好。
(The session was held in our front room, and was free from interruptions.Once again Jane spoke at a fast rate; several times I had to ask her to slow down.As is often the case with witnesses, her delivery was much more active.Although her eyes remained closed for the whole session, her voice was loud and at times quite a bit deeper than usual.She was very restless in her chair, changing position often.It will be remembered that Johns entity name is Philip.)(这节课在我们前面的房间举行，没受到什么干扰。珍讲话一样很快；有好几次我得拜托她放慢速度。就跟其他几次有见证人在场的情形一样，她的口述显得活泼许多。虽然整节课眼睛都闭着，但声音却很大，有时候比平日低沉得多。她在椅子上非常躁动，时常变换姿势。记得，约翰的存有名叫菲利普。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
([John:] “Good evening, Seth.”)([约翰：]“晚安，赛斯”)
My heartiest regards to our friend Philip, irregardless of his own rather frivolous good evening.尽管我们的朋友菲利普的问候相当轻佻，我还是要跟他致上我最衷心的问候。
I would here like to continue our discussion concerning the nature of the personality.Joseph, if I speak too quickly, I hope I can rest assured that you will ask me to slow down.在这里我想继续讨论人格的本质。约瑟，假如我讲太快，你可以要求我放慢速度，我希望我不用担心这一点。
(“All right.”)(“好。”)
As we mentioned in our last session, the personality cannot be considered alone, but it must be thought of in its relationship to action and to all those aspects of reality of which it is a part.就像我们上一节课所讲的，不能单独只考虑人格，而必须同时考虑到它与行动的关系，以及它与它所属实相里全部面向的关系。
When it accepts an illness as a part of its own self-image, then the illness becomes an actual part of the reality that is the self.The personality must therefore be considered as a biological reality. It must also be considered as an electrical reality, as a psychological reality, for any experience is automatically translated into all these systems.当人格把疾病视为本身自我意象的一部分，这个疾病便成为实际实相的一部分，也是自己的一部分。因此，人格就必须被当成一种生物实相来看待，也必须被当成一种电子实相、心理实相来看待，因为任何经验都会自动转换到所有这些系统之内。
I would suggest that our friend with the ulcer read our last two previous sessions, for this will bring home to him the fact that he does indeed, literally, consider his ulcer as much a part of himself as an arm or a leg.He considers the ulcer, in fact, more real and necessary than an arm or a leg, since his whole life now revolves about this illness.我会建议我们那位患有溃疡的朋友，看看前两节课的资料，因为这会使他彻底了悟到，他的确是将溃疡视为自己的一部分，就跟手脚完全一样。事实上，他把溃疡看得比手脚更真实、更有必要，因为他现在的全部生命就绕着这个疾病的轨迹在跑。
In such a case the whole personality structure adopts such an illness as a new unifying principle, about which life activities are then centered.That man, for all his seeming outwardness, fears to relate himself in a basic manner toward the outside environment.在这个状况下，他整个人格结构就把这样的疾病视为一个新的统合法则，各种日常活动就以这个统合法则为中心。这个人虽然外表看似外向，但基本上他仍害怕将自己本身与外在环境连结。
(Jane smiled, and pointed to John. Her eyes were still closed.Her voice was now loud and active, with a strong edge.)(珍面带微笑，手指着约翰，眼睛现在仍然闭着，声音则变得宏亮、有活力，非常激烈。)
We do not have that trouble here, for here, if we may use Philip as another example, we find better balance.Philip relates himself well in an outward manner, insisting to some extent that he maintain also his inward integrity.I am here mentioning the two personalities and bringing them together in our discussion because they are both salesmen.如果以菲利普做为另一个例子，就没有那个问题，我们发现他平衡得比较好。菲利普自己对外的连结做得不错，在此同时，他也多多少少坚持要维持好自己内在的整合。因为他们两人都是业务员，所以我这里将这两个人格相提并论。
As such their positions demand outgoing natures. But one of our salesman has an ulcer and the other man does not.There are obvious reasons for this, and reasons that will allow us to delve more deeply into the nature of the human personality in general.就他们的职位来说，都需要外向的性格，可是其中一个业务员罹患了溃疡，另一个却没有。这当中的原因显而易见，这些原因可以让我们深入探讨一般人格的本质。
We will for the purposes of our discussion ignore, for now, certain aspects in Philips personality, such as a deep secrecy which is indeed based on fear, because this characteristic and others will not help us progress in our particular subject matter.We will instead content ourselves with a comparison of the two personalities in regard to certain characteristic reactions, which tend to lead the personalities toward health or illness.为了达成我们讨论的目的，现在会略过菲利普人格的某些面向，例如其实会出于恐惧而深藏秘密，因为这个特质和其他特质对于我们这个主题的进展，并没有帮助。相反地，我们会针对此二人格中，某些容易将人格导向健康或疾病的特有反应加以比较，以达成我们的目标。
What is required of them both in their daily working lives is in many respects precisely the same. They are both excellent salesmen. They are both intimately familiar with the use of energy, in that they are able to use their own energy to affect the minds of other individuals.But their reactions are entirely different, and Philip’s past life experiences prepared him for the nature of his present occupation, where he is dealing with medicinal matters.他们两人在日常工作生活中，在很多方面该具备的特质其实完全相同，他们两人都是很优秀的业务员，对于能量的使用都相当熟悉，因为他们都能运用他们的能量去影响其他人的想法，但他们的反应却截然不同。菲利普过去的生命经验，已为他目前的职业属性做好了准备，他目前正从事医药方面的工作。
(Seth dealt with one of John 's past lives and his connection with medicine in an amusing way during the 21st session, of February 3,1964.John knocked on our door during the session, but since we had not yet begun having witnesses, we asked him to return later. As soon as the door closed behind John, Seth went into a rather lengthy rundown on him, much to our surprise.At that time, neither Jane or I had seen John very many times.)(赛斯在1964年2月3日第21节中，曾以饶富趣味的方式，处理了约翰过去的某一世以及他跟医药的连结。在上那一节课时，约翰来敲我们的门，但因为我们那时尚未开放见证，所以请他晚一点再来，他才一关上门离开，赛斯就针对他做了相当长的描述，令我们大为惊讶。那时候我和珍都没见过约翰几次。)
He is, in a more basic manner than he may realize, deeply committed here. He is quite content with his ability to affect the minds of others.Our other friend, to the contrary, is afraid of this ability, and distrusts it, and is not at all committed to the product that he sells.基本上，他深深地投入于此，投入的程度可能比他自己认为得还深，他对于自己影响他人想法的能力感到很满意。相反地，我们另一个朋友害怕这种能力，也不信任这种能力，对于他所卖的产品一点都不投入。
But this is not the only reason that one man has an ulcer and the other man has none, for we are involved here with characteristic reactions and with habits that have been engraved within each personality since last physical birth, and before.I will now suggest your break, and we will continue with this particular discussion.但这不是一个有溃疡一个没溃疡的唯一理由，因为我们这里探讨的是，每个人格上一次肉体出生及在那之前，具有根深蒂固的特有反应和习惯。我建议你们休息一下后再继续讨论这部分。
The matter of the surveys will be in due time discussed, Philip. I will be glad to tell you the little that I know.I now suggest your break.菲利普，有关问卷调查的问题会在适当的时间讨论，我乐意把我所知不多的东西告诉你。我建议你们可以休息了。
(Break at 9:20.Jane was well dissociated, far-out, she said.Her delivery had been very active, her voice loud at times, her pace fast, her eyes closed.(9:20分休息。珍出离得很好，她说自己彻底出去。她传述时精力充沛，噪门有时候很大，节奏快速，双眼闭着。
(She ended the session with a smile, referring to the survey discussed by John before the session began. This was a detailed psychological questionnaire that John had recently completed for his drug company, Searle. John felt that the questions were loaded, that his answers, which were very frank, would be used in considering him for advancement.(她带着微笑结束这一段，同时提到上课前约翰讨论过的问卷调查，约翰最近刚为他所服务的塞尔药品公司，完成这项详细的心理问卷调查，约翰觉得问卷里的问题设有陷阱，他的回答非常坦白，会用来做为他晋升的参考。
(Jane resumed in the same active manner, her eyes still closed, her voice strong, at 9:33.)(珍的精神一样充沛，眼睛仍然闭着，传述声音强而有力，9:33分继续。)
I am, as always, fascinated by your discussions with guests during your break periods.我跟往常一样，对于你们休息时间与访客的讨论内容感到着迷。
There is much I will say at a later date, having to do with Ruburt’s truly idiotic performance in visiting the supposed medium in your town.鲁柏拜访城里公认为是灵媒的那个人，真是愚蠢的行为，有关这方面改天我有很多话要说。
It would seem to me that his nature would be somewhat above deliberately leading the poor deluded woman astray by lies.She is at best deluded and neurotic, and embarrassingly sincere.在我看来，他本质上好像有点故意要以谎话，引导那被瞒骗的可怜女士走入歧途。她顶多是被瞒骗、神经质，且真诚到令人尴尬的程度。
Since when does Ruburt stoop so low as to make fun of fools?If anything, the woman deserves pity, and hardly scorn. I was not pleased with that performance.鲁柏从什么时候起把标准降得这么低，会去取笑傻瓜啊？其实这位女士该得到的是同情，而不是嘲笑，我对那种行为感觉不悦。
(Jane smiled and frowned.Her voice now became more amused and less scornful, but not much quieter.)(珍笑笑，且皱起眉头，这时她的声音变得比较愉快，而不太像嘲弄的味道，可是也不太温和。)
On the other hand, I did watch with some amusement as the scene was enacted in a small room, and as the ghosts were supposed to materialize in the doorway.I do therefore on the one hand somewhat appreciate Ruburt’s reaction.In one of my more friendly moods, I might indeed have tried a materialization of my own that would have frightened the poor woman out of her wits.另一方面，那一幕在小房间上演，那些鬼应该在门口现形时，我的确看到了，心里还觉得有些好玩。因此在某方面来讲，我真的有点感谢鲁柏的反应。在我心情比较好的时候，或许真的会尝试将自己现形，届时可能会把这可怜的女士吓得半死。
Nevertheless, I did not do so, and I feel duty bound to mention the fact that Ruburt's performance was dishonest, and there was no good reason for it.It would be much better for him also if he stayed out of the investigation that he so gleefully entered into with Peggy Gallagher, concerning the so-called mediums in your town.然而我并没有这么做，我觉得我提出一个事实，鲁柏的表现并不诚实，而且没什么正当理由。他和蓓•加拉格一起，很高兴地对你们城里所谓的那些灵媒做了一项调查，如果他能退出这项调查，对他而言会好得多。
In all cases that I know of, these women are indeed neurotic and misled and self-deluded.Nevertheless they harm no one. They listen where no one else will listen.They are well-meaning, and occasionally they are able to use their inner abilities.就我所知的全部状况，这些女士真的都是神经过敏，不但被误导，也都在自我欺骗。不过她们并没伤害到任何人，她们听信了别人都不会听信的内容。她们出于善意，而且有时候能使用她们的内在能力。
There is nothing wrong with the idea of an investigation. Ruburt simply should not be involved in it. It is not his place. It is not his area, and because of his conscientiousness, and hardheadedness. He would be much harder on these women than is necessary.But the thought of him baiting an elderly 72 year-old self-deluded woman is too much.调查的这个点子并没有错，只是鲁柏不该涉入，那不是他的地方，那不是他的领域，因为以他龟毛和顽固的个性来讲，他对待这些女人必然严苛得多。但是他想引诱一位自我欺骗的72岁高龄妇人，这个想法是太过分了。
(Janes voice grew to a near shout, briefly.She said later that she did not know the age of the woman medium being discussed here, but that she had taken it for granted it would be in the seventies.)(珍的声音一度变得像在大叫，她随后说，她不知道我们讨论的这位女灵媒年纪多大，但她理所当然认为应该是70多岁。)
We will now return to our previous discussion.我们现在就回到之前的讨论。
We find that Philip believes, basically, in the products that he sells. We find that the general nature of the products is related to experiences in past lives.We find that he has endless energies when he wants them, at his disposal.我们发现菲利普基本上相信他所推销的产品，我们也发现产品的一般属性跟他过去累世的经验相关。我们发现，当他想要能量时，可以拥有无限的能量供他支配使用。
(Her eyes still closed, her voice again louder, Jane pointed at John Bradley.)(珍的眼睛还是闭着，声音又变得比较大声，手指着约翰·布莱德利。)
We find that he relates well to the outside environment. And then we have this secrecy of which I said I would not speak.We also find, in your other friend, boundless energies and a genuine ability to relate to others. But the personality is torn against itself. It does not believe in what it is doing, and here we will find a comparison between this tendency toward secrecy on Philips part, and this divided nature on the part of your other friend.我们发现他跟外在环境连结得非常好，我们也知道他这个秘密，但我说过我不会把它讲出来。我们还发现你们另一个朋友的身上，也有无限的能量和真正的能力，可以与其他事物连结，但这个人格却自我撕裂了，不相信自己所做的，这里我们就可以看出，菲利普对秘密的处理态度，以及你另一个朋友分裂的本性，两者之间有什么不同。
(The other fiend being Bill Gallagher.Bill and his wife Peggy have witnessed the 158th, 161st and 162nd sessions.)(另一位朋友指的是比尔·加拉格。比尔跟他太太蓓在第158、161和162节课中见证过。)
For when your other friend is relating to the exterior environment, he does something that Philip does not do. He closes himself off entirely, as much as possible, from the inside environment.Philip insists, in a rather cocky manner, in taking his own inner integrity along.Your other friend cannot, so far, relate the inner and the outer selves. He can relate to the inner self or the outer self, but he has not learned to unite the two, nor allowed for any understanding or communication between them.你们另一个朋友连结到外在环境时，做了某些菲利普不会做的事，他会尽其所能将自己从内在环境完全隔绝开来。而菲利普则相当自豪地坚持，随时关照好自己内在的统整性。到目前为止，你们另一个朋友都无法同时连结内在与外在的自己，他可以连结到内我自己或外在自我，但还学不会同时连结两者，也不允许这两者了解或彼此沟通。
When he is at work he thinks “This is not me, this is not myself.”The inner self has not so far recognized this other portion of the personality.When our friend Philip sells he is thinking “This is me. You can like it or not, but buy what I am selling.”But he believes in what he is selling.他工作时会认为：“这不是我，这不是我自己。”内我至今都还不承认人格当中另外的这一部分。而我们的朋友菲利普在推销时，会想：“这就是我，你可以喜欢，也可以不喜欢，但就是来买我推销的东西。”他相信他所卖的东西。
Your other friend sends a part of himself into the marketplace, and leaves the essential part of himself at home.He is an expert salesman. He enjoys selling. But he will not admit that he enjoys it to his own inner self.The ulcer is caused by many things, and we have discussed some of them.你们另一个朋友把他自己的一部分送到市场上，而将自己重要的部分留在家里。他是很专业的推销员，以推销为乐，但是他并不会对自己的内我承认他喜欢这个工作。他的溃疡是由许多事情造成的，我们讨论了其中一部分。
It is nevertheless the physical materialization of this lack of communication. Its purpose is basically a good one. The results are obviously poor.The ulcer is an attempt to force a recognition of unity from the various levels of the self.It is, literally, a physical bridge.At this time it is an impeding action, but it can be dissolved and resolved, according to our previous discussions.溃疡就是这种缺乏沟通而在肉体上具体化的结果，它的目的基本上是出于善意，但结果显然很糟糕。溃疡就是想办法要迫使他承认，各个不同层面的自己其实都是一部分。精确来说，它是一种肉体上的桥梁。此时，它就是一种阻碍性的行动，但根据我们之前的讨论，这可以化解或解决。
The dependent portion of the personality is literally appalled at the more aggressive aspects of the whole personality.In the case of Philip, we find these aggressive tendencies welcomed. But because basically Philip is able to unite the various levels of the self, there is no such deep and persistent physical problem.The aggressiveness is given reign and acceptance.The tendency toward division in Philip’s personality shows itself in this tendency toward secrecy, which affects most deeply the nature of his home life.人格中依赖的那部分，简直被整体人格中比较进取(aggressive)的那些面向吓坏了。但是就菲利普来说，我们发现这些进取的部分很受欢迎，但因为菲利普基本上能整合自己的各个不同层面，所以他的身体没有这么难以搞定的严重问题。进取心得到了统治权，同时也被接纳。菲利普人格里的分隔倾向(tendency toward division)表现在他对秘密的态度上，这部分深深影响到他居家生活的品质。
You may take a break if you prefer, or I will continue with the session.你们愿意的话可以休息一下，不然我就继续上课。
(“Well take the break.”)(“那我们就休息一下。”)
As you wish.就照你说的。
(Break at 10:00.Jane was again well dissociated. Her pace had been fast, and my writing hand was tiring.I had already asked Seth to slow down several times, and now at break asked Jane, as Jane, to see what she could do about the problem.In recent sessions her rate of speaking has pushed my writing ability to the limit, even with the rather elaborate system of symbols and abbreviations I have evolved for taking down the sessions.(10点休息。珍再次出离得非常好，她的节奏一直都很快，我写字的手也很酸。我好几次要求赛斯放慢速度，这时趁着休息时间我问珍，是以珍的身分，看看她是否能解决这个问题。最近几节课她讲话的速度都把我的笔记能力逼到最上限，即使我为了记录赛斯课已发挥出相当精湛的符号和缩写系统，仍无法应付。
(Jane began at a pace slightly slower, in the same strong and active voice, with her eyes again closed, at 10:15.)(珍传述的节奏放得稍慢一些，声音一样有力，精神一样充沛，闭着眼睛。10:15分继续。)
As Philip suspected, his questionnaire is indeed loaded.就如菲利普怀疑的一样，他的问卷里确实有陷阱。
However, the fact that it is so set up does not change the earlier predictions which I have made.There will be a definite demand that changes be made because of the financial losses that are being suffered.不过，这样的设计并没改变我之前做的预测。由于正逢财务上的亏损，势必需要改变。
This will not happen overnight, but it has already begun; and the forces that are now working toward such a reorganization will suffer, within six months, a seeming downfall from which, however, they will indeed recover.这种状况不会在一夜之间发生，而是早已开始；当前努力做这样子组织改组的这些力量，在6个月内将会看似衰退，不过实际上会复元。
The recovery process will take a year but the forces then will be very strong, and the reorganization is inevitable.复元过程会花上一整年，但到时候这些力量会变得非常强大，而组织重整势必无可避免。
(“Not too fast.”)(“不要太快。”)
Within five years there will be a definite change in Philip’s place of employment and living area, when he will accept a much better position, and wholeheartedly.5年之内，菲利普工作和居住的地点肯定会变动，到时他会获得一个更好的职位，而且全力以赴。
The reorganization however will occur before this time, and there will be talk of changes for him, as there have been, and some minor changes will occur.But the main change in Philip’s condition with the company will not occur until after the inevitable reorganization.然而公司的改组将会在这之前发生，就像之前一样，会出现有关他异动的话题，同时也会出现一些较小的改变。但是要等到那无可避免的改组之后，菲利普跟公司的状况才会有重大的改变。
It will occur within six months to one year after the reorganization. My idea of time is obviously not your own, and I cannot at this moment pinpoint the particular date.Also, there are some variables which cannot be adequately predicted because of conditions that will change drastically the attitudes of two men within the organization, and also a death which will occur in the higher organizational realm.这会在改组后半年到一年之内发生，我的时间概念跟你们的显然不同，此刻我无法精准指出确切的日期。由于某些状况，会让组织内两个人的态度大为改变，同时组织高层会有人死亡，所以还有一些无法预测的变数存在。
At the time of the reorganization those who have spoken out will be sought out, and those who did not speak out will be on the firing line.Again, I am not sure of the date of the death that will be involved here. It will occur within a year and a half, and perhaps within six months.The repercussions will not be immediately felt, but they will be one of the basic causes that will lead officials to decide upon such a reorganization.组织改造时，那些已经表态的人会被挑选出来，而那些没表态的人则会备受责难。同样地，我无法确定将在这儿发生的死亡日期，也许是在一年半之内，也许是在半年内发生。这件事造成的影响，大家不会马上感觉到，但将成为高层干部决定这次改组的基本原因之一。
(John Bradley has witnessed the following sessions: 37, 54, 63, 70, 95, 135, and 166, the present one.In most of these Seth has dealt with John 's connection with Searle to at least some degree, making the type of predictions he makes in this session.To sort out the rather complicated pattern of these predictions would require a study of the above sessions.To date John has agreed with their content, but most of them are of such long range that little has yet developed against which to check.)(约翰·布莱德利见证过下面几节：37、54、63、70、95、135、以及现在第166节。赛斯在其中好几节课当中，多多少少都处理过约翰跟塞尔药品公司的关系，就像这节课一样，也做了这种预言。如果要从这些预言中，整理出相当复杂的形态，就必须研究上述这几节。到目前为止，约翰都同意预言的内容，但由于大部分都是这么长期的预测，所以几乎没有什么预言的发展可据以检验。)
Philips connection with the conservative groups, politically speaking, will strangely enough have something to do with the promotion which can be later expected.This connection will not have to do with the fact that his group is conservative, necessarily, but will have to do with the fact that he exerts leadership in that area.菲利普跟政治上保守团体的连结，说也奇怪，会跟后来可预期的升迁有关。这种连结与他是属于保守派的事实，并没有必然的关系，而是与他在那个领域发挥了领导才干有关。
His political movements are being closely watched by one man in particular, but the interest is being caused by his ability to organize, rather than because the political movement involved is a conservative one.有一位男士现正特别密切观察他的政治活动，但引发这位男士观察兴趣的是菲利普的组织能力，而不是他参与了保守派政治活动的关系。
Oddly enough, the fact that the movement is conservative will work to his advantage in very strange ways.Though they may not agree with his political beliefs, they will on the other hand trust his integrity because the movement is conservative.They do not believe that he would follow an unpopular cause unless he believed in it.They will want a man who is sincere. They will also want a man who can lead. They will be afraid of a liberal.I hope that this is sufficient. After our next break I will give you what additional information I have. You may take a break, or we will continue with our session.很诡异的是，保守派活动将会以很奇怪的方式为他带来好处。虽然他们可能不认同他的政治理念，但由于他参与的这个活动是保守派的，他们反而会信任他的正直廉洁。他们认为他不会去追随一个不得人心的理想，除非他相信它。他们将需要一个真心诚意的人，他们也需要一个有领导能力的人，他们会怕自由主义者。我希望这些就够了，下次休息后，我会给你们更多的讯息，你们可以休息一下，不然我们就继续上课。
(“Well take the break.”)(“我们休息一下。”)
I should from here on call you “I will take a break Joseph.”I do, however, appreciate the work that you give to our sessions, and if you will forgive my humor I will forgive yours, as I sometimes am acquainted with it on those few occasions when I look in on you between sessions.By all means take your break, and if you prefer I will then continue.从现在开始，我应该跟你们说：“约瑟，我要休息一下。”不过，我真的很感谢你为我们这些课的付出，如果你愿意原谅我的幽默，那我也会原谅你的幽默，因为我在各节课之间偶尔探望过你们，所以我有时会熟悉你的幽默。无论如何，你们休息一下吧，但如果你们喜欢的话，我也可以继续。
(Break at 10:32.Jane was again well dissociated. She ended the delivery with a smile.Her pace of dictation had been so fast recently that I took a break whenever I could.(10:32分休息。珍再度出离得很好，带着微笑结束了这部分的传述。她最近讲话速度都非常快，所以我只要能休息就会休息。
(It might be noted that I again detected traces of what I call a brogue in Jane's manner of speaking this evening, and thought it more pronounced as the session wore on. She does not have this characteristic usually.This brogue had been quite pronounced at times during the 162nd session, witnessed by Lorraine Shafer and Bill and Peggy Gallagher, and I have noted traces of it during subsequent sessions.(值得注意的是，我再度觉察到，今晚珍讲话时带有所谓爱兰尔口音的味道，而且随着课的进行，这种腔调越来越重，她通常不会这样。这种口述在第162节中有时候相当重，洛琳•雪佛、比尔和蓓•加拉格都是那节课的见证人，从那之后，我都会在课堂中留意这方面的迹象。
(This accent has been apparent in other sessions in a minor way at times.Perhaps I am more conscious of it recently because of the two Father Trainor episodes. See the 131st and the 158th sessions.During these readings Jane's brogue was unmistakable.Jane grew up in an Irish neighborhood in Saratoga Springs, NY, and is a quarter Irish.She had no father at home, growing up as a child, but Father Trainor, a frequent visitor, was Irish.(其实这种腔调在其他节课偶尔也听得出来，只是没那么明显。或许是因为崔诺神父那两次经验的关系，我最近比较会注意这部分，见131和158节。在这两节的朗读中，珍显然就有这种口音。珍小时候在纽约撒拉托加温泉市的爱尔兰社区长大，具有四分之一的爱尔兰血统。她童年成长过程中，家里并没有父亲陪伴，不过崔诺神父三不五时会来探望，他倒是个爱尔兰人。
(John Bradley said he was thoroughly convinced that a reorganization would have to take place in his company, that great financial losses were being suffered.This theme has run through Seth’s predictions concerning John's company for the past year or so. John himself has suffered some paper losses in stock values, and is of course concerned.(约翰·布莱德利说，他完全相信公司必须改组，而且正逢重大的财务亏损。目前的话题是在总览一下赛斯对约翰公司过去大约一年来的预言，约翰自己面临股份账面上的一些损失，当然会担心。
(Jane resumed with her eyes again closed, and in a somewhat quieter but still fast voice, at 10:43.)(珍再度闭上眼睛，传述的稍微温和些，但速度仍然很快。10:43分继续。)
We will shortly conclude our session.我们很快就会结束我们这节课。
However I will add a few notes. Philip is now being seriously watched and considered for another position.His immediate superior is basically not his friend, although personally they may get along well. It is others in higher positions who are watching him.不过我还有几点要补充，有人正审慎观察菲利普，并考虑是否将他调到另一职位。虽然菲利普的直属主管跟菲利普的私交可能不错，但基本上并不是他的朋友，在观察他的是另一个职位更高的人。
(“Not too fast.”)(“不要太快。”)
I will endeavor to speak more slowly, and I will be directed in this respect Joseph by you, if you will make your wishes known during the delivery.There is one other company in particular with whom Philip could become involved to his advantage.我会努力尽量讲慢点，约瑟，在口述当中，如果你对这方面有什么期望就让我知道，我会愿意配合。其实另外还有一家公司，菲利普如果能进去，对他会有好处。
It is situated in the Midwest, perhaps in Minneapolis. It is presently a small firm, comparatively speaking, but it will expand drastically within a short time.He will become involved with this company I believe irregardless, either as a competitor or as a member of the organization.这家公司在中西部，可能在明尼亚波利斯市(Minneapolis)，目前公司规模相对较小，但会在短时间急遽扩张。无论如何，我相信他会跟这家公司结下不解之缘，不是成为它的竞争对手，就是成为它的一员。
(Jane's brogue was now becoming more pronounced again.)(这时珍的爱尔兰口音又变得更重。)
If he uses his patience it will be for his best advantage, everything taken into consideration, to remain with his present company, and his impatience will not serve him well if he leaps too fast.如果他有耐心，将每件事都纳入考量后，那么继续留在目前的公司对他而言最好；如果他按捺不住，太早跳槽，对他将没什么好处。
The stock of his present company will drop still further. This will be another reason for the inevitable reorganization.The stock will go very low, and it will be this financial loss that will make the reorganization itself come about.The head man within the company will suffer a loss of power, although he may retain his title.他现在这家公司的股票会继续跌，这也将成为公司必须改组的另一个理由。股份会跌到相当低，这种财务上的亏损将促使公司改组自然来到。公司老板虽然可能还保得住头衔，但将会大权旁落。
(As of July 3rd, G. D. Searle stock closed at 54 ‘L.John told us that a few months ago it had been in the low 60's.)(7月3日那天，塞尔药品公司的股票就以54.5元跌停作收。约翰告诉我，几个月前，股份就来到低档60几元了。)
Philip should not stray from the medical field, although for various reasons he would not function well as a physician.He will always be able to deal with physicians however, to his advantage and theirs.If he puts his efforts into the company, and his energy, he can go as far within it as he desires.菲利普虽然因各种原因，当医师当得不太顺，但仍不用离开医药界。他一直都可以做医师的生意，对他自己、对医师都会有好处。如果他能对公司、对他的能量多加努力，他将可以在这个领域中随心所欲、挥洒自如。
I will not give any further information this evening concerning these matters, but he may check with me from time to time if he so desires.There is a short man of whom he should beware. I will now conclude our session.关于这件事，今晚我不会再提供任何进一步的讯息，但如果他想要的话，可以偶尔跟我核对一下。菲利普应该要多留意一个矮子，我现在就要结束我们的课了。
My heartiest and best wishes to you all.If you prefer you may take a break and continue it as you wish. I am always at your beck and call.送上我最衷心、最深的祝福给各位。如果你们愿意，可以休息一下，再照你们的意思继续，我随传随到。
(“Well say good night.”(“那我们就道声晚安吧。”
(End at 10:50.Jane was well dissociated—far-out, again. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice had been a little quieter.(10:50分结束。珍出离得非常好——再次彻底出去，她双眼都闭着，声音稍微轻柔了些。
(John did not know of any smaller drug company near Minneapolis, he said, but could check that area in a directory in the library of his hometown, Williamsport, PA.We usually see him every month or six weeks; if he unearths some pertinent information he will let us know by a card or letter so that it can be inserted in the record.(约翰说，他并不知道明尼亚波利斯市附近有什么小药厂，但可以在他家乡宾州威廉斯波特图书馆里的目录中，查一下那个区域。我们通常每个月或每6个星期可以看到他；如果他发现任何相关讯息，就会寄明信片或寄信让我们知道，以便将讯息插入记录里。
(John agreed with Seth’s statement, concerning his immediate superior not being, basically, his friend. He had not told Jane and I this, although we had met the individual in question once, briefly, here in Elmira at an art show.John had no idea of a short man of whom he should beware.(约翰同意赛斯说的，他的直属主管基本上不是他的朋友，但约翰不曾将这件事告诉过我和珍，虽然我们在埃尔迈拉这儿的一次画展中，曾短暂遇见过讨论中的这个人。约翰对于他该留意的那个矮子则毫无所悉。
(The three of us were discussing the session and related matters when Seth abruptly came through again.Resume at 11:10.)(我们三人正在讨论这一节和一些相关问题时，赛斯突然又穿透过来。11:10分继续。)
The fact that Philip has become involved with a political movement will indeed, of itself, have much to do with the promotion that will follow if he waits for it.事实上，如果菲利普愿意等待的话，他参与的政治活动与随后而来的升迁密切相关。
There was in the past disagreement as to his capability in the field of human relationships, as far as the ordinary person is concerned.The impetus that allowed him to become involved is only too well now recognized within the company.就一般普通人而言，过去大家对于他在人际关系上的能力看法并不一致。但目前公司里面的人，对于让他变得如此投入的这股动力，却都看得很清楚。
There is an individual within the political organization who, all unwittingly, gives information to Philip’s superiors through a family in-law relationship.If Philip for any reason allows his enthusiasm for this political group to wane, this will reduce his chances for advancement within the company, for it will be taken as a mark of fleeting interests.在政治组织里，有个人透过姻亲关系，不经意地把讯息告诉了菲利普的上司。假设不管菲利普基于什么原因，对这个政治团体的热情消退，那么他在公司的升迁机会就会减少，因为人家会认为他只是5分钟热度而已。
Philip would do well in his home relationships to be more open, for there is a possibility that his secretiveness could here cause serious difficulties.The home relationship is a strong basis for his inner security, and if he threatens it this will be seriously reflected in his other areas of activity.菲利普会好好把家庭关系经营得更开放，因为他隐瞒秘密在此时可能会引发严重的问题。家庭关系是他内在安全感的坚实基础，如果他威胁到家庭关系，后果可能会严重反应到其他的活动领域中。
(End at 11:14.Jane was fully dissociated. She had no idea of the material.The delivery was totally unexpected, she said, a complete surprise to her. I was also surprised.Jane's eyes had remained closed; her voice had been rather loud and fast.(11:14分结束。珍出离得很彻底，她对这部分的资料没什么概念。她说，这部分的口述完全都在意料之外，确实令她讶异，我也感到很惊讶。珍的眼睛一直都闭着；声音也一直相当宏亮、相当快。
(John agreed with Seth. He said that as far back as last January his suspicions had become aroused, when one of his superiors had mentioned John’s involvement with a political organization. John had not told anyone in the company about his activities in politics at that time.From what Seth said in the above delivery John now believes he knows who the individual is who might be passing along information about him.)(约翰同意赛斯所说的，他说，打从今年1月起，他就开始纳闷，当时早就有一位上司提到约翰参与政治组织的事，可是约翰那时并没有告诉公司里任何人关于参与政治活动的事。从赛斯上面这段的口述中，约翰现在认为，他已经知道是谁把他这件事传出去的。)

SESSION 167 第167节 人格的所在面向都不是静止不动的


JULY 5, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年7月5日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(The session was held in our quiet back room. Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed for the entire session. Her voice was quiet, picking up a little volume as the session progressed.Her speed of dictation was slow, with pauses, in the beginning, but by first break had attained its usual rather fast pace.)(这节课在我们后面安静的房间举行，珍整节课都是闭上眼睛坐着讲话，声音轻柔，但随着课的进行，音量也变大了些。她起先传述的速度缓慢，停顿几次，但到第一次休息时，就回到平常快速的样子。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
The personality must always be considered as motion, for no aspects of it are ever still.随时要把人格想成是移动(motion)来看待，因为它所有面向都不是静止不动的。
With the exception of the ego, the various parts of the personality do not react to time as a series of moments. All is experienced as present.The child therefore within the adult personality is not dead, nor are his reactions considered, basically, as reactions which are part of a past behavior pattern; but these reactions exist side by side with adult reactions.除了自我之外，人格的各个部分不会把时间当成是一系列的片刻来反应，所有一切都会被视为当下来经验。因此，在大人人格之内的小孩并没有消逝，基本上，他的反应也不会被当成是过去行为模式的一部分，这些反应就跟大人的反应一起存在着。
This should be clearly understood, yet the personality is far from static.But what it was always changes, but that which was is always taken along.人格根本并非静止不动，这一点应该要清楚了解。过去曾经发生的事，永远会再改变，但过去曾经发生的事，也永远会被随身带着。
We are going to have a brief session this evening for several reasons, but there were a few points considering the personality which I did want to make clear.由于几个理由，我们今晚这节课会较精简，但我真的想把跟人格有关的几点讲清楚。
That which was is constantly taken into what you call the present.The ego may choose to use or not use various reactions. It may reject various reactions as a part of the past, for it is the ego alone who is concerned with past, present and future.The ego’s denial of a reaction however does not cause the reaction to disappear from within the personality, at least as part of possible pattern reaction.过去曾经发生的事，经常被带入你们所谓的现在。自我可以选择是否要使用各种不同的反应，它可以将各种反应视为过去的一部分而加以拒绝，因为只有自我会关心过去、现在与未来。然而，自我拒绝了某个反应，并不会导致这个反应从人格之内消失，至少会成为可能反应模式的一部分。
Many reactions, many patterns of reactions, are rejected by the ego upon some occasions and accepted upon other occasions, but as a rule such alternate behavior is annoying to the ego itself.The ego deals with cause and effect, and often denies particular reactions because it decides that they are not effective.The ego is fairly rigid, comparatively speaking.Rationalization is one method by which the ego justifies its acceptance of a reaction which it once rejected as ineffective.许多反应，许多反应模式，有时候会被自我拒绝，有时候又会被接受，通常这种选择性的(alternative)行为会对自我本身造成困扰。自我处理原因与结果，而且常常会拒绝某些特定的反应，因为自我认定它们并不管用。相较之下，自我相当僵化。对于某个曾被认为无效而遭拒绝的反应，自我判断要不要接受它的方法之一就是合理化(rationalization)。
Such alternative reactions frighten the ego because they seem to injure the ego’s self-image.Yet all characteristic reactions, whether denied by the ego or not, are kept for use as alternative actions.In many cases actions unacceptable to the ego may be precisely those actions that are necessary for whole other areas of the personality.When too many actions are restricted by the ego, they may begin to form impulse patterns or groupings of various rejected impulses.These then adhere through attraction, and attempt to find expression regardless of the ego’s attempts to restrict expression.这选择性的反应会让自我感到害怕，因为它们仿佛会伤害到自我的自我意象。而所有独特的行动，不管是否被自我拒绝，都会留下来当成选择性行动来使用。许多状况下，自我无法接受的行动，可能正是人格其他全部领域所需要的那些行动。一旦太多行动受到自我限制，它们可能会开始形成冲动模式、或各种遭拒的冲动群组。这些冲动会透过吸引相互结合，不理会自我的试图限制，想办法寻求表达。
The ego must act therefore as a director of activity in the personality’s relationships with the physical environment.The ego is concerned with purposeful action. However when the ego is too restrictive its conception of purposeful action becomes so narrow that many legitimate and necessary impulses are dammed up, forming these rejected action patterns.因此，在人格与物质环境的关系中，自我必须扮演活动指导者的角色，自我关注的是目的性行动。不过，如果自我限制得太过分，那么它目的性行动的观念会变得非常狭隘，使得许多理所当然的必要冲动被压制住，因而形成这些遭到拒绝的行动模式。
As the number of rejected impulses grows, more and more energy is of course concentrated in this area, the energy that is inherent within the impulses themselves.This sort of grouping together of rejected impulses will occur mainly when the ego’s restrictions are too severe, so hampering that very deep and basic needs of the whole personality are being denied expression.It is therefore for the benefit of the whole personality that these impulses be given expression.遭到拒绝的冲动数量增加时，越来越多的能量当然就会集中在这个区域，而这些能量也是天生就在冲动本身之内。这种遭拒的冲动之所以会聚集，主要是发生在自我限制太过严格的时候，这种束缚相当大，使得整个人格中深层、基本的需求都无法获得表达。因此，让这些冲动有机会表达，对整个人格而言相当有益。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:16. Jane was well dissociated for a first break. Her eyes had remained closed and her delivery had speeded up considerably.She resumed in the same manner at 9:23.)(9:16分休息，珍在第一次休息时的出离状况很好，双眼一直闭着，传述的速度加快。她以同样的方式，9:23分继续。)
In many instances the ego then feels a lessening of available energy and a definite shortage of energy may occur, so that the ego finds it more difficult to handle its relationships with the outside environment.许多时候，自我会感觉可用的能量减少，而可能真的会出现能量短缺现象，所以自我会发现更难掌握它与外面环境间的关系。
It feels the concentration of energy that has collected to form the rejected action patterns, and indeed it may feel that this unified rejection pattern is then even an enemy to its own superiority.It may, with more force than ever, attempt to hold back the expression of these impulses, and its fear of them grows.它会感觉到集中的能量聚集成为被拒绝的行动模式，实际上也可能觉得这个未统一的拒绝模式，甚至会变成敌人，挑战它自己的优势地位。它可能会使出前所未见的力量，试图阻挡这些冲动的表达，但对这些冲动的害怕也会与日俱增。
The rejected action patterns, however, will find outlet. The nature of the outlet will be the result of the nature of the particular patterns themselves.The quality of the outlet will depend upon the intensity of these patterns, and the necessity or the degree of necessity, for their expression.Unless some adjustments are made at this point, the ego will have nothing to say with the direction that these patterns may take, simply because it will not accept their legitimacy.然而，这些被拒绝的行动模式终将找到出口，出口的种类则依这些模式本身的性质而定。出口的特质会取决于这些模式的强度，以及为了表达的需求状况或需求程度。除非自我在这一点上做了一些调整，否则自我对于这些模式可能采行的方式就无话可说，只因为自我不会接受它们的正当性。
The strength of the ego of course is also a factor here. If the ego is not a particularly strong one to begin with however, the conflict will seldom reach these proportions.Instead the ego will merely be slightly surprised at behavior which it does not condone, but eventually will accept because it has been forced to recognize its reality.当然，自我的力量也是这当中的一个因素，如果自我一开始并不是特别强，那么冲突就不太容易发展到这种程度。相反地，自我对于无法容忍的行为，就只是稍微感到惊讶而已，但是由于自我被迫承认它的实相，所以到最后还是会接受。
When the ego is a very rigid one however, it will not accept the reality of these rejected patterns so easily, and according to the nature of its rigidity it may restrict so many areas of activity that the inside action, or the inside impetus for expression, almost equally balances the ego force itself.可是如果自我相当固执僵化，就不会轻易接受这些遭拒模式的实相，而且由于它僵化的本质，可能会限制非常多的活动区域，导致那些想表达的内在行动或内在冲动，几乎完全抵销掉自我本身的力量。
As this point is reached the ego obviously becomes more disturbed. In very few cases however does the conflict reach this sort of proportion.A lack of communication between the ego and the inner self is obviously one of the main causes for such difficulties.当这种情况发生，自我显然更麻烦了，不过，冲突真的很少会发展到这种地步。自我跟内我间缺乏沟通，显然是这种问题的主因之一。
We will use tonight’s material as a basis for some other discussions.This evening’s session will be a brief one. We will hold Wednesday’s session as usual. I am interested here with a regeneration of energies at this time.I am indeed pleased that this was a quiet session, and I prefer that sessions this week be fairly brief.You can both use the rest, and regenerate your energies.You may need them.我们会将今晚的资料作为其他讨论的基础。今晚这节课会很简短，我们星期三的课照常举行，我现在对能量的再生非常感兴趣。我真的很高兴这是一堂安静的课，我倒希望这周的课都相当简短。你们可以利用剩下的时间，让自己的能量再生。你们或许需要它们。
(“Why?”(“为什么？”
(Jane smiled, her eyes still closed.)(珍笑了笑，仍闭着眼睛。)
I anticipated you would ask the question when I made the statement.我就料到我说了这句话，你一定会发问。
It was no coincidence that you both took today off.The freedom was excellent for you both, and I am simply giving you the opportunity to regenerate your energies.They are not at low ebb, but an excess of energy will serve you both well during your symposium.你们两个今天都有空，这并不是巧合。这样的自由对你们两个都相当好，我只是给你们能量再生的机会而已。它们并没在低潮期，但充沛的能量在你们研讨会期间会很有帮助。
We will hold Wednesdays session, however. I will now bid you a fond good evening, and my best wishes to you both.We have had quite intensive sessions for some time now, and I simply prefer that you are allowed a rest before your trip.我们星期三还会上课，希望你们有个美好的夜晚，也送上我最衷心的祝福给你们俩。目前我们已经非常密集上课一段时间了，你只希望你们旅行前能休息一下。
There is something here we will discuss at a later date, concerning the rhythms within these sessions, for they follow certain inner rhythms of activity, and I am always concerned that we use these to advantage.In some cases this entails longer and more intensive sessions. At other times it involves shorter sessions, particularly when I have some eye out for future events.My best regards now, and good evening.关于这些课的节奏问题，有个东西我们改天再讨论，因为这些课遵循着某些活动的特定内在节奏，我总是关心我们要如何运用才会有帮助。某些状况下需要更长、更密集的课，而另外一些状况下则需要较短的课，特别是当我需要对未来的事稍加留意的时候。送上我最衷心的祝福，晚安。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 9:44.Jane was again well dissociated.(9:44分结束。珍再度出离得非常好。
(I was tempted to try to obtain more information from Seth about immediately future events, following up his own hints, but did not do so because he called for a short session.Jane and I leave Elmira this Friday, July 9, to attend the Hypnosis Symposium at New York’s Oswego State University College on July 9, 10 and 11.)(在赛斯的暗示后，我非常想从他那边得到更多的讯息，以了解即将到来的事情，但我没这么做，因为他要求课要简短些。我和珍在这个星期五，7月9日那天会离开埃尔迈拉，去参加7月9日到11日的纽约奥斯威戈州立大学举办的催眠研讨会。)

SESSION 168 第168节　去奥斯威戈参加催眠会前的准备


JULY 7, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年7月7日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Lorraine Shafer and Bill and Peggy Gallagher were witnesses for the session.Lorraine has witnessed the 144th and 162nd sessions, the Gallaghers the 158th, 161st and 162nd sessions.(洛琳∙雪佛、比尔和蓓·加拉格是这节课的见证人。洛琳见证过第144和第162节，加拉格夫妇见证过第158、161和162节。
(The session was again held in our font room, with all of us sitting in a circle.Jane’s eyes remained closed for the whole session.She spoke while sitting down, and in a voice a bit stronger than usual. Her manner was quite active and much of the time she leaned forward, elbows on her knees.We anticipated a short session.Jane actually began speaking at 8:56.)(这节课又到我们前面的房间举行，大家围坐成一个圆圈。珍整节课都闭着眼睛，坐着说话，声音比平常宏亮些。她精神充沛，大部分时间身子都往前倾，双肘放在两膝上。我们预估这是简短的一节课，珍实际开始的时间是8:56分。)
May I now wish you all the heartiest of greetings.先向各位致上我最诚挚的问候。
I am pleased with our group. However this will be a short session. It is not because I grow weary. It is merely, again, that I must watch for your human limitations, and it will be best that you have all available energy at your beck and call later on for your trip.很高兴与大家一起，不过这是简短的一节课，倒不是因为我累了，只是我还是得注意到你们人类的限制，你们在到来的旅行中，最好随时都有足够的能量可用。
Whenever it is possible, I would suggest that our gentleman with the ulcer read our last sessions.Indeed, I believe that he has somewhat less of an ulcer now, although the degree is slight.I will also, if I may, congratulate the writer of the newspaper article, even though my own name was nowhere mentioned, for it goes without saying that I am indeed truly humble.我建议我们这位患有溃疡的男士，不管什么时候，只要条件许可，都要读一读我们前面几节课的资料。实际上，我相信他现在溃疡已经舒缓一些了，即便只是轻微的缓解。如果可以的话，我也要向报上文章的作者贺喜，虽然没提到我自己的名字，但不用多说，那是因为我实在很谦虚的关系。
(Jane’s voice was quite amused. The reference here is to the story Peggy Gallagher wrote for the Elmira Star-Gazette concerning Jane’s ESP book.It was excellently done, and was printed on July 6.)(珍的声调相当愉快，这边指的是蓓·加拉格对于珍那本ESP书，为《埃尔迈拉星报》报社写了一篇相关报导，写得相当好，已在7月6日刊登。)
We will not involve ourselves with any deep and weighty matters this evening, and you may slow me down, Joseph, when you prefer.You will find, incidentally, that within a fairly short time that the stock of which we have spoken will take a quite severe drop, after which it will slowly rise.今晚我们不会讨论到深奥、重大的问题，约瑟，如果你愿意的话，可以叫我放慢速度。顺带一提，你们会发现，在相当短的时间内，我们提过的那档股票会惨跌，之后再慢慢回升。
(See the 166th session, which John Bradley witnessed.Seth discussed John’s drug-company employer, G. D. Searle, during the session, and stated then that Searle stock was due to fall still more.As of today, July 7,1965, the stock closed at 55.)There will be three people in particular with whom you will be involved at your meeting, three men.One of these will be younger than the others.There is, I believe, a book which you will be asked to read, and there will be an appointment made.As you suspect, there was no coincidence involved when you chose your Dr. Instream. The affair will work out much better now, for in the past circumstances would have prevented not his interest, but his availability.There will indeed be a change that is only now beginning, in the daily ways of your lives, and you are both subconsciously preparing yourselves.(请见约翰·布莱德利见证过的第166节。赛斯在那节讨论到约翰的塞尔药品公司，他说塞尔的股票还会继续下跌。股价在今天，1965年7月7日，以55元作收。)值得一提的是，你们会面时会有3个人一起加入，是3位男士，其中一人比其他人年轻。我相信，有人会要求你们读一本书，也会约好碰面时间。如你们所怀疑的，你们选择了殷斯翠姆博士并非巧合，这件事情现在会好很多，因为在过去的环境下，会限制他的不是兴趣，而是他时间上不能配合。事实上，在你们的日常生活方式中，有一种变化现在正要开始，而你们两潜意识上也正在为此做准备。
The changes will not suddenly show themselves. This is merely a slow beginning, but the initial steps have been made, and the first and initial program has been completed.It is developing even better than I had hoped, and our own material will now begin to really develop, for we have enough background to enable us to cover subject matter that would have been impossible at an earlier time.But the first portion of our program has been completed in many other ways, having to do with the development of abilities, and with the development of that gestalt which we now form.这些变化将不会突然自己显现，这只是一种缓慢的开始，但初期的一些步骤已完成，最前面与开头的计划也做完了。它现在发展得甚至比我之前想像得还好，而我们自己的资料现在将开始真正发展，因为我们的背景足以让我们涵盖到早期不可能涵盖的主题 。但我们计划的初期部分已经透过其他许多方法完成了，这跟能力的发展有关，跟我们现在所形成的完形发展也相关。
I will suggest your break, and we will then at least briefly continue.I would here add however that those others in this room have also helped us in at least one phase of our program.Take your break, and we will then continue.我建议你们休息一下，然后我们很快会继续口述。不过我这里要补充一点，房间里其他的那些人，在我们计划的至少某一阶段也帮助过我们。休息一下，待会儿再继续。
(Break at 9:11.Jane reported that she was fairly well dissociated for a first delivery. Her voice had again acquired a touch of that peculiar accent, or brogue as I call it.She resumed in the same active manner, with a bit louder voice, at 9:19.)(9:11分休息。珍说第一阶段传述的出离状况相当好，声音又开始出现那种特殊的腔调，那种我称之为爱尔兰口音的腔调。她的精神依然充沛，音量比之前还大声了些，9:19分继续。)
It was from the beginning necessary not only that Ruburt’s abilities be developed, but also that Ruburt’s ego not be left in the dark.打从一开始，不仅鲁柏的能力必须发展，而且他的自我也不能被忽略。
His ego is indeed a healthy and vigorous one, but of a stubborn bent.For our purposes however this is actually excellent, for he is learning effectively to operate well in the physical environment while at the same time he is manipulating within that inner reality.他的自我的确很健康，且精力充足，但带有固执的倾向。不过就我们的目的来说，这样其实反而非常好，因为他正学习如何在物质环境中好好有效运作，同时又可以在内在实相之内操纵。
This is a difficult procedure, and in all cases and in all developments of this nature, there must be no attempt made to browbeat the ego, for in this way lies schizophrenia and disorientation. Ruburt’s abilities now are beginning to develop. We are sure of our foundation, and this was most necessary.未翻译
We can now begin shortly on other aspects of our program, the second.You are not unfamiliar with this program, Joseph, nor indeed is Ruburt. Your own inner knowledge is most adequate. It is Ruburt’s independent ego that is here a strong helpmate to us, for since we have taken it into consideration it allows us leeway while automatically keeping the whole personality in good balance.我们很快就可以开始我们计划的其他面向，也就是第二部分。约瑟，你并非不熟悉这个计划，事实上鲁柏也是，你自己的内在知识相当足够，鲁柏独立的自我在这里是我们强而有力的合作伙伴，因为从我们考虑到它的那时起，它就留给我们自由的空间，同时也自动维持好整个人格的平衡。
His abilities will indeed improve to a large degree. Your own strength and balance and inner abilities provide a large part of the psychological climate in which we can operate.You also act, in that you provide both added energy and help Ruburt to receive these communications.I have promised you that I would explain more clearly the nature both of your abilities and their part in our venture, and so I will.他的能力确实会有长足的进步，你自己的力量、平衡以及内在能力，营造了大部分的心理氛围，让我们可以在里面运作。你也采取了行动，因为你提供了额外的能量，也帮助鲁柏接收这些讯息。我已答应过你们，我会更清楚解释你们俩能力的本质，以及这些能力在我们冒险计划中扮演的角色，我一定会这么做。
I mentioned if you recall Peggy Gallagher last year; and the couple, I knew, had peculiar abilities that would help us here.如果你们回想一下应该记得，我去年就提过蓓·加拉格；我知道，这对夫妻有特殊能力可以帮我们这里的忙。
(See the 63rd session in Volume 2. Jane now smiled and turned toward Lorraine Shafer.Her eyes were still closed.)(见第二册第63节，珍这时面对着洛琳笑笑，双眼还是闭着。)
There will be not, not answers, but questions, shortly for our other guest.We shall provide the questions, and she shall provide the answers.She is asking the wrong questions, and the answers to them will not help her.马上会有一些问题，而不是答案，要给我们另一位访客。我们将提出这些问题，而她将提供答案。她在问一些错误的问题，而这些问题的答案对她没什么帮助。
We will also have more to say concerning the ways in which such a gestalt as this is composed.Again, I will let you take a break, for I am dealing relatively easily with you this evening, and then we will again continue.诸如这样子的完形如何组成，关于这方面我们还有很多东西要说。我又要让你们休息了，因为今晚我想轻轻松松跟你们相处就好，休息完后我们再继续。
(Break at 9:30.Jane was fairly well dissociated. Her voice had acquired a strong edge and had been fairly loud.Concerning her accent, which I have called a brogue, Lorraine and Bill Gallagher said they thought of it as a cultivated, well- educated accent acquired perhaps by one who had spent some time in Ireland, for instance, then moved on to live in another country—England, for instance.(9:30分休息。珍出离得很好，声音强而有力，相当宏亮。至于她的，也就是我所说的爱尔兰口音，洛琳和比尔说，他们认为那是一种经过培训、受过良好教育的腔调，或许这个人在爱尔兰待过一段时间后，又搬到别的国家，比如说英国，所学到的一种腔调。
(Lorraine was not consciously aware of the questions she has evidently been considering, according to Seth, although she said she is aware of the ideas she has about the Seth material.(对于赛斯提到洛琳显然在思考的那些问题，她在意识上并不了解，不过她说她意识到自己关于赛斯资料所具有的概念。
(Jane resumed in the same manner, leaning forward in her chair and with her eyes closed, at 9:40.)(珍以同样的方式，闭着眼睛，身体前倾，9:40分继续。)
I was not speaking of specific questions. I did not think that our guest had a list of questions from one to ten, which I was being asked to consider.我并不是在谈特定的问题，我认为我们的访客不会问一连串的问题，需要我去思考。
I was speaking of those questions which our guest asks herself, and these are the questions that she subconsciously would like me to answer.We will go into these matters again upon another occasion.我说的是我们访客问她自己的那些问题，这些是她潜意识上希望我回答的问题。这部分我们其他时间再来探讨。
There are a few other remarks that I would make concerning your journey.First of all, although I said earlier that Ruburt should not take a vacation, in many respects he will not be taking a vacation. He will have much to do.有关你们的旅行，我有其他几点要评论。首先，虽然我之前说过鲁柏不应该去度假，但从许多方面来看，他也不会去度假，他还有许多事要做。
(Here Jane smiled broadly, then sat quietly for a moment.)(珍这里咧嘴而笑，静静坐了一会儿。)
You can also be of aid, both of you, as far as your brother Bill is concerned, Joseph, and I suggest that you take steps to speak with him, and if necessary we will hold a session, if the circumstances are correct for our purposes.约瑟，就你的好朋友比尔来说，你们两个也都会受益，我建议你要实际采取行动跟他说，如果有需要的话，我们可以来上堂课，要是情况符合我们目标的话。
I see you also in a group of four. If there are five, the fifth will be a woman, and one man in this group will later be of benefit to us.I am pleased indeed that we have come so far in such a brief time.We have done well, particularly since the foundations for this sort of venture are so important.We can now go forward, fairly certain that Ruburt is strong enough to carry the burden.It is more than worth his while.我知道你也在4个小组当中，如果有5人的话，那第五个人会是个女士，而且这个群体中的某位男士，之后对我们也会很有帮助。我真的很高兴，我们在这么短的时间内居然可以达到这样的程度。我们已经做得很好了，尤其是因为这种冒险计划的基础非常重要。我们现在可以继续往前走，同时也相当确信鲁柏意志够坚决，足以承担这个重责大任。她这么做真的很值得。
I regret that you yourself have been so necessarily preoccupied of late, in preparation for your journey.And yet Joseph, this is also well worth your while.我很遗憾这几天你们必须全神贯注在旅行的准备上。不过，约瑟，你这样做真的也很值得。
I am taking the opportunity to speak concerning these matters, since I had already decided not to cover any complicated material for our session.I am also giving you more frequent breaks, since I am again aware that your energies will be needed.Our material in general however can now expand; and indeed, though not always, some extra dimensions and perspectives may be added to our sessions.从我决定我们这节课不谈复杂的资料后，我刚好趁机谈谈这些问题。我现在给你们休息次数也很多，因为我知道你们将需要能量。大体上来说，我们的资料现在已经可以扩展了；一些额外的面向和观点，或许真的可以加到我们的课里面，虽然并非总是如此。
I anticipate meeting the distinguished company.我预料会遇到一家卓越的公司(company编注：此词也有“合作伙伴”之意)。
There suggest your break, for I am not going to give you a preview. You have much to look forward to. By all means take your break.And you will see, Joseph, that I am not overworking your fingers.我建议你们这里休息一下，因为我不会给你们预告，你们还有很多东西值得期待，你们还是休息一下好了。约瑟，你应该看得出来，我不会把你的手操得太过头。
(Break at 9:55.Jane was well dissociated as usual.The discussion that followed during break was very lively.Janes voice had been loud last delivery, and active; and she resumed in the same manner, smiling often, at 10:05.)(9:55分休息。珍跟平时一样出离得非常好，休息时的那段讨论非常热烈。珍最后的口述声音响亮，非常活泼；珍以同样的方式口述，过程中不时微笑，10:05分继续。)
As always, I find myself amazed at your discussions, and I always seem to be lurking somewhere in their shadows.跟往常一样，我发现自己对你们的讨论感到很惊讶，而且我往往好像会潜藏在它们影子下的某个地方。
I am as you know a rather humorous gentleman.But someday we will have jokes that are not on me. You have not heard me laugh yet.It can however be arranged, according to the circumstances; for I do not laugh unless there is something worth laughing at, and we can arrange a good-natured harmless but amusing joke, at no one’s expense.如你所知，我是个相当幽默的绅士。不过有一天，我们会有一些不是发生在我身上的笑话。你们还没听过我的笑声，不过，可以视状况来安排看看；因为除非有一些值得笑的事，否则我不会笑，我们可以安排优质、无害的笑话，有趣却不伤人。
(Janes voice had been climbing the scale somewhat as far as volume went, and her rather fast delivery became even faster.Seth/Jane was highly amused while delivering the above paragraph.Strangely, as far as I recall no one had ever mentioned the possibility of Seth laughing, myself included.)(珍的音量简直大到要破表，原本就相当快的传述速度变得更快。赛斯-珍讲上面这段时乐不可支，奇怪的是，就我所知，从来没有任何人，包括我自己，曾提过赛斯会笑的可能性。)
It is only when I am not concerned with our weighty material that I can afford thinking in these directions.The second phase of our program will include definite expansions in the scope of our general material. It will show expansions in the manner in which we allow ourselves to operate.We will have greater leeway, and this is to the good.我只有在没关注我们重要的资料时，才会让自己思考这方面的事。我们第二阶段的计划，肯定会包括增加我们一般资料的广度，它会以我们自己可以运作的方式呈现出广度。我们会有较自由的空间，这是好现象。
To a large measure Ruburts confidence has been won. It was most necessary that we go slowly, particularly in the beginning, for if our foundation was not strong we would have never progressed.The whole venture would have been lost. There is no fate in these matters. Our venture was not fated to be. Our venture represents gestalts of energy coming together in quite natural manners.It was necessary however that we meet in such a manner without clashing.鲁柏已建立起非常大的信心，我们必须慢慢进行，特别是在一开始的时候，因为如果我们的基础不够扎实，就不会有进步，整个冒险计划会失败。这些事没有所谓的命定，我们的冒险计划并没有注定要如何，我们的冒险计划代表了能量完形以相当自然的方式，聚集在一起。无论如何，我们必须以这种不用彼此冲击的方式相聚。
Many sessions ago we spoke of transparency, and I said that true transparency was not the ability to see through, but to move through.我们很久以前就谈过穿透(transparency)的问题，我说真正的穿透并不是看穿(see through)，而是穿越(move through)。
(See the 12th session in Volume 1.)(见第一册第12节。)
Energy moves through all fields and all systems.You are enabling the energy which is yourself to realize its existence within other systems; and speaking merely in terms of energy and action, we are here involved with transparent motion as energy moves from one system to another.能量可以穿越所有场域和所有系统，你们可以让你们自己的能量，了解它在其他系统之内的存在；如果只就能量和行动来说，当能量从一个系统移动到另一个系统，我们就涉及了穿透的动作。
This is not done at all times, but the ego is not usually aware either of the motion nor of the other systems involved.Through your own abilities, and partially through circumstances that happen to be favorable, you are able with my help, to some degree, to add this experience of mobility to your natures and transfer the knowledge to the conscious ego.这种现象不是时时刻刻都在发生，自我并不是常常都会意识到这样的动作，也不会意识到其他相关的系统。透过你们自己的能力，特别是透过恰巧有利的环境，你们或多或少可以在我的帮助下，将这种移动经验加入你们的本质中，并将讯息转达给有意识的自我。
We will later be concerned more deeply with this transparent mobility, for it operates within all systems.And without it your own physical system would not exist.When the nature and behavior of energy as it is seen in action is understood, and when it is applied to the mobility of the human personality, then such sessions as ours will be taken for granted, though this I admit will take a while.后面我们会更深入关注这种穿透性的移动，因为它会在所有系统之内运作。没有了它，你们自己的物质系统就不会存在。一旦了解能量在行动内的本质与作用，而且也将能量的本质与作用应用在人类人格的移动后，像我们这样的课，才会被视为理所当然，虽然我承认这得花一点时间。
I will now let you take a break, or as you prefer you may close the session.我现就让你们休息一下，或者你们愿意的话，也可以结束这节课。
(“Well close it then.”(“我们就结束了。”
(Seth/Jane smiled.)(赛斯-珍微笑着。)
I will then meet with you shortly. My best regards and heartiest good wishes to you all.我很快就会再跟你们碰面，送上我最深、最衷心的祝福给各位。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:20.Jane had been well dissociated as usual. A lively discussion now developed among us as to the nature and possible origin of the brogue or accent Jane had displayed during most of the session.(10:20分结束。珍跟平时一样出离得非常好，她在这节课的大部分时间都出现了爱尔兰口音，我们也针对这个腔调的性质和可能的来源热烈讨论。
(The discussion was sparked because of Seth/Janes pronunciation of the words “fate” and “stock” in particular, and others similar.Bill and Lorraine did not believe the accent to be Irish, even considering Jane’s early years in an Irish neighborhood and her association with Irish priests.(由于赛斯-珍特别在讲到“命定”和“股票”这几个字，以及其他类似的字时，发音很不一样，因此引发我们的讨论。比尔和洛琳虽然考量到童年住在爱尔兰社区，与爱尔兰神父也有连结，但他们并不认为这是爱尔兰人的口音。
(Bill Gallagher knows something about languages. He made so many good points that I asked him to write them down for the record.He had just begun when Seth came through again, loud and clear.Janes voice was strong but not close to matching the rather spectacular 158th session, for example.It was obvious that she and Seth enjoyed the proceedings immensely.She spoke rapidly and used many gestures, but her eyes remained closed throughout.Resume at 10:44.)(比尔对于语言稍有研究，提出了很多不错的观点，所以我就拜托他写下来做为记录。不过正当他才开始要写，赛斯再度穿透过来，声音响亮而清晰。珍的声音铿锵有力，但还不至于像第158节那么特别，她和赛斯显然都很喜欢这样的过程。她讲话很快，也使用很多手势，不过眼睛一直都闭着。10:44分继续。)
I am not going to hold you up. However, I see that our group will have its Jesuit member.我不是要阻拦你们，不过我知道我们的群体将会有耶稣会信徒。
(Bill Gallagher’s head went back in a soundless laugh.)(比尔回过头来，静静笑着。)
I shall be discussed from all angles, and scrutinized, and like the monks in the Middle Ages we will wonder if I can fit on the head of a pin, but I will not get stuck.I am indeed flattered, and as Ruburt mentioned a change of perspective is good.其他人会从各种角度仔细讨论我，而且就像中世纪的修道士一样，我们将会好奇我能不能站在针头上，不过我是不会被困住的。我真的感到很荣幸，而且就如鲁柏所言，改变一下观点是好事。
The inquiring mind of our Jesuit member is indeed refreshing, and the very inquiry does him good.He hit upon several excellent points, and he will discover more.I enjoy this Jesuit; and for Ruburt’s benefit I will indeed tell you that the likeness that you have painted of me, Joseph, is excellent.我们的耶稣会信徒爱追根究底的精神的确令人耳目一新，这对他自己也很有帮助。他提出了几个非常棒的观点，而且还继续会有新发现。我喜欢这个耶稣会信徒；为了鲁柏好，约瑟，我真的要告诉你，你把我的画像画得像极了。
(Her eyes still closed, Jane pointed to a portrait I had just hung.It was of a short heavyset bald man, beckoning to the viewer to come closer. I had been working on it for some weeks.(她眼睛仍然闭着，手指着我刚吊上去的一幅画像。那是一个矮矮壮壮的秃头男，招呼看画者再靠近一点，我连续画了好几个礼拜才完成。
(The idea for it had come to me one day and I had begun work on it at once.In view of some rather odd sensations it had engendered within me I had thought it might refer to Seth, or myself in a previous life.Jane had admired it at once, even from the first drawing, and insisted all along that it pictured Seth.(那是有一天我突然有个点子想画张画像，于是就马上动手开始画。那时我心里产生了一些相当古怪的感觉，认为它可能与赛斯有关，或与我某个前世有关。珍甚至从我第一次画这张图时，就立刻大加赞赏，一直坚持认为那就是赛斯没错。
(It is of interest here to note that in the 134th session Seth also announced that I had painted a likeness of him.This painting shows a much younger blond man, bearing no resemblance to the other portrait.I have not asked Seth about the discrepancy yet of course, but Jane feels they both represent different facets of the Seth entity or personality.)(在这里值得一提的是，赛斯在134节中也说，我画了一幅他的画像。那幅画像是一位年轻许多的秃头男，与另外那幅并不像。我当然还没跟赛斯问为什么两幅画不一样，不过珍觉得这两幅画代表了赛斯的存有或人格的不同相貌。)
I knew that Ruburt would recognize me, and the word fate is pronounced fate.我就知道鲁柏认得我，而命定这两个字念成命定。
(This play upon words, in Seth/Janes peculiar accent, brought forth laughter from the group.)(赛斯-珍用他特有的腔调开玩笑念了这些字，引来哄堂大笑。)
I will now, with my true dignity, bring this fateful session to a close.I would continue but for my innate good manners.I will at another occasion give our Jesuit some rather fateful measures to contemplate, and perhaps we will ask him how many ulcers can sit on the head of a pin. My best and most sincere wishes to you all. I will sign myself fatefully yours.我要以最庄严的态度，结束这命定的一节课，要不是我天生的好规矩，就会继续下去。我会另外找机会，提供我们耶稣会信徒一些可决定命运的思考方法，或许我们会问他有多少溃疡可以坐在针头上。送上我最深最衷心的祝福给各位，在结尾我会签命定者敬上(译注：赛斯这里拿命定[fate]开玩笑，将平常书信结尾faithfully yours 改成了fatefully yours)。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:55.Jane was well dissociated. She took quite a few moments to open her eyes.
