She said a word Bill had used had started her off again, to her own surprise.Bill said Seth used the Jesuit simile to make his point very well.He also said his ulcer had been much improved lately; it had bothered him a little earlier today, for instance, but hardly at all this evening.(10:55分结束。珍出离得很好，她花了些时间才把眼睛打开，她说，比尔刚才用的一个词又让她再度出去了，这让她很讶异。比尔说，赛斯运用了耶稣会信徒的譬喻将他的观点表达得非常清楚。他也说溃疡最近好多了；举例来说，他今天稍早虽然还有点不舒服，但今晚几乎就好了。
(Jane was keenly aware of Seth’s emotions during the above delivery she said, and as always it made the delivery most enjoyable.When this involvement takes place, she feels reserves of energy sweeping her along, welling up from Seth, even when she might feel tired to begin with.)(珍说，在上面这一段口述里，她敏锐觉察到赛斯的情绪，这使她跟平时一样觉得这段口述愉快极了。即使在刚开始时她或许觉得疲惫，一旦全神贯注投入，就感到能量库存从赛斯那边源源而出，席卷着她往前走。)
(My sensation of Friday night, July 9,1965.(1965年7月9日 星期五晚上，我的感觉。
(Sometime during the night while sleeping in Johnson Hall, a residence hall at Oswego State University College, I was awakened by some noisy students in a nearby hall.It was raining and I lay in a pleasant drowsy state.(我在奥斯威戈州立大学宿舍詹森楼过夜那天晚上，有一度被隔壁楼一些吵闹的学生吵醒。那是个下雨天，我舒服地躺在床上昏昏欲睡。
(I then began to feel an enlargement in both of my hands, and in the left side of my face as it lay upon the pillow. The sensation progressed to a remarkable degree, lasted for well over five minutes by my estimation, and was unmistakable.The feeling grew until each of my fingers felt themselves to be several inches in diameter.I could literally feel or sense their greatly-enlarged diameters.(之后，我觉得双手以及躺在枕头上的左脸开始变大，这种感觉后来变得非常明显，据我估计维持5分钟以上，确实没错。这种感觉持续，直到我每根手指头自己都觉得直径有好几寸长为止。我真的可以感觉到它们大幅扩增的直径。
(At the same time, I would get the feeling that the fingers of each hand were united or combined into thick clublike paws, as though I was wearing great baseball gloves.The two sensations were sometimes apparent together. Either or both were very pleasant after the strangeness disappeared and I lay quietly and deliberately did my best to analyze and remember each sensation.The sensation finally dwindled slowly away.(在这同时，我觉得每只手的五根手指头都连在一起，变成一排厚实的爪子，就像戴上一只大棒球手套。这两种感觉有时候同时都很明显，当奇怪的感觉消失后，就觉得其中一种或这两种感觉都很舒服，我安静地躺着，尽我所能仔细分析跟记住每一个感觉。后来这些感觉就慢慢变小，最后消失了。
(I recalled, also, that as I was drifting off to sleep upon retiring that evening, I had been aware of a slight sensation of tingling or thrilling in my hands.This mild sensation has been a rather standard one for me during psychological time, when presumably I was in a light state of dissociation.This was by far the most pronounced feeling of enlargement that I have experienced, and is separate from the other strong bodily sensations of thrilling, or the feeling of sound as Seth describes it, that I have known upon a few occasions.(我也回想到，那天晚上我在这些感觉消失后，慢慢睡着之际，觉得双手有点震颤或发抖。这种微微的颤抖是我做心理时间练习时一种非常典型的感觉，这时候我应该是在轻度的出离状态。这显然是我经验过最强烈的一次膨胀感觉，而且不同于身体其他强烈的颤抖感觉，也不同于赛斯形容过的声音感觉，因为我体验过几次声音感觉，知道两者间的差异。
(For data on my other sensations and some visions, see the following sessions: 22, 24, 26, 27, 65, 145, 146, 163.These would not include, either, the “fat hands " sensations that Jane and I experienced during sessions.)(有关我其他感觉和视觉的资料，可参阅下列章节：第22、24、26、27、65、145、146和163节。这些并没涵盖我和珍在课堂上经验过的“臃肿双手”感觉。)

SESSION 169 第169节　与殷斯翠姆博士对话


JULY 12, 1965 1:37 PM MONDAY UNSCHEDULED1965年7月12日 星期一 晚上1:37计划外
(Jane and I attended the Hypnosis Symposium at Oswego State University College at Oswego, NY, on Friday evening, July 9th, and on Saturday and Sunday, July 10 and 11, at the invitation of Dr. Instream, co-director.I had written to Dr. Instream on June 1,1965 and sent him sessions 138, 141, 142, 149, 153 and 154, plus lists of the inner senses and the basic laws of the inner universe as defined by Seth. [Jane calls the good doctor Instream in The Seth Material, ©1970.](我和珍在共同督导殷斯翠姆博士的邀请下，参加了在纽约奥斯威戈州立大学举办的催眠研讨会，会期从7月9日星期五晚上到7月11日星期天。我在1965年6月1日就写信给殷斯翠姆博士，送他第138、141、142、149、153和154节课的资料，外加由赛斯所界定的内在感官及内在宇宙基本法则的目录清单。[珍在1970年出版的《灵界的讯息》里，称呼这好博士为殷博士]。
(We had no real opportunity to talk with Dr. Instream until Sunday evening at his home, after the symposium was over.During our discussion Dr. Instream revealed that he had mailed the sessions listed above to his friend Dr. Gardner Murphy, at the Menninger Clinic in Topeka, Kansas, and asked for his opinion.Jane and I answered Dr. Instreams questions as well as we could, and made an appointment to attend his Monday morning class at the college.This was to be followed by lunch with him before we left to visit my brother Bill in Rochester.(我们一直到研讨会结束后的星期天晚上，才真正有机会与他在他家里交谈。在我们的讨论中，殷斯翠姆博士揭露说，他早就将上述资料寄给在堪萨斯州托皮卡市[Topeka]门尼格[Menninger]诊所执业的朋友加德纳∙墨菲[Dr.Gardner Murphy]博士，并征求他的意见。我和珍都尽我们所能回答了殷斯翠姆博士的问题，约好星期一早上去参加他大学里的课。如此一来，我们能在上课后与他共进午餐，之后再启程前往罗彻斯特[Rochester]探访我的弟弟比尔。
(To digress a moment: As predicted by Seth in the 168th session of July 7, Jane and I did find ourselves involved with three men in particular, one of whom is younger, at the symposium.Two of these men are physicians in their fifties, with whom we became rather well acquainted at lunches, etc., and exchanged addresses.The third man is a psychology instructor at the college, perhaps in his late thirties. On Saturday evening he leafed through some of the Seth material briefly, then pronounced it the work of a clever schizophrenic.This upset Jane briefly but she recovered well.During our Sunday evening visit, Dr. Instream demolished the young psychologist’s diagnosis rather easily.(这里先打个岔：就如赛斯在7月7日168节中预言的一样，我和珍的确发现我们在研讨会中特别认识3位男士，其中一位比较年轻。当中有两位是50来岁的内科医师，在之前几次的午餐等活动中，已跟我们很熟悉，也交换过地址。第三位则是大学的心理学讲师，大概接近40岁，星期六晚上他很快翻了一下部分的赛斯资料后，就断言说这是一个聪明的精神分裂患者的作品。这种说法马上令珍大为光火，但后来就心平气和。在我们星期日晚上拜访殷斯翠姆博士时，他三两下就轻易推翻了这位年轻心理学家的判断。
(Seth also said in the 168th session that we would make an appointment, as we obviously did to see Dr. Instream privately.Over coffee Monday, Dr. Instream asked if we had read F.W.H. Myers’ Human Personality.Seth had said we would be asked to read a book, but Dr. Instream did not insist that we read this work.We also bought two books by Dr. Instream at the college bookstore Monday noon.(赛斯在第168节里也说我们会跟人家有约，显然我们真的跟殷斯翠姆博士约定私下去拜访他。在星期一喝咖啡时，殷斯翠姆博士问我们是否读过麦尔斯[F.W.H.Myers]的《人类人格》[Human Personality]这本书。赛斯曾说过，有人会要求我们念一本书，不过殷斯翠姆博士并没有坚持要我们念这本书。我们星期一中午也在大学书店里买了两本殷斯翠姆博士写的书。
(We lunched with Dr. Instream at Howard Johnson’s, adjacent to the campus.This interlude was longer than we had anticipated, and after the talk had dealt with matters psychic for some little time Jane announced that she felt uneasy.She thought Seth could give a session. Dr. Instream then suggested that we go to his office where it would be private and quiet.(我们跟殷斯翠姆博士在校园旁边的霍华德∙约翰逊[Howard Johnson’s]餐厅一起吃午餐。这顿饭吃得比我们预期的久，在话题谈论到通灵问题一阵子之后，珍表示她觉得心神不太安稳。她认为赛斯可以上节课，于是殷斯翠姆博士就提议到他的办公室，那里较私密也较安静。
(This is but the second session we have held outside of Elmira, the other being the 89th, of September 19,1964, held at my brother’s home in Rochester, NY, before three witnesses.Jane was now a little concerned at having a session away from home and in daylight. At the same time she had wanted to hold a session for Dr. Instream, feeling this would explain more about the sessions than any other method could.(这是我们第二次在埃尔迈拉以外的地方上课，第一次是1964年4月19日在纽约罗彻斯特我弟弟家上第89节课，当时有3个见证人。珍这时有点介意在家里以外上课，而且是在大白天，但她同时又想为殷斯翠姆博士上一堂课，因为她觉得这样的方式最能为赛斯提供详细的说明。
(Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her eyes remained closed for the entire session. Her voice was stronger than normal, and echoed somewhat in the crowded office. At times it became louder, but never approached the volume of the 158th session, for example.Her pace was rather fast, and she used many gestures while speaking as Seth.I had to ask Seth to slow down several times during the first part of the session.(珍坐下来，闭着眼睛开始讲话，整节课都闭着眼睛，声音比平常还有力，在狭小的办公室里有点回音，有时候会比较大声，但不会达到像158节中那么大的音量。她以赛斯身分讲话时节奏相当快，使用了很多手势。在这节课的第一部分，我好几次都得拜托赛斯放慢速度。
(This first part of the session is verbatim as usual, until the interchange between Seth and Dr. Instream began at 1:59.Here the pace began to speed up as the two talked back and forth, and in the interests of spontaneity, and because this was a new development in the sessions, I made no attempt to slow Seth down, nor to record every word Seth or Dr. Instream spoke.(本节课的第一部分跟平时一样逐字记录，一直到1:59分赛斯与殷斯翠姆博士对话时才有所变动。这时整个节奏开始加快，因为他们两个一来一往，而且都是自发性的，由于这是课堂上的一个新发展，所以我没打算让赛斯减速，也不想记下赛斯或殷斯翠姆博士所讲的每个字。
(Instead I took down the gist of their conversation, key words and phrases, and thus captured most of what they said.No major topics of conversation, for instance, were lost. Jane and I also left with Dr. Instream at his home on Sunday evening, copies of sessions 150, 151, 158, 160, 162, 164 and 165.)(我记下他们的对话要点、关键字及片语，因此能够掌握住他们所说的大部分内容，不会遗漏重要的对话主题。星期日晚上，我和珍也将150、151、158、160、162、164和165节课资料的复本，留给殷斯翠姆博士。)
I would like to give my greetings to Doctor Instream.我要向殷斯翠姆博士致上我的问候。
We are working here indeed with human limitations.However, within the range of human limitations there is indeed much that can be done.我们在这里上课真的是在挑战人类的极限。不过，在人类极限的范围内，倒是还有很多事可以做。
My field is indeed education, and my particular interest is that these abilities of human personality be understood and investigated.For these are not, dear Doctor, these are not sudden unnatural occurrences.事实上我的领域是在教育方面，而我特别感兴趣的是，让大家了解和探索人类人格的这些能力。因为这些东西并不是，我亲爱的博士，这些东西并不是无缘无故突然发生。
We are dealing with inherent abilities of human personality, whether or not the personality is focused within physical matter, but I am indeed aware of the difficulties which shall be encountered.I appreciate your interest and concern.I have some difficulties with Ruburt’s own rather stubborn attitude at times; but we must also take this into consideration, and so we shall.我们正在探讨人类人格天生固有的各种能力，不管这个人格是否聚焦于物质，我确实了解即将面临的困难。感谢你们的爱好与关心，鲁柏那相当固执的态度，有时让我不太好搞定；但我们也必须将这一点纳入考虑，而我们真的也会如此。
I will indeed see what experiments can be made, working within the limitations that are, unfortunately, what we now have to deal with.At a future regular session, I will endeavor in a more specific manner to discuss what can be done here, and what cannot be done.We can do much, much we cannot do.But since we do understand both the potentialities and the limitations, then we can indeed make the best of what we have.我确实会看看在限制内有哪些实验可以做，很遗憾地，我们现在必须面对的就是在这些限制内工作。在未来某一节定期课，我会努力以更具体的方式，讨论在这里什么可以做，什么不可以做。我们可以做的有很多，不能做的也很多。不过，因为我们对潜能与限制都了解得一清二楚，所以我们真的可以将我们拥有的部分发挥到极致。
I have said this often, but I meet you for the first time: I am indeed no misty-eyed ghostly spirit, materializing in the middle of the night. I am simply an intelligent personality no longer bound by your physical laws.Nevertheless these are limitations, when I must accept these physical laws in order to prove to pompous nincompoops that what we, you and I, know exist does in fact exist.下面这句话我常说，不过这是我第一次见到你：我确实不是个泪眼朦胧的鬼魂，会在三更半夜出现，我只是一个不再受限于你们物质定律的聪明人格。为了要向自命不凡的傻瓜证明我们，包括了我和你们，所知道的存在实际上真的存在，这时我就必须接受这些物质定律。
I will seriously endeavor to do what I can do, considering our circumstances.We need have no worries concerning the personality with whom I work, since there is by now some sort of a rapport that will work for us. My cooperation can be counted upon.It goes without saying that all of this cannot happen overnight, but we shall begin.由于考量到我们的环境，我会认真努力做可以做的。对于和我一起做事的人格，我们不用担心，因为现在我们彼此建立了某种和谐关系，这对我们很有帮助，我的合作值得信赖。所有这些当然并非一蹴而就，但我们就要开始。
I am very happy that I have been allowed to speak directly to you. There is in our material, if you will forgive my lack of humility, some hints and some specific remarks that will show the direction in which we can operate.I will be more than happy to work for our common goal when I am dealing with a personality who is not stupid, who is open-minded.我很高兴我可以获准直接跟你们讲话，如果你愿意谅解我不懂谦卑的话，那么在我们的资料中，有一些暗示、一些谈话会指出我们可以遵行的方向。每当我跟一个不愚蠢且心灵开放的人格打交道，一起为我们共同的目标而努力，都会感到快乐无比。
For Ruburt’s and Josephs sakes, I stayed well within the bounds of propriety.I do not overtly speak out against men who have no imagination, and little concept of any reality but their own.But if we work together, I will reserve for myself the privilege of saying to them what I choose.Otherwise I shall work well within the bounds of propriety.But if they will deal with me, so shall I deal with them.为了鲁柏和约瑟，我恪守分寸不会逾越规矩。对于那些没有想像力、以及除了自己以外对任何实相都没概念的人，我不会公然跟他们唱反调。可是如果我们一起工作，我就会保留我自己的权利，跟他们说出我所选择的是什么。要不然，我就会谨守分寸。可是如果他们要跟我打交道，那我也会跟他们打交道。
I will not keep you. Like myself, you are a busy man.But I will see what can be done, and we shall work along those lines, taking into consideration the potential, and quite human, limitations.我不想再耽误你，你跟我一样都是大忙人。我会再看看有什么可以做，我们会在考量可能的、也很人性化的限制之下，往这些方面努力。
I now bid you a most fond good afternoon, and thank all for the opportunity for this small discussion.I have endeavored to keep the voice somewhat under control because of the proximity of other offices.My heartiest regards to all.祝你们有个快乐的午后时光，也谢谢各位提供这次简短讨论的机会。由于这间办公室紧邻着其他办公室，所以我已经努力控制音量。送上我最衷心的祝福给各位。
(End at 1:50.Jane had been fairly well dissociated, she said. Her eyes had been closed, her voice good but nothing exceptional.(1:50分结束。珍说，她出离得非常好，眼睛一直都闭着，声音也不错，没有什么特别。
(Dr. Instream asked Jane how much of the delivery she could remember, and Jane replied that she retained a generalized memory of what had been said.Dr. Instream said the voice effect was somewhat unusual, and questioned us about Jane showing fatigue afterwards.We told him that Jane had little if any fatigue after such displays, no matter how long they might last, and referred him to the 158th session as an example.This session was among those I had left with him Sunday evening.(殷斯翠姆博士问珍能记得多少传述内容，她回答说对于自己所讲的只能大致上记得。殷斯翠姆博士说她的声音效果有点不寻常，他也跟我们问到珍在口述后是否略显疲惫的问题。我们告诉他，不管上课持续有多长，珍在这样子的口述后，即使有任何的疲倦也都只是一点点而已，我们举第158节为例，请他看资料。该节资料是星期天晚上我留给他的资料当中的一部分。
(Dr. Instream said that Jane was in a light trance during her delivery, and that automatic speech was involved.Our conversation then turned to the matter of scientific proof and related subjects. This was also one of the subjects we had discussed at lunch, leading of course to Seth’s subject matter in the delivery just concluded.(殷斯翠姆博士说，珍口述时是处于轻度出神状态，而且出现自动讲话的现象。接着我们的对话就转到科学证明的问题以及一些相关主题，这也是我们午餐时讨论的主题之一，当然就是因为午餐时的讨论，才把我们引导到赛斯现在刚结束的这段口述。
(Up until this point I had made a verbatim record as usual, and had thought the little session in Dr. Instreams office ended.An exchange now developed however, that was new to us in the sessions, involving Jane, Seth, Dr. Instream and myself.The pace quickened to some degree, and as stated before I made no effort to interfere with the spontaneity of the session.Unless otherwise noted what follows is the exchange between Dr. Instream and Seth only, and reports the gist of their conversation as taken from the notes and quotes I made on the spot. Nothing is included here which depends on my memory alone.(到目前为止，我都跟平常一样逐字记录，认为在殷斯翠姆博士办公室举行的这节短课就此结束。不过这时出现了对话的情形，对象包括珍、赛斯、殷斯翠姆博士和我自己，这种课中的对话对我们而言还是新鲜事。对话的速度节奏有点快，就如前面所说，我不想打断上课时的自发性。除非另有注记，下面的内容只是殷斯翠姆博士和赛斯之间的对话，同时也列出对话的要点，这些都是来自我当场记录或引述的内容，单是留在我记忆中的东西不会在这边呈现。
(Times noted indicate when Jane was in trance and when she came out of the state.When she remained in trance while Dr. Instream was speaking she listened to him intently, sitting with her eyes closed and her head cocked forward.Her voice was fairly strong as before, and very briefly at times it hit a stronger volume.She resumed as Seth at 1:59.)(下面列出的时间是珍出神及回神的时间。在出神状态中，殷斯翠姆博士讲话时她会抬着头，闭着眼睛，很专心听。她的声音就跟平时一样相当有力，有时候还会瞬间瀑出更大的音量。1:59分，她以赛斯身分继续口述。)
I will not keep us.Nevertheless spontaneity must be allowed for primarily.Then the sort of evidence with which you are concerned, Doctor, can be obtained.However, if we are overly concerned for effects then the spontaneity disappears. The ego comes in and we are lost....我不会耽误我们的时间。然而，最重要是必须让自发性出来。博士，你所关注的那种证据可以得到。但是，假如我们太过关注效果，那自发性就会消失，自我会进来，我们会迷失……
([Dr. Instream:] “Exactly... we must proceed carefully, without pushing....”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“的确如此……我们得小心进行，不能强求……。”)
Correct. For that will give us our effects.正确，因为这样一来就会为我们带来效果。
([Dr. Instream:] “I’m out of my depth here, Seth... spontaneity is important....”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“这里对我来讲太深奥了，赛斯……自发性很重要……。”)
It is our doorway... If objects come through, if evidence comes through, it comes through that doorway.它是我们的门路……如果目标出现了，如果证据出现了，那它就会穿越那个入口。
([Dr. Instream:] “Yes... the trouble is our human limitations... our methodology is important to us here... if we are to get others to listen to us....”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“没错……问题是我们人类的限制……我们的方法论在这里对我们很重要……如果我们要其他人来听我们……。”)
We will in a regular session take this into consideration... it would be of great benefit if you and others would understand that these limitations exist only because you accept them.我们会在某一节定期课里，将这部分纳入考虑……对你和其他人来说，如果能了悟到这些限制之所以能存在，纯粹都是因为你们接受它们的缘故，那将有非常大的帮助。
([Dr. Instream:] “Yes....”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“对……”)
I will not endeavor to go into this in any detail at this time. We will work within these limitations and see what we can do.The human is not innately limited... the waking state, as I have said often, is as much a trance state as any other state. Here we merely switch the focus of attention to other channels.All that is required is that we switch the attention... consider merely that all types of awareness are trance states... consciousness is the direction in which the self looks.此时我不会再详细讨论这个部分，我会在这些限制之下进行，看看我们能做些什么。人类并不是天生就受到限制……就像我常说的，醒时状态就跟其他任何状态一样，都是在出神状态中，我们在这里只是把注意力焦点切换到其他频道而已。需要的只是我们切换注意力……只要知道所有各类的觉察都是出神状态即可……意识就是自己看出去的方向。
(At 2:03 Jane came out of the trance state and opened her eyes.A discussion followed involving the sessions in general, the field of psychic investigation, proof, etc. Jane went back into trance and resumed as Seth at 2:25.)(2:03分珍回过神来，睁开了眼睛。接着我们讨论到一些问题，包括赛斯课的一般状况，通灵研究的领域与证据等等。2:25分，珍又回到出神状态，并以赛斯身分继续。)
Irregardless of our particular interests, I look forward to long conversations with you on less formal topics... like yourself, I am independent. We have many fields of common interests... the personality should always be considered in an elemental way as patterns of action.It is never stable. When you attempt to tamper with various levels you change it.When you crack an egg to discover what is inside you ruin the egg.There are other ways to get inside the egg, and they are not too difficult to do... you have the sort of mind, Dr. Instream, that will be of great benefit to us here.We do not need a hammer to crack the eggshell.I am an egghead, but I do not need a hammer to be cracked.先撇开我们特殊的兴趣不管，我期望与你有长时间的对话，来谈谈没那么严肃的话题……我和你一样，也是独立的，我们有许多共同的兴趣领域……基本上，人格永远应该被视为行动的模式，它从来就不是固定不变的。如果你想跟它做各种不同程度的调节，那你就改变了它。当你打破一颗蛋(eggshell)，看看里面有什么东西，等于是把它毁了。想看看蛋中乾坤，还有许多其他方法，而且不会太难……缺我是个有知识的人(egghead)，但不需要拿铁槌来把我敲破。(译注：此处赛斯使用egghead的双关语，该字表面看来好像是蛋的脑袋，但真正的英文意思是指有知识的人或理论家，是非正式或略带轻蔑口吻的用法。)
(Jane ended this delivery on a strong note of humor, and in a good voice. She remained in trance.(珍以非常幽默的口吻与不错的声音结束这段口述，她仍然在出神状态中。
([Dr. Instream:] “ We’ll get insight on this...I’m human, I need to learn... we need proof.’’)(殷斯翠姆博士：“这一部分我们会去了解……我是人，我需要学习……我们需要证据。”)
Your attitude may enable us to get some proofs. But others who say this does not exist will never get proof.All of our evidence will not be of a nebulous sort. If we succeed, some of it will be definite.你的态度或许可以使我们得到一些证据，但其他认为这个不存在的人，就永远不会得到证据。我们所有的证据都不会含糊不清，如果我们成功，那么其中一部分就会很明确。
([Dr. Instream:] “Some evidence we already have is difficult to deny... we must conduct a methodical investigation of these things.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“我们已经获得一些难以否认的证据……我们必须对这些事情做有系统的调查。”)
This is one of the main reasons why I have not tended toward the seance atmosphere, why I have avoided blatant superstitious displays... we have some factors that will work for us, and we will have more.我之所以不太愿意营造降神会的氛围，而且避开公然的迷信表演，其主要原因之一就在于此……我们有一些对我们有利的因素，未来还会更多。
([Dr. Instream:] “I’m in over my depth... need time to consider what we can do, what your ideas are.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“这对我来讲太深奥了……需要时间来思考我们能做什么、你的想法是什么。”)
We will make definite efforts in that direction. There will be a time lag while I build up Ruburt’s acceptability in this direction, but I anticipate no difficulty.My boundaries are different than yours...we will attempt to discover what we can.我们确实会在这方面努力，我正在建立鲁柏对这方面的接受度，因此会有一些时间上的落差，但我预测应该没什么困难。我的界限跟你们的不一样……我们会设法发现我们能做的是什么。
(Jane came out of her trance at 2:32, discussed her voice effects during sessions briefly with Dr. Instream, then went back into trance as Seth at 2:33.)(2:32分，珍回神过来，和殷斯翠姆博士简短讨论她口述时的声音效果，2:33分，珍又回到出神状态成为赛斯。)
In the past I saw no reason to dominate these sessions with any particular effects. That was not my main concern.I will however at our sessions try to manage a greater variety of effects.The particular voice effect, for example:This is nothing difficult, it proves nothing. What would it prove?过去我看不出有什么理由必须要以任何特定效果来掌控这些课，那并不是我最关注的。不过，在我们的课中，我会尝试广泛用各种不同的效果。举例来说，像这种特殊的声音效果；这不是什么困难的事，根本不能证明什么，它能证明什么？
(Briefly, Jane’s voice became stronger.(珍的声音短暂地变得比较有力。
([Dr. Instream:] “You’re quite right.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“你说得很对。”)
For my own enjoyment I use such tricks at times. Such effects have served to increase the confidence of Ruburt...I am not a pompous ass.The voice can occur at any time, but it is hardly the kind of evidence with which, Doctor, you are concerned.我有时候会耍个这样的把戏自娱，这样的效果可以增加鲁柏的信心……我不是一个自负的白痴。这种声音随时都会出现，博士，但几乎不是你所关注的那种证据。
(Jane came out of her trance at 2:35.Since we do not have a phone we gave Dr. Instream the number of our neighbor across the hall, Leonard Yaudes.(珍2:35分回神。因为我们没有电话，所以就把大厅对面邻居李奥纳·奥德斯[Leonard Yaudes]的电话号码留给殷斯翠姆博士。
(Dr. Instream talked of bringing a couple of others into the sessions but did not mention them to us by name.He stressed that it was best to be very careful about inviting others to participate.Also he mentioned that he would like an example of voice effects on tape, as long as we had a recorder, and we discussed mailing the tapes to him from Elmira, Jane then went back into trance as Seth again at 2:48.)(殷斯翠姆博士提到他想带几个人来上这个课，但没有跟我们说他们的名字，他强调，要带其他人来参加最好多加小心。他还提到，只要我们有录音机，他也想要一段声音效果的录音样本，因此我们接着讨论从埃尔迈拉寄带子给他的事情。2:48分，珍回到出神状态再度成为赛斯。)
We will, as a gesture of good will, see that you will have a voice display on tape. I realize that this is but a gesture on my part.Then we will consider more serious possibilities, as far as evidence is concerned.我们将看到，你会有一份展现声音的录音带样本，这也是我们一种善意的表示，我了解那只不过是我的一种表示而已。就证据来说，我们会思考更为严肃的可能性。
([Dr. Intream:] “Okay as far as it doesn’t interfere with your plans, Seth.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“好的，就以不影响到你的计划为限，赛斯。”)
We will consider ways in which we can work within the physical circumstances.I want to also use the potentials in which I can work.I am somewhat sly... I am used to getting around corners.We will indeed try, within our scope of action, to do what we can.I am used to opening eggs without cracking them.我们会考虑一些让我们可以在物质环境中运作的方法。我也想使用我可以在里面运作的各种可能性。我有点顽皮……我习惯各角落到处走走。我们真的会在我们的行动范围内，试着来做我们可以做的。我习惯以不击破的方法将蛋打开。
(Jane came out of her trance at 2:53, ending on a humorous note.Dr. Instream said that the impression he had of Seth was of a very mature and capable mind. He was interested in getting this impression on tape because the Seth voice itself reinforced this feeling.Seth, he said, possessed tremendous insight.(2:53分珍以风趣的口吻结束，并回神过来。殷斯翠姆博士说，在他的印象中，赛斯的心智非常成熟与能干，他很想从录音带中获得这种印象，因为赛斯的声音本身强化了这种感觉。他说，赛斯拥有相当惊人的洞察力。
(The conversation then turned to the psychic societies, and to the director of the American Society.Jane and I received two brief letters from the director, concerning the Seth material, on March 23,1964 and April 23,1964.Jane then went into trance again, and began speaking as Seth in a strong and assured voice at 3:00.)(接着，对话内容就转到心灵协会美国精神研究协会理事长。我和珍在1964年3月23日和4月23日，分别收到来自理事长两封有关赛斯资料的简函。3点整时，珍又再度出神，并以赛斯的身分开始讲话，声音有力而坚定。)
I am an excellent debater.I can hold my own in any conversation. Forgive my lack of humility.I can hold my own with your good doctor in New York, I can take him for you... I also know my own limitations, but I do respond to human relationships.我是个极为优秀的雄辩家。在任何对话中，我都有坚守我自己的论点，请恕我不知谦卑。我可以跟你那位在纽约的好医师坚守我自己的论点，我可以替你说服他……我也知道自己的限制，但是我确实会对人际关系有所回应。
([Dr. Instream:] “That tickles me, Seth.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“赛斯，这下可把我逗乐了。”)
I have to admit that I am most pleased at our discussion. I am amused at your reactions, and my own... this is my first opportunity to talk with you... I have not pushed in the past for any kind of arrangement where proofs can be obtained....我得承认，我们能有这次讨论我感到非常高兴，我都被你的反应逗笑了，我自己的……这是我第一次有机会与你谈话……过去我从不会为了获得证据而刻意做任何安排……。
([Dr. Instream:] “You can take care of yourself”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“你可以照顾好你自己。”)
We must all take care of ourselves; and I know with whom I am dealing.我们都必须照顾好我们自己；我知道自己正在跟谁打交道。
([Dr. Instream:] “We’ll get better acquainted.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“我们彼此会更熟悉的。”)
We shall indeed, and make arrangements for future sessions.我们的确会，而且也会安排好未来的课。
(Dr. Instream now commented upon the fact that Jane had no apparent fatigue while using the Seth voice.)(针对珍以赛斯的声音说话时都不会有明显的疲惫感，殷斯翠姆博士这时提出了一些看法。)
The increase in voice will not produce fatigue. It never does. Also, there is no invasion of Ruburt. The personality with whom I am working is intelligent.For reasons that I will explain much later, it was necessary that I align myself with a personality who is both intelligent and intuitional.I do not want to shove the ego aside. I have no need or wish to shove the existing personality aside. We get along well.音量的增加并不会造成疲惫，从来都不会，而且也不会有侵犯鲁柏的问题，跟我合作的这个人格很聪明。为了某些我很久以后才会跟你们解释的理由，我必须跟兼具理性和直觉的人格共同合作。我不想把自我摆到一边，我没必要也不希望把目前存在的人格摆到一边，我们彼此相处很愉快。
There is much here to be studied about personality.From your viewpoint the information available to you can be practically endless.There is much to be learned about perceiving other realities. Trance states are only a beginning.The self is made of action. Teaching the self to expand is most important, and the ways are nor difficult... this is what makes the experiment interesting.This is not beyond human abilities. The structure of the personality makes this possible.这里有很多关于人格的东西需要学习。从你的观点来看，你能获得的讯息其实是无可限量的。有关如何觉知其他的实相，也有很多需要学习，出神状态只是一个开始而已。自己是由行动组成，教导自己如何扩展，极其重要，方法也不难……而这也是这类实验有趣的地方。这并没有超出人类能力之外，人格的结构是有可能这么做的。
The peoples of the East know more about this, but they have closed their eyes to the human conditions of existence... they live in poverty and filth, and there is no real reason for this.Experiments in expansion can be carried on that I will be glad to discuss with you... they can be for the use of any intelligent personality.东方人对这方面了解更多，但他们对于人类存在的状况却一直闭眼不见……他们生活在贫穷与脏乱之中，实在没有理由这样。这些扩展练习可以实际来进行，我乐意跟你一起讨论……任何聪明的人格都可以做这些练习。
([Dr. Instream:] "Some very interesting possibilities here.... ”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“这里有一些非常有趣的可能性……”)
I deal with possibilities, and so do you.我在探讨可能性，你也一样。
(Dr. Instream now asked Seth about the possibility of bringing some other people in on the sessions.)(这时殷斯翠姆博士问赛斯有关带其他人来参加这个课的可能性。)
We must not deal with the overly gullible or skeptical.The mean will work for us very well.对于太容易受骗或疑心病太重的人，我们没必要涉及。中庸的人对我们会很有帮助。
([Dr. Instream:] “Yes, I agree....”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“对，我同意...”)
I have no objection, except that we must not deal with the gullible or skeptical.The gullible can do us more harm than the skeptical.只要不必处理易受骗或疑心病太重的人，其他的我没有异议。易受骗的人对我们的伤害会比疑心病太重的人还大。
(Dr. Instream agreed again; and Seth/Janes voice, strong to begin with, took on a note of mock horror.)(殷斯翠姆博士再度称是；赛斯-珍的声音一开始很有力，这时故作恐惧状。)
I quail before such a possibility.I can to some extent deal with the skeptic.With the gullible I cannot deal.We will indeed at all times try to be as reasonable as possible.I do become impatient. This is a characteristic of my own. I try not to let it direct my relationships.而对这样的可能性我会胆怯。对于疑心病太重的人，我多少还可以应付；但对于易受骗的人，我可就没辙了。事实上，我们随时都要尽可能试着保持合理的态度。我真的变得比较没耐性，这是我自己的性格，我试着不要让它影响到我的人际关系。
([Dr. Instream:] “I will try to be most careful... it can be a matter of gradual unfolding.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“我会试着以如履薄冰的态度小心进行……它可以是一种逐渐揭露的过程。”)
There is no great rush. We will proceed... I have built up the foundations well.不要冲得过猛，我们将会着手进行……我已经建立了良好的基础。
([Dr. Instream:] “It’s too bad Elmira is 120 miles away... you have no telephone....”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“埃尔迈拉离这边120里远，真是太可惜了……你们又没有电话……。”)
We may see that this is of no great difficulty. It may work for us.我们或许会发现，这并不会太困难，它或许对我们有帮助。
(Dr. Instream said that he had been thinking of the possible damage that publicity could do to the sessions.)(殷斯翠姆博士说，他一直在想，公开发表之后，可能会为赛斯课带来什么不利的影响。)
I am somewhat concerned. When Ruburt’s book is published the fact of the sessions will be known.We have not had to deal with this in the past. I make no effort to direct Ruburt’s writings in any manner.What Ruburt has said in his book has been up to him, and therefore we have to deal with the results.我有点担心，鲁柏的书一出版后，大家就会知道赛斯课的事。过去我们一直都不用处理这方面的事，我没有以任何方式试图为鲁柏的写作下指导棋。鲁柏在书上说了些什么，全都由他决定，因此我们必须处理这方面的结果。
([Dr. Instream:] “I can help Ruburt meet such problems... some people get steamed up over this subject.The criticisms could hurt if you weren’t prepared... but we can ignore such critics.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“我可以帮助鲁柏面对这一类的问题……有些人对于这个主题会怒火中烧。如果你没做好，他们的批评就会造成伤害……但是我们可以不理会这种批评的人。”)
Your attitude is very much like my own.你抱持的态度跟我非常像。
(Dr. Instream said it was best to pursue a policy of denying nothing, to ignore the criticisms and go our own way.We should avoid personal polemics in the field and not get involved; just as he has always gone his own way. fane, as Seth, sat listening intently.She nodded.)(殷斯翠姆博士说，我们最好采取不否认的策略，不理会那些批评，走我们自己的路。我们应该要避免个人在这方面的争辩，不要卷入其中；就像他一向走他自己的路一样。身为赛斯的珍坐着仔细聆听，她点点头。)
Yes, but you have had to put up with very much. This is indeed unfortunate.Your own potentials should have been given much greater reign.The human personality continually both amazes me, amuses me, and completely appalls me.Charlatans are often more deeply rewarded... I ask you to forgive my extended monologue.是的，不过你得要有相当大的忍受力，这的确令人遗憾。你自己的潜能早就该得到更多的统治权。人类人格一直都令我惊奇、令我发笑、也令我十分惊恐。不懂装懂的人却常常得到很多奖赏……我自己滔滔不绝讲太多了，请多包涵。
([Dr. Instream:] “No, that’s all right, it gives me insight... tells me who I'm dealing with.The book will be criticized... a barrage of criticism. It can’t be helped... but Ruburt must be rendered unsusceptible.... ”(殷斯翠姆博士：“不会，没有关系，这让我透彻了解……也告诉我在跟我打交道的是谁。这本书会受到批评……铺天盖地的批评，这也没办法……不过鲁柏一定要坚守立场，不能被撼动……”
(A case in point, Dr. Instream continued, was our meeting with the young psychologist on Saturday evening.See my notes on page 132. Dr. Instream said to forget such encounters.Jane again nodded in agreement, and her voice again became stronger briefly.)(殷斯翠姆博士继续说，星期六晚上我们与那位年轻的心理学家会面，就是个很好的例子。见我前面的笔记，殷斯翠姆博士要我们忘掉这类的事，珍再度点头表示同意，她的声音又短暂变得较为强烈。)
The meeting between the two was indeed upsetting to him.这两人的会面的确令他反弹。
Nevertheless, he recovered rather quickly. The experience did him much good... a practical example... had it not happened now, a much more vicious attack would have occurred at a later date.不过他很快就平息下来，这个经验对他来说非常好……一次实际的经历……要是现在没发生这件事，改天就会有更猛烈的攻击。
([Dr. Instream:] “Yes... well act as a buffer.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“没错……我们可以扮演缓冲的角色。”)
I am particularly grateful for your interest and concern.我要特别感谢你的喜爱与关心。
(Dr. Instream said that people often do get hurt, when instead they should be protected.He knows Dr. Rhine and another director personally, and voiced suspicions about their methods.)(殷斯翠姆博士说，人们真的常常会受伤，其实这时的他们反而应该要受到保护才对。他私下认识莱恩博士和另一位督导，而且对他们的方法曾表示怀疑。)
[The other director] is too much concerned with his own personal image. He does not want to be involved with anything that may fail... this is a personal concern of his.His ego is such that it makes him, in a strange manner, often prevent the sort of effects that he seeks.He asks too much, and receives too little. He will always be that way.(另一位督导)太在意他自己的个人形象，不想卷入任何没把握的事情……这是他担心的事。由于他有个这样子的自我，因此让他经常以奇怪的方式防止这类他所要追寻的效果。他问得太多，但接收太少，他会一直这样。
(Dr. Instream agreed.)(殷斯翠姆博士表示同意。)
There is a sweetness in the nature of your Dr. Rhine.你们的莱恩博士本性温和亲切。
(Again Dr. Instream agreed.) That sweetness allows for spontaneity, and explains why many of his cases succeeded.But for entirely different reasons Dr. Rhine also gets too involved, and the end result is the same... we can get effects, but the laboratory atmosphere will not help us.(殷斯翠姆博士再度表示同意。)那种温和亲切的本性会让自发性出来，也解释了为什么他很多个案都会成功。但由于一些全然不同的原因，莱恩博士也涉入了太多，其最后结果也一样……我们可以获得效果，但实验室的气氛对我们并没帮助。
([Dr. Instream:] “Yes.”)(殷斯翠姆博士：“对。”)
I will now let my friend Ruburt have his cigarette. I would myself prefer a cigar.我现在要让我的朋友鲁柏抽根烟，我自己比较喜欢雪茄。
(End at 3:28.Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her voice had been good up until the end, and she now displayed no unusual fatigue. Her eyes had remained closed for the entire session.(3:28分结束。珍出离状况跟平常一样，她的声音到结束时一直都很好，现在也没有特别累，整节课眼睛都闭着。
(Dr. Instream agreed with Seth’s brief sketches of Dr. Rhine and the other director.He said that Dr. Rhine’s sweetness had led him into traps where his controls were not rigid enough during experiments, that his disposition was of the type that would not make him crack down.On the other hand, the other director was too strict.Dr. Instream used these examples to point out how important the correct methodology was in trying to obtain proof in psychic investigations. .(殷斯翠姆博士同意赛斯对莱恩博士跟另一位督导的简短描述。他说，莱恩博士为人温和亲切，导致自己掉入做实验控制不够严谨的陷阱，而且他的性格是属于不会让自己垮掉的那种类型。另一方面来讲，另一位督导则是太过严谨。殷斯翠姆博士以这些例子指出，在尝试获得灵学研究证据时，正确的方法论是何等重要 。
(As we said good-bye, I offered to send Dr. Instream a copy of the session.)(我们道别时，我表示要把这节课的复本送一份给殷斯翠姆博士。)

SESSION 170 第170节　赛斯课录音——给殷斯翠姆博士证据


JULY 19, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年7月19日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(The regularly scheduled session for last Wednesday, July 14, was not held because Jane and I were on vacation.(由于我和珍去度假，因此上星期三，7月14日的定期课没有举行。
(We had indicated to Dr. Instream last week that we would record a session upon returning home, and ship him the tape for his own use.Jane and I had not used our recorder much lately, so we practiced with it last night, establishing proper distances from the microphone, and volume settings.The session was recorded with the Gallaghers as witnesses, at their home, and turned out well.There follows the little talk Jane gave on tape before the actual session began:(我们上周跟殷斯翠姆博士说过，一回到家之后，就会录一节课寄给他使用。我和珍最近不太使用录音机，所以昨晚练习了一下，以便抓好它跟麦克风之间的距离及音量设定。这节课在加拉格夫妇家录制，他们两人也一起做了见证，过程一切顺利。下面的录音内容，是珍在真正上课前的一小段谈话：
(“This is Jane Butts, speaking in my usual voice.My husband, Robert Butts, and I live at 458 West Water St., Elmira, NY.The date is July 19,1965, the time is about 8:30 PM. The following Seth session, number 170, is being recorded at the home of Bill and Peggy Gallagher, Pine City, NY, with them as witnesses.(“我是珍·柏兹[Jane Butts]，现在是以平常的声音讲话。我的先生罗伯∙柏兹[Robert Butts]，目前住在纽约埃尔迈拉华特街458号。今天是1965年7月19日，现在时间是晚上8:30分左右，下面这节是第170节赛斯课，在纽约州派恩城[Pine City]比尔和蓓·加拉格夫妇家录制，他们也一起当见证人。
(“The recorder is operated by my husband. It is a Sears Silverstone.The Tone and Volume One controls are set as far to the left as possible during recording. The Volume Two control has been set at 4, and unless otherwise noted this setting will not be changed for the rest of the evening, whether I am speaking as Seth or myself.I am sitting between five and six feet from the microphone, and will keep this position throughout the session.The entire recording is being made on Monaural One, Side One and Side Two.(“录录机是西尔斯百货的银通[Sears Silvertone]厂牌，由我先生操控。录音当中，音色和音量一的控制钮已调到最左边，音量二的控制钮调到第四格，不管我是以赛斯或我自己的身分讲话，除了特别注明的地方外，这种设定整晚都不变。我坐在离麦克风五、六尺的地方，而且整节课都会坐在这个位置。整段录音是以单声道[Monaural One]录制，录了第一面与第二面。
(“Breaks during the session will be indicated by my husband announcing the time. The next time you hear my voice it will be 9 PM, and I will be speaking as Seth.”(“课程中的休息时间我先生会念出来，等会儿你们会在9点听到我的声音，我将以赛斯的身分讲话。”
(Note that Jane did not include the speed, 3- 3/4, in the above announcement.(值得注意的是，珍在上面的公开说明中，并没提到磁带经过磁头的速度控制钮，我们是采用每秒钟长度三又四分之三寸。
(Jane had felt for several days that Seth would address the session to Dr. Instream, and so he did.Janes eyes remained closed for the entire session. She began the session while sitting down. More or less as I had anticipated, she began speaking too rapidly for me to take notes effectively, although at times during the session I was able to keep up with her.Peggy Gallagher also took notes.Thus this session is taken from the tape itself largely, and necessitated replaying it several times.(珍几天前就觉得赛斯会为殷斯翠姆博士讲这节课，果真如此。她整节课都闭着眼睛，坐下来开始上课，开始时的速度快到我无法好好做笔记，不过这多少也是我预料中的状况，我只有偶尔能跟得上她讲话的速度。蓓·加拉格也做了笔记。因此这节课大部分都是取自录音带本身，不得不来回重听好几次。
(Jane actually began speaking at 8:57. Her voice was stronger than usual from the beginning, her manner active.The recording was begun with the footage set at 000 prior to Janes introduction, on Monaural One, Side One.)(珍实际上说话的时间是8:57分，她的声音一开始就比平常大，精神也非常充沛。在珍开始介绍前，录音机计数器就归零，以单声道方式开始录制第一面。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I will address my remarks this evening to Dr. Instream, with whom I am at least now somewhat acquainted.I will speak fairly slowly, since Ruburt is taking his time in order that Joseph may take his notes. Notes in our circumstances are fairly important.今晚我会跟殷斯翠姆博士说话，现在我跟他多少有点熟了。我会说得很慢，因为鲁柏要从容不迫，好让约瑟可以做笔记，在我们的状况下，笔记相当重要。
There are some matters which I would discuss with you, Dr. Instream.They are matters in which we both have some deep concern, and some considerable interest.殷斯翠姆博士，有些事情我要跟你讨论。这些事情我们两个都很关心，也很感兴趣。
Let us first consider the trance state.Let us for example consider the following circumstances, which are happening only in our imagination.We will therefore consider this imaginary circumstance: an individual is in a trance state. His focus of attention is rather severely limited in some aspects, and yet in other ways it is very strongly focused.首先，我们来讨论出神状态。我们就以下面的状况为例来想想看，这些状况只发生在想像中而已。我们来思考一下这个想像出来的情境：一个人正在出神状态中，他的注意力焦点在某些面向中受到严格限制，但在别的面向中却是非常强烈地聚焦。
The individual involved is aware of very little as far as physical objects are concerned. There is, for example, a table in front of him.The table is real, it is physical. Under ordinary circumstances it could be seen and touched.Objects could be placed upon it; and yet, Doctor Instream, our entranced individual is not conscious of that table.In his state he is concentrating upon some object which we cannot see. Now, consider:we will attempt to prove the existence of this material table to this individual who is not aware of it. How, therefore, could we prove to him that this table exists, when he is not aware of it in any manner whatsoever? His attentions are focused elsewhere. For him the table does not exist. We have indeed a rather delightful dilemma; and yet, is this not what you require of me?I speak of “you” simply because I have come in contact with you. I recognize only too well your sympathy and your understanding.Nevertheless the situation in which you put me is exactly like the situation which I have only now described.这个人几乎不会觉察到实质的物体，比方说，他面前有张桌子，这张桌子是真实的，实质存在。一般状况下，看得见也摸得到，可以在上面放东西；可是，殷斯翠姆博士，我们那个出神的人并没意识到那张桌子。在他的状况中，他正聚焦在我们看不到的某些东西上。现在，想想看：我们将试图向那个没意识到这张实质桌子的人，证明桌子的存在。要是不管用什么办法他都无法意识到这张桌子，那我们又怎么能向他证明这张桌子的存在呢？这时他的注意力聚焦在别的地方，对他来讲，这张桌子并不存在。我们碰到了相当有意思的两难之局；然而，难道这不是你对我的要求吗？我讲到“你”是因为我已经接触过你的关系，我太了解你的同情心和体贴。不过，你给我的情况正好就像我刚刚描述的那样。
Your attentions are indeed focused elsewhere. You are in a trance as well as Ruburt is in a trance state now. This is far from unusual.I use you, dear Doctor Instream, only as an example.Consciousness of any kind is merely the direction in which the self looks. I told you this at our brief meeting.Consciousness is the focus, the direction of focus.Your ordinary consciousness is as much a trance state as any trance state induced through hypnotism.Therefore it is nearly impossible to convince a subject in trance that something he does not see exists.你的注意力的确聚焦在别的地方，你现在就在出神状态，就像鲁柏一样，这根本没有什么不正常。亲爱的殷斯翠姆博士，我只是以你为例来说明罢了。任何种类的意识都只是自己看出去的方向而已，我在我们短暂会面时，已经告诉过你了。意识就是焦点，就是聚焦的方向。你们平常的意识就是一种出神状态，跟任何透过催眠所形成的出神状态完全一样。因此，要说服一个出神的人相信某个他没看到的东西确实存在，几乎是不可能的。
If you have already suggested that the table does not exist for him, he will never see the table. The table will not seem to exist.The table will not exist in actuality for this subject in the trance state.It ceases to have any meaning for him at all.Nor will he recall or remember any meaning for him that that table might once have had.假如你已经对他暗示桌子并不存在，那他将永远不会看到桌子，这张桌子就仿佛不存在。对这个出神中的人而言，这张桌子实际上就不会存在。桌子对他来说，变成毫无意义。对于那张桌子在过去或能一度带给他的意义，他想不起来，也记不得。
Though objects upon the table be dearly familiar to him, in his trance state he will not recall them.Any sentiment involved with the objects on the table, such sentiment will disappear and have no meaning.The ordinary state of consciousness is no different from that trance state. You have merely turned the focus of your attention into different realities.My attention, and my reality, is mainly focused in another direction.虽然他对桌子的东西非常熟悉，但在出神状态时就无法回想。如果对桌上物品曾有过情感，这种情感都会消失或失去意义。意识平时的状态跟出神状态没有两样，你只是把注意力焦点转到不同的实相而已。我的注意力和我的实相主要是聚焦在另一个领域。
Adequate scientific proofs, such as science so surely needs, requires the enlargement of consciousness; not, my dear doctor, on my part, but on the part of science.There are some things that I can indeed do, and I will do what I can.Nevertheless the fact remains that I am indeed extending myself, and my dear doctor it is science which is not extending itself, and it is science that will not meet reality halfway.科学的确亟需充分的证据，但充分的科学证据都需要意识的扩展；我亲爱的博士，这里的扩展不是就我来说，而是就科学而言。有些事我可以真的做，我也会做我可以做的。然而事实依然是，我的确在扩展我自己，我亲爱的博士，没有扩展自己的是科学，无法与实相妥协的也是科学。
I am as I told you an educator, and as such my main concern is with education, is with ideas.I want to tell you exactly what you want to know, and if you will hear me then to a large measure you will have to accept some of my terms, for I am quite willing to accept some of yours. Much of this has to do with your idea of the theory of suggestion.If you would read some of our material, it would then become obvious to you that mental suggestion is indeed the basis upon which all reality is founded.就像我告诉过你的，我是个教育家，因此我最关心的是教育，是想法。所有你想知道的我都会确切告诉你，假如你要听个过瘾，就得接受我的一些用语，因为我也很愿意接受你的用语，这大部分与你对暗示理论的想法有关。如果你读一读我们的一些资料，就会清楚知道，心理暗示事实上就是所有实相形成的基础。
Therefore it is not overplaying the point to say that all psychic phenomena is caused by suggestion.For my dear doctor, without suggestion, without automatic and continuous suggestion, no human being would breathe one breath.I am indeed happy to be able to speak to you in this manner. There are several points that I would like to cover this evening, for I have you here now, you see, where you cannot talk back to me.因此，如果说所有心灵现象都是由暗示所引起的，那并不夸张。我亲爱的博士，要是没有暗示，没有不知不觉和持续的暗示，人类连吸一口气都没办法。我真的很高兴能用这个方式跟你讲话，今晚我有几个重点要讲，因为，你知道，此时此刻你只能听我讲话，不能跟我回应。
I shall of course take advantage of the opportunity, but then you will have time to speak to me at your leisure.There are many points to be considered, and these matters certainly cannot be covered in one evening such as this.I hinted at our last discussion that it is indeed within the ability of the human personality to become aware of other realities while still keeping contact with physical reality.Manipulation in the physical universe is of course a necessity, but there are ways by which the human individual can become aware of other quite valid realities, and still maintain balance and control within his own more usual field of activity.我当然会好好把握这个机会，不过你有空的时候也可以跟我讲话。有好多重点需要思考，这些问题当然无法在一个像今晚这样短短的时间之内讲清楚。我们上次讨论时，我曾提示过，人类人格的确有一种能力，可以在与物质实相接触的同时又可以觉知到其他实相。物质宇宙的操控当然有其必要，但也有一些方法，可以让人类个体在觉察其他相当确切的实相时，又能在他自己更为平常的活动场域中，维持平衡与控制。
I now suggest a brief break, and we will shortly resume with our discussion.我建议现在稍微休息一下，我们很快就回来继续讨论。
(Break at 9:12.Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her eyes had been closed and she had remained seated for the entire delivery.Her voice had been stronger than usual and she had spoken at such a rapid pace that I had not been able to keep up with her in my notes.The bulk of the above delivery is thus taken from the tape.The delivery ended with the footage registering 333 on the recorder; Mono One, Side One.(9:12分休息。珍出离的状况如常，整段口述中，眼睛都闭着，也一直坐在椅子上。声音比平常还有力，而且讲话也很快，导致我在做笔记时都赶不上她。因此上面全部的口述内容都是取自录音带。这一阶段的传述结束时，录音机上的计数器跑到333，单声道，第一面录音。

My dear Doctor Instream, I will speak slower, since my friends are having trouble keeping up their notes. We must also take this into consideration.亲爱的殷斯翠姆博士，我会说慢一点，因为我那两位做笔记的朋友很难跟上，我们得顾及这个问题。
Now. In the dream state it would be impossible for the dreamer to prove the existence of the familiar street outside of his familiar door. His attention is momentarily directed toward a different sort of reality. The ordinary trees outside of his window do not exist for him.It would be highly difficult to ask a man while he dreamed to prove the physical reality of the bed in which he slept, or the bedside table which was at his head, or to prove the existence of the wooden floor upon which the bed rested.Highly difficult indeed, for such objects do not exist for our dreamer.现在，在梦境里，做梦的人不可能证明他熟悉的大门外那熟悉的街道是存在的，他的注意力已暂时被导向一个不同频的实相那边去，平时在窗外的树木对他而言不复存在。很难去要求一个做梦的人，证明他所睡的那张床，或是他头旁边的床头柜是物质实相，或是证明放置床铺的木头地板确实存在。这真的非常困难，因为对做梦的人来说，这类物体并不存在。

Joseph, may I ask you if I am again speaking too swiftly?约瑟，我可以问你我是不是又讲太快了？
(“Not at the moment.”(“现在不快。”
(Jane had slowed her pace somewhat, and I was now having some success in keeping up with her.Peggy Gallagher evidently was having better luck; she had been writing steadily ever since the beginning of the session.)(珍早就把速度降低了一些，我现在稍微可以顺利跟上她，蓓∙加拉格显然比较幸运；她从这节课一开始就一直可以稳定地做记录。)

Again, if I stood clear as day in the middle of a meeting room, with twenty fine and sturdy, respectable fuddy-duddies, what would this prove?They would swear that they were under the effects of suggestion.I will. I will for my own amusement, give you in the future many—not one but many—clairvoyant effects.Again, for my own amusement.还有，假如我清清楚楚站在会议室中间，让20个优秀、健壮、可敬的保守人士看得到，这样可以证明什么呢？他们会发誓说，这是因为他们受到暗示的关系。未来我会，我会为了自娱，展现很多次——不只一次而是很多次——千里眼的现象给你看。再说一次，这只是为了自娱。
Now.I trust your integrity, and I am quite certain of my own.Between us, what do you think we can accomplish?We can accomplish much despite my sarcastic remarks, but it will not be easy and it will not be quick.You will indeed live many years yet, before we meet face to face.And when we do meet face to face then indeed, if you will most respectfully forgive me, there will be hell to pay.现在。我信任你的正直，我也很相信我自己。在我们之间，你认为我们可以完成什么？尽管我会说一些挖苦的话，但我们可以完成的事却相当多，不过那并不容易，也并非一蹴而就。实际上，在我们会面之前，你还有许多年要活。等我们真的碰面时，请原谅我说这句话，就是后果一定不堪设想。
For though we do have the same interests there are many areas in which we do not now agree.But I will see if I cannot bring you around; and if you will forgive me my dear doctor, this humility of yours is indeed overdone.There is nothing of what I have said that you do not understand, your comments to the contrary.You pretend with yourself.If you will forgive me, for I am speaking to you as one old crony to another, you are too sly to stand up straight and say who you are, and what you are, and accept the responsibility for your own abilities. You do not want the world mad at you.虽然我们确实有一些共同的兴趣，不过也有很多部分现在仍有不一致的看法。但是我会看看我是不是真的无法让人信服；我亲爱的博士，如果你不见怪的话，你实在太过谦卑了。我所说过的内容绝对没有你不了解的，你的评论却恰恰相反，你在跟自己装蒜。因为我把你当成老朋友在跟你讲话，恕我直言，我会说你太狡猾了，所以才无法挺直腰杆说出你是谁，你是什么样子的人，为你自己的能力负起责任，你不想让整个世界对你生气。
I do not blame you. My own inclinations may not exactly be the same.You stand up well for yourself within certain limits, and then you become humble.我不责怪你，我自己的性向或许跟你不完全一样。你在某些有限的范围内，会让自己站得住脚，接着你就变得谦逊有礼。
Your abilities are much greater than this.Your achievements are much greater than this. You may interpret the following statement as you wish:however, this engagement is important to both of us.You know it and so do I. I say once more: I know with whom I am dealing, and by now you know with whom you are dealing.你的能力远大于此，你的成就也远大于此。如果你想要的话，可以诠释下面这句话：无论如何，这样的约定对我们两个都很重要。这一点你我都知道。我再说一次：我了解我在跟谁打交道，而你现在也已经知道你在跟谁打交道。
You see now, I forget. I become involved with the very personal relationship between us both, but I have been asked to give voice effects, and so indeed I shall comply (louder, briefly) out of the goodness of my heart, and because of the amusement which it affords me.However I take this encounter with utmost seriousness, and I may presume that your attitude is the same.我忘了，现在你知道，我已卷入我们两个之间非常私人的关系当中，但我被要求要展现声音效果，出于我的好心肠，也因为它能为我带来乐趣，所以我真的会照做(短暂变得较大声)。不过，我是以最正经的态度看待这次碰面，想必你的态度也应该一样。
I will now suggest that a break be taken, if you will bear with me once again; I look forward to the more friendly conversations which will occur between us in the future.For such formality indeed, and such mechanical limitations, do not allow me to achieve that friendly informal attitude that I would prefer, and I enjoy answering your questions, for in many ways you are indeed a man such as I was.你如果愿意再次包容的话，我现在会建议休息一下。我期待未来我们两人之间会有更友善的对话。我比较喜欢用友善、不拘谨的态度来谈话，但是在这么正式的场合和这种机械的限制下，让我无法如愿。我很喜欢回答你的问题，因为在许多方面，你这个人的确跟我过去很像。

Ruburt and Joseph also to some extent, and for good reasons, hold back.鲁柏和约瑟基于一些很正当的理由，也或多或少退缩了，

There are many reasons why adequate proofs for immortality have not been received in the past.These reasons have to do, among other things, with the laboratory experiments and atmosphere, which do not allow for spontaneity.为什么过去一直找不到永存不灭(immorality)的充分证据，其原因很多。别的原因先不提，光是实验室的实验和气氛就脱不了关系，因为在其中不允许自发性。
They also have to do with the idiotic and gullible attitudes of those who have been involved with many notorious seance cases.For here we find self-deluded well-meaning nincompoops, ready and willing to accept any fraud, and cry hallelujah!(Much louder.)而有些人抱着白痴与轻信的态度，参与许多恶名昭彰的降神会，他们也脱不了关系。因为我们发现，有一些自我欺骗、心地善良的傻瓜，随时都准备好愿意接受任何欺骗，然后大叫哈利路亚(编注：赞美上帝的颂歌)！(更大声)
What you have needed, and if you have the sense to perceive it, and I think you have, was a situation where both logic and intuitions were allowed full play.We will have much to do with each other, my dear doctor, and you know already that this case is one for which you have long waited.如果你有意识去觉察的话，而我相信你有，你所需要的是一种能够让逻辑和直觉完全展现的情境。我亲爱的殷斯翠姆博士，我们彼此将会有很大的关联，你自己也知道，这是你盼望已久的一件事情。
(Jane now stood up again.As usual she remained just in front of her chair, her eyes closed, her hands thrust into the pockets of her slacks.)(珍再度起身，跟之前一样，只站在椅子前面，闭着眼睛，把双手挺进裤子的口袋里。)
I myself have indeed long awaited some circumstances which we now can take advantage of for our own benefits.However, I am not mainly concerned with proving for you the fact of my own existence.(Strong voice.) (Jane’s voice again climbed the scale in volume. I do not imagine that this information will save the world.It will take more than myself and twenty gods beside to handle that problem.I do however insist that in my not too humble way, I can do something to set you right.And by right and by you I do not refer to you, Doctor Instream, but to humanity at large.I do not pretend, either, to know definitely what is right and what is wrong for your universe.我不去想像这些资料会拯救世界。要解决这个问题，不能只靠我自己以及旁边的20个神。不过我的确会坚持，我可以用不是很谦虚的方式做某件事来导正你。殷斯翠姆博士，我这里说的导正和你，其实并不是指你，而是指全人类。我也不会假装很确定知道对你们宇宙来说什么是对的、什么是错的。

I am myself quite happy, and somewhat amused by our relationship, my dear doctor, for in many areas we are indeed very much alike.I know and I appreciate the fact that you are not a young man. I know indeed that you lean toward a belief in immortality, while at the same time you cannot entirely accept the possibility without some sort of scientific proof.我亲爱的博士，我相当高兴，也觉得我们的关系有点好玩，因为我们有很多方面实在非常相像。我知道也意识到你不是个年轻小伙子，事实上我知道，你有一种信仰永存不灭的倾向，但另一方面来讲，你没有某些科学上的佐证，所以还无法完全接受这个可能性。
I am also quite aware of the cruelty that would be involved if I led you on in this endeavor without due consideration.I can only tell you that I appreciate both your objectivity and your beliefs.I will do my best, my dear doctor, to satisfy you in both respects.You may call it chance. You may name it in whatever way pleases you: nevertheless, it is because of my personal rapport with you that I will bother with any displays at all.我也非常明白，如果未经过适当的考虑就把你引诱来做这方面的努力，那有点太残忍。我只能跟你说，我欣赏你客观的态度和你的信仰。我亲爱的博士，我会尽我所能来满足你这两方面。你或许可以称它为机缘，也可以决定称之为巧合，也可以随你高兴给它取个名字：然而，因为我跟你的私交关系不错，所以才会费心表现给你看。

Now. Quite practically your personal and practical interest in immortality will give the impetus, the emotional impetus that will indeed allow me to deliver what you want.This is perhaps one of the most important statements of this evenings session.Emotions are more important than you suppose. There is no fraud in me. There is no fraud in Ruburt or Joseph.They are not stupid and they are not gullible. You are not stupid nor gullible.They are not caught up in pseudo religious nonsense. This will serve us well.现在，你个人对永存不灭确实很有兴趣，而这种兴趣确实也会带来一股动力，这股情感动力真的会让我传达出你所要的东西。这或许是今晚这节课最重要的一句话。情感比你所以为的还重要，我没骗你，鲁柏或约瑟也不会骗你。他们并不愚蠢，也不容易受骗，你不愚蠢，也不易受骗。他们不会被伪宗教(pseudoreligious)的胡说八道所迷惑，这一点对我们来说非常有益。
At another time, at another occasion when we have an afternoon together, you and I can discuss the God concept, for it continually fascinates me, and it continually fascinates you.看看哪天下午你我都有空，可以找个时间来讨论神的概念，因为这个话题一直都很吸引我，也一直很吸引你。
(Seth has discussed the God concept and related subjects in the following sessions, among others: 31, 51, 62, 66, 81, 95, 97, 115, 135, 147, 149, 146, 151.)(赛斯在下列章节中也讨论过神的概念和一些相关主题：第31、51、62、66、81、95、97、115、135、146、147、149、151节。)
You must be aware that the next move is up to you.If you do not make a next move then neither of us is out a thing, and it will have been a most delightful encounter.你必须了解，要不要采取下一个行动就看你了。如果你没有采取下一个行动，那我们两个就都没事儿，而这将仅止于一次最令人愉快的相遇。
However I do not sincerely believe that such will be the case, and I can assure you that I am not one to dillydally.I am deeply aware of my responsibilities to Ruburt, through whom I speak, and I will endeavor to protect this personality from undue or unnecessary bother.But I will in all manners cooperate in any sincere effort that will add to the knowledge of the human [species] in general.不过我真的不相信情况会是这样，我可以跟你保证，我不会三心二意。我深深了解我对鲁柏的责任，我透过他来讲话，我会努力保护这个人格，以免他受到过度或不必要的干扰。但是我会透过所有方法，真心尽力跟他合作，以增加人类(物理)普遍的知识。
It would be unfair of me to back upon an elderly gentleman’s desire for immortality, and I would never stoop to such a practice.I was myself an elderly gentleman, and I understand too well the soul-searching aspects of such a reality.You may therefore be assured that I will not play on such human limitations.I will under all circumstances never take advantage in any such manner.要我支持年长男士追求永存不灭的那股欲望，那对我而言不公平，我永远不会屈服于这样的做法。我自己就曾是年长的男士，我太了解这种追求灵性面向的实相。因此，我可以跟你确定，我不会利用人类这类的限制。不管在什么状况下，我永远都不会利用任何这样的方式。
I say this only to let you know that I understand any innermost doubts that you might have concerning the possibility that others would so take such advantage.I thoroughly enjoyed our brief meeting. Our conversation indeed was most beneficial. I appreciated the give and take.This may not sound like a very scientific document, yet in many ways it may be more scientific than you imagine, for its effects will indeed be felt.我之所以这样说只是要让你知道，我了解在你内心最深处或许怀疑其他人可能会这样子玩弄。我们之前曾有过短暂的会面，我高兴极了，我们的对话的确大有助益，我感谢这样的交流机会。这或许不像很科学的文件，但从很多方面来讲，它可能比你想像的还要科学，因为真的会让人感受到效果。
I will now suggest a brief break, and we will then conclude our brief session.I regret, my dear doctor, that it remains a monologue.我建议现在休息一下，待会儿我们再为这简短的一课做个结论。我亲爱的博士，很可惜，我还得继续唱独角戏。
(Break at 11:18.Jane was dissociated as usual, and was not displaying any undue fatigue from the long session.She remained standing until break, her eyes closed all the while. Her voice had been good, yet quieter than the really strong display of the earlier delivery, and I had been able to keep up in my notetaking.Peggy had no trouble either.Footage at 686, Mono One, Side Two.(11:18分休息。珍出离的状况如常，并没因为这么长的课而显得非常疲惫。她一直站到休息时间，眼睛也一直都闭着，声音都很好，而且比较柔和，不像之前那么强烈，因此我笔记的速度可以跟上她。蓓也没有问题。第二面，单声道，计数器为686。
(I did not know exactly how many feet of tape were left on our recorder, due to inexperience, yet saw that the session would have to end before too long or we would run out of tape first.Although Seth/Jane started out in a relatively quiet manner on this last delivery, another voice display, perhaps even better, began to develop.Jane resumed the session while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her pace was faster, and after a few sentences she rose to her feet once more.Resume at 11:29.)(由于缺乏经验，我不知道我们录音机里的带子到底还剩多少，但我知道这节课必须赶快结束，否则我们的带子就会先用完。虽然赛斯－珍在最后一段的传述中，声音开始变得比较柔和，但另外一种的声音表现，或许是更好的表现，也开始在形成。珍坐下来，闭着眼睛口述。她的节奏变得比较快，在讲了几句话后，她又站起来。11:29分继续。)
Ruburt and Joseph are, again, in many ways reluctant.They are more humble than is necessary also.还有，鲁柏和约瑟在许多方面都显得很勉强。他们也没必要这么谦虚。
They are not humble where their own work is concerned, but they find it difficult to accept the possibility that they are involved in such a venture as this one.We have here merely a conglomeration of excellent circumstances, and we shall take advantage of them, Dr. Instream, you and I. Our purposes somewhat complement each other.(Loud, very loud and strong.)他们在他们自己的工作领域并不谦虚，不过他们对于可能要投入像这样的冒险，觉得难以接受。殷斯翠姆博士，我们这里只是同时拥有各种绝佳的环境，所以我们，也就是你和我，得以善加利用。我们的目的或多或少可以互补。(声音很大，非常大声强烈)
I am concerned because I want the theoretical material to be widely distributed.I am not primarily concerned with giving effects or proofs of my existence.I know that I exist as you know that you exist.How would you feel if someone asked you to prove your existence?If you answer this question honestly, then you will see that I am far from being as irascible as it may appear.I bend over backward to understand. I bend over backward, and this is most difficult for me.(Strong.)因为我想要让理论资料广为流传，所以我会在意。我主要担心的并不是要为我的存在提出什么效应或证据。我知道我存在，就如同你了解你存在一样。如果有人要求你证明你的存在，那你感觉如何？如果你诚实回答这个问题，就会了解我一点都不像表面上可能看起来的那么暴躁。我拼命来了解，我会竭尽所能，但这对我来说仍是困难至极。(语气强烈)
You must also understand that I work to some extent within the human limitations of Ruburt’s own personality, and you have underestimated that personality.You have not underestimated my personality.你也必须了解，我多多少少是在鲁柏自己人格的人性限制之内工作，而你低估了那个人格。你并没有低估我的人格。
I am no secondary personality.There is no case of multiple personality here. What you have if you take advantage of it, is Ruburt’s personality, which with Josephs help is capable and willing to perceive more than one reality at once.You will not, my dear doctor, get a second chance in this endeavor.我不是第二人格，这里不会有多重人格。如果你善加运用的话，你所拥有的就是鲁柏的人格，这个人格在约瑟的协助下，就有能力也有意愿同时接收到一个以上的实相。我亲爱的博士，在这方面的努力上，你不会再有第二次的机会了。
There is very much concerning the characteristics of the trance state which you do not yet understand, and I can help you here.Hypnotism may seem very strange. It involves no more, however, than a study of human personality, for it involves nothing more than a switching of focus.It is imperative, if we are to speak easily, that you read the material having to do with the specific ways in which the human individual creates physical matter on a subconscious basis.有关出神状态的存在，还有很多你尚未了解，在此我可以帮助你。催眠术看来或许非常奇怪，然而，它牵涉到的只是人类人格的研究，只不过涉及到焦点的转换罢了。对于人类个体究竟是用什么特定方法，在潜意识的基础上创造实体物质，这些相关资料你一定要读一下，如此一来我们谈到这个主题会更容易。
I have not left this in general terms. Your mathematicians can verify much of it.我不是随便说说而已，这当中有很多可以由你们的数学家来验证。
(Jane’s voice had been slowly growing in volume since last break.Seth now pulled out more stops than ever before, I believe. The voice display now became deafening.My ears rang, off and on, for the next few paragraphs.I saw Peggy and Bill blinking. Jane merely stood in font of her chair, head thrown back.As stated before she exhibited no strain in producing these stunning effects.The electric eye on the recorder closed, meaning that it was recording, as far as I know, at maximum volume.)(从上次休息之后，珍的音量就一直慢慢变大。我相信，珍现在暂停次数比之前少，这时他的声音震耳欲聋。在接下来的几段中，我的耳朵断断续续出现耳鸣。我看到蓓和比尔在眨眼睛，而珍只是站在椅子前面，头往后仰。就如之前所叙述的，她在发出这些惊人的声音效果时，看不出用力撕扯的感觉。录音机上的电眼都是关着，就我所知，这表示它正以最大的音量在录音。)
Now. Because I have been called upon to give a voice display, so shall you see that I can do so.(Very loud and strong.) You will also find at the end of this session that Ruburt’s vocal chords are in no way fatigued; and I can so speak here for hours, nor would this bother Ruburt in the slightest degree.If such a display serves to convince you of my validity then so shall it be.I find it difficult to imagine that you need such childish play to convince you of that which you already know.(Loud and strong.)现在，由于我被要求提供声音上的展现，所以你会看到我办得到。(非常大声与强烈)这节课结束时，你也将发现鲁柏的声带一点也不觉得累；而我可以在这里以这种方式继续说几小时，也不会对鲁柏造成丝毫的困扰。如果这样的展现可以让你相信我确实存在，那就这样下去。令我很难想像的是，你竟然需要这样幼稚的把戏，才能说服自己相信你原本已经知道的事。(声音大而强烈)
Let it not be said that I do not cooperate; and before twenty psychologists, my dear friend, we shall be most willing to comply.But we have our conditions, and if your conditions shall be met (very loud here, to slowly subside) my dear friend, then so shall mine. (Loud again.) We will give and take.I shall not give and give.If you consider this display a childish one, then let me remind you that I consider your requests in the same manner.希望不会有人说我不合作，我亲爱的朋友，在20个心理学家面前，我们绝对愿意。不过，我们有我们自己的条件，如果你的条件能得到满足(这时非常大声，然后慢慢平息)那我的也会如此(又很大声)。我们会相互配合，我不会只是一直满足你。如果你认为这样的声音展现看起来很幼稚的话，那就让我提醒你，我对于你的要求也有同样的感觉。
If I sound theatrical, if I sound irascible, kindly remember that to make my point I work with disadvantages and distortions which would make you speechless.I do sincerely understand your true sympathy. As I said earlier I feel a rapport.Nevertheless I feel that I must indeed make my position clear.如果我的声音听起来很夸张、很暴躁的话，那麻烦记得，为了阐述我的观点，我以不利的条件以及让你没办法讲话的扭曲方式在进行这个工作。我由衷了解你真心的同情，如同我先前说过的，我觉得我们关系密切。不过，我也觉得我确实必须把我的立场表达清楚。
All those here present may take a break, or end the session as they prefer.This will indeed be a most significant session.在座各位也许可以休息一下或结束这节课，就看你们的意思。这的确是非常有意义的一节课。
(“We’ll end the session then.”)(“那么我们就结束这节课。”)
I will then give my due respects to Doctor Instream, and also ask for his understanding as I make certain points quite emphatically, in order to make certain that they are made at all.We will, between us, come to an understanding; and those effects which he desires, in time can be given.我得跟殷斯翠姆博士致上我的敬意，同时也请求他的谅解，因为我在阐述某些观点时，为了确保能完整表达，证据相当断然与坚决。我们彼此之间将会达成相互的理解；而他所想要的那些效果，将来都会提供。
We must to some extent consider Ruburts own personality, and all protection that is possible should be given here.Doctor Instream can act in this behalf, and I will consider such actions as a gesture of his faith; though the word faith is not meant as any alternative to the word science, it is quite possible to have both.在此，我们必须适度考量到鲁柏自己的人格，同时应该尽可能提供所有的保护措施。殷斯翠姆博士在这方面可以有所行动，而我将会把这样的行动当作他一种信仰的表示；虽然信仰这个词并不能替代科学这个词，但它还是很可能兼具两者的意义。
(End at 11:45.Jane had been dissociated as usual. She remained standing in her accustomed spot until the end of the session. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice had been good all the way, with some very strong and vibrant passages.In my opinion these exceeded the loud passages in the 158th session.Jane had cleared her throat a few times toward the end of the session, but now displayed no strain, or unusual fatigue.(11:45分结束。珍出离的状况如常，她站在惯常的位置上，一直到这节课结束，双眼持续闭着，声音也都很不错，当中有某些段落非常强烈与震耳。依我看来，这些声音已超越了第158节中很大声的那几段。接近结束时，珍清了几次喉咙，不过现在并没有显露出喉咙紧绷或异常疲惫的样子。
(This point was abundantly made, for although we did not know it at the time, the session was due to resume at midnight.At the moment the footage scale on the recorder read 860, Mono One, Side Two.We had a little tape left, so I decided to use it to demonstrate for others the fact of Jane’s immunity to voice fatigue.(这里课程结束的时间点标注得很清楚，但是我们这时候并不知道，这节课后来在半夜再度进行。此时录音机上的计数器是860，单声道，第二面。我们的带子还剩下一些，所以我决定就利用它来向其他人展现珍声音不疲累的事实。
The following is taken from the tape verbatim, and includes a statement from Bill Gallagher, who witnessed the session with his wife Peggy.It was made immediately after the end of the session; perhaps a few minutes were lost here when I made a false start on the recorder, due to inexperience, and had to start the exchange between Jane and myself over.下面的内容是从录音带中听写下来的逐字稿，里面包括比尔∙加拉格的一段话，他跟太太蓓一起见证了这节课。这是在课一结束后立刻进行；由于缺乏经验，我没按好录音机上的开始钮，所以可能有几分钟的内容不见了，因此必须从我和珍之间的对话再重新开始。

([BG:] “This is Bill Gallagher.I want to verify the fact that the 170th Seth session was held in my home on Holden Road, where it was witnessed by my wife and myself on July 19,1965, from 8:57 to 11:45.What you hear on these tapes has in fact occurred, and Jane was within view at all times; and I don’t know what else I can add, other than the fact that it was a very astounding presentation.”(比尔·加拉格：“我是比尔·加拉格。我要证明第170节赛斯课是在我豪登路[Holden Road]的家里举行，时间是1965年7月19日8:57分到11:45分，我和我太太一起见证。你在录音带里听到的都是实际发生的事，整个过程大家都可看到珍的状况；这是个令人非常惊奇的展现，除此之外，我不知道我还可以补充些什么。”

(Footage at 876.I added the following notes a couple of days later.(目前录音机的计数器为876。两天之后我又补充了下列资料。
([RB:] “This is Robert Butts again, speaking two days later on July 21st.I would like to add that the 170th session, which you have just heard, and which formally ended at 11:45 PM last Monday, July 19, resumed that night at midnight.It involved an informal exchange between Jane, Seth, Bill and Peggy Gallagher and myself, and lasted until about 1:30 AM.(罗勃∙柏兹：“我是罗勃∙柏兹。两天之后的7月21日，我再度讲话。我要补充的是，你刚刚听到的第170节课，原本在7月19日晚上11:45分正式结束，但在当晚深夜又继续，内容包括了我自己、珍、赛斯、比尔和蓓之间的非正式对话，一直持续到凌晨1:30分才结束。
Our tape was almost exhausted and so it was not recorded. Seth also stated he did not care particularly to have it on tape, or have notes taken.During this exchange Seth was in an excellent good humor. I joked with him about the voice display, and he responded with another which was both stronger and longer-lasting than the one on tape here.Our ears rang, really, before it was over.And when it was over at last, and we were all weary, Seth, or Jane, was as capable as ever.Jane had no voice strain or fatigue that we could detect.Seth said he could continue until dawn, and I believe it quite possible. Jane just threw her head back and let the sound come out. ”由于我们的录音带几乎用尽，所以这部分就没录下来，赛斯也表示，他并不会特别介意这部分是要录音或做笔记。在这段对话中，赛斯极为幽默，我拿他的声音表现跟他开玩笑，而他却用另一种声音效果来回应，那种声音比这个录音带上的声音更强烈、更持久。说真的，那种声音都远没结束，我们早就耳鸣了。等到那声音终于停止时，我们都已经疲惫不堪。而赛斯，或珍，精力依然旺盛，一点事都没有，我们也看不出珍有什么声音紧绷或疲惫沙哑的现象。赛斯说他可以继续到黎明都没问题，而我也相信这相当有可能。珍只是把她的头向后仰，好让声音可以出得来。
(Footage at 887.)(计数器为887。)
(The session resumed without preamble at midnight. Our active discussion after I had finished with the tape brought it about, and it involved an exchange between Jane, Seth, Bill and Peggy, and myself, in the manner of the 169th session held in Dr. Instreams office.(这一节毫无预警地在午夜时继续，录音完后我们热烈讨论，引发了这节课继续进行，这是我、珍、赛斯、比尔和葆之间的交谈，其方式就如在殷斯翠姆博士办公室举行的第169节课一样。
(Although Seth said to forget about notes, I found myself making a few after a few minutes, out of habit.Peggy also made some, and what follows is taken from these two sources; nothing is included here that is not touched upon in the notes.Seth talked at a normal rate, and neither Peggy nor I made a serious effort to get it all down.Some of the material was a repeat, in a more informal way, of what Seth had said during the session itself.During this exchange it was obvious that Seth was enjoying himself immensely.More than once he referred to Bill Gallagher as his favorite Jesuit, and this is getting to be something of a standing joke between Bill and Seth.(虽然赛斯说就不要做笔记了，可是我发现过没几分钟，自己出于习惯又开始做。蓓也做了一些，下面的资料就是来自这两个出处；笔记中未触及的东西不会出现在这里。赛斯以正常的速度讲话，不过我和蓓不必很费力就能把全部内容记录下来。部分资料是以一种稍微非正式的方式，重复赛斯正式上课时说过的话。交谈时，赛斯显然乐不可支，不止一次提到比尔∙加拉格是他最喜欢的耶稣会信徒，而这也慢慢成为比尔和赛斯之间常用来开玩笑的活笑柄。
(None of us asked questions that might lead to totally new, unfamiliar material that we might wish later was recorded.Bill wanted to ask Seth to comment on the God concept, but thought this was a complicated subject. He settled instead for a question pertaining to a large wooden Tibetan statue he and Peg had purchased in Ithaca, NY.To our surprise this subject developed a few complications of its own.(我们都没有人提出一些或许会导向全新或陌生资料的问题，因为我们希望这部分的资料以后可以录音下来。比尔本来想请赛斯谈谈神的概念，不过这是一个复杂的问题，他退而求其次，提出了跟一尊西藏巨大木刻雕像有关的问题，这尊雕像是比尔和蓓在纽约伊萨卡买的。让我们始料未及的是，这个话题本身后来竟变得有些复杂。
(Seth was rather loathe to discuss the statue at first, but kept throwing out bits of information about it in between his protests.During this time Jane remained seated, her eyes closed.The statue, of a mythological or Godlike being in a sitting position with its arms upraised, did come from Tibet, Seth said—a small area in a southwestern corner of the country.I asked him for the name and he said he did not think Ruburt could pronounce it. The closest he could come via spelling was S-w-a-s-o-o- w-a-n. Swasoowan.(赛斯刚开始相当不喜欢讨论雕像的问题，不过在他的抗拒中，还是不断丢一些有关雕像的资料。这段时间内，珍闭着双眼一直坐着。这尊雕像是个虚构或像神一样的人物，坐着并举起双手，赛斯说它的确是来自西藏——是西藏西南角的一个小地方。我问赛斯这地方叫什么名字，赛斯说他认为鲁柏没办法发出这个音，他能拼出最相近的音是S-w-a-s-o-o-w-a-n，斯瓦苏万[Swasoowan]。
(The statue originated in the 12th century, and its name is not the same now as it was, Seth said.The statue represented the God of the Universe. There is some information on it in a book in the Elmira Library.The word Sense is involved here, Seth said according to my notes, although it may need translation.I do not remember why.(赛斯说，这尊雕像可以追溯至12世纪，原本的名字跟现在不一样，雕像代表宇宙之神。在埃尔迈拉图书馆里，有一本书提及一些相关资料。根据我的笔记，赛斯说感知[Sense]这个词这里跟它相同，虽然或许需要翻译。我不记得为什么。
(Seth said that originally the statue was accepted as a gift by a missionary, a Father Hogan, in payment for healing the daughter of a chieftain.Father Hogan was 46years old. It was carried by him to a shop in Hong Kong and sold. Father Hogan was a Jesuit.Seth said the statue is not an original dating from the 12th century; this one dates from the late 18th century.[Bill Gallagher later verified this, telling us that a professor of Tibetan art at Cornell University, in Ithaca where they had bought the statue, had so stated. Ithaca is some 35 miles northeast of Elmira, NY.](赛斯说，这尊雕像原本是一位头目送给传教士霍根神父[Father Hogen]的礼物，以答谢神父医治好他女儿的病。霍根神父46岁，他把这尊雕像带去香港的一家店铺里卖掉了，霍根神父是一位耶稣会信徒。赛斯说，这尊雕像并不是12世纪时的原始雕像，而是18世纪的。[比尔后来也证实这件事，他告诉我们说，康乃尔大学一位研究西藏艺术的教授也这样说过，而他们买这尊雕像的地方就是该大学的所在地伊萨卡，位于纽约埃尔迈拉市东北方大约35英里的地方]。
(The statue was taken by an American from Hong Kong to San Francisco in 1905.Seth was not positive about the date. He mentioned 34th Street, and I believe referred to New York City.A man named Bryant purchased it in San Diego, for his daughter, and transferred the statue from there to New York by nefarious ways.Seth then called Bill a romantic Jesuit.(这尊雕像在1905年由一位美国人从香港带到旧金山，赛斯不太确定日期。他提到了第34街，我相信他指的应该是纽约市。一位名叫布里洋特[Bryant]的男子在圣地牙哥买下了它，送给女儿，并以不法的手段从那里转送到纽约市。赛斯接着称呼比尔为一位罗曼蒂克的耶稣会信徒。
(I joked with Seth about the great voice effects, and Seth agreed that he had not yet reached the peak in voice effects, at least as far as volume went.Whereupon Jane rose to her feet again and treated us to a voice display that in my opinion exceeded to some small degree the voice effects we had taped this evening.This was a prolonged display that lasted more or less for the balance of the session, and seemingly could have continued until dawn without effort on Jane’s part, just as Seth said.The volume of sound hurt my ears at times.(我拿巨大的声音效果跟赛斯开玩笑，而赛斯也同意至少就音量来讲，他还没有把声音效果发挥到极致。珍于是再度站起来为我们示范，我认为这次的音量有点超越今晚录下来的声音效果。那是一种持续性的声音展现，整节课大致都可以如此，而且就如赛斯所说的，仿佛也能在珍不用太费劲的状况下持续到黎明时分。那种音量有时会让我的耳朵感到疼痛不舒服。
(Seth said again that he considered such effects childish, but that it would be a small sacrifice to make if it helped to get the material across.Again he dwelt upon the difficulty of proving immortality. No matter what he did, people would say it was trickery.He still maintained that he could offer proof that would be sufficient, in time. He repeated again that he could not play on Dr. Instreams desire for immortality in order to arouse his interest in the material.(赛斯再度说，他认为这样的效果很幼稚，不过如果能有助于其他人了解资料，那也算是小小的牺牲而已。他再次论述要证明永存不灭有其困难，不论他做什么，大家都会说那是骗人的把戏。他依然坚持说他会及时提供充分的证据，再度重申不会利用殷斯翠姆博士对永存不灭的渴望，来激发他对赛斯资料的兴趣。
(What I think could be a very important point now came up when Peggy asked Seth about the question of proof.Seth said that proof she would accept would not be accepted by science.One proof to come, he said, would involve very strong facial changes in Jane during sessions.When I asked if these could be photographed he said yes.(当蓓问赛斯有关证据的问题，我突然想到我认为很重要的一点。赛斯说，她会接受的证据，不会被科学所接受。他说，上课期间将会出现一项证据，珍的容貌会有非常强烈的变化。我问赛斯是否可以将这些变化拍照，他说可以。
(During most of the above dialogue, Seth spoke in a very loud and strong voice; Peggy estimated it could be heard for a city block.(在上面的对话中，赛斯大多以非常大声、强烈的声音在说话；蓓估计大概整个街区都听得到。
(To recap: Seth also said, referring to photographic proof official changes in Jane, that if she took the photographs for instance [Peggy is a reporter for the Elmira Star-Gazette], she would be accused of collusion with Jane and myself.(要点重述：赛斯也说到，有关珍脸部表情变化的证据，如果蓓拿照片为证[蓓是《埃尔迈拉星报》的记者]，那人家会指控她与我和珍是共同串通好的。
(Referring again to the question of immortality, Seth said that all of us in the room knew what it was like to be old men, and that some of us had also been old women.He did not get more specific on this last point.(再回到有关永存不灭的问题，赛斯说，在座的每个人都知道当个老头儿会是什么样子，我们当中有些人也当过老妇人。他对最后这一点并没有特别说明。
(Our bank account would never go below $700.00.(我们银行户头的存款绝不会低于700元。
(Jane’s poetry and my paintings were good, and would achieve their own kind of immortality.(珍的诗集和我的画作都很不错，会达成它们各自的永存不灭。
(The Seth endeavor is well worth our while. Seth said he would arrange things so that I spent no more time writing up the material than I do now.He also bellowed that he would one day speak in an auditorium filled with psychologists.(赛斯资料的学习非常值得我们花时间去探究，赛斯说，他会做好安排，让我花在笔记资料的时间不会比现在还多。他也大声吼说，有朝一日他会在一个坐无虚席的大讲堂里，对着一群心理学家演讲。
(In answer to a question of Bill Gallagher’s, Seth said Bill did well to refuse a promotion that would have necessitated his moving to Detroit.[Bill also works for the Elmira paper, in advertising.] Seth said that Bill was on the right track, that once he gets his physical problems straightened out, meaning his ulcer, he will be doing very well.(在回答比尔提出的问题中，赛斯说，比尔对那次需要他搬家到底特律的升迁案拒绝得非常好[比尔也在埃尔迈拉报社的广告部门上班]。赛斯说，比尔的方向正确，一旦他解决了身体的问题，意思是指他的溃疡，就会一帆风顺。
(There was more to this part of the session, but I believe that between us Peggy and I covered most categories discussed.End between 1:30 and 1:45 AM.Jane seemed as fresh as ever.The rest of us had had it.)(本节的这一部分还有很多更多的内容，不过我相信我和蓓已经涵盖了大部分的讨论项目。凌晨1:30分至1:45分之间结束。珍看起来还是跟平常一样精神充沛，但是我们其他人早就累坏了。)

SESSION 171 第171节 短课


JULY 21, 1965 9:14 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年7月21日 星期三 晚上9:14 定期课
(Note the late starting time. Tonight’s session was almost not held at all. Both of us were tired from Mondays extra-long session, and had decided not to hold a session tonight.I worked until almost 9 PM transcribing notes from Mondays taped session, then upon reconsidering told Jane it was okay with me if she wanted a session.Jane then decided to hold a session, and said she thought it would be brief.(请留意开始的时间有些延误，今晚的课差点上不了，我们两个都因为星期一那次超长的课觉得很累，所以就决定今晚停课。我将星期一上课的录音带听写成文字稿，一直做到今晚接近9点，经过再三考虑后，我告诉珍，如果她想上课，我这边没问题。于是珍决定要上课，她说她觉得应该是一节简短的课。
(Jane had been much surprised at hearing her voice, as Seth, as it was taped Monday, July 19, for Dr. Instream. The power of the voice had amazed her, whereas I had taken it for granted because of long hours spent listening to it.She also was uneasy in that she felt Seth was too harsh at times; she worried about the reception Dr. Instream would give the tape, since Seth spoke in no uncertain terms.I thought that Dr. Instream's reception would be perfectly fine, and that in this tape Seth, and Jane, had made their points just as they wanted to.(7月19日星期一为殷斯翠姆博士录制了录音带，珍在听到她以赛斯身分讲话的声音后非常惊讶，声音的力道让她相当惊奇，而我已听了好几个钟头，所以觉得没什么大不了。她觉得赛斯有时候太严厉，为此她也感到不安；担心殷斯翠姆博士听了录音带以后，不知道会有什么反应，因为赛斯讲话时句句都是言之凿凿。我认为殷斯翠姆博士听了应该会认为好极了，我觉得赛斯和珍在录音带中，把他们想表达的观点讲得非常清楚。
(The session was quite short. It was held in our quiet back room.Jane spoke while sitting down, with her eyes closed, and in a voice somewhat deeper than usual.Her pace was slow.)(这节课相当简短，在我们后面安静的房间举行。珍闭上眼睛坐着讲话，声音比平时稍微低沉些，速度徐缓。)
Dear friends.This will be a brief session.亲爱的朋友。这会是一节简短的课。
Do not fear that many sessions will pass before we return to our own material. Our last session was indeed an important one.We have all the time available that we need. The material itself will develop to the fullest possible scope.不必害怕还要再经过许多节课，才会回到我们自己的资料上面，我们上一节课的内容的确很重要。所有我们需要的时间，我们都会有，资料本身将会发展成最完整的范畴。
I knew what I was doing in our last session. The straightforward attitude will save us difficulties in the future.It is natural that Ruburt was startled when he heard the way he sounds when he allows me to speak.我很清楚我们上一节课我在做什么，直率的态度可以为我们省掉未来的麻烦。鲁柏听到他允许我讲话时的那种发声方式而吓一大跳，这很自然。
This will pass, but it is all to the good that he was able to hear the voice.We will see to it that you are not too badly inconvenienced in any investigation.I appreciate the basic inconvenience which the sessions cause, and I will endeavor to help you in whatever way I can, so that you are to some small extent repaid.这种状态终会过去，不过能让他听听那种声音，绝对是好事。我们敢保证，不管任何研究调查，都不至于造成你们太大的不便。但是我也了解，这些课会对你们造成一些困扰，我会尽我所能想办法来帮助你们，以给予你们一些回报。
I regret that when the voice has a loud volume it does indeed sound quite harsh.I assure you that this is not my intent.For Ruburt’s benefit, I have made no promises that I cannot keep.I cannot force, and will not attempt to force, Ruburt to accept my independent structure on a conscious level. He will do so in time.很抱歉，我的音量很大时，听起来确实相当严厉。不过我明确告诉你们，这并非我的本意。为了鲁柏好，我所承诺的事都会做到。我既无法也没打算强迫鲁柏在意识层次上，接受我独立的结构，而他早晚会接受。
Do you have any questions, Joseph?约瑟，你有任何问题吗？
("Nothing in particular, I guess. I’m satisfied with Mondays session.”)(“我想没什么特别的问题，我对星期一的课很满意。”)
I will not keep you, as I realize that your time has been occupied with notetaking.I am always pleased to speak with you, and I regret the technical difficulties involved on your part. That is why, now and then, I enjoy sessions on a less formal basis, without your notes.It allows you some freedom, and it allows me the opportunity to speak with you in a more normal manner.我知道做笔记已经占满了你的时间，我就不再耽误你。我一直都很喜欢跟你讲话，对于你技术上的问题我感到很抱歉，那也是为什么我偶尔也喜欢一些比较不正式的课程，因为你就不用做笔记。那样的课让你有一些自由，也让我有机会以比较正常的方式跟你说话。
If you have no questions then I will not keep you.One point first: Doctor Instream is the best man that you could have contacted.If you have no questions I will give you some rest.如果你没有问题，那我就不再留你。最重要的一点是：殷斯翠姆博士是你们所接触的最佳人选。如果你没有问题，那我就让你们休息。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 9:25.Jane was dissociated as usual. She said Seth enjoyed the little session.Jane also said she retained a general idea of what Seth had said.She always knows what he is saying at the moment; the trick is to retain it after coming out of trance.(9:25分结束。珍的出离状况如常，她说赛斯喜欢这一节简短的课。珍又说，对于赛斯说的内容她大致有印象，她当下都知道他在说什么；诀窍在于回神以后要将大致的印象保留下来。
(On July 20, Jane and I received a letter from Dr. Instream, in which he mentioned the possibility of a session with another doctor at Oswego State University College; the other doctor also wanted to consider the study, within limits Seth may feel advisable.(我和珍7月20日收到一封殷斯翠姆博士寄来的信，信中提到是否能与另一位奥斯威戈州立大学的医师一起上堂课；此外还有一位医师也想在赛斯认为适当的限制下，考虑这个研究。
(Also on July 20, I mailed copies of the 168th and 169th sessions to Dr. Instream.)(我也在7月20日那天，把第168节和169节的复本寄给殷斯翠姆博士。)

SESSION 172 第172节 转折——珍自如切换出神入神状态


JULY 26, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年7月26日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(On July 23, we mailed the tape of the 170th session to Dr. Instream.On July 26 Dr. Instreams letter arrived, acknowledging receipt of the 168th and 169th sessions.(7月23日那天，我们把第170节的录音带寄给殷斯翠姆博士。7月26日收到殷斯翠姆博士的来信，说他收到第168和169节的资料。
(Tonight’s session was witnessed by Lorraine Shafer and Bill Macdonnel.The last session witnessed by Bill was the 133rd, of February 17,1965. Lorraine witnessed the 168th, of July 7,1965 .It will be recalled that Bill Macdonnel’s entity name is Mark, and Lorraines is Marleno.(今晚的课由洛琳•雪佛和比尔·麦唐纳见证。比尔上一次见证的是1965年2月17日第133节课，洛琳见证的则是1965年7月7日第168节课。记得比尔·麦唐纳的存有名叫马克，洛琳的则叫玛蕾诺。
(The session was held in our front room, with the four of us sitting in a circle, roughly.Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her pace was rather fast but I had no trouble keeping up with her; nor did Lorraine, using shorthand.(今晚的课在我们前面的房间举行，4人大致围成一个圆圈坐着。珍闭上眼睛坐着讲话，速度相当快，不过我仍然可以跟得上，没什么问题；洛琳也一样，她用的是速记方式。
(Jane rather surprised us by opening the session in a voice that was surprisingly deep and somewhat loud.I can say that the voice was somewhat deeper than her voice in the 170th session, though lacking of course anything like the sheer volume displayed in that session. At times it was almost a bass voice, quite vibrant, produced without visible strain.Indeed, Seth was in an almost jocular mood.(珍一开始讲话的声音出奇低沉且有点大声，令我们相当讶异。我认为这种声音比第170节还低沉些，不过音量当然不像那一节表现得那么大，有时候几乎就是低音贝斯的声音，震撼力十足，但外表却看不出有拉紧声带的现象。事实上，赛斯的态度非常幽默逗趣。
(Jane’s voice was fairly deep in the 151st session.There have been some other instances of a voice deeper but not necessarily much louder or stronger; my estimate is that she reached her deepest voice in the 33rd session, of March 9,1964.In that session her voice was also loud, much louder than in tonight’s session.(珍的声音在第151节也很低沉。另外还有几次她的声音也比较低沉，但音量上不见得更大声或更有力；依我看，她声音最低沉的时候是在1964年3月9日的第33节里。在那一节中，她的声音也很大，比今晚这节还大得多。
(Jane actually began speaking at 8:59.)(珍实际上从8:59分开始讲话。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
My heartiest greetings to our visitors.为我们的来宾致上我最衷心的问候。
