I hardly find it necessary to deliver any massive voice displays this evening, and so we shall largely dispense with such activity.我发现今晚几乎不太需要大量的声音展现，所以这部分我们会大幅减少。
(“Not too fast.”)(“不要讲太快哦。”)
We will make an effort to return to our own material.我们会努力回到我们自己的资料上面。
There are however a few remarks which I will make concerning other matters.不过，对于其他的事，我有几句话要说。
Now first of all Joseph, when I speak too quickly you simply must tell me so. If you do not speak out then indeed I am not to blame—现在，首先，约瑟，如果我讲得太快，一定要告诉我，如果你没讲出来，那真的就不能怪我——
(There came a knock on the door, and Jane stopped speaking.We don’t use our font room for sessions anymore unless we have witnesses, in order to avoid the risk of interruptions.In the past such interruptions have been physically painful for Jane. She has compared the shock of an interruption to being doused with ice water.(这时门口传来了敲门声，珍停了下来。为了避免受到打扰，除非有人来见证，否则我们不会使用前面的房间。过去像这样的打扰，对珍来说都会造成身体上的痛苦，她把这种惊扰比喻为被浇了冰水一样。
(We all sat quietly for a moment.I was then surprised to note that Jane had come out of her trance with no difficulty, and that her eyes were open.In fact, it was she who answered the door, to speak briefly with someone who was looking for another apartment on our floor.(我们全都安静地坐在那儿愣了一会儿。接着让我惊讶的是，珍轻易地回神了，双眼还张开。事实上，前去应门的人就是她，她跟那个人简短交谈几句，原来那个人是要找同一楼层的另一户人家。
(In the 136th session such an interruption was enough of a shock to Jane to cause Seth to end the session.During the session with Dr. Instream, the 169th, held in his office at Oswego, Jane demonstrated an ability to go into and out of the trance state very easily. This marked the first time she had switched focus so easily, repeatedly.Now, Jane walked back to her chair. Before she was seated she had reentered the trance state, and was speaking.Resume at 9:01.Her voice was still quite deep.)(在第136节中，另一次类似的打扰对珍造成的惊吓之大，甚至让赛斯停掉那次课。在殷斯翠姆博士位于奥斯威戈的办公室里举行的第169节中，珍就轻而易举展现过出神与回神间出入自在的能力，那是她第一次这么轻松自如，重复转换焦点。这时，珍走回她的椅子，还未坐定又进入出神状态开始讲话。9:01分开始口述，声音依然相当低沉。)
We will here encounter no such difficulties as were encountered in the past. Ruburt will find that he is able to return to himself almost automatically.In some circumstances this will serve us both very well.我们这里不会再碰到过去那样的问题，鲁柏会发现，几乎在不知不觉间就可以回到他自己。在某些情况下，这对我们两个都非常有帮助。
Now.We will indeed cooperate in any investigation in which we may become involved.We will however progress at our own rate, without due speed, and we will in all cases keep our own sessions as uncomplicated as possible.现在。在任何可能跟我们有关的研究调查中，我们将会密切合作。不过，我们会照自己的节奏前进，没有所谓应该的速度，不管在什么状况下，我们都会尽可能让我们的课不要太复杂。
Any effects that are demonstrated will appear within ordinary sessions.I will endeavor indeed to see that they are as definite as possible, and as clear-cut as will be desired.But spontaneity will as always remain a prerequisite for any such displays.任何要展现的效果，都只会在一般平时的课中出现。我会确实努力让那些效果尽量明确、清楚，以符合需求。不过，在任何这类的展现中，自发性都会是先决条件。
You will not be pressured, Joseph, for I shall see to it.Nor will Ruburt be pressured. We are so far dealing, however, with men of good will, and it is for this reason that we shall cooperate.The material itself is my main concern, and I know that it is your own.约瑟，我也保证你不会被强迫，鲁柏也不会。不管怎么说，目前跟我们接触的都是意图善良的人，正是因为这个原因，我们应该要合作。资料本身是我最关注的，我知道这也是你们自己关注的。
There will indeed be a give and take between the three of us, and your good investigators.I thought it best in our recorded session that I speak frankly, now, and so I did.事实上，在我们三个以及你们优秀的研究人员之间，确实会相互配合。我认为在我们录音的那节课里，我说话最好要坦率，现在，我真的做到了。
I am interested in adding now to our own discussions, for it is time that we enlarged both their quality and scope.We will almost immediately embark upon a more concentrated study of the personality as it operates within its dream reality.我现在很想为我们的讨论增加内容，因为该是扩大讨论品质和范畴的时候了。我们很快会对人格在梦实相之内运作的情形做更专精的探讨。
We will also discuss a matter which will be of extreme interest in the area of therapy, for we will be concerned with health and its relation to the dream universe. This will be most significant.我们也会讨论一个在治疗领域里相当有意思的问题，因为我们会关注健康与梦宇宙之间的关系，这样的讨论极具意义。
I will let you take a break, since I am attempting to take the human limitations that are involved in our situation into consideration. There is no reason why you must take notes until your fingers feel as if they would drop.First however, I wish to give particular greetings to our friend Mark, who has consented to visit our circle.I speak fondly in my own manner. By all means take your break, and we will continue with our session.由于我努力考量到我们环境中的各项人类限制，所以要让你们休息一下，你们没必要做笔记做到手快断掉才休息。不过，我想先跟我们的朋友马克致上特别的问候，他答应过来访问我们。我以自己的方式深情地说话，无论如何，休息一下吧，我们待会儿再继续。
(Break at 9:14.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery.Her voice had remained deep until break. She said the knock on the door didn’t bother her at all.She thinks the ability to switch in and out of the trance state so easily made itself known during the session with Dr. Instream at Oswego; Jane feels however that she must have been preparing herself for this step forward without being aware of it.(9:14分休息。在第一阶段的口述中，珍的出离状况如常。她的嗓音一直到休息时都维持低沉的声调，她说一点都没受到敲门声干扰。她认为在奥斯威戈与殷斯翠姆博士上课的那一节中，是那种出神回神间出入自在的能力自己要凸显出来；珍觉得她自己一定早就准备好要在没察觉的状况下往前迈出这一步。
(Jane’s manner had been smiling and active during her first delivery, and it became even more so when she resumed speaking.She often leaned forward in her chair, gesturing and pointing even though her eyes remained closed.Her voice, still deep, hit occasional stronger spots so that it almost boomed out.I began to wonder what our neighbors might hear, since our windows were open.Resume at 9:24.)(第一阶段的口述中，珍一直都面带微笑，精神抖擞，而后面继续口述时更是如此。她坐在椅子上，不时将身子往前倾，虽然闭着眼睛，但时常伴随着各种姿态与手势。她的声音依旧低沉，偶尔还会瞬间用力，使声音听来几乎如雷贯耳。由于我们门窗开着，我开始好奇邻居可能会听到什么东西。9:24分继续。)
In future sessions, in the immediate future, we will deal with the dream universe in relation to many new aspects which we have not considered in the past.在未来的课程中，在不久的将来，我们会就许多我们以前从没思考过的新面向，探讨它们与梦宇宙间的关系。
You will then discover that this dream situation can be used for your own advantage. We will go into the ways and means by which such advantages can be obtained.The information will be of a very practical nature, and it will still serve to advance our theoretical material.之后你们就会发现，梦境可以用来帮助你们，我们会探究它们帮助你们的途径和方法。这些讯息会非常实际，也会增益我们的理论资料。
We will also be concerned with the framework of the human personality as it exists within several levels of reality.We will conclude our discussion concerning the nature of action, in so far as action is considered by itself.We will always be concerned with a discussion of action, even though other subjects are under consideration however, since it is impossible to divide action into various parts even for the purpose of discussion.我们也将会关注到存在于数个实相层面之中的人类人格架构。就行动本身来说，我们会为行动本质的讨论下结论。我们永远重视行动的探讨，不过其他主题也在考量之中，因为即使是为了讨论的目的，也不可能将行动切割成各种不同的部分来处理。
Shortly after, we will take a group of sessions to discuss particular dreams, and interpret them.In no case will we ever leave the basic material. It will serve as the framework from which, and within which, all of our sessions have their existence.我们很快就会花几节课的时间，讨论并诠释一些特别的梦。我们绝不会脱离基础的资料，这些基础资料将会成为一种架构，而我们所有赛斯课的存在，就是来自于这个架构、也在这个架构之中。
(Here Jane’s voice was deep and loud.)(珍这时候的声音低沉、大声。)
We will also find that it becomes natural and easy for Ruburt to speak in the manner in which he is now speaking, as a matter of course; and full concentration can still be given to the material in which we are interested.我们也将发现，鲁柏讲话的方式就会跟现在一样自然而然、轻而易举，这是可以想得到的；而最大的焦点仍然可以放在我们感兴趣的资料上。
There are questions which were asked in a general manner before your session began this evening.今晚上课前，有人如常地提出一些问题。
I have no reason particularly not to answer them.However the questions involve more than you know; I am, Marleno, no guardian angel.I do not flap my wings. I have no wings to flap.对于这些问题，我没有特别的理由不回答。不过它们牵涉到的东西比你们所知道的还多；玛蕾诺，我不是守护天使，不会拍打翅膀，也没有翅膀可以拍打。
(Lorraine had asked the questions.Now Jane, her eyes still closed, leaned forward in her chair toward Lorraine.Holding her arms outstretched she moved them up and down like wings.)(洛琳提了一些问题。这时珍仍旧闭着眼睛，在椅子上倾身朝着洛琳的方向。她张开双手，上下舞动，就像翅膀一样。)
My interest is concerned with those personalities with whom I am involved, and the circle of my interest includes those who come to these sessions; as indeed your own interest includes those people with whom you are acquainted.I never attempt to meddle into the private lives of those with whom I am concerned. If I am invited to comment, then I do.我对那些跟我有关的人格感兴趣，我的兴趣范围也包括那些来上课的人；就如你们自己的兴趣包括那些你们熟悉的人一样。对于我关心的那些人，我从来不会想去干涉他们的私生活，不过如果有人请我提出看法，那我会照办。
I am indeed aware, in a general manner, of the main events in your life and in Marks.But unless for some reason these are brought forcibly to my attention they remain as a part of my generalized knowledge.一般来说，我确实知道你和马克生活中的大事。不过，除非某种理由让这些大事强行进入我的注意范围，否则它们仍只是我一般讯息的一部分而已。
(Jane was very restless in her chair, now leaning forward, then back.Her voice was still deeper than usual.She smiled.)(珍在椅子上相当躁动，一会儿往前倾、一会儿又往后靠。声音仍然比平时低沉，面露微笑。)
I find that in black and white my words may sound harsh.Yet I do not so intend them.I am simply concerned with your existence, and with Mark’s, in the same manner with which you are concerned with the existence and circumstance of a friend.我发现我的话听来或许真的很严厉。然而，那并不是我的本意。我只是关心你们的存在，还有马克的存在，其方式就跟你们关心一个朋友的存在和他的情况一样。
I am indeed aware of many of the events in both of your lives, but it is relatively simple for me to so acquaint myself with your situations.I am willing at any time to render whatever services I can so render, but I do not walk ghostly through your rooms; and most certainly I do not peek through the windows.我确实知道你们两人生活中的许多事情，不过对我来说，要清楚了解你们的状况其实相当简单。我随时愿意提供我能提供的任何服务，但我不会像鬼一样走过你们的房间；很肯定的是，我不会透过窗户偷窥。
There are reasons why certain personalities have been drawn to our sessions. This is obvious.Some of you have known each other in past lives. There are other reasons which, if you will excuse me, we shall not consider this evening simply because you do not yet have a basic understanding of certain issues which are involved.You can be assured of my interest and concern. My scope of activity is simply larger than your own.某些人格之所以会受到吸引来参与我们的课，有其原因，这一点显而易见。你们之中某些人在过去的转世里已经彼此认识，这当中还有其他一些理由，但很抱歉，今晚我们将不会纳入考量，纯粹是因为你们对某些相关问题还没有基本的了解。你们放心，我对这些问题有兴趣，也很关心，我的活动范围的确是比你们的范围还要大。
I am aware of more and yet the reason for my concern could be called a quite human reason.You were drawn to the sessions for various reasons. These have something to do with both my interest and my concern.Mark in his own way is also so drawn.我知道的还有更多，我关切的原因可说是相当人性化的原因。你们受到各种不同原因的吸引，来到这里上课，我对这些原因感兴趣而且关切。马克依着他自己的方式也受到吸引而来。
I will never turn aside from human problems and human relationships in these sessions. The material itself must be oriented toward such relationships.I will for Joseph’s benefit here state that the material itself will in the future be closely studied.It will form a basis for an upward thrust of Mental activity and understanding.在这些课里，我永远不会避开人的问题以及人际关系，资料本身一定要这样的关系。为了约瑟好，我在这里要说，在未来，要仔细研究资料本身。这样一来将会奠定好一种基础，以提升对精神活动的信任和理解。
This session is somewhat in the nature of a transitory session, for we will almost immediately in following sessions return to our main interests.这节课本质上有点算是临时的短课，在接下来的课里，我们很快就会回到我们最感兴趣的部分。
I will now suggest that you take a break.I will also tell you, Joseph, that with my voice I am like a bird trying out its new wings.(Jane’s voice grew abruptly much louder, briefly.) And if I grow overenthusiastic I trust that you will forgive me.I will here in your apartment however keep a careful watch.我建议你们现在可以休息一下。约瑟，我也要告诉你，有了这种声音，我就像是一只想尝试拍打新翅膀的小鸟。(珍的声音短时间内突然变得大声许多)如果我变得太过热情，我相信你应该会体谅我的。无论如何，我在你们房子这边会好好注意的。
(Break at 9:47. Jane was dissociated as usual. She remembered some of the subject matter in a general way, and thought that if she tried hard enough she could retain more of it.Her eyes had remained closed, her voice had been a little lighter in timbre at times.(9:47分休息，珍的出离状况一如往昔，如常记得部分的主题内容，而且认为如果自己够势力的话，应该还可以记得更多。她的眼睛依旧闭着，嗓音方面有时候比较清亮些。
(Jane resumed in a deeper voice, at a good pace and with her eyes again closed, at 9:58.)(9:58分珍闭着双眼，以比较低沉的声音继续口述，速度拿捏得很好。)
We will shortly conclude this evenings session.我们马上会为今晚的课做个结论。
I am attempting to take some workload from Joseph now. He needs a rest in this respect.We will however in our next session return to our usual format.我现在打算减轻约瑟一些工作负担，他这部分需要休息。我们下节课会回到平常的上课方式。
I will answer any questions that any of you might have.我会回答你们任何人想问的问题。
(I looked at Lorraine and Bill, but neither of them had a question prepared.I too was caught by surprise.)(我看着洛琳和比尔，但他们两人都没有准备问题。赛斯突然这么一问，我也措手不及。)
Otherwise we will shortly end.I am concerned that we return to our material, for there will be times when it will be necessary for us to focus our energies in other directions.Such circumstances will not arise frequently, but they will arise.I am most sympathetic, Joseph, to the predicament in which you found yourself last weekend, and when we are alone we will discuss efforts that may be taken in the future.You did very well, considering the whole situation.不然的话，我们很快就结束。我关注的是回到我们的资料，因为我们会有几次课必须把焦点放在其他方向上。这样的状况不会常常发生，但就是会发生。约瑟，对于上周末你自己发现的那种困境，我完全可以感同身受，等我们独处时可以讨论未来能做哪些努力。整体来看，你已经做得相当好了。
(The above passage refers to my parents. Seth has discussed them at various times in the past and his advice has been very helpful.Among others see the following sessions:17, 18, 21, 27, 53, 93 and 94, ranging through Volumes 1, 2 and 3.)(上面这一段指的是我父母，赛斯过去多次讨论到他们，他的建议也非常有用。其他相关资料可参看下面几节：第17、18、21、27、53、93和94节，分别在第一、二、三册。)
As always I regret leaving you.You may rest assured that I will hold my own with your psychologists. I am very fond of your Dr. Instream, however.We shall proceed in a way that will serve us all very well, and (louder) you need have no doubts concerning the affair in general.一如往昔我又要离开你们了，真令人不舍。你们放心，我会跟你们的心理学家坚守我自己的立场，我很喜欢你们的殷斯翠姆博士。我们会以对大家都非常好的方式继续前进(声音变得比较大)，对这些事大体上你们不必有疑虑。
It is very possible that Ruburt will soon discover that I am who I say I am.He knows this subconsciously, but I am speaking now of a conscious recognition.I now bid my friends a fond (deeper and louder) good evening.And if I do not sound like a nightingale, it may be said that I speak in tones not quite as bad as a grandfather frog.鲁柏很可能马上就会发现，我就是我说我是的那个人。他潜意识上知道这件事，不过我现在说的是一种意识上的认知。我要祝福各位朋友有个愉快(声音较低沉、大声)的夜晚。就算我的声音听起来不像夜莺那般悦耳，但或许我讲话的声调也并不完全像青蛙爷爷那么糟糕。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:05. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her voice maintained its deep tones until the end of the session.Seth closed out on a loud and deep and humorous note.And again, the peculiar accent that Bill Gallagher insists is not an Irish brogue, was in evidence at times during the session.)(10:05分结束，珍的出离如常，声音到结束时都一直维持深沉的音调。赛斯退离时声音宏亮、低沉，也很幽默。另外，比尔•加拉格坚持认为并非爱尔兰口音的那种独特腔调，偶尔再度明显出现在这节课当中。)

SESSION 173 第173节 梦世界与人格之间的关系


JULY 28, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年7月28日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Jane has been practicing psychological time regularly, but reports that she has achieved little besides her usual excellent state.She has had no unusual or startling experiences since Seth cut her psy-time periods to 20 minutes, in the 151st session.(珍已经开始规律练习心理时间好一阵子，不过她表示除了平常非常不错的状况外，并没有太多收获。自从赛斯在第151节把她的心理时间长度缩减为20分钟，到目前为止都还没有特别或令人惊奇的经验。
(Jane has had some striking clairvoyant and telepathic experiences outside of psy-time, however, and is keeping separate records of these.Three such instances in the last two weeks have been especially interesting. One was clairvoyant, two were telepathic.Two of the experiences have been verified so far by the other people involved.(不过，珍在心理时间之外曾经有过一些显著的千里眼和心电感应的经验，她也把这些经验另外记录下来。过去两周以来有三次这样的经验特别有趣，一次是千里眼，两次是心电感应。目前为止，其中两次经验已由相关人士验证过。
(This evenings session was held in our small back room, and was very peaceful and quiet.Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her voice was quiet and she used pauses for the first time in quite a few sessions.)(今晚的课在我们后面的小房间兴行，气氛非常安宁平静。珍闭上眼睛坐着说话。声音柔和，暂停好几次，这是最近这么多节以来首次出现暂停。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
We will have a quiet, and all in all a rather brief session.我们的课会很平静，而且整体说来也会相当简短。
We have taken advantage, and we will continue to do so, of good circumstances and high periods of psychic activity.It is only fair that I allow you to rest now and then.Very seldom will we have vacations as such, unless of course you request them.For this reason we will go slowly this evening.我们已善加利用了良好的情境和心灵活动的高峰阶段，而且会继续利用。我偶尔让你们休息一下，这颇为公平恰当。当然，除非你们提出要求，否则我们要有像这样的假期是非常少见的。为此，我们今晚会慢慢进行。
I will however begin a discussion concerning the personality and its relationship to those dreams which it creates.不过，我们会开始就人格和它所创造的那些梦来探讨两者这间的关系。
We have discussed this subject to some degree. However we have not begun a study in depth. It is now time for us to do so.The personality as you know is composed of energy gestalts. The dreams created by the personality can be considered therefore as a part of the changing personality.We are speaking here in one context only, for we know that the dream universe is also to some extent independent of personality.这个主题我们之前已讨论了一些，但还没有深入探究过，现在该是我们付诸行动的时候。如你们所知，人格由能量完形构成，因此人格所创造的梦可以当成是变动中人格的一部分。我们现在仅就单一背景来说，因为我们知道，梦宇宙多多少少也独立于人格之外。
In this particular context however the dream world will be considered in its relationship to the personality.In many ways the dream universe does operate within this context, and is part of the personality framework.As the personality is changed by any experience or any action, so it is changed by its own dreams.Here again we see how energy or action operates within itself. We can even trace the actions and interactions.在这个独特的背景下，可以来思考梦世界与人格之间的关系。从很多方面来看，梦宇宙确实会在这种背景下运作，而且也是人格架构的一部分。任何经验或行动都会改变人格，所以人格也会被它自己的梦改变。这里我们再度看到了能量或行动如何在它本身里面运作，我们甚至可以追踪这些行动和互动的状况。
As a personality is molded by his exterior circumstances, so is he also molded by the dreams that he creates, and which help to form his interior or psychic environment.To the whole self there is little differentiation made between actions that are of an exterior nature, and actions that are of an interior nature.While the ego makes these distinctions, the basic core of the personality does not do so.人格由他的外在情境形塑而成，所以他也是由他所创造的梦形塑而成，这些梦有助于形成他内在或心灵环境。对全我而言，外在性质的行动和内在性质的行动并没有什么区别。虽然自我会做这些区别，但人格的基本核心并不会这样做。
A particularly vivid dream is every bit as real to the inner self as a vivid psychological experience that occurs within the waking state.It is important here that we realize that as far as the basic self is concerned no distinctions are made in this respect.The personality creates its dreams; the dreams are then experienced.The experience is indelibly recorded, and then changes the personality, again, in the same manner that any experience would.对内我来说，一场特别鲜明的梦与一个醒时活生生的心理经验，其真实性完全一样。在这里我们必须了解，就基本的自己而言，这方面并没有什么区别，这一点很重要。人格创造它的梦；然后梦被人格经验。经验永远铭刻在记录中，接着又改变人格，任何经验都是如此运作。
The individual therefore reacts to his interior environment or psychic environment in the same way that he reacts to his physical situation.And as he changes his physical situation through reacting to it, so he changes his interior or psychic situation as he reacts to it.因此，个体以他对物质环境反应的同一种方式，也对他的内在环境或心灵环境起反应。正如他会透过对物质环境的反应而改变物质环境，他也可以透过对他内在环境或心灵环境的反应而改变它。
It goes without saying that the dream universe is every bit as real to the inner self as the physical universe is to the conscious egotistical self.The physical universe is relatively (underline relatively) as unimportant to the inner self as the dream universe appears to be to the egotistical self.梦宇宙对内我的真实性，就跟物质宇宙对意识自我(the conscious egotistical self)的真实性完全一样，这一点不用多说。物质宇宙对内我相对不重要，就如梦宇宙对意识自我也比较不重要一样。
The core of the self is obviously aware of all realities to some extent.If portions of the self did not coincide then it would be impossible for the whole personality to ever operate as a unit.Here we simply have spirals, so to speak, of ever moving actions that compose the whole self.But portions of these spirals coincide, and in this analogy the spirals of action not only have those dimensions which you understand, but other dimensions with which you are not yet familiar.核心的自己显然多少知道所有的实相。假如自己的各部分不一致，那整个人格就不可能以一个单位整体运作。可以这样说，这里我们有许多永续行动的螺旋(spirals)组成了全我。不过，这些螺旋的一部分彼此重叠，在这个比喻里，行动的螺旋不但有那些你们认识的维度，也有你们还不熟悉的其他维度。
The designations put upon these units of action are highly artificial, and represent limitations that are quite arbitrary.We mentioned in an earlier session something to this effect, in that you simply perceive a small portion of such action, label it as a unit, can perceive no further, and so suppose that what you see or perceive is all there is to see or perceive.加诸于这些行动单位的名称都相当人工化，它们代表了非常武断的框架限制。在之前的某节课里，我们对这种效果曾提出一些讨论，因为你们只感知到这种行动的一小部分，并把它称为一个单位，没能进一步觉察，所以就认为你们看到、感知到的，就是所有能看、能感知的。
The self is limitless.Where your perceptions fail, boundaries seem to appear.This has much to do with your conception of the reality of dreams, for it appears to you that dreams cease when you are no longer aware of them.Another portion of the self however is aware of them.自己是无限制的。当你们无法感知时，界限仿佛就会出现。这跟你们对梦实相的概念关系相当密切，因为你们似乎认为一旦你们不再觉知梦，梦就会戛然而止。其实，另一部分的自己是可以觉知到它们的。
You may take your first break, and we will continue.你们可以第一次休息，然后我们再继续。
(Break at 9:23.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first break. Her pace had been good, even with pauses.(9:23分休息。珍第一阶段的出离状况跟平常一样，速度一直都很好，当中暂停几次。
(Seth has discussed dreams to some extent in many sessions; too many to list here.He was discussing nightmares as far back as the 15th session, dream locations in the 44th session among others, the layers of the subconscious and dreams in the 92nd session.For a few examples of the manner in which Seth interprets dreams, see the 85th, 93rd and 94th sessions.See the 151st session for material on dreams, moment points and time, the 162nd for dreams and the electrical field, the 164th for dreams and impeding actions.(赛斯在许多节课里或多或少都讨论过梦；由于太多，这里无法一一列出。他早在第15节就讨论到梦魇的问题，第44节和其他章节讨论到梦地点，第92节则是谈到潜意识和梦的层次。有关赛斯解梦方式的一些例子，可参看第85、93和94节。第151节可看到有关梦、片刻点和时间的资料，第162节是有关梦和电子场域的讨论，第164节则是梦与阻碍性行动的相关资料。
(Jane resumed, again with her eyes closed, and sitting down, in a quiet voice, and at a brisk pace, at 9:31.)(珍闭上眼睛坐着口述，声音柔和，节奏轻快，9:31分继续。)
On one level the personality does attempt to solve problems through dream construction.某个层面来讲，人格打算透过梦的建构来解决问题。
In many cases these problems are not those belonging to the ego, but to other layers of the self.We spoke in a fairly recent session of illnesses as impeding actions.(See the 163rd and 164th sessions.)在许多情况下，这些问题不是那些属于自我的问题，而是属于自己其他层次的问题。在最近的课里，我们谈过疾病是阻碍性的行动。(见第163和第164节。)
In dreams the personality first attempts to solve many problems, and to give freedom to actions that cannot be adequately expressed within the confines of the physical universe.在梦中人格首先会试图解决许多问题，并为那些在物质宇宙的限制范围中，无法充分展现的行动，提供了自由。
If the personality handles his dream activities capably, then the problem action finds release.When the ego is too rigid, it will even attempt to censor dreams.When the personality in general is too rigid, freedom of action is not entirely permitted even in the dream state.如果人格能巧妙掌握他的梦活动，那么这个问题行动就可以得到释放。如果自我太过僵化，甚至就会想办法审查梦。一般来说，人格如果过于僵化，那么即使在梦境里，行动也无法完全获得自由。
When this solution fails the impeding action will then materialize as a physical illness, or as an undesirable psychological condition.The dream experience however is much more richly varied than you suppose.There are ways which we shall discuss that will enable a personality to deal more effectively with the dream situation, and to use it more effectively with the dream situation, and to use it more effectively.如果这个解决方法失败，阻碍性行动就会具体成为身体上的疾病，或不受欢迎的心理状况。梦经验的变化实际上比你们认为的还要丰富精彩得多。我们未来会讨论一些方法，让人格能更有效地处理梦情境、善用梦情境。
This is a rather simplified explanation.Consider however a situation in which the personality needs to express dependency, but feels that such an expression is not possible within his waking experience.If he is able to dream in such a manner that he can construct dream dramas in which he plays a dependent part, then the action is satisfied.这是一种相当简化的解释。不过，可以思考一种情况，比如说，人格需要表达依赖性，可是觉得在醒时状况不可能表达。如果他可以做一场梦，在梦里他可以当自己的编剧，剧中可以演出依赖的桥段，那么这个行动就得到满足。
In many instances this is exactly what happens.The individual would not of course as a rule remember such a dream on a conscious level.Psychologically however the experience would be completely valid, and the dependency therefore expressed.许多场合中，这就是实际会发生的状况。当然这个人在意识层次上通常不记得这样的梦。不过心理上来讲，这个经验完全有作用，依赖性因此可以表达出来。
(The above paragraph brings to mind the fact that Seth discussed a dream of Bill Macdonnel’s during the 84th session; Bill witnessed the session, and afterwards told us he had no conscious memory of the dream, which had taken place a few days before the session according to Seth.Yet Seth analyzed the symbolic content of the dream rather thoroughly, saying it was an important one for Bill since it bore upon his home and professional life.See Volume 1.)(上面这段让我想起一件事，赛斯在第84节中曾讨论比尔•麦唐纳的一个梦；比尔见证了那一节，后来告诉我们他意识上不记得有这个梦，根据赛斯的说法，那个梦是在那节课的前几天做的。不过赛斯把梦里的象征内容分析得非常透彻，他说对比尔而言，那是一个重要的梦，因为里面涵盖了他的家庭和职场生活的状态。见第一册。)
Dreams can be interpreted as you know from many viewpoints, since their reality exists within various aspects of actuality.The dream experience itself, and I cannot stress this too strongly, is as real as any experience to the basic self.It follows that instructions may be given to the self, so that various problems can be solved within the dream situation.如你们所知，梦可以从许多观点来诠释，因为梦的实相存在于各种不同的现实面向当中。对基本的自己来说，梦经验本身就跟任何经验一样真实，这一点再怎么强调也不为过。因此我们或许可以提供一些操作指南给自己，以便在梦境中解决各种疑难杂症。
The solution may or may not be given to the consciousness.In many instances this would not be necessary.The inner ego of which we have spoken is the director of such unifying activities, and while the inner ego is mainly concerned with inner reality, it is also aware of physical existence.意识可能会、也可能不会获知这些解决方法。许多状况下，意识并不需要知道。我们说过的内在自我就是这种统合活动的指挥者，虽然内在自我主要是跟内在实相有关，但它也能知觉到物质的存在。
(Jane now took a long pause, sitting quietly without moving for perhaps a minute.It was the first such pause she had used in quite a few sessions.)(珍这时暂停好久，身体不动，安静坐着长达或许一分钟左右，这是她最近很多节课以来第一次暂停。)
The inner ego is indeed the “I” of your dreams, having somewhat the same sort of position within the inner self as the ego itself has to the physical self.Actions however merge within the inner ego. The scope of awareness is more complex.We will at a later time discuss this inner ego in connection with the dream situation and health.实际上，内在自我就是你们梦里面的“我”，它在内我里面的位置就跟自我在物质的自己(physical self)当中的位置有点类似。不过，行动会融入内在自我当中，觉知的范围更复杂。我们后面会讨论这个内在自我跟梦境和健康之间的关联。
Dream dramas are not nebulous theater-like productions. Their own dimensions, in their way, are every bit as valid as those of waking life. They are as coherent. They affect the self sometimes to an even greater degree.The dream personalities are indeed fragments, projections of the self, all working out various roles, seeking various experiences, searching for solutions and gratifications.梦的戏码并不像剧场作品那么含糊不清，它们本身的维度，以它们的方式，与那些醒时生活的维度一样真实有效，它们相互连贯，而且它们对自己(self)有时候甚至会产生更大的影响。事实上，梦中的人格都是片段体，是自己的投射，可以演出各种不同的角色、寻求不同的经验，也会寻找问题的解决之道与喜悦的事物。
(The word fragment was first used in the 4th session, Volume 1, page 22, by Frank Watts.Actually the Frank Watts personality was in the process of being superseded by Seth then, and on the next page Seth announced his presence by name. This was on December 8,1963.The word compartment had been used in the third session, with a similar meaning.)(片段体这个词，首次出现在第一册第4节，由法兰克•沃兹提到。事实上，法兰克•沃兹人格那时正处于赛斯接替的过程中，在第4节中，赛斯才以名字宣布自己的存在，那天是1963年12月8日。第3节曾提到间隔(compartment)这个词，意义也类似。)
These dream personalities or fragments indeed have their own consciousness. They are as unaware, and as aware, of you as you are of them.They exist once you have created them.No action can be withdrawn. It must complete its nature according to the dimensions in which it exists, and so the dream personalities or fragments continue to exist whether or not you are aware of them.这些梦中的人格或片段体实际上都有它们自己的意识，它们可以觉察不到你，也可以觉察到你，就像你对它们觉察的状况一样。一旦你创造了它们，它们就会存在。行动无法被抽离，必须根据它所存在的维度来体现它自己的本质，所以梦中的人格或片段体会持续存在，不管你是否意识到它们都是如此。
The inner ego however is to some degree still familiar with their activities.Solutions found by these dream personalities are automatically picked up by the inner ego, and transmitted to the various levels of the self.The dream world changes as the personality changes, so that it is always a part of the mobile personality framework.不过，内在自我多少也了解它们的活动。内在自我会自动捡拾这些梦中人格找到的解决方法，并传送给各个不同层面的自己。人格如果改变，梦世界就会改变，因为梦世界永远都是流动多变的人格架构其中的一部分。
It is always within this framework, but not always does it maintain the same relative position within it.The stability of the personality depends in some degree upon the effectiveness with which it handles and manipulates these dream situations.It is realized that the personality manipulates within the physical universe, but the fact is not generally accepted that similar manipulations must be made within this dream universe.它一直都在这个架构里面，但并不是永远都在里面维持同样的相对位置。人格的稳定性或多或少取决于它掌握或操控这些梦境的效能。人格会在物质宇宙之内操控，这一点众所周知，不过人格在梦宇宙之内也一定会做类似的操控，这一点大家普遍都不知道。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:01.Jane was dissociated as usual. She said she can usually recall what she said when she is dealing with personalities, such as Dr. Instream.She finds the kind of abstract material presented above difficult to retain, however, outside of a very general idea.(10:01分休息。珍的出离状况如常，她说，跟殷斯翠姆博士这样的人格打交道时，通常可以回想起她说过的内容。不过，她发现像上面这种抽象的资料就很难记得住，因为内容远超过一般的概念。
(Jane had delivered the above material while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice had been quiet, her manner slow and with pauses.She resumed in the same fashion at 10:07.)(珍闭上眼睛坐着传述了上面的资料，声音轻柔，动作轻缓，停顿几次。10:07分以同样的方式继续口述。)
Much work has been done in the attempt to interpret dreams. None, or very little, has been done to control dreams, or to control the direction of activity within dreams.大家付出很多努力想解释梦，但却很少或未曾努力去控制梦或梦中活动的方向。
Upon proper suggestion the personality will work out specific problems in the dream state, as earlier mentioned.If the solution is not clear to the ego, this does not mean that the solution has not been found, necessarily.There may even be instances where it is not only unnecessary but undesirable that the ego be familiar with such a solution.如同稍早提过的，在适当的暗示下，人格可以在梦境中解决特定的问题。如果自我不清楚解决方法，不见得表示解决方法没有找到。有些情形甚至是，自我不必要也不想要了解这样的解决方式。
This problem-solving aspect of dreams is rather important, and can be utilized with rather impressive practical results.We are merely beginning to scratch the surface here in this discussion, and we will devote a number of sessions to it.We have spoken about the importance of expectation.With practice dream activities can also be directed in this direction.梦可以解决问题的这个面向相当重要，而且可以运用在令人印象深刻的实际结果上。我们这里的讨论只是开始搔到皮毛而已，之后还会花很多节课来探讨。我们之前谈过期望的重要性。透过练习，也可以将梦的活动引导到这个方向。
(For some material on expectation see the following sessions, among others: 79, 135, 157, 158, 159, 160, 163, 164, 169, in Volumes 2, 3, and 4.)(有关期望的其他资料可参考下列章节：第二、三、四册的第79、135、157、158、159、160、163、164及169节。)
Dreams do express a personality’s basic reality.Negative dreams tend to reinforce the negative aspects of the personality, helping to form vicious circles of unfortunate complications.Upon suggestion dream actions can be turned toward fulfilling constructive expectations, which can themselves effect a definite change for the better in the personality involved.梦确实表达人格的基本实相。负面的梦容易强化人格的负面面向，而形成不幸的结果，于是恶性循环。在暗示下，梦的行动可以经由导引来实现建设性的期望，它们本身确实可以为该人格带来更好的改变。
I am speaking now of general circumstances, since there are occasions when negative actions seek expression quite legitimately, and without any danger to the personality involved.We will have much more to say concerning these connections between dream actions and the balanced personality.Again, there are many ways in which dreams can be used beneficially, and with deliberation.我现在是就一般状况来说，因为有时候负面行动也会寻求相当合情合理的表达，而不会对该人格造成任何危险。有关梦中的行动与平衡的人格之间的这些关系，我们还有很多东西要说。此外，你们也可以在许多方面有效、审视地利用梦。
I told you that this would be a fairly brief session, and so There end it.My best regards to you both.Do you have any questions?我告诉过你们，这节课会很简短，所以我就在这里停止。送上我最深情的祝福给你们俩。你有任何问题吗？
(“Do you dream？”)(“你会做梦吗？”)
I do dream, but not necessarily while in a sleeping state.I am conscious of these actions that occur within the psychological framework of my personality.Theoretically the human personality can, or could, be conscious of dreams even while he was in a waking state.Practically however this does not appear to be of benefit, nor does it seem to occur.我的确会做梦，但不一定是睡觉时做。我可以意识到那些在我人格心理架构里面出现的行动。理论上人类人格甚至可以，或可能在醒时状态下意识到梦。不过实际上来讲，这不见得是好事，而且似乎也不会发生。
The human personality within the physical system cannot juggle realities with any ease.If you have no more questions we will end the session.物质系统内的人类人格要玩弄实相一点也不简单。如果你们没有任何问题，那我们就结束了。
(“How’s my old friend, Frank Watts?”(“我的老朋友法兰克·沃兹还好吧？”
(Jane smiled, a reaction that I expected.It will be remembered that the sessions began when Jane contacted the Frank Watts personality.Frank Watts in turn is a fragment of the Seth entity.Seth discussed Frank Watts to some degree in the 85th and 88th sessions, promising more data in the future.)(珍笑了笑，这是我预期的反应。还记得我们的课是珍接触到法兰克·沃兹人格时才开始的。法兰克·沃兹是赛斯存有的一个片段体，赛斯在第85节和88节课时，稍微讨论过法兰克·沃兹，也答应未来会提供更多资料。)
I greatly enjoy your laudable concern with Frank Watts.He is indeed quite well, thank you.你对法兰克·沃兹的关心令人赞赏，我很高兴。他真的很好，谢谢你。
(“Is that all you’re going to say about him!”(“对于他，你要说的就只有这样？”
(Jane smiled again.)(珍又笑了。)
He is on his own. I will some evening say more.他现在自己独立行动，我再找个晚上多说一点。
(“Has Dr. Instream listened to the tape we sent him?”(“殷斯翠姆博士听了我们给他的录音带吗？”
(We mailed the tape of the 170th session to Dr. Instream on Friday, July 23. This is the session Seth addressed to Dr. Instream.)(我们在7月23日星期五那天，把第170节课的录音带寄给殷斯翠姆博士。)
He has.他听过了。
(“What did he think of it?”)(“他觉得如何？”)
He was fascinated.非常感兴趣。
(“Did anybody else listen to it with him?”)(“还有其他人和他一起听吗？”)
I do not know.我不知道。
(“Well I guess that’s it, then.”(“好，那我想就这样吧。”
(After a short pause Jane’s eyes opened.(停了一会儿之后，珍张开眼睛。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:27.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet.She said Seth had felt no apparent urge to elaborate on any of his answers to my questions.He was concerned mainly with the general material.She said she sensed a slight irritation on Seth’s part when I asked if anybody else had listened to the tape with Dr. Instream; it was as though Seth could get the information to answer the question, but didn’t feel inclined to so exert himself.(10:27分结束。珍的出离状况如常，声音轻柔，眼睛一直闭着。她说，赛斯懒得详细回答我任何问题，她关心的主要还是一般资料。还说，当我在问是否有别人跟殷斯翠姆博士一起听录音带，她感觉到赛斯有点不耐烦；情况似乎是赛斯可以得到讯息来回答这个问题，但他不想这么费力。
(Jane said that after thinking over the recent occasions when strong voice effects were demonstrated, as in the 170th and 172nd sessions, she feels that Seth uses the voice as an insulator for herself and as a projection of himself.)(珍说，她仔细思考过最近那几节展现强烈声音效果的课，如第170和172节，后来发觉赛斯是把这种声音当做珍自己的绝缘体，也当做赛斯自己的一种投射在使用。)

SESSION 174 第174节　梦的疗法


AUGUST 2, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年8月2日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(To our surprise, we received the tape of the 170th session back from Dr. Instream on July 29th, Thursday.We had mailed it to him on July 23rd, Friday, taking it for granted he would want to keep it for a while.No letter accompanied the tape.We noticed the tape had been transferred to a new reel, so took it for granted that Dr. Instream had played the tape, as stated by Seth in the 173rd session of July 28 th.(出乎意料的是，我们在7月29日星期四那天，收到殷斯翠姆博士寄回来的第170节课录音带。我们7月23日星期五寄给他。理所当然认为他应该会保留一阵子。录音带没有附上信件。我们也注意到，录音带已经捲到另一个轴心，所以可以确定殷斯翠姆博士听过，就如赛斯在7月28日第173节课最后所说的。
(In the 166th session, which John Bradley witnessed, Seth stated that the stock of John’s company, G.D. Searle, would go very low before making a recovery presumably. This was on June 30,1965.Since we have been watching it Searle stock has fluctuated somewhat. On July 3 it closed at 54 1/2 . On July 29 it reached a low of 50 1/2. On August 3 it closed at 53 1/4.(在由约翰·布莱德利见证的第166节课里面，赛斯说，约翰的塞尔公司股价可能会跌得很惨，然后反弹。那天是1965年6月30日，从那时起，我们一直关注塞尔的股价，发现稍有波动。7月3日以54.5元作收， 7月29日来到50.5的低点，8月3日收盘时回到53.25元。
(The session tonight was held in our back room, and was again a quiet one.Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her voice was quiet, her pace rather slow.)(今晚这一节在我们后面的房间举行，同样是个安静的夜晚。珍闭上眼睛坐着说话，声音温和，速度非常慢。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I cannot stress too strongly the fact that mankind in general is aware of very little outside of physical reality.人类对于物质实相以外的世界通常知道得非常少，我这样说一点也不夸张。
He has managed to organize physical reality because he focuses so intensely within it. His knowledge of other realities is limited however to infrequent glimpses. He perceives bits and pieces of other realities.As long as his perception in this manner is so disorganized and so fragmentary he cannot hope to compose any conception of the total.他会设法组织物质实相，因为他在这里面太过聚焦了，而对于其他实相的了解只限于罕见的惊鸿一瞥，所感知到的其他实相也只是零零碎碎的东西。只要他感知的方式是这么没组织、这么零散，就无法指望能组合出任何整体的概念。
The nearest field of reality outside of the immediately physical one is the area of dreams. This field has been given very little study. It represents in many ways a meeting ground between psychic and physical existence.You realize here that the terms psychic and physical are merely designations used for the sake of convenience.在贴身的物质场域以外，最接近的实相场域就是梦领域，有关梦领域的研究极为稀少，它在许多方面都代表了心灵与物质存在的一种交会处。你也知道，这里所说的心灵和物质，只是为了方便而使用的名称。
I have mentioned before that in its own way the dream universe is as permanent as the physical universe.Basically its structure is somewhat the same, in that it is composed of atoms and molecules. These particles however simply exist within a different perspective.The inner logic is much more consistent within the dream universe, and action is permitted greater freedom in several important respects.我以前说过，梦宇宙，以它自己的方式，就跟物质宇宙一样耐久。基本上，它的结构有些相同，因为它是由原子与分子组合而成，只是这些粒子存在于一个不同的视角。在梦宇宙里，内在逻辑一致得多，而且在某些重要的面向上，行动可以获得更大的自由。
The interrelationship between the waking state and the sleeping state has never been clearly understood.One of the main differences between the waking and sleeping states is merely the almost complete change of focus that is involved.When you are using intellectual methods alone you will necessarily fall short in any study of the dream reality.Man is indeed his intellect, but he is much else besides.醒时状态与睡时状态两者间的相互关系，从来都未被清楚了解过。醒时与睡时状态的主要差异，仅仅是涉入的焦点完全改变。如果你只单独使用理性的方法，必然达不到任何梦实相研究的标准。人类真的就只知道用理性，但除了理性之外，人类还有更多。
The intuitions must go hand in hand with the intellect. The intellect is useful in interpreting your data in terms that the ego can understand.The intuitions come close to mankinds source, and it is through the intuitions that information pertaining to the dream reality will come.直觉必须与理性并用，在解释你们的资料时，理性的用处是可以让自我了解资料内容。直觉很接近人类的根源，若想获得梦实相的相关讯息，得要透过直觉。
The experience involved in learning to change your own focus of awareness will be most beneficial.It will even add to the beneficial nature of your own dreams. You do not have to sleep to dream.Every individual has had his daydreams, and here you can see more clearly this change of focus. I meant to mention this earlier. Ruburt can request levitation dreams, and he will have them.学习改变你自己意识焦点的经验极有帮助，它甚至可以提升你们梦的助益价值。你不一定要睡觉才能做梦，每个人都做过白日梦，这时你可以更清楚看到焦点的转换。我之前就想提这件事，鲁柏可以请求做漂浮梦(levitation dreams)，他将会做这种梦。
(Jane already has; two nights ago.)(珍两天前已经做过。)
Now.If the basic personality is fairly well balanced, then his existence in the dream reality will reinforce his physical existence.The opposite will also hold true. You are involved in a juggling of realities. The dream reality is simply the nearest reality with which you are concerned outside of your physical preoccupation.It is necessary to see the personality as it operates within both realities, if you are interested in viewing the personality as a whole.And even then unless you delve deeply you will fall short.现在。如果基本人格相当平衡，那么他在梦实相的存在就会强化他物质的存在，反之亦然。你们已经被实相的花招给耍了，梦实相只是你们对物质的关注之外，与你们最接近的一种实相。如果你们对于将人格视为整体有兴趣的话，就必须了解人格在这两种实相之内运作的情形。而且除非你们深入探究，否则还是无法透彻了解。
Studies of space and distance as they are experienced in dreams will be helpful, and our material will indeed deal with such discussions.For investigation into the nature of space and time as they are experienced within the dream framework, will tell you more about the real nature of space and time then you can ever learn through studying their distorted appearances within physical reality.This will be most important to us.探究在梦里如何经验空间和距离，非常有帮助，我们的资料一定会讨论这部分。因为与你们在物质实相中研究被扭曲的时间与空间相比，探讨在梦架构中经验到的时间与空间之本质，才会让你们更了解时间与空间真正的本质。这对我们极为重要。
I suggest your first break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:24.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery.She resumed in the same quiet and slow manner, with her eyes closed, at 9:32.)(9:24分休息。珍第一阶段口述的出离状况如常。9:32分她闭着眼睛继续口述，声音一样和缓轻柔。)
In normal memory you recall, obviously, but a slight percentage of your dreams, and usually these are from more surface levels.就一般的记忆来讲，你们显然只记得一部分的梦，而且这些梦经常是来自比较表层。
I would suggest that you tell yourselves that you will henceforth be able to remember dreams from the deeper levels of your personality, and you should find that you will be able to do so.我会建议你们可以告诉自己，今后你将会记得来自人格更深层的梦，那么你们应该就会发现真的可以记得住。
(Jane is in her second year of keeping records of her dreams, and has written down several hundred.Since September of 1965, a period of 11 months, I have recorded 185 dreams.Jane recorded 103 dreams for 1964, and so for 1965 has recorded 303 dreams, for a total of406 dreams to date.)(珍记录梦的习惯已进入第二年，她记下好几百个梦。从1965年[译注：这里应是1964年，可能是约瑟的笔误]9月开始，这11个月内，我记了185个梦。珍在1964年记了103个梦，1965年记了303个梦，迄今为止一共记了406个梦。)
You can also tell yourselves when you wish that you will give special attention to the nature of time and space, as these appear within your dreams.You will discover then upon awakening that many perceptions concerning time and space within the dream state will remain with you.你们也可以告诉自己，当时间和空间出现在梦里，你们会想特别留意时间和空间的本质。那么醒过来后，就会发现自己记住了许多有关梦里时间和空间的知觉。
As I mentioned, your psychological time experiences will also help you to investigate the nature of time and space to some degree.如同我提过的，心理时间的经验或多或少也有助于你们探讨时空的本质。
In this sort of an investigation instructions then can be given before sleeping, and a portion of the self will indeed continue to work for you in this manner.You can indeed learn much concerning events; but what we are mainly concerned with here is the stuff of dreams, and the framework within which they have their existence.在这样的探讨中，睡前可以给一些指引，那么自己的某一部分就真的会以这种方式继续为你运作。你的确可以知道许多相关的事；但我们这里主要关注的是梦的内容，以及它们的存在所依附的架构。
For the framework is the same framework in which you have your physical existence.We will make you investigators even in your sleep; and you can see now how your very investigations are bound to change the nature of your dreams themselves.Only in this case nothing will be lost, and much gained.It is unfortunate that medical men who deal with the mind as a specialty have not thought of some of these connections more thoroughly.这个架构跟你们的物质存在所依附的架构相同，我们甚至会让你们在睡觉中也成为探究者；你们现在就可以了解，为什么你们这个探究一定会改变你们梦自身的本质。唯有如此，才不会漏掉任何东西，且能有很大的收获。令人遗憾的是，把心灵当作一种专业在处理的医疗人员，对于这一类的相互关联欠缺更周到的考虑。
Many problems could be worked out in the dream state.Dependency feelings that are overwhelming could be given freer and safer expression, if the patient had the suggestion given to him that he would dream of himself in dependent positions.He could then behave in the physical environment with greater confidence. He could to some extent have his cake and eat it too.许多问题在梦中可以解决。如果病患得到一个暗示说，他会梦到自己处于依赖的状态，那么强烈的依赖感便可以获得更自由、更安全的表达空间。于是他就可以在物质环境中表现得更有信心，某程度他便可以两全其美，鱼与熊掌兼而得之。
For once more, to the basic personality an experience is important according to its vividness or significance on an intimate basis.The personality does not differentiate between a waking or a sleeping experience in any real manner. This also is not clearly understood.Dream therapy could offer great advantages, but here again it could be dangerous in the hands of unscrupulous or rigid personalities.再说一次，对基本人格而言，一个经验的重要性，会取决于它对于这个人格的生动程度和意义。基本上人格并不会区分醒时经验和睡时经验，这一点大家也不是很了解。梦的疗法有很大的优点，不过，如果在不道德或固执僵化的人格手中，可能就会有危险。
The rigidity of a personality is its downfall. We will have some sessions dealing with dream therapy.Through such therapy actions would be allowed greater spontaneity, and channels would not be clogged by impeding actions to any great degree.Dream therapy would actually involve no more than lending a helping hand to a phenomena that already occurs.人格的衰败肇因于它的固执僵化，我们会花几节课的时间讨论梦的疗法。透过这样的治疗，各种行动可以获得更大的自发性，各个管道也绝对不会被阻碍性行动严重阻塞。实际上梦疗法只不过是为已经发生的现象助上一臂之力。
Both psychological and physical illnesses could be largely avoided in such a manner. Rather harmlessly, aggressive tendencies could also be given freedom.The individual involved would experience the aggressiveness, and yet he would hurt no one.Suggestions could even be given so that he learned to understand his own aggressiveness through watching himself in the dream state.心理上和身体上的疾病大都可以用这种方式避免，攻击倾向也可以获得释放，不会造成危害。当事人可以经验攻击的感觉，而又不会伤害任何人。也可以借由给予暗示，使他能透过在梦中对自己的观察，来学习了解自己的攻击倾向。
This is not as farfetched as it might seem. Much seemingly erratic antisocial behavior could be avoided through such dream therapy.I will even say that crimes of the grossest sort could be prevented. The desired but feared actions would not then gather up toward an explosion.The habitual, overly-aggressive or overly-dependent tendencies would not result in habitual aggressive or dependent behavior, for each individual action would be harmlessly expressed.这种做法并不像表面上看起来那么遥不可及，像是许多看似荒诞不经的反社会行为，经过这样的梦疗法就可以避免。我甚至会说，很多重大犯罪可以防患于未然，而那些让人又爱又怕的行动，也不会累积到爆点。至于那些惯有的过分攻击、过分依赖的习性，就不会造成惯常的攻击或依赖行为，因为每一个个别行动都可以表达出来，不会造成伤害。
If I may indulge in a fantasy, theoretically you could indeed imagine a massive experiment in dream therapy, where wars were fought by the sleeping and not by the waking nations.We will discuss this whole question very thoroughly, as I have been leading up to it for a while.如果我可以天马行空地幻想，那么理论上你们在梦疗法里，真的能想像真实的体验情境，国家间的战争只发生在睡觉时，而不是在醒时状况。我已经把话题引导到这整个问题一会儿了，所以我们将可以彻底讨论。
I am not suggesting that you substitute dream reality for your so-called waking reality. I am mainly suggesting that the two can reinforce each other to a larger degree than you recognize.Also it is difficult for you to accept the idea that experience within dreams is as vivid and valid a part of the personality as its waking experience.我不是建议你们要以梦实相代替你们所谓的醒时实相，我主要是说这两者彼此互相增益的程度，远比你们想像的还要大。梦中经验跟醒时经验完全一样，都是人格活生生、确实有效的一部分，但这个观念你们也很难接受。
The inner ego is quite capable of dealing with both types of experience, and it is of course to this inner ego that your own suggestions will make sense, and be acted upon.内在自我很有能力处理这两种经验，对它来说，你们自己的暗示当然都有意义，都可以实现。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:02.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her delivery had been somewhat faster this time, though still quiet.Her eyes had remained closed.She resumed in the same fashion at 10:08.)(10:02分休息。珍的出离状况如常，这次的口述声音虽然轻柔，但速度快了些。眼睛一直闭着。10:08分以同样的方式继续。)
There are however many considerations here that must be understood.不过这里有许多考量，你们必须了解。
We can only begin to discuss them this evening. They are vital and must not be overlooked.When or if, for example, aggressiveness is the problem, then the preliminary suggestion should include a statement that in the dream the aggression will be harmlessly acted out (underline harmlessly), and not directed against a particular individual.我们今晚的讨论只是个开头，这些考量极其重要，绝不可忽略。比方说，如果是攻击性的问题，那刚开始的暗示应该要包含以下这句话：在梦里攻击行为将会表现出来，但不会造成伤害，也不会针对某一个人。
The subconscious is quite capable of handling the situation in such a manner.This may seem like a double censure, but it is in all cases the intangible element, the aggressiveness itself, that is important, and not the person or persons toward whom the individual may decide to vent the aggressiveness.潜意识相当有能力以这样的方式掌握状况。这看来或许像是一种双重指责，但不管在什么状况下，重要的是那个无形的要素，也就是攻击性本身，而不是当事人可能决定要对哪一个或哪些对象发泄攻击能量。
When the aggressiveness is released, then there will be no need for a victim.We do not want, in other words, to direct an individual to dream about a situation in which he is attacking a particular individual.There are many reasons for this, both telepathic realities which you do not as yet understand, and guilt patterns which would be unavoidable.This again is vital, and we shall discuss such matters to some degree.攻击能量释放后，就不再需要有受害者。换言之，我们不想引导一个人梦到他去攻击某个人的情境。这有很多原因，包括你们还不了解的心电感应实相，以及无可避免的罪恶感模式。这一点也重要至极，我们会稍微讨论这类问题。
Again, we are not attempting to substitute dream action for physical action, generally speaking. We are talking about specific problems that may arise that need treatment.As far as general practice is concerned, we will deal with our dreams in a much more positive and constructive manner, along the lines of expectation.另外，一般来说我们不打算以梦行动取代实质行动，我们说的是一些可能出现也需要处理的具体问题。就一般的做法来说，我们会怀抱着期望，以更正面、更有建设性的方式来处理我们的梦。
Problem solving will also come under this classification, where solutions are being sought.In our discussion of dependency and aggression I was speaking of potentially dangerous situations, in which an individual shows signs of being unable to cope with these psychological actions through ordinary methods of adaption.No one can deny that a war fought by dreaming men, at specified times, would be less harmful than a physical war, to return to my flight of fancy.问题的解决也属于这一类，在那里可以找到解决之道。我们讨论依赖性和攻击性时，我提到了潜在的危险情境，在这些情境中个体出现一些征兆，显示他无法透过一般的适应方式，来应付这些心理行动。回到我刚才的幻想航程，一场由做梦的人在特定时间打的仗带来较少的伤害，这一点没有人能否认。
There would still be repercussions, however, though less disastrous, that would be unavoidable.For again, basically the personality does not differentiate between a waking and a sleeping experience.The importance of any experience is judged by the personality according to its personal vividness and significance.It is only the ego who makes other distinctions.这种情形造成的灾难虽然较少，但仍然有其无可避免的不良后果。因为如同前面提过的，基本上人格不会分辨醒时经验与睡时经验。任何经验的重要性，都是由人格依据个人的生动程度和意义来判断。只有自我会做其他的分辨。
(Jane now took a long pause.)(珍这时暂停了好一阵子。)
This evenings session will serve as a basis for many to come.今晚的课可以做为后面许多课的基础。
You will hear from your Dr. Instream shortly.你们很快就会有殷斯翠姆博士的消息。
(Another long pause.)(再度暂停许久。)
I will now bid you a fond good evening, and pleasant dreams to you both.祝福你们俩有个美好的夜晚和愉快的梦。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:25.Jane was a little more dissociated for the last delivery, she said. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet.She remembered some of the material.)(10:25分结束。珍说，她最后一段口述的出离状况稍微深了一些，声音轻柔，眼睛一直闭着，记得部分资料内容。)

SESSION 175 第175节　传述课程受电磁干扰　第一次远程透视


AUGUST 4, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年8月4日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Once again the session was held in our quiet back room.Both of us felt somewhat tired, but attributed it to the weather, which has been cloudy and oppressive for the past few days.Jane and I try to ignore such factors consciously, but have no doubt we feel the psychic effects of weather as much as anybody else.(这节课仍然在我们后面安静的房间举行。我们两人都觉得有点疲倦，不过那是因为天气的关系，这几天阴沉闷热。我和珍意识上都想忽略掉这些因素，但无疑地我们跟其他人一样，感觉到天气对我们造成的心灵影响。
(Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed. As in the last session her voice was very quiet and clear, and she used many pauses.We hoped to obtain more material on dream therapy.She began speaking at 9:01 actually.)(珍闭上眼睛坐着说话，跟上次一样，声音非常轻柔、清晰，也暂停很多次。我们希望能获得更多有关梦疗法的资料。她实际上从9:01分开始口述。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I see that we will have another quiet session.我看我们又会有一节安静的课。
We will take advantage of it by furthering several of our discussions.我们会利用这节课做些进一步的讨论。
I have spoken often concerning the importance of changing focus, altering the direction of consciousness.This does not involve a change in consciousness itself, merely a change in the direction in which consciousness is focused.This ability is obviously not only inherent within the human race, but it is used constantly in your ordinary life to some degree.Usually however this involves a rather surface change of focus, as your attentions are directed first upon specific physical areas, and then switched to other specific physical areas.我常常谈到有关改变焦点以及改变意识方向的重要性。这并不涉及意识本身的改变，只是意识聚焦的方向改变而已。人类显然不仅天生就在这种能力，而且在你们日常生活中也多多少少一直在使用。不过，这往往只涉及一种相当表面的焦点改变，因为你们的注意力一开始先放在某个特定的物质范围，然后再转换到另一个特定的物质范围。
This does not involve however a change of focus in depth.A change to a different level entirely occurs when the individual switches focus from physical reality to other realities.In the dream state obviously we have an example of such change.One of the main reasons why this is possible within the dream state, rather than in the waking state, is that survival necessities have usually been satisfied.无论如何，这并不涉及焦点深度上的改变。当一个人将焦点从物质实相转换到其他实相，才会全然产生不同层次的改变。梦境里显然我们就有这种变化的一个例子。为什么在梦境中才可能有这种情形，而醒时则没有？其主要原因就是生存需求通常已经获得满足。
(Jane now took what I term a long pause; lasting about a minute.Her pace had been slow; the above paragraph had been broken by many shorter pauses.)(此时珍停下来，这次是我所谓较久的暂停，大约持续一分钟。她的速度一直都不快；光上面这一段就被好几次较短的暂停打断。)
Such a change of focus demands a concentration in one area to the exclusion, as a rule, of other areas.In the waking state you are usually not aware of your dreaming existence.In your dreaming existence your physical environment is replaced by your dream environment.You react to both environments whenever you are concentrated within them.Our study of the dream state will take us into many other discussions, for you will learn much about the nature of uncamouflaged reality.这类的焦点改变，通常需要专注一个范围，而排除其他范围。醒时状态你们往往不会意识到梦中的存在。在你们的梦中存在里面，你们的物质环境被梦中环境取代。不管何时，只要你们专注在这两种环境里面，就会对它们有所反应。有关梦境的探讨将会把我们带入许多其他的讨论，你们对于非伪装实相的本质将会学到很多。
There are several ways that will allow you to change the focus of your own awareness when you choose.I am speaking now of a change regarding depth and levels.你们在选择改变自己的意识焦点时，有好几种方法。我现在说的是深度与层次上的改变。
(Jane took another pause. This one lasted a minute and a half by the clock. She sat quietly, eyes closed, her hands folded in her lap.It is probably as long a pause as she has taken during the sessions.Finally she resumed speaking, her voice quiet as before.)(珍再度暂停，这次长达一分钟，闭着眼睛安静坐着，双手交叠在膝盖上。这次暂停的时间，或许就跟她之前在课中暂停过的时间一样那么长。最后她继续讲话，声音跟之前一样轻柔。)
We will have an extremely brief session, as I can see, for various reasons, no important ones, we are falling short for this session.Or you may take a break and we will try again.We simply have a poor connection. The reasons have nothing particularly to do with any of the three of us, and occur very seldom.The conditions indeed are rather interesting in themselves, and will be discussed now or later.就我来看，因为基于各种原因，这一节课会极为简短，但都不是重要原因，我们这节课并未到达日常上课标准。或是说你们可以先休息一下，然后我们再试试看。我们单纯只是通讯不良，其原因与我们三人并没有特别相关，而且也很少发生。实际上这个状况本身还相当有趣，我们迟早都会讨论。
(“Well take a break and see what Jane says.”)(“我们就休息一下，再看看珍说什么。”)
As you wish.就照你的意思。
(Break at 9:18.Jane reported that she was dissociated as usual for a first break. She was as surprised as I was that Seth had announced a poor connection.We had no conscious ideas as to why this should be, and indeed this was the first time this problem had come up during the sessions.(9:18分休息。珍表示她第一次休息前的出离状况跟平常一样，对于赛斯说的通讯不良，我和珍一样都感到惊讶。至于为什么会这样，我们意识上都不明白，事实上，这还是头一遭在上课中碰到这样的问题。
(We thought our feeling tired nothing unusual, nor had we been concerned at any effect the weather might have upon us.Jane said that the extra long pause listed above was a most unusual one, however, in that it reminded her of being connected with a “dead” telephone.During most pauses, when she is aware of them, she feels that even though she may not be speaking she is still connected with a live source.(我们在想，我们觉得累也不是什么大不了的事，我们也不担心天气会对我们造成什么影响。不过，珍说上述这次超长的暂停很不寻常，因为这让她想到自己像是连上了一支“停用”的电话。在大多数她意识得到的暂停之中，她觉得即使自己没讲话，但依然与一个活的源头连接在一起。
(Jane elected to try to continue the session, since she felt all right.She resumed in the same quiet voice, though with a faster pace, and with her eyes again closed, at 9:25.)(珍觉得没事，选择试着继续上课。9:25分以同样轻柔的声音继续口述，速度比较快，眼睛再度闭着。)
The conditions do not originate with you personally, though they are at your end rather than at my end, and they have to do with electromagnetic disturbances that are, to some degree, cyclic, and to which you react.They form a sort of insulation which makes communication difficult.You can see that they occur infrequently, since this is the first time that they have annoyed us.They occur to some degree fairly frequently, but this period is one in which they are strong enough to exert some force.这种状况虽然出现在你们这边，而不是我这边，但起因不在于你们个人，而是跟电磁干扰有关，这些干扰有一定程度的循环周期，会引发你们的反应。它们形成一种阻碍，使沟通变得困难。你们可以发现，它们不常发生，因为这是它们第一次妨碍到我们。它们某程度也算发生得相当频繁，但这段时间的强度高到足以产生某些影响力。
Their action is inhibiting at your end.The weather has also a connection here, and your moods are affected by both.The period should be over by three o’clock, approximately, tomorrow afternoon, when the conditions dissipate, or begin to dissipate.就你们一端而言，它们是一种妨碍性的行动。这当中，天气也有关联，两者都影响到你们的心情。这段时间大概会持续到明天下午3点才结束，到时候状况就会消失或开始消失。
(“Can this condition produce distortions in the material?"(“这种状况会造成资讯的扭曲吗？”
(Naturally I wondered about this, and whether it was worth continuing the session under distortive conditions.)(我当然会对这个问题感到疑虑，也怀疑在扭曲的情况下是否值得继续上课。)
Theoretically, if they affected Ruburt’s ability to translate the material.There are no distortions in this evening’s session, such as it is.You have felt the effects of these conditions, and they have been felt by others.They are like pockets, and are not uniformly distributed.理论上来说应该会，如果它们影响到鲁柏转译资料能力的话。不过，今晚的课倒还好，并没有遭到扭曲。你们已经感受到这些状况的影响了，其他人也是。但它们就像钱财一样，并不是平均分配。
Your green plants are affected when the conditions prevail.如果这些状况普遍存在，你们的绿色植物就会受到影响。
(Jane's delivery had again slowed up somewhat, so that she began to use pauses.(珍传述的速度再度慢了下来，开始出现停顿。
(“The baby downstairs has been crying a lot lately, in the middle of the night.Do these conditions have anything to do with that?”)(“楼下的婴儿最近在半夜一直哭得很厉害，这些状况跟那个有关吗？”)
The child is also affected. I will not give you information dealing with the child this evening.这个小孩也受到影响，我今晚不会给你们有关这个小孩的讯息。
(Jane took another pause.The following material began to come through at 9:35 by our clock.Jane took many pauses while delivering it, and until just before break she sat quite still. Her eyes remained closed.Her manner was quiet and deliberate.)(珍又暂停一次。下面的资料在我们时钟9:35分时开始传来。珍口述时暂停了很多次，而且一直到休息前都坐着不动，双眼维持闭着，声音轻柔，态度从容。)
I would prefer that you not ask me questions about what I am going to say.接下来我要说的话，希望你们不要问我相关问题。
There are four men at a table, and we are under discussion. Dr. Instream being one, I believe. If not, then the man meets his physical description closely.One other man is along in years. One is much younger. I do not know the last man’s age.桌子旁边有4个男人，我认为，其中一位是殷斯翠姆博士，如果不是他，至少那个人的外观很像他。第二个男人的年龄也差不多，第三个男人年轻许多，最后那个男人的年龄我不知道。
A large coffee urn is nearby. Papers, no tablecloth.Someone may be taking notes. Some indecision, and a clash of dates.Straight-backed chairs.I do not hear other voices.One man may be bald in the center of his head, and one may have a mustache, or if not he is not cleanly shaven.旁边有一个很大的咖啡壶，有一些报纸，但没有桌巾。有个人好像在做笔记，有一些迟疑和日期上的冲突。几把有靠背的椅子。我没听到其他声音。有一个男人的头顶好像秃了，还有一位好像留了小胡子，要不然就是没刮干净。
Flowers somewhere, in a vase or outside a window, I don’t know.(Jane shook her head.)There seems to be something about a radio.I do not know to what this refers. A letter to you. Some cautiousness in it because of indecision, though the cautiousness may or may not be apparent.One point should be made here. It is sometimes difficult to give specific time limits, since basically I do not perceive time as you do.某个地方有一些花，我不知道是在花瓶里或是窗外。(珍摇头)好像有个跟收音机有关的东西，我不知道这是指什么。一封给你的信，由于不能确定，所以里面会有点谨慎小心，不过谨慎小心的程度也许很明显，也许不明显。这里有一点必须说明，有时候要给出特定的时间范围并不容易，因为基本上，我觉察时间的方式跟你们不同。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:45.Jane was dissociated as usual. She did not realize she was using so many pauses in giving the above data.She said she had a very “hazy” impression, as Seth talked, of a group of figures at a table. She saw nothing plainly, and so feels she is taking Seth’s word for the above material(9:45分休息。珍的出离状况一如平常，她不知道自己在给上述资料时暂停了很多次。她说赛斯在说话时，她对于桌子那边的一群人有个非常“模糊”的印象，但看不清楚，她觉得姑且相信赛斯上面所说的话。
(Jane said the above is the kind of material she would have blocked in earlier sessions as soon as she felt it coming up, although occasionally she has allowed it to come through.One instance of such data checking out concerned the Provincetown and Bill Macdonnel material of the 68th, 75th, 82nd, 83rd, and 84th sessions.(珍说，在之前的课程里，只要她一感觉到像上述那种资料要传过来时，就会立刻挡掉，不过偶尔也会让它传过来。有关这种资料的例子可参阅第68、75、82、83及84节中有关普罗温斯顿和比尔·麦唐纳的资料。
(Jane now emphasized that where she would have “stiffened up” earlier, she now feels it foolish to let the fear of failure block what might be good material.Her attitude now is that if she is wrong once, perhaps she’ll do better the next time.(珍这时强调，对于之前她会“严厉把关”的地方，她现在觉得出于对失败的恐惧感而阻挡可能的好资料其实很愚蠢。她目前的态度是即使错了一次，下次或许就会做得比较好。
(Jane now resumed in the same quiet manner, sitting down and with her eyes closed.This time she began speaking again while holding a hand to her eyes, at 9:55.)(珍坐在椅子上闭着眼睛，神情一样温和。这次她将一只手挡住双眼，9:55分继续口述。)
I see also a box of clippings in a drawer, perhaps a desk drawer, (Jane took a long pause) and an unusually-shaped object, perhaps used as a paperweight.我也看到抽屉里有一盒剪报，或许是桌子的抽屉，(珍暂停很久)还有一个奇形怪状的东西，应该是做为纸镇使用。
We will now close a very brief session.My fondest regards to you both.我们现在就结束这节非常精简的课。送上我最深情的祝福给你们俩。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 9:57.Jane was again dissociated as usual She said that again she had the vaguest kind of an impression, this time of an object, perhaps the paperweight, on top of a dark wooden desk.She pointed out that Seth said nothing about the desktop being dark.)(9:57分结束。珍的出离状况如常。她再度说，有个极为模糊的印象，这次是一个物品，可能是纸镇的东西，放在深色木桌上。她指出，赛斯没提到木桌是深色的。)
My sensation of Friday night, August 6,1965.1965年8月6日星期五，我的感觉。
(On the above evening I again experienced a feeling of enlargement in parts of my body . This was very similar to my experience of July 9,1965, at Oswego State University College in Oswego, NY.See page 131. Both experiences seem to be related to sound, and both took place in the small hours of the night after I had been sleeping for some time, then awakened.In each case Jane slept on beside me.(这天晚晚我又经验到部分身体膨胀的感觉，就跟我1965年7月9日在纽约的奥斯威戈州立大学的经验非常类似。两次经验似乎都跟声音有关，也都发生在我刚入睡一阵子之后的凌晨时分，然后就醒过来。每一次珍都睡在我旁边。
(At Oswego, I was awakened by a party of college students in a nearby residence hall .This time I was roused by the tenants downstairs, who came home at about 2:30 AM, with company, and sat in the backyard talking.It was a very hot and humid night.(在奥斯威戈那一次，我被一群住在邻近宿舍的大学生吵醒。这一次则是被楼下的住户干扰到，他们大约在凌晨两点半跟同伴一起回家，然后就坐在后院讲话。那是个相当湿热的夜晚。
(In a drowsy state, I lay on my left side with my arms loosely crossed over my chest. I began to feel the enlargement first in my hands, then across my chest.This time I was alert as to what was happening at the first signs, and tried to encourage it without making any strenuous effort of will.The results didn’t surpass those of July 9; they were just a bit different.(昏沉中，我侧着左身躺着，双手轻松交叠抱胸，开始感到双手先膨胀起来，接着就是胸部。这一次我特别注意刚开始的征兆与现象，同时也试着助长它，但意志上并不会做任何费劲的努力。后来的结果并没有超越7月9日那次的经验；两者略微不同。
(My chest came to feel that it was much wider, much broader and stronger and thicker—perhaps a yard wide. My upper arms gradually grew to feel that they were as thick as my thighs. My hands, as on July 9, came to feel the size of baseball gloves.I was aware of a greatly enlarged feeling in each of the fingers to some degree, as before, but this time the feeling that my fingers were somehow united into a paw like or clublike unit was dominant.(我开始觉得胸部厚实、强壮许多——也许有一码厚，上臂慢慢变得跟大腿一样粗，双手如7月9日那样，感觉像棒球手套那么大。我跟以前一样，觉察到每根手指头都有明显的膨胀感，不过这次主要是感到我的手指有点像爪子或棍棒那样并在一起。
(The sensation was very pleasant and not at all frightening.This time I had no feeling of enlargement in my face, or in my body below the diaphragm.The sensation lasted very definitely for several minutes, giving me plenty of time to explore it, then gradually dwindled away.(这种感觉令人非常愉快，一点也不恐怖。这次我没感觉到脸或是横隔膜以下的身体膨胀。这种感觉确定持续长达几分钟，因此我有很多时间可以探索，之后就逐渐消失。
(For data on my other sensations and some visions, see the following sessions: 22, 24, 26, 27, 65, 145, 146, 163, 169.Nor do these include the enlarged hand sensations that Jane and I have experienced during sessions.)(有关我其他的感觉及一些视像经验可以参看下面章节：第22、24、26、27、65、145、146、163及169节。不过这些章节并没有包括我和珍在课堂上经验到的手膨胀的感觉。)

SESSION 176 第176节　罗的艾拉姑姑、爱永远是一种报护


AUGUST 9, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年8月9日星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(On the evening of August 5, Thursday, Jane and I mailed Dr. Instream a copy of the 175th session, held August 4,1965, and asked him to check the telepathic! Clairvoyant information on pages 176. 77.We had not heard from Dr. Instream recently, up to the time we mailed the letter.(8月5日星期四晚上，我和珍把1965年8月4日举行的第175节课的复本，寄给殷斯翠姆博士，并请他帮忙检查心电感应/千里眼的资料。一直到我们寄这封信给他的这段时间，都没有他的消息。
(Janes clairvoyant experiences continue.Some are more complete than others and can happen at any time of the day.Some appear while she is awake and active, others when she is in a drowsy state.They have been appearing often enough recently so that she now keeps a separate record of them.See also the notes at the beginning of the 173rd session.(珍持续都有千里眼的经验。其中有些经验比较完整，在一天中的任何时间都能发生。有些会在她醒时出现，而且非常生动，有些则在她昏昏沉沉时出现。由于最近频频出现，因此她现在会将它们另外记录下来。请参看第173节开头的注记。
(See pages 131, for Friday, July 9,1965, and 177 and above for Friday, August 6, for the two latest examples of my experience of physical enlargement.I mentioned them to Jane just before the session tonight in hopes that Seth would mention them.(有关我最近两次身体膨胀的经验，可参阅1965年7月9日星期五，以及8月6日星期五。今晚上课前，我跟珍提起这些经验，希望赛斯会提到。
(On Sunday afternoon, August 8, Jane and I attended the funeral of my Aunt Ella Buck in Wellsburg, NY, a nearby small town.Ella was my fathers sister and died at 88.My mother and father and my brother Loren and his wife and son were also there.I had seen very little of Aunt Ella over the years, and Jane had met her twice, as best we can recall.I thought it might be interesting to ask Seth to comment on Ella, so I also mentioned this subject just before the session.(8月8日星期天下午，我和珍到纽约威尔斯堡[Wellsburg]附近的小镇，参加姑姑艾拉∙芭克[Ella Buck]的丧礼。艾拉是我父亲的姐姐，享年88岁。我父母、我弟弟洛伦以及他太太和儿子也在场。就我们记忆所及，这些年来我几乎没看过艾拉姑姑，珍跟她见过两次面。我觉得请赛斯谈谈艾拉应该会蛮有意思，所以我也在课前提起这件事。
(The session was a quiet one and was held in our small back room.Jane spoke while sitting down, with her eyes closed and in a rather rapid manner, throughout the session.Occasionally she used pauses. Her voice was quiet to begin with, but where indicated it began to deepen. It did not acquire much more volume. This manifestation reminded me somewhat of the deeper voice effect Jane showed in the 172nd session.In that session Seth stated that it would become natural and easy for Jane to speak in that manner.)(这节课在我们后面的小房间举行，气氛平和宁静。珍坐在椅子上说话，整节课闭着眼睛，速度相当快，偶尔会暂停。刚开始时声音轻柔，不过到了我标示的地方就开始变得低沉，音量并没有大很多，这种现象有点让我回想起珍在172节中表现的声音效果。那一节中，赛斯说对珍而言，那种说话方式会变得很轻松自然。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I had intended to further our discussion concerning dream reality.Nevertheless I will be glad to discuss your aunt Ella, whose entity name is Dorinella.我打算进一步讨论梦实相。不过我也愿意谈谈你的艾拉姑姑，她的存有名字叫多莉内拉(Dorenella)。
(Jane hesitated over the pronunciation of Dorinella, and I had to ask Seth to spell it out.)(珍念“Dorenella”这个字时犹豫了一下，所以我请赛斯拼出来。)
Her previous lives were four. Her spiritual existence this time was a very happy one.The personality however was never entirely centered within physical reality, and was able to cope with it only by remaining relatively aloof.她有4个前世，她这次的心灵存在非常快乐。不过，这个人格从来不曾在物质实相里全然聚焦过，但仍能以较为疏离的方式来应付物质实相。
She was connected with your father’s brother in this life. His name was Jay.She was connected with him two lives previously as a very beloved wife.她跟你的伯父这一世有所连结，他的名字叫杰(Jay)。她在两世之前也曾跟他连结，是深受他疼爱的妻子。
When we have a suitable period of time it would be most beneficial for us to discuss the various members of your present family, Joseph, in connection with their past experiences.约瑟，如果有适当的时间，我们可以谈谈你目前家族的不同成员跟他们过去经验的关联，那将极有帮助。
The [retarded] son represented the result of two main conditions.The woman could simply not bring herself to form a complete construction. Her energies were not directed in a manner that would permit her to give birth to a normal child.She deeply reacted against violence, and was overly sensitive.那个智力发展迟缓的儿子代表了两种重大状况的结果。这个女人完全无法让自己形成完整的建构，她的能量并没有受到适当引导，导致她无法生出正常的小孩。她极力反抗暴力，而且过度敏感。
She felt that it was her responsibility to have a child, and so she did.At the same time, because of the child’s defect, she managed to produce a child who was relatively free of those pressures against which she reacted.She produced in other words an idiot, who was in his own way supremely invulnerable to the realization of misfortune, a child who would not grow mentally into an adult, and a child who would remain secure in a relatively eternal childhood.她觉得有责任生个小孩，而她也做到了。同时，由于小孩有缺陷，因此她生出来的这个小孩，可以确实摆脱掉那些曾反抗过的压力。换句话说，她生了一个白痴，一个可以用自己的方式完全避开灾难的小孩，一个心智上不会长大成人的小孩，一个可以在相对长久的童年里保持安全的小孩。
(Here Jane’s voice began to deepen and grow a bit louder.Jane knows rather little about my family history.Seth is correct in stating that my father’s older brother, my Uncle Jay, who is also dead, was connected with Ella in this life; he was very protective toward her, and after he died eight years ago his wife continued to watch over Ella.(这时珍的声音开始变得低沉，也略微大声。珍对我的家族史所知甚少。赛斯说得对，我爸爸的哥哥，也就是我已去世的伯父杰，在这一世与艾拉有所连结；他对艾拉呵护备至，在他去世后的8年来，他太太也继续照顾艾拉。
(I have a few boyhood memories of Ella’s retarded son, also named Jay.He has been institutionalized for many years, and I do not believe Ella and her husband Wilbur saw him for a number of years prior to their deaths.)(艾拉弱智的儿子也叫做杰，我对他还有一些童年记忆。他已经被送到疗养院好多年了，我认为艾拉和她先生韦尔伯[Wilbur]在去世前那几年，不曾去看过他。)
Nor did she feel guilty.Basically she considered that she had indeed produced a human being who would remain in a sort of summer garden, secure from deep hurts and vain regret.她也不觉得有罪恶感。基本上她认为自己确实生了一个小孩，这个小孩会留在一种夏日花园里，不会遭遇到严重的伤害和无谓的悔恨。
The child was extremely gentle in his way, and in his way he is still a gentle child.We are speaking honestly here, and so I will say that she would herself have preferred to dwell in such a dreamlike state herself. She was never a part of her century or her time, and she tried to protect her offspring according to her own limits, by seeing to it that his escape would be a more definite one than her own.这个小孩性格极其温顺，一直是个温和的孩子。我们这里就实话实说，我会说艾拉自己宁可长期安住在这种如梦似幻的状态中，她从来就不是自己所属的那个世纪或那个时代中的一部分，而且她也在自己的能力范围内，努力保护儿子，以确保儿子比她自己更能安全逃离世俗。
(Jane spoke while smiling, her voice going a little deeper.)(珍面带微笑讲着，声音变得低沉些。)
You must also realize that the entity who became her son also chose the circumstances, knowing of them in advance, for his own purposes.There are many character aspects to be considered here. For if each personality is an energy gestalt, then also each family group is also an energy gestalt. The actions and interactions form its characteristics and nature.你也必须知道，成为她儿子的那个存有，也为了自己的目的，事先了解这样的环境，并且选择了它们。这里有许多角色层面的问题须纳入考量，因为如果说每个人格是一个能量完形的话，那么每个家庭群体也会是一个能量完形，这些活动和互动形成了各个家庭群的特质和本性。
Your Ella, then, reacted against the repressed violence which has always been a part of that family structure as it is composed of its various personalities.She reacted vehemently against this repressed violence. She married a man in whom there was little aggressiveness.你的艾拉姑姑反抗那被压抑的暴力，而暴力一直是那个家庭结构的一部分，因为家庭结构是由不同的人格所组成的。她极力反抗被压抑的暴力，嫁给了一个几乎没什么攻击性的男人。
Their ways were different in many respects, but they were kind to each other always. They shared a love of nature. They both hoarded the things they loved. To some extent they hoarded each other. They both dug in like squirrels, and hid.他们在许多方面都有所不同，但他们一直都善待对方，分享对大自然的爱，也会珍藏各自钟爱的事物，某程度他们也彼此珍藏，两人都像松鼠般挖洞，然后躲藏起来。
To some extent she resembled her mother.Her vanity, however, was not a characteristic womans vanity. Her vanity was perhaps the one characteristic that she shared with other members of the family.She felt she was set apart, but also that she was set apart because she could not tolerate violence. Violence frightened her deeply.她有点像她妈妈。不过，她的虚荣心跟一般女人不一样，她的虚荣心或许就是她与其他家人共有的特色。她觉得自己被孤立了，并认为这是因为她无法忍受暴力才被孤立，暴力把她吓坏了。
She would not admit the fear, but would change the fear to pride, saying to herself that the world was evil, and she would therefore have little to do with it. And so she did not.She was not a foolish woman. She loved her husband most deeply. She and he shared a quite mystical love of nature and of animals. They would harm no one.艾拉不会承认这个恐惧，但她会把恐惧转化为自傲，而对自己说这个世界是邪恶的，因此她很少与这个世界打交道，她的确如此。她不是笨蛋，她极爱丈夫，两人彼此分享一种对大自然和动物相当不可思议的爱，他们都不会去伤害任何人。
I will indeed have more to say here, since I have begun.Nevertheless you may take your break.既然话匣子打开了，我真的还有很多东西要说。不过，你们可以先休息一下。
(Break at 9:24.Jane was rather well dissociated for a first break, she said. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice fairly deep but not loud to speak of.(9:24分休息。她说这个阶段的出离状况相当好，双眼一直闭着，声音非常低沉，但不会太大声。
(I can say that as far as my own memory goes, Seth has furnished a stunningly accurate picture of Aunt Ella, her temperament, etc. The descriptions here tally very closely with my remembered childhood impressions of Aunt Ella, when I saw her most often.(就我自己的记忆所及，可以说赛斯对艾拉姑姑及她的性格等描述正确无误。这个描述与我小时候对姑姑的印象相当吻合，那时我常常看到她。
(As stated before, Jane met Ella twice, both times rather briefly some years ago, and has no idea how much she remembers of the visits subconsciously.Jane met Ella’s husband Wilbur once; he died a few years ago.I remember Wilbur as a small gentle man who was a tailor and who smoked strong cigars.He had a white mustache and a gravel voice.I recall that the family accused him of drinking heavily and of not taking care of Ella, although I recall no objective evidence of this.I always liked Wilbur. After his death Ella was moved to a nursing home.(就如先前所说，珍几年前见过艾拉两次面，都相当短暂，而且潜意识上并不知道对这两次拜访记得多少。珍曾经见过艾拉的老公韦尔伯一次面；他几年前就去世了。我记得韦尔伯是个裁缝师，体形瘦小，个性温和，抽很浓的雪茄，留着白色小胡须，声音沙哑。我还记得，家人谴责他酗酒，也不照顾艾拉，不过我倒觉得并没有这方面的客观证据。我一直都很喜欢韦尔伯，他去世后艾拉就被送到安养中心。
(For some data on my parents and our family group, see the following sessions: 17, 18, 21, 27, 53, 93, 94, 172, among others, in Volumes I through 4.(有关我父母及我们家族的资料，除了这里之外，也可参考下面第一册到第四册的章节：第17、18、21、27、53、93、94及172节。
(Jane resumed in the same deeper voice, at a good pace and with her eyes closed, at 9:30.)(9:30分珍闭着眼睛继续口述，声音一样低沉，速度适当。)
She was gentle, and yet displayed a characteristic hauteur, in that she felt that the world was soiled, and so she would come in contact with it as little as possible.她个性温和，不过也会表现出特有的傲慢态度，因为她觉得这个世界已经被污染了，所以她尽可能不去接触这个世界。
Your father feels this way also. But he is bitter against it, and wants what it has to offer despite himself. She did not care.She was deeply attached to the other brother.She collected buttons and string and papers, even as she collected animals.To her the buttons almost seemed to have consciousness, and when she was alone she would take out her boxes of buttons and hold some in her hands, and remember the garments to which they belonged, and when she had worn them, and how the weather had been; and she lived in a present that was deeply colored by the past.你父亲也这么认为，不过他是对这个世界充满敌意，尽管如此，他仍然想获得这个世界该提供的一切，艾拉则毫不在意。她与另一个兄弟深深连结。她会搜集钮扣、线和报纸，甚至还搜集动物。对她来说，那些钮扣似乎都有意识，她独处时会搬出全部的钮扣盒，拿一些放在手上，回忆它们本来是在哪些衣服上，她是什么时候穿这些衣服，当时的天气如何；她活在深富过去色彩的现在里。
(The material on buttons surprised me a great deal. I had forgotten about Ella’s penchant for collecting things, and as far as I know had not mentioned it to Jane. Jane had no conscious memory of my doing so.As soon as Seth mentioned buttons, I immediately had a picture of Aunt Ella holding an old-fashioned red tin box, in which many buttons lay.As a boy I had been fascinated by this.)(有关钮扣的那段资料让我吓一大跳，我早就忘记艾拉有搜集东西的嗜好，就我所知，我没有跟珍提过这件事，珍意识上也不记得我提过。赛斯一提到钮扣的事，我脑海中马上浮现出一个画面，艾拉姑姑手持一个旧式的红色锡盒，里头放了许多钮扣，那时还是小孩的我深深着迷。)
Her husband did resent this, and he would eye her when she sat thus, but he did not say a thing.She had saved the buttons from his garments also, and she would say, “Do you remember when you wore this suit, and where we were, and what we did?”她老公对这种行为感到厌恶，每当艾拉坐下来做这种事，他会注视着她，但不发一语。她也从老公的衣服上搜集钮扣，而且会问说：“你记得什么时候穿这套衣服的吗？那时候我们在哪里？做些什么事？”
Originally, she collected the buttons to help him in his business. His family was large and scattered.He took great pains in his work, but he was also frightened; and the world confused him and he chattered, again like a squirrel.But they were very free in their own way, and your fathers family never forgave them for this freedom.起初，她搜集这些钮扣是为了要帮助老公的工作，老公的家族成员很多，分散在各地。他费尽心力在工作上，可是也会感到害怕；这个世界让他感到困惑，他会喋喋不休，就像松鼠吱吱叫。两夫妻以自己的方式过得自由自在，而你父亲的家人却从来没原谅过他们如此自由。
Your father wanted it but would not pay the price for it.Your mother would never think of it as freedom, but as slavery, so she had no use for either of them.She never understood the desire for freedom from worldly concerns that is part of your fathers nature, and of all your natures.It was because your father was not willing to pay the price that he was attracted to your mother, although other elements also entered in here.你父亲想要自由，但又不想为此付出代价。你母亲从来就不认为那是自由，而是奴役，所以她不喜欢这对姐弟。她从来就不了解那股亟欲摆脱凡尘俗事的渴望，而这股渴望是你父亲及你们所有人的本性。他之所以会受到你母亲吸引，是因为你父亲不愿付出代价，不过这当中还掺杂了其他因素。
For part of him was determined to gain worldly success, and he was always caught between wanting freedom, but he would not pay the price, or wanting worldly success for which he was not willing to pay the price.So that part of him that wanted success was attracted to your mother, who also wanted the same thing, and he spoke to her with that part of himself only.So in the beginning she did not know about this other part of him.某部分的他决心要获得世俗上的成功，但是他一直陷入两难；一方面想获得自由，不想付出代价，另一方面想获得世俗上的成功，也不愿意付出代价。由于那部分想要成功的自己，深深吸引了你那同样想要成功的母亲，他就只以那部分的自己在跟你母亲对话。因此打从一开始，你母亲就不了解他喜欢自由的那一部分。
He did not tell her because he knew she would have had no part of him.So when she discovered this other part of him she felt betrayed.To some extent she was, since she had been honest with him.Then when she discovered that he was not willing or able to go either way, or pay either price, she was enraged and embittered, and did not think of him as a man.So she hated this sister of his and thought:was this, this squalor, what he wanted?And she looked at Jay and was envious, and hated him for being the sort of man she wanted and did not get.他并没有告诉你母亲，因为他知道你母亲心中一直没有这部分的他。所以当你母亲发现他的这一部分，就觉得遭到背叛。因为某程度上来说，你母亲对他一向都很诚实。等你母亲发现他不愿意或不能选择任何一条路。或付出任何一种代价，她极为愤怒与痛苦，而不再认为你父亲是条汉子。因此她恨他姐姐，心想：难道这个，这个卑劣的生活就是你父亲所要的？后来她注意到了杰，心生嫉妒，而且因为他就是那种她想要却得不到的男人，所以由爱生恨，也怨恨杰。
For your father was a great pretender in those early days; a dude and even a braggart, and he hid the part of himself that was aloof and sensitive, and wanted freedom.So he could be successful in no direction, for he did not know who he was.你父亲早年伪装得很厉害；伪装成纨绔子弟，爱说大话，他隐藏了那个疏离、敏感、想要自由的自己。所以他不管在什么方面都没有成功，因为他已经不知道自己是谁。
The sister knew all this in her way.And when your parents visited her, your mother and father played the part in the beginning of the grand lady and condescending gentleman, for your father considered tailoring beneath a man.你父亲的姐姐对这一切了然于心。你父母拜访她时，一开始两夫妻就以贵妇和傲慢的绅士自居，因为你父亲认为男人当裁缝师有失身分。
Your mother still remembers the early days of her marriage, when she thought that she and your father would ultimately, beyond doubt, gain riches and success.She saw herself as the beautiful grand lady. She saw your father as her squire, and none of it happened.The man that she married had not told her the truth about his inner self, this itch he had for freedom from worldly concerns.你母亲仍然记得自己早年的婚姻生活，那时她以为自己跟你父亲最后一定会成功致富。她把自己视为美丽的贵妇，把你父亲视为她的侍从，但最后什么都没发生。跟她结婚的这个男人，并没有向她透露自己内在的实情，也就是他其实很渴望自由，想摆脱凡尘俗事。
She did not have that sort of sensitivity, but she was more honest than he.她没有那种敏感度，但她比这个男人还老实。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:54.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace had been rather fast, her eyes had remained closed.She had no offhand conscious memory of hearing about Aunt Ella's penchant for collecting buttons, although she could have heard it easily enough from my mother, for instance.(9:54分休息。珍的出离状况如常，速度一直很快，双眼闭着。珍意识上一时想不起艾拉姑姑搜集钮扣的嗜好，虽然她大可以从我母亲那边轻易得知这件事。
(Jane had ended the delivery in a lighter voice.She resumed in this same voice, again while sitting down and with her eyes closed, at 10:02.)(珍结束这段口述时声音较为轻柔，坐在椅子上闭着眼睛，以同样的声音10:02分继续口述。)
We will go into the other questions that you had for me upon another occasion.我们另外再找时间探讨你问的其他问题。
I do not like to deal with isolated facts. For various reasons it is easier for me to deal with blocks of related material.Much shuffling is required to give isolated facts.
