While I am engrossed in this particular subject I will therefore continue with it.You end up with better and more detailed information in this way, since certain associations invoke related data.我不喜欢处理零散的事实，基于各种不同的理由，我觉得处理大宗的相关资料比较轻松。提供零散的讯息没办法连贯，我必须跳来跳去，一旦我关注于这个特定的主题，就会继续下去。由于某些讯息环环相扣，会带入相关资料，如此一来，你最后就可以得到更好、更详细的资料。
(I have long been aware that questions usually slow up the flow of the material, and have refrained from very many questions since the early sessions.(打从课程一开始，我就知道太多的问题往往会降低资料的流量，所以我尽量克制自己不要问太多问题。
(The shuffling Seth refers to above may have to do with the material on time and the electrical field.See the following sessions among others: 122, 123, 125, 126, 128, 131, 135.According to them, Seth would have to sort through blocks of electrical intensities in order to lift out individual bits of information.)(赛斯上面提到的跳来跳去或许跟时间及电子场域有关。有关这部分除了本节之外亦可参阅以下章节：第122、123、125、126、128、131和135节课。从那些资料可得知，赛斯必须透过大量的电子强度，才能调出个人的一些讯息。)
This desire for freedom from worldly concerns is a characteristic in your family on your fathers side.It has not been given any creative fulfillment except in your own case, for they have been thinking in terms of freedom from rather than freedom for. They did not have anything that they wanted to do with the freedom, but only escape.So your one brother with his [model] trains, and the other brother with his golf.The outlets are extremely necessary to them.摆脱凡尘俗事的渴望是你爸爸这边的家族特性。除了你自己之外，这样的特性并没有带来任何创造性的实际行动，因为他们是以摆脱(freedom from)的角度，而非以自由从事(freedom for)的角度来思考。他们所想要的事物都跟自由无关，只有逃避，所以你一个弟弟玩[模型]火车，另一个弟弟打高尔夫球。对他们而言，这些出口极有必要。
One small point here. I meant to mention a relative, Alice, who is a strong masculine personality; well-integrated, however, because of a unifying drive.In other circumstances, if she had children for example, there would have been great misfortune.这里再提一点，我想要说一位名叫爱丽丝(Alice)的亲戚，个性相当强悍阳刚；不过由于一股统合的驱动力，把自己整合得非常好。假设在别种情况下，比方说她有小孩，那就真的会很不幸。
(Alice is a cousin to my family although we barely know her.Ella was greatly attached to her, I believe, and the two women spent some time together in the same rest home.Alice was a missionary in Korea for many years. She left the home where Ella was staying a year before Ella’s death.At the funeral Sunday we heard that Alice, at 80. odd years, was still alive, traveling about the country at the moment in connection with the sale of some property.)(爱丽丝是我们家一位表亲，不过我们对她不太认识。我觉得艾拉跟她走得相当近，这两个女人有段时间曾在同一家养老院待过。爱丽丝曾在韩国当过好多年的传教士，她在艾拉去世的前一年，离开了这家养老院，当时艾拉还住在那里。艾拉丧礼的那个礼拜天，我们听说80多岁的爱丽丝仍然健在，此刻正为了某个房地产的买卖在国内四处奔走。)
Another point I wanted to mention. Your father told himself that your mother, as a young woman, was sensitive and intelligent because she was beautiful.You can reread the earlier material given on your family’s past lives, and you will see further involvements.我还要提另外一点，你父亲曾告诉过自己，你母亲身为一个少妇，既敏感又聪慧，因为她很漂亮。你可以再看一下之前有关你家族前几世的资料，就会看到更多的连带关系。
(See page 181 for a list of these sessions.)(见此节前面列出的相关章节。)
You Aunt Ella was much less frightened of death than anyone might suppose.She loved life, if not the world, but she did not believe that death was really an end. She felt her will nearby. For several years she had begun to retreat from this existence, and as she did so she became happier.你艾拉姑姑怕死的程度比任何人想的要低很多。她热爱生命，而不爱这个世界，但她认为死亡不是真正的结束，她觉得自己的意志近在咫尺，她好几年前就开始退出这个存在，而且在这么做的同时，变得比较快乐。
Your parents did not understand her when she spoke to them because they were both afraid to understand.There was nothing wrong with her mind. She simply did not bother focusing her energies upon practical matters, particularly during the last years, but she was quick spiritually.她跟你父母讲的时候，你父母并不了解，因为他们两人都害怕去了解。她的心智并没有什么问题，只是不想费劲将能量聚焦在实际事务，特别是生前最后那几年，不过她的灵性上倒是很敏捷。
She picked up hints and signs. She responded to warmth in people, and was somewhat childlike in this manner, but she would not pay any attention to a sharp tongue. She would turn her directions elsewhere.As people can turn their backs, she would turn her inner self away.她会留意各项暗示和征兆，对人家的温情会有反应，这样的方式有点像小孩子，不过她根本不会在意尖酸刻薄的话语，她会把自己转向别的地方。她可以将她的内我转离，就像人们转身一样。
You have been doing much better in relating yourself with your parents.You are learning that you need not go to extremes, for extremes of behavior will only serve to confuse them further, and also rob you of consistency and peace.你跟你父母的连结状况好很多了。你正在学习的是不必走极端，因为极端的行为只会使情况更混乱，使你失去和谐与平静。
Another small note here, but a rather important one: Ruburt has nothing to fear from his mother, now, or after her death.这里还有一小点必须说明，但却是相当重要的一点：鲁柏对于他的任何事都不用害怕，不管是现在，或是她去世后。
To some extent he projects his understandable but regrettable bitterness upon her, and then imagines that she aims it at Ruburt.The mother indeed has no great love for the daughter. There is a deep rage inside the mother. To some extent it is directed toward Ruburt, but Ruburt does have protection, the protection of his own love of all living things.鲁柏把或多或少可以理解但令人遗憾的痛苦，投射到母亲身上，然后想像母亲将这些痛苦再加诸到他身上。这位母亲对女儿确实没有深深的爱，母亲内心深处满怀怒火，这股怒火某程度是冲着鲁柏而来，但是鲁柏实际上有自己的护卫，这种护卫就是来自他对所有生物的爱。
He would do his mother no harm, and for this reason she can do him no harm.The desire and the intent to do violence almost inevitably brings forth violence.他不会伤害母亲，因此母亲也不会伤害到他。暴力的欲望和意图势必会带来暴力。
We are involved here somewhat in a basic problem, hardly Ruburt’s alone, that will some day take up many sessions.For like does indeed attract like. If you hate, you will be hated. You will attract hate.我们这里已多多少少触及一个基本问题，这不单是鲁柏的问题，改天我们再花很多节课来讨论。同类的事物的确会互相吸引，你恨人家，人家就会恨你，你会吸引到恨。
There are definite reasons for this. The reasons have been known and forgotten, but the very practical facts remain.If Ruburt would indeed do his mother harm if the opportunity presented itself, then he would indeed be in danger of harm.He is not capable of hurting anyone deliberately, even someone he dislikes bitterly.这确实有其道理，这些道理大家都知道，但也忘了，不过事实仍然是事实。如果鲁柏在逮到机会时真的去伤害母亲，那么他实际上也会陷入被伤害的危机之中。他无法蓄意伤害任何人，即使对他恨之入骨的人也一样。
His own fear is somewhat a danger.It is much less than it was, and your relationship has done much to better that situation. I will at some time say more.Ruburt’s love for you, his ability to love in general, is his protection. So he has nothing to fear.他自己的恐惧某程度是一种危险。现在状况好多了，你们的关系大幅改善了这种状况，改天我会再多说一些。鲁柏对你的爱，他博爱的能力就是他的护卫，所以他没什么好怕的。
Loves is always a protection, in a quite literal manner; in a biological and electromagnetic and chemical and psychic manner.爱永远是一种保护，的的确确就是这样；生物上、电磁上、化学上及心灵上来讲都是如此。
I will now close this evening’s session, and we will return to our previous discussions at our next meeting.I wish you both the heartiest good evening.And I look out for you two.I would help Ruburt if the need arose.现在我就要结束今晚的课，不次会面时我们会回到之前的讨论。祝福你们俩有个美好的夜晚。我会照料你们。如果鲁柏需要的话，我会帮忙。
(“Good, night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”

(We were discussing a short list of mixed questions I had drawn up to ask Seth when the opportunity presented itself, when Seth came through again.He came through, I believe, because I expressed disappointment that he hadn’t mentioned my two recent sensations of physical enlargement.See the notes on pages 177. 78.(我们正讨论一份我整理出来的各类问题短清单，准备赛斯再次穿透过来时，可以伺机而问。我相信他穿透过来了，因为我对于他没有提到我最近两次身体变大的事情，表达了失望之意。见175节尾的注记。
(When Jane began to speak again she was lying down; she had stretched out to relax for a moment after the regular session.Now she removed her glasses, propped her head up with one hand, and began to speak from this prone position.She had briefly used a prone position once before, in the unscheduled 129th session, witnessed by Judy and Lee Wright.Now, her voice was quiet, her eyes closed.Resume at 10:33.)(珍再度开始讲话时，躺了下来；在正常课结束后，她伸展手脚放松一会儿。这时她摘下眼镜，一只手撑着头，侧卧着身子开始讲话。她之前在第129节的临时课里，也曾短暂出现过这种倾斜侧卧的姿势，那一节是由茱蒂和李∙赖特见证。现在她声音轻柔，双眼闭着。10:33分继续。)
We will not go deeply into the sensations this evening, mainly because I am thinking of you, and do not wish to take up more than my share of your time.今晚我不会深入讨论这种感觉，主要是因为我考虑到你，不想占用你太多时间。
When situations arise it is sometimes necessary that additional time be spent; but when it is not necessary then it is best that you have leisure and hours to devote to your own work.当有状况的时候，偶尔需要多花一些额外的时间；不过如果不需要时，你们最好有充裕的时间投注到自己的工作上。
The sensations are a physical demonstration of an inner sense reaction on a psychic basis, or level, which you have not yet achieved, and cannot be expected to. The self would expand.In your relationship with your parents for example, such a psychic expansion of self would allow you to absorb your own awareness of their sometimes painful existence, and you would feel no wound yourself.这些感觉是一种内在感官的反应，表现在身体上的现象，以心灵为基础或发生在心灵层次上，而你尚未达到这种基础或层次，你也无法期待。自己会膨胀扩大，以你跟你父母的关系为例，这种自己的心灵膨胀，会让你吸收到他们偶尔活得很痛苦的感觉，但你又不会觉得自己被伤害到。
(Jane had been facing me as she spoke from her prone position, and I had noticed that her eyes had appeared to be slitted, as though preparing to open.They now did open, slowly as she continued speaking.They were very dark and without highlights. She stared at me as she spoke for the most part, although occasionally she drew upon a cigarette that she had left burning in an ashtray beside her.Her voice remained quiet.)(珍侧卧讲话时一直面对着我，而我早就注意到她的眼睛都是眯着，仿佛准备张开。现在她开始讲话，眼睛也确实渐渐张开了。双眼非常黑，没有光彩，大部分时间都盯着我看，其间偶尔把放在一旁烟灰缸里未熄灭的烟拿起来吸两口，声音依旧轻柔。)
You could therefore help them without being concerned with self-preservation.You must now be so concerned, and you are doing very well.因此你可以帮助他们，而不用担心自我保护的问题。你现在一定非常担心，不过你做得相当好。
But with such a psychic expansion you would know that you had nothing to fear.Until you know that you have nothing to fear, then the fear is a reality and must be treated as such.This development is not an easy one, nor can it be rushed, nor can you expect it of yourself.有了这种心灵的扩大经验，你就知道你没什么好恐惧的。如果尚未了悟到你没什么好恐惧的，那么恐惧就会是实相，且必须被视为实相看待。这种发展并不容易，不能操之过急，你也无法期待这样的发展会自动出现。
(Jane now sat up on the bed as she spoke.)(珍这时坐在床上讲话。)
When such developments occur, then you have the awareness of the whole self, and the ego does not need to fear for its survival.The self can then act to help others, and can in no way be threatened.如果出现这类的发展，那你就有了全我的知觉，自我不用再害怕自己的生存问题。自己可以采取行动帮助别人，而且绝对不会面临任何威胁。
The physical manifestations come first. This cannot be willed.We will say more if you wish at another occasion.If you prefer I will continue.身体的现象最先出现，这无法用意志控制。假如你喜欢的话，我们会另外找时间多谈一些。如果你们愿意，我会继续下去。
(“Later is all right, then.”)(“以后再说没关系。”)
We will then close the session.那我们就结这节课。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:45.Jane blinked several times, squeezing her lids shut, then was out of her trance.Her eyes had stayed open until the end.She had been dissociated as usual. While speaking she had been aware that her eyes were open.(10:45分结束。珍紧闭双眼，眨了几下就回神了。她的眼睛到结束时都张开着。出离状况如常，她讲话时也知道自己的眼睛是张开的。
(For some information on Jane’s mother, including reincarnational data, see the 4th and the 59th sessions, among others in Volumes I and 2.)(有关珍母亲的其他讯息，包括转世的资料，可参阅第一册和第二册的第4和第59节。)

SESSION 177 第177节 ▲加拉格夫妇见证 如何给潜意识积极暗示 佛教


AUGUST 11, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年8月11日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher were again witnesses.To date they have witnessed the following sessions: 158, 161, 162, 168 and 170.(比尔和蓓·加拉格夫妇再度见证。到目前为止，他们见证过的章节如下：第158、161、162、168及170节课。
(The session was held in our large front room.It was a warm night. The windows were of necessity open and traffic noise was quite audible, but we heard Jane without difficulty. She began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her manner was quite active and she smiled often. Almost immediately her voice acquired a somewhat hard edge that cut through the traffic noise, and she maintained this through most of the session.The “brogue” that sometimes crops up was also quite in evidence.)(本节课在我们前面的大房间举行。那是个温暖的夜晚，我们得打开窗户，因此车子噪音很吵杂，不过我们还是可以听到珍的声音，并没有什么困难。她坐下来，闭上眼睛开始说话，精神奕奕，时常微笑，声音几乎马上就快要盖过车子的噪音，整节课大部分时间就维持如此。珍偶尔也会冷不防地冒出一些非常清楚的爱尔兰口音。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
And welcome to our friends.I am always glad to see our Jesuit, and we shall certainly discuss the God concept for him, tonight or during another session.欢迎我们的好朋友到来。我一向很喜欢看到我们的耶稣会信徒，今晚或是改天找一节课，我们一定会为他讨论上帝的概念。
I am particularly concerned however with carrying our discussion further concerning dream realities.不过，我特别关注的是进一步讨论梦实相。
Our Ruburt did indeed steal from me a few paragraphs in his book, that were not rightfully his in one manner of speaking.In a brief communication one afternoon I explained to him the similarity between multiple personalities and the various aspects of the personality as it appeared in the dreaming and trance states.我们鲁柏在书里面的的确确从我这边偷了几段话，照道理说，这些话并不是属于他的。在某天下午的一次简短沟通中，我跟他解释了在梦里和出神状态，多重人格与人格各种面向之间的相似处。
I did not have occasion to bring this up in our sessions, and he very nicely whipped in and picked it from my palm.He did a very good job of explaining my idea, for which I am grateful.在我们的课里，我没有机会提到这一部分，而他却很巧妙地从我手中迅速把它捡走了。他把我的观念解释得相当好，我非常高兴。
(This occurred last Monday afternoon, August 9.Jane happened to need this bit of information for a chapter in her book, and so used it when Seth made it known.She said Seth might have mentioned it during Mondays session had he not devoted the session to the material on my Aunt Ella.)(这是发生在8月9日星期一下午的事。珍书里面某个章节恰巧需要这些资料，所以在赛斯讲完后立刻用上。她说，如果赛斯没把星期一的课用来讨论我艾拉姑姑的资料，那他或许在那节课就会提到。)
Nevertheless it is known that cases of legitimate multiple personality exist.Here we have several personalities, all operating within one self, each unaware of the other, and each going his own separate way.不过，多重人格的合理存在是众所周知的事实。我们有好多个人格，它们都在一个自己之内运作，每个人格都意识不到其他人格，各走各的路。
The primary ego is equally unaware of the other personalities, who very often are actually struggling for dominancy.Now. With this in mind, consider once more the various aspects of the self in the waking and the dream states.The conscious “I” is unaware of the “I” who dreams. Indeed, the dreaming “I” seems more familiar with the waking self upon many occasions. Here you have excellent examples that correspond to your dual or multiple personality thesis.主要的自我也同样意识不到其他人格，实际上这些人格时时刻刻都努力想拿到主控权。现在，记住这一点之后，再次思考一下醒时状态与做梦状态下自己的不同面向。有意识的“我”觉察不到做梦的“我”。在许多情况下，做梦的“我”其实似乎比较熟悉醒时的自己，你们这里就有一些相当好的例子，可以呼应到你们双重或多重人格的论点。
It should be obvious that there is nothing strange in the fact that the dreaming self and the waking self appear so unfamiliar to each other.The study of hypnotism will greatly enlarge man’s understanding of human personality in general.These separate states of consciousness, these multiple levels of awareness, these seemingly unrelated personality aspects, are not unnatural artificial productions, brought about through hypnosis.Hypnotism is merely a method that allows you to study the personality directly.做梦的自己和醒时的自己彼此非常陌生，这种现象显然不足为奇。一般而言，催眠的研究可以大幅度增加人们对人类人格的整体了解。这些不同的意识状态、这些多重的觉知层面、这些看似不相干的人格面向，并不是透过催眠而产生的非自然人工结果。催眠只是一种可以让你们直接探究人格的方法。
Its nature becomes known, for the personality, again, is not an object, nor is it an unchanging unit.You have been studying it in the past in a very superficial manner.It should be remembered however that hypnotism is also an action, and as such hypnotism will change the personality to some extent, as all action changes and affects other actions.人格的本质众所周知，因为再说一次，人格并不是一个东西，也不是一成不变的个体。过去你们对它的研究方式非常肤浅。无论如何，你们该记得催眠也是一种行动，它本身或多或少会改变人格，就像所有的行动会改变其他行动，也会影响其他行动。
Now.These effects, these various seemingly separate selves that can be demonstrated through hypnosis, operate continually and quite normally in both the waking and the dream states.There is however a cooperation that exists between these seemingly separate aspects of the self.It goes without saying that some overall direction must be, and is, maintained.现在。这些效应、这些可以经由催眠显现而看似各自不同的自己，在醒时状态和做梦状态下，都可以相当正常地持续运作。然而，自己这些看似各自分开的面向之间，其实存在着一种合作关系。某个整体的方向必须维持住，也的确维持住了，这一点无须赘述。
I am grateful to your psychologists’ ideas concerning multiple personalities, since they present excellent analogies—我非常感谢你们心理学家有关多重人格的概念，因为他们提出了相当棒的比喻——
(There was a knock on our door at 9:16.Jane stopped speaking but as in the 172nd session, when she was also interrupted, she gave no signs of shock or even discomfort.In a few seconds she was out of her trance.(9:16分时，有人来敲我们的门。珍不再讲话，但就像第172节那样，她当时也受到干扰，但并没有显出惊吓甚至不舒服的表情。几秒后，她就回神了。
(Our visitors were a young couple from next door, stopping briefly before continuing on other errands.They do not know about the sessions.After their departure, we agreed that our friends probably sensed that something unusual was going on. We did not ask them to stay.And as Bill Gallagher pointed out, they probably heard the deep Seth voice while in the hall outside our door; upon admittance they saw no one with which to identify such a voice.Also, although the room was well lighted the shades were closed, a practice Jane and I do not indulge in otherwise.(来敲门的是隔壁一对年轻夫妇，短暂停留之后就继续忙他们的事。他们并不知道我们在上课。他们离开后，我们一致认为我们的朋友可能感应到发生了不寻常的事，我们没请他们留下来。就如比尔指出的，他们可能在我们门外走廊听到赛斯低沉的声音；进门后却找不到有谁会发出这样的声音。而且，这个房间采光虽好，但当时窗帘全都关上，通常在别的情况下我和珍不会这么做。
(Jane said she heard the knock itself and was aware of what it meant.As long as an interruption had occurred she decided to take our first break.Her eyes had remained closed during the delivery, and she had remained seated. She had been dissociated as usual.(珍说，她听到了敲门声，也了解它的意思。既然被打断了，她就决定让我们先休息一下。传述当中她一直闭上双眼坐着，出离状况如常。
(Jane resumed in the same deep voice, which now was quite amused, and at a faster pace at 9:35.)(9:35分，珍以同样低沉的声音继续口述，但这时变得非常开心，速度也比较快。)
I am always tempted to, when I meet your friends and acquaintances, to delve somewhat into their backgrounds.However I shall in this instance restrain myself, so that we may continue with our previous discussion.每当我遇见你们的朋友和熟识的人，都一直很想探究一下他们背景。不过这次我要克制自己，好让我们之前的讨论可以继续。
I cannot stress too strongly the fact that any investigation into the nature of the human personality must indeed follow the lines which have been here given.The nature of reality, uncamouflaged, can be glimpsed to some degree as you study the personality in the dream state, where awareness does not operate in an ego-directed manner.任何对人类人格本质的探讨，必须确实遵照我在这里给的方法进行，这个事实再怎么强调也不为过。你们在梦境里研究人格时，或多或少可以瞥见实相的本质，那是一种未经伪装的样貌，因为在梦里不是由自我来主导觉察的运作方式。
Again, the nature of space and time is glimpsed more clearly as it appears to the sleeping self, for in the dream state reality is to a large measure uncamouflaged, and the personality appears in a freer state.It should also be borne in mind that all aspects of the personality are part of the whole self.As such there is an overall communication between the various aspects of the self, although the separate aspects of the self may not be aware of the communications.此外，睡梦中的自己可以更清楚瞥见时间与空间的本质，因为在梦境中，实相并没有经过伪装，人格可以更自由地表现。人格的所有面向都是全我的一部分，这一点也应该谨记在心。因此大致上来讲，自己的各种不同面向可以彼此沟通，虽然不同的面向或许没有意识到这些沟通。
We have seen therefore that suggestions may be given by the waking personality to the sleeping personality, and these directions will be followed.They will be followed however by the sleeping self in its own fashion, and according to its own understanding.The solutions asked for may not appear to the conscious self in the fashion that it expects.The conscious self may not even recognize that it has been given a particular solution, and yet it may act upon the solution.因此，我们已经明白醒时人格可以提供暗示给睡梦中的人格，这些指示会被执行。不过，睡梦中的人格会根据自己的了解，以自己的方式来执行。要求的解决方法，或许不会依照意识上的自己所期望的方式呈现。意识上的自己甚至可能还搞不清楚那个解决方案已经到手，即使如此，这个解决方案还是可以执行。
(Jane’s voice hit a louder and stronger note briefly. Again she was much amused. She sat opposite Bill Gallagher.Now, her eyes still closed, she hiked her chair closer, then pointed at him.)(珍的声音短暂变得比较大声有力，她又乐不可支，坐在比尔正对面。这时，双眼仍旧闭着，把椅子往前拉，然后指着他。)
Our Jesuit with the ulcer—shall I say our ulcerated Jesuit—may derive some benefit by reading a few of our immediately previous sessions, in which we spoke of dream therapy.我们患有溃疡的那耶稣会信徒——我会说我们这位为溃疡所苦的耶稣会信徒——你或许可以看看我们前几节谈过的梦疗法资料，对你会有一点帮助。
In such a case it is not necessary that the conscious self recall the dreams which it requests.In many cases, in fact, it is to the ego’s advantage that it remain unaware of the actual dreams involved; for the ego is indeed touchy, rigid and querulous as an old arthritic gentleman, and cranky.在这样的例子当中，意识上的自己并不需要记得它所要求的梦。事实上，在许多状况下，让自我持续觉察不到它所做的梦，反而有帮助；因为自我就像得关节炎的老绅士，真的很容易发怒、固执僵化、满腹牢骚、很难取悦。
Dream therapy will be discussed in many of our sessions, and definite directions will be given, whereby the waking self can to a large extent insure the help of the physical organism.The various aspects of the self communicate with each other, when they do, in a very sly fashion, for no such communication is direct.They are like relatives who do not speak to each other, yet each one knows what goes on in the others household.我们会利用很多节课来讨论梦疗法，也会提出一些确切的方向，醒时的自己肯定可以借此帮助肉体组织。自己的不同面向会彼此沟通，而且它们这样做的时候，会以非常心照不宣的方式进行，因为这类的沟通并不是直接的。它们就像彼此不讲话的亲戚，然而每个人其实都知道其他亲戚的家务事。
The inner ego directs all activities which are deeply subjective.The outer ego as you know deals with the manipulation of the self in the physical environment.You must remember that the whole self is more than the sum of its parts; and also, since it is action, it is never the same. It is therefore impossible at any moment to pinpoint the personality.Therefore the whole self is not only the sum of the personality as you know it in your time, it is also the sum of what it has been and what it shall be.For as I have explained action is simultaneous, and time as you think of it is caused by your own physical perception.内在自我会指引所有高度主观的活动。而外在自我，如你们所知，会在物质环境中负责自己。你们必须记得，全我大于各部分的总合；而且，由于全我就是行动，所以它时时刻刻都不一样。因此不管什么时候，要精确定位人格是不可能的。全我不只是你们在你们时间内所认识的人格之总和，也是它曾经所是与未来所是的总和。因为就如我之前的解释，行动具有同时性，而时间正如你们所以为的，是由你们自己的身体知觉所形成。
Therefore, in the dream state communication is possible between all portions of the self.The personality appears in its truest state if it seems, in dreams, that you are free of space and time.It is indeed because the basic self is free of space and time.If you appear to hear voices out of the past, if you seem to see into the future, it is because the dream state is a more or less faithful approximation of a basic reality in which your time and space simply do not exist.因此，在梦境中，自己的所有各个部分之间可能会彼此沟通。在梦里，你们仿佛都未受到空间与时间的限制，这时人格就呈现出最真实的状态。实际上那是因为基本的自己未受到时空束缚的关系。如果你们仿佛听到来自过去的声音，如果你们仿佛看见未来，那是因为梦境几乎忠实呈现了基本实相的近似状况，在这种基本实相里，你们的时间与空间根本就不存在。
We will be dealing rather extensively with a study of space and distance and time as they appear within the dream state, and with the freedoms that are possible for the personality within it.All of this information can be used most beneficially. It will enable the ego itself to expand its consciousness and its knowledge.我们将广泛探讨梦里出现的空间、距离与时间，以及人格在梦里可能拥有的自由。所有这些资料可以做最有效的利用，能让自我本身扩展意识及知识。
I will give you directions which will allow you to study the appearance of space and time within your dreams.You will be one self dreaming, while another spying self takes notes.I will now give you both a break from taking your notes, and we will then continue.我会提供一些指引给你们，你们可以借此研究自己梦里面空间与时间的现象。你将会成为一个做梦的自己，而由另一个暗中仔细观察的自己来做记录。我现在就让你们休息，先不要再做你们的记录，然后我们再继续。
(Break at 9:58.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her voice bad been on the deeper side, with the brogue apparent at times. Her eyes had remained closed. She had remained seated.(9:58分休息。珍的出离状况如常，声音比较低沉，偶尔会出现明显的爱尔兰口音，双眼闭着，一直坐在椅子上。
(We discussed with the Gallaghers the material given on dream therapy in sessions 172. 74.Bill Gallagher also wondered about using suggestion even in working out problems connected with a hobby.His hobby is rope work, and at times the designs he uses are quite complicated.(我们跟加拉格夫妇一起讨论172至174节中，有关梦疗法的资料。比尔对暗示的使用也感到疑惑，甚至怀疑能否用来解决一些跟嗜好有关的问题。他的嗜好是结绳，他使用的样子有时候相当复杂。
(Jane resumed in the same manner, her voice rather strong, at 10:10.Again, Seth was quite amused.)(珍以同样的方式10:10分继续口述，声音力度相当强。赛斯仍然非常愉快。)
There are some very simple suggestions that I can give to our confused Jesuit that may be of some help.我可以提供一些非常简单的暗示给我们困惑的耶稣会信徒，这对他会有一些帮助。
These are tricks known to both Joseph and Ruburt, but quite beneficial for all of that.You may give directions to your subconscious when you are in your normal waking state, and it will follow them.You may for example suggest before sleeping that the next day, while you are involved in your working situation, the subconscious will be involved in working out designs for you for your own projects.这些小技巧鲁柏和约瑟都知道，也相当有用。在正常的醒时状况下，你可以向潜意识下一些指示，潜意识就会遵照进行。举例来说，你可以在睡前暗示说，隔天你投入工作的同时，潜意识将会为你自己的专案拟好设计图。
This will give you the satisfaction of making the time twice as valuable.You can indeed suggest to the subconscious that it carry on in such a manner regardless of your conscious concern.As a result the ego can apply itself to the job at hand while the subconscious works for you and your inner purposes.This is very practical, and works without much difficulty.这会让你的时间价值加倍，你会很满意。你真的可以向潜意识暗示，让潜意识按照自己的方式继续执行，而不必去理会你意识上的关注。如此一来，自我本身就可以关注在手边的工作，而让潜意识为你和你内在的目的效劳。这样子做非常实际，也不会有什么太大的困难。
You may give any such suggestions and they will be followed.Do not however strain yourself trying to figure out whether or not the suggestions are being followed. Give them, then turn your attention to other matters.You may obviously also direct your subconscious to react only to constructive suggestions from any source.This is in fact an excellent habit to cultivate.你可以下任何这样的暗示，都会被执行。但不要让自己刻意费劲去察看这些暗示是否被执行，你只管给出暗示，之后就把注意力转到别的事情上。你也可以清楚指示潜意识只对建设性的暗示起反应，不管暗示来自哪里。事实上，这是一个值得培养的绝佳习惯。
There are many ways in which you can use these tricks to your advantage.I do not exaggerate when I tell you that one simple psychic manipulation can save you much difficulty. It sounds more difficult however than it is.你有很多种方式可以利用这些小技巧来帮助自己。只要运用一种很简单的心灵操作，就可以解决很多难题，我这样讲绝不夸张，实际上做起来并不像听起来那么难。
(Grinning, Jane pointed to Bill Gallagher.Her eyes were still closed, her voice a bit deep, her pace fast.)(珍指着比尔咧嘴而笑。她仍然闭着眼睛，声音有点低沉，节奏快速。)
You can learn, even a Jesuit can learn, to change the focus of your attention within seconds.Practice is all that is required, but the practice itself will show results.When you fear any difficulty with your particular physical problem, you can immediately turn your awareness away.This is no Pollyanna gibberish.你可以学习，甚至耶稣会信徒也可以学习，在很短的时间内改变注意力的焦点。唯一的要求是练习，光练习本身就会产生效果。如果有任何个人身体上特定的问题让你感到害怕，那么可以马上把意识焦点转移到别的地方去。这不是胡言乱语，瞎掰一通。
As soon as your focus of awareness is switched the physical symptoms will vanish.It requires a knack, but it is simpler than it sounds, and you can master it.This only requires that you give suggestions to your subconscious. Tell it that it knows how to perform this manipulation, and suggest that it do so the next time you are in difficulty.只要一转换你的意识焦点，身体症状就会消失。这需要诀窍，但比听起来简单得多，是你可以掌握的。唯一的要求是你要向潜意识下暗示，告诉潜意识它知道如何执行这项操作，同时也向它暗示，下次你碰到困难时就如法炮制。
There will suggest a brief break, and I will continue for a short time.我建议这边休息一下，然后我再继续一会儿。
(Now I saw that Jane’s eyes had opened.She looked around at us all as she spoke, smiling.Her eyes were quite dark, without highlights, almost as though glazed.)(这时我看到珍的眼睛已经打开了。她边讲话、边微笑地环视着大家，双眼变得相当黑，没有光束，几近呆滞无神。)
I am very glad that we are here together, and if I cannot be merry, it is only because when I am merry I speak too loudly, and I embarrass my hosts.大家相聚在此，我很高兴，假如我听起来不高兴，那全是因为我一高兴起来讲话会太大声，我怕这样会对我的主人不好意思。
(Break at 10:23.Jane was dissociated as usual. She knew when her eyes opened, she said.As she looked around at us she felt that she saw us once removed, or as through a sheet of glass.To come out of the trance she blinked or squeezed her eyes shut several times. Her voice had maintained its deeper than usual note.(10:23分休息。珍的出离状况一如平常，她说知道自己的眼睛何时张开。当她环视着我们，觉得看到我们一度被移开，或是仿佛隔着一层玻璃看着我们。她用力眨了几下眼睛让自己回神，维持着比平时低沉的声调。
(Jane resumed with her eyes closed, and in the same deeper voice, at 10:31.)(10:31分，珍闭着眼睛，以同样低沉的声音继续口述。)
We will indeed begin a program of sorts.We will initiate a thorough study of the God concept, which will be begun the next time these friends are present, and will be continued when they visit us at other sessions.That is, whenever they attend a session for a while we will concern ourselves with the God concept and all of its implications.我们真的就开始来谈另一个话题吧。我们将准备全面探讨上帝的概念，下次这些朋友出席时就会开始，而且以后他们来访时也会继续。也就是说，只要他们过来参加课程，我们就谈谈上帝的概念以及其他所有的含意。
There is some material that has already been given, and our friends should read it as a preliminary to our own study.We will therefore be concerned with the pyramid gestalts of which I have spoken, and it will be to our advantage to have this as a unit.有些资料已经给过了，我们的朋友应该读一读，以做为我们探讨的初步基础。因此我们会关注在我提过的金字塔完形，对于这一部分如果能有完整的认识，那对我们将有助益。
(Seth has actually dealt with the God concept fairly often. This would involve such related matters as the soul, energy transformation, cycles on our plane, spirituality the “source of the source, ” the Crucifixion, beginnings and endings, prayer and the will to be, etc. Among others see the following sessions:3, 24, 27, 31,51, 62, 66, 81, 95, 96, 97, 115, 135, 146, 147, 149, 145, 151.)(事实上，赛斯不时会提到上帝的概念，相关议题包括：灵魂、能量转换、轮回转世、灵性、“起源的起源[the source of the source]”、被钉十字架、开始与结束、祷告和意志力等等。相关资料可参看下列章节：第 3、24、27、31、51、62、66、81、95、96、97、115、135、145、146、147、149和151节。)
I may suggest therefore Joseph that for convenience’s sake the next such session simply be labeled “A” along with your usual designation, the next “B” and so forth.For your records this will allow you to refer to those sessions in a simplified manner.因此，为了方便起见，我会建议约瑟按照你平时命名的习惯，就把下次这种课简单标示为“A”,再下一次为“B”，依此类推。这种记录方式可以让你更方便找到那些章节。
It is natural then that such a study will involve us in many allied matters.I may say that Buddhism does indeed come closer in essence to reality than other religions.However, the Buddhists either have not gone far enough, or have gone too far, according to your viewpoint.这样的探讨自然而然就会让我们触及很多相关的问题。我或许会说，佛教在本质上的的确确比其他宗教更接近实相。不过，依据你们的观点，佛教徒要么就是不够深入，不然就是过度执迷。
If they have gone too far, then they have been so concerned with inner reality that they have become too tolerant of physical disease and disasters.If they have not gone far enough, then they have not followed through sufficiently so that these physical disasters could truly be suffered without pain.如果是过度执迷，他们就是太过关注内在实相，导致对肉体的病痛和苦难过于容忍。如果是不够深入，那他们就是还没充分修行，好让自己确实可以度过这些肉体灾难而不觉得痛苦。
They have the knowledge to a very large degree, but they have fallen short.It is one thing to realize that all physical matter is camouflage, and they know this.But this camouflage can be most disastrous if it is not manipulated correctly.You are in no position to ignore it. You are in a position to understand it and to use it.他们拥有相当丰富的知识，可是仍有不足之处。有一件事必须了解，所有实体物质都是伪装物，这一点他们都知道。但如果这个伪装物没有正确使用，那可会悲惨至极。你不能忽视这一点，你应该了解它、使用它。
It is all very well for monks to utilize astral projection.It is all very well for them to skitter through space as if they were on pogo sticks; their knowledge is fundamental and good.The fact remains that millions of human beings who follow and practice Buddhism are told, as many religions tell their followers, “Better worlds are to come, so ignore this agony, and this hunger, and this pain, and the murder in the streets.Be in ecstasy while your belly bloats.”This is not human, and it is far less than godly.和尚使用灵体投射(astral projection),这非常好。对他们来说，在空间中瞬移就像玩弹跳棒(pogo stick)般容易；他们的知识有其重要性与长处。但是有一种现象仍然存在，就是有不计其数的佛教徒与修行人被教导说：“美好的世界就要来到，所以不要在意眼前的痛苦、饥饿、疼痛与街上的凶杀案。肚子胀痛难耐时仍然要充满法喜。”许多宗教都这样告诉信徒，可是这业不人道，离佛还远着呢。
There is a unity and there is a joy and there is an exaltation in all aspects of life and consciousness.It is not to any religion’s benefit that people starve.There is nothing wrong with using spiritual knowledge in practical manners.生命与意识的所有层面都是一体的，都充满了万分的乐趣和喜悦。人们忍受饥饿之苦，对宗教并没有任何好处。以务实的方式运用灵性知识并没有什么不对。
Fulfillment, value fulfillment, implies fulfillment of all abilities and all potentials, including quite physical potentials.The pyramid gestalts of which I have spoken have experiences far beyond those of any human being.Yet they are concerned with the least, with the existence of the least among you.实现或价值完成，意指发挥所有的能力和所有的潜能，肉体方面的潜能也包含在内。我提过的金字塔完形所经历过的这类经验就远比人类还多。不过它们与最小的，与你们之间最小的存在有所关联。
The fullest potentialities cannot be developed unless the physical aspects are also developed.Your job is to manipulate as well as you can within the physical universe, and to develop within it religious leaders of any denomination.Any leaders who restrict development along one level for the sake of development along other levels, betray their followers.除非肉体面向(physical aspects)也予以发展，否则就无法将最大潜能发挥出来。你们的工作就是在物质宇宙中，尽可能把它操控好，并且在这当中培养出所有宗派的领导者。任何领导者，只要为了某些其他层面而限制了某一层面的发展，就等于背叛了信徒。
I could indeed continue this discussion, and wear you all out.However, I will now let you take a break, or Joseph if he prefers may end our session.我真的可以继续这部分的讨论来让你们累翻。不过，我现在就让你们休息一下，或是如果约瑟愿意的话，也可以就此结束。
(“Well end it then.Good night, Seth.”(“那我们就结束好了。晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:50.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed her voice had been good, her pace fast.(10:50分结束。珍的出离如常，双眼一直闭着，声音很好，节奏快速。
(Jane, the Gallaghers and I were discussing the session and related subjects when Seth came through again at 11:00.All of us were in very good humor, including Seth; the session as it continued reflected this, and a rapid-fire exchange resulted in which Jane was in and out of trance at the wink of an eye, so to speak.She manifested this same ability during the 169th session, held in Dr. Instreams office in Oswego, NY, but I would say that her switching back and forth this evening was more rapid.She said later that it was no effort at all.(赛斯11点再度透过来，那时我、珍和加拉格夫妇正在讨论这节课的内容和一些相关话题。我们大家都沉浸在非常愉快融洽的氛围中，包括赛斯在内；这节课继续进行时一直呈现这种气氛，而且珍的出神与回神也在眨眼之间就立刻完成，可以说是火速转换。她在第169节课当中也展现过这样的能力，那节课是在纽约奥斯威戈殷斯翠姆博士的办公室举行，不过我得说，她今晚来来回回的转换速度比那一次还快。她随后说，这样的转换毫不费吹灰之力。
(Jane began speaking again with her eyes closed, but they opened at times during the exchange, as they had in the last session, the 176th.Jane has resumed often lately after formally ending a session, as in the 169th, 170th, and 176th.(珍又开始闭着眼睛讲话，但在转换时眼睛偶尔会张开，就像在上次第176节一样。珍最近常常在课正式结束后又重新开始，第169、170和176节都是如此。
(Seth began by stating that he liked to sit in with us only as an interested participant, without bothering about notes, etc. Jane, he said, could use the practice of switching focus; and we did have the effect of a conversation among five people instead of four.There follow a few quotes from Seth as I noted them down, with some hints from Bill, Peggy and myself.)(赛斯一开始就说，他喜欢跟我们坐在一起，但只当个感兴趣的参与者就好，不用在乎笔记等问题。他说，珍可以运用焦点的转换；而且我们真的发挥了5人间对话的效果，而不是4人的效果。下面这些是我在笔记上摘录赛斯说的话，里面也有一部分是关于比尔、蓓和我自己。)
—Ruburt can use this practice.You see now we are using a very speedy change of focus.This ability can serve us in the future to our advantage.——鲁柏可以运用这种方式。你们现在也看到了，我们正非常快速地转换焦点。这种能力未来对我们会很有帮助。
(11:01—Jane was out of her trance. She grinned and waved at us.The conversation revolved around our use of slang, and our speculations as to the source of Seth's knowledge.)(11:01分——珍回神了，跟我们挥挥手咧嘴而笑。这时我们的话题围绕在俚语的使用，以及推测赛斯知识的来源。)
—Ruburt has always been a doubting Thomas.And now I meet a doubting Jesuit... I have known several doubting Jesuits, but it would take me several hours to tell you about them. I have the time however....——鲁柏一向是个怀疑主义者。现在我又碰上了一个多疑的耶稣会信徒……我认识一些多疑的耶稣会信徒，要跟你们谈这些人得花上好几个钟头，不过我有的是时间……
(11:02—Jane was out of trance again, then went back in at 11:03.) —No one has to watch their conversation with me.I am capable of dealing with all aspects of reality, even cloudy ones on my plane....(11:02分——珍再度回神，但11:03分又出神了。)——没有人必须监看他们跟我之间的谈话。我有能力处理各方面的实相，甚至包括我的层面中一些阴郁的面向……
(Seth continued after we all sat silently for a moment.)(我们大家都静默不语，坐了一会儿之后，赛斯继续说。)
—I come and everyone is silent.I had hoped for a quiet chat... instead I meet with restraint and deadly silence.——我来到这里，但大家都不讲话。我原先期盼有轻声细语的闲聊……，不过感受到的却是这种自我克制、快令人窒息的沉默气氛。
(Bill Gallagher had something to say, by way of analogy, about Socrates and the city street cleaners.)(比尔想借由打个比方，讲一些有关苏格拉底和清道夫的事。)
—I am convinced, young man, that you plan these remarks, they are so good.I know they are not planned, however.You are very flattering.I must therefore consider the reasons... but I have always been this way, more or less———年轻人，我相信你准备讲这些话，这些话非常好。不过我知道这些话并不是事先准备好的。你真让人感到高兴。因此我必须顾及一些因素……不过我一向都是这样，几乎——
([Bill]: "You have the knowledge, and I’m trying to get the knowledge.”)([比尔]：“你拥有知识，我也想尝试获得这些知识。”)
I am older.我比较老啊。
([Bill:] "Sometimes I think I’m the older one, the way I feel.”)([比尔：]“有时我觉得我比较老，我是这样觉得啦。”)
You have been around... but there Joseph sits. He too has been around.I could tell you much about Joseph and Denmark, but I would not divulge the circumstances in which he was so unfortunately involved.你的阅历丰富……可是约瑟在场，他也是阅历丰富。我可以告诉你有关约瑟和丹麦的很多事，不过我不会跟你讲那些相当不幸的遭遇。
(Seth had more to say about my life in Denmark in the 1600’s, although nothing factual or involving dates, etc. The sum total of it was far from flattering to me.Jane was out of her trance again at 11:05.She remembered some of the material.(有关我1600年代在丹麦的生活，赛斯还有很多话要说，虽然那些东西都没有实事根据或确切的日期可考。对我来说，那些讯息全都不讨喜。11:05分珍再次回神，记得部分资料内容。
(Seth resumed again at 11:10, again in a jocular fashion, after we had been discussing his definition of action, among other things.)(我们讨论完赛斯对行动的定义及其他事之后，11:10分他再度以打趣的口吻继续说。)
I enjoy the emotional rapport among us here... our discussions are indeed action.Action changes me, and everyone in this room. I am no exception, even though I am here in a less conventional form.Actions change us all. We must change. I enjoy the actions... I also enjoy the buildup of your ideas.I am sincerely interested in all of your ideas—so that I can correct them.But this does not mean we cannot have an informal atmosphere.我喜欢我们之间现在的亲密情感……我们的讨论确实是一种行动。行动改变了我，也改变了在座的各位，我也不例外，纵使我现在的外形没那么传统。行动改变了我们大家，我们必须改变，我喜爱行动……我也喜欢你们建立观念。我对你们所有的观念真的很感兴趣——因此我可以修正它们。不过，这并不意味着我们不能有非正式的气氛。
(Jane, smiling, was out of her trance again at 11:11.She went back into it within a couple of minutes to wind up the session.)(11:11分，珍再度回神，面带微笑，她又回到出神状态来结束这节课。)
—I will now, since I too know your conception of the time, leave.As always, since you are my friends, I regret leaving.There is much you do not understand about relationships, which will explain these informal gatherings...——因为我也了解你们的时间概念，所以我现在就要离开。不过就如平常一样，我舍不得离开，因为你们都是我的朋友。对于各种关系，你们还有很多不了解，这些关系将可以解释为什么会有这些非正式的聚会……
I am not completed, or finished, or fulfilled anymore than you are.我丝毫没有比你们更完整、更完美或更满足。
We shall on some occasion have an entirely informal evening...I shall be gentle about any connections I may make.我们有时候将会有整节完全轻松的夜晚……在我可能做的任何连结中，我会保持温和的态度。
(End at 11:14. Jane’s eyes had been closed and she ended upon a note of humor. Her manner had been pleasant and animated throughout.Her eyes had been open at times, and very dark. At times she had switched in and out of the trance state very rapidly—more rapidly than indicated here. It had been no trouble for her.(This experience reminded me that Jane might try a little experiment of her own the next time such an occasion arose for informal exchange.It was simply that it should be possible for Jane herself to ask Seth questions, then go into trance to answer them.She agreed that it should work, especially if she was capable, as Seth, of carrying on a conversation with three other people, almost simultaneously.(11:14分结束。珍闭着眼睛，结束时语带幽默，从头到尾神情愉快，生气勃勃，双眼变得非常黑，偶尔会张开。她有时会在出神与回神状态之间快速转换——比这里描述的还要快，这对她来讲毫不困难。(这个经验提醒了我，下次如果有这种非正式对话的机会时，珍搞不好可以尝试做点自己的实验。简单来说，就是珍应该可以自己向赛斯提些问题，然后再出神回答问题。她同意这样应该很管用，尤其是当身为赛斯的她，几乎能够同时跟其他3人展开对话。
(During this informal exchange, Jane had been dissociated as usual.She now has participated in three such informal exchanges: during the 169th, the 170th, and the 177th.(在这次的非正式对话中，珍一如平常地出离。目前为止她已参与了3次这样非正式对话：分别是第169节、170节和这一节。
(During tonight’s exchange her voice had not been as deep as during the regular session preceding it.She had however spoken quite rapidly.)(今晚的对话中，她的声音都不像先前定期课那么低沉，不过讲话的速度倒是相当快。)

SESSION 178 第178节 睡前暗示


AUGUST 16, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年8月16日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(On Thursday, August 12 we received a letter from Dr. Instream that was somewhat puzzling to us; in the letter he did not mention receiving the copy of the 175th session, which we mailed on August 5.The session contained some clairvoyant-telepathic material, presumably referring to Dr. Instream or people he knows, that we were interested in checking out.(8月12日星期四，我们收到殷斯翠姆博士寄来的一封信，让我们觉得有点不解；因为信中并没提到他收到我们在8月5日寄出的第175节复印本。那一节的内容包含一些千里眼与心电感应的资料，这些资料应该是在描述殷斯翠姆博士和一些他认识的人，我们倒很有兴趣想查证看看。
(Jane has been practicing psychological time regularly. She reports that she attains her usual good “state, ” with little else happening.The only suggestions she gives herself now are to the effect that she is completely relaxed, and free of space and time. She used to use many more suggestions.(珍一直都规律在做心理时间的练习，她表示通常能达到不错的“境界”，很少会出什么状况。目前她给自己下的唯一暗示，大意是她完全放松，也摆脱了时间和空间的束缚，她过去习惯使用更多的暗示。
(It will be remembered that in the 140th session Seth suggested Jane avoid psychological time for a while, after she had unwittingly gone too far, too fast.A week later Jane resumed psy-time on a reduced time basis.Now, even though she is back up to her regular half-hour, she has had no experiences to speak of since then.She has however had some rather startling clairvoyant experiences outside of psy-time.(大家应该记得，第140节当中，在珍不经意练习得太过度、太快速之后，赛斯曾建议她那阵子先暂时停止练习心理时间。一周后，珍恢复练习，但缩短了时间。目前，珍虽然又回到半小时的规律练习，但从那时起她并没有什么经验可说。不过在心理时间之外，她有过好几次相当惊人的千里眼经验。
(It was a very hot and humid evening and we held the session in our large front room, where we have a cooler.Because our windows were open traffic noise was rather bothersome to me.Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet—too quiet as it developed. I had trouble hearing her, and shortly after she began speaking she hiked her chair closer to my table, and her voice acquired a little more volume.She used many pauses.)(这是个非常闷热潮湿的夜晚，我们的课在前面的大房间举行，那里有空气调节器。由于窗户开着，所以车子噪音令我相当困扰。珍闭上眼睛坐着说话，上课过程中轻声细语——声音太小，我听得很吃力，珍开始说话后旋即把椅子往我桌子拉近，这时声音才稍微大一点。她暂停多次。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
We see that Ruburt is trying too hard outside of our sessions.我们知道，目前鲁柏利用课余时间尝试得非常辛苦。
He is doing very well in our sessions.However in his psychological time experiments he is trying too hard.This leads to a constriction. We want an expansion.他在我们的课当中，做得相当好。不过他在心理时间的练习上，尝试得太过辛苦。这会造成压缩，我们要的是扩展。
(Jane moved her chair closer again, after I had asked her to repeat a few words.)(我请珍把几个字再说一遍后，她再度把椅子拉得更靠近。)
He is not to worry concerning any investigations of our sessions. Affairs will be handled very naturally.有关我们赛斯课的研究，他根本不必担心，事情自然而然会解决。
We are concerned with our material.Witnesses however are beneficial for the development of his own confidence, and the development of his own confidence facilitates the development of his abilities.我们关注我们的资料。不过见证人的参与，会有助于他建立自信心，而建立了自信心后，就会帮助他增加能力。
There will be a period of relaxation following the completion of his book, and during this time there will be a release of psychic energy that he will use most beneficially.He forgets to open up when he becomes overly concerned about his abilities.However, in the dream state he has been teaching himself to achieve greater freedom, and the results will show.他完成书之后会有一段放松时间，在这段时间释放出的心灵能量，可以让他做最有效的运用。一旦他过度关注自己的能力，就会忘记将能力发挥出来。不过，他在梦里一直都在教导自己如何获得更大的自由，这部分的效果以后会显现出来。
(Since Seth began discoursing on dream suggestion and health in the 172nd session, both Jane and I have been experimenting with these ideas.Jane has had quite a few interesting dreams since then, as a result of her suggestions.)(由于赛斯在第172节里开始谈到梦暗示与健康，所以我和珍两人就将这些概念付诸实验。从那时起，珍因着自己的暗示，做了相当多有趣的梦。)
He must avoid a do-or-die attitude. He does best when he allows his mind to wander, and not when he hems it in.In his psychological time experiments lately, he has concentrated with his will, though he did not realize he was doing so. Again, this leads to a constriction.他千万不要有不做就会完蛋的态度，若能允许自己的心四处游走，就会有最佳表现，但若关闭自己的心，就不会有效果。最近他进行心理时间实验时，都是靠自己的意志力聚精会神地练习，不过他自己并不知道这一点，而这种做法会导致压缩。
His book will be successful in many ways, and there will be other such books.On a subconscious basis Ruburt actually suggested his recent levitation dreams, with most effective results.He was not confident enough of his own abilities, and the dream success was most beneficial from this viewpoint.他的书在各方面都会很成功，而且陆续会有其他类的书。在潜意识的基础上，鲁柏实际上已暗示了他最近的漂浮梦，而且也获得极佳的成效。他对自己的能力不够有信心，从这个观点来说，漂浮梦的成功对他帮助最大。
In many ways his nature is extremely spontaneous in a natural fashion, and it is this attribute that is important to us.We will indeed try our own tests on various occasions. Our results will depend to a large degree upon the development of Ruburt’s abilities, and upon his own confidence.This is quite natural. He tries too hard with his own tests. When he forgets to try he does very well.他的本性在许多方面会以自然的方式流露出极端的自发性，这一项特质对我们很重要。我们真的会利用各种机会来做测试，我们的成果将相当依赖鲁柏的能力发展和自信心。这极其自然，他自己实验得太辛苦了，当他忘掉实验这回事，就做得非常好。
(The above passage refers to tests Jane uses on herself.Sometimes these involve Dr. Rhine’s Zener cards, sometimes objects sealed in envelopes, etc. Jane has not really extended herself in such tests, mostly due to a lack of time.She is interested in learning what other abilities she may have, however, outside of these sessions.)(上面这一段指的是珍对自己做的实验，有时候是莱恩博士的卡片，有时候是装在信封里的东西等。珍在这些实验上并没有真正扩展自己，多半是因为时间不够的关系。不过，她很想了解课堂以外她可能还拥有哪些其他能力。)
There are many details here that we shall discuss most thoroughly.He must remember however in his psychological time experiments that to focus outward, within and through the universe, is to expand and focus inward simultaneously.He must seek the expansion before he seeks the results or effects of the expansion.这里有很多细节我们还会详细讨论。但是他做心理时间练习时必须记得，不管是在宇宙里面或是穿透宇宙，他在往外聚焦的同时，其实也是在往内扩展与聚焦。他必须先求扩展，才能获得扩展的结果或成效。
It would help if he let himself go in the same way that he does when he works on his poetry.It will indeed be beneficial for you both to suggest to your subconscious that it enable you to develop your psychic abilities, and then consciously forget the matter.如果他能让自己以写诗集时一样的方式来进行，会很有帮助。跟你的潜意识暗示说，它可以让你发展心灵能力，然后在意识上把这件事忘掉，这对你们俩实际上都很有好处。
Ruburt does allow himself this freedom, until he begins to brood about it.We will begin slowly to further develop his abilities in our sessions.We may even ourselves initiate such a program.在鲁柏开始担心这部分之前，他确实一直允许自己有这样的自由。我们会在我们的课里面，开始慢慢进一步发展他的能力。我们自己甚至都可以开始进行这样的计划。
I am not primarily concerned with effects, as you know.They can be beneficial however from several viewpoints, and they can also give Ruburt confidence.Any such effects however will happen within the framework of our sessions, and we must always work in an atmosphere of mutual integrity.如你们所知，我关注的重点并不是在效果。不过，从某些方面来说，它们可能会有帮助，也可以为鲁柏带来信心。不管怎样，任何这样的效果都会出现在我们的课程架构里面，我们随时都必须在彼此坦诚的气氛下进行。
I suggest your break, and we will then turn to other matters.我建议你们休息一下，然后我们再来讨论其他问题。
(Break at 9:22.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first break.Her eyes had remained closed; her voice had been loud enough to rise above the traffic noise.The noise had bothered me, but Jane said that as she was speaking she was aware of no distractions.(9:22分休息。珍第一阶段的出离状况如常，双眼一直闭着；音量早就压过车子的噪音。那些噪音一开始就干扰着我，不过珍说，她讲话时知道自己并没有分心。
(She had used many pauses, some of them close to a minute long.Her “brogue” had also been apparent at times.She resumed at a somewhat faster rate, again with her eyes closed, at 9:30.)(她停顿多次，其中有些长达将近一分钟。她的“爱尔兰腔调”有时候也很明显。9:30分她再度闭上眼睛，以稍快的速度继续口述。)
Now. The connections between the dreaming self and the waking self, and between the dream universe and the physical universe, exist on chemical, electromagnetic and psychic levels.现在，做梦的自己与醒时自己的连结，以及梦宇宙与物质宇宙的连结，这些现象都存在于化学、电磁及心灵层面上。
They are completely interwoven. Effects in one are reflected in the other[s].As you have already supposed Joseph, suggestions received during the sleeping state are often carried out by the waking personality.它们完全交织在一起，某个宇宙里的效应也会反映在其他宇宙里。约瑟，如你认为的，醒时人格经常会实现睡梦中接收到的暗示。
(It might be interesting to digress a moment to discuss the point raised by Seth in the last paragraph.I believe he is referring here to an experience of mine.As far as I can recall, this was the first time I became consciously aware that a dream could influence waking action.(现在岔开话题来讨论赛斯上面提出的那一点，应该蛮有意思的。我相信他这里指的是我的经验。就我的记忆所及，那是我第一次在意识上觉察到梦可以影响醒时的行动。
(On Tuesday night, June 22, I had five dreams which I wrote in my dream notebook the next morning.Dream number five was a very short one, in color.In it I found myself approaching a certain traffic light in my car.I was on a side street, two blocks from the printing plant where I work.In the dream I sat waiting for some little time for the light to turn green, giving me access to the main highway, Lake Street.I seldom take this route in actuality, since this particular light is set to favor the heavy flow of traffic on Lake Street.Anyone approaching it as I did in my dream can wait for up to a couple of minutes for it to change.(6月22日星期二晚上，我做了5个梦，隔天早上我写在梦笔记本里。第5个梦非常简短，是彩色的。梦里我发现自己在车子里，往某个红绿灯前进。我在一条小街上，距离我上班的印刷厂两个街区。梦中的我为了进入主干道湖街，坐着等红绿灯已经一会儿时间了。事实上，自从为了舒缓湖街拥塞的交通，而设置这个红绿灯以后，我就很少走这条路。就如我梦中状况一样，任何要通过这个红绿灯的人都至少得等个几分钟。
(As usual, after writing down the dream upon arising I promptly forgot it.I left the house for work.Sometimes I drive to work by different routes, for variety.On this particular morning, June 23, I did so.I then found myself traveling down this particular side street, approaching the light in question, but without remembering the dream to this moment.(一如往常，在起床写下这个梦之后我立刻就把它忘了。后来我离家去上班。为了有变化，我偶尔会开不同的路去。6月23日那天早上，我就是这样。后来我发现自己就走在那条小街上，往上述那个红绿灯前进，但那时并没有联想到那个梦。
(When I was a few car lengths from the light, the dream suddenly popped into my mind.Just as in the dream, I found myself stopping for a red light.The effect was so startling that I at once began to wonder whether it was possible to act out dream suggestions in waking life.My self questioning was particularly intriguing because I could have chosen from a half-dozen routes to work; yet I had picked a course that enabled me to act out the dream of the night before, while not being consciously aware of the dream.)(在我离那个红绿灯还有几部车的距离时，这个梦突然蹦进我脑海里。就跟梦里面一样，我发现自己停下来等红绿灯。这个效果如此惊人，使得我马上开始怀疑醒时生活里是否可能实现梦的暗示。我反思这件事时觉得很有意思，因为当时我有6条上班路线可供选择；但在我意识上并未觉察到那个梦的状况下，却选了一条让我实践前晚梦境的路线。)
Suggestions made by the waking personality are also carried out by the sleeping self.The characteristics of the sleeping personality therefore partially determine the physical existence of the waking self.Solutions to problems are sought and received and worked for in the dream state.The physical environment is directly affected then by the activities of the dreaming self.醒时人格的暗示也会由睡梦中的自己执行。因此，睡梦中人格的特质可以部分决定醒时自己的物质存在。在梦境中可以发现与接收到问题的解决之道，然后执行。接着物质环境就直接受到梦中自己的活动所影响。
Abilities unused by the waking personality are utilized in the dream state.A study of dream activities will often allow the waking personality to recognize abilities of which it is not aware, to discover talents that are not being used.Such a study can be most beneficial in allowing the personality to utilize all of its capabilities.There is no doubt that the whole self is a composite formed by the various aspects of the personality as it is seen in the waking and dream states, and at other levels of operation.醒时人格未使用的能力会在梦境中发挥。探索梦里的活动，往往会让醒时人格认出原本它未觉察到的能力，以发现目前还没使用到的天赋。这样的探索有利于让人格运用自己所有的能力。毫无疑问，全我是由人格的各种不同面向所组成，就像在醒时状况、做梦状态及其他运作层面中看到的一样。
There are levels of which we have not yet spoken.The repository of potentiality however is contained within those layers that are not conscious.As a rule the ego chooses those elements from this repository which it feels will be most beneficial in dealing with physical reality.有些层面我们还没谈到。不过，潜能宝库就存在于那些非意识的层面里。自我通常就从这个宝库里，选取那些它觉得在与物质实相打交道时最有用的元素。
In many instances however, because of environment and other influences, the ego accepts few of the abilities available, and therefore hampers the full development of personality.Of necessity the ego discards more than it accepts, and this is why Ruburt runs into difficulties when he becomes too egotistically concerned.不过由于环境和其他因素的影响，许多时候自我只接受少数几种可获得的能力，于是阻碍了人格完全的发展。自我舍弃的必然比接受的还多，这也是为什么鲁柏对自我太过关切时就会遇到困难的原因。
In actuality the ego itself definitely benefits by allowing greater flexibility.It does become more active, and to some degree more permissive under such conditions, but the flexibility involved adds to its strength in beneficial ways.事实上，自我本身确实可以透过允许更大的弹性而获益。在这种情况下，自我的确会变得更活跃，某程度上也会变得更宽容，而这种弹性会以有益的方式增加自我的力量。
Ego concern is a very jealous concern, and it is directly connected to the personality’s concept of survival necessities within the physical universe.The ego that is overly fearful for survival will allow little potential to show itself unless that potential is directly connected with physical survival.Actually what happens here is that the ego sells the personality short, out of fear, and denies those very abilities that are needed, and in practical terms.自我对于其所关切的事项，带着高度的警戒心，这与人格在物质宇宙里的生存需求有直接关联。对生存过度恐惧的自我不太允许自己发挥潜能，除非这个潜能跟物质生存直接相关。实际的情况是，具体而言自我出于恐惧而低估了人格，否认了那些必备的能力。
I will suggest your break, and we will continue along these lines.我建议你们休息一下，我们再继续讨论这部分。
(Break at 9:48.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice had been a bit stronger, her pace had picked up quite a bit during the delivery.Her brogue had again been apparent at times.(9:48分休息。珍的出离状况如常，口述时一直闭着眼睛，声音的力度大了一些，速度也加快很多。她的爱尔兰口音有时候还是很明显。
(She resumed in the same manner at 9:57.)(珍以同样的方式，9:57分继续口述 。)
The ego that ignores too many of the possibilities of the inner self is soon in dire difficulty, and is forced to realize that it has been considering survival in a very limited light.由于自我忽略了太多内我的可能性，很快就会陷入极大的困境，而且势必会明白它一直以狭隘的观点看待生存。
For the personality in such circumstances will shrivel up, and ultimately the physical self will die ahead of its time, and despite all emergency efforts made by the ego, unless it makes the necessary effort.Survival within the physical universe, as within all others, is determined by the full development of potential.因为在这种情况下的人格会枯萎，到最后肉体的自己就会提前死亡，即使自我努力做了所有的紧急措施也一样，除非它做的是必要的努力。物质宇宙里的生存，跟所有其他的宇宙一样，取决于潜能的完全发展。
The greatest possible development allows the greatest possible security, for such development shows itself physically and in all other manners.The entire gestalt simply works better and more efficiently and more joyfully, from the smallest cell to the most organized aspects of personality.最极致的发展会带来最极致的安全，因为这样的发展会展现在物质层面及所有其他方面。整个完形绝对会运作得更好、更有效且更愉快，从人格最小的细胞层面到最大的组织层面都一样。
You may find it helpful, and certainly fascinating, to study your own dreams, looking at them for the purpose of searching in their framework for abilities of which the ego is not aware.探讨你自己的梦，仔细端详它们，以便在它们的架构中寻找自我未觉察到的各种能力，你们或许会发现这样做真的很有帮助、也很有趣。
(Jane now took a long pause, then smiled.)(珍这时候停顿很久，然后微笑。)
Your own talents have worked for the survival of your personality, Joseph. They have given you a strength that you would not possess if your ego had not allowed them to emerge.You may not think of your artistic abilities as serving any practical purpose, insofar as survival is concerned, and yet they have been your main security, and in very practical ways.约瑟，你自己的天赋已经为你人格的生存在运作了，它们给了你一股力量，但如果你的自我不允许天赋出现，就不会获得这股力量。就生存来说，你或许不认为你的艺术才能可以达成什么实际的目的，但它们一直就是你主要的保障，而且以非常实际的方式在发挥。
Without a sense of joy and inner accomplishment and development of potential, the personality will not only fail to flourish, but the inner self will refuse to maintain the physical structure adequately.This is extremely important. Superficial measures will not fool the inner self.如果感受不到喜乐愉悦、内在圆满及潜能发展，那么不但人格无法茁壮成长，而且内我也不会维持适当的肉体结构。这一点极为重要，肤浅表象的作为骗不了内我。
We will discuss for some sessions the nature of dreams, practically speaking, from many viewpoints.Other suggestions will be given for general benefit.I hope in the future to make these points clear enough so that you will be able to discover definite connections where you have not before, that will tie in waking and dreaming situations with rather surprising results.实际上，我们会花几节课的时间，从各种观点来讨论梦的本质。我也会提出一些其他不错的建议。我希望未来能好好理清这几点，让你们可以发现之前不曾发现的连结，这个醒时与梦境的连结会带来相当惊人的结果。
By far the most immediately helpful suggestions have to do with dream therapy, with problem solving, and the search for abilities as shown within the dream state.显然，此刻最有帮助的建议是关于梦疗法、问题的解决、发现梦境中显现的能力。
The energy used in constructing dreams is every bit as intense as the energy used in the waking state, but there is no depletion because the sleeping self uses energy more naturally, realizing that it is available, and being more free in its operation.用来建构梦的能量，其强度与醒时状态所使用的能量相比毫不逊色，但是却永远不会耗尽，因为睡梦的自己使用能量的方式更为自然，也了解能量随手可得，在能量的运作上也更为自由。
The energy is used in a more diffused manner however, than in the waking state. It does not have to be focused in one main direction only.It is as intense, but it has a wider radius. There is no strain involved.然而，与醒时状态相比，在梦境中能量的使用更能四处扩散，不必只聚焦在某个主要方向上。它有着同样的强度，但又有更大的范围，也没有过度使用的问题。
This is one of the reasons why health suggestions given immediately before sleep are so effective. Incidentally, they are excellent practice. Expectation can also aid you.In this case suggestions should be given leading to dreams in which a desired situation is accomplished. The dream will then increase and activate your own expectations.And as you know, the expectations themselves have much to do with whether or not any given situation will occur.Further detailed discussions will be held on all of these points, before these matters are covered.这是为什么临睡前的健康暗示会很有效，顺带一提，睡前暗示是相当棒的做法，心中怀抱着期望，对你也有帮助。在这种状态下，应该给自己一些暗示，告诉自己会在梦里实现想要的情境。接着梦就会加强和活化你自己的期望。如你们所知，期望本身就与任何特定情境是否真的会发生密切相关。在涉及这些主题前，会进一步详细讨论所有的观点。
I will now close our session.And Ruburt should reread particularly the first portion of the session several times.我现在就要结束我们的课。本节的第一部分鲁柏应该再特别多看几次。
My heartiest wishes to you both.送上我最深情的祝福给你们俩。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:20.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. Her pace had been good, her voice average and with an occasional touch of brogue.The hot and humid evening had not bothered her during deliveries.)(10:20分结束。珍的出离状况如常，双眼一直闭着，速度维持得不错，声音大小适中，偶尔会出现爱尔兰腔调。今晚传述时，湿热的天气并未干扰到她。)

SESSION 179 第179节 第一次“信封测验”


AUGUST 18, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年8月18日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(In the last session Seth had commented favorably on trying some tests with Jane and me.An hour or so before this evenings session, without telling Jane beforehand, I made a black ink drawing of the symbol below on a small sheet of paper.[This was to be our first “envelope test’’.](上一节课赛斯善意地提到要跟我和珍一起尝试做些测验。今晚上课前一小时左右，在事先没告诉珍的情况下，我用黑色墨水在一张小纸上画了上面的图案[这应该是我们第一次“信封测验”。]
(I folded it once, put it in an envelope, then sealed this envelope in another so there was no chance of seeing through paper.My idea was to hand the envelope to Jane just before she went into trance for the session. I wanted to see how much, if any, of the contents Jane or Seth could describe.(我把它对折一次，放进信封袋，然后再把这个信封放在另一个信封袋里，以防止透视。我的构想是，在珍上课出神前将信封递给她，看看珍或赛斯对信封内容描述多少。
(Interestingly enough, Jane came back to my studio as I was writing down the above paragraph in longhand.(很有趣的是，我正在书写上面这段话时，珍走回我的工作室。我一向在上课前写下这些开头注释，以节省时间。
I usually write these preliminary notes before the session to save time. I tried to divert her attention now but she read the words “without telling Jane beforehand.” She left the studio when I asked her to, but I now thought she had been alerted to something unusual, and might be anticipating a test of some sort.I had not wanted to make her nervous.这时我试着转移她的注意力，但她已读出“在事先没告诉珍的情况下”这几个字。之后我请她离开工作室，不过这时候我在想，她早就警觉到有些不寻常的事了，或许已经预料到会有某种测试。我原本并不想让她紧张。
(I picked the symbol above because Seth had dealt with a version of this in the 68th, 75th, 83rd and 84th sessions, in connection with Bill Macdonnel’s trip to Provincetown, MA, last summer.Seth insisted that Bill had seen a symbol similar to this on a rowboat at Provincetown, although Bill did not recall it.Other data Seth gave us about Bill’s trip was verified.Note that I added my own initials to the symbol above.My idea was that using such a design as a test would summon up a little more emotional involvement, since Bill was included along with Seth, Jane and me.(我选择了上面的符号，因为赛斯在第68、75、83和84节里，谈过这个符号，那是跟比尔∙麦唐纳去年夏天到麻萨诸塞州普罗文斯敦旅行的事件有关。赛斯坚称，比尔在普罗文斯敦的一艘小船上曾见过类似的符号，不过比尔并不记得。至于赛斯所说其他有关比尔旅行的资料都经过验证。请注意，我在这个符号加上了我自己姓名的开头字母。我的想法是，由于比尔、我、赛斯、珍都跟这个符号有关，因此以这样的设计当做测试就可以引发多一点的情感投入。
(I was not sure whether the test would be telepathic or clairvoyant, or a combination.I felt it would now be different since Jane was probably alerted.She confirmed this just before the session when she asked me about it, so I gave her the envelope at 8:57.She agreed to some nervousness, though not a great deal.She also said she thought Seth might address the session to Dr. Instream, and that if he did she would prefer not to be distracted. Thus she might not deal with the envelope.(我不敢确定这个测试会是心电感应或是千里眼，还是两种都有。我觉得现在状况有所不同，因为珍可能已经警觉到了。其实，在上课之前珍问我这件事时，就确认这一点了，所以我在8:57分便把这封信交给她。她承认自己有些紧张，不过并不太严重。她也说，认为赛斯这节课应该是讲给殷斯翠姆博士听的，如果真是这样，那她就不想分心，或许就不去理会这封信。
(Because it was another very hot and humid night we held the session in our large front room, where air circulation is better.Traffic noise was a problem once more; our windows of course had to be open, although the blinds were drawn.The quality of the air seemed to aggravate the noise, and quite often during the session Jane appeared to pause until the noise abated temporarily.I felt that the noise, being such a problem, was influencing the quality of the session.(今晚又非常湿热，所以我们就在前面的大房间举行这堂课，那里空气比较流通。车子噪音再度是个问题；窗户当然得开着，不过百叶窗已放下。空气品质似乎让噪音干扰更为严重，上课时珍的停顿相当频繁，似乎要等噪音暂时变小才继续。我觉得这样的噪音问题影响了上课品质。
(Strangely enough, Jane did not speak in an overly loud voice. In the beginning she spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed. She leaned forward in her rocker, holding the envelope in her clasped hands.She used many pauses, some of them quite long.)(非常奇怪的是，珍讲话的声音并没有太大声，开始时珍闭上眼睛坐着说话，坐在摇椅上，身体前倾，双手紧握着那封信，停顿多次，其中有几次停顿相当久。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I would like to make a few points here in connection with the letter which you recently received from Dr. Instream.对于最近你们从殷斯翠姆博士那里收到的信，我有几点要讲。
First of all, I have no information of setting up any unreasonable nor impossible conditions.An atmosphere of trust, mutual trust, would however seem to be indispensable.Spontaneity must be allowed for.首先，我并没有意愿设定任何不合理或不可能的条件。不过，一种信任、互相信任的气氛似乎不可或缺。同时也必须允许自发性的表现。
These two factors are extremely important. I do not set them as conditions.It is simply a fact that little will be achieved without them.这两种元素极为重要，但我并没把它们设为条件。没有它们就难竟其功，事实就是如此。
(Cars and trucks rumbled and boomed by outside, and Jane sat quietly until the noise subsided somewhat.Seth refers above to Dr. Instream’s letter of August 10.)(这时外面的汽车和卡车轰隆隆地来来往往，珍安静坐着直到这种噪音稍微减缓为止。赛斯上面这段话指的是殷斯翠姆博士8月10的来信。)
Another meeting between Dr. Instream and myself would be advantageous, so that we could speak plainly.Perhaps such a meeting would facilitate mutual understanding, without which such a venture has little hope of success.如果我跟殷斯翠姆博士能再碰个面，会很有帮助，我们可以打开天窗说亮话。这样的会面或许就会增进彼此的了解，如果没有彼此了解，这类的试探计划就没有什么成功的机会。
Our main problem is simply Ruburt’s own confidence, or lack of it.This, in time, will not bother us.I spoke plainly in our recorded session, nor do I regret so doing.I am not only objective, I am also, perhaps unfortunately, given to bluntness.我们主要的问题纯粹是鲁柏自己的信心，或是说缺乏信心。这部分慢慢就不会影响我们。在我们录音的课里，我说得很明白，我也不后悔这么做。我说话不但公正客观，而且或许可以算不幸吧，我也很坦率。
(Another long pause, until the traffic noise subsided.The recorded session that Seth addressed to Dr. Instream is the 170th.)(又是一次较长的停顿，一直到汽车噪音慢慢变小。赛斯为殷斯翠姆博士录制的课在第170节里。)
I did say quite plainly that I would cooperate in any such endeavor that is conducted with integrity, and so I shall.When I spoke of terms, saying that my terms should be met, I was not, again, speaking of any impossible conditions; merely that spontaneity, trust and integrity be necessary factors in our endeavor.我的确说的相当明白，在任何这类彼此诚实对待的努力中，我都愿意合作，也会付诸行动，我在谈到条件，说要符合我的条件时，再重早一次，我不会开出任何不可能达成的条件；我只说自发性、信任和诚实是我们努力过程中的必备要素。
It is quite true however that proof is not necessary from my standpoint.It is quite necessary perhaps from your standpoint.This is quite understandable, and since I realize this I do not see how it becomes an issue. Particularly since I have more than once stressed that I would cooperate.然而，从我的观点来看，根本不需要证据，的确如此。但就你们的观点来说，或许相当需要证据。这一点非常容易理解，因为我知道这种情形，所以我看不出它会是个问题，尤其是我一再强调我会合作。
My emotional response however was quite legitimate.I would prefer that some informal meeting be held if possible between us, as a preliminary to our venture.I do not necessarily stand on ceremony, but I do feel that some friendly discussion would be seeming under the circumstances.无论如何，我的情绪反应算是相当合情合理。可能的话我希望我们之间来些非正式的会面，以做为我们试探计划的准备。我不见得会拘泥礼节，但我的确觉得在这样的情况下，一些友善的讨论似乎有其必要。
For one thing, I would like to know specifically what Dr. Instream has in mind, and prefer that we work it from that angle.This could be discussed between us.首先，我特别想知道殷斯翠姆博士心里在想些什么，也希望我们能从那个角度来进行。这个我们都可以讨论。
I now suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:18.Jane said she was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes remained closed. She used many pauses other than those indicated, and said she was aware of the traffic noise at times. She held the test envelope for the entire delivery.(9:18分休息。珍说她第一阶段的出离状况如常，眼睛一直闭着，停顿次数比上面注解的还多，也说有时候可以意识到车子的吵杂声，口述时全程拿着那个测试信封。
(Her voice had been rather quiet, and remained so.Again with her eyes closed, and holding the envelope, she resumed at 9:26.)(她的声音一开始就非常轻柔，并一路维持这样。珍再度闭着眼睛，手拿信封， 9:26分继续口述。)
Such a meeting would help to set Ruburt at ease.这样子的会面可以帮助鲁柏舒缓情绪。
It is important however that he does not feel under pressure.The idea of tests somewhat upsets him, but this can be overcome without too much difficulty in time.不过，重点是他不要觉得有压力。测试的点子让他觉得有点烦乱，但最后还是不难克服。
I would consider it a gesture of courtesy if Dr. Instream acquainted himself with some of our material.如果殷斯翠姆博士自己能熟悉一下我们的一些资料，我会把这当成是礼貌的表现。
Now, for ourselves: Ruburt must work some things through on his own, as he knows.There is no doubt that the whole affair still seems strange to him, and he is acclimating himself to new conditions as they arise.It is understandable that he becomes uneasy at times under such circumstances.It is an excellent idea that he has taken up his painting again, for this turns his awareness to other matters.We shall endeavor to handle our relationships with the outside world in such a way that your private situations are not bothered any more than absolutely necessary.现在，为了我们自己：有一些事情鲁柏必须自己去完成，就如他所知的一样。无疑地，对他来讲，整件事看起来仍然很奇怪，不过当新的状况出现，他也会让自己去适应。他在这样的情况下偶尔变得心神不宁，的确可以理解。他能重拾画笔，其实非常好，因为这样可以将它的觉察力转到别的事物上。我们会努力掌握好我们跟外在世界的关系，好让你们的私生活不再受到任何不必要的干扰。
(Another long pause.Jane sat learning forward, her head down, holding the test envelope.)(再次停顿很久。珍坐着，身子前倾，低着头，手拿测试信封。)
Ruburt has been lately in a period in which he has been seeking knowledge as to his own abilities. This has been reflected in his dream activities, as well as in his waking situation.The concentration upon psychic phenomena in general, including his concentration in his book, has somewhat made him weary.This is very temporary, and already he is beginning to find new reserves of energy.I am easy on him now, however, for the above mentioned reasons.鲁柏最近处于寻求认识自己能力的阶段，这种情形已反映在他梦里的活动和醒时的情境上。整体来说，他对心灵现象的专注，包括对自己书的专注，让他感到有些疲惫。不过这种状况非常短暂，他已开始寻找新的能量库存。不过，基于上述原因，我现在对他比较宽容。
We will try to see what we can do with your envelope. It contains paper with writing on it, printed or perhaps typewritten, and also I believe handwritten.It may be in the nature of a license, but it is of some legal nature rather than a personal note, blue or green and white, the handwritten material on printed lines.I believe it belongs to you, Joseph, and while it is yours that it has a legal connotation.我们试着来看看怎么处理你的信封，里面是一张纸，上面写了些东西，是印上去或可能是打上去的，但我相信是手写的。它可能是某种执照之类的东西，具有法定效力，而不是个人笔记，是蓝色或绿色白色，在印好的线条上，手写了一些东西。约瑟，我相信这个东西属于你，它是你的，隐含了某种法律意义。
(Jane took a pause of average length.She sat with her eyes closed, still holding the envelope though not actively fingering it.She had delivered the above information quietly and steadily.)(珍这时停顿下来，时间不长不短。她闭着眼睛坐着，手里依然拿着那个信封，不过并没有常常用手指去搓它。传述上面资料时，声音轻柔，态度沉稳。)
It seems that another person is also somehow involved with it, a male.好像还有一个人跟它也有点关联，是个男人。
(Another pause, longer this time.)(另一次停顿，这次停得比较长。)
Ruburt has been somewhat uneasy at the thought of a test. To some degree this may affect our results.However, the very fact that he permitted the test to be conducted shows that his attitude is improving.鲁柏一想到这个测试就有些不安，这种情形或多或少会影响到我们的结果。不过，他答应做这个测试，此一事实显示出做的态度正在进步中。
I will now suggest a short break.我建议现在休息一下。
(Break at 9:43.Jane was dissociated as usual. Traffic had become noisy again, and she said she thought Seth took the break now because of this.Jane had realized she was discussing the envelope.When she opened it she was quite disappointed with the results. I was pleased.(9:43分休息。珍的出离状况如常，车子噪音再度扰人，她认为赛斯是因为如此才在此时休息。珍知道自己正在讨论这个信封。她打开信封看到结果后相当失望，而我却很高兴。
(We had no idea of how to interpret such an experiment, or even whether there is a one best way. Would “errors” of omission be counted'?Seth did not mention a symbol at all, yet used the words handwritten and printed.To me printed means mechanically produced; to Jane printed means hand lettering, as were my initials beneath the symbol.(我们不知道怎么解释这样的实验，甚至也不知道是否有个最佳方式，省略算是“错误”吗？赛斯根本没有提到那个符号，只说了是用手写和印上去的。对我而言，印上去是指由机器生产；对珍来说，印上去则是指以手指书写，就像符号下面我姓名的开头字母一样。
(Seth did not mention two envelopes, although Jane said she knew there were two involved.It is also obvious that touch alone could give information as to whether the envelope contained paper, some kind of cardboard or other heavier material, or perhaps metal.(赛斯没提到有两个信封，不过珍说她知道有两个。单靠触摸就可以得知信封里是否装了纸张，或某种纸卡或其他较厚的东西，像是金属物质，这一点也显而易见。
(I was puzzled as to why Seth, or Jane, was so definite about the envelope containing a license or some sort of similar document, when Jane revealed that at last break she had thought the envelopes did contain a license.We thought it most interesting that the data based on Janes conscious thoughts proved to be that in error.It will be remembered that Seth/Jane paused before delivering the last line of information concerning the envelopes. This information I consider a direct hit.Another person, Bill Macdonnel, is involved with the symbol.See my notes on pages 199. 200.(珍上次休息时，表示她早就认为这个信封的确装了执照，那为何赛斯或珍，这么确定信封里不是执照就是某种类似的文件，这让我有点搞不懂。珍在意识思想上的资料，错把里面的东西认为是执照，这一点我们觉得非常有意思。大家应该记得，赛斯－珍在传述有关信封的讯息时，在说最后一句话之前停了下来，我认为是因为这时突然直接来了这个讯息。另一个与这个符号有关的人就是比尔∙麦唐纳。请参阅我在前面相应的注释。
(I can say that when Seth/Jane paused before delivering this last line, I had the feeling that some kind of inner shift in control had taken place; that Seth rather than Jane was responsible for the last line of material.There was no objective evidence on which I could base this feeling, yet I sensed it.And of course I knew as Jane delivered it that the material about a license was not correct.(我可以说，在赛斯－珍传述最后那一句话前停顿时，我就感觉到某种内在控制权的转变已经发生；我觉得说出资料最后一句话的是赛斯而不是珍。我这种感觉并不是基于客观的证据，但我就是感应得到。当然，我知道，就如珍所口述的，所谓信封里装的是执照之类的东西并不正确。
(Jane said that Seth himself was definite about another male being involved with the contents of the envelope.Her own thought, as she spoke, was that a female was involved; but Seth, she said, would not allow her to say a female was involved.Thus it seems that in giving the material on the envelope, Jane was drawing upon a couple of levels of awareness at once.(珍说，赛斯自己很确定跟信封内容有关的是另一个男人。但珍自己的想法，就如她说的，则认为是个女人；不过珍说，赛斯不准她说那个是女人。因此珍在提供信封的相关资料似乎同时使用了两种意识层次。
(Traffic noise was still audible.Jane resumed in a bit louder voice, with her eyes closed, at 9:57.)(车子噪音依然很吵。9:57分，珍将嗓门稍微拉大些，闭着眼睛继续口述。)
We will not have a long session.我们这一节课不会太长。
The combination of the traffic and the test, of which Ruburt was aware, served, though only slightly, to dismay him.However there are some points I would like to make.鲁柏同时觉察到了车子噪音和这个测试，这让他感到惊慌，不过程度还算轻微。我这里还有几点要说明。
We are dealing here with something rather unusual, in that we are attempting to permit two personalities to exist side by side, so to speak.Ruburt is not in a deep trance state. I do not supersede his own personality.He allows me, in our sessions, to coexist with himself.我们现在面临了某件相当不寻常的事情，因为我们正努力让两个人格同时存在。鲁柏出神的程度并不深，我并没有取代他自己的人格。在我们的课堂里，他允许我跟他自己同时存在。
A deeper trance state would allow us to get less distorted results on such a test as this, initially, but our results will improve.And such experiments will be helpful in that the various layers of the two personalities, Ruburt’s and my own, will be seen in their operating procedures.一开始，深度的出神可以让我们在这样的测试中，获得较不扭曲的结果，不过我们的结果会进步。这样的实验会很有帮助，因为在运作过程中，可以看到我自己和鲁柏这两个人格里的各种层面。
Ruburt will learn very quickly through such practice.It must be remembered that this is new to him, and upon occasion he must distinguish between my communications and his own thoughts.This sort of practice will be most beneficial, and though he may not think so consciously it will build his confidence.透过这类练习，鲁柏可以学得很快。一定要记得，这种事对他来说很新鲜，有时候他必须辨别是我的沟通讯息还是他自己的意念。这种练习极有帮助，虽然他意识上或许不以为然，但仍然可以建立起他的信心。
(“Were you aware that he was distorting the information while he was speaking.(“他说话时，你知道他正在扭曲讯息吗？”
(Jane paused and frowned.)(珍暂停下来，皱着眉头。)
On one level, yes.However, this is a rather permissive relationship in many respects, and one of my primary concerns has been to allow both of you to recognize and develop your own abilities.某层面来说，是的。不过，就许多方面而言，这是一种相当随意的关系，而我关注的重点在于让你们两人认识并发展你们自己的能力。
The distortions that appeared are most helpful, in that they allow Ruburt to differentiate between my communications and his own thoughts.At times he has had difficulty in this respect, as is perfectly natural.This does not occur when he does not know in advance that a test is planned, when I speak spontaneously; as for example when on one occasion I gave definite details concerning your Marks vacation.出现了这些扭曲其实极有帮助，因为它们使鲁柏必须辨别我的沟通讯息与他自己的意念。有时候他在这一方面有困难，这一点很正常。如果他事先不知道有测试计划，那当我自发性讲话时，这种情形就不会发生；像是有一次我提供有关马克度假的明确细节，就是这样。
(Mark is Bill Macdonnel’s entity name.Again, see the 68th, 75th, 83rd and 84th sessions, and pages 199. 200.Bill verified just about all of the details Seth gave us concerning Bill’s trip to Provincetown last summer.)(马克是比尔·麦唐纳的存有名字。相关资料请参看第68、75 、83和84节。赛斯给了我们关于比尔去年夏天到普罗文斯顿旅行的资料，比尔全部核对过。)
The features which hung in front of his face did not bother him, since he did not know what I had planned to do.For the record incidentally, let us add that this occurred in full light.挂在他面前的那个脸孔并没干扰到他，因为他不知道我打算这么做。顺便郑重声明一下，让我们再补充一点，这件事发生在光线十分充足的地方。
(See the 68th session.During this session, in which Bill Macdonnel saw an apparition for upwards of an hour, Bill and I saw an independent set of features that appeared to hang just in front of Jane’s features.)(参见第68节。在这节中，比尔·麦唐纳看见一个幽灵，时间长达一小时以上，我和比尔看到一个独立的脸孔挂在珍的面前。)
The repetition of such tests will be beneficial, and his abilities to let material through undistorted will grow. You can benefit however in the meantime even from failures.We are attempting to develop Ruburt’s abilities. They are not fully developed by any means.重复做这种测试很有帮助，他精确传递资料的能力会增加，即使失败，你们也会收获。我们正努力发展鲁柏的能力，无论如何，他的能力都尚未完全发展。
(Jane had spoken for much of the evening with her head down at a slight angle.Very recently she had lifted it somewhat, and I saw that her eyes appeared to be slitted.Now they opened, at 10:15. She looked at me casually. Her eyes were very dark, without highlights.(珍今晚口述时，有许多时间都微低着头。她刚刚把头稍微抬起来，我发现她眯着眼睛。现在10:15分她打开双眼，随意地看着我，眼睛非常黑，没有光彩。
(Jane’s cigarettes lay on the table beside her. She lit one as she continued speaking, in a quiet voice.Traffic noise had quieted.She did not stare at me continually.)(珍的香烟放在身旁的桌子上，点了一根，继续口述，声音轻柔。车子噪音已经停歇，她并没有继续盯着我看。)
My interest is in the development of the abilities. Proofs will be a natural result.I communicate with you through Ruburt. I am to some extent therefore dependent upon him.It is up to me to train him, and tests such as this will help us in this endeavor.我感兴趣的是能力发展，证据只是一种自然的结果。我透过鲁柏与你们沟通，因此某种程度我得依赖他。训练他是我的责任，在这样的努力过程中，这类的测试对我们会有帮助。
My only concern is that he is not frightened off.I believe however that our foundation is strong enough so that we can safely proceed in this direction.我唯一关注的是他没有被吓跑。然而，我相信我们的基础非常稳固，足以让我们能安全地往这个方向前进。
Your idea Joseph was a good one basically, for practice.It was hardly scientific enough, even if the results were 100 percent accurate, which they were not, for Dr. Instream.But it is a beginning.约瑟，你的点子基本上是个很好的练习。对殷斯翠姆博士来说，即使所得到的结果百分之百准确，也很难称得上够科学，更何况也并非百分之百准确。不过这是个开始。
Using such a procedure in each session will do much to eliminate Ruburt’s uneasiness and to build his confidence.The emotional impetus however is lacking. In some manner perhaps in the future we can do something to build in an emotional impetus of some sort, as it will be conducive to success.每节课采取这样的步骤，可以有效消除鲁柏不安的情绪，并建立他的信心。不过，缺少了情感动力，未来我们或许可以透过某种方式，做某件事以增加某种情感动力，因为这样做比较容易成功。
(Janes eyes now closed at times as she spoke.Her voice was quiet and she was still smoking.)(珍这时说话偶尔会闭上眼睛，声音轻柔，仍抽着烟。)
Some similar experiments might be conducted with our friendly Jesuit, and she who dislikes the feline family.或许可以找我们亲爱的耶稣会信徒，和那位不喜欢猫科动物的女性，一起做一些类似的实验。
(Here Seth refers to Bill and Peggy Gallagher, who have witnessed several sessions.Last week they agreed to participate in some tests.In the beginning the experiments would involve such simple procedures as having the Gallaghers, while at their home, focus upon objects Jane and I have not seen, at appointed hours during sessions held in our own home.)(赛斯这里指的是比尔和蓓·加拉格夫妇，他们见证过一些课。上礼拜他们答应参与一些测试。一开始的实验是一些简单的步骤，例如约定我们在家上课的时间，请加拉格夫妇同时在他们家里，将焦点放在一些我和珍不曾见过的东西上。)
Such experiments could be done on your own, and also in connection with our sessions.这类的实验你们可以自己做，也可以跟我们的课连结。
(“We’d like to try them in connection with the sessions.”)(“我们愿意跟我们的课连结来实验看看。”)
I am perfectly willing.You may have some difficulties with Ruburt, but I presume you can get around this.我非常乐意。但你们或许在鲁柏方面会有问题，不过我认为你们应该有办法应付。
I suggest a brief break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:24.Jane was dissociated as usual.Her eyes were open as break came; she blinked several times and was out of her trance.While speaking she had been aware that her eyes were open. Her voice had been quiet.(10:24分休息。珍的出离状况如常，到了休息时间张开眼睛；眨了几次眼睛便回神了。她讲话时知道自己眼睛开着，声音一直轻柔平静。
(We had anticipated a regular break, but hardly had we relaxed when Seth came through again.This time Jane spoke with her eyes closed for the most part, in a quiet voice, and with pauses.Resume at 10:25.)(我们原以为休息时间会跟平常一样，不过我们休息时间几乎还没到，赛斯又穿透过来。这次珍大部分时间都闭着眼睛讲话，声音轻柔，停顿几次。10:25分继续。)
On second thought I will make a few comments and end our session.进一步考量后，我想做些评论，然后就结束我们的课。
A meeting with Dr. Instream will build up Ruburt’s confidence, in that he will feel that he knows with whom he is dealing.I know, but Ruburt needs to feel a friendly reinforcement on the doctor’s part.跟殷斯翠姆博士见个面可以增强鲁柏的信心，因为他会觉得他知道自己正在跟谁打交道。我知道，不过鲁柏需要感受到来自博士友善的支持与鼓励。
This is not strictly necessary, but it would be advantageous.He reacts to the emotional atmosphere, and his abilities will operate best if he feels that he is investigating these matters along with interested parties, than if he feels that he is being skeptically observed.这件事并非绝对需要，但会有帮助。鲁柏对情绪氛围会有所反应，如果他觉得自己在跟有兴趣的群体一起探讨这些问题，而不是觉得自己被别人抱持怀疑的态度在观察，那么他的能力就会达到最佳运作状态。
(Jane’s eyes now opened again, and she lit a cigarette while speaking.)(珍的眼睛再度张开，边讲话边点了一根烟。)
There must be a friendly cooperation.Even scientific investigations can flourish in such an atmosphere.We will now end the session. My heartiest wishes to you both, and my regards to Dr. Instream.一定要有个友善的合作关系。即便是科学研究，在这样的气氛下也可以得到丰硕的成果。我们现在就结束这节课，衷心祝福二位，也向殷斯翠姆博士致上问候之意。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:30.Jane was dissociated as usual. She ended the session with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet.(10:30分结束。珍的出离状况如常，闭着眼睛结束了这节课，声音轻柔平静。
(Again, we had barely begun to discuss the session when Seth came through briefly.Jane spoke with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet and she continued to smoke.Resume at 10:31.)(我们才正要开始讨论这节课时，赛斯很快再度透过来。珍闭着眼睛讲话，轻声细语，继续抽烟。10:31分继续口述。)
All in all, we did not do badly, considering that Ruburt was forewarned that a test would in fact take place.总而言之，若是考量到鲁柏事先就预警到会有个测试，我觉得我们做得还不错。
You will get better results either if Ruburt does not know in advance that a test of any kind will be given, or if such tests become so commonplace that they no longer concern him.要是鲁柏事先不知道会有个什么测试，或是说这些测试已司空见惯，再也引不起他的关注，那么你们获得的成果将会更好。
An emotional rapport of some sort, established between Ruburt and Dr. Instream, would definitely help us.鲁柏和殷斯翠姆博士之间如果能建立起某种情感上的和谐关系，肯定对我们会有帮助。
(Jane took a long pause.)(珍停顿了很久。)
