Such an informal meeting as I have suggested, perhaps on Ruburts home ground, again, would reinforce such rapport.And a frank as well as objective attitude on the part of Dr. Instream in his letters would also help.像我建议的这种非正式会面，或许可以在鲁柏家举行，会强化这种和谐关系。殷斯翠姆博士在信中如果能抱持坦白、客观的态度，也会有帮助。
Ruburt feels to some extent that there is a lack here.鲁柏现在或多或少就觉得缺少这一部分。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:33.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed.She said she would prefer that tests be given often, so that she can become used to them; as she has become used to speaking while sitting down, and with her eyes open occasionally.)(10:33分结束。珍的出离状况一如平常，双眼一直闭着。她说希望常有这些测试，可以让自己习惯；就像她已经习惯坐着讲话而且偶尔张着眼睛一样。)

SESSION 180 第180节 尝试千里眼测试 信封2


AUGUST 23, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年8月23日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(Jane has finished her ESP book for all practical purposes, and has been looking through the Seth material for a suitable quote to end the final chapter.I suggested she ask Seth for a few appropriate words this evening.(实际上珍已经完成ESP书，而且也一直在仔细搜寻适当的赛斯资料，以便引用做为最后一章的结语。我建议她今晚请赛斯给些适当的话。
(Jane has been improving in her psychological time experiments since Seth advised her that she was trying too hard in the 178th session.Today she attained an excellent state.(珍心理时间的练习持续进步，因为赛斯在第178节中提示她做得太过认真了。今天她已到达极佳的境界。
(As I had for the 179th session, I prepared a test envelope in case we had a chance to use it during the session.This time the double envelopes contained a black and white photo I took of Jane at York Beach, ME, a little over a year ago this month.I thought this would have an extra emotional content, as did the symbol I used in the first test. [This is to be our second such test.](如同第179节，我准备了一个测试信封，以备今晚如果有机会就可以使用。这一次双层信封里装了一张黑白照片，那是我去年8月再度去缅因州约克海滩时为珍拍的，离现在正好满一年多。我想这张照片里应该包含了额外的情感内涵，就像我第一测试用的那个符号一样。[这是我们第二次做这类的测试])
(It will be remembered that it was at York Beach, in August 1963, that Jane and I saw the fragments we had ourselves created, according to Seth, in the dancing establishment called the Driftwood Lounge. This was some months before the sessions began.The snapshot was taken on the beach perhaps 200yards from the Driftwood.For York Beach material see sessions 9, 15, 17, 69, and 80 in Volumes I and 2.(1963年8月在约克海滩的浮木舞厅[Driftwood Lounge]里，根据赛斯所说，我和珍看到了我们自己创造出来的片段体，那是在我们这些课开始前的几个月。这张快照是在离浮木舞厅大概两百码的海滩所拍。有关约克海滩的资料可参阅第一册和第二册的第9、15、17、69及80节。
(I took care that Jane did not see me preparing the envelopes this evening, although she was well aware a test might take place.We had discussed the matter earlier in the day but she had not given me an unequivocal yes or no answer, as to whether we should make such tests an everyday procedure during sessions.See Seth’s comments on this in the last session.(我今晚小心翼翼，没让珍看到我在准备这个信封，虽然她心知肚明，可能会有个测试。今天稍早之前，我们曾讨论到这件事，不过对于我们在上赛斯课期间是否要让这样的测试成为每次的例行常规，她并没有给一个明确的答案。参看上一节赛斯对这个部分的评论。
(Tonight’s session was held in our back room.My writing table is beside a bookcase, and before the session I slipped the test envelope between a couple of books without Jane being present. Thus I could easily reach it during the session.(今晚的课在我们后面的房间举行。我书桌旁是一个书架，上课前我趁珍不在那里的时候，偷偷把这个测试信封塞入两本书中间，这样一来我便可以在上课时轻易取得。
(Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed for the entire session. Her voice was quiet, and although she used pauses her delivery was for the most part quite rapid.She began speaking at 8:59.)(珍整节课都闭上眼睛坐着讲话，声音轻柔，中间虽然有几次停顿，但大部分时间传述速度都相当快。8:59分开始说话。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Our Ruburt is indeed relaxing, having just finished his book, and he has my congratulations.我们的鲁柏刚完成他的书，现在真的轻松了，我要向他道贺。
There may be a pleasant languor for a few days.He should think of other matters at least briefly, and concern himself with innocent pleasures so that he may be renewed.接下来或许可以愉快慵懒个几天。不过他至少该简单思考一下其他的事，也该让自己心情全然放松，让精神焕然一新。
His painting will serve him well in this respect, and his psychic energies will indeed be refreshed and renewed.在这方面他的画对他很有用，他的心灵能量确实可以获得复原与更新。
The book will definitely be a success, and a financial one, that will represent his initiation into a field to which he will contribute in no small manner.The book will represent the beginning also of financial success. The reasons are fairly simple, for this field is one in which Ruburt’s innermost energies and interests are already rooted.这本书肯定会成功，而且会很畅销，这也代表他开始进入一个他会全力以赴的新领域。这本书也代表他财务上成功的开始，理由相当简单，因为鲁柏最内在的能量和兴趣就是在这个领域扎根。
It was far from inevitable that he turn to this field but the innermost portions of his personality were drawn to it, and within this field he can develop his abilities, mature, and contribute.Because of this intense focus, there will be financial success.虽然他不一定会转到这个领域，但他人格的最内在部分会被吸引过来，而且在这个领域中，他可以发展他的能力与成熟度，并贡献一己之力。由于这样的强烈聚焦，他财务上的收入会很好。
Within, I believe, three months after the book is accepted, another book will be assured; and then at that time, or very shortly after, it will be contracted for.我相信，在这本书被认可后的3个月内，另一本书也将底定；到时候或不久之后， 会签订合约。
Your own abilities, Joseph, have been at a plateau level, from which they will begin to rise, at which time another plateau will be reached, and the process continued.Such plateau levels are beneficial to the whole personality, since they allow time for adoptions.约瑟，你自己的能力已处在高原阶段，会从那个阶段开始往上提升，届时又会到达另一个高原阶段，然后继续这样的过程。这样的高原阶段对整个人格有所助益，因为它们给予了较长的接受时间。
I would like to add a few notes here. Ruburt was simply not confident enough in the Father Trainor episode last evening to adequately perform the inner manipulations necessary, without your presence.The first occasion was completely spontaneous, and his ego was not aroused.我想补充几句话，昨天晚上有关崔诺神父的插曲方面，鲁柏纯粹是因为信心不够，他不相信自己可以在你不在场的状况下，适当执行必要的内部操作。第一个场合完全是自发的，他的自我并没有被唤醒。
(Sunday, August 22nd, Jane discovered the tape recording of the first two Father Trainor episodes was deteriorating, for unknown reasons.Last evening she tried a rereading of the two poems involved, but stopped before getting through G. K. Chesterton’s Lepanto.She began the reading all right but soon felt a sense of strain. She turned off the recorder.(8月22日星期日，珍发现前两段崔诺神父插曲的录音品质变差了，原因不明。昨晚，她试着重读里面的两首诗，不过还没念到切斯特顿的叙述诗〈雷邦多〉，就停了下来。后来她又开始读，但马上就发现卡住了，于是关掉了录音机。
(Bill Macdonnel was present but I was working in my studio.Jane said my absence annoyed her somewhat.Perhaps too cautiously, I had advised her against the attempt earlier in the day, since she had expressed general fatigue.She was also not quite sure of how sympathetic Bill was to the attempt.See the 131st and 158th sessions for details on the Father Trainor experiments in Volumes 3 and 4.(那时候比尔·麦唐纳在场，而我则在工作室里工作。珍说，我不在场让她有点恼怒。或许是我太过谨慎，那天稍早之前劝她不要做这个尝试，因为她说感觉全身疲累。她也不太确定比尔是否赞成做这个尝试。有关崔诺神父的实验细节，参看第三册第131节和第四册第158节。
(Now Jane smiled, speaking quietly along.)(这时，珍面带微笑，轻声细语继续讲。)
I see you have no tests for me this evening. Soon perhaps I shall have some for you.我知道今晚你不会测试我，我也许很快就会给你一些资料。
(This was a perfect opportunity for me to slip the test envelope out of its hiding place on the bookshelf, reach across my small writing table and drop the envelope into Jane’s lap.It was 9:10.Her eyes remained closed and she did not touch the envelope.(这是个绝佳的机会，我将测试信封从书架中藏匿的地方抽出来，越过我写字的小桌子，放到珍的腿上。这时是9:10分。她的眼睛还是闭着，手并没有碰触到信封。
(“There’s one for you.”)(“有个测试信封给你。”)
I shall still have some for you. They will involve dreams, and we will work for awhile in an effort to train you so that clairvoyant dreams can be received at your suggestion.This may involve somewhat more than you suppose, but nevertheless you should learn to handle the sleep state well enough so that some success is achieved.我还有一些资料要给你们，跟梦有关，我们再利用点时间加把劲训练你们，以便你们可以在自己的暗示下接收到千里眼的梦。这个牵涉到的东西也许比你们想像的多一些，但是不论如何，你们应该先学会掌握睡眠情境，以克竟其功。
We will be involved when we are alone with variations of the dream condition, and with dream therapy, and the nature and classification of dreams.You should find the material highly interesting.我们来谈谈梦境的变化、梦的治疗以及梦的本质与分类。你们应该会发现这些资料非常有趣。
The stuff or fabric or makeup of dreams has not been covered here, nor have we discussed the actual ways in which the personality uses energy to construct his dreams and project them.All of these matters will be thoroughly covered.我们尚未论及梦的组成，或结构，也还没讨论到人格如何运用能量建构并投射出梦境的实际方法。所有这些问题我们都会彻底探讨。
(Jane now smiled again.She picked up the test envelope and held it in both hands, lightly fingering it briefly without heavily bending it, twisting it, etc. It was 9:14.Her eyes remained closed.She paused rather briefly, then delivered the following material in a quiet voice, with gentle emphasis at times, and with average pauses.)(珍这时再度微笑。她拎起那个测试信封，双手拿着它，手指轻轻触摸一会儿，并没有用力折弯或搓揉。这时是9:14分，她仍然闭着眼睛，很短暂地停顿一下，就以相当轻柔的声音继续传述下面的资料，有些地方会温和地强调，停顿的频率普通。)
We will see now what we can do with your own little test, and with our friend Ruburt.我们来看看怎么处理你自己的小测试和我们的朋友鲁柏。
Inside the envelope, heavy paper or light cardboard.I sense color, perhaps orange, yellow; but I get the impression of something sunny, as an orange-yellow color would be.I also have the impression of black, and two people.The numbers 4, 6, perhaps of an age or date, and a border.I think now of a border of flowers, and of the two people, a man and a woman, and J. B.I think also of hills.信封里面，不是厚纸张就是轻薄的硬纸板。我感应到颜色，可能是橘色，黄色；不过我隐约感觉到阳光，像是橘黄色。我也感觉到黑色，和两个人。有4、6的数字，指的或许是年龄或日期，以及边框。现在我认为是花坛，还有两个人，一男一女，以及J.B。我也想到了小山丘。
You may now take your break.你们现在可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:18.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery.She was greatly pleased at the results of the test, and so was I. Neither of us regard these tests as scientific but we do consider them a beginning toward scientific tests.(9:18分休息。珍第一阶段的出离状况如常，她对测试结果感到很高兴，我也一样。我们两个都知道这些测试不符合科学，但我们的确认为它们是朝向科学实验的开端。
(Jane said she felt it when I dropped the test envelope into her lap.This did not make her nervous however; she was “already Seth, ” she said.In the first test she had the envelope in her possession before the session began, and could not but help know that a test was in the offing.(珍说我将测试信封扔到她腿上时，她感觉到了，不过这并没有让她紧张；她说她是“就绪的赛斯”。第一次测试时，珍上课前已经先拿到了测试领土，因此必然知道即将会有个测试。
(Jane said that when Seth began speaking she tried to keep herself out of it as much as possible.She had the feeling that Seth was in the foreground, she was in the background.She did not feel nervous while giving the data.(珍说，赛斯开始说话时，她就尽可能让自己退离。她感觉到赛斯是在前景当中，而她自己则在背景里面。她在给出这些资料时，并不觉得紧张。
(Also, while she was giving the data Jane experienced a concept.She had the mental picture of a border, of something square, as the photograph is, with a border around it.She had no indication of size; the photograph is 4” x 4”.And also again, at this time Jane had a “distant” thought or impression of the error she made in the first test regarding a license, but felt content that she was keeping herself in the background.(此外，她在给出这些资料的同时也经验到一个意念。她脑海里出现一个边框的画面，某种方形的东西，四周有边框的画面，就像照片那样。她没有提到尺寸大小；那张是4x4的方形照片。而且，珍“隐约”感觉到第一次测验时犯下的错误，当时她把信封内的东西误认为是执照，不过对于这次退居到背景当中她觉得很满意。
(The orange-yellow-sunny interpretation of this photograph is particularly intriguing to us because it was taken on an extremely bright day; we remember it well because some other pictures I took on this roll, of rocks and the sea, were overexposed because of brightness and reflections.It is of course a black-and-white photo.The two people involved, a man and woman, could be Jane, and me who took the picture.I am 46 now, but was 45 when I took the picture.(对这张相片里橘黄色阳光的解读让我们特别感兴趣，因为拍照时天气极为晴朗，阳光刺眼；我们记得很清楚，因为我那卷底片中其他一些岩石和大海的照片，由于亮度和反光的关系过度曝光。它当然是张黑白相片，提到的两个人，一男一女，可能是珍和拍摄这张照片的我。我现在46岁，但拍这张照片时是45岁。
(Jane does not know what association led her to mention a border of flowers.Most striking of all perhaps, she said that when she heard herself speak the initials J. B., she knew that Seth meant Jane Butts, the subject of the photograph.She recalls wondering at the time why she did not say her own name aloud.The reference to hills is clearly seen in the photo: Jane sits on a group of craggy high rocks on the Maine seacoast.With the figure painted out of the photo the rocks would easily resemble any number of aerial shots of denuded mountain ranges, or hills, depending on scale.(珍不知道自己那时候想到什么让她提到花坛。这当中最令人惊奇的是，她说一听到自己讲出J.B.的开头字母时，就知道赛斯指的是Jane Butts，也就是照片中的主角。她想到自己曾怀疑为什么那时候没有大声说出自己的名字。至于所提到的小山丘，相片中可以清楚看到：珍就坐在缅因海岸一群高耸陡峭的岩石上。如果把照片中的人物涂掉，那岩石就很像数量不等的裸露山脉或小山丘的空拍照片，就视比例尺而定。
(And again we consider the ways of various levels of the mind.With all of the above data Seth, or Jane, did not use the word photograph.(而且，我们考虑了心灵各种不同层次的用语。赛斯或珍在上面的资料中并没有用到相片这个字眼。
(For some other material on concepts see the following sessions: 149, 151, 153, 164.(有关其他讨论概念的资料可参阅下列各节：第149、151、153和164节。
(The session resumed with Jane again sitting down and speaking with her eyes closed.Her voice was quiet and rather fast.She smiled in recollection of her ebullient feelings.Resume at 9:35.)(珍坐在椅子上闭着眼睛继续口述，声音轻柔，速度相当快。她回忆起充满自信的感觉，又微笑了。9:35分继续。)
I am pleased that Ruburt is so pleased.看到鲁柏这么高兴，我也很高兴。
If I can satisfy him, then indeed we will be able to satisfy anyone, for he is so stubborn.他非常倔强，如果我能满足他，那我肯定也可以满足任何人。
He has learned much however since our last session, and you can see that it was much better that we allowed the distortions to come through in our first test, since it allowed him to learn more about the simultaneous existence of our consciousnesses during a session.不过，从我们上一节课之后，他学到了很多。你们也可以看得出来，第一次测试时我们允许扭曲的讯息传过来，这样子会更好，因为可以让他更加了解，上课时我们的意识是同时存在的。
I may therefore myself congratulate him.There are few limitations upon what we can do, and most of these limitations are human limitations, existing on Ruburt’s part rather than on my own.He is quick to learn however, once he makes up his mind and is willing to learn.因此我个人要恭喜他。在我们所能做的事方面仅有少许的限制，而这些限制大部分都是人类的限制，是鲁柏这一边的限制，而不是我这边的。不过，一旦他下定决心且愿意学习，就学得非常快。
These informal tests are an excellent method of building up his self-confidence. And his self-confidence is absolutely necessary to us.这些非正式的测试是一种让他建立自信的好方法，他的自信对我们来讲绝对不可或缺。
It is best that we work in this manner to begin with, in his home territory.Later it will make no difference if he progresses, as I believe that he will.For the immediate present, and for the immediate present only, such tests should be conducted here.He is concerned too much about the object which your friends are using for the other test, and for now I am afraid that he will unwittingly distort this material in this respect.我们一开始就以这种方式在他的地盘进行，这是最好不过的了。如果他持续进步，那后面就没什么差别，我相信他做得到。就即刻的现在来讲，只就即刻的现在来讲，这类测试就应该要在这时候做。他太过关注你朋友为另一个测试所使用的东西，现在我怕他在这方面会不经意扭曲了这部分的资料。
(“Do you know what the object is?”)(“你知道那是什么东西吗？”)
I know what the object is.我知道那是什么东西。
(Seth/Jane spoke quietly but firmly in answer to my question.The object in question is one that Janes friend, Peggy Gallagher, is carrying about with her in her handbag. I do not know what it is.(赛斯－珍轻声而肯定地回答我的问题。这里指的东西是珍的朋友蓓∙加拉格在手提包里随身携带的东西，我不知道那是什么。
(Peggy has had the object here in our apartment on a couple of visits not connected with the Seth sessions, and of course told Jane about it.Peggy began to carry it about with her a week or so ago after Jane and I had asked if Peggy and Bill, her husband, would cooperate with us in some future tests.(蓓有几次来我们公寓做客时，就带了这个东西，当然她也跟珍提过，那几次来访跟赛斯课无关。大约一个礼拜前，也就是我和珍询问蓓和她老公比尔，未来能否跟我们一起合作做些测试之后，蓓就开始放在包包里随身携带。
(Perhaps also Peggy began carrying the object because recently Jane has had several clairvoyant experiences involving the Gallaghers, and other mutual friends, that have been verified.)(珍最近经历过几次已验证过的千里眼经验，都与加拉格夫妇和其他一些共同朋友有关，也许是因为这样，蓓开始随身带着这个东西。)
In a very short time, as his confidence is built up, we will not have the difficulty.I believe however that he will be able to take part in such tests when your friends are present and the object is concealed.But he should not be forewarned.在很短的时间内，他会建立起信心，那时我们就没有困难了。不过，我相信如果你的朋友在场，而且那个东西也藏好了，那么他就可以参与这样的测试。不过事先不能让他知道。
It is important that these affairs be spontaneous, at least for a while.When he feels under test conditions he will not do well until his confidence is strengthened; and we shall see that it is.重点是，这些事情都是要自发的，而且至少要维持一会儿。他一感觉自己处在测试的情境，就无法好好表现，除非他的信心加强了；我们会看到事实就是这样。
We will learn much through these endeavors, for they will provide lessons in themselves, and will be excellent examples of the precise manner in which extrasensory perceptions, as you prefer to call them, are received and interpreted.The role of association will be found to play an important part.透过这些努力我们会学到很多，因为这些努力本身就会提供经验教训，而且也会成为精确接收和诠释超感官知觉的绝佳范例，超感官知觉是你们爱用的说法。你们会发现联想的角色扮演了重要的部分。
I suggest a short break.我建议你们短暂休息一下。
(Break at 9:48.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. Her voice had been quiet and rather fast, although she had used pauses too.(9:48分休息。珍的出离状况如常，眼睛一直闭着，轻声细语，速度相当快，不过中间也停顿几次。
(Jane said she felt that Seth was trying to come through with material on the Gallagher object, and that she was trying not to block it.She had the feeling Seth wanted to say it was rock; the other day Jane had the conscious impression that it was tin or galvanized metal, of the sort Bill Gallagher uses in fashioning some of his modern sculpture.(珍说，她感觉赛斯试着透过来讲述加拉格的东西，而且她也试着不去阻挡。她有种感觉，赛斯想说那个东西就是石块；几天前珍的意识中浮现一个印象，那个东西是锡或镀锌的金属，比尔在塑造他一些现代化的雕像时会用到这种金属。
(I would like to note here that the Gallaghers have not pressed Jane to name the object, in trance or otherwise, nor have I. Jane has certainly been aware of it, since she has mentioned it to me at odd times during the last few days.Therefore I was somewhat surprised that either Jane or Seth might be considering an attempt to name it now.(我想在这里说明一下，不管是在出神状态或其他情况，加拉格夫妇都没有强迫珍要说出这个东西的名字，我也没有强迫珍。珍一定早就觉察到，因为她在最近几天偶尔曾跟我提起这件事，所以珍或赛斯现在考虑要说出这个东西的名字，让我有点惊讶。
(Jane resumed in the same quiet and fast pace, with her eyes closed, at 9:55.)(9:55分，珍闭着眼睛继续口述，声音同样轻柔、节奏一样快速。)
We have our beginning.我们有了我们的开始。
I am interested in these matters because they will show the ways in which the personality handles such data.They will be demonstrations to point up our own text, because I will handle them in that way.我对这些问题很感兴趣，因为它们会提供一些方法，让人格可以处理这样的资料。由于我会以那种方式来处理，所以它们会清楚表达出我们的内容。
They will end up providing proofs that your scientists require, but they will serve a purpose closer to my heart, in that they will display the operating procedure of the human personality as it manipulates inner perceptions.它们最后会提供你们科学家要求的证据，不过它们更贴近我心里的想法，因为它们会显示出人类人格在操作内在感知时的运作过程。
We will build up Ruburt’s confidence until he will be sure enough of himself in relationship to me, so that he will be able to let undistorted material come through where tests are concerned.我们会建立鲁柏的信心，直到他十足确认他自己与我的连结为止，如此一来他便可以在测试的情境中，让未受扭曲的资料传递过来。
There has never been any real problem in this respect with the material, because it did not egotistically alarm him.For a beginning he is doing very well.In a light trance state, some quite complicated manipulations are necessary in this sort of situation.就资料方面来讲，从来没有任何真正的问题，因为它不会自以为是地警示他。才刚开始，他就做得非常好。在轻度出神状态中，在这种情况下必须要有一些相当复杂的操控。
He will actually be building up confidence in me, and therefore he will allow me to come through when it is required that I do so in any investigations.For regardless of my own occasional irascibility with the behavior of your scientific communities, such men seek after truth, and there are few enough involved in that search.实际上他对我的信心将会增加，因此，如果有必要的话，在任何调查研究时他就会允许我穿透过来。尽管我自己偶尔对你们科学界那群人的作为很容易生气，但至少这些人愿意寻求真理，不过投入这种调查的人实在是少之又少。
We will try to arrange my tests for you as far as clairvoyant dreams and suggestion are concerned, so that these tests also add definite objective knowledge to the nature of clairvoyance in general.我们会针对千里眼的梦和暗示，试着为你们安排我的测试，让这些测试也可以为千里眼的一般特性，增加一些明确客观的知识。
The human personality has no limitations except those which it accepts.There are no limits to its development or growth, if it will accept no limits.There are no boundaries to the self except those boundaries which the self arbitrarily creates and perpetuates.There is no veil through which human perception cannot see, except the veil of ignorance which is pulled down by the materialistic ego.人类人格没有限制，除非人格愿意接受这些限制。如果人格愿意相信没有限制，那么它的发展与成长就不会受到限制。自己也没有界限，除非自己恣意创造并坚守这些界限。没有什么面纱是人类感知上不能看穿的，除非是由唯物主义的自我拉下的无知面纱。
That which appears empty, such as your space, is empty only for those who will not perceive, who are blind because they fear to perceive that which the ego cannot understand.The ego however is also capable of greater knowledge and potentiality and scope.看起来好像是空的东西，好比你们的空间，只有对那些不会感知的、盲目的人而言才是空的，因为他们害怕去感知自我无法了解的东西。其实自我可以拥有更广大的知识、潜能和领域。
It dwells in the physical universe, but it can indeed also perceive and appreciate other realities.The ego is part of the personality, and as such it can partake of sturdier, heartier, more vivid realities.The personality can dwell, and does dwell, in many worlds at once.自我虽然住在物质宇宙里，但实际上也可以感知和了解其他实相。自我是人格的一部分，它本身可以参与更强健、更真实、更有生气的实相。人格可以同时存在、也确实存在于许多世界。
The inquiring intuitions and the searching self, like summer winds, can travel in small and large spaces, can know of actualities that are more minute than pinheads and more massive than galaxies.好奇的直觉和喜好追根究底的自己，就像夏日的风一样，可以旅行在大大小小的空间，可以了解各种比针头还小、比银河还大的现状。
The power and ability of the human personality, in a most practical manner, can be seen as unlimited.从最实际的观点来讲，可以把人类人格的力量与能力，看成是无可限量。
Ruburt can use this to close his book if he so desires.如果鲁柏愿意的话，可以用这些内容作为他书的结尾。
(See my notes at the start of session 180, page 206.)(请参阅第180节开头的注释。)
You may now take a break and I will continue, or you may end the session as you prefer.As always I await your pleasure.你们现在可以休息一下，然后我再继续，要不然也可以结束这节课，随便你们。一如往常，我就看你们喜欢怎么样。
(“We’ll take a short break.”(“我们短暂休息一下。”
(Break at 10:14.Jane was dissociated as usual. She ended the delivery with a smile. She felt very good. Her eyes remained closed, her voice quiet.She thought she might very well use Seth’s material above to end her book.(10:14分休息。珍的出离状况如常，口述结束时面带微笑，感觉很好，眼睛一直闭着，声音轻柔和缓。她认为自己可能会善用赛斯上面的资料作为那本书的结尾。
(She resumed in the same quiet fashion, at a somewhat slower pace and still with her eyes closed, at 10:20.)(珍的声音一样轻柔，速度则更慢一些，两眼同样闭着，10:20分继续口述。)
I am not going to keep you much longer.我不会耽误你们太久。
It is most helpful however that at least now Ruburt can definitely differentiate between our two consciousnesses; or at least he is learning to do so.至少鲁柏现在可以明确分辨我们两个的意识，这是最有帮助的；要不然起码他正在学习这一部分。
This will be helpful in other respects also. The practice will soon show excellent results.He will simply know which channels are which, and therefore can change his frequency, so to speak, with a surer hand.This has been a most enlightening session for you, and we have achieved results that do not show here yet.Do you have any questions, Joseph?这在其他方面也有好处，这种练习很快就会产生极佳的结果。他将完全知道每一频道是某某频道，也就是说，可以因此而改变他的频率。这节对你们最具启发作用，我们已获致前所未有的成果。约瑟，你还有任何问题吗？
(“Was there any element of telepathy involved between you and me, in the test this evening?”)(“今晚的测试中，你我之间有任何心电感应的成分吗？”)
In tonight’s test?今晚的测验？
(“Yes.”)(“对。”)
Tonight’s test dealt with clairvoyance. Although I happened to pick up my information in that way, and it could have just as easily been obtained through telepathic communication.In the future I imagine that tests will be worked out in whatever manner is needed.今晚的测试用的是千里眼，虽然我刚好用那种方式得到我的讯息，但透过心电感应一样很容易获得讯息。我想，在未来的各种测试中，不管使用什么方法，只要是用对方法都会成功。
(“How about in the first test?”(“你觉得第一次的测试怎么样？”
(See the 179th session.)(见第179节。)
The first test was the same.第一次的测试也一样。
I myself operate well in that way.In many instances however data can be received in either manner, and telepathy may well be involved in other tests.I, for my own reasons and peculiarities, usually obtain such information clairvoyantly; and we will have much to say concerning the ways in which such information is received and interpreted, as this is very important.我自己以那种方式操作得很好。许多情况下，可以透过任何一种方式得到资料，心电感应在别的测试中或许很管用。由于我个人的一些原因及偏好，我通常会以千里眼的方式得到这类讯息；有关接收与诠释这类讯息的方法，我们还有很多要谈，因为这部分非常重要。
If you have any questions I will do my best to answer them.Or if not we will end the session.如果你有任何问题，我愿意尽力回答。如果没问题我们就可以结束了。
(“I have no more for now.”)(“我目前没有问题。”)
My congratulations then. Your part in these sessions is extremely important, as I expect that you know.那就恭喜你，你在这些课里面的角色极为重要，我希望你能够知道。
(“Yes.Good night, Seth.”(“是。晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:28.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed.Her voice had been quiet and rapid for the most part.)(10:28分结束。珍的出离状况一如平常，眼睛一直闭着，大部分时间声音轻柔，速度轻快。)

SESSION 181 第181节 自我只从实相和经验的最表层飞掠而过


AUGUST 25, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年8月25日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Jane has decided to use the passages on unlimited human potentialities, given by Seth in the last session, to close out her ESP book.(珍决定用赛斯上节课谈论人类无限潜能的那几段话作为那本超感官知觉(ESP)书的结尾。
(Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed, at 8:59.Her voice was quiet, her pace rather rapid even though she used pauses.)(8:59分，珍闭着眼睛坐在椅子上开始说话。声音非常轻柔，节奏相当快，不过中间停顿几次。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
The ego skims the topmost surface of reality and experience.自我只从实相和经验的最表层飞掠而过。
This is not the result of any inherent egotistical quality.It is true that the egos responsibility is with the relationship between the self and the physical environment. It must of necessity be focused within the confines of physical reality.这并不是任何自我天生特质所产生的结果。自我的责任在于维系自己和物质环境的关系，这一点千真万确，所以它必然要集中焦点在物质实相的范围内。
Nevertheless it is fully capable of perceiving far more than Western man allows it to perceive.Fear and ignorance and superstition quite obviously limit the potentialities of the ego, and therefore to some degree limit even its effectiveness within the physical universe.不过，自我能感知到的范围，远超过西方人允许它感知的程度。恐惧、轻视和迷信显然限制了自我的潜能，甚至或多或少也限制了它在物质宇宙内的效能。
The ego itself in many instances cannot experience directly certain intuitions and psychological experiences, but it can experience them insofar as it can be aware of them on an intellectual basis.When training forces the ego to become too rigid, and to limit its perception of other realities, then the intuitions will not be accepted by the ego because intuitional experience will not fit into the framework of reality as the ego sees it.许多情况下，自我本身无法直接经验某些直觉和心理经验，但在理性的基础上，自我所能觉知的范围内，就可以经验到这些直觉和心理经验。如果某些训练迫使自我变得太过僵化，也会限制它感知其他实相，此时自我就无法接收到直觉，因为这个直觉经验并不符合自我看到的实相架构。
The ego, because of its responsibility, will therefore fight against what it then considers an unknown threat to survival.Struggles are therefore initiated which are entirely unnecessary.We want to bring intuitional comprehension to a point where the ego will accept it.因此，自我出于本身的责任，对于那些被它认定为对生存具有不明威胁的东西，便会加以反击。所以，许多完全不必要的对抗于焉产生。我们要把对直觉的理解带到自我会接受的那一个点。
In our dream experiments therefore, this is one of the purposes that we hope to achieve.The ego is not equipped of itself to delve directly into nonphysical realities.If the ego is trained to be flexible however, it will accept such knowledge from the subconscious, and other wider horizons of the self.而这就是我们希望在我们梦实验里能达成的目的。自我本身并不足以直接探究非物质的实相。然而如果训练自我变得有弹性，那它就会从潜意识和自己其他更广阔的领域当中，接收到这类知识。
Our ego must have its feet upon the solid earth, it is out of its element, naked and in an unfamiliar environment, outside of the normal characteristics of physical existence.Its basic distrust of dream experience is necessary for the overall balance of the personality.Physical reality is a rock to which the ego must cling, and from which it achieves its power, energy, position, and reason for existence.我们的自我必须让双脚站在实体的地球上，它赤裸地处在陌生环境里，无法适应，也没有物质存在的正常特性。自我基本上并不信任梦的经验，但为了整体人格的平衡，这种不信任有其必要。物质实相就是自我必须依附的磐石，它可以从中得到力量、能量、地位和存在的理由。
This provides necessary balance and necessary control, and results in the sturdy anchorage of the personality in the environment in which it must survive.You have here one of the main reasons why you must request the subconscious to enable you to recall your dreams.The ego would see no reason for such a memory, and on general principles attempts to repress them.这种情形提供了必要的平衡与必要的控制，并且在人格存活所必须的环境中形成坚实的人格固定锚。就是基于这个主要原因，所以你们必须要求潜意识让你们回想起梦的内容。自我看不出有什么理由需要这样的记忆，因此通常会想办法压制梦。
Again however, through this excellent balance and these fine controls, the ego will accept knowledge derived from the dream state, as a man might accept a message from a distant land in which he does not care to dwell, and whose environment would both mystify and frighten him.然而，透过这个非常好的平衡和这些良好的控制，自我就会接收到来自梦境的讯息，就好比某个人可能获得来自远方的讯息一样，但他不在意是否要居住在那遥远的地方，而且那个地方的环境既令他困惑不解，也令他惊吓。
In our dream experiments then, we will allow you to bring such messages to the ego.We will attempt to map this exotic country in such a way that the ego can understand what is there in terms of resources, that can be used for its own benefit.We shall map this dream state from various perspectives, until you know it very well.在我们梦的实验里，会允许你们把这些讯息带给自我。我们会以这样的方式尽力仔细勘探这个奇异的国度，以便自我能知道那里有哪些资源可善加利用，以嘉惠自我。我们会从不同的视角有系统地勘察这个梦境，直到你们熟识为止。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:16.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery.Her eyes had remained closed.She resumed with the same fast and quiet delivery, again with her eyes closed, at 9:20.)(9:16分休息。珍第一阶段的出离状况如常，一直闭着眼睛。9:20分她再度闭着眼睛继续口述，速度一样快，声音一样轻柔。)
For several reasons we will have a fairly brief session this evening.由于几个原因，今晚我们的课会相当短。
I want to give you some more material to further fill out our outline for future sessions dealing with dream reality.I have intended to give you both an evening off entirely, out of the goodness of my heart, and because we will be concerned very soon now with relatively significant discussions, and a break will do you good.未来几节我们将探讨梦实相，为了进一步充实梦实相的大纲，我要再给你们一些资料。基于我的善意，而且由于我们马上要进行相当重要的讨论，我打算给你们俩一个可以完全休息的夜晚，休息对你们有好处。
Instead of missing a session however, I decided to give you this small preliminary material this evening, and then dismiss school early.而为了不要错过这一堂课，所以我决定今晚先给你们这一点先备资料，然后就提早下课喽。
(Jane smiled.She had been speaking with quiet amusement.)(珍露出笑容，一直讲得非常开心。)
We will be involved with a study of the characteristics of the dream world in general, and attempt to isolate it as a separate reality simply for the purposes of examination.Then we shall consider it rather carefully in its relation to physical reality, using comparisons and dissimilarities.我们将会整体探讨梦世界的特性，同时打算将它独立出来成为一个单独的实相，这纯粹是为了方便检视。然后我们会相当仔细推敲它跟物质实相的关系，加以比较，以了解两者间的差异。
This will then allow us to proceed into the relationship between the waking and sleeping personality, and discover the many ways in which the personality’s aims and goals are not only reflected but sometimes achieved in and through the dream condition.这样一来，我们接着就可以进入醒时人格和睡时人格关系的讨论，并找出许多方法，使人格的目标与目的在梦中或透过梦境可以反映出来，甚至有时候也可以达成。
Usually the dream state is considered from a negative standpoint, and compared unfavorably with waking reality.Emphasis is laid upon those conditions present in the waking condition, and absent in the dream state.人们常说以负面观点看待梦境，并拿它来跟醒时实相做不利的比较；而且也会将重点放在那些醒时呈现出来的状况，而非梦境的状况。
We shall however consider those aspects of consciousness which are present within the dream environment, and absent in the physical environment.No study of human personality can pretend to be thorough that does not take into consideration the importance of the dream reality.不过，我们会考虑到那些在梦境里出现但在物质并没出现的意识层面。对于人类人格的研究，只要是忽略梦实相的重要性，都不能号称是完整的研究。
In our final discussions we will, in a practical manner, discuss the ways in which conscious goals can be achieved with the help of the sleeping personality.All of this material will be reinforced with experiments that I hope you will conduct yourselves.在最后的讨论中，我们会实际探讨如何在睡时人格的帮助下，达成有意识的目标。我希望你们亲自做的那些实验，对所有这些资料都将有所增益。
(Again Jane smiled. I had noticed that her eyes had become slitted again as she spoke. They now opened. They were very dark, without highlights.She lit a cigarette as she continued speaking.)(珍再度微笑，我早就发现她在说话时又变成眯眯眼，现在双眼打开，相当乌黑，没有光彩。她点着烟，继续口述。)
It is amazing how man regrets the hours spent in sleep, for he does not realize how hard he works when his ego is unaware.人类对花在睡觉的时间感到惋惜，其程度令人咋舌，因为他不明白，当自我没有知觉的时候，他工作得多么辛苦。
We hope to make it clear.We hope to let you catch yourselves in the act.This phase of our endeavors will be fascinating to you in its scope.You will not, again, regret the hours spent in sleep, for you will see how productive they can be, and you will realize how they are woven into the tapestry that makes up your entire experience. We will deal also, as I mentioned previously, with the nature of space, time and distance as they appear in the dream environment. And some of our experiments in this line will be very illuminating.我们希望理清这一点。我们希望让你们在这个行动中掌握好你们自己。在这个范围内，我们这一阶段的努力将会吸引你们。而且，你们也将不会对花在睡觉的时间感到惋惜，因为你们会知道这段时间具有多么大的生产力，也会了解这段时间如何与其他经验交织在一起，共同形成你们人生全部的经验。
Here the ego cannot go, but it can benefit from the information that is given to it, and perhaps in time even a shadow of the ego may pass through that strange land, and feel in some small way at home.自我在这里无法动弹，但是可以从它接收到的讯息当中获益，最后甚至连自我的影子都可能会经过那个陌生地带，并且有点回到家的感觉。
I believe that I will now end our session, unless there is anything that you prefer to discuss.我想现在就可以结束我们的课，除非你们还有事要谈。
(“No, I guess not.”)(“好，我想没有。”)
My best wishes then to you both; and I quite enjoyed the quiet and relaxed atmosphere.那就送上我衷心的祝福给二位；我蛮享受这种宁静轻松的气氛。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 9:39.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes closed, then opened and she was out of the trance.She had looked at me only casually while delivering the material. Her voice had remained quiet and rather fast.(9:39分结束。珍的出离状况如常，闭着眼睛，随后就张眼回神。她传述资料时偶尔看着我，声音仍然轻柔，而速度则相当快。
(Oddly enough, looking back, Jane could not say whether or not she realized her eyes were open.But she was sure she was aware of this while she was speaking.)(奇怪的是，珍此时回头想，竟然说不出她究竟知不知道自己的眼睛是开着的。不过她很确定自己在说话的当下可以觉察到这一点。)

SESSION 182 第182节 私人课 罗的花粉热


AUGUST 28, 1965 10:30 PM SATURDAY UNSCHEDULED1965年8月28日 星期六 晚上10点30 临时课
(No session was expected for tonight.Bill and Peggy Gallagher visited us unexpectedly at about 8:30 PM.The four of us decided to try a sitting like we had on Friday evening, August 20,1965.That didn’t develop into a session; Seth didn’t speak.I have separate notes on it, showing how Jane expressed voice contact with an entity professing to be a female Gallagher.The details given by the entity were however not overtly familiar to Bill or Peggy.After the sitting we concluded that although something had taken place, the information was probably garbled.(今晚原本没预定要上课。晚上8:30左右，比尔和蓓·加拉格突然来访。我们4人就决定围坐在一起，像1965年8月20日星期五晚上一样，那时并没有发展成一堂课；赛斯没有讲话。我另外为它做了笔记，描述珍如何与一个宣称是女性加拉格的存有，进行口头上的接触。不过比尔或蓓对于那位存有提供的详细内容不太熟悉。结束后我们下了一个结论，就是虽然发生了某件事，但其中的讯息可能遭到曲解。
(To begin tonight, the four of us sat at our small coffee table, holding hands.The room was lit by a candle within three feet of us on another table, and by reflected light from the kitchen on one side of the living room, and from the bedroom on the other side.Jane began speaking, asking if anyone was present.I had hesitated to speak, because on a previous occasion while trying this procedure I had inadvertently brought in Seth.See the 129th session, witnessed by Judy and Lee Wright.(今晚一开始，我们手牵手围坐在小咖啡桌边。客厅的光线来源是一根点燃的蜡烛，放在另一张离我们不到三尺的桌上，以及一边来自厨房和一边来自卧房的反射光线。珍开始讲话，询问是否有任何人在场。我迟疑不太敢说话，因为之前那次尝试这个过程时，我无意间就把赛斯带了进来。见第129节，那时茱蒂和李∙赖特也在场见证。
(This time however Jane brought Seth in herself.We had clustered around the coffee table for perhaps five or six minutes when Seth came through.We broke our handclasps and relaxed for an informal exchange that lasted until 1:23 AM, with rather frequent breaks.(不过，这次是珍自己把赛斯带了进来。我们围坐在咖啡桌大概5、6分钟后，赛斯透过来了。我们松开双手，轻松愉快进行一场非正式的对谈，一直持续到凌晨1:23分才结束，其间休息了很多次。
(Jane’s eyes opened perhaps ten minutes after she began to speak, and remained open for most of the session thereafter.She smoked, looked about at us, etc. Her eyes were very dark, without highlights.None of us saw any indication of feature change, nor did Seth tell us to be alert for such.Seth’s manner was quite energetic, the voice on the strong side but not really loud.Twice in a frisky mood, the voice climbed very briefly in volume; both times this happened near the end of the session.(珍在开始讲话后10分钟左右，张开了眼睛，之后大部分的时间都一直开着。她抽着烟，四下环顾着我们，眼睛相当乌黑，没有光彩。我们都没看到她的面容有任何变化的迹象，赛斯也没有告诉我们要留意这一部分。赛斯的精神非常充沛，声音强而有力但又不会真的太大声。其间两度在高长的情绪下，音量很快飙高；这两次都出现在课堂快结束时。
(I made no attempt to take notes, nor did Peggy.What follows is my reconstruction from memory, made immediately after the session ended.I kept my notebook beside our bed also, and whenever I thought of something to add I did so, up until noon of the next day.Jane then read the notes and suggested any corrections she happened to remember.Peggy and Bill did most of the talking during the session.They are reading the early sessions now, and so what developed was a rather condensed review of some of the main tenets of the material, for their benefit.(我没打算做笔记，蓓也一样。以下是上课结束后我立刻根据记忆重新建构起来的内容。我也把笔记本放在床头，一直到隔天中午前，不管何时只要我想到什么内容要补充，就加进去。之后珍也读了这些笔记，并提供她恰巧记得的改进建议。课中大部分的谈话都来自比尔和蓓。他们在读早期课，目前的进度是密集复习赛斯资料的一些重要原则，这对他们会有帮助。
(Seth periodically asked if any of us had questions.For myself I avoided questions that might lead to answers I would wish to have on paper.The Gallaghers’ questions were of a more general nature usually; and many of them had to do with Bill’s family history.Seth usually addressed Bill as the “friendly or inquiring Jesuit, ’’ and Peggy as the “cat lover.”(赛斯偶尔会问我们有没有人要提出问题。对我来说，如果问题的答案可能会让我想拿纸笔写下来，就先避开不问。加拉格夫妻提出的通常是较为一般的问题；其中多半是跟比尔的家族史有关。赛斯经常以“友善或爱追根究底的耶稣会信徒”来称呼比尔，而以“爱猫人”称呼蓓。”)
(Much of the session was a kind of review, as the 162nd session was, which the Gallaghers also witnessed, with Lorraine Shafer.The material on the construction of matter was gone over. Seth talked a good deal on the cooperation of all living things in maintaining our universe, and of how it’s so very wrong for civilized human beings to kill.He dwelt upon this at some length. I believe a remark Bill made before the session began, about animals, led to this.(这一节大部分都是一种回顾，就像第162节一样，那节课加拉格夫妇跟洛琳∙雪佛一起在场见证。有关物质建构的资料已经结束，赛斯花很多时间谈到在维持我们宇宙的过程中，所有生物要互助合作，也谈到文明人类的杀戮是多么谬误的事。他相当详尽谈论这些部分，我认为是比尔在这节课开始前讲的一些话，才引出这部分的话题。
(There were a few new bits and pieces of information throughout the session.One is to the effect that although Seth’s contact with Jane and me is his first venture into education on our plane, [which he had told us many sessions ago], he is also in contact with other groups on other planes.These other groups are not physical in our terms.Seth said that these other groups also have their wrongs, as we have ours.Killing is not one of them however, nor are wars.(整节课当中，还零零碎碎谈到一些新的讯息内容。其中一项是，虽然赛斯与我和珍的接触是他第一次来到我们层面做的教育冒险，[这一点他很多节前就告诉过我们]但他也在接触其他层面的其他族群。就我们的观点来讲，这些其他族群并不具有肉体。赛斯说，这些族群就跟我们一样，也有他们自己的错误。不过，这些错误中并不包括杀戮，也不包括战争。
(A new physical effect concerned the candle, standing on the table against the wall perhaps three feet from our group.All the windows in the apartment were closed with the exception of one kitchen window, because the night was extremely windy; this wind aggravated my hay fever.The candle burned with a low flame, one perhaps a quarter-inch high.Seth, talking about physical effects, said that he could probably have levitated the small coffee table we sat around tonight, with Ruburt’s help.But Ruburt still needs to develop his abilities further, Seth said.(还有一项新的物理效应是关于蜡烛，这根蜡烛是在靠墙的桌上，离我们大概3尺远。今晚的风相当大，除了厨房里的一扇窗之外，公寓里其他窗户都关着；因为风会让我的花粉热病况恶化。蜡烛即将燃尽，大概只剩4分之1寸高。赛斯谈到物理效应时说，他在鲁柏的协助下，或许可以把我们今晚围坐在旁的那张小小咖啡桌腾空升起。不过赛斯说，鲁柏仍然需要进一步发展能力。
Abruptly the candle flame shot up to a noticeable degree, at least twice its previous height.The increase in brightness was plainly noticeable, causing all of us to look at the candle.Seth then said he had caused the flame to grow.It stayed brighter for several minutes as he continued talking, then died down.Bill confirmed my own thought at the time, that a stray burst of wind had affected the fame.We had no way of knowing if wind was responsible or not; the kitchen window was perhaps fifteen feet away, and around a corner.Seth went on to say that the candle flame would not grow higher again, because Ruburt was alerted to the effect now, and was watching it.这时蜡烛火焰突然显著窜升，起码变成原来的两倍高。室内亮度明显增加，于是我们大家都盯着蜡烛看。接着赛斯说，是他让火焰变大的。在他继续讲话时，这根蜡烛维持了几分钟的熊熊火焰，然后就变小了。比尔这时证实了我自己的想法，认为是一股莫名其妙的风影响了火焰。我们也没办法知道是不是风造成的；厨房的那扇窗大概有15尺远，而且是在角落。赛斯后来说，蜡烛的火焰不会再烧得那么高了，因为现在鲁柏警觉到这个效应，他正在看着它。
(Seth said my special sensitivity to windy days during hay fever season, [and one I was well aware of], stemmed from an incident that took place while I was traveling to California with my parents when I was about three years old. [This would be about 1922.] On a windy day on the prairie, somewhere west of the Mississippi, but short of the West Coast, I stood by a hill with my parents.My mother and father were arguing loudly.Father threatened to leave my mother and my brother and me.My father also had hay fever.I had had attacks before, but after this incident I had hay fever each year. [I have always had it since I can consciously remember.] When I remarked that my father had got rid of his hay fever, Seth said he gave it to me.Seth said this is a common occurrence in illnesses being passed about among a family group.I identified with my father out of fear, Seth went on, because he threatened to leave me and thus must be all powerful; and since my father had hay fever, I acquired hay fever as a mistaken sign of strength.(赛斯说，我在花粉热的季节里之所以对风特别敏感，[而且这现象我很了解]是因为我大约3岁时跟父母到加州旅行时发生的一件事。[大概是在1922年]那天风很大，我跟父母站在小山丘，那是在密西西比西边的大草原，离西海岸不远。我父母大声吵架，父亲威胁要离开母亲、弟弟和我。父亲也有花粉热，我之前也发作过，但从这件事之后，我每年都会发作。[从我有记忆以来，一直都有这个毛病]当我说我父亲已摆脱掉他的花粉热时，赛斯说，他把花粉热给了我。赛斯说，疾病在家人间传来传去的现象很普遍。他继续说，父亲威胁要离开我，因此他必然强而有力，而我出于恐惧，认同了他这股力量；因为他有花粉热，而我误把花粉热视为一种力量的象征，所以也跟着得到这个疾病。
(Seth dwelt upon the Tibetan monks who use astral projection, and follow their strict religion, while the peasantry live miserable practical daily lives, without hope for the most part.This is not right.He said the monks use psychic energy, which all of us have available; but they don’t use it for any great ends, and thus are shallow.(赛斯也谈到使用灵体投射的西藏僧侣，他们遵照严格的宗教戒律，而农民则过着十分悲惨的生活，对未来大多不抱希望，这是不对的。他说，这些僧侣所使用的心灵能量，我们大家也都可以使用；但他们并不是为了什么伟大的目的而使用这种能量，因此很肤浅。
(Peggy asked Seth about a recent dream in which she saw numbers in various corners.Seth named the numbers as 4 and 2; the month of April was represented by 4, with 2 being that day of the month.He did not say what this meant however.(蓓问赛斯一个她最近的梦，梦里她在不同角落看到一些数字。赛斯指出数字是4和2；4代表4月分，2则是该月的日期。不过他并没有说这代表什么意思。
(Bill’s mother, who was also an arthritic cripple like Jane’s mother, was a very aggressive personality, a masculine one, who developed arthritis in order to lose her mobility and thus avoid harming Bill’s father and the children.She felt a growing rage and aggressiveness she could not control.Seth said association worked here, in that Jane could perceive this data because her own mother has arthritis.Bill’s mother was very fond of flowers.(比尔的母亲，像珍的母亲一样，因为关节炎而跛脚，是个非常敢冲撞、很男性化的人，她得关节炎是为了要让自己失去行动力，以免伤害比尔的父亲和孩子。她感觉到怒火中烧，带有攻击性，自己却无力控制。赛斯说，这里有某种连结，因为珍自己的母亲也有关节炎，所以珍可以感知到这些资料。比尔的母亲非常喜欢花。
(Bill’s mother was fascinated by the relationships of numbers, Seth said, and the color blue.After the session Bill revealed that his mother had been a bookkeeper, which Jane and I did not know previously.Peggy recalled that Bill’s mother had been buried in a blue dress, which upset Bill’s father very much; and that Bill’s mother had many blue dresses in her wardrobe.(赛斯说，比尔的母亲对数字间的关系及蓝色非常感兴趣。上完课后，比尔透露说他母亲以前是记账员，这件事我和珍本来不知道。蓓回想起比尔的母亲穿着蓝色衣服下葬，这让他父亲很不高兴；而且比尔的母亲衣柜里也有很多蓝色衣服。
(Seth told Bill he subconsciously blamed his father for his mother’s condition, after Bill remarked that whenever he and his father were together for a few minutes they would end up arguing.Also, when a small child Bill had overheard a sexual encounter between his parents, in which his mother cried out. Bill took it to mean his father had hurt his mother.Later when his mother fell ill, Bill made the subconscious connection with her illness and this earlier incident, and blamed his father for his mother’s illness.(比尔说只要跟父亲相处一会儿，两人最后就会争吵不休，之后赛斯告诉比尔说，他在潜意识里为了母亲的情况而责怪父亲。而且，比尔小时候曾偷听到父母亲做爱时，母亲大叫的声音，比尔认为这是父亲在伤害母亲。后来他母亲生病了，比尔在潜意识里便将她的病与先前这件事连结在一起，责怪父亲害母亲生病。
(Bill’s mother tried to project her illness to other members of the family, as often happens also.This involved guilt feelings on her part.(比尔的母亲也经常试着将自己的病投射到其他家人身上。这部分就牵涉到她的罪恶感。
(Seth slipped in some personal material on Walter Zeh before “Ruburt catches me in the act.” He prefaced this by saying that we were all friends here tonight, presumably I suppose if the information was considered to be personal, Just before this he had mentioned again the similarity between Jane’s mother and Bill’s mother.Now he said that Walter Zeh had also been an invalid in a previous life, and a female.For reasons he didn’t go into now, Jane owed Walter Zeh a debt, which she has paid in full.Jane had been attracted to him also in an attempt to make up to him, because she hadn’t been able to make up to her invalid mother.In his previous life Walter Zeh had been crippled because of an accident.(赛斯不经意透露一些关于沃尔特•泽的私人资料，那是在“鲁柏逮到我”之前的事情。他一开始就说，今晚我们在这里的都是好朋友，我猜测，这样的讯息是否应该算是私人的。就在这之前，他再度提到珍的妈妈和比尔的妈妈之间的相似处。现在他说，沃尔特•泽前世也是残障人士，是个女人。由于某些原因，赛斯这时并没有详述，只说珍欠沃尔特•泽一笔债务，不过已全部还清。珍曾为他着迷，想办法讨好他，因为珍一直无法讨好她残障的妈妈。沃尔特•泽前世因为一场意外而跛脚。
(Also it was necessary that this episode in Jane’s life take place before I came along, and be gotten out of the way and done with. It had to be done first.(此外，珍生命中的这段插曲必须发生在我出现之前，而且已处理与解决，这件事必得先了结。
(Seth made one short remark I would have liked to question him further on, to the effect that we would have plenty of go-arounds with “your parapsychologists.” He did not elaborate.(赛斯简短提到我原本想进一步问他的一件事，大意是我们跟“你们诡异的心理学家”会有很多激烈的争辩。他并没有详细说明。
(Seth told Bill that a summer Sunday in 1946 is very important to him subconsciously. It involved Bill’s father William [Jane hadn't known the name of Bill's father], and an older man with brown hair whom Bill looked upon as being in a position of authority.There was some kind of disagreement as to Bill’s choice of a career [Bill had left the Navy not long before], an argument with Bill’s father; ever after that Bill didn’t get along with his father.Bill did not follow his father’s suggestions, I believe.(赛斯告诉比尔，1946年夏天的某个星期日，对他的潜意识来说是非常重要的一天，涉及比尔的父亲威廉，[珍不知道比尔父亲的名字]，以及一位年纪稍长的棕发男士。比尔视他为权威人士。比尔对于自己生涯抉择的看法，[当时比尔刚从海军退伍不久]跟父亲有所不同，两人因此发生口角；从此以后比尔就跟父亲处不好，我相信比尔不会听从父亲的建议。
(Walter Zeh is a fragment personality, and a disturbed one.Because he had been an invalid in a past life, he tried to slow down Jane’s development in this life to a crawl.Yet Walter has learned much and is doing very well.(沃尔特·泽是片段人格，一个精神失常的人格。由于前世残障，因此他尝试要把珍这一世的发展减缓下来，以龟速前进。不过沃尔特学到了很多，而且进展得非常好。
(Seth told Bill that his mother had been very close to another female in the family, though not a daughter.They had talked about childbirth, etc. Bill thinks the other woman was possibly the wife of his father’s brother.(赛斯告诉比尔，他母亲跟家里另一位女性非常要好，不过这位女性并不是她女儿。她们聊过生儿育女这方面的事，比尔认为这位女性可能是他妈妈的妯娌。
(Seth said he had unfortunately been involved with some other groups on our plane, in seance gatherings.He spoke very harshly of such “idiotic” gatherings and personalities.At the same time Seth stated he was not a spirit, although if he materialized in the middle of the floor we would pay more attention and not take him for granted.(赛斯说，他很遗憾跟我们层面的其他团体在降神会上有所牵连。他提到这一类“白痴的”聚会与人格时相当严厉。同时赛斯也说，他并不是个鬼魂，虽然要是他现身在我们地板上，我们就会更注意他，而不会视他为理所当然。
(During his discussion on the creation of matter, Seth used the coffee table and a wineglass in making his points about how each of us creates his own world, with its own atoms and molecules.This led also into a discussion of the consciousness of each atom and molecule, etc., and our agreement telepathically on such things as the placement of objects in space.See sessions 66 and 68 in Volume 1.(在讨论到物质的创造时，赛斯以咖啡和酒杯为例，说明我们每个人如何以自己的原子与分子，创造出自己的世界。这又引导我们讨论到每个原子与分子的意识，以及我们在心电感应层面上，彼此如何同意空间之内物体的配置。见第二册第66和68节。
(A Freudian slip that Jane made in reference to her own mother in the past tense, “was, ” whereas Seth wanted Jane to say “is, ” was duly noted.Jane, he said, would be perfectly happy never to see her mother again.(这里要特别留意的是，珍在提到自己的母亲时，会误以过去式“was”表示，但其实赛斯是要她说出现在式“is”。赛斯说，如果从今以后珍都不必再见到母亲，一定会非常开心。
(Right after the session began, Seth showed how Jane’s personal subconscious memories had, during the sitting with the Gallaghers, on August 20, distorted the material we received.What actually happened was that Jane’s maternal grandmother tried to get through, but Jane wanted to get Bill’s mother, and so named the entity speaking as a Gallagher.Seth mentioned that Jane’s own memories of the shredded-wheat incident should have told her what had happened.Also, Jane confused the corner grocery in her neighborhood with the grocery in Bill’s neighborhood, which was located in the middle of a block.Much, Seth said, Jane had picked up telepathically from Bill. Bill had looked up to the man running the grocery store in his neighborhood.(就在课开始后赛斯表示，在8月20日与加拉格夫妇一起聚会时，珍个人潜意识的记忆扭曲了我们接收到的资料。实际的情形是，珍的外祖母试着要透过来，但珍想要让比尔的母亲过来，所以就把那天讲话的存有称为加拉格。赛斯提到，珍自己对碎麦片[shredded-wheat]事件的记忆，应该已经告诉她发生了什么事。而且珍也把她家附近街角的杂货店，误认为是比尔家附近位于街区中间的杂货店。赛斯说，珍以心电感应从比尔那边拾取很多讯息。比尔一向很敬仰在他家附近开杂货店的那位男士。
(Toward the end of the session Seth said he thought the object Peggy has been carrying in her handbag has “something to do with rock, ’’and that a man had somehow been connected with it, or its origin.The problem here is getting the information through Ruburt, without distortion. See the 180th session.The Gallaghers said nothing about the object at this point, nor did I. Later at break I forgot to ask them about it.(这节课快结束时赛斯说，他认为蓓一直放在手提包里的那个东西“跟岩石有关”，而且有个男人跟它或它的来源有关。现在的问题是要透过鲁柏获得讯息，而且不能扭曲，见第180节。此时加拉格夫妇对于那个东西没说什么，我也没有。稍后休息时我也忘了问他们这件事。
(Bill’s mother exerted a “pull” on his father which the father subconsciously resented.Her illness was not the result of events in this life only, but of past lives also.(比尔的母亲曾以“强拉”的方式对待父亲，他为此在潜意识里忿忿不平。她的病并不只是这一生各种事件造成的结果，也包括过去累世的事件。
(I told Seth I hadn’t felt like going out dancing tonight because of the windy weather, and that I thought Jane would be disappointed. I had wished some company would drop in. This was just before darkness fell.As soon as the Gallaghers entered, they told us they had thought about us while eating dinner in Ithaca, NY, some 30. odd miles away, and had decided to stop by just in case we were home, even though it was Saturday evening.Seth said there had been telepathic communication between us, and as near as we could calculate we had been thinking about each other at roughly the same time.(我告诉赛斯，因为今晚风太大，所以我不想出去跳舞，我想珍可能会很失望，我心里期待会有朋友顺道来访，这些都是天黑之前的事。加拉格夫妇一进门就告诉我们，他们在离纽约大概30里的伊萨卡吃晚餐时突然想到我们，然后就决定如果我们在家的话就来串串门，即使是周六晚上也没关系。赛斯说，我们之间早就用心电感应沟通过了，双方是在同一时间想到彼此，时间点几乎没有误差。
(The number 5 is connected with Bill’s 1946 date and incident, but Seth could not say in what way, or how.(数字5跟比尔1946年的日期和事件相关，不过赛斯并不能说是哪方面的关联或如何相关。
(Bill and Peggy agreed that Seth’s material on his parents seems to fit them psychologically, although some of the information given concerning Bill’s subconscious feelings toward his father was a surprise to Bill. At one point Seth asked Bill to not say so much when he answered a question, because this led Ruburt to start to actively and consciously consider the material and to make his own interpretations, which could be distorted.Seth also asked Bill not to tell us any more about his family relationships; presumably so that more material Seth came through with in future sessions could be checked with Bill’s knowledge, as in the blue dress and the bookkeeping incidents.(比尔和蓓同意赛斯所说，关于他父母那部分的资料就心理上来说似乎是对的，不过一些有关比尔对父亲的潜意识感觉，却令比尔惊讶。这时赛斯要求比尔回答问题时不要说太多话，因为这样子会导致鲁柏开始在意识上积极思考资料，做出他自己的诠释，使资料遭到扭曲。赛斯也要求比尔不要再告诉我们任何关于他家庭关系的讯息；这样一来，未来上课时赛斯传递过来的更多资料，就可以由比尔提供的讯息加以验证，就像上述蓝色衣服和记账员的例子一样。
(Possibly Peggy and Bill could dream about events of interest to them, that were discussed this evening, if they used suggestion.They could also use the pendulum, though they might need more subconscious practice.Seth repeated often that Peggy and Bill should read more of the material.(如果比尔和蓓使用暗示，或许就可以梦到那些今晚讨论过程中他们感兴趣的事情。他们可以使用摆钟，不过可能需要更多潜意识的练习。赛斯一再说，比尔和蓓应该多读些资料。
(Speaking of the fact that civilized man should not kill, Seth said the whole idea of killing is fallacious to begin with: an enemy who is “dead" is far more harmful than one who is still alive.Here he was dealing with the basic unity of all consciousness again.Killing is not thought of as an end in itself on other planes, he repeated.But it is wrong to kill on our plane when we do consider it an end.(至于文明人不该杀戮这件事，赛斯说，打从一开始整个杀戮的观念就是错的：“已死”的敌人远比活着的敌人更会造成危害。这里他重申所有的意识基本上都是一体的观念。他再度说，杀戮本身在其他层面中并不被视为结束。可是在我们的层面，如果我们真的把它当成是一种结束，然后去杀戮，那是不对的。
(Seth told me that tests similar to our envelope tests, or perhaps involving objects, could probably be held here in the apartment when others such as the Gallaghers are present.Ruburt’s confidence is the big factor.This restriction to home grounds is a very temporary one, and later Ruburt can deal with objects at a greater distance.(赛斯跟我说，类似我们的信封那种测试，或是有关物品的测试，或许可以在公寓这边进行，而且是趁着别人在场的时候，像是加拉格夫妇。鲁柏的信心是一大因素。这种受限于自家范围的现象，只是非常短暂的过程，鲁柏以后就可以处理放在更远的物品。
(Bill’s mother had lived a previous life in China. Bill’s family was involved in very complicated psychic relationships.Bill told Seth he thought that on the whole his ulcer is a little better since he and Peggy had first attended a session, the 158th, of May 30,1965.Seth told Bill the ulcer is a parasite, and that he no longer needs it.(比尔的母亲前世是在中国，比尔的家庭在心灵层面上关系相当复杂。比尔告诉赛斯说，他觉得自从和蓓在1965年5月30日第一次来上第158节的课以后，整体而言溃疡好一些了。赛斯跟比尔说，溃疡只是一种寄生物，他已不再需要它。
(The session had been going for perhaps half an hour when Bill suggested to Peggy that they leave because the hour was growing late. He felt tired.Seth then said he would wake Bill up, or get him interested, and he proceeded to do this by launching into the discussion on Bill’s mother.(这节课进行了大约半个钟头后，比尔向蓓提议说要离开，因为时间不早了，他觉得很累。赛斯接着就说，他有办法提振比尔的精神，或让他感兴趣，于是他开始讨论到比尔的母亲。
(Ruburt has abilities of his own that sometimes get mixed up with Seth’s.There was much telepathy going on tonight.Regarding the individual constructions of the world of matter, each with its own set of atoms and molecules, Seth said that these individual worlds are not as much alike as one might think, even though there is telepathic agreement on such things as the placement of objects in space, etc. We focus on the similarities and ignore the differences to a large extent.(鲁柏自己的一些能力有时候会跟赛斯的能力混在一起。今晚用到很多的心电感应。谈到每个人以自己的一套原子与分子，建构个人物质世界，赛斯说，这些个人世界的相似度并不像一般人认为的那么高，即使说在心电感应上，大家都同意空间之内物品的配置等事情。我们都聚焦在相似度上，可是却大大忽略它们之间的差异。
(So far man’s behavior has him headed for destruction rather than survival.Seth repeated several times that for civilized man to kill is wrong.An animal in the jungle killing for food is one thing. To kill for the sake of killing is another.When a wild animal kills, the killed is replaced in the natural scheme of things. No gap is left, and the balance of nature is maintained.When man kills he rips out a part of himself that he has created.Man will stop killing when he realizes this, and that death is not an ending but a change of form.(目前人类的行为已经走向毁灭之途，而非生存之路。赛斯重复说了好几次，对文明人来说，杀戮是不对的。从林里的动物为了食物而杀戮是一回事，为了杀戮而杀戮又是另一回事。野生动物杀戮时，被杀的动物在自然界的架构中被取代了，这中间并没有缺口，大自然的平衡得以维持。当人类杀人时，他等于撕毁掉那个他创造出来的一部分自己。如果人类了解这一点，也知道死亡不是结束，而是一种形式的转变，就不会再杀人了。
(Just before the Gallaghers left, Seth/'Jane’s voice began to grow very loud just for a sentence or two.We all clapped our hands over our ears, and Seth had mercy on us.The voice was somewhat unusual, Seth told us; he himself was not interested greatly in physical effects or proofs, but realized they might be necessary to us, or scientists. He was interested, he said, in effects like the voice, or Jane’s facial changes.There was much that he and Ruburt could do; there was also much they could not do.It depended upon Jane’s confidence to a great extent.(就在加拉格夫妇离开之前，赛斯-珍有一、两句话开始变得非常大声。我们所有人都用双手捂住耳朵，赛斯对我们手下留情。他告诉我们，这种声音有些不寻常；他自己对于物理效应或证据没有太大的兴趣，不过他知道，对我们或科学家来说，这些效应或证据有其必要。他说，他对于这种声音或珍表情变化的效应感兴趣。他和鲁柏可以做的还有很多；但也有很多他们做不到，这多半取决于珍的信心程度。
(Seth told Bill and Peggy, in connection with the subconscious construction of their individual worlds, that they really lived in many worlds at once.At the end of the session Seth told the Gallaghers he had deliberately given the information about Bill’s mother being a bookkeeper and liking the color blue, in order to show them that valid information had been produced, no matter what its source.(在个人世界的潜意识建构方面，赛斯告诉比尔和蓓，他们的的确确同时活在许多世界里。这节课快结束时赛斯也跟加拉格夫妇说，他刻意提供比尔母亲是记账员背景和蓝色等方面的资料，以让他们清楚知道，可靠的讯息已经得到，不管它来自哪里。
(As Bill opened the hall door, Jane, standing beside him, came through as Seth, very loud, for a few words. But it was enough to make him shut the door quickly.When Seth then departed, usual good nights were said, the Gallaghers left and the session was over.(比尔开门时，珍就站在他旁边，此时赛斯透过来，非常大声讲了几个字，但这就足以让比尔赶快把门关上。接着赛斯一如往常说声再见后退离，之后加拉格夫妇也跟着离开，课结束。
(End at 1:23 AM.Jane felt fine in spite of the length of the session.Indeed, it was she who initiated it during our casual conversation, after the Gallaghers had been here for a while.Her eyes had remained open for the most part until the end, and she had been dissociated as usual.(凌晨1:23分结束。尽管课拖得很长，珍觉得还好。加拉格夫妇来了一会儿之后，确实是珍在我们闲话家常中开始这节课的。一直到结束前她大部分时间都张开眼睛，出神状态也都一如平常。
(Addition: Also, Seth said, when a person gets sick, they want the illness—a reference to my hay fever, taken from my father.(补充：赛斯也说，人生病时，就是他们想要这个病——指我的花粉热，从我父亲那边来。
(The Gallaghers later confirmed that Bill’s mother was very fond of flowers.(加拉格夫妇后来确认，比尔的母亲非常喜欢花。
(Seth told the Gallaghers they should record their dreams, and study the symbolisms therein.Dreams are very cunningly constructed by the whole self so that one symbol can have meaning to many layers of the self.(赛斯跟加拉格夫妇说，他们应该把梦记录下来，并研究里面的象征意义。梦是经由全我精心建构而来，所以每一个象征对自己的很多层面都具有意义。
(Seth said the material on individual constructions of the world of matter can be verified mathematically.(赛斯说，有关个人物质世界的建构资料都能以数学的角度来验证。
(Jane’s maternal grandmother is on a midplane—at least one, and perhaps more, lives to come yet. [Or Bill’s mother, I can’t recall].Later: we believe Bill’s mother is the one on the midplane.)(珍的外祖母目前在中间层面[midplane]里——她至少要等一世，也许更多世后再过来。[或是比尔的母亲，我不记得了]后来，我们认为在中间层面的应该是指比尔的母亲。)

SESSION 183 第183节　情感、空间和距离在醒时状态里的关系　信封3


AUGUST 30, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年8月30日　星期一　晚上9点　定期课
(This afternoon while painting I had a vision.With my inner eye I saw the face of an older man, facing to the left in full color. I made two pencil drawings of the image.It was quite clear, especially about the eyes, nose and mouth; and later I realized that I had been “seeing” it for at least a few moments, almost absent-mindedly, before I understood what was happening.(今天下午我在作画时，看见一个内在心象。我用内在眼睛看到一张男性长者的脸，面向左边，是彩色的，我为这个景象画了两幅铅笔素描。影像相当清楚，尤其是眼睛、鼻子和嘴巴部分；后来才了解，我几乎是在恍神的状态下，至少“看”了它几分钟，才知道到底是怎么一回事。
(For what it is worth, earlier in the afternoon I had been wishing I had a model handy, for I felt like doing some quick sketches as a relief from the constant oil painting.It is difficult for me to get models when I have the time to use them.For some other material on my visions, see the 22nd and 47th sessions, in Vols. I and 2.(值得一提的是，因为我最近一直不停画油画，所以很想画一些素描，让自己放松一下，于是下午稍早前我很希望手边能有个模特儿。对我来说，每当我有时间需要模特儿来画素描时，都很难找到适合人选。其他有关我看到内在心象的资料，可参阅第一册与第二册第22节和47节。
(I had prepared a test envelope to give to Jane during the 181st session, of August 25, but did not do so because of the short session.When the envelope was not used I did not mention it to her, but saved it for tonight’s session.It contained part of a calendar page for April 1965.I came across the calendar beneath a stack of books and on the spur of the moment decided to use it for the test, wondering whether this type of cut and dried subject matter would have as much emotional pull for Seth Jane as the subject matter of the first two tests.See the 179th and 180th sessions.Jane was out of the house when I prepared the usual double envelope.(8月25日第181节课中，我准备了一个测试信封要给珍，但由于那节课太短了，所以就没有给她。既然没有用到那个信封，我也就没跟珍提起，于是把它留到今晚的课中使用。里面装的是1965年4月份月历的一部分。那是我无意间在一叠书下面看到的，灵机一动，决定用来做测试。我担心这种无趣的主题是否也能像前两次测试一样，对赛斯-珍产生那么大的情绪张力。见第179和180节。我在准备普通双层信封时，珍不在家。
(As will be seen, there were some very interesting developments because I chose this particular subject for a test.(就如待会儿即将揭晓的，因为我选择了这个特殊的主题来做测试，下面的发展非常有趣。
(The session was held in our small back room. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet and she used pauses, although her pace picked up considerably as first break approached.)(这节课在我们后面的小房间举行，珍闭上眼睛坐着开始讲话，轻声细语，中间有一些停顿，不过在快接近休息时，速度加快许多)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth！)(“晚安，赛斯)
I had told you that I had considered giving you a night off.Instead, we had an extra session.我早就告诉你们，打算放你们一个晚上的假。但我们反而多加了一节课。
The experience was a good one for Ruburt, since it served to give him additional and much-needed confidence.I attempted to give several definite characteristics that would serve to identify your Jesuits mother, and I believe that we succeeded.这对鲁柏而言是一次不错的经验，因为让他更具信心，这正是他目前极为需要的。我努力提供一些明确的特征，以协助你们认识耶稣会信徒的母亲，我认为我们做到了。
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher witnessed the unscheduled session, the 182nd, on Saturday August 28.The Jesuit tag has come to be a standard one for Bill, and quite a humorous one in Seth’s view.(比尔和蓓·加拉格见证了8月26日星期六第182节的临时课。耶稣会信徒已成为比尔的标准代称，从赛斯的观点来看，这是个幽默的昵称。
(During the session Seth gave an accurate psychological account of Bill Gallagher’s mother, according to Bill. She is now dead, and Jane and I never met her.Bill has told us very little about her, other than that she was an arthritic cripple like Jane’s mother is.Three points in particular were quite authentic, according to Bill. Seth stated that his mother “was fascinated by numbers, ” loved the color blue, and was inordinately fond of flowers.After the session Bill Gallagher told us his mother had been a bookkeeper, was buried wearing a blue dress—blue was her favorite color—and that she was indeed very fond of flowers.)(根据比尔所说，赛斯在这节课中精确描述他母亲的心理，她已经去世了，我和珍从没见过她。比尔很少对我们提起她，只说过她像珍的妈妈一样因关节炎而跛脚。据比尔表示，赛斯说的三件事情特别真实可信，包括他母亲“对数字着迷”、偏好蓝色、特别喜欢花卉。课结束后，比尔·加拉格告诉我们，他妈妈当过记账员，下葬时穿着蓝色衣服——蓝色是她的最爱——还有她的确非常喜欢花。)
Now, before we plunge into the nature and characteristics of dream reality, let us briefly consider the relationship between emotions, space, and distance as they occur within the waking conditions.现在，在我们进一步讨论梦实相的本质与特性之前，先稍微思考一下情感、空间和距离在醒时状态里的关系。
An emotion obviously does not take up physical space, yet it takes up varying amounts of psychic space according to its intensity.It seems to recede in time and to shrink in psychic space as the intensity of it begins to diminish.An intensive emotion will represent the present in time, a particular instant of now.情感显然不占用物理空间，不过依据其强度的高低，会占用大小不等的心灵空间。当情感强度开始减弱，仿佛会在时间上倒退回去，在心灵空间上也会缩减。浓烈的情感代表着时间上的现在，特别是当下的这个时间。
Whenever circumstances tend to revitalize such a charged emotion, that particular now will be re-created.The emotion will once again rush into the psychic space which is formed by elements in the personality’s psychological environment.The immediate emotion of any moment, therefore, forms the framework of your present time within the waking state.As the emotion diminishes it takes up less of your psychic space, fills up less of your inner environment, and you seem to yourself to recede from it.不论何时，只要环境能激发起这种高胀的情感，那个特定的当下就会再度创造出来。情感将再次冲进心灵空间，而这个心灵空间是由人格的心理环境之内各种元素所形成。因此，任何片刻的当下情感，就形成了你醒时状况里当下这一刻的基本架构。随着情感消退，它所占用的心灵空间就比较小，填补的内在环境也比较小，你自己也似乎从中撤退。
As far as distance, physical distance, is concerned, this whole idea is subconsciously taken into consideration.That which appears ahead of you in distance, and has not yet been experienced, under usual circumstances has not yet entered the psychic space of inner environment.When you reach this imaginary physical experience, and if you are emotionally involved in it, then it becomes the PRESENT, in capital letters.至于距离，物理上的距离，这整个概念要从潜意识的角度来考量。出现在你们面前的距离，尚未被经验，一般而言还没进入内在环境的心灵空间中。当你触及这个想像的物质经验，而且也投入情感的话，那么它就会变成当下(PRESENT，译注：原文中赛斯提到这个英文字要大写)。
The moment is remembered because the emotions experienced at the time almost completely fill the psychic space, forcing all other experiences out.The stronger the emotion the more vivid the moment becomes, the more totally it is recalled.And even in future years such past instances can be experienced as vividly as any present experience.In other words, to some large extent such a strong emotion unites experience and knocks down the artificial barrier of past, present and future.那个片刻会被记住，因为当时被经验的情感，几乎完全填满了整个心灵空间，把所有其他经验挤出去。情感越强烈，这个片刻就变得越鲜明，也越可以被全然忆起。甚至在未来几年后，这类在过去发生的事件，就像是发生在今日一样如此鲜明。换句话说，这种强烈的情感多半可以将经验整合起来，打破过去、现在与未来之间人为的藩篱。
I will let you take your break.我要让你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:17.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet but fast.She had used some pauses however.She resumed in the same manner, with some longer pauses, at 9:26.)(9:17分休息。珍第一阶段口述的出离状况一如往常，双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔而快速，不过中间也停顿几次。9:26分珍以同样的方式继续口述，中间有几次停顿较久。)
As we have often stated, inner experience is the only true dimension of existence.就如我们平常所说的，内在经验是存在的唯一真实面向。
Because of the physical structure, experiences within your system have a slow-motion distortion which creates the appearance of time.Time as you know it, waking time, is intimately connected with the emotions and with emotional intensities.Now. There is also a connection here that can be explored most clearly by using color designations.由于物质结构的关系，你们系统里的经验会产生一种慢动作的扭曲，创造出时间现象。时间，如你们所知的，醒时时间与情感及情感度密切相关。现在，这里也有一种关联，可以利用颜色名称来彻底探讨。
Red is the most present or immediate of colors. The cool colors are more contemplative, or more indicative of contemplation.They do not however have the same type of intensity. They leave room within psychic space for other emotional experiences also.红色是最当下或最即时的颜色，冷色系偏冥想，或表示沉思。不过它们的强度不同，在心灵国度里，也会为其他情感轻验腾出空间。
There are electrical connotations here also that are important, electrical components that compose the emotional experience, and that tend to show themselves in certain auras of color.Within the dreaming state however inner experience is not limited as it is in the waking condition, so that the time barrier can be largely dispensed with. There is an additional psychic space to be filled.这里也有电子上的意涵，非常重要，电子成分组成了情感经验，很容易在某些颜色氛围里头显示出来。在梦境中，内在经验并不像醒时状态下那样受限，所以可以大大摆脱时间上的障碍，因此有多余的心灵空间留给其他情感经验。
(For some related material concerning time, intensities and moment points, see the following sessions: 149, 150, 151, 152.)(有关时间、情感强度和片刻点，可参看第149、150、151和152节。)
Experiences are more directly felt, although the same sort of differences occur here as far as intensities are involved.In the dream state as in the waking state, experiences vary in their intensity.There is however a more mobile element and an easier movement through experiences.Transitions are more rare in the dream state, since physical time lapses are not necessary.经验可以更直接被感受到，虽然就强度来说，也一样会产生差异。经验在梦境里跟在醒时状态一样，有不同的强度变化。然而在梦中，透过经验会有更为流动的元素和更轻而易举的行动。各种过渡时期在梦境中更是少见，因为根本不需要物理时间的流逝。
Spontaneity is more the rule.Images appear and disappear, for there is no necessity to construct them as continuous physical constructions.There is therefore greater opportunity for new creations.These dream experiences take up psychic space, as do waking experiences.Their intensity is immediately felt however without any reliance upon physical time.自发性更是一种常态。影像可以现形又消失，因为这里不必把它们建构为连续的物质构造。因此有更多机会可以进行新的创造。这些梦经验一样占有心灵空间，就像醒时经验一样。不必依靠任何物理时间，就可以立即感受到它们的强度。
They are felt according to their intensity only.You might say, returning to our analogy, that there is more color-mixing within the dream state, and the materials are immediately at hand.Distance is then seen in its true light, not in relation to physical space but in its basic relationship to emotional intensity.As you seem in the waking condition to travel out of an experience, or as you seem to separate yourself from it, then physical time enters into your awareness.它们只能依据其强度被感觉到。回到我们的比喻，你们或许会说，在梦境中会有更多的色彩混合，东西也可以立刻到手。因此距离也可以清清楚楚看到，这跟物理空间无关，而是跟情感强度有重要的关联。就像你在醒时状况中旅行到了经验之外，或是当你似乎与某个经验分离时，此时物理时间才会进入你的意识。
When you directly experience an emotional event, when you are at its heart, so to speak, then you do not seem to experience physical time.Only as you move to the outskirts of the experience does such time realization enter in.The dream experience however is always free of the realization of physical time, practically, for you experience dream events directly from the center of awareness.当你直接经验一个情感事件，可以这么说，当你正处在它的核心，似乎就不会经验到物理时间。唯有在你走到该经验的边缘时，这样的时间认知才会进来。实际上，梦里经验通常没有物理时间的认知，因为你是直接从意识的中心经验梦中事件。
You move from the outskirts of one dream into the core of another without a change of intensity, and therefore without the sense of physical time passing.It goes without saying that a sense of time may or may not be interwoven in any given dream sequence, but you as the dreamer are not conscious of the physical hours that pass as you sleep.你可以从一个梦的边缘进入另一个梦的核心，而不用改变强度，因此也不会感知到物理时间的流逝。不用多说，时间感可能会、也可能不会夹杂在任何一连串的梦当中，但是身为梦中人的你，并不会意识到你睡觉时所流逝的物理时间。
You may take a break.你们可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:49. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been rather fast.(9:49分休息，珍的出离状况如常，一直闭着双眼，节奏相当快速。
(Our bed is in the small back room we usually use for sessions. She came close to it this evening, leaning back upon an elbow quite often.(我们的床铺是在我们经常用来上课的后面小房间里，休息时珍坐在床上吸着烟。这次休息相当久，珍开始抽第二根。赛斯再度透过来时，她仍然在床上。珍至今从未以趴着的姿势讲话，她今晚差点就要趴下来，经常用一只手肘撑住。
(Her eyes opened soon after she began speaking, and she continued smoking. She was quite restless. Most of the time she spoke from a sitting position. Her eyes closed at times for a sentence or two. They were very dark, and her voice was quiet and fast.Resume at 10:00.)(她一开始讲话就立刻张开双眼，继续抽烟，相当焦躁不安，大部分时间都坐着讲话，有时候会闭上眼睛讲个一、两句话，双眼非常黑，声音温柔而快速。10:00点继续口述。)
In the dream reality you have the opportunity to work out solutions to problems within a larger framework in a psychic environment, where there is no immediate necessity for physical construction.在梦实相里面，你们有机会在心灵环境更大的架构里，找到问题的解决方法，在心灵环境并没有物质建构的迫切需求。
This function is extremely important, and represents one of the main ways in which problem-solving is dealt with by the personality.This is also the reason why the plays of Shakespeare have endured the centuries. The dramas are not true to life in physical terms, but are true to life in psychic terms.这个功能极为重要，代表了人格处理问题的一种主要方法，这也是莎士比亚的戏剧几世纪以来历久不衰的原因。就物质的角度来说，梦对生命并不真实，但就心灵的角度而言，梦对生命却是实实在在的。
The creative abilities have full reign within the dream state, and it is here that the personality first tests its creative intensities and methods.The personality’s physical environment therefore is greatly colored and formed by his dream existence.There is some leakage from waking-life experience to dream experience, but this leakage usually represents the material needed, or the problem to be solved.Mental events and dream events are primary. The individual first manipulates situations within the dream reality, and then transposes his characteristic method of handling them upon the physical reality.创造的能力在梦境中主宰一切，人格最初就是在这里测试自己创造的强度和方法。因此，梦的存在大幅渲染和形成了人格的物质环境。有某种醒时生活的经验会渗漏到梦经验，不过这种渗漏往往代表了所需要的物质，或是有待解决的问题。精神事件和梦事件才是最原始的，个体刚开始都先在实相中操纵环境，然后再转移到物质实相中，以自己特有的方式操纵它们。
It is true, as Ruburt has discovered, that these dream elements are interwound.Events are indeed clairvoyantly perceived in the dream state.On the other hand in many instances the sleeping personality solves a problem, and therefore causes the physical event because it is the result of the dream work involved.就跟鲁柏发现的一样，这些梦元素确实交织在一起。在梦境中，真的可以用千里眼的方式察觉到事件。另一方面来说，许多状况下，睡梦中的人格解决了问题，因而形成了物质事件，因为这正是梦境运作后的成果。
In many cases he perceives in a dream a future physical event, and then within the dream situation acts out various possible solutions, until he hits upon the most agreeable one.In the dream state the personality actually has at its command a stupendous amount of subconscious information of which the ego is not aware.It is actually more practical therefore to seek the solution in the dreaming state, or in periods of dissociation if you prefer.The amount of data available to the subconscious is simply superior in quality and larger in quantity to that available to the ego, and this information can be used effectively through suggestion.许多情况是，他在梦里觉察到一个未来的物质事件，接着就在梦境当中采行各种可能的解决方法，直到他偶然发现一个最满意的方法为止。梦境中，人格其实可以自由支配为数众多且自我并不知道的潜意识讯息。因此，如果你愿意的话，在梦境中或是在意识出离状态中去寻求解决之道，真的是更为实际的方法。潜意识比自我所获得的资料，在品质上更好，数量上更多，而这些讯息都可以透过暗示有效利用。
The subconscious in sleep has great freedom, and has at its command information gained through past experience in this life and in other lives. In the intense focus of awareness that occurs within the dream state, the inner self is able to direct all of its energies for the purpose of solving a given problem.睡眠时潜意识拥有很大的自由，可以透过一世和其他世的过去经验，自由支配所获得的讯息，梦境当中，在强烈的意识焦点之下，内我可以指挥所有的能量，以解决碰到的问题。
It is able to use all of its vast information, gained through previous experience, and all of its knowledge, to solve the problem at hand.Literally, the whole inner personality is able to focus upon any given problem, completely free of distractions, using the subconscious language of symbols.This language is crisper in its fashion, and more concise and more inclusive than any written language.For as we have explained, each symbol has various meanings to all layers of the self.它可以使用透过先前经验得到的大量讯息和自己的所有知识，来解决手边的问题。精确地说，整个内在人格可以完全心无旁骛，聚焦在任何碰到的问题上，并使用潜意识的象征语言。这种语言的形式，比起其他书面语言更干脆利落，也更简洁，较具概括性。因为就如我们解释过的，每个象征符号对自己所有的层面来说，均具有不同的意义。
(Among many others, see the 92nd, 93rd and 94th sessions in Volume 3.)(这一部分除了上述资料之外，也可以参考第92、93和94节等其他资料。)
Computer like, the data is instantly made available exactly when and where it is needed.The ego is indeed equipped to handle physical reality. Its purpose is the manipulation of the personality within the physical universe.Its most effective method of procedure however is to form the problem concisely, and then to feed it to the subconscious before the personality enters the dreaming state.这些资料就象电脑一样，只要有需要，随时随地立刻唾手可得。自我的确配备好来处理物质实相，其目的就是在物质宇宙之内操纵人格。不过，最有效的运作方式就是提出简要的问题，然后在人格进入梦境之前，先丢给潜意识。
This requires on the egos part an excellent ability to perceive correctly the elements of the physical situation, to express it in terms that the subconscious can understand, and to deliver the message properly.The subconscious will then break the physical data given to it down into its psychic components, translate it into symbols; and the inner self, at the request of the subconscious, will then focus all of the energies at its command to deliver the most acceptable solution, taking the entire needs of the whole self into consideration.这部分需要自我具备优异的能力，来正确感知物质情境的要素，以潜意识可以了解的用语表达，并妥善传递讯息。然后潜意识会将接收到的物质资料拆解成心灵成分，再转译成象征符号；接着，在潜意识的要求下，内我会以整个全我的需要为考量，自由支配所有聚集的能量，来传递最可行的解决方案。
The solution therefore may not necessarily be accepted completely as the best solution by the ego. The ego is aware of the physical situation only in its relationship to itself. It is not aware of the internal situation.The solution however must be made in relation to the total conditions.It is extremely important then that the ego correctly interprets the physical situation, for this is the information that it will give to the computer, so to speak.因此，自我不见得会认定这个解决方法是最佳方案，自我只了解与自己有关的物质情境，不了解内在的情况。毕竟，解决方案必须考量到整体状况。所以，自我必须能正确诠释物质情境，这极其重要，因为我们可以说，这就是自我要给电脑的讯息。
You may take a break or you may end the session.你们可以休息一下或结束这节课。
(“We’ll take a short break then.”(“那我们稍微休息一下吧。”
(Break at 10:26. Jane was well dissociated. It was one of those instances, she said, where she was “totally involved” with the material she was delivering. She felt as though she was inside the material.Her eyes had been open most of the time, and she had been quite restless. Her pace had been fast.(10:26分休息，珍的出离状况很好，她说这次“完全融入”传递的资料当中，觉得自己仿佛就在资料里面。双眼大部分时间都张开，一直坐立难安，传述速度很快。

Nor had I given her the test envelope.I had discovered that I was reluctant to break into the material when it was going so well, and when Jane gave such an indication of involvement with it. I thought it might introduce an alien note, and also that it might interfere with the results of the test itself(休息的时候珍说，赛斯还没有讨论到我在前面提到的内在心象问题，我也还没有把测试信封交给她。我发现刚才资料传得这么顺畅，而且珍自己也提及如此投入资料，所以实在不忍心打断，要是我这么做，或许会带入新主题，而且也可能会妨碍到测试本身的结果。
(I did not mention the envelope, and in view of the late hour decided to forget about it for this evening, Jane began speaking while sitting cross-legged on the bed.Her eyes opened again shortly after she began. She was smoking, and her voice was quiet and fast.Resume at 10:33.)(我没有提到这个信封，而且考量到时间不早了，决定今晚的测试先作罢。珍盘腿坐在床上开始讲话，开始后不久，她的双眼又张开，抽着烟，声音温和而快速。10:33分继续口述。)
I have several points to make here.这里我要指出几个要点。
We cannot cover everything I had in mind for this evening, or this session would run well over its ordinary allotted time.今晚我们无法全部涵盖我想讲的内容，否则这节课就会比平常预定的时间超出许多。
To follow the above material, let us emphasize the importance here of a clear, honest, perceptive intellect, for it is largely upon the intellect that the ego depends. The intellect collects from the physical environment those situations and conditions which affect, or will affect, the ego.延续上面的资料，我们就来强调一下清醒、真诚和敏锐的理性，在这里扮演的重要性，因为理性是自我相当依赖的一部分，理性会从物质环境中，收集那些正在影响或将会影响自我的情境与状况。
The intellect chooses from the total physical situation those elements with which the personality will ultimately have to deal.The intellect is discriminating and selective. An ego that is overly rigid will inhibit the intellect from perceiving various portions of physical reality, and therefore distort the appearance of reality, limiting the intellect’s abilities.理性会从整体物质情境中，选择出人格终究必须处理的那些因素。理性具有辨别力和选择性，过度僵化的自我，就会禁止理性去感知物质实相中各种不同的部分，因而扭曲了实相的样貌，限制了理性的能力。
Necessary and vital information is therefore not collected. The problem is not seen in any total light, but in a distorted manner.This distorted picture is then delivered to the subconscious, which is able to make some corrections.It still cannot view the physical situation as clearly as can the ego under best conditions.于是便无法收集到必要且关键的讯息，只能以扭曲的方式，而无法以任何完整的角度看清楚问题。这种遭扭曲的画面就会传送到潜意识，不过潜意识还是可以做一些修正。潜意识在看待物质情境时，仍然无法像自我在最佳的情况下时，看得那么清楚。
When the ego is of such a rigid nature that it distorts physical reality out of all context, then however the personality had better rely upon the subconscious even in this respect, for the subconscious will at least perceive those elements of physical reality that immediately threaten the whole self.如果自我的本性这么僵化，导致它扭曲了整体脉络下的物质实相，那么这个人格在这方面最好就要仰赖潜意识，因为潜意识至少能感知到那些立刻会威胁到全我的物质实相元素。
This material this evening will be extremely useful and practical to you both.We will discuss it more thoroughly in another session.今晚的资料对你们俩极有帮助，也极为实际。我们会在另一节课更彻底讨论这部分。
(Jane closed her eyes and smiled.)(珍闭上眼睛微笑着。)
A very brief word here concerning your Mark.Putting up with him will not seem a chore if you realize that psychic energy is not only being used when you do so, but within reason, when you do so unresentfully, you are gaining psychic energies through interactions.关于你的朋友马克，我有简单几句话要说。如果你能明白，你对他容忍时不只是用到心灵能量，而且是在合理的范围内，那么容忍他似乎不会是件苦差事。要是你心平气和地容忍他，就会透过互动获得心灵能量。
(Mark is Bill Macdonnel’s entity name.)(马克是比尔·麦唐纳的存有名字。)
The very act of dealing with him kindly utilizes your own abilities in many ways, stretches the limitations of your sympathy and understanding, and of your patience, yes; but in so doing you become stronger and better able to deal with your fellow human beings in general, with benefits to all.以和善的态度与他打交道，这个举动本身就能让你在许多方面运用自己的能力，扩大你的同情心、体贴及耐心；在这么做的同时，你会变得更强大，更能与你们人类伙伴相处，对大家都有好处。
I am not speaking of overdoing this, as you understand.There is an analogy here, perhaps not flattering to Mark, but I do not mean it unkindly.如你们所知的，我不是说要做得太过分。打个比方，或许不用太奉承马克，但我的意思也不是要你不近人情。
Are your hands tired?你的手会酸吗？
(Jane looked at me. The pace had been rather fast.(珍看着我，她的节奏一直都很快。
(“No.”)(“不会。”)
You recall that I told you animals relied upon the psychic energy of their owners.So do weaker personalities to some extent rely upon stronger ones.Now this could result in a draining of available energies, but when this occurs it is only because you are not as strong as usual.When energy is withdrawn for this reason, the individual who is used to relying upon it will feel bewildered and resentful, and abandoned without knowing the reason.你们回想一下，我告诉过你们，动物会依赖主人的心灵能量。同样地，较脆弱的人格或多或少也会依赖较强壮的人格。现在，这种情形会导致可用能量的耗竭，不过如果发生这种现象，纯粹是因为你不像平常那么强壮。一旦能量因此被抽走，那么这个惯于依赖能量的人会感到困惑、不平、被抛弃，但却不知道缘由。
The use of energy in such a way does not however, and should not, ordinarily drain you.To the contrary, again within reason, it should invigorate you, allow you to draw upon additional energy, and give you practical experience in doing so.不过，以这种方式利用能量，通常不会、也不应该让你的能量枯竭。相反地，只要是在合理的范围内，应该会让你精神大振，汲取更多能量，也会给你实际的经验。
