I say to you within reason, but if your abilities were fully developed I would not have to use that phrase, for you would be so renewed in any encounter that no such question would arise.我跟你说在合理的范围内，可是如果你的能力已经完全发展，那我就没有必要说那句话，在能力完全发展的情况下，不管你遇到任何人，能量都可以得到更新，当然就没有这样的问题。
The you does not necessarily apply to you, Joseph.约瑟，我这里说的你，不见得是在指你。
I will give you a few sentences concerning your vision.Or you may take a break, or I will save it for the beginning of our next session.有关你看到的内在心象，我有几句话要说。你可以休息一下，或者也可以等到下一节课我再跟你说。
(“You can continue.”(“你可以继续说。”
(See my notes on page 223.)(见我前面的注释。)
The man was an acquaintance of yours in a life many centuries ago. He no longer experiences earthly or physical existence.I know of him. I do not know him.He was a teacher, and is one now.He was a relative when Ruburt was Seth.He knows of our relationship, and was curious.这个男子是你在几世纪以前的某一世所认识的熟人，他不再经验地球上或物质上的存在。我知道这个人，但我不认识他。他之前是教师，现在也是。鲁柏是赛斯时，他是鲁柏的亲戚。他知道我们的关系，对此感到好奇。
(The very first sessions dealt a good deal with reincarnation.Jane and me did not ask for this kind of data; it just came that way through the Ouija board and we accepted it at face value.Frank Watts, it will be remembered, was our communicator; the present Seth entity did not announce his presence until the 4th session, when he superseded Frank Watts.(最早的那几节课，对轮回转世的主题讨论相当多。我和珍并没有要求这种资料；这些资料经由灵应盘传过来，我们就信以为真。当时与我们对话的是法兰克·沃兹；现在这个赛斯存有一直到第4节才宣布自己的存在，接替了法兰克·沃兹。
(In the 3rd session, December 6,1963, Frank Watts told Jane and me that we had lived lives in Mesopotamia, our first, in the 4th century BC.Frank Watts and I were females, Jane was a male, our brother, and his name was Seth.(在1963年12月6日的第3节中，法兰克·沃兹告诉我和珍，我们公元前4世纪时曾出生在美索不达米亚[Mesopotmia][译注：第一册第3节出现的地名为Mesopania，译为莫索帕尼亚]，那是我们的第一世。我和法兰克·沃兹都是女性，珍是男性，是我们的兄弟，名叫赛斯。
(In the 54th session Seth went into considerable detail in explaining the construction of entities.He could not give us this information earlier, he said, because we would have leaped to the conclusion that he was Ruburt’s [Janes] subconscious mind; this is not so.As everything else does, entities constantly change.To quote Seth: “Ruburt is not myself now, in his present life; he is nevertheless an extension and materialization of the Seth that I was at one time...He grew, evolved and expanded in terms of a particular, personal set of value fulfillments... He is now an actual gestalt, a personality that was one of the probable personalities into which Seth could grow. I represent another, I am another.”(第54节中，赛斯详细解释了存有的建构。他说不能太早给我们这部分的讯息，因为我们会直接下结论说他就是鲁柏[珍]的潜意识心；而这并非如此。存有就像万事万物一样，时时刻刻都在变化。摘录赛斯的一段话：“鲁柏现在不是我自己，在他的这一世；然而他是我曾经所是的那个赛斯的一个延伸和物质化……就个人特有的一组价值完成而言，他成长、进化也扩展了……他现在是一个真实的完形，一个赛斯可以长成的可能人格之一，我代表另一个，我是另一个。”
(Seth then continued to explain how I am also an offshoot of that early Seth entity.Thus Jane, myself, and our present communicator, Seth, are related psychically; it is this that makes our sessions possible, according to Seth.)(赛斯接着继续解释我也是早期那个赛斯存有一个分支。因此，珍、我自己，还有我们现在的交谈对象赛斯，在心灵上相连；根据赛斯所说，就是因为如此，才可能有我们的赛斯课。)
I will now end an excellent, rather lengthy session.I do suggest that you study this material carefully this evening.我现在就要结束这节课，虽然有点冗长，但相当棒。我真的建议你们今晚仔细探讨这些资料。
Do you have no tests for me?你不是要测试我吗？
(Jane, still sitting cross-legged on the bed, smiled and learned forward.Her request caught me by surprise, and it took me a few moments to fish the test envelope out of its hiding place and lay it on the bed before her.It was 10:58; I thought it much too late for a test.)(珍面露微笑，仍盘腿坐在床上，身子往前倾。她这一要求着实让我感到惊讶，我花了一些时间从藏匿地方找出那个测试信封，然后把它放在她面前的床上。这时是10:58分；我觉得要做测试真的是太晚了。)
You must give me a moment.你得给我一些时间。
("Yes.”(“好。”
(She picked up the envelope, fingered it lightly without bending it, and waved it at me briefly.Her eyes were still closed.)(她捡起信封，手指轻轻拨弄着，但并没有折弯，然后对我挥了几下。仍然闭着双眼。)
I have the following impressions, that are somehow connected with what we have here.我得到以下的印象，不知怎地与我们这里的东西有点相关。
The number five, and several buildings.Much space.Something to do with two people, and a yard.Wind, and blue, perhaps a dress.有数字5，几栋建筑。好大的空间。跟两个人和一个庭院有关。风、蓝色，或是一件衣服。
I would here like to make a suggestion, that tests be given to Ruburt fairly close to the middle of a session, rather than at the beginning or end.我这里倒是想提个建议，这些测试可以尽量安排在接近课的中间给鲁柏，而不要在刚开始或快结束的时候。
I also get the impression of a string, of what I do not know.Did I mention the number five?我也得到一连串不知道是什么东西的印象。我提过数字5了吗？
("Yes.”)(“没错。”)
Perhaps 1965, and a road.I will now end the session.也许是1965年，还有一条路。我现在要结束这节课了。
(Jane laid the envelope down.Her eyes were still closed.(珍放下信封。眼睛仍然闭着。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:02.Jane was dissociated as usual. She said that as I fumbled around trying to find the test envelope, she was forced to wait.During this period she spoke to Seth: “Okay, I’m staying in the background, so you can come through loud and clear, ” or words to this effect.(11:02分结束。珍的出离状况如常，她说我在到处乱摸找那个测试信封时，她不得不等待。在这段时间，她对赛斯说：“好，我现在已经退居幕后了，你可以大声、清楚地穿透过来”或类似这个意思的话。
(When she opened the test envelope to see a clipping of a section of a calendar page, containing numbers and a few spots of red and yellow, Jane was quite disappointed.Her reaction was similar to my own as I listened to her recitation of the test data.A very interesting fact now dawned on both of us when we looked at the back of the clipping; for here we found most of the data Seth had given was quite correct.(珍打开了测试信封，看到一小张的月历，上面有数字和一些红色和黄色的斑点，觉得失望透了。她的反应跟我自己在听她叙述测试资料内容时的反应一样。等看到月历背面，一件非常有趣的事让我们两人恍然大悟；因为这时我们发现赛斯给的资料大部分都相当正确。
(In making up the test, I had unwittingly focused my conscious attention on the calendar side of the paper.This was the first time I had used a test object containing material on both sides of the paper.The makeup of this particular calendar consisted of the days of the month on one side, and a drawing in color on the other.(我在准备这个测试时，不知不觉将意识的焦点集中在月历那一面。这是我第一次使用两面都有内容的纸张做测试。这张月历的正面是这个月的日期，背面则是一幅色彩图画。
(The test paper was folded once. The number five was on the calendar side, in the upper center.Directly back of the number, on the other side of the paper, were two buildings, one an erected house, with just above it a floor plan of another.There was a yard, and trees, and a blue simulation of blueprint paper in back of the floor plan.(这个测试纸张对折过一次，数字5在月历那一面，就在上面的中间位置。在数字的正背面，也就是纸张的另一面，是两栋建筑物，一栋是矗立的房子，在它上面则是另一栋房子的楼层平面图。楼层平面图后面则是一个庭院、树木、和蓝色的模拟设计图。
(Returning to the outside, calendar side of the test paper, there were several strings of numbers.The calendar month was April 1965, although the year date doesn’t show.Returning to the other side of the paper, we see that a road leads up to the garage attached to the drawing of the erected house.(回到测试纸的正面，也就是月历那一面，则有几串数字。月历的月份是1965年4月，不过并没有看到年份。再回到纸张背面，我们看到一条路通往车库，这个车库附属于那栋矗立的房子。
(Thus it seems that Seth traveled through the thickness of the paper, picking up impressions as he went along, and did this at least twice.He also mentioned “two people...perhaps a dress.”There were no people on either side of the test paper.Checking the whole calendar however, we noted there was a drawing of a man and a woman on the upper section of this particular page, but that I had left them behind in clipping out the test section. They would be about four inches removed from the clipping, and stood before another drawing of a house.We do not know if this is a legitimate interpretation of something “somehow connected with what we have here. ”(因此，赛斯好像穿越了纸张的厚度，在穿越的同时也获得印象，这个动作至少做两次。他还提到“两个人……或许是一件衣服”。可是测试纸张两面都没有人。不过后来我们去检视整张月历时，发现在这一面比较上面的地方，有一男一女的图画，只是我在剪下测试纸张时，没有将这两人剪进来，他们离这张剪纸大约4寸的距离，两人就站在图画中另一栋房子前面。我不知道这样是否就可以合理解释“……不知怎地与我们这里的东西有点相关”。
(Wind is an intangible, and is not overtly indicated in the drawing.These are a draftsman’s drawings, quite precise in detail.The background material is rather freely and loosely brushed in, so that a breezy and modern effect is indicated.We do not know if this effect prompted Seth’s mention of wind.The effect of the drawing was one of “much space. ”(至于风的部分就很难理解，因为图画中看来并不明显。这些图画出自于一位素描画家的手笔，相当细致详实。背景内容的笔法非常自由、洒脱，因此呈现出活泼与现代化的风貌。我们不知道是不是因为这样的效果，才让赛斯提到了风。从画中可以看出“好大的空间”这样的效果。
(Jane said she had not expected any test, and so did not feel nervous about anything forthcoming.(珍说并没有料到会有测试，所以也不会为即将到来的任何事情感到紧张。
(Also, the calendar is from a building-supply company: “Lumber. Hardware. Paint. Masonry. Supplies. Roofing.”)(另外，这份月历是来自一家建材公司，上面写着：“木材、五金、油漆、砖石、材料供应、屋顶材料。”)

SESSION 184 第184节　临时课　信封4


SEPTEMBER 3, 1965 10:30 PM FRIDAY UNSCHEDULED1965年9月3日　星期五 晚上10:30 临时课
PART ONE第一部分
(Tonight’s unscheduled session is arbitrarily divided into two parts in order to present the envelope test data first.I have verbatim notes on this; I asked Seth to speak slowly enough for notes on the test and he agreed.The rest of the session material is presented in summary form in Part Two.(为了先呈现信封测试的资料，我就随意将今晚的临时课分成两部分。这一部分我做了逐字的注释说明；我请求赛斯慢慢讲，好让我可以写下这些注解，他也答应了。这节课的其余资料就以摘要的方式呈现在第二部分。
(Jane, her ESP book finished and mailed, has some free time for a change.She has copied the 179th, 180th and 183rd sessions to send to Dr. Instream. She also plans to write him a letter.As it developed, she will be copying Part One of this session to send to Dr. Instream also, for even though the session was unscheduled an envelope test developed.Once again parts of the test results were unexpected.The whole test was very interesting; and all the more so because it was Jane’s first before witnesses.(珍完成了ESP书，也已寄出，因此就有一些自由时间可以换换口味。她将第179、180和183节课的复本寄给了殷斯翠姆博士，也打算写封信给他。等这节课完成后，她还会复印第一部分给殷斯翠姆博士，因为即便这节是临时课，但还是包括了信封测试。这些测试结果的其中有些部分一样超乎预期。整个测试非常有趣；由于这是珍第一次在见证人面前做测试，所以更饶富趣味。
(Our regularly scheduled session for last Wednesday, September 1, was not held because Jane and I had unexpected visitors.A few details here are of interest because the visitors became entangled with the test results mentioned above.(我们9月1日星期三的定期课并没有举行，因为我和珍临时有访客。由于他们一直绕着上面提的测试结果不放，所以这里有些细节值得一提。
(Actually the young couple calling on us live in a downstairs apartment.They have been married about a month. Both of them work at my place of employment, Artistic Card Co., in Elmira.I secured the apartment for them when a vacancy developed just before their marriage.The young lady works with me in the art department. Her husband is a salesman who travels at irregular intervals, but quite often.(事实上来访的这对年轻夫妻就住在我们公寓楼下。他们结婚大概一个月，两人都在我上班的地方工作，也就是埃尔迈拉的艺术卡片公司[ Artistic Card Co]。他们结婚前恰好这间房子空着，我就帮他们弄到手。那位年轻太太跟我在艺术部门一起工作，老公是业务员，会不定期出差，次数非常频繁。
(Our friends in question do not know about the sessions.They visited us at 8:30 PM Wednesday, and before Jane and I realized it session time had come.We like our new neighbors a good deal and did not resent their calling, but we did dislike missing the session.They left us at about 10:30.Jane and I did not consider having a session then; I also thought Jane could use the break in routine.(我们这两位朋友对这个课并不了解。他们星期三晚上8点半来访，等到我和珍发现时，上课时间已经到了。我们非常喜欢这两位新邻居，并不会抱怨他们来访，可是我们也不想停课。他们10:30离开，这时我和珍就不考虑上课了；我也认为珍可以按照惯例休息一下。
(I had prepared the usual test envelope that Wednesday afternoon while Jane was napping, as she usually does on session days.When the session did not materialize I saved the envelope for the next session, which I thought would be on Monday, September 6.(由于星期三晚上要上课，所以珍习惯先睡个午觉，那天下午也不例外，我就趁那个时候备妥平常的测试信封袋。结果当天没有上课，于是我便把信封留到下次上课使用，我原本认为是9月6日星期一。
(The double envelope contained a simple line drawing I executed in black ink on ordinary white paper. It was folded once.I chose this subject matter in an effort to see how Seth would handle more abstract subjects.The drawing is reproduced on page 232; it is a pen tracing made from the original on a light table.(这个双层信封里放了一张线条简单的图画，是我用黑色墨水在一般白纸上画出来的，对折一次。我之所以选择这个题材，主要的用意是想看看赛斯会怎么处理较为抽象的东西。我在前面复制这张图；那是在描图桌上用笔将原稿描绘下来的。
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher, who have witnessed several sessions, visited us this evening, Friday, September 3.Our conversation touched upon many subjects. They read the 183rd session, dealing with Jane’s third envelope test.No session had been planned for this evening but as the four of us sat around our coffee table Seth came through at about 10:30 PM.(已见证过几次课的比尔和蓓∙加拉格夫妇，今晚9月3日星期五又前来拜访。我们的对话触及许多主题，他们看了第183节的资料，内容提到珍第三次信封测试。今晚原本没打算要上课，可是当我们4人围坐在咖啡桌旁，赛斯透过来，时间是晚上10:30左右。
(Seth told us that he merely wanted to join in the general conversation, as he had during the unscheduled 182nd session last weekend, which the Gallaghers also witnessed.Seth requested that we continue our exchange without notes on my part and without weighty questions.Jane’s eyes were closed in the beginning, her voice average in volume. She was nevertheless quite active in her chair.After perhaps half an hour her eyes opened. They were very dark. She smoked as she talked with us, and at times got to her feet as Seth.This last is something she has not done for many sessions.(赛斯告诉我们，他只是想加入我们闲话家常，就像上周末第182节的临时课一样，当时加拉格夫妇也在场见证。赛斯要求我们继续交谈，我不用做笔记，也不要讨论重要问题。珍刚开始时闭着双眼，音量适中，不过她坐在椅子上相当活跃。大概过了半小时后，她张开眼睛，双眼非常乌黑，抽着烟跟我们讲话，有时候还以赛斯身分站了起来。她最后的这种动作，已经好多节课没出现过了。
(Much was said before the envelope test developed, and this is summarized in Part Two.At about 11:50 PM Seth surprised me by asking if I had a test prepared. I replied that I had and went back to my studio to get the envelope I had readied for last Wednesdays session, and my pen and notebook.Jane, as Seth, sat quietly talking with the Gallaghers while I was gone; I wondered if the enforced delay would give her time to become nervous.(信封测试还没开始前，赛斯说了很多话，这部分的摘要放在第二部分。晚上11:50分左右，赛斯突然问我是否准备了信封测试，我吓一大跳，回答说有，然后就到工作室拿出原本为星期三上课准备的信封，以及笔和笔记本。我离开期间，身为赛斯的珍坐着小声与加拉格夫妇讲话；我怀疑这段不得不出现的空档，是否让她的心情变紧张。
(Normal lights were on in the living room where we had gathered. Jane took the double envelope.She held it without making any obvious attempts to guess at its contents by feeling.She sat with her eyes closed now and her head down somewhat as she faced the three of us. She did not appear to be nervous, and her voice remained average.Pauses will be indicated. The first paragraph that follows consists of the excerpts I noted down.Begin at approximately 11:51 PM.)(我们聚在客厅，灯光正常开着，珍拿着双层信封。她手持信封，却一点儿也看不出来想用感觉猜猜看里面的东西。这时她闭着眼睛，面对我们3个人而坐，头微微低着，看起来并不紧张，声音也正常。暂停时我会注明，下面第一段是我记录下来的摘要。大约晚上11:51分开始。)
We will go slowly with this, Joseph... The first test in the presence of witnesses... We are not bothered by light... We will be silent for a moment however.约瑟，这一部分我们会慢慢来……第一次在见证人面前做测试……灯光不会干扰我们……不过我们会沉默一会儿。
(Jane paused.The following material is verbatim until otherwise noted.)(珍停顿下来。以下资料都是逐字稿，除非我另外注明。)
These are impressions of what it is I hold.我对于手上拿的东西有一些印象。
I have the impression of the number 3 or 7, or perhaps 3 and 7, (pause) and of a road, and something spectacular.我有个印象是数字3或7，要不然就是3和7(停顿)，一条路，还有某个很壮观的东西。
I am aware of course of the double envelope.(Pause.) Something 10 times, and a familiar location.A spread of sorts, as perhaps of a spread of grass.我当然知道这是双层信封(停顿)。10样某种东西，熟悉的地点。一大片某类的东西，也许是一大片草地。
An unpleasant circumstance occurred before or after, in which a woman was involved.The color gray, and a multiplicity of design. (Pause.)前后发生了不愉快的状况，牵涉到一名女子。灰灰的颜色，还有多样化的图案(停顿)。
Perhaps crisscross shapes, and a sign.可能是纵横交错的形状，还有一个签名。
I will now suggest a break.我建议休息一下。
(Break at midnight. Janes eyes now opened. She had been dissociated as usual.She asked me to open the test envelope. She said she had no idea whether the information given was correct.(午夜时休息，这时珍张开眼睛，出离状况如常。她请我打开测试信封，说她不知道给的讯息对不对。
(In the first test, given in the 179th session, I had found myself mystified over part of the data.Now, the four of us found ourselves puzzling over the first part of tonight’s test data.As will be seen however most of it is connected with the test object.We are learning that our confusion stems from the unexpected and sometimes far- reaching turns that such connections can take.(在第179节的第一次测试中，我发现自己对于其中部分资料感到迷惑不解。现在，我们4个人对于今晚第一部分的测试资料也觉得难以理解。不过，就如我们即将看到的，大部分的测试资料跟测试的物品有关。我们知道，我们的困惑来自于这类的连结出乎意料之外，而且有时候也太过牵强。)
(Jane herself made the possible connection that the “...unpleasant circumstance... in which a woman was involved, ’’could be entangled with the day I made the drawing; this being last Wednesday, when we missed our regular session became of visitors.See my notes on page 233.Seth’s information following this statement connected itself with the drawing easily enough, even to the “color gray, ” which arises from the shadow effect I achieved in the drawing by using closely-spaced parallel lines.(珍自己就做了这样可能的连结：“……不愉快的状况，牵涉到一位女子。”与我画这张图的日期有关系；那天就是这个星期三，我们因为客人来访而停上定期课。见我前面的说明。这句话之后，赛斯所给的讯息就与这张图画相当容易连结，甚至与“灰灰的颜色”也是，那是我在画中使用密集的平行线条产生的阴影效果。
(Bill Gallagher pointed out that my name and date on the drawing, besides being a “sign, ’’also contained a combination of 10 letters and numbers, as “something 10 times.” We do not know what to make of such interpretations.(比尔∙加拉格指出，我图里面的姓名和日期，除了是一种“签名”以外，也是10个字母与数字的组合，就如“10样某种东西”。我们不知道怎么做这类的诠释。
(Seth came through again at 12:10 AM, as we were discussing possible distortions of the test data.Once more Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet but faster than before, so the following short account consists of the excerpts I noted down.Resume at 12:10 AM.)(赛斯12:10分再透过来，那时候我们正在讨论测试资料可能会有什么扭曲。珍又闭着眼睛坐着说话，声音轻柔，但速度比之前快，所以下面的简短说明就是我摘录的笔记。凌晨12:10分继续。)
Once again there was some confusion of channels... as there was in our first test when we were alone... But tonight we succeeded in getting Ruburt painlessly across that first-test-before-witnesses barrier...And it was a barrier to him. Such tests are very good training for him... He needs it... It is a beginning.对于管道再度有些疑惑……就如我们第一次测试一样，那时候只有我们……可是今晚我们让鲁柏轻易超越了“在见证人面前首度测试”的障碍……对他而言那是个障碍。这样子的测试对他来说是非常好的训练……他需要这样……这只是开始而已。
We held many sessions before we tried such tests... while we waited for Ruburt’s confidence and abilities to develop... They are still growing. They need even more developing, and they shall be.在我们做这类测试时，已经先举行过很多次课……那段期间我们一方面在等鲁柏的信心与能力发展……它们仍然在成长，它们需要、也将会有更多的发展。
(End at 12:12.Jane was dissociated as usual.(12:12分结束。珍的出离状况一如往常。
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher now left. I thought the session had ended, but as Jane and I sat talking Seth came through once more.The following material still concerns tonight’s test, and is verbatim because once again I asked Seth to speak slowly.Jane’s eyes were closed in the beginning, her voice quiet.Resume at 12:20.)(比尔和蓓∙加拉格这时候离开，我原以为这节课结束了，可是当我和珍坐着讲话时，赛斯又再度透过来。下面资料依然跟今晚的信封测试有关，因为我又要求赛斯慢慢讲，所以是逐字稿。刚开始时珍闭着眼睛，声音轻柔。12:20分继续。)
We were not selective enough. We will have to learn to be more selective.我们斟酌得不够仔细，我们得学着更仔细斟酌。
The road referred to your neighbor, the male, who is a salesman, and who travels on the road often.It was he and his wife who were referred to here in the unpleasant episode.This was associated with the test because the session for which you prepared the test was not held because of their visit.那条路指的是你邻居，那个做业务的男子，他经常奔波于出差的路途上。不愉快事件这里指的就是他和他老婆。这件事跟这次测试有关，因为你原先准备用来测试的那节课，由于他们的到访而取消。
(Jane paused, then opened her eyes.She lit a cigarette.)(珍暂停下来，打开双眼，点根烟。)
I did not realize that this would not help you, that this information would not help you here. This was not Ruburt’s distortion, but my own misunderstanding.我不晓得刚才这个讯息没帮到你的忙，这并不是鲁柏的扭曲，而是我自己的误解。
The 3 and 7 referred to a visual image, not too clear, of 7 designs, separated somewhat from 3 other designs.The road was a distortion, but only superficially, for it was meant as a symbol to describe the man involved, and I could not get Ruburt to say salesman.It was a misunderstanding actually, rather than a distortion.3和7指的是一种7个图案的视觉形象，不是很清楚，它与其他3个图案有点分隔开来。路是一种扭曲，但只是表面上而已，因为它是用来描述那个男子的一种象征，我无法让鲁柏说出业务员。事实上这是一种误解，而不是扭曲。
I could not get the meaning clearer to Ruburt, but he did not distort the meaning.He came as close as he could under the circumstances.是我没让鲁柏更清楚了解这个意思，他并没有把意思扭曲掉。在那些情况下，他已经尽量贴近原意了。
(“Thank you, Seth.”(“谢谢你，赛斯。”
(End at 12:25.Jane was dissociated as usual. She had no visual images that she was aware of, she said, while giving the original test data.As far as she knew she had let Seth through without thinking about anything herself Again, see my notes on page 233.It appears that many impressions can attach themselves to such a simple thing as a small pen drawing.(12:25分结束。珍的出离状况如常，她说，在提出原始测试资料时，并没有意识到视觉形象。就她所知，她让赛斯穿透过来时并没有想到自己的任何事情。见前面我的说明。事实上，像一小张铅笔画这么简单的东西，就可以产生许许多多的印象了。
(Referring to the drawing, it can be seen that there is an interlocking group of 7 designs or blocks on the right, and a like group of 3 on the left.My literal mind also notes a single block beneath each of the larger groups, but Seth did not refer to these.We suppose the “familiar location”’ can refer to our own apartment wherein I made the drawing; or perhaps to the apartment house itself, in which our visitors also live.And surely the drawing contains a “multiplicity of designs” and “crisscross shapes”.(至于这张画，可以看见图的右边有7个图案或方块连结成串，左边也有3个连在一起。我原本的想法是注意到这两大群的下方各有一个单独的方块，不过赛斯没提到它们。我们认为“熟悉的地点”指的可能是我们自己的公寓，我就是在里面画这张图的；要不然也可能是指整栋公寓住宅本身，里面也住着我们的访客。这张图无疑地包含了“多样化的图案”和“纵横交错的形状”。
(The drawing can be “a spread of sorts, ” but we see no particular connection with grass, nor with “something spectacular.” I did not think to query Seth about these points as we sat talking near the end of the session.(这张图可以算是“一大片某类的东西”，不过我们看不出跟草地以及“某个很壮观的东西”有什么特别关系。我们坐着闲聊到接近课的尾声，我并没有想再问赛斯这些问题。
(The session ended at 1:10 AM. Through it all Jane had been dissociated as usual. There had been rather frequent breaks.Jane now went to bed, and I began to make notes to supplement what I had already written down.I would like to add here one more piece of information given by Seth, concerning an earlier test, before concluding Part One. This was given after the Gallaghers had left.(这节课于凌晨1:10分结束，整节课从头到尾珍的出离状况都跟平常一样，过程中有相当频繁的休息。珍这时要去睡了，而我则开始对我记录下来的东西做些补充说明。我想在这里加入赛斯在第一部分结束前提供的一些讯息，内容是关于先前的测试，这是加拉格夫妇离开后才给的。
(It will be remembered that in connection with the test photograph used in the 180th session, Seth/Jane stated: “...and a border. I think now of a border of flowers... ” The test photograph has a white border.Seth now informed me that in the 180th session Jane distorted the information about the border of the photo into a border of flowers because of her personal childhood associations.He said Jane has an early memory of a border of flowers around a garden.(还记得在180节课里用的测试照片，赛斯－珍说：“……边框，现在我认为是花坛……”这张测试照片有白色边框。赛斯现在跟我告知，由于珍连结了个人的孩提时期，所以在180节里，就把有关照片边框的讯息扭曲成花坛。他说在珍的早期记忆里，有个花园四周种植花朵当作花坛。
(After tonight’s session Jane said she vaguely remembers a small plot of grass and vegetables, bordered by flowers, maintained by her grandfather in the backyard of her home in Saratoga Springs, NY.This would be quite an early memory for her.She had not made any conscious connection with this memory and the border data given in connection with the second test, however, until Seth mentioned it tonight.)(今晚上完课后，珍说她依稀记得，外公曾利用她纽约撒拉托加温泉市老家后院的一小块地种植草皮和蔬菜，四周就种花把它围绕起来。这个记忆对她来讲非常遥远。不过，直到今晚赛斯提起这件事，她才在意识上将这个记忆与第二次测试的边框相关资料连结在一起。)
PART TWO第二部分
(The following material is a summary of other topics covered in the unscheduled 184th session, witnessed by Bill and Peggy Gallagher.Some of the material was of course obtained while the Gallaghers were present, and was in actuality intermingled with the test data discussed in Part One.Part Two depends on my memory and on Jane’s to some extent, I am fairly certain of it. Material I recall but vaguely is omitted.(接下来的资料是第184节临时课其他话题的摘要，比尔和蓓·加拉格见证了这节课。当然，其中部分的资料是加拉格在场时得到的，事实上也已纳入第一部分讨论的测试资料里。第二部分的资料大多是依据我和珍的记忆，这些都是我相当确定的内容，对于可以记得但印象模糊的资料，就予以删除。
(Almost at the beginning of the session Jane, as Seth, pointed at me and said my head would be clear for the rest of the evening.Hay fever had been bothering me a great deal during the day. Seth said the reason I am bothered more at home than at work, where I feel remarkably good, is that the house dust in the apartment reminds me of house dust at home, and of my mother, when I was a child.(几乎在这节课一开始时，身为赛斯的珍就用手指着我说，今晚接下来的时间我的头脑会很清楚。我白天已经被花粉热折腾够了，赛斯说，我上班时会觉得很好，但在家比上班时更容易受到花粉热所苦，原因是公寓里的灰尘，让我想到小时候家里的灰尘和我妈妈。
(As Seth suggested, it developed that my head was good for the next few hours, and I was more than willing to comply with the suggestion.Seth said I could have information concerning my parents and my hay fever at any time during a regular session, so I could get it all in writing.He said he prefers to deal with blocks of material in this fashion.(情况发展就如赛斯暗示的，我的头在之后的几小时内都很好，我真的是很愿意顺从这个暗示。赛斯说，上定期课时，我随时都可以得到我父母和花粉热的相关讯息，我能够以书面方式得到全部资料。他说，他比较喜欢以这种方式处理一整批的资料。
(Seth told me I have improved in my relations with my parents, even though this is hard to see for me, at times.I am doing all I am capable of for them at the moment. In the future I will expand enough to be able to include them in my awareness without fear of personal threat, which impedes me at the moment.My parents need love as a child needs love, unquestioningly, and this I cannot give at the moment. I should not feel guilty at this.My parents visited my brother Loren for four days during the week of August 29 to September 3. Seth said this was more than an ordinary visit as far as the folks are concerned, in that they were looking for the type of love described above from Loren and his wife also.Loren is 45; I'm 46; Jane 37.(赛斯告诉我，我跟父母的关系有进步，即使对我而言有时候不容易看出来。目前，我正在做所有我可以为他们做的，未来我会扩展到足以让自己的意识能够涵盖到他们，而不会对个人的威胁感到恐慌，这种恐慌现今还是会妨碍到我。我父母需要爱，就像小孩需要爱一样，这一点无庸置疑，而这份爱目前我还是无法给出去，对于这部分我不该有罪恶感。我父母在8月29日到9月3日那一周拜访我弟弟洛伦，赛斯说，对老人家来说，这并不只是一般拜访，因为他们也寄望洛伦和他太太能给出上述的那种爱。洛伦今年45岁；我46岁；珍37岁。
(It would be a great help if I could learn to talk with my parents in a conversational way, about inconsequential things.(如果我能学会以闲话家常的方式跟父母聊些日常琐事，应该会很有帮助。
(In this summary I give all the information I can recall on a particular subject at the same time, for conveniences sake, although it may have been scattered throughout the session.Thus some of the above material was given to me after the Gallaghers had left.(在这些摘要中，为了方便起见，我会以一个特定的主题为单位，将所有我能回想起来的资料同时呈现出来，虽然这些资料实际上可能在这节课的不同地方。因此，上面有些资料是加拉格夫妇离开后我才得到的。
(Seth deplored our ideas on war and peace, which must improve if we are to survive.This led into a discussion about computers, and Bill Gallagher's personal idea of studying up on them for future use in business.Seth said computers would transform human life.He said Bill’s personal ideas were good ones; the inherent danger with them had to do with the type of salesmans personality, the feeling of superiority and of having power over others, that might color the use of computers.He told Bill that it would require strict discipline on his part if he worked with computers in such a fashion.(赛斯对于我们战争与和平的观念感到遗憾，如果我们要活下去，就必须改变观念。这个话题后来延伸出对电脑的讨论，比尔就未来电脑在商业上的运用加以研究，提出了个人的看法。赛斯说，电脑会改变人类的生活，他说比尔的一些个人观念非常好；但这些观念潜在的危险，在于业务员的人格形态、优越感以及对他人握有权力，这会影响到电脑的使用。他告诉比尔，如果他以这样的方式将电脑运用在工作上，那他就得经过严格的训练。
(After the Gallaghers had left Seth told me Bill Gallagher had “great bursts’’ of energy.Bill and Peggy, he said, were very good for us and the sessions, in that they contributed.I do not recall more on this particular point.Seth told Bill that if he follows the material given on the construction of matter and suggestion, and applies it, he can be rid of his ulcer within a year.It will require discipline. Bill should read the material because the intellectual integrity behind it will appeal to him. Then he will understand how he creates his own ulcer.(加拉格夫妇离开后，赛斯跟我说比尔·加拉格的能量已经“大爆发”。他说，比尔和蓓的贡献很多，对我们和赛斯课都非常有帮助。对于这一点，我就只记得这样而已。赛斯告诉比尔，如果他能遵照之前给的物质建构与暗示的相关资料，加以实际应用，就能在一年内摆脱掉溃疡。这需要训练，比尔应该读读资料，因为资料背后兼具道德与智慧，将会吸引他，接着他就会明白是怎么创造出自己的溃疡。
(Seth told Bill he didn’t seem to have enough time in the day because he had the common habit of chopping time up into segments of minutes.A conception of time close to psychological time would give Bill enough time to do all he wants to do.(赛斯跟比尔说，因为他习惯把时间切碎，以分钟为单位来计算，所以白天的时间好像永远都不够用。而类似心理时间的时间概念，会让比尔有足够的时间来做他想做的所有事。
(In the beginning of the session Seth asked us to continue as we had been; he wanted the convivial party air.When we fell silent, or adopted the usual more formal session air, he demanded to know what had happened to all the jokes.On one occasion his voice began to climb in strength and volume, half jokingly.Bill and I implored him to keep the voice under control.For the most part however the conversation moved along quite easily.(课刚开始时，赛斯要求我们就照原来那样继续交谈下去；他想要有欢乐的派对气氛。我们一陷入沉默，或气氛变成像平常上课时那样正式，他就会征求有没有什么好笑的事。他声音的力度和音量一度曾半开玩笑地开始飙高，我和比尔还拜托他要控制声音。不过大部分对话过程都相当轻松愉快。
(At this time Jane, as Seth, stood up and picked up our cat Willy. Her eyes were open. Her voice was loud also, and Willy immediately squirmed out of her arms and darted away, his ears back.“See, ” Seth/Jane said, “Your pussy doesn’t know who his mistress is right now....” Actually, Seth said, Willy knows him well, having grown used to his appearances.Many many sessions ago Willy had occasionally reacted to Seth’s appearance, usually just before a session began, or at the very beginning itself.(这时身为赛斯的珍抱了我们的猫威立站起来，珍张开眼睛，声音也很大，威立马上就扭动着跳开她的手臂，飞奔而逃，两耳向后。赛斯－珍说：“看吧，你的小猫咪现在不知道他的女主人是谁了……”赛斯说，威立其实跟他很熟，已经习惯他的外貌了。在许多节课以前，威立对赛斯的外貌偶尔会有反应，通常在课开始之前，或是课刚开始之后。
(At one point I remarked to Bill Gallagher that I used to have two favorite questions for Seth: “What do you do between sessions?” and “How’s my old friend Frank Watts?” Seth’s answer to my first question was “What do you do?”He now gave essentially that answer when Peggy asked my old question tonight.Commenting on Frank Watts, the personality Jane and I first contacted on the Ouija board to begin these sessions, Seth told me that there were records in town pertaining to Frank Watts, if we would stir ourselves to look for them.(有一度我跟比尔·加拉格说，我曾问过赛斯两个问题：“没上课时，你在做什么？”以及；“我的老朋友法兰克·沃兹现在如何？”赛斯对第一个问题的回答是：“你都在做些什么？”今晚蓓提出我这个老问题问赛斯时，他基本上也是给相同的答案。至于法兰克·沃兹，也就是我和珍在刚开始上赛斯课时，以灵应盘首度接触到的那个人格，赛斯告诉我说，城里留有一些法兰克·沃兹的记录，我们可以自己去找资料。
(When Peggy asked him if the records pertained to Frank Watts being a teacher, Seth gave an answer I do not recall, except that I am sure it was not a direct yes or no.Frank Watts, Seth did tell us, is doing very well.Seth also said in a quietly humorous way that Frank Watts was still a fathead, as he had told us many sessions ago.In Volume 1, see the 11th session, held on January 1,1964.(当蓓问他这些记录是否跟法兰克·沃兹当老师时有关，赛斯给了个答案，但我想不起来，不过可以确定的是他并非直接回答是或否。赛斯的确告诉我们，法兰克·沃兹现在非常好。赛斯又以相当幽默的口吻说，法兰克·沃兹依然是个傻瓜，就像许多节之前跟我们讲的一样。见第一册，1964年1月1日举行的第11节。
(Seth told me that if possible I should go out dancing as usual with Jane tomorrow night, Saturday, if I felt good enough.As it developed we did not go.(赛斯告诉我，如果可能的话，而且我的状态也够好，明天晚上我应该像平常一样跟珍出去跳舞。不过后来我们没有去。
(A few days ago Peggy Gallagher had brought Jane a copy of the latest Cosmopolitan magazine, and suggested that Jane query them about running some excerpts from her ESP book.In view of Cosmo’s drastically revised format, Jane agreed to try.Naturally we wondered how the ESP subject would be received by a popular magazine, and this gave us a chance to try an experiment that we had discussed before.(几天前，蓓·加拉格带了最近一期的《时尚杂志》[Cosmopolitan magazine]给珍，建议珍去问问看，他们是否愿意从她ESP的书里摘录一些东西刊登在杂志上。珍考量到这份杂志做了很大的改版，答应会试试看。我们自然会怀疑流行杂志是否接受ESP的主题，而这也给了我们一个机会，可以做做之前曾讨论过的一项实验。
(This was simply to determine if Jane herself, as Jane, could ask Seth a question, then go into trance and deliver the answer as Seth.Since Jane had been switching focus often tonight, I suggested that now was as good a time to try the technique as any.With a little urging Jane, a little self-consciously, asked Seth about what kind of a reception such a query would get from the editors at Cosmo, whether they would buy such an article, etc.(这纯粹要看珍是否能以身为珍的自己，问赛斯一个问题后，再出神以赛斯的身分回答问题。因为珍今晚早就频繁切换焦点多次，所以我建议现在是尝试这种技巧的好机会。在些许怂恿下，珍略带自我意识请教赛斯，像是去问《柯梦波丹杂志》的编辑会得到什么回应，他们是否会买下这样的文章等。
(She then closed her eyes, went into trance, and delivered the answer.It was entirely in the affirmative.(接着珍就闭上眼睛，进入出神状态开始传递解答。结果答案全都是肯定的。
(Seth stated that the editors at Cosmo would be interested, and that in answer to Jane’s query which would consist of a chapter from her ESP book plus a letter outlining her ideas on adapting it for the magazine, they would send a letter of interest.Such an article, Seth said, would not be immediately bought by Cosmopolitan, but would eventually.The editors would ask for some changes. In the beginning they would be merely interested. Seth mentioned no time limit concerning the sale.(赛斯说，《柯梦波丹杂志》的编辑会有兴趣。珍在询问时会附上ESP书的其中一章，外加一封信，概略提一下如何修改以符合该杂志的调性，对方会回信表示感兴趣。赛斯说，这样的文章《柯梦波丹杂志》不会马上接受，但终究会买下来。编辑会要求做些修改，刚开始时，他们只会表示感兴趣，至于何时才会达成交易，赛斯并没有提出最后时间表。
(This past week Jane learned the editor of Topper magazine that they had bought a short story of hers, The Mission. She was of course greatly pleased by this news.Seth now told us that Jane would sell more stories out of that batch she had written up before starting the ESP book.It will be remembered that Seth had something to say about Jane’s sales of short stories and books in the 104th session.The predictions given in that session 10 months ago are still working out.See Volume 3.(珍本周得知，《一流杂志》[Topper magazine]的编辑已经买下她的一篇短篇故事〈使命〉[The Mission]，对于这个消息她当然开心极了。赛斯现在又告诉我们，珍开始写ESP书之前所写的那一批故事，还有很多会卖出去。大家应该记得，赛斯在第104节课中，对于珍卖短篇故事和书的事，曾说了一些话。10个月前那节课里的预言此刻仍在应验中。见第三册。
(Seth said the oil sketch I have begun of my vision, described in the notes for the 183rd session, is very good. It is promising to be one of my best pieces of work.(赛斯说，我对自己的内在心象所画的油画素描非常好，这部分在第183节的注记里描述过，它可望成为我的最佳作品之一。
(Yoga exercises are excellent because they teach concentration.Jane, Peggy and I had been trying some earlier in the evening.(瑜伽练习可以让人专注，是一种相当好的运动。我、珍和蓓今晚稍早的时候，试着做了一下。
(Jane, Seth said, needs a rest after finishing her ESP book.Even a day or two of rest will help, in terms of subconscious value fulfillment.The individual must have such rest periodically in one form or another.Sometimes such value fulfillment cannot be really attained for years, Seth told us. At other times it is achieved in a moment or two.(赛斯说，珍完成ESP的书之后需要休息。从潜意识价值完成的观点来看，即便是一、两天的休息也会有所帮助。人一定要有这样定期的休息，不管用哪种方式。赛斯跟我们说，有时候这种价值完成真的无法在几年内达到，而在某些时候可能一下子就达到了。
(Jane is at loose ends now, and quite restless.She will be calmer when she starts her next project.In the meantime she worries, Seth said, about my opinion of her because the money is slow in coming.She also worries about a delay before her next project is accepted, remembering the long delay between her first novel, The Rebellers, and the acceptance of the ESP book—at least a year. I reassured Seth that I am not worried about Jane or her contributions in any way.Seth told me that Jane is pulling her weight psychically in our household, and that money will follow.(珍现在无所适从，相当焦躁不安。下一个计划开始之后，就会沉稳一些。赛斯说，她同时在担心我对她的看法，因为钱会比较晚入账。此外，她还担心下一个计划是否会延误，因为她的第一部小说《反判者》[Rebellers]结束后，至少隔了长达一年的时间，ESP书才终于获得认可，得以着手进行。我跟赛斯保证，我绝对不会担心珍或珍的稿件。赛斯告诉我，珍在心灵上对我们家善尽本分，金钱会随之而来。
(At one time our cat Willy became sick on the rug, and Seth broke from the discussion to enable Jane to take care of Willy.(我们的猫威立身体一度不舒服，躺在地毯上，赛斯暂停讨论，让珍去照顾威立。
(Seth briefly discussed the candle-flame effect mentioned in the 182nd Session, saying the phenomenon was so successful because Jane had no forewarning of it.(赛斯也简短讨论到第182节提过的蜡烛火焰效应，他说因为珍事先毫不知情，所以那次的现象算是圆满成功。
(Seth said in answer to a remark by Bill Gallagher about tattoos, that he himself had never been tattooed.Our friend Mark had, however, in his Denmark existence when he was a sailor.Mark is the entity name for Bill Macdonnel.According to Seth, Jane and I knew Mark in Denmark in the 1600’s.Mark, Seth told us, had a large angel tattooed on his chest as a good luck charm, and believed it to be a protection against storms at sea.(赛斯在回答比尔·加拉格提到有关纹身的问题时说，他自己不曾纹过身。不过，我们的朋友马克在丹麦当水手的那一世就曾经纹过身。马克是比尔·麦唐纳的存有名。根据赛斯所说，我和珍在1600年代在丹麦认识马克。赛斯又跟我们说，马克当时在胸前纹了一个大天使，做为带来好运的护身符，相信自己在海上碰到暴风雨时可以得到保护。
(Seth had some very interesting comments to make when the conversation turned to flying saucers, and the recent rash of reports on such craft in the newspapers.The craft do exist, Seth said, and the action of governments in relation to them leaves much to be desired.I believe he used the word pitiable in this connection.Also, government people cannot bear to admit something they cannot explain.(在聊到飞碟和最近一连串这类飞行器的新闻报导时，赛斯做了一些非常有趣的评论。赛斯说，这种飞行器确实存在，政府在这方面所采取的行动还有很大的改进空间。关于这一点，我记得他使用了令人遗憾的字眼来形容。而且，政府官员无法接受那些他们无法解释的东西。
(Seth said that nevertheless the government had a point when they tried to prevent public panic by denying the existence of such craft.A great danger at this particular time would be that an admission of the saucer’s existence would, strangely enough, serve to unite the far-left and far-right extremist groups in this country.These groups would unite in declaring the craft to be Russian, that they were much advanced over anything we have; this whole furor would create panic, Seth said.In six months such reasoning would not apply, because of impending developments in this country. This would presumably be because of the impending elections, though Seth didn’t say this in so many words.In answer to my question he said Barry Goldwater would not be one of the far-rightists to cause trouble.Nothing was said about the source of the saucers, their inhabitants, etc.(赛斯说，然而当政府试图借由否认这种飞行器的存在，来防止大众恐慌，背后有其道理。那就是如果此时此刻承认飞碟的存在，会出现一个令人不可思议的重大危机，也就是国内极左派和极右派团体将团结起来。这些团体会联合宣称这种飞行器是属于苏联的，他们的东西比我们拥有的任何东西更先进；赛斯说，整个狂乱气氛会引发恐慌。由于国内情势发展未定，因此这种推测在6个月内还不至于发生。这一点虽然赛斯未多做说明，但应该是因为选举情势尚未明朗的关系。在回答我的问题方面，他说，巴里·金水[Barry Goldwater ]并不是惹麻烦的极右派分子。对于飞碟的来源及其居民等问题，赛斯则未提及。
(Bill Gallagher has something of a cold, and Seth gave him instructions for using suggestion upon retiring tonight.If he executed the suggestions properly, Seth told Bill he would wake up tomorrow to find his cold vastly improved.He would not be rid of it overnight, but would be well on the way to disposing of it.(比尔·加拉格好像有点感冒，赛斯教他今晚就寝时给自己下暗示。赛斯告知比尔说，假如他正确执行，明天醒来后就会发现自己的感冒好多了。他虽然不会在一夜之间摆脱感冒，但会很快恢复。
(One disquieting subject arose after the Gallaghers had left, and Jane, Seth and I were talking quietly.Seth surprised me by mentioning our neighbor across the hall, Leonard Yaudes.We have known him for several years but he does not know of the sessions.Seth began by saying that the following information was on the edge of Ruburt’s awareness and that he was not very well focused upon it.It had to do with the possibility of an accident or an unpleasantness for Leonard sometime within the next three months.Seth then mentioned the period from September 15 to October 15, after saying that possibly he could focus a little more intently upon the problem.(加拉格夫妇离开后，珍、赛斯和我在轻声谈话时，出现了令人不安的话题。赛斯提到一位住在我们大厅对面的邻居李奥纳·奥德斯，吓了我一跳。我们认识他好多年了，但他不知道赛斯课。赛斯一开始就说，下面的讯息鲁柏似乎没有很清楚意识到，他并没有非常专注在这上面。这个讯息牵涉到未来3个月内的某时，有个意外或不愉快事件可能会发生在李奥纳身上。赛斯说，他或许可以更专注聚焦在这个问题上，随后就提到日期是在9月15日至10月15日之间。
(Seth said one other person would be involved, but he would not say whether it would be a male or female.(赛斯说，也会涉及另一个人，但他没讲是男性还是女性。
(At first I had thought Seth meant that Jane and I would be involved in the trouble seen for Leonard, but Seth reassured me by saying we would not.It did not involve a disaster for Leonard, he said, nor a crippling accident; he used the word unpleasant often, and did not commit himself beyond this.(起初我认为赛斯指的是，我和珍会牵扯到李奥纳的麻烦问题，可是赛斯跟我打包票说我们不会。他说，李奥纳的事无关乎大灾难，也非重大事件；他大部分是使用不愉快这类的字眼，并没有超出这样的范围。
(Any trouble that developed would be the result of present trends involving Leonard, and at this time these trends were so general it was impossible to pinpoint future events with any certainty.If the present trends were changed, the personality of the future trouble would change also, Jane and I know Leonard fairly well, but actually know little of his inner feelings, his friends, etc. We have no idea of what Seth means by trends.I had become concerned about attempting to warn Leonard in some fashion, but Seth said this could not be done.(任何麻烦问题的发展，都涉及到李奥纳现阶段的动向带来的结果，目前这些动向都毫无异状，所以不可能精确指出未来会发生什么事。如果当下的动向能改变，那么人格未来会发生的问题也会跟着改变。我和珍与李奥纳很熟，但说实在的，对他内在感觉和交友状况等方面的了解却十分有限。我们并不知道赛斯说的动向指的是什么，我急着想用某种方式向李奥纳提出预警，可是赛斯说不能这么做。
(In case of a specific predicted event such a warning could be given, and if heeded could head off trouble.Seth told us that in this case there was nothing we could do.The present trend would have to continue before trouble really was a possibility.Nevertheless Jane and I will be alert on Leonard’s behalf, especially between September 15 and October 15.(万一真会发生某预言事件，那就应该发出这样的预警，如果小心留意，就可以避免事情发生。赛斯告诉我们，这次的情况我们也无能为力。目前只能让动向继续发展下去，再看看事情是否真的可能会发生。不过，我和珍会替李奥纳多加留意，特别是9月15日到10月15日那段期间。
(The session ended at 1:10 AM.Jane had been dissociated as usual while speaking as Seth. Much of the time her eyes had been open.She had smoked many cigarettes. Her voice had usually been quiet, her pace a conversational one, which means that usually it is a little too fast for me to take notes.Jane felt no unusual fatigue at the end of the session.(本节课于凌晨1:10分结束。珍以赛斯身分说话时出离状况如常，双眼大部分时间都开着。她抽了好多根烟，声音一直都很轻柔，速度就如对话一般，意思是说对我做笔记来讲通常是太快了一些。课结束时珍并没感到特别累。)

SESSION 185 第185节　个体疗愈能力 饮食建议　 信封5


SEPTEMBER 6, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年9月6日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(Since today was a holiday, Jane and I had some extra time. We used part of it to copy the 179th, 180th and 183rd sessions, plus Part One of the 184th, to send to Dr. Instream.We also agreed on a letter to him. Jane will mail the material tomorrow.1959年彩色照片正反面描摹图，使用于1965年9月6日第185节第5次信封测试(由于今天是假日，我和珍有一些多余的时间，我们就利用部分时间复印了第179、180和183节，以及184节第一部分的资料，准备寄给殷斯翠姆博士。我们两人也一致同意要写封信给他，珍明天就会把这些资料寄出去。
(Once again I planned an envelope test for the session, should the opportunity arise.I prepared the usual double envelope while Jane was working at the front of the apartment.For the test I used a color photograph of my brother Bill, his wife and two young children, taken in Webster, NY, in 1959.I found the photo accidentally in my files earlier in the day while looking for something else. I knew Jane hadn’t seen it for some time, perhaps years.Bill is 37 years old.(我再度为这节课准备了一个测试信封，以便有机会时可以利用。我趁着珍在房子前面工作，为这节课准备好双层信封。这次测试我用了一张我弟弟比尔、他太太和两个小孩的合照，是1959年在纽约韦伯斯特[Webster]所拍摄。这张照片是我今天稍早找其他东西时偶然间发现的，我知道，珍有一段时间，也许是好几年没看过这张照片了。比尔今年37岁。
(The photo is of a winter scene, with brilliant contrasts of light and shadow.I have indicated the colors crudely in my tracing on page 242 . The group of four sit on the edge of a concrete patio at the back of Bill’s house.I did not mention a test to Jane, but she is well aware that they are in the offing now; earlier in the day she casually mentioned tests, without asking specifically whether I had one planned for tonight.(这张照片是冬天的景象，有鲜明的光线和阴影对比。我在上面的描摹图中概略标示了色彩，这4个人就坐在比尔家后面的水泥平台边缘。我并没有跟珍提到测试，可是她很清楚等会儿马上就有；白天稍早时她无意间提到了测试，但并没有问我今晚是否已准备。
(The session was held in our small back room.The window was closed, for my hay fever bothered me most of the day.In spite of this however, I believe I have been helping myself to some extent through suggestion.Jane began speaking while sitting down as usual, with her eyes closed.Her voice was quiet.She began rather slowly but soon picked up her pace considerably.)(这节课在我们后面的小房间里举行。窗户关着，因为白天我大部分时间都深受花粉热所苦。尽管如此我还是相信，透过暗示我一直或多或少在自我帮助。珍一如往常，闭上眼睛坐着开始讲话，声音轻柔。刚开始时速度相当慢，但过不了一会儿就快马加鞭。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
For this session we will leave our material concerning dreams, to discuss another matter.We will however return to the dream data at our next session.我们这一节会把跟梦有关的资料暂时搁一边，改来讨论其他问题。等下节课再回到我们的梦资料。
A while earlier this evening Ruburt read something that made him wonder whether or not he had, or could develop, healing ability. I decided to speak about the general subject this evening.今天晚上稍早之前，鲁柏读了一些东西，让他怀疑自己是否具备疗愈能力，或是否可以发展疗愈能力，今晚我决定就概略谈谈这个主题。
It is an extremely interesting one, though somewhat complicated.This ability is a natural one, operating to some degree or another within every personality.It is a natural protective mechanism of inner origin, directly affecting matter. It is a self-correcting mechanism.The individual’s health is determined by his ability to take advantage of, or to use, this mechanism.这虽然有点复杂，但极为有趣。这种能力是天生自然就有的，或多或少会在每个人格之内运作。它是一种内在原始的天然保护机制，会直接影响到物质，也是一种自我导正机制。个体的健康取决于他利用或使用这种机制的能力。
The term mechanism may be a poor one, but I use it now to emphasize the physical aspects of its nature.When the ego is resilient this mechanism works automatically and well.It is the ego in many cases who clogs the works, so to speak.Ruburt has for years done fairly well in this matter, automatically regulating large areas of his health, with as you know some small failures, such as the sinus condition mainly, and the faulty eyesight.机制这个用词或许不是很恰当，我现在只是用它来强调物质面向的性质而已。如果自我有弹性，这个机制就会自动有效运作。可以这么说，很多情况下都是自我在阻挡这种运作。多年来鲁柏这方面做得相当好，她的健康状况大部分都会自然而然调整好，除了少数问题仍然存在外，如你们所知的，主要像是鼻窦的状况，还有视力欠佳。
(My hay fever bothered me enough so that I made some noise using a tissue.Jane sat quietly waiting, her eyes closed.)(我被花粉热整得很惨，使得我制造出一些擤鼻涕的噪音。珍闭上眼睛，安静坐着等待。)
Are you ready?你可以了吗？
(“Yes.”)(“可以了。”)
Generally he has done very well in regulating the physical organs, however, and in maintaining a level of effectiveness that is most unusual, considering his early unhealthy psychic environment.然而考量到他早年不利健康的心灵环境，现在的他整体来说，在调节身体器官的机能，以及维持器官极为不平凡的效能水准，这两方面都做得相当好。
We will now tell you, Joseph, that your head will be clear for the rest of this evening.约瑟，我现在要告诉你，今晚接下来的时间你的头脑都会很清楚。
(“Okay.”(“好。”)
(I was glad to hear this, and had been wondering whether Seth would give me this suggestion without my asking.He had done likewise in the unscheduled 184th session last Friday, and the suggestion had worked well for me.Whatever its source I had certainly responded.)(听到这些话我好开心，我早就在猜赛斯是否不用我请求，就会给我这个暗示。他在上星期五第184节的临时课里，做过同样的暗示，而这个暗示对我还真管用。不管它源自哪里，我确实有反应。)
There are ways in which this natural ability can be strengthened, and it may be of benefit that we discuss them.These ways will not only be helpful in facilitating these automatic health correction tendencies, but will also be generally beneficial as far as all inner abilities are concerned.这种自然的能力可以透过一些方法予以加强，我们来讨论一下这些方法，或许会很有帮助。这些方法除了可以促进健康自动朝正确的方向前进之外，对全部的内在能力来说，也有普遍性的助益。
They will allow you to increase your clairvoyant and telepathic abilities. They will aid in astral projection training. They will increase your powers of concentration, and will also show themselves in your own work.它们会让你们增加自己千里眼和心电感应的能力，对于灵体投射训练也有帮助，会增加你们的专注能力，也会在你们自己的工作上表现出来。
It goes without saying that you must bring to all your experiences more than a mere wish to be different, more than a mere curiosity.In order for you to operate effectively in any area there must be in your makeup a strong, positive and definite desire to benefit the race of man.Intellectual knowledge is important, but the desire to benefit your fellow human beings must be emotional as well as intellectual.不必多说，你们必须将这些带到你们所有的经验上，不只是希望有所不同，也不只是好奇心。为了让你们能在任何地方有效运作，你们的性格里必须要抱持着利益人类种族的欲望，而且强烈、正面且肯定。理性知识很重要，但是利益你们人类的欲望必须兼具情感与理性。
These suggestions which I am about to give you will aid immeasurably if they are followed.如果能遵行我即将给你们的这些建议，将会带来无可限量的帮助。
They demand a certain discipline it is true, and according to your desire you will find the discipline easy or difficult.I could have given you all of these suggestions at an earlier date, but you would not have been ready for them.In giving them to you, I take into consideration your own backgrounds, and I have made concessions accordingly.的确是需要某种纪律，你们会发现这种纪律的难易程度，端视你们的欲望而定。我本来早就可以给你们所有这些建议，但你们尚未做好准备。我给你们这些建议时，会考量到你们自己的背景，因此我稍微让步了。
(Janes eyes opened briefly.She looked at me then closed them again.)(珍短暂张开眼睛，看看我，然后再闭上。)
Your meals could be somewhat simpler. I would here suggest very few fried foods. You have too many of these.I would suggest less heavy foods. Fresh fruits and vegetables are excellent. Meat, but not fatty meats, and not an overabundance of meats.You will enjoy your meals more and you will savor the individual tastes with more discrimination.你们的饮食可以简单些，我这里会建议油炸食物少吃，这类东西你们吃了太多。我也建议难消化的食物要减少，新鲜的蔬菜水果相当好，肉类可以吃，但不是脂肪太多的肉类，也不能过量。你们将可以更享受你们的餐点，也可以细细品尝各种不同的风味。
I will give you the suggestions, and then I will give you the reasons behind them.I will have some little more to say concerning diet.You do well as it is, avoiding thick sauces and gravies.There is no fear here of short-circuiting necessary vitamin needs. I am mainly suggesting a change in the way food is prepared, and whenever possible a reliance upon fresh vegetables and fruits. Frozen are preferable to canned.我会给你们建议，也会告诉你们这些建议背后的理由。我还要谈一些饮食控制的问题。你们目前做得还不错，不会加太多的调味料和酱汁。这边不用怕必要的维生素会摄取不够，我主要是建议食物的烹调方式要改变，尽量食用新鲜蔬果，冷冻的比罐头好。
It is important obviously not to overeat.In general small fairly frequent meals are preferable to three heavy meals.不要吃太饱，显然很重要。一般来讲，少量多餐会比吃三次大餐来得好。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:27.Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her delivery had been rather fast. Her eyes had remained closed after the one look she gave me.(9:27分休息。珍的出离状况如常，传述的速度相当快，看了我一眼之后，双眼就一直闭着。
(Seth’s comments on our meals rather surprised us, since we are quite careful about our diet as it is.We do eat fried foods, of course, but decided we could cut down on these.(赛斯对饮食的评论实在令我们惊讶，因为目前我们非常注意饮食控制。当然，我们的确吃油炸食物，但已决定要降低这类食物的摄取量。
(I thought my head was a little better, following Seth’s suggestion; but the difference was slight and I hoped for more improvement.It was a relief not to be sneezing however.During break I mentioned that each new tack the material takes usually leaves some other subject dangling.I expressed concern because Jane was interested in receiving all the material on dreams that she could get. She thought her next book might deal with dreams.(我觉得在赛斯暗示之后，我的头好一点了；但只是轻微缓解，我希望能再多改善一点，不过不再一直打喷嚏就已经是种解脱。休息的时候我提到，每次更换新的主题方向后，总是会造成原本的主题讲到一半，搁着不管。我对此表达关切之意，因为珍对于自己可以接收到的所有梦资料很感兴趣，她认为自己的下一本书或许就会探讨梦。
(Janes eyes opened again after a few sentences following break.She looked at me but casually as she spoke, and at times let her eyes close.I would say her eyes were open about half of the time until next break. Her voice remained quiet.Resume at 9:35.)(休息完讲了几句话后，珍又张开眼睛。她讲话时，眼睛偶尔会随意看看我，有时又闭起来。一直到下次休息前，她的眼睛大概有一半的时间张开，声音依然轻柔，9:35分继续口述。)
Now my dear Joseph, this material concerning health will indeed tie in very well with our dream material, which is one of the reasons why it is being inserted here.现在，我亲爱的约瑟，这些跟健康有关的资料与我们的梦资料，实际上密不可分，因此才会放在这里。
We shall have our sessions for many years. There is no fear that any of the material will be left dangling in midair.The material will change now and then in the balance of its components, for it too must change and grow.The identity of the material must change and grow if it will endure.我们的课会持续很多年，不必害怕有什么资料会讲到一半，搁着不管。我们的资料也需要改变与成长，所以为了内容的平稳，偶尔也会变更讨论的主题。如果资料本身要经得起时间考验，就得改变与成长。
Theoretically, it would be better indeed if you were vegetarians. However at this time I do not suggest it.There is no doubt, for various reasons, however, that many benefits are connected with this particular dietary habit.I repeat: I do not suggest it for you, for various reasons. Moderation will do us as well.理论上来讲，如果你们吃素，确实会比较好，不过，我现在并不会提这个建议。然而，基于各种不同原因，这种特别的饮食习惯显然好处多多。我再说一次：由于各种理由，我不建议你们这么做，适量的饮食对我们也有帮助。
You would do better with fruits for dessert more often.常对水果做为饭后甜点对你们比较好。
Now aside from these dietary suggestions, I also believe other patterns of behavior could be adopted.The isometric exercises, for now, are excellent and should be followed by both of you.The two Eastern exercises, done occasionally by Ruburt, should be adopted by you both as a matter of routine daily.除了这些饮食建议外，我相信也有其他行为模式可以采行。等长肌肉锻炼(isometric exercises)就相当好，你们两人现在都应该做。鲁柏偶尔会做的那两种东方运动，你们两人都应该当成例行公事来做。
Later other such Eastern exercises should be added.The walks should indeed be systematically continued. Deep breathing should always be adopted during such walks.When the walk entails an errand the walking itself should be the important matter.You should attempt to feel yourselves a part of the environment through which you pass, and attempt to enter into it rather than feel yourselves as observers.之后，其他这类东方运动也应该再加进来。散步真的应该持之以恒，持续下去，散步期间随时都要深呼吸。如果散步是为了到达某个目的地办事，那要将散步本身视为重要的事。你们应该试着感觉自己就是超过的环境其中一部分，试着融入环境，而不是只将自己视为旁观者。
Ruburt should drink no more than five cups of coffee daily at the most. If he is not giving up his cigarettes, then as you suggested moderation should be used.The present fifteen a day will do for now, but this should be reduced to ten when it is feasible.鲁柏每天喝咖啡最多不应该超过5杯，现在如果他还无法戒烟，就该按照你的建议，要减量节制。目前每天15支的量还可以，但如果可能的话，应该减到10支。
I mentioned in the past those suggestions given by Ruburt to himself, concerning the continued health of the physical organism. You should both utilize this practice.In our dream material we will go deeply into the nature of health suggestions given in connection with the dream situation, and such suggestions may be considered a part of this evening’s list.All of these—you may call them rules if you prefer—all of these rules then are for your own benefit, and are personalized, formed by me taking into consideration your own needs, strong points and weaknesses.Therefore they apply, the dietary suggestions and the exercise suggestions, to you only.我过去透过鲁柏给他自己的那些建议，都跟维持身体健康有关，你们俩都应该好好付诸实行。我们的梦资料会探讨对健康的暗示，其本质与梦境相关，这样的暗示或许可以看成今晚的一部分内容。所有这些——如果你高兴的话，可以称之为法则——所有这些法则都对你们有利，是为你们量身打造的，是我根据你们自己的需求、优点和弱点而提出来。因此，这些饮食建议和运动建议只适用于你们。
We can and will give a general list, but it is always better if this list be implemented by personal consultation.You have done much better in the overall in health maintenance than you did in the past; since you are both in excellent organic condition you can say that you have both done well.However there is a large difference between a general state that is free of disease and a state of exuberant health, in which the inner and outer selves are perfectly attuned.我们可以、也将会提供一份一般的清单，不过如果能透过个人咨商来落实这份清单，一定会更好。整体而言，你们在健康的维持上比以前好很多；你们两人的身体状况相当好，所以你们俩可以说做得很不错了。不过，没有病痛的一般状态与充满活力的健康状态，两者间有很大的差异，后者是内在与外在的自己完全和谐一致。
Such a state is far from impossible, and we shall see that you achieve it.The rules that I have given you are an absolute necessity if that state is to be achieved.And it is only in that state that the inner self can utilize its abilities.这样的状态并非不可能，我们即将看到你们达成。如果想达到这种状态，绝对需要我给你们的这些法则。只有在这种状态下，内我才能利用它的各种能力。
You may take your break.I will then have a few words to say concerning the connection between diet, personality, and health.All of which incidentally is reflected in the dream state, and in the nature of dreams themselves.你们可以休息一下。我待会就饮食、人格和健康三者之间的关系，跟你们讲几句话。所有这些偶尔会反映在梦境当中，也会反映在梦本身的本质。
(Break at 9:56.Jane was well dissociated. Although her voice had been rather average this evening, she said now that she felt it to be strong subjectively.Jane told me it is hard to explain, but at times she feels she is more a part of the voice than at other times.(9:56分休息。珍出离得很好，今晚她的声音虽然相当平常，但是她说主观上觉得自己的声音坚定有力。珍告诉我说这很难解释，不过她有时候会觉得自己特别像是声音的一部分。
(Her pace had been good, her eyes closed at times. Usually she opened them and stared at me to emphasize a point.(她的速度一直很恰当，眼睛有时闭着，大部分时间眼睛都张开，在强调重点时，会盯着我看。
(I was now aware of some improvement in the state of my head, and felt much better. I hoped the improvement would continue.Jane now resumed while sitting down, and with her eyes closed, at 10:02.)(我现在注意到头的状况有一些改善，觉得好多了，我希望这样的改善能持续下去。珍坐下来闭着眼睛，10:02分继续口述。)
Joseph, you can help yourself considerably by giving yourself suggestions, beginning tonight, as you fall off to sleep, to the effect that your head will be clear tomorrow.Suggest that while you sleep your inner self will make whatever corrections or adjustments are necessary to bring about this end.约瑟，你可以从今晚开始，在躺下来入睡时，对自己暗示说，你的头脑明天会很清醒，如此一来，就能帮自己一个大忙。你要暗示自己，在睡觉时你的内我会做任何必要的修正或调整，以达到想要的结果。
This should be done every night during your season, and will immeasurably help you.The same suggestions should be given by Ruburt for the sinus condition.He has helped your health often, automatically.He is a health-giving personality in this respect, generally speaking.在你容易不舒服的季节里，应该每天晚上都这么做，对你自己将大有裨益。鲁柏针对自己鼻窦的状况，也可以下同样的暗示。他经常自动地帮助你更健康。整体来说，他在这方面是一个给予健康的人格。
The nervous cigarette habit does not help him however, for it diverts his energies. Obviously it is a symptom.Moderation at least will be of great benefit, if he follows our suggestions.不过，紧张不安的抽烟习惯对他并没有帮助，因为会让他的能量转移，显然是一种症状。如果他能遵照我们的建议来做，那么不要过量至少会有很大的帮助。
(It was 10:06.Reaching over, I dropped the test envelope in Jane's lap as she spoke. Her eyes were closed. They did not open now, nor did her delivery falter.Actually she gave no sign that she was aware of the envelope. I chose this method of introducing the envelope into Jane's awareness to see if it would halt or interfere with the material of the moment, and was pleased to see that it did not.I had taken care to see that Jane had not seen the test envelope during breaks, or before the session.)(时间来到10:06分。珍正在讲话，我伸手过去把测试信封丢在她腿上，她双眼闭着，这时眼睛并未张开，口述也未受影响。事实上，我看不出她觉察到这个信封，我还用这种方式来引起珍对信封的注意，看会不会造成当时资料传述的暂停或干扰，我很高兴看到的答案是不会。在休息时及上课前，我特别留意没让珍看到这个测试信封。)
His efficiency in this healing process can indeed grow.在这个疗癒过程中，他的效率确实可以成长。
A little more here concerning diet. You are indeed to a large extent what you eat.You are bound up in the cycle of earth relationships. The eating of meat without doubt focuses the physical mechanism closely to the physical system.There is nothing wrong with this. If you are trying to develop inner abilities however, and if you wish to allow yourself a mobility of focus, then moderation in this respect must be used.Eggs and milk and cheeses can be substituted occasionally without changing your overall eating habits.再谈一下饮食，你确实是吃了什么就得到什么，这种情形相当明显。你与地球关系中的循环密切相关，吃肉无疑是将物质机制紧密聚集在物质系统，这本身并没有错。不过如果你想发展内在能力，也希望让自己的焦点能机动灵活，那么肉类的节制在这方面就一定要好好落实。在不改变你整体的饮食习惯下，蛋类、奶类和寿司偶尔可做为替代品。
(It was 10:11.Jane had been speaking with pauses.Now she paused again, then picked up the test envelope.Her eyes were still closed.As during her previous four tests she held the double envelope lightly in both hands.She did not appear to be nervous.)(现在是10:11分。珍说话时有停顿。这时她又停顿下来，接着拎起测试信封。双眼仍然闭着。就如之前4次测试一样，两手轻轻拿着这个双层信封，神色自若，看不出紧张的样子。)
We will now see about your envelope. Give me a moment.我们现在就来看看你的信封，请稍候一下。
(Jane's pause was very brief.)(珍的暂停非常短。)
I have an impression of a road or a tree:that is, of such parallel lines.I have an impression of afternoon, an impression of three people, of dirt or dirt color, and shadows or shadow shapes, perhaps of pyramid form.Again, I have the impression of a white border, and perhaps on the other side, of writing.The shadow shapes are dark, and contrasted with light. I have the impression of chimney shapes.我有一条马路或一棵树的印象；那是一些平行线。我感受到的印象是下午、3个人、灰尘或灰色，还有，或许是金字塔外形的影子或影子的形状。此外，我也有一个白色边框的印象，还有书写文字，可能在另一面。影子形状是暗的，跟光线形成对比，我还有烟囱的印象。
Ruburt has the impression of the school fence across the street from the house in which he lived, and he is thinking of a particular photograph of his own that involved his house, the street, part of the fence, and perhaps some children.We are letting all of this come through.鲁柏有学校围墙的印象，是在他居住房子的对面街道，他正想到自己的一张照片，照片里有他的家、街道、部分的围墙以及或许是一些小孩。我们正在让所有这些资料传过来。
I now suggest your break.我现在建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:15.Jane had been dissociated as usual.Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet.She delivered the test data without hesitation or Jumbling.She told me she had felt the envelope drop into her lap but that it had not bothered her.(10:15分休息。珍的出离状况如常。双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔。传述测试资料时，并不会犹豫，也不会支支吾吾。她告诉我，感觉有信封丢在她腿上，但并没有受到这个动作干扰。
(Once again the test data was interesting. This was the first time, also, that Seth had separated his own data from that of Ruburts, or Janes.Refer to my tracing of the photograph on page 242. Seth’s data can be seen to apply rather directly, with the exception that the photo is of four people instead of three.This is dealt with after break, along with the matter of chimney shapes.(测试资料还是很有意思，这也是赛斯第一次把自己的资料，与鲁柏或珍的资料区分开来。回到我上面那张照片的描摹图，可以看到赛斯的资料，除了照片里是4个人而非3个人之外，其余都相当符合。这部分在休息后将会跟烟囱形状一起处理。
(Jane told me that in the past she would have given her own interpretation of the photograph she had in mind along with Seth 's information.On one level she had a distinct impression of her own photograph.But now she allowed Seth to separate the two impressions.(珍告诉我说，过去她会将自己心里对照片的诠释与赛斯的讯息一起说出来。某层面而言，她对自己的照片会有清楚的印象。不过现在她会让赛斯把这两种印象区分开来。
(Jane resumed while sitting down and with her eyes closed, and in a quiet voice, at 10:21.)(珍闭上双眼坐着，声音轻柔，10:21分继续口述。)
Now. We let all of this material come through purposely, so that you can learn from it.现在，我们就刻意让这些资料全部传送过来，以便你们能从中学习。
For one thing, we are trying to teach Ruburt preciseness in word formation.I am not able yet to give him a visual image during a test. Therefore the information must be passed on verbally.首先，我们正试着教导鲁柏用字遣词的精准度。我还不能在测试当中给他一个视觉意象，因此必须以口头的方式逐字传递讯息。
The parallel lines and the tree did refer to the wooden boards of the wall, which are obviously parallel, each board being distinct and clear.平行线和树指的正是墙壁上的木板，这些木板显然都是平行的，每块木板清晰可见。
I was able to transfer to him the pattern of the people. This is where three came through. The child, the baby image, did not come through clearly.The road is obvious.我可以将人的样子传达给他，传来了3个人，但是小孩子，也就是婴儿的形象并没有清楚传过来。马路倒很显明。
Now, I knew this was a photograph.Ruburt however, through association, made certain deductions.He picked up from me the fact that children were involved.He picked up the road and the pyramid shapes.This led him to think of his old home, for in the afternoon the shadow of its roof threw a pyramid shadow form upon the road.现在，我知道这是一张照片。不过，鲁伯透过联想，做了某些推断。他从我这里获知照片里有小孩。也获知马路和金字塔形状。这些让他想到自己的老家，因为老家屋顶在下午的时候，会在马路上投射出一个金字塔的影子。
The children that I perceived, he projected into this picture of his, a photograph in which children were indeed involved.The photograph used in the test was taken in the afternoon.The chimney was not in the picture. I saw the chimney of the other house in the test photograph, but this does not show there.他把我感知到的小孩，投射到他自己的这张照片中，一张确实有小孩的照片。测试用的照片是在下午拍摄。烟囱不在照片里，我看到另一间房子的烟囱在这张测试照片里，不过这一部分并没有出现在那里
These tests are most advantageous, and should be continued.We will endeavor to teach Ruburt so that more precise data is received.这些测试极有助益，应该要继续下去。我们会努力教导鲁伯，让他可以更精准地接收资料。
We will now end the session, though I would continue if you prefer.我们现在就要结束这节，不过如果你们愿意的话，我也可以继续下去。
(“I guess we can use the rest.”)(“我想我们可以结束了。)
My heartiest regards; and follow my suggestions, both of you.送上我最深情的祝福；你们俩要遵循我的建议哦。
(“Yes.Good night, Seth.”(“好的。晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:31.Jane was dissociated as usual.As before, her eyes had alternated between opening and closing.Her pace had been good.She said that Seth was in a good mood and would have liked to continue the session.(10:31分结束。珍的出离状况如常。眼睛跟以前一样，时而睁开时而闭上。节奏很好。她说赛斯心情很好，很想继续上下去。
(During last break we had speculated about the photograph being taken in the afternoon, because of the elongated shadows on the white snow.I will check with my brother in Webster, hoping he can remember after six years.It seems reasonable to agree with Seth; I do not believe such shadows can be found in the morning during the winter months.(最后一次休息时，我们推测这张照片应该是在下午拍的，因为白雪上的影子被拉长了。我会向住在韦伯斯特的弟弟求证，希望他还记得6年前的事。我理所当然同意赛斯的说法；也认为冬天早上看不到这样的影子。
(See my sketch of the photo on page 242.The baby in white sits on the lap of my brothers wife, Ida.The pattern of his clothing and blanket forms a triangular shape, very similar to the shadow shapes on the snow; these forms can be called pyramid easily enough.The baby perhaps did not come through as well as the other three figures because of a lack of contrast.(见我上面对照片的描摹图。婴儿包在白色毛毯里，坐在我弟媳艾达[Ida]腿上。他的衣物和毛毯构成一个三角形，非常像雪地上影子的形状；这些构图就足以称之为金字塔了。或许是因为缺乏对比，这个婴儿就没有像其他3个人一样传递得那么好。
(The photograph has a white border, and a stamp with writing on the reverse side.No chimneys show in the photo.The house across the street is very small in the photo; for Seth to make an association with that house is most intriguing to us.As in the last test, the process of association involved proved to be most interesting.(这张照片有白色的边框，背面贴了一张邮票，上面还有一些文字。照片中看不到烟囱，街道对面的房子在照片里非常小；对赛斯来说，他连结到了那间房子，这件事最能引发我们的好奇心。就如上次测试一样，在测试过程当中的关系连结，事实上是最有趣的部分。
(Tracing of cancelled United States postage stamps used in the 6th envelope test, Session 186, September 8,1965. )第186节 睡前暗示　固执僵化的是自我不是潜意识　信封6

SESSION 186 1965年9月8日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课


SEPTEMBER 8, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED已盖邮戳的美国邮票描摹图，使用于1965年9月8日第186节第6次信封测试
(It will be recalled that in the 185th session Seth gave me some tips on how to help my hay fever through suggestion upon retiring at night.It has been a rough season and I was very uncomfortable over the Labor Day weekend.I had been using suggestion at various times through the day; trying Seth’s method I noticed an amazing improvement at once.I slept well the night of the 6th, and sneezed but five times the whole following day.The improvement has maintained itself, and soon now the season will be over.I can truthfully say the change in my condition has been magical.I am on a much-reduced dosage of my prescription antihistamine.I have learned I can do without it, but taking the drug removes the last of the lingering traces.For some reason, the suggestions given before falling off to sleep are very potent.(还记得赛斯在第185节里，针对如何在睡前透过暗示改善我的花粉热，给了一些诀窍。现在已进入令人难受的季节，劳动节那个周末我就非常不舒服。我利用一整天内不同的时间，做了好多次暗示；试了赛斯的方法，立刻发现改善程度令人惊奇。9月6日那天晚上我睡得很好，隔天也只打了5次喷嚏。这种改善状况一直维持着，现在这种季节就快结束了。我可以老实说，发生在我身上的变化真是一大奇迹。我服用处方药抗组织胺的剂量已大为减少，我知道我不必再吃药，但是吃药可以摆脱掉最后那些挥之不去的残留症状。由于某些原因，入睡前的暗示相当有效。
(Ever since mailing in the finished manuscript of her ESP book Jane has been very restless.She is very eager to get to work on her next project, but keeps struggling among many ideas, notes, etc. I suggested to her that she skip tonight’s session if she felt so nervous, but she decided to hold it regardless.(珍自从寄出ESP一书的完稿后，就一直非常焦躁不安。她迫切渴望下一个计划赶快动工，可是又在许多概念、调性等等之间挣扎不已。我建议她如果这么紧张的话，就跨过今晚的课，但是她决定无论如何还是照常举行。
(I had prepared the usual double test envelope earlier in the day, but doubted it would be used if Jane was not in a good mood for the session.This time I cemented a collection of used U.S. postage stamps, still on original paper, to a folded piece of white paper.See my tracing on page 250.I sandwiched this paper between two pieces of Bristol board to prevent identification by touch, and slipped the assemblage into the usual two envelopes.(我今天稍早之前就准备好一个普通的双层信封，不过我怀疑，如果珍今晚上课的心情不好，那么这信封是否会派上用场。这次我搜集了一些用过的美国邮票，都还贴在原来的纸张上，把它们另外贴在一张对折的白纸上。见下图。我再用两张厚纸板夹住，以免一触摸就辨识出来，接着将整组东西塞入平常使用的双层信封里。
(The session was held in our small back room. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was average, her pace good. She used a few pauses.)(这节课在我们后面的小房间举行，珍坐下来闭着眼睛开始讲话，声音如常，速度适中，中间停顿几次)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
We are indeed endeavoring to run through the storm clouds.我们真的好像身处在暴风雨中，努力穿越层层乌云。
I do not know how long our session will be. We will have to discover what we can do here. I will direct some remarks personally to Ruburt.我不知道这节课会上多久，我们必须知道我们这时可以做什么，我会个别给鲁柏一些指导的话。
First of all, he has not relaxed since he mailed his book, really.首先，自从他把书寄出去之后，就一直没有放松过，真的。
Since he finished his ego has held him in a tight clamp.After the psychic excitement and effort and discipline involved in the venture of the book, there simply must be a complete relaxation, a letting go.There must be time for the organism to renew itself.从他完工后，他的自我就紧紧掐住自己。写书的挑战为他带来了心灵上的刺激、努力和自律，在这之后必须完全舒缓下来，好好放空一下。一定要给身体时间来自我更新。
It makes no difference that physical time does not exist as you imagine, since you act as if it does.For this reason physical time is involved.Ruburt has been at himself constantly for new ideas, trying to force himself to plunge into something new.There must be a recharge of energies.物理时间的存在并不如你们想像的那样，但这对你们来讲没什么影响，因为你们仍然按照你们想像的那样来行事。由于这个原因，这里涉及到物理时间。鲁柏时时都想让自己接触新观念，努力强迫自己投入新事物。但一定要让能量重新充电。
The conscious mind, the ego, must be momentarily diverted, so that the intuitive self is allowed freedom.He should know that inspiration does not come from the ego.He knows this intellectually, but upon this occasion he insists in using his ego as a whip to force speed.In the past he was more sensible in this respect.意识心、自我，一定要短暂退离，好让直觉的自己获得自由。他应该知道，灵感不是来自于自我。他的头脑对这一点很清楚，但在这种状况下，他坚持要把自我当成皮鞭，用来鞭策自己加快脚步。过去他比较能知觉到这一方面。
When he is working his plunge into creativity is deep. It is not in his nature to go halfway.If he had taken more time off completely, he would not be in his present position.他工作时会深深投入创造之中，半途而废不是他的本性。如果他有更长时间的完全休息，那他现在的状况会不一样。
It will not do if he resents the time he thinks is lost in relaxation or other pursuits.His intuitive nature will respond easily and enthusiastically when he stops trying to beat it into submission.如果他将用来放松或从事其他休闲的时间，视为一种浪费，而且讨厌这些时刻，那可就不行。只要他不再一直逼迫直觉的本性就范，那么直接的本性会很乐于回应，而且不费吹灰之力。
He has forgotten the daily joy that comes through simple observation of the day.There suggest most strongly that until the following Monday at the earliest, he does not work at his writing or his records, that he does not consciously brood over them, and that he divert himself by changing the focus of his conscious awareness.他已经忘记，透过对每天简单的观察，可以带来每日愉快的心情。我在这里强烈建议他，至少在下星期一之前，都不要再写作或做记录，意识上也不要去思考这些事情，同时也要借由改变意识觉察的焦点，来转移自己的注意力。
Surely this is not too bitter a pill. It may require effort but relaxation is necessary, or the period of transition will be needlessly prolonged.He can do what he likes: putter in his apartment, visit friends, paint, read, walk.It would be preferable if he did change his environment during this period, physically, by walking outdoors or visiting.这当然不是一件苦差事，可能需要一些努力，不过必须放松，否则这个过渡阶段就没必要延长了。他可以做自己喜欢做的事：在家里闲晃、拜访朋友、画画、散步等。如果他这段期间内，能借由到户外散步或访友，确实转换一下自己的物理环境，那会更好。
The psychological-time experiments should also be suspended.When the conscious mind is so diverted the intuitions can do their work.You did well Joseph, teaching him discipline, but as he never goes halfway, so sometimes he learns his lessons too well.One point here also: you pace yourselves differently in your work.心理时间的实验也该暂停。如果意识心能转移注意力，直觉能力就会尽其本分开始运作了。约瑟，你教他自律的这一部分做得很好，不过因为他做事从来就不会半途而废，所以有时候学东西会过度认真。这里还有一个重点：你自己的工作节奏跟他不一样。
I suggest a break, and we will see what we can do.我建议休息一下，再看看我们可以做什么。
(Break at 9:19.Jane was dissociated as usual.(9:19分休息。珍的出离状况如常。
(As in the 183rd session, Jane began to speak after break while sitting upright and cross-legged on the bed.She was still out of sorts and restless.She sat with a hand to her eyes, her head down. Her eyes were closed, her voice quiet.The pace was slower now, with more frequent pauses.Resume at 9:28.)(就像第183节一样，珍休息完后，身子打直，盘腿坐在床上。她仍然觉得不舒服，情绪焦躁不安。一只手捂住眼睛低着头，闭着双眼，声音轻柔。这时的速度较为缓慢，经常停顿。9:28分继续口述。)
Now.Generally speaking, this automatic mechanism that adjusts the whole health structure works very well when the personality is in the dream state.现在。一般来讲，人格在梦境里，调整整体健康结构的这个自动机制运作得非常好。
It is very susceptible to suggestion.Ruburt's jesting remark this evening that he would suggest refreshing dreams was actually an excellent one.The personality can indeed refresh itself in such a manner, and often does automatically.它很容易受暗示影响。鲁伯今晚打趣地说，他会暗示自己做个提神的梦，这真的是绝佳的暗示。人格的确能以这种方式让自我恢复活力，而且经常自动这样做。
(Jane now took a long pause.She still sat with her head down, resting in one hand.)(珍这时停顿较久，仍然低头坐着，一手托腮。)
I did have a suggestion myself, that involved some small effort on Ruburts part.It, if followed, would do him good however.It would be most beneficial for him to do some sketching at the riverbanks. The sketches could then be used for paintings.我自己确实有个建议，需要鲁柏付出一些小小的努力。不过如果照做的话，对他会有好处。到河边画些素描，对他来说最好不过了，这些素描可当成画作的草稿。
(Another long pause.The pace was getting to be so slow that I expected the session to end at any moment.)(又一次较长的停顿。由于传述的速度变得非常慢，我预计这节课随时会结束。)
It goes without saying that suggestion before sleep will also help.It is the ego that is rigid, not the subconscious.睡前的暗示也会有帮助，这点就不必多说了。固执僵化的是自我，不是潜意识。
Do you have any tests for me this evening?你今晚要我做什么测试吗？
("Yes."(“是的。
(It was 9:34.Jane smiled as she asked the question. Again I was surprised, not expecting any interest in a test tonight.I fished the envelope out and handed it to her. She held it in her right hand.Her position was the same, head down, eyes closed.)(现在是9:34分。珍面带微笑提出这个问题，又让我吓了一跳，因为我并没有期望她今晚会对测试有兴趣。我把信封摸出来递给她，她就拿在右手中，保持同样的姿势，低头闭着眼睛。)
We will see what we can do. Please give me a moment.我们马上知道我们能做什么，请等我们一会儿。
I have the impression of something splendid. Perhaps a scene. Two or three people, and some connection with water.我有个印象，是非常精彩的东西，或许是一片风景，有两个或3个人，跟水有关。
(Another pause.Jane sat without moving.)(再度暂停，珍坐着不动。)
I also have the impression of a tavern of some sort, or place of refreshment; of tall parallel lines, and of horizontal parallel lines.Also lines on the other side, and of someone stubborn.我还有一个印象，是某种小酒馆或提供茶点的地方；有直的平行线和横的平行线。另一面也有一些线条，还有一个人，个性顽固。
I have the impression of 3 6, perhaps an age or part of an address, and something that only partially appears, that is half visible. Maybe something to do with a man, woman and a child.There is something to do with a child somehow involved.我有3 和6的印象，或许是年龄，要不然就是地址的一部分，还有某个东西只露出一部分，只能看到一半，可能跟一个男人、女人和小孩有关的东西。有某个东西跟一个稍微牵涉其中的小孩相关。
You may take a break to check our results.你们可以休息一下，检查一下我们的结果。
(Break at 9:39.Jane was dissociated as usual.Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet.She had used many pauses in giving the test data, although she hadn’t appeared to be nervous.During the whole passage, she sat almost without moving, holding the test envelope almost motionless in her right hand.She had no visual impressions while speaking, she said.(9:39分休息。珍的出离状况如常。眼睛一直闭着，声音轻柔。虽然看不出紧张的样子，但在传述这些测试资料时，暂停了多次。整个过程中，几乎都坐着不动，右手拿着测试信封，一动也不动。她说在讲话时，并没有视觉上的印象。
(Jane regarded the test results as very poor, at first glance.I didn’t know what to think.Some of the information applied at first glance; other parts of it, I thought, were impressions attached to the test objects themselves, as in the 185th session.(珍第一眼看到时，认为这次测试结果糟透了。我不知道该怎么想，某些讯息一看就知道说中了；我想，另外一些讯息是测试物品给人的印象，就如第185节里面那样。
(Still sitting upright on the bed, Jane resumed with her eyes closed, in a quiet voice and with pauses, at 9:47.)(9:47分，珍挺直地坐在床上，闭着眼睛继续口述，声音轻柔，中间停顿几次。)
Ruburt was not at his best this evening, so we did not get specific-enough information.I knew you had a test prepared however, and thought that we should go ahead.鲁伯今晚并不是处在最佳状态，所以我们获得的讯息不够确实。不过，我知道你已经准备好要测试，因此认为我们该进行。
(“Did you pick that test information up from me telepathically?’)(“你是以心电感应方式从我这边获得测试的讯息吗？)
The fact of a test, yes.就测试这件事而言，是的。
(“After the session began?”)(“是在这节课开始之后吗？”)
Yes.没错。
I would, overall, suggest that Ruburt not return to work until spontaneously he desires to do so.This will happen rather quickly if he relaxes.Wait until an idea presses him for expression.整体来说我会建议鲁柏，要等到自发地想工作时，再回到工作岗位上。如果他放轻松的话，这一刻很快就会来到。就等着某个念头逼他表达吧。
I am going to close.However, I will see that all in all we have not lost out.Ruburt should remember that his reaction is a normal one.Our next session will indeed be a full and excellent one.My heartiest wishes to you both.我马上就要结束了。不过整体来说，我知道我们并没有损失。鲁柏应该要记住，他的反应很正常。我们下节课真的很充实、很精彩。为两位送上我最深情的祝福。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 9:54.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed until the end of the session, her voice quiet.Seth said no more about the results of the test, and in view of Jane's state I thought it best not to query him about it tonight.(9:54分结束。珍的出离状况如常，一直到课结束前眼睛都闭着，声音轻柔。赛斯对于测试结果没再多说什么，考量到珍的状况，我觉得今晚最好不要再问赛斯相关细节。
(From the sketch on page 250 it can be seen that parallel lines, both horizontal and tall, or vertical, are present; these are the customary wavy lines of cancellation.See stamps numbered 1, 2, and 3 on the sketch.On the envelope paper beneath stamp #2 is a green printed box of the type used for prepaid mail, but I do not know if this is what Seth means by “lines on the other side.” This could also refer to the letters the stamps once serviced.(从上面的描摹图可以看出，平行线，包括横的和直的，确实存在；这些是邮戳上惯有的波浪线条。见描摹图上①②③的邮票。②号邮票下面的信封纸，是用在预付资费邮件的绿色印刷盒子，我不知道这个是否就是赛斯指的“另一面也有一些线条”。这也可以指原本使用这些邮票寄出的信件。
(Herbert Hoover, the Mayo brothers, Susan B. Anthony and Robert E. Lee appear on some of the stamps; I suppose any of these could be connected with “something splendid.” Stamp #2 depicts a scene in Kansas.Seth mentioned two or three people; the stamps depict a total of nine people, plus two hands on the special delivery stamp.Are these hands “something that only partially appears?”The same thing could be said about any bust depicted.(赫伯特∙胡佛[Herbert Hoover]，梅奥(Mayo)兄弟，苏珊∙B∙安东尼(Susan B. Anthony)和罗伯特∙E∙李(Robert E. Lee)都出现在这些邮票当中；我认为这里面任何一个人都可以跟“非常精彩的东西”沾上边。②号邮票描绘堪萨斯州的风景。赛斯提到有两个或3个人；这些邮票里面总共有9个人，包括限时专送邮票上的两只手。这两只手是否就是“某个东西只露出一部分”？也可能是指邮票上任何半身画像。
(No water scene appears specifically on any stamp, or a child. Men and women are shown.As far as I can tell no portion of an address shows, or a tavern or place of refreshment.Nor do we know what to make of “someone stubborn, ” unless this was a personality trait of one of the people depicted on the stamps.I could speculate that Jane's constant nagging at herself to begin another project was stubborn, in that she refused to relax.This is hardly the kind of test data we seek however.3 6 is Jane's age, but we discount this also.(邮票上没特别看到水的景象，也没有小孩，倒是看得到男人和女人。就我所能辨识的内容来看，邮票上也没有部分的地址、小酒馆或提供茶点的地方。我也不知道“顽固的人”指的是什么，除非是指邮票上某个人的人格特质。我能做的推断是，珍一直不断自寻烦恼强迫自己要开始另一项计划，这就是一种顽固的个性，因为她拒绝放松自己。不过这几乎不是我们想看到的测试资料。36是珍的年龄，但这个数字也有点出入[译注：珍当年是37岁]。
(Tracing of the photographic negative used in the 7th envelope test, in Session 187, September 13,1965.)第187节 距离实相取决情感强度 比尔、蓓见证 信封7

SESSION 187 1965年9月13日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课


SEPTEMBER 13, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED底片描摹图，使用于1965年9月13日第187节第7次信封测试
(While at work last Thursday, September 9, at 11 AM, I had a vision of the type described on page 223.This time, while bending over my desk, I saw with inner vision a rusty opened sardine can lying on a worn wooden shelf.The colors were very vivid, the detail needle sharp.I saw clearly if briefly the flecks of rust on the can and the grain of the wood.The scene was lit by strong sunlight from my left, so that long shadows were cast to the right by the humble can.(上周四，9月9日上午11点，我在工作时看到一个类似前面描述的那种内在心象。这一次，我伏案工作时，透过内在视觉看到一个生锈的沙丁鱼罐头，已经打开了，摆在老旧斑驳的木架上。影像色彩非常鲜明，细节非常清晰锐利。即使只稍微瞄一眼，也可以清楚看到罐头上的锈斑和木头上的纹路。从我左侧面而来的强烈阳光照耀了此一景象，长长的影子投射到右侧，不起眼的罐头就在斜影旁。
(Earlier in the day I prepared the 7th envelope test for the session tonight. This time I picked a negative I had taken during our vacation in 1964 at York Beach, ME.The subject was the Driftwood Hotel, situated but a stones throw from the beach. This place has strong emotional attachments for Jane and me.It will be remembered that it was in the dancing room of the Driftwood that Jane and I saw the personality fragments we had ourselves created, on our vacation in York Beach in 1963. See the 9th session in Volume 1. We had this experience several months before these sessions began. See the sketch of the negative on page 255 of this Volume 4.(稍早时我为今晚的课准备了第7次信封测试，这次我挑了一张1964年我们在缅因州约克海滩度假时拍照的底片。底片的主角是离海滩非常近的浮木旅馆(Driftwood Hotel)，我和珍对这个地方有很强烈的情感连结。大家应该记得，1963年我和珍在约克海滩度假时，就是在这家旅馆的舞厅内，看到我们自己创造出来的人格片断体，见第一册第9节课，这段经验发生在我们开始上这些课的前几个月，见上图的底片素描。
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher were witnesses for tonight’s session, and the session was held in our large front room.Traffic noise was not a problem, the windows being closed because of the cool night.Jane began speaking while sitting in her favorite Kennedy rocking chair.Her eyes were closed, her voice good but not loud, her pace a little fast.She used few pauses, and sat much of the time learning forward with her hands clasped before her and her head tilted down slightly.She began speaking at 8:59.)(比尔和蓓·加拉格见证了今晚的课，这节课在我们前面的大房间举行。由于天气寒冷，门窗紧闭，外面车子的吵杂声并不是什么问题。珍坐在她最喜欢的肯尼迪摇椅里开始讲话。闭着眼睛，声音适中，不是太大声，节奏有点快。停顿几次，坐着的时候大部分时间身子往前倾，双手紧扣放在身体前面，微微低头。8:59开始讲话。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
My heartiest welcome to our dear friends, the Jesuit and the cat lover.衷心欢迎我们亲爱的朋友，耶稣会信徒和爱猫人。
I am going to speak this evening concerning our dream reality, although I promised our guests earlier that we would discuss the God concept.However we took valuable time out in order to put our Ruburt in line, and so we are somewhat behind.虽然我之前答应过我们的客人要讨论神的概念，但是今晚我会谈谈我们的梦实相。不过，之前我们为了让鲁柏能上轨道而花费了一些宝贵的时间，所以我们现在的进度有点落后。
I am pleased that he has been following my suggestions.我很高兴看到他听从了我的建议。
And I hope that our Jesuit will also follow those instructions I have given him.We will here consider the dream reality in an isolated manner, as if it were a thing disconnected from normal consciousness, although in reality it is not so disconnected.我希望我们的耶稣会信徒也能遵循我给他的那些指示。我们这里会单独来看梦实相，将其视为跟正常意识毫无瓜葛，不过实际上它与正常意识并非毫不相干。
Joseph, you will let me know if and when I speak too swiftly.约瑟，你会让我知道我是不是哪里讲太快吧？
(“Yes. ’’(“对。”
