(By now Janes accent, which might be termed a brogue of sorts, had become quite noticeable.)(这时候珍的腔调，或许可以称之为某种爱尔兰的口音，早已变得非常明显。)
I spoke in a recent session concerning the connection between distance and emotions.The true reality of distance as you know it is dependent upon the intensity of emotion, and has nothing to do with your idea of space.The emotion which is intense is felt at its peak as present in time, and immediately here in terms of distance.我在最近的课谈到了距离与情感的关联。如你们所知，真正的距离实相取决于情感的强度，与你们的空间概念没有关系。处于高峰的浓烈情感，可让人觉得时间仿佛就回到当下，空间上也犹如就在现场。
Emotions take up a certain amount of what we call psychic space within the personality’s awareness.As the intensity of the emotion fades, so it seems to you that it recedes in time. But this is an illusion caused by the limitations of your outer senses. Now.In the dream state the outer senses are to a large degree restrained in their activity. Therefore the dream state more clearly represents the actual nature of time.Intense emotions within the dream state are experienced as present time, and the personality moves easily through these emotional intensities without experiencing the sense of passing time, although any given dream may contain within it its own time element.在人格的知觉当中，情感在我们所谓的心灵空间占有一定的份量。情感的浓度消退后，你就会觉得事件在时间上仿佛离你远去，不过这是一种你们外在感官产生的错觉。现在，梦境中，外在感官的活动受到很大的限制，因此梦境更清楚代表了时间的实际本质。虽然任何的梦里面都可能包含了自己的时间元素，但是梦境里强烈的情感会被体验为当下，人格可以在这些强烈情感里穿梭自如，而不会感觉到时间流逝。
The dreamer is not aware of the actual passing of physical hours. He is only aware of the interior time element as it appears within the framework of his dream. The personality will be seen to operate in some manners that would be considered quite normal, if he were in the waking state.做梦的人不会意识到实际物理时间的流逝，只会意识到出现在梦架构里面的内在时间元素，此时人格的一些运作方式，就跟醒时一样，看似相当正常。
He acts, speaks, walks, talks, makes certain deductions. He responds to interior stimuli.The personality also operates within the dream state in ways that would not be considered normal in the waking state. He travels through space in moments. He speaks with those who do not exist within physical reality. He sees parents who have died in physical ways, and in his dreams he knows, on many occasions, what other characters think within the dream context.他会行动、会说话、会走路、会聊天、会推理，会对内在刺激起反应。人格在梦境里的另一些运作方式，会与醒时状况不同，所以会看似不正常，像是可以在顷刻之间太空旅行，会跟那些不存在于物质实相的人讲话，会看到肉体已经死亡的父母，而且在梦里的许多状况下，他知道梦境里的其他人心里在想什么。
(Jane smiled, then paused for emphasis.)(珍笑了笑，为了强调，暂停了一会儿。)
You see, then, that while the personality can act in a more or less normal manner while in the dream state, he can also act in ways that are denied him in periods of so-called normal consciousness.He has freedoms and abilities and talents in the dream state of which his waking self may be unfamiliar.所以你们知道了，人格在梦境里固然能以几近正常的方式来行动，但也能以在他所谓正常意识时会拒绝的方式来行动。梦境里，人格拥有许多醒时或许都不认识的自由、能力和天分。
It would seem to be that the waking personality could learn much from his sleeping counterpart, and this is indeed the case.Theoretically speaking, and in theory only, anything that a personality can do or achieve in the sleeping state, he can do and achieve in the waking state.The limitations are those adopted by the ego, in many cases for good reason.看来醒时人格似乎可以从睡觉中的对等自己，学到很多东西，确实是如此。理论上，纯就理论来说，人格在睡觉中能做到或达到的任何事，在他醒着的时候也一样可以做到或达到。其中如果有什么限制，许多状况下都是自我本身基于好理由而甘愿接受。
However the limitations can be diminished, and the waking personality can avail himself of many characteristics shown by the sleeping self.不过这些限制可以减少，对于睡时自己显示出来的许多特质，醒时人格都可以善加利用。
I will suggest your break, and we shall continue.我建议你们休息一下再继续。
(Break at 9:20.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had remained closed.Her pace had picked up as time passed, and by break her delivery was quite fast and businesslike.(9:20分休息。珍第一阶段传述的出离状况一如平常，双眼一直闭着。随着时间过去，速度慢慢加快，到休息前她的口述速度已变得相当快、相当利落。
(Bill Gallagher voiced the thought that during delivery there is always a change in Janes face, but that he couldn't articulate it.He said he has been aware of this since the first session he and Peggy witnessed, the 158th.(比尔·加拉格表示，珍口述时脸上总会有一种变化，但他说不上来。他说，打从他和蓓在第158节课第一次见证时，就注意到了。
(Jane resumed while sitting down and with her eyes closed once more. Again her brogue was apparent, her voice good, her pace fast.Resume at 9:33.)(珍再度闭上眼睛坐下来口述，爱尔兰口音还是很明显，声音适中，节奏快速。9:33分继续。)
The sleeping personality is as close to the inner self as you will come in this existence, for here the personality is soon free of the camouflage concerns with which it must be involved in the waking condition.睡时人格跟内我的接近程度，就和你进到这个存在时的状况一样。人格在醒时状态必须涉入伪装实相，而在睡梦中，人格很快就能摆脱掉对伪装实相的关注。
In the sleeping state we see the personality as it is in operation. We see its abilities and its limitations.Our friend, the Jesuit, will do well to read our dream material, for dreams are a reflection of the needs of a personality and of the abilities.The focus of attention and concentration are magnified a thousand fold in the dream state, and dreams form the basis for your physical environment.在睡眠状态中，我们可以看到人格在运作，看到它的能力和限制。若是我们的朋友耶稣会信徒去读一读梦资料，将得到很好的成效，因为梦反映出人格的需求与能力。在梦境中，注意力聚集和集中在程度可以到千倍之多，而梦形成了你们物质环境的基础。
First, problems are worked out within the dream framework. Answers and solutions are arrived at. These answers and solutions are then transformed into physical reality.No dream is meaningless. No dream lacks purpose. Each dream has meaning to all levels of the personality, and one dream object is a symbol which is translated by all layers of the self, in a mathematics which is more complicated than any dealt with by your physical computers.首先，在梦架构里问题得以解决，答案和解决之道会浮现出来，这些答案和解决之道接着就会转化为物质实相。没有毫无意义的梦，没有毫无目的的梦，每个梦对人格的所有层面都有其意义，梦里的每件事物都是一种象征，由自己的所有层面以数学方式来转译，其运算过程比你们实质电脑的更复杂。
As we have suggested in the past, the dream state can indeed work for your benefit in a more efficient manner, if proper suggestions are given before sleep.The dream fabric itself, the dream drama, is woven of many threads, and all aspects of the personality contribute some of the ingredients.就如我们过去建议的，如果睡前能给予适当的暗示，那么梦境的确能以较有效的方式为你们的利益来工作。梦织物(fabric)本身，梦戏剧，是由许多的线(threads)纺织而成，人格的所有层面都提供了部分的素材。
One dream will enable the ego to solve pressing immediate problems. The dream drama will enable the personality to act out various possibilities which are experienced as reality.The most effective drama is then reacted to in physical reality.梦让自我有能力解决迫在眉睫的问题，梦戏剧使人格可以演出各种不同的可能性，这些可能性都能当成实相来体验。然后最有效的戏剧才会在物质实相中反应出来。
This same dream, however, will deal with many other actualities.It will serve as a method of communication between the various portions of the self.It will deliver information concerning past and future, and if proper suggestions are given it, then the self will use the dream drama particularly to better the overall condition of the personality.不过，这相同的梦，也会与许多其他的现实打交道。它将作为自己各个部分之间的沟通方式。它会传递关于过去和未来的信息，如果给予适当的暗示，那么这个自己就会运用梦戏剧来具体改善人格的整体情况。
There are chemical and electrical connections that cannot be ignored here. For a dream has a chemical reality and an electrical reality.It is built up, on one level, of chemical components that have an electrical basis, and it is through these connections that transformation within the nerve structure of the physical organism is made.这里也有化学和电子上的连结，不能忽视，因为梦有化学实相和电子实相。某层面上来说，梦是由化学成分所组成，而这些化学成分带有电子基础，就是透过这些连结，肉体组织的神经结构才能顺利转换。
The pituitary gland is of great importance here, and the thyroid gland of secondary importance.Negative electrical charges are responsible mainly for the durability of any given dream.The mind, as you know, does not appear within physical reality, although the brain is indeed of physical origin.脑下垂体在这边很重要，其次是甲状腺。任何梦的持久性主要取决于负电荷。如你们所知，虽然大脑的确源自于物质，但心灵(mind)并不会显现在物质实相里。
Our dreams therefore occupy the same space as is occupied by the mind—no space at all.There still must be a connection with the physical organism, and here our chemical and electrical components enter in.Each dream is actually built up through a chemical synthesis that follows strong electrical pathways.因此，我们的梦所占有的空间大小就跟心灵一样——也就是完全不占空间。但梦仍必须与肉体组织相连，好让我们的化学和电子成分进来。每个梦实际上是透过化学合成，沿着强烈的电子路径建构而成。
You recall that all experience has an electrical reality, deposited from birth within the physical cells of the body, so that at physical death we have an electrical counterpart of the physical being with all memory and experience intact.Were such experience a part of the physical self, and dependent upon it, the personality could hardly survive physical death.And were dreams so connected to the physical self, then whole areas of the personality would dissolve with physical extinction.你们回想一下，所有的经验都有一个电子实相，打从出生时就寄存在肉体细胞里，以便在肉体死亡时，我们会有一个物质存在的电子对等人物，带着所有完整的记忆和经验。如果这样的经验隶属于肉体自己的一部分，且依赖着肉体，那么该人格几乎就无法从肉体死亡中幸存下来。如果梦跟肉体的自己连结得这么紧，那么人格的所有区域就会随着肉体的灭绝而消失。
As it is these dreams, having an electrical reality, are deposited in coded form, with all other experience, within but independent of the physical cells.Dream experience is as real to the personality as waking experience. Only the ego makes any distinction.Therefore the personality that has survived makes no distinction on its own.事实上，具有电子实相的这些梦，连带其他所有的经验，会以锁码的方式一起寄存在肉体细胞里面，却又独立肉体细胞。对人格来说，梦经验就跟醒时经验一样真实，只有自我会去做各种区分。因此，存活下来的人格本身并不会去区分。
I suggest your break, and we shall continue.It is nice to have such friendly guests.I do not grow weary of speaking to Joseph but it is good to have an audience, particularly when one is a Jesuit in spirit, although I believe he does not follow certain Jesuit rules.我建议你们休息一下，之后我们再继续。有这么友善的客人真好。虽然单独跟约瑟讲话不会让我感到无聊，但有观众更好，尤其是一位在精神上信仰耶稣会的教徒，不过我认为他并不会遵守耶稣会戒律。
([Bill G:J “You ’re a most interesting speaker, Seth.”)([比尔•加拉格：]“赛斯，你的演讲真有趣。”)
I try.我尽力而为。
(Break at 9:57.Jane was quite well dissociated, she said.Her eyes had remained closed. Her pace had been fast, her voice good, with more than a touch of brogue at times.(9:57分休息。珍说她出离得相当好。她一直闭着眼睛，节奏很快，声音适中，有时有爱尔兰腔调。
(Bill Gallagher said that in his opinion Jane, when speaking as Jane, doesn't move her facial muscles the same as Seth does.Seth forms his words more carefully and distinctly, Bill said, and this effort shows.(比尔·加拉格说，依他自己的观点来看，珍以自己的身分讲话时，脸上肌肉的动作跟赛斯不一样。比尔说，赛斯的用字遣词更谨慎、更明确，这种情形显而易见。
(Jane resumed in the same manner, again with her eyes closed, at 10:11.)(10:11分，珍再度闭着眼睛，以同样的方式继续口述。)
We have said this often. However, suggestions should always be given before sleep, that the subconscious will maintain the organic integrity of the physical organism. This is basic.我们经常说，暗示应该要在睡觉前做，如此一来，潜意识会维持肉体组织器官的健全与完整，这一点很基本。
Suggestions should also be given so that a harmonious relationship be maintained among all levels of the personality structure.Suggestions should be given that constructive tendencies are given free reign.Perhaps more important, suggestions should be given that only constructive suggestions will be reacted to.These suggestions give you a leeway.为了人格结构所有层面之间能维持和谐的关系。你们也应该做一些暗示。而且暗示的内容应该是让建设性的倾向可以尽情发展。以下这个暗示也许更重要：只有建设性的暗示才会实现。这些暗示给你们很大的弹性。
(Jane now paused and smiled. Her eyes opened.She looked at Bill Gallagher.)(珍这时候停下来微笑，张开双眼，看着比尔·加拉格。)
I am very pleased, for I opened Ruburt’s eyes earlier, and our Jesuit missed it.When I can put one over on him, then indeed I am doing well.我很开心，因为我刚刚张开了鲁柏的眼睛，我们的耶稣会信徒错过了。每当我可以愚弄他时，我真的都会好好表现一下。
(I missed it too, of course.My eyes are down most of the time as I write, although I have cultivated the habit of looking up at Jane quickly every sentence or so, as a matter of routine.(我当然也错过了。虽然我已经养成一种习惯，只要珍每说一句话，就快速抬头看她一下，但我写字时眼睛大部分还是向下看。
(Jane's eyes were very dark, without highlights.She looked casually at the three of us.)(珍的眼睛相当黑，没有光彩。她偶尔会看看我们3人。)
These simple suggestions will serve to guard the personality from many unfortunate circumstances, and if they are given nightly they will serve as an adequate protection against organic disease, such as ulcers.这些简单的暗示可以保护人格，使他避开许多不幸的遭遇，如果每天晚上都能做这些暗示，就能预防身体疾病，例如溃疡。
(Jane grinned and pointed at Bill.)(珍指着比尔咧嘴而笑。)
A man who has an ulcer, Joseph, he thinks differently than a man who does not have an ulcer.Suggestions such as these will keep problems such as these in the background.约瑟，患有溃疡的人，思考方式不同于没患溃疡的人。这些暗示可以让诸如此类的问题消失。
Such suggestions will serve to protect the integrity of the physical organism, for these suggestions also have an electrical reality and a chemical reality, as your fear of cats has a chemical and an electrical reality that forces you to act within that framework.这样的暗示可以保护肉体组织的健全与完善，因为这些暗示也有一种电子实相和化学实相，就好像你怕猫咪这件事也有一种电子实相和化学实相，会迫使你在那个架构下行事。
(Jane was now speaking to Peggy.)(珍这时对着蓓讲话。)
You have created the framework, and you can remove the framework, as he has created the framework within which an ulcer can have reality.既然你创造了这个架构，那你也能拿掉，就像他(比尔)创造了使溃疡实相会在其内产生的架构一样。
(Our cat, Willy, had been sitting at the foot of Jane's chair.As if by signal Willy now got up and walked toward Peggy, who sat but a few feet away.He brushed against her leg and she involuntarily jumped. The timing was perfect.We all laughed.)(我们的猫威立一直坐在珍的椅脚旁边。这时威立仿佛接获讯号一样，爬起来走向坐在几尺远的蓓。威立抓抓她的脚，她不由自主地跳开，时间配合得恰恰好，我们大家都笑了。)
I am amused.我也被逗乐了。
Because suggestions do have an electrical and a chemical reality, they can therefore change the framework within which you operate.Theoretically there are no limitations to what any of you can do. Practically the limitations are your own, and practically it is within your province to change them or not to change them.暗示的确有其电子与化学实相，因此可以改变你们在其中运作的那个架构。任何你们想做的事，理论上都没有限制，实际上限制都是来自于你们自己，而且事实上要不要让这些限制改变，就要看你们自己。
Because suggestions are formed of the same stuff that forms your physical reality, suggestions can indeed change the framework within which you operate.This is no Pollyanna hogwash. Many of the ways and the means have been given. My suggestions, if followed, will be fair enough proof of the validity of our material.因为形成暗示的材料跟形成你们物质实相的材料是一样的，所以暗示的确可以改变你们在其中运作的那个架构。这不是胡言乱语，我提供了很多方法和手段，如果能遵循我的建议，就可以强力证实我们资料的可行性。
Do you have a test for me this evening?你今晚要测试我吗？
(“yes.”(“对。”
(It was 10:23.The material had been so interesting that I had forgotten the time.I had planned to hand Jane the test envelope at about 10:00. Her eyes had been open up to this point, but she now closed them and sat waiting quietly while I handed the envelope to Bill; he passed it to Jane.She held it lightly in both hands, her eyes still closed.)(现在是10:23分。由于资料太有意思，让我忘了时间。我原来打算10点左右把测试信封递给珍，她的眼睛从那时起就一直张开到刚才为止，但现在闭着双眼安静坐着，我把信封交给比尔，再由他传给珍。她双手轻轻拿着，双眼仍然闭着。)
I ask that you give us a moment.请给我们一点时间。
These will be impressions.I have the impression of four, f-o-u-r, of something. Of gray, of mood or color.(Pause. Jane shook her head as if in doubt.) The impression of a masterpiece of some kind in connection with what I hold. (Pause.) And something federal. (Pause.)得到一些印象。我有个印象是跟4有关，是灰灰的心情或色调。(停顿，珍摇摇头，似乎有点犹豫)有个印象是某种杰作，跟我手上拿的东西有关。(停顿)联邦政府的某件事物。(停顿)
Ruburt has the impression of something to do with a toothbrush, or toothbrush salesman.鲁伯有个印象，跟牙刷或者牙刷业务员有关。
I have the impression of a door, and of horizontal parallel lines, and a mass.(Pause.)我的印象是一扇门，有水平的平行线，还有一大堆什么东西。(停顿)
I do not bother to state the material is light.It would be obvious; or that we have sealed envelopes.I have the impression of dark, and of a voice, and of initials. I would say again, J. B.我不必刻意说这东西很轻，因为很明显；我们封住了信封。我还有一个印象，包括黑暗、声音和英文名字的开头字母，这次还是J.B.
We will now take a break or end the session.我们现在就休息一下，要不然就结束这节课。
(“We’ll take a very short break then.”(“那我们就稍微休息一下好了。”
(Break at 10:28.Jane was dissociated as usual.She said she had no visual data during the material on the test; just the thought of the toothbrush and of herself. Her eyes remained closed until break.(10:28分休息。珍的出离状况如常，她说在测试时并没有获得影像资料；只想到牙刷和她自己，双眼到休息前一直都闭着。

(As usual, some of the test material obviously applied, and other statements seemingly did not.By now however we have learned that material in the latter category is not necessarily distorted; it could merely be another example of the sometimes far-reaching impressions that attach themselves to test objects.Seth has said very little about the reasons for this.So we were now curious to learn what application, if any, such statements as four, a masterpiece, a voice, etc., had to the test object.Again see my sketch of the photographic negative on page 255.(跟平常一样，有些测试资料显然说中了，有些似乎没有。不过，此时我们也知道后面部分的资料未必遭到扭曲；可能只是有时候对测试物品本身产生的另一种广泛的印象。对于这种情形的原因，赛斯几乎没提到。所以我们现在很好奇想知道，像4、杰作、声音等这类描述，对测试物品说中了多少。请再参看我上面的底片素描。
(Jane resumed in the same good voice, and with her eyes closed, at 10:40.)(10:40分，珍闭着眼睛继续口述，声音一样很恰当。)
The photograph was taken at four o’clock in the afternoon.这张照片是在下午4点拍的。
The voice referred to a singer who sang on the bandstand while you danced.声音指的是你们跳舞时在台上唱歌的一位歌手。
The federal represented all I could get through to Ruburt, I am sorry to say, concerning the fact that the building was a large one.He had the idea from my information of a large federal building.联邦政府代表所有我能传达给鲁柏的讯息，很抱歉我必须这样说，那是有关那栋建筑气势雄伟的这个事实。他从我的讯息中得到的概念是气势雄伟的联邦政府建筑。
The other statements are obvious.We are in a training period, and will progress. And I hope rapidly.其他的表述就很清楚了。我们还在训练阶段，会再进步，我希望进步神速。
(I did not realize at the time that Seth did not explain the masterpiece statement; I could have asked otherwise.Jane's manner now turned more humorous.Her eyes opened again.She smiled, and looked back and forth among the three of us as she spoke with quite a bit of animation.)(这时候我不懂为什么赛斯没解释到杰作的描述；其实我那时应该也可以问问。珍现在的态度变得较为风趣，再度张开眼睛，微笑着，眼光来回看着我们3人，讲话相当生动活泼。)
Ruburt is still rather nervous in our tests; even with his good friends present, oh he is so frightened!However we are making headway in this respect, and he will learn with experience.He is hardheaded. In many ways this is to our benefit.In the overall we will want more specific information. It must come in a more clear manner, and so it shall.鲁柏在我们的测试中仍然相当紧张；即便他的好朋友在场也一样，喔，他真的吓坏了！不过我们这方面仍在进步当中，他会从经验中学习。他很顽固，这在很多方面对我们有利。整体来说，我们想要更明确的讯息，必须以更清楚的方式进来，未来也会如此。
We shall do things here. It may take time.我们在这里会做一些事，可能要花点时间。
(Jane's eyes had closed briefly.Now she looked at Peggy and smiled.)(珍短暂闭了一下眼睛。她现在露出微笑，盯着蓓看。)
Our cat lover is embarrassed when he looks at me.我们的爱猫人士在看我时，他自己会觉得不好意思。
([Peggy smiling:] “Why would you say that?You said “he” when you spoke to me.”)([蓓笑着说：]“你为什么这么说呢？你对着我讲话时用“他。”这个字。)
Because—I say he advisedly, and we shall go into that at a later occasion—because he is not sure who he is looking at. A natural reaction.因为——我刻意要说他，我们以后有机会再仔细谈谈这部分——因为他不确定他看的是谁，一种自然的反应。
(This little exchange was interesting to Jane and me.It will be remembered that Janes entity name is Ruburt, and that Seth refers to Ruburt as “he”; our interpretation of this being that Jane's entity is male-oriented in the overall sense.Many sessions ago however Seth explained that this male or female orientation had little if anything to do with sex as we conceive it.(这一段简短的对话对我和珍来讲非常有趣。大家应该记得，珍的存有名叫鲁柏，赛斯以“他”来指称鲁柏；我们对这种情形的诠释是，就整体感觉而言，珍的存有是男性取向。不过在许多节之前，赛斯解释过，这种男性或女性取向与我们以为的性别，没什么关系。
(Peggy's entity name is Aniac, given by Seth in the 158th session.Seth has given little information on Pegs entity, but his use of “he” evidently means that Peg's entity, like Jane's, is male-oriented.(蓓的存有名叫安妮雅克，那是赛斯在第158节里为她取的。赛斯很少提到蓓的存有，但他用“他”来称呼，显然是指蓓的存有，就像珍的存有一样，是男性取向。
(Jane now pointed at Bill.)(珍现在指着比尔。)
He is so busy looking that he is hardly embarrassed.他忙着观察，所以根本不会觉得不好意思。
(This was a reference to Bill’s habit of closely scrutinizing Jane as she delivers the material.(这是指珍在传述资料时，比尔会近距离仔细观察她的这个习惯。
([Peggy:] “I don’t think embarrassed is the right word.”)([蓓：]“我认为不好意思一词在这里用得不好。”)
You may choose a better one.你可以选个比较好的用词。
([Bill:] “You fell into the trap, Peggy.”)([比尔：]“蓓，你中计了。”)
I watch Joseph's hand. I will be glad to give suggestions when you remind me, so that your hand will not tire, and so that I do not tire our friends.我看到约瑟的手，如果你提醒我，我会乐意提供一些建议，好让你的手不会太累，而我也不会把我们的朋友搞得疲惫不堪。
I will indeed, with due regrets, end our session.For I do indeed hesitate as always to leave you—很抱歉，我真的要结束我们的课了。一如往常，我实在舍不得离开你们——
(Jane's voice abruptly rose in volume until it became very loud.I winced the strong voice subsided quickly.)(珍突然拉开嗓门，一直到变得非常大声为止。我皱起了眉头；那强烈的声音很快就平息下来。)
—and it is not because I am weary———这不是因为我累了——
(“Yes.”)(“是。”)
—but because I have sympathy for the limitations of your endurance.I will answer any questions put to me kindly.——而是因为我同情你们的耐力有限。我的态度会很亲切，回答任何我收到的问题。
([Peggy:] “Why did you say that a man who has ulcers thinks differently?”)([蓓：]“为什么你会说，患有溃疡的人思考方式跟没患溃疡的人不一样?”)
Simple questions.It is because the man thinks differently that he has the ulcer, for the ulcer is the result of his characteristic method of thought. It is the result of his characteristic manner of viewing reality.This causes him to add to his self-image, in reality, that disability.The ulcer is formed intimately from the electrical reality that composes his thoughts.Do you find that a satisfactory answer?简单的问题。那是因为他认为自己有溃疡的关系，光这一点就跟别人不一样，溃疡是来自于他特有的思考方式，那是他自己看待实相的特别方式造成的结果。事实上，这种情形导致他加强了那种无能的自我形象。那个溃疡显然是由组成他思想的电子实相所形成。这个答案你觉得满意吗？
([Peggy:] “Yes, very definitely. ’’([蓓：]“没错，确实如此。”
(Jane turned to Bill.)(珍转向比尔。)
And do you—should I say dear father—你——或许我该说，亲爱的神父——
([Bill:] “Yes, my son—”)([比尔：]“是的，我的孩子”)
—have any questions or remarks?——有任何问题或什么话要说吗?
([Bill, still laughing:] “I’m afraid not.Not at this time.")([比尔笑着说：]“我想没有。这次没有。”)
I will then close the session.My heartiest regards to you all.Good evening!那我就结束这节课了。为各位致上我最衷心的祝福。晚安!
(Jane really blasted out the good evening.(珍那句晚安真的很大声。
([Bill:] “Good night, Seth, and thank you.”([比尔：]“赛斯晚安，谢谢。”
(“Good night, Seth.”(“赛斯晚安。”
(End at 10:50.Jane was dissociated as usual. It was evident that Seth enjoyed the exchange at the end of the session.Jane's eyes remained open until the end.)(10:50分结束。珍的出离状况如常，赛斯显然对结束前的那段对话感到很高兴，珍的眼睛到结束前都睁着。)

SESSION 188 第188节　梦的构成 梦影像


SEPTEMBER 15, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年9月15日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(As it developed tonight’s session was a short one.Several of the young people I work with planned to gather this evening in the downstairs apartment.The young couple mentioned in the 184th session live downstairs, and I also work with them.There was talk at work this morning that the whole group might visit us this evening.I relayed the information to Jane at noon, and suggested she decide whether she wanted to hold a session with the idea that it might be interrupted.(看样子今晚的课不会太长。跟我一起工作的几个年轻小伙子，今晚打算到楼下聚会。第184节中提及的那对夫妻住在楼下，我也跟他们一起共事。今天早上上班时，这群年轻人曾提到今晚大伙儿可能会来拜访我们。我中午将这个讯息转达给珍，并建议由她来决定今晚的课是否要举行，因为我们的课可能会受到干扰。
(Jane's first thought was to skip the session, but as the party downstairs got under way in a quiet fashion, and we were not called upon as 9 PM approached, she decided to hold it as usual.(珍本来的打算是跳过这节课，不过因为楼下的聚会很安静，而且接近晚上9点时，他们都还没来访，所以她决定照常举行。
(Shortly before session time Jane told me she had the thought that dreams and astral travel or the astral body, were somehow connected.The session was held in our small back room. Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her voice was quiet, her pace quite slow and with pauses.)(珍上课前一刻告诉我，她有一个意念，与梦和灵体旅行[astral travel]或灵体有些相关。这节课在我们后面的小房间举行，珍坐下来，闭上眼睛开始说话，声音轻柔，停顿几次。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Ruburt prepares himself in certain ways for our sessions. He forms a certain psychic and psychological framework, within which we operate.When there is question as to whether or not a particular session will be held, it is more difficult for him to make these preparations.为了我们的课，鲁柏用了某些方法让自己准备好，他组织了某种心灵及心理架构，让我们在里面运作。对他而言，碰到某节课是否要如期举行的问题时，让他更不容易做这些准备。
We will now continue with our previous discussion, and carry it further.我们现在继续之前的讨论，并进一步探究。
There are indeed connections between what is called ectoplasm and the composition of dream images.They are not the same thing, but they are closely allied.What is called the astral body is also composed of some of the same components.所谓的灵质(注：ectoplsm生物学上是“外胚层质”，心灵学上为“(灵媒在降神的出神状态中发出的)灵的外质，灵气”。)与梦影像的成分，两者其实相关。它们并不是一样的东西，但关系密切。所谓的灵体(astral body)也是由一些同样的成分所组成。
It goes without saying that dream images certainly have form to the dreamer, even as physical objects have form. The astral body also has a form.These forms do not take up space in the way that physical objects do. There is less density, but there is still observable form.The images that appear in dreams exist as forms in another dimension. They are free of the necessity to follow physical rules of time and growth. They are constructed more immediately and directly and spontaneously than are physical objects.对做梦的人来说，梦影像当然有外形，就像实质物体有外形一样，而灵体也有其外形。这些外形并不像实质物体一样占有空间，它们的密度比较低，但是外形依然可见。出现在梦里的影像，是以另一个维度中的外形存在，不需要依循时间和成长的物质法则，它们的形成比实体物质更快速、更直接，且更有自发性。
There must be a connection however with the physical organism, and the connection, the physical connection, is both electrical and chemical.The connection between what you might call materializations, and the physical organism, are also electrical and chemical.The same applies to the connection between the astral body and the physical body.不过，与肉体组织也必定有连结，而这种肉体上的连结兼具电子与化学性。你们可能称为具体化的现象，与肉体组织之间的连结也具有电子与化学性。灵体与肉体间的连结也是如此。
Dream images are indeed, in density, between the tangible nature of physical objects and the intangible reality that is entirely independent of physical matter.The dream reality cannot be entirely disconnected from the material universe because of its connections with human personality.There is a dependence here.事实上梦影像的密度，介于以下两者之间；一个是实质物体有形的本质，另一个是完全独立于实体物质之外无形的实相。由于梦实相与人类人格相互连结，因此梦实相与物质宇宙无法完全脱离关系。这里存在着依赖关系。
The dream images however are projections sent out, so to speak, by the personality, and many astral projections occur within the dream state of which the waking personality is unaware.In this case the projection is simply of a kind that allows manipulation back and forth between two realities.The dreamer who dreams he was in Paris may well have been there.可以这么说，梦影像是人格向外的一种投射，梦里面会产生许多醒时人格未觉察到的灵体投射。这种情形下，投射只不过是一种可以在两种实相之间来回操弄的方法。一个梦到自己在巴黎的人，极有可能早就去过那里了。
Dream images, not astral projections, operate within certain electrical limits, limits that form the boundaries of the dream universe.Dream images are nevertheless almost fibrous projections, almost a thinned-out composition, more plastic basically than physical matter, but composed of a number of the same properties.For again there must be this connection between the nature of dreams and the matter of physical reality.梦影像，非灵体投射，在动作时受到某些电子上的限制，这些限制形成了梦宇宙的界限。然而，梦影像几乎都是类似纤维状的投射，是一种近乎稀稀疏疏的组合结构，基本上来说，它们比实体物质还具有可塑性，不过是由许多相同的属性所组成。再说一次，梦的本质与物质实相的东西，两者间必定有这种连结。
(During her delivery of the above paragraph Jane's eyes opened, then closed. They were very dark.She continued to open and close them until break.)(珍在传述上面这段资料时眼睛张开，随后又闭上，双眼非常黑，就这样开开合合，一直到休息的时候。)
We will use an analogy for its excellent implications. It is as if the personality in sleep projected out of himself bits of himself, of his own physical matter, thinned out, stretched into an amazing plasticity; plastic properties that can change instantly from one form to another.He goes out with these portions of himself, but because of the nature of reality projections cannot be recalled.我们会打个意味深远的比方，就好比一个睡觉的人，从他自己里面投射出些微的自己、些微自己的物质，薄薄淡淡的，具有惊人的延展性与可塑性，其可塑性足以从原来的形状立刻变成另一种形状。他就跟着这些部分的自己走出去，但因为实相本质的关系，这些投射并不能召回。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:25.Jane said she was dissociated as usual for a first break. She reported a “weird” feeling however.She was aware that the material was good, yet at the same time she felt annoyed and distracted.We thought this stemmed from the fear of interruption because of the party downstairs, though we heard nothing.(9:25休息。珍说她第一阶段的出离状况一如平常，不过，她也表示说有种“古怪”的感觉。她知道资料很不错，不过同时却也觉得被打扰和分心。我们认为这应该是怕被楼下聚会干扰而造成的恐惧，虽然我们听不到任何声音。
(Jane said she was even conscious of my movements, slight as they were.The night seemed rather close also, so we had to open a window.Even though the window was on the side of the house, we immediately became aware of some traffic noise.(珍说，她甚至可以意识到我的动作轻轻的。今晚天气似乎也相当闷，我们得打开窗户。虽然窗户是在房子的侧边，但我们马上就感觉到一些车子的噪音。
(Jane resumed in the same quiet voice, with pauses, and with her eyes closed, at 9:36.)(9:36分，珍闭着眼睛继续口述，声音同样轻柔，中间停顿了几次。)
Dreams are a continuous process.梦是一种连续的过程。
You create them both waking and sleeping, although you are not aware of them in the waking state.You constantly project and constantly emit energy in meaningful patterns on as many layers of activity as possible.你们醒时和睡时都在创造梦，虽然你们在醒时状态中并未觉察到它们。你们经常以富有意义的方式，尽可能在许多活动层面投射和释放能量。
These are quite legitimate realities that continue in their own fashion, even though you are no longer concerned with them.They remain connected to you, that is to the personality, however, and are a part of the overall reality of the self.You partake of their energy.这些是相当合理的实相，以本身的方式持续着，即便你对它们不再关注。它们与你，也就是与人格，都一直保持着连结，它们也是自己全部实相的一部分。你分享了它们的能量。
(Jane had been using pauses while speaking.Now however she took what turned out to be the longest pause that I have noted during these sessions.It was just two minutes long by the clock.During this time she sat quite still in her chair, her eyes closed, her head down with one hand lifted to her face.)(珍说话时一直停顿。现在她又停下来，而且是上课以来停顿记录最长的一次。看看时钟，停顿时间刚好长达两分钟。停顿时，她低着头，一手托腮，眼睛仍然闭着，相当安静地坐在椅子上。)
Oftentimes you send out dream images within a dream framework from your own nerve centers.These then work out problems for you, and the answer is given to you subconsciously.在梦架构里，你们时常从你们自己的神经中心送出梦影像。接着这些梦影像会为你们解决问题，以潜意识的方式提供答案给你们。
This material will be extremely interesting, and is somewhat difficult.Because Ruburt is not at his best I am going to close our session, and give you this material at our next regular meeting.这些资料非常有趣，不过有一些难度。鲁柏目前不是处在最佳状况，所以我就要结束我们的课，等到下次定期课再给你们这部分资料。
The reality and the framework within which these sessions exist have electrical and chemical organizations also, that require a delicate focus that was upset this evening.It is simply more difficult then for Ruburt to make the necessary inner adjustments.这些课赖以存在其中的实相和架构，也具有电子和化学性的组织，需要专心一致的聚焦，不过今晚的注意力被打乱了。对鲁柏而言，要他做必要的内在调整无疑就更为困难。
Distractions, or fear of distractions, have their own reality, and set up strongly positive electrical charges which can be detrimental, although other conditions, chemical and electrical conditions, must also be considered.We do have a good start however.分心，或对分心的恐惧，有它们自己的实相，而且会大量形成可能有害的正电荷，不过其他状况，也就是化学上和电子上的状况，也必须纳入考虑。但话说回来，我们的确有个好的开始。
My heartiest regards to you both.If there is anything you would like to say, Joseph, by all means do so.为你们两送上我最衷心的祝福。约瑟，如果你还有什么话要说，就尽管说吧。
(I didn’t think it wise, considering Jane 's mood.)(“我想没有。”)(考虑到珍的状况，我还是不提为妙。)
Then we will end our session.那我们这节课就结束吧。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“赛斯晚安。”
(End at 9:49.Jane was dissociated as usual. She was however still bothered and upset; this time the traffic noise contributed.Her eyes remained closed, her voice quiet.(9:49结束。珍的出离状况如常，不过她仍然受到了干扰，觉得心神不宁；这次是因为汽车噪音的关系。她双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔。
(Jane said she was even conscious of the sound my pen made on the paper as I wrote.I always work on several thicknesses of paper so that writing noise is not a problem, and use a ballpoint pen to avoid scratching noises.Ordinarily Jane has excellent hearing; she must have super acuity in the trance state.(珍说，她甚至可以意识到我做笔记时笔在纸上发出的声音。为了让写字声音不致造成困扰，我一向都在好几层纸张上做笔记，同时也用原子笔以避免笔尖发出刷刷的摩擦声音。珍的听觉平常就相当好；她在出神状态下听力一定超级敏锐。

SESSION 189 第189节 第一次千里眼试验 梦影像构建 信封8


SEPTEMBER 20, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年9月20日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(Last week we received Dr. Instreams letter of September 13, in which he wrote that he would like to try straight clairvoyant communication with Seth on Monday and Wednesday nights at 10 PM.Dr. Instream also noted that on the evening of August 23,1965 he and his wife stopped overnight at York Beach, ME, while traveling.(上周我们接到殷斯翠姆博士9月13日的来信，内容提及他想在星期一和星期三晚上10点，直接以千里眼的方式跟赛斯沟通。殷斯翠姆博士也提到，1965年8月23日晚上，他和太太旅行到了缅因州的约克海滩，在那边过夜。
It will be remembered that Janes second envelope test was held on the night of August 23, in the 180th session, and that the test photo featured Jane on the waterfront at York Beach.I took the picture in the summer of 1964.大家应该记得，珍第180节课中的第二次信封测试，就是在8月23日晚上举行，测试信封里的主角，正是在约克海滩旁边的珍。那张照片是我在1964年夏天拍摄。
(Dr. Instream would like us to ask Seth why he stopped at York Beach, since he had never been there before.For our part we want to know whether Dr. Instream understands that he was in York Beach on the same night a photo of York Beach was used in a session, or whether he remembers reading about York Beach in previous sessions.(殷斯翠姆博士想要我们问赛斯，为什么他会在约克海滩停留，因为他从来就不曾到过那儿。而我们这边想知道的是，殷斯翠姆博士是否知道就在他去约克海滩的那天晚上，赛斯课正好也用到约克海滩的照片，或者他是否记得读过前面关于约克海滩的上课资料。
(In preparation for her next book, which will deal with the Seth material itself Jane made an exploratory trip to several county records offices in Elmira; she is beginning an effort to track down Frank Watts.She accomplished a little, and met some helpful people; she enjoyed the quest.(珍为了替下一本书作准备，探访了埃尔迈拉的几个历史档案馆，那本书要探讨的就是赛斯资料；她正开始努力追查法兰克·沃兹的来龙去脉，已完成了一小部分，也得到了一些贵人相助；对这次的探索调查感到很开心。
(The double test envelope for the 8th test contained a page from an old novel of Janes entitled The Adult Time.She wrote this seven or eight years ago, and it was never published.The page is not numbered. I rummaged through her files and pulled out a page at random. I folded it in quarters and sealed it up.(第8次双层测试信封内，装的是珍一本旧小说《成人时光》[The Adult Time]里的一页。那是她7、8年前写的。不曾出版，该页并没有页码，我翻阅她的档案资料，随手抽出这一页，把它对折再对折，再放入信封里封住。
(It was a very hot and humid night but we held the session in our small back room. We opened the windows however.Jane said she felt a little nervous, embarking on the clairvoyant tests with Dr. Instream. She also felt anticipatory.She began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet.She used many pauses.)(今晚天气非常湿热，课就在我们后面的小房间举行，不过我们开了窗户。珍说要与殷斯翠姆博士做千里眼测试，让她觉得有点紧张，她事先也感觉到了。她坐下来开始讲话，双眼闭着，声音相当轻柔，停顿多次。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
We will go more deeply into a discussion of the ways and means by which both dream images and other materializations are constructed.For there are various balances, or rather various delicate imbalances, which must be maintained; and there are differences also in the makeup of dream images, which are usually seen only by the dreamer, and some other more physical materializations which may be created by the semi-waking self, and under certain circumstances seen by others.我们会进一步探讨，梦影像和其他具体化现象形成的方式或方法。因为有各种不同的平衡，或是各式各样巧妙的不平衡，这些都必须维持。梦影像的构成也有差异，通常只有做梦的人才看得到，至于其他较为物质具体化的现象，则可能是由半清醒状态的自己所创造，而其他人得在特定情况下才看得到。
Nerve patterns are indeed very important here, and mechanisms of metabolism.An understanding of the methods used by the dreamer to construct dream images will, however, allow you to understand more clearly those other constructions.The chemical percentages are important here; that is, the chemical percentages vary from those found in the body during what you call normal states of consciousness.事实上，神经的形式在这里非常重要，新陈代谢机制也是如此。然而，了解做梦的人如何建构其梦影像的方法，也可以让你们更清楚了解其他方面的建构。化学的比例在这里也很重要；也就是说，做梦时的化学比例，不同于你们所谓的正常意识状态下身体呈现的化学比例。
Dream images are composed in part as a result of chemical excesses that are built up normally by the organism in the waking state.Physical materializations are built up by bringing about this condition of excessive chemical action.梦影像的组成，某部分是由有机体在醒时状态中，正常产生的过量化学成分所导致。化学成分过量的情况，形成了物质具体化的现象。
It is true that a state can be produced in which such materializations can occur, by artificially producing the chemical imbalance necessary.However, success by this method may or may not occur.借由人工制造出必要的化学失衡，的确可以营造出一种情境，让这样的物质化现象得以产生。不过，这种方法有时会成功，有时则否。
I am keeping your York Beach material until later in the session, close to the ten o’clock hour.有关你们约克海滩的资料，我会留待本节课稍后接近10点时再讲。
The material of which we are speaking—我们正在谈的资料——
(There came a knock on a window from the front of the house. The loud, brittle sound was clearly audible through the closed door. Jane came out of her trance without effort.Our first impulse was not to acknowledge the sound, but since it was unusual we did so.It proved that a TV antenna had been loosened over our porch roof, and a repairman asked us for the loan of a flashlight.We told him we were at work in the back of the apartment, and left the light with him.(这时，我们房子前面传来了敲窗户的声音，那响亮尖锐的声音隔着闭上的房门，还是听得一清二楚，珍轻易地回神了。我们当下第一个想法是不予理会，不过因为这种事并不寻常，所以还是回应了。结果是我们门廊屋顶上方的一条天线松脱，有位维修人员要跟我们借手电筒。我们告诉他，我们正在屋后忙，然后把手电筒留给他。
(I was somewhat irritated by the interruption, since we use the cramped back room to avoid such incidents.But Jane told me not to worry, that the session was going to be a good one, that she felt Seth coming through well.(这次中断还是让我觉得有点烦，因为我们使用后面这个狭窄的房间，原本为的就是要避免这样的事情。不过珍叫我不用担心，说这节课会很不错，她也觉得赛斯穿越得非常好。
(The interruption occurred at 9:11. Jane resumed at 9:15.)(这次中断发生在9:11分，9:15分珍继续口述。
This material will be most helpful in our own sessions, since when we are finished with it you will understand to some degree those conditions which may be advantageous and those which are not.在我们的课里面，这部分的资料相当有帮助，我们讲完这部分后，你们或多或少就会明白哪些情况有利，哪些情况不利。
The electrical composition of the air is important, as you have read, and the periods of even temperature and fair weather are excellent for our purposes.就如你们已知的，空气中的电子成分有其重要性，平衡的温度和晴朗的天气对我们的目的极为有利。
(Jane's eyes now opened. This was quite early in the session for such a step.They did not open fully; Jane looked casually at me, and about the room, from beneath half lowered lids.Her eyes closed at the end of the following paragraph.)(珍这时张开眼睛，在课堂中这样的举动算是相当早，双眼并没有完全张开；偶尔会从半开的眼睛中看看我、看看房间。她在下面这一段的结尾闭上眼睛。)
The evening hours are best, and it was for this reason that I chose them.By this hour there is apt to be a stability of electromagnetic properties, though of course this is not always the case.Since all things have an electrical and chemical reality, the food that you eat is also important, and it is for this reason that I made certain suggestions concerning your diet.晚间时光最好，这也是我为什么选择晚上上课的原因。这段时间的电磁容易稳定，当然也不一定统统都是如此。由于所有东西都有其电子和化学实相，所以你们吃的食物也很重要，基于这个原因，我曾提供一些有关饮食的建议给你们。
(See the 185th session.)(见第185节。)
These suggestions, as you know, were far from extreme. The exercises that I suggested Ruburt take also aid him in utilizing negative ions.Each individual has various ways in which he or she characteristically handles the protoplastic elements of which the physical being is composed.你们也知道，这些建议一点都不离谱，我建议鲁柏采行的做法也可以帮助他善加利用负离子。对于形成物质存在的原生质(protoplasm)元素，每个人都有自己不同的特别处理方式。
The protoplasm is not entirely physical, however, but in a basic manner is a meeting ground between physical matter and inner vitality.Therefore the characteristic ways used by any given personality, in connection with his or her physical image, will also be used in the construction of dream images.不过，原生质不全然是物质性的，基本上也是实体物质和内在活力之间的交会场所。因此，任何人格都会使用一些与自己的肉体形象相关的特有方式，也会将这些特有方式用来建构梦影像。
The dream images are indeed extensions, not only of the psychic or inner self, but a definite extension of the electromagnetic and chemical properties that operate through the physical self.It is indeed as if extensions of nerve endings reached out in self-expansion, making new connections, and this is indeed what occurs in the creation of dream images.梦影像真的不仅是心灵或内我的延伸，确实也是电磁和化学特性的延伸，而电磁和化学特性会透过物质的自己运作。实际上，仿佛就像神经末梢的分支，透过自我扩展往外延伸出去，形成了新的连结，梦影像的创造就是这么一回事。
I will nowdi suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:27.Jane was very well dissociated for a first delivery, she said. Where in the last session everything had bothered her, even the sound of my writing, tonight nothing bothered her, not even the interruption.Her eyes were closed most of the time.(9:27分休息。珍说第一阶段传述的出离状况非常好，前一次上课时，大大小小的事都会干扰到她，甚至连我写字的声音都会，但今晚任何事都干扰不了她，甚至被打断了也无所谓。她的双眼大部分时间都闭着。
(Jane now told me she thought the “two people" referred to by Seth in the 2nd envelope test in the 180th session, were Dr. Instream and his wife Judy.See page 209. I have a few side notes here.这里我还有一些附带说明。
One. Interruptions in themselves will not bother us once a session is under way.You may follow whatever course you personally prefer, as circumstances warrant.第一，一旦开始上课，中途被打断就不会干扰到我们。只要情况允许，你可以跟随你个人喜欢的路线来进行。
As far as Ruburt is concerned, uncertainty as to whether or not a session will be held, is disturbing.There will be some circumstances when conditions are not of the best, however, when interruptions may bother.But generally we are beyond such disturbances.就鲁柏来说，课举行与否的不确定性令她困扰。而总有一些时候并不是处在最佳状况，中断可能会造成干扰。不过一般来说，我们都能克服这样的困扰
You have noticed, I am sure, that at times visitors to a session are of definite value, for the psychic energy is pooled, and can be of value.The emotional impetus, when it is present, is also of benefit.Now in the same manner you can use and collect such energy when you are in a group, as in your Saturday evening excursions.我很确定，你们应该已经注意到，课堂上的访客有时候有一定的价值，由于心灵能量会灌注进来，因此带来价值。情感的动力一旦出现时，也有其益处。当你们身处一个团体之中，便能以同样的方式利用并汇集这样的能量，就像你们星期六晚上的短途旅行一样。
There is actually a quite natural and most effective manner of psychic refreshment, and most particularly when the conscious mind is somewhat diverted, as by music and so forth.The intuitions act well under such circumstances, and these intuitions are stored subconsciously, and will show themselves in your work.实事上，有一种心灵净化的方法，相当自然也极为有效，最特别的是像音乐这类东西，可以让意识心稍微转移注意力。在这样的情境下，直觉可以运作得非常好，这些直觉会储藏在潜意识里，并在你们的工作上显现出来。
There is indeed a knack required here. Primitive peoples use it all unknowing.Unfortunately, in civilized conditions it sometimes needs relearning.All methods of gaining and renewing energy are important, in ordinary living and in our sessions.这里其实需要个小诀窍，古代人不知不觉中就会用上这个诀窍。但令人遗憾的是，在文明的环境里，有时候却需要重新学习。在日常生活和我们的课堂中，所有获得和更新能量的方法都很重要。
Ruburt picked up energy in this way this afternoon, quite spontaneously, and without conscious consideration.鲁伯今天下午就以这样的方式获得了能量，相当自然，没经过头脑有意识的思考。
(Here Seth refers to Janes trip downtown to the records offices, in search of data on Frank Watts.She was somewhat uneasy setting out on her journey, but wound up enjoying the afternoon a great deal.)(这里赛斯指的是，珍为了寻找法兰克·沃兹的资料，而到城里历史档案馆的那趟旅行。她出发时还有些不安，但结果是欢度了一个愉快的下午。)
There will be more said concerning this matter, since the same sort of mechanism is involved in the construction of materializations, in sessions such as this one, and in the construction of dream images.对于这件事，我还有话要补充，因为这类的作用原理，与物质建构、类似本次内容的课程、梦影像的形成都相关。
A discrimination, preferably a spontaneous and subconscious discrimination, is necessary, but it may be consciously diverted if undue conscious direction is not allowed to rule with a heavy hand.You may consciously give the suggestion to yourself, that you will constructively use such energy, for example, but then the matter should be forgotten and left alone.辨识力有其必要，而且最好是自发、潜意识的辨识力，只要不允许不当的意识方向采取高压统治，这种辨识力就可以在有意识的情况下转移开来。举例来说，你可以有意识地暗示自己说，你会建设性地使用这样的能量，但之后就该将这件事置之一旁，忘了它的存在。
The suggestion itself, psychologically, also prevents you from simply being swept away, willy-nilly, by the collective energy.You must understand that use of such energy does in no way suggest monopolizing it. You do not deprive others. Your own actions continue to produce additional energy.This method of utilizing energy is also used in the creation of dream images.The form of the images is not an illusion. You simply have form without mass, to all practical purposes, and there is no contradiction in that statement.就心理层面来说，暗示本身也可以使你免于无奈地被汇集的能量卷走。你们必须了解，这种能量的使用绝不是意味着据为己有，你不用剥夺其他人的能量，你自己的行动会继续产生额外的能量。这种利用能量的方法，也可以用来创造梦影像。影像的外形并不是一种幻觉，实际上，你只拥有外形而没有质量，我这么说并没有矛盾之处。
Mass and form may seem synonymous, but they are not.Mass is not dependent upon weight. We may say however that dream images have a density which is formed of electrical intensities, that are partially the result of chemical actions.质量与外形看似是同义词，但事实上并不相同。质量并不是依赖重要，而我们可以说，梦影像有它的密度，是由各种不同的电子强度所组成，某部分也是化学行动造成的结果。
You may take a brief break, and we shall consider other matters, and then perhaps return to this material.你们可以休息一下，我们会探讨别的事情，接着或许会回到这部分的资料。

Ruburt, or Jane Butts , in this case was the emotional connection.The test itself involved however a particular photograph that was of Jane Butts at York Beach, and in which the Instreams did not appear.I was not able to make the distinction clear to Ruburt, for it was definitely not a photograph of the Instreams.这种情形下，鲁柏或是珍·柏兹(Jane Butts)是情感上的连结。不过，实际上测试内容就是珍·柏兹在约克海滩的那一张照片，殷斯翠姆博士夫妇并没有在里面。我无法让鲁柏清楚了解之间的差异，因为它确实不是殷斯翠姆博士夫妇的照片。

(His wife was drinking a cup of coffee in the kitchen.“I saw a station wagon just like your father’s, ” Bob Hagel said.(他老婆正在厨房喝咖啡，“我看到一台旅行车，好像就是你爸那一辆。”鲍伯·海格尔说。
(“Great. Just what we need.He'll be coming any day now, though.You just wait and see.”(“太好了，正是我们需要的。接下来的日子，他随时都会过来。你就等着瞧。”
(“Things pile up, don’t they?” he said.“东西叠了一大堆，不是吗？”他说。
(“I’m all goose-pimply thinking about everything. All kinds of decisions.I'm waiting for them to totter down on us like a pile of bricks.” She grinned sheepishly. He sat down, but she stared at the table.Everything seemed threatened, curled at the edges, burnt black and in need of replacement.Her wide gray eyes were anxious, her slim almost boyish body had an impatient agility.She shook her head emphatically so that her short curly black hair bobbed up and down.(她羞怯地咧嘴而笑说：“我一想到每件事就起鸡皮疙瘩，所有的决定。我正等着看它们像一堆砖块一样，摇摇欲坠倒在我们上面。”他坐了下来，而她则是盯着桌子看。每样东西似乎都有危险，边边都卷曲了，烧得焦黑，需要更新。她圆滚滚的灰色眼睛露出焦虑的神情，纤细却几乎像是男孩般的身体，散发出不耐烦而敏捷灵活的气息。她使劲摇头，好让自己卷曲的黑色短发能上下甩动。
(Bob Hagel grinned at her, yet for a moment he didn't know what to say. He had a sick feeling in the pit of his stomach.While he hadn’t made any conscious decision to leave the valley, he felt as if he had. He felt as if the whole thing was out of his hands.He sat there in his paint-stained khakis, a man almost forty, brave, cowardly, cocky.Before he spoke he tilted his brown-gray head at an earnest angle and stared at her with his usually severe face now wreathed with smiles.“Don’t take it so hard, ” he said. “The world isn’t falling apart or anything. ’’(鲍伯对着她咧嘴而笑，一时之间也不知道要说些什么，他觉得胃不舒服。虽然他在意识上还没决定要离开山谷，但觉得自己仿佛早已下定决心，感觉整件事情似乎无法掌控。他坐在那里，身穿沾到油漆的卡其裤，一个年近40的男人，既勇敢，又胆小，也自大。他开口前，以最热切的角度抬起综灰色的头注视着她，这张平日严肃的脸孔，此时尽是笑容。他说：“放轻松，世界不会倒下而毁灭，不会有事的。”)

(See the copy of the test item on page 266. It is an excerpt from one of Janes early unpublished novels.It can be seen that once again Seth, or Jane, delivered a variety of impressions that can apply easily enough.The script deals with two people. (During break I asked Jane to discuss why I picked the particular photograph of York Beach to use in the test for August 23.At the time I made up the envelope the Instreams were already on their way to York Beach; I wondered what lines of communication had been open.(休息时我请珍讨论，为什么我会挑选约克海滩那张照片作为8月23日的测试物品。我准备这个信封，殷斯翠姆博士夫妇已经在往约克海滩的途中；我怀疑是否打开了某些沟通管道。
(Jane resumed in a quiet voice, and with her eyes again closed, at 10:42.)(10:42分，珍再度闭着眼睛继续口述，声音相当轻柔。)
We will end our session shortly.我们这节课很快就会结束。
In answer to your question, Joseph: both you and Ruburt were subconsciously aware of the Instreams’ location, and it was for this reason that you chose the photograph of York Beach, though you did not consciously realize the connection.约瑟，我来回答你的问题：你和鲁柏两人潜意识上都知道殷斯翠姆博士夫妇在哪里，这就是为什么你选了约克海滩照片的原因，不过你意识上并不了解其中的关联。
Ruburt is indeed being very cautious. But he is learning to open up more in these tests, to let more information through.The opening up of the channels is the important thing. Oftentimes information will come through in a rather indiscriminate fashion, and a spontaneous (underline spontaneous) choice of available information is important.A variety of impressions may be received, many valid, but not closely connected enough for your purposes.So it is in the area of distinctions that we must work.鲁伯真的非常小心，但是他还在学习面对这些测试时，如何更开放，好让更多讯息传进来。管道的开放是很重要的事，讯息传进来的时候往往杂乱无章，能从可获得的资料当中自动节选很重要(自动两个字要加底线)。各式各样的印象都可能接收得到，其中有许多虽然正确无误，但与你们的目标并没有什么密切关联。对于这一部分我们必须加以辨别。
My heartiest regards to all, and I will close our session.送上我最深情的祝福给你们，我就要结束本节课了。
The material on our own test this evening came through as a literal translation of concepts in the script.今晚在我们自己的测试中所传过来的资料，就如手稿原意的精准转译一样。
(“Good night, Seth.” A reminder: Seth alone calls for all underlined words.(“晚安，赛斯。”值得一提的是：所有加底线的字都是赛斯自己要求的。
(End at 10:49.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed, her voice quiet.Seth's comment on this evenings test came through because Jane and I had been speculating about such a translation of the script at last break.)(10:49结束。珍的出离状况一如平常，双眼闭着，声音轻柔。由于我和珍在最后一次休息时，一直在探讨这样的手稿转译，所以赛斯又将他对今晚测试的评论意见传进来。)

SESSION 190 第190节　临时课


SEPTEMBER 21, 1965 APPROXIMATELY 9:30 PM TUESDAY UNSCHEDULED1965年9月21日 星期二 约晚上9:30 临时课
(I made no notes during this session or immediately after.What follows is Jane's own reconstruction of the session, made two days later; for this reason I think it interesting, aside from its intrinsic content, in that it reveals that Jane was able to recall quite an amount of what she said while in the trance state.(我并没有在这节课进行当中或结束后马上做笔记，下面的资料都是在上课两天后，珍根据自己对这节课的内容重新建构出来的；撇开实质内容不谈，我觉得这样子蛮有趣，因为这显示珍能大量忆起自己在出神状态中说的话。
(This is the first time she has tried to reconstruct a session from her own viewpoint.As I go along, where necessary I will add my own notes, and these will be in parentheses.)(这是她第一次尝试从自己的观点来重建上课内容。在这过程当中，必要时我会加入我自己的注释，放在括号里面。)
Our fiend John Bradley visited us this evening.We played part of the 170th session, which was recorded and directed by Seth to Dr. Instream.In the middle of a passage Seth suddenly came through, saying: “Why settle for a recording when you can have the real thing?"His voice was quite strong. He seemed in excellent spirits.John had never heard the loud Seth; the previous sessions he witnessed had all been quiet ones.Now Seth began to speak loudly and jovially.Rob made no notes, as Seth told him they were not necessary.These notes are written from memory.我们的朋友约翰·布莱德利今晚来访。我们播放了第170节课的部分内容，那是赛斯针对殷斯翠姆博士所录制的。听到中间有一段，赛斯突然穿透过来说：“既然你可以来真的，为什么还要退而求其次听录音呢？”他的声音强而有力，精神似乎很高昂。约翰从未听过赛斯这么大声讲话；他之前见证的课，赛斯讲话都很轻柔，这时赛斯开始兴高采烈撇开嗓门。罗并未做笔记，因为赛斯跟他说没必要。这些笔记是依据回忆写出来的。
(We had been hunting through the taped session for particularly strong voice effects so that John could get an idea of the power of the Seth personality.Jane was on her knees before the recorder; we had found a strong passage.Her eyes closed and she switched the recorder off as she began speaking as Seth.The transition was so smooth that it was a moment before John and I realized we were no longer listening to the tape.Jane's voice was strong from the be beginning.)(我们在录制内容中，遍寻声音效果特别强烈的段落，好让约翰能对赛斯人格的力量有所了解。珍跪在录音机前；我们发现了一段声音强而有力的段落，接着她闭上眼睛，关掉录音机，开始以赛斯的身分讲话。这个转变非常顺畅，片刻间我和约翰才意识到我们已没有听录音带。珍的声音一开始就铿锵有力。)
John is considering leaving his job and buying a restaurant bar in his home town, Williamsport, PA.He asked Seth’s opinion concerning this plan.Seth doubted John would make the move, because of his desire for security for his family, and because of his need for cosmopolitan outlets.These were met in his sales work, but would not be so easily satisfied if he were a proprietor of a settled establishment.约翰正在考虑辞职，回到家乡宾夕法尼亚州威廉斯波特(Williamsport)买间餐厅酒吧。他征询赛斯对这个计划的看法。赛斯认为他不太可能搬家，因为他渴望家庭的安全保障，也需要国际性的畅货中心。这些需求在他的业务工作中可以达成，但如果他拥有了一间稳定发展的公司，那么这些需求就无法轻易满足。
Seth said that no changes would occur in the organization with which John is now connected, Searle Drug, until next February at the earliest.John is planning his job change for next January. Seth said the new project would be a success if John actually bought the business.赛斯说，现在跟约翰连结的那家塞尔药品公司，至少在2月之前还不至于产生什么变化。约翰计划明年1月换工作，赛斯说，如果约翰真的买下酒吧，新计划就会成功。
(Seth also told John that the data given on Searle Drug, its financial and personal entanglements, plus John 's own promising prospects if he remained with the firm through its present crises, still applied.Some of this information goes back well over a year. It is scattered through the following sessions that John has witnessed: 37, 54, 63, 70, 95, 135, 166, in Volumes I through 3.)(赛斯也告诉约翰，之前给的讯息至今仍适用，也包括塞尔药品公司及其财务人事纠葛，还有如果他能留下来与公司一起度过当前的危机，就会有美好的前景等。部分讯息可以回溯到一年多前，这些资料分别在约翰见证过的各节课当中：第一册至第三册的第37、54、63、70、95、135和166节。)
John also asked Seth if he knew what the trouble had been when John had had a pain in his throat on June 17,1964; on this date John witnessed the 63rd session.While trying psychological time on June 18,1964, I had a very startling experience in which I was told by a thunderous voice that John 's trouble lay really in a “bad tongue."See Vol. 2, pages 167. 68.Seth now explained that this mysterious voice had been his.He said John had cut his tongue on a bone sliver while eating, but because of the human nerve structure in that part of the anatomy the pain had been felt down in his neck.约翰还问赛斯，是否知道1964年6月17日那天他咽喉痛是怎么回事？那一天约翰见证了第63节课。1964年6月18日，我试着做心理时间练习时，有个非常令人吃惊的经验，一种如雷贯耳的声音告诉我，约翰真正的麻烦是一根不好的舌头惹来的。见第二册。赛斯这时解释时，那个神秘的声音来自他。他说约翰吃东西时，舌头被碎骨头伤到了，不过由于人体该部位的神经结构关系，那种疼痛感会出现在下面的脖子部位。
John made a remark to the effect that he would like some sort of proof of Seth's existence.Seth lit into him, saying that the voice effects were impossible for a woman of my makeup. Seth said he could just as legitimately insist that John prove his existence to him.约翰提到说，希望能得到某种赛斯存在的证明。赛斯斥责他，说一个假冒我的女人不可能有那种声音效果，赛斯还说，他也大可以合理坚持请约翰证明自己的存在。
(During this part of the impromptu session Jane's voice became very loud and strong at times; it did not match the effects of the recorded 170th session, but came close once or twice.It was far too loud for the house, in my opinion, with others living so close. Jane's eyes were open for the most part by now, and she, or Seth, often looked deliberately at me, knowing my embarrassment.But this did not prevent another strong blast.At times Jane got to her eet and tipped her head back, as she had done in the 170th session.At these points Seth would remark about using such a position to attain more power, and would talk about how impossible such an effect was for Jane to attain normally.)(这次临时课中，珍的声音有时候变得非常大声、非常强烈；虽然还无法与第170节的声音效果相比，但有一、两次已经很接近。依我看，对其他住得这么近的住户来讲，赛斯太大声了。到目前为止，珍的眼睛大部分时间都开着，而且她或赛斯也常常刻意看看我，知道我觉得很尴尬，但这却不能避免另一次强烈的声音爆发。珍有时候站起来，仰着头，就如她在第170节那样。在这些时候赛斯会说，这种姿势可以更有力量，也说珍平常不可能有这样的声音力道。)
John asked Seth if he knew who he, John, could get to type extra copies of the material.Seth told us that later Dr. Instream would help us out in this respect, although he didn’t know it yet.Seth said there was a woman at the college in Oswego who would do the work.Seth also told John to keep looking for someone himself “The effort will do you good. ”约翰问赛斯，是否知道他，也就是约翰，可以请什么人来为额外的资料复本打字。赛斯说，殷斯翠姆博士以后会帮我们这个忙，不过殷斯翠姆博士目前并不知道。赛斯说，奥斯威戈大学里有位女士将会做这个工作。赛斯也告诉约翰，要靠自己继续寻觅人选：“这样的努力对你会有好处”。
Seth said the practice involved in such unscheduled sessions was good for me. In the new experiments with Dr. Instream, involving clairvoyance, Seth said enough valid information would come through to keep up Dr. Instream's interest, even though we would do better later on.赛斯说，临时课的做法对我而言有益，也说到与殷斯翠姆博士一起做的千里眼新实验中，会有效力十足的讯息传过来，让殷斯翠姆博士一直保持兴趣，而我们以后还会做得更好。
The voice became very loud at times. I worried about the neighbors during our frequent breaks.It was a hot and humid night and our living room windows were of course open.Seth was obviously enjoying himself, and I was very active physically as I spoke for him. My eyes were open a good deal of the time.声音有时候变得非常宏亮，在次数频繁的休息时间内，我担心邻居的反应。那是个湿热的夜晚，我们客厅的窗户当然都打开。赛斯显然很开心，我替他讲话时精力充沛，非常起劲，双眼大部分时间都张开。
A few times the voice reached startling volume. I was afraid that the neighbors would wonder what was going on, and as it turned out my fears were justified.As Seth was speaking a knock came at our door. Almost instantly, it seemed, I snapped out of my trance.有好几次音量令人相当吃惊，我怕邻居会怀疑发生了什么事，事实证明我的恐惧有其道理。赛斯在讲话时，我们大门那边传来了敲门声，我似乎马上回神过来。
For a moment we just sat there.Then I answered the door. Two neighbors from the house next door stood grinning at us.They had their cat with them.They had heard the voice from this apartment; their place is actually two lots away; a space of perhaps seventy feet separates the two houses.一时之间，我们只是呆坐在那儿。后来我去应门，隔壁栋的两个邻居站着对我而笑，还带了一只猫咪。他们听到了从我们家传出去的声音；他们住的地方实际上跟我们的房子隔着两块空地；两间房子大约距离70尺。
Our friends were mystified. They had recognized elements of my voice, but because of the volume did not really think it was mine.The girl, Donna Taylor, said she thought we might be in trouble of some sort.Her husband Ed finally decided to come over to see what was going on.Not knowing what to say, I tried to joke that it was the television set, but Donna said it wasn’t; their set had been on, and they had checked all the eight stations to see if they could find such a voice.我们的朋友一头雾水，他们认得出是我的声音，但觉得那音量真的不像是我的。那个女孩多娜•泰勒(Donna Taylor)说，担心我们可能碰上麻烦。所以她老公艾德(Ed)最后就决定过来看看发生什么事。我不知道该说些什么，就试着跟他们开玩笑说就是电视机的声音，不过多娜说不是；因为他们的电视也开着，而且检查过全部8个频道，看看能否找到这种声音。
Rob then said it was an experiment in self-hypnosis for my next book.This certainly was no lie, and the Taylors seemed to accept the explanation.John was having trouble keeping a straight face.The Taylor 's cat began playing with our cat, Willy, and we had no trouble steering the conversation into safer channels.The Taylors stayed for half an hour, then left. John Bradley left shortly after. By then it was past midnight.随后罗说，那是为我下一本书而做的自我催眠实验。这当然不是谎言，泰勒夫妇似乎接受这个解释。约翰在一旁很难忍住不笑。泰勒夫妇的猫开始跟我们的猫威立玩在一起，我们也顺利将话题转移到较安全的方向。泰勒夫妇待了半小时后就离开，约翰也随即离开，那时候已过了午夜。
(I would estimate the session ended at 11:20 PM, with the knock on the door.The Taylors are a nice young couple, newly arrived in Elmira, and do not know of the sessions.When I saw who was at the door I had visions of long complicated explanations, but the self-hypnosis explanation appeared to satisfy them.If they were still curious they did not reveal it.Very few people in town know about the sessions, although this state will be drastically altered next spring with the publication of Jane's ESP book.(我推估，随着敲门声的出现，这节课大概在11:20分结束。泰勒夫妇是一对很好的年轻人，刚到埃尔迈拉不久，不知道我们的课。当我知道门口的人是谁，心里出现了一长串复杂的解释画面，不过最后是自我催眠的解释满足了他们。就算他们还是感到好奇，也没有再显现出来。城里几乎没什么人知道我们的课，但隔年春天珍的ESP书出版后，这种状况就会有戏剧性的改变。
(As often happens when witnesses are present, Seth was in a fine and frisky mood; there is no doubt that a witness or two will produce what appears to be abundant extra energy on Seth/Jane's part.More often than not strong voice effects are manifested.Jane appears to be swept up, fully involved in the role, and thoroughly enjoying it. Nor does this involvement produce any apparent fatigue of any kind.On top of this, Seth promised an excellent session at our regularly scheduled time tomorrow night.)(一如往常，每当见证人在场，赛斯的心情就很好、很活跃；无疑地，只要有一、两个见证人在，就可以让赛斯-珍的能量充沛，那种强烈的声音表情往往非常明显。珍自己退居一旁，全力投入这个角色，全然乐在其中，这样的投入一点也看不出会让珍感到筋疲力尽。此外，赛斯也承诺明天晚上我们会有一节很精彩的定期课。)

SESSION 191 第191节　假身体　假形象 信封9


SEPTEMBER 22, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年9月22日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(It will be remembered that in the unscheduled 184th session Seth said that Cosmopolitan Magazine would be interested in an excerpt from Jane's ESP book, but that nothing would happen right away.Jane sent them a chapter on dreams, with suggestions for reworking it into an article.The material was returned today with a plain rejection slip.Seth had stated that Cosmo would return the material, but with a letter expressing interest.(还记得在第184节的临时课中，赛斯说过《时尚杂志》对珍ESP的其中一章会有兴趣，但不会马上发生什么事。珍寄给他们一个讨论梦的章节，提议可以把它重写成一整篇文章。这份资料今天被退回来，附上一张退稿通知。赛斯说过《时尚杂志》会退回稿子，但也会附上一封表示感兴趣的信。
(Since we wonder if clairvoyant data involving Dr. Instream will be a regular feature of the sessions from now on, we mentioned this before the session.We also wondered what Seth would have to say about the Cosmopolitan affair, and last night’s unscheduled session, witnessed by John Bradley.(我们很好奇，从现在开始有关殷斯翠姆博士的千里眼资料，会不会成为我们课的固定重点，所以在这节课开始前讨论了一下这部分。我们也想知道赛斯是否会提到《时尚杂志》的事，以及昨晚由约翰•布莱德利见证的那节临时课。
(See page 277for a tracing of the money order used in tonight’s 9th envelope test.This was returned to me a few days ago; I had written a paper company requesting samples.They sent the samples but returned the 25¢ money order.On the spur of the moment today I decided to use it for the test, and enclosed it in the usual double envelopes. I also enclosed the money order itself between two pieces of thin Bristol, to make it difficult for Jane to unwittingly pick up anything by feeling the shape of the object within the envelopes.(请参阅上图今晚第9次信封测试使用的汇票描摹图。这张汇票前几天退回来给我：我之前写信给一家造纸厂，向对方索取样本。他们把样本寄过来，但也退回这张25分的汇票。今天我未加思索就决定用来做测试，把它放在平常使用的双层信封里，还把汇票夹在两片薄薄的纸板中间，以避免珍在不经意中感觉到信封内东西的形状，而得到任何线索。
(The session was held in our back room.Just before it began Jane admitted, again, to a slight nervousness at the projected clairvoyant experiments involving Dr. Instream.She began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet, in contrast to last night's noisy unscheduled session. Her pace was slow, with many pauses.It was another hot and humid night.)(这节课在我们后面的房间举行。就在课开始之前，珍再度承认对于殷斯翠姆博士计划的千里眼测试感到有点紧张。她坐下来，闭着眼睛开始讲话，跟昨晚吵杂的临时课相比，她今晚的声音很轻柔，速度缓慢，停顿多次。又是一个温热的夜晚。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I will be very quiet this evening. Our energy will go into other matters.我今晚会轻声细语，我们的能量会用在别的地方。
Dream images are in a most vital manner extensions of the self.They are projected from the self, extending outward indeed like branches from a tree. Yet they are individual, and have an amount of freedom as even leaves do.And as branches are composed of all those elements that make up the whole tree, so indeed dream images are composed of those elements that make up the personality.梦影像是以一种极富活力的方式，将自己延伸。梦影像是从自己投射出来，其实就像树皮从一棵树往外扩展出来一样，但各自独立，如同树叶一般拥有很大的自由。树枝是由构成整棵树的全部元素所组成，同样地，梦影像也是由构成人格的那些元素所组成。
It is obvious that the dream images are not responsible to the ego, however.While they contain within them compositions that are also seen in the physical self, these properties appear in different percentages.As leaves bring vital nutrients to the tree trunk, so also do dream images bring nourishment to the personality.不过，梦影像显然不用对自我负责。虽然梦影像里面包含的成分，在物质的自己身上也看得到，但这些特性会以不同的比例呈现。就如树叶为树杆带来维持生命所需的养分，梦影像也会为人格带来营养。
As leaves drop from the tree, so finally do dream images depart from close connection with the personality. Yet a psychic connection is always maintained to some degree.Dream images are often images which cannot be created for various reasons within physical reality at any particular time.Dream images may appear later however as physical images.树叶会从树上掉落，梦影像最后也会脱离与人格的亲密连结，但仍然会时时保持着某程度的心灵连结。梦影像通常是那些因为各种原因，而无法于某特定时间在物质实相中创造出来的影像。然而，梦影像后来也可能呈现为身体形象。
There are seasonal variations, temperature variations, electromagnetic and chemical reactions that all influence the production and efficiency of dream images, and that also influence the effect of dream images upon the individual.There is also, as I mentioned, a close relationship existing between dream images and other materializations, that are not ordinarily regular physical occurrences.季节的变换、温度的改变、电磁与化学的反应，都会影响梦影像的产生和效能，也影响梦影像对个人造成的效应。如我之前所说，梦影像和其他的物质化现象，也存在着密切的关系，一般来说，这些物质化现象不见得会规律地发生在身体上。
Since the individual creates his own physical image to begin with, then there is nothing so strange about his creation of a pseudo physical body which is not so closely dependent upon the physical system.Again however, such a pseudo body has electromagnetic and chemical connections that originate in the more usual physical image.In your field of activity this sort of connection must always exist.由于个人一开始就创造了自己的身体形象，因此创造出一个不必太依赖物质系统的假身体(pseudo physical body)，也没什么大惊小怪。同样地，这种假身体也有其电磁与化学上的关联，这个关联是源自于更为平常的身体形象。在你们的活动场域，这种关联一定随时都存在。
The field that connects the personality to this kind of pseudo image is actually formed by extensions of psychic energy.Imagine it, the field, if you will, as a thin but sturdy thread that connects the pseudo image with the original image.There are some limitations here then as to range. These are not basic limitations, but have to do with the individual’s ability to so extend himself.Many dreams involve such roamings on the part of the personality while it is within this sort of pseudo image.连结人格与这种假形象(pseudoimage)的场域，实际上是由心灵能量的延伸所形成的。如果你们愿意的话，可以把这个场域想像成是一条坚韧的细线，连结着假形象与原始形象。至于它的范围，则有一些限制，这些并不是基本的限制，但与个人能否扩展自己有关。当人格在这种假形象里，许多梦就涉及到这样子的漫游。
Much training and practice would be necessary before it would be possible for the personality to be aware of such journeys on a conscious, egotistical level.For like a man walking a tightrope in his sleep, sudden awareness of such a feat could be disastrous, for the delicate balance necessary is not dependent upon egotistical awareness; and such awareness, without warning, could be highly detrimental.对人格来说，必须先经过很多的训练与练习，才能在意识层面、自我层面上，觉察到这种旅程。就像一个睡梦中走钢索的人，如果突然觉知到自己有这么高超的技艺，可能会酿成大灾难，因为走钢索所需具备的精巧平衡能力，并不是依赖自我的觉知；这样的觉知，如果没有事先警告的话，会相当危险。
I suggest your first break.我建议你们第一次休息。
(Break at 9:22.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes remained closed, her voice quiet.Her pace had picked up considerably. The heat hadn't bothered her, but as soon as break arrived she became aware of it.(9:22分休息。珍在第一阶段的口述中，出离状况一如平常，双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔，速度加快很多。炎热的天气原本并没有影响到她，但一到了休息时间，她就立刻觉得很热。
(Jane resumed with her eyes again closed, and at a slower pace, at 9:33.)(珍再次闭着眼睛，以较慢的速度9:33分继续口述。)
I feel that I should explain myself to some degree, concerning the infrequent unscheduled sessions that occur, and some of the reasons behind the voice effects, which indeed we do keep under control most of the time.我觉得自己该稍微解释两件事，一个是不常举行的临时课，另一个是声音效果背后的一些因素，这些效果我们多半都控制得不错。
The unscheduled session is beneficial in that it gives Ruburt practice.The voice effects carry him along so that he gives no attention, or very little attention, to what I am saying, and therefore we usually get a good reception in terms of clear communication.临时课的好处是可以提供鲁柏练习的机会。至于声音效果会吸引他，让他对于我所说的话不会注意，或几乎是不太注意，如此一来，我们在沟通上往往就可以顺利接收资料。
The Jane ego stands further aside.There is an emotional rapport that also carries Ruburt along when my spirits or moods then also sweep him along; and again the Jane ego is content to stand aside.My emotional makeup comes to the foreground at times, of course.Energy is used for such demonstrations, so that it may seem that the material takes second place.But the practice is to the overall advantage of the material.珍的自我站在一边。当我的精神或心情驱使着鲁柏，就会有一种情感上的和谐关系，支持着鲁柏走下去，而此时珍的自我也愿意退居一旁。当然，我的情感性格有时候会跃居主角。由于能量用来做这一类的展现，因此资料看起来就变成其次了。不过，这种做法整体来说对资料有利。
There is on occasion an extension of self, whereby the Jane ego can also participate, though in a temporarily subordinate manner.The experience is valuable to Ruburt in that he sees that no invasion is involved; and that when his emotions are stilled there is still an emotional reality, as my emotions come to the foreground.有时候自己(self)会扩展出去，借此珍的自我也可以参与其中，不过这只是一种暂时使用的次要方式。这种经验对鲁柏也很有价值，因为他会明白，这当中并没有所谓入侵这回事；而且也会了解在我的情感跃居主角时，他的情感虽然静止，但是情感实相依然存在。
It is sometimes difficult to maintain the fine distinction that is necessary to you, for example, so that the voice is not too loud.I must use of course a buildup of energy, which is then expended. The rate at which it is expended controls the volume of the voice.There are delicate balances here, you see, so that while I sometimes fool with you in a joking manner, oftentimes the energy simply is not as finely controlled as I would like.要维持这样细微的区别，有时候并不容易，但这种区别对你而言有其必要，比方说，这么一来声音不至于太大。我当然必须增加能量，然后再消耗它，消耗的速度关系到音量的大小。你也知道，这当中需要微妙的平衡，虽然我有时候以开玩笑的方式戏弄我们，不过能量通常无法像我想的那么好控制。
This simply involves practice again, as I learn how much energy is necessary to get certain effects.Since I am using Ruburts voice mechanisms, certain adjustments must be made as I discover how best to manipulate the necessary mechanisms.我该使用多少能量以达到一定的效果，这纯粹又涉及练习。由于我使用鲁柏的发音器官，就得做某些调整，才能了解如何把这些器官操纵到最好。
The emotional energy I use as when I show good spirits, are the same energies that propel themselves outward through the voice. This is somewhat more complicated than it may appear.There is a similarity here between the extension of my self outward through Ruburt, and the extension necessary for example in an individual's projection of a pseudo image.我用来表现精神饱满的情感能量，与透过声音驱策它们往外的能量相同，这可能比看起来的还稍微复杂一点。我的自己透过鲁柏往外扩展，与个人假形象投射所需的那种扩展，两者有其相似之处。
When others are present there is simply more energy available.Yet again, such use of energy does not imply a depletion. I am not stealing energy from others.In actuality Ruburt uses the energy, for it is in a form which is more accessible to him than to me.There is a pooling of energy in such cases, and in such a pooling of energy telepathic communications are facilitated; for the many selves present, in pooling their energy, extend themselves.其他人在场时，就会有更多的能量可以取得。这种使用能量的方式并不暗含能量耗竭，我并没有从其他人身上窃取能量。事实上，鲁柏会使用这种能量，因为他比我更容易取得那种形式的能量。在这种情况下能量会聚集(a pooling of energy)，而这样子的能量聚集，让心电感应方式的沟通更顺利；因为在场的许多个自己，在注入能量的同时，也扩展了它们本身。
In good circumstances Ruburt then dips into this energy pool, which obviously must contain certain elements of personal experience on the part of the participators.I have meant to give you this information in the past, and shortly you will see why telepathy and clairvoyance occur more readily in the dream state.在良好的情境下，鲁伯会沉入这个能量池(energy pool)之中，显然那里面一定包含了参与者个人经验的某些元素。我之前就打算提供这些讯息给你们，而你们很快就会明白，为什么梦境中比较容易产生心电感应和千里眼的现象。
Now I suggest a brief break.我建议现在休息一下。
(Break at 9:55.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet. Her pace had picked up speed.She had some idea of what she had been saying, but didn’t think she had been speaking for any length of time.(9:55分休息。珍的出离状况如常，双眼一直闭着，轻声细语，速度加快。她稍微知道自己说了些什么，但并不认为已经讲了一段时间。
(Since it was close to 10 PM, the hour suggested by Dr. Instream for clairvoyant contact with Seth, Jane told me she felt some nervousness, as she had the first time this experiment had been tried in the 189th session.(由于接近10点钟，也就是殷斯翠姆博士提议跟赛斯做千里眼接触的时间，珍告诉我说，她有点紧张，就像第189节她第一次尝试做这个实验时的感觉一样。
(As during the first experiment, Jane used many pauses. I will indicate just some of them.She began speaking in a very quiet voice. Her eyes were closed, her head down somewhat.Resume at 10:06.)(珍停顿很多次，就如同第一次实验那样，我只会标示其中几次。她以相当轻柔的声音开始讲话，闭着眼睛，稍微仰头。10:06分继续口述。)
Now.We will see what we can get.(Pause.) As these experiments with Dr. Instream continue Ruburt will rapidly be more at ease.现在。我们看看能得到些什么。(停顿)随着跟殷斯翠姆博士继续做这些实验，鲁伯很快就会比较自在。
It is unfortunate that the idea of tests often disturbs the flexibility that is necessary in order to achieve results.That is, Ruburt, wanting correct information, (pause) has some tendency to want it so badly that the ego stiffens, forming barriers.遗憾的是，一想到要测试，就常常会影响到灵活性，而这种灵活性却又是获得成果的必要条件。也就是说，鲁柏一心想要得到正确无误的讯息，(停顿)有某种过度渴望的倾向，使得他的自我变得僵化古板，形成了阻碍。
However Ruburt learns quickly, and in the long run this will not hamper us overmuch; (pause) and enough will come through in the meantime, I believe.不过鲁柏学得非常快，这个状况终究不会对我们造成太大的妨碍；(停顿)我相信，在这同时就会有足够的资料传递过来。
Now.These are my impressions.(Pause, at 10:11.)现在。我得到了以下的印象。(10:11分停顿。)
Dr. Instream is now, or has been immediately preceding this hour, or will be immediately following this hour, in a meeting with many people.(Pause.) In a fairly large room, with one speaker, and then others for briefer periods of time.A brick building, the meeting not on the ground floor.(Pause.) His seat three to five seats from an aisle, nearly but not quite in the center of a row of seats.殷斯翠姆博士现在，不然就是前一小时或下一小时，会跟很多人一起开会。(停顿)在一个相当大的会议室里，跟一位讲者在一起，后来又跟其他人在一起，不过时间较短暂。一栋砖造的建筑物，会议不是在一楼举行。(停顿)他的座位离走道还隔着三至五个座位，大概接近那一排的中间位置，但不在正中间。
(Jane took a long pause at 10:14, sitting quite still and with her eyes closed.)(10:14分珍暂停好久，闭着眼睛，坐着一动也不动。)
This could be however a theater or theater building, but if so it is not (pause) on exact street level.不过，这可能是一间阶梯式讲堂或整栋剧院建筑，不过如果是这样，那就不是(停顿)刚好在一楼。
Someone seems to be wearing an eyeshade, a male.有个人好像戴着眼罩，是个男的。
(Another long pause at 10:16.)(10:16分。又停顿很久。)
Slides or pictures may be shown.I believe he had two visitors today at his office, in particular.One not a student. (Pause at 10:19.)可能在放映投影片或图片。我相信今天他办公室里特别有两个访客，其中一个不是学生。(10:19分停顿)
Do you have a test for me?你今天要测试我吗？
(“Yes.”“(对啊。”
(I handed Jane the test envelope at 10:20.She sat quietly, holding it in her right hand, her eyes still closed.)(10:20分我把测试信封交给珍。她安静坐着，信封拿在右手，双眼依然闭着。
Give me a moment and we will see what we can do.给我一点时间，看看我们可以做什么。
Something two times, in duplicate, or as twins.某个两倍的东西，一式两份，或者成对的东西。
I will not give obvious information that Ruburt could pick up through touch.These are impressions. A gushing forth, such as something explosive, as the rushing of a waterfall.Ruburt thinks of a photograph of a waterfall at your old camping place.我不会提供鲁伯借由触摸就可以清楚得到的讯息。我的印象如下，大量往外喷出的东西，诸如爆发性的东西，像奔流的瀑布。鲁柏想到你们在旧营地的一张照片。
Again, something to do with two people, perhaps several, both males and females.The idea of rock and water and many colors, and a connection with a note.(Pause.) A place which you have both visited.Numbers.Too many people for comfort.A border.还有，跟两个人，也许几个人有关的东西，男生和女生都有。岩石、水、色彩缤纷的意念，还关联到一张便条纸。(停顿)一个你们俩去过的地方。数字。太多追求舒适的人。一个边框。
Again a multiplicity of design.Initials, I believe R. B. In connection with you, Joseph.Your handwriting on the back.(Pause.) Having to do with a familiar place, a tent, and a landscape of a landscape.还有多样化的设计。开头字母，我觉得是R.B。，跟你有关，约瑟，背面有你的笔迹。(停顿)跟一个熟悉的地点、一顶帐篷和一幅风景画有关。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:26.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet with many pauses.She opened the test envelope.(10:26分休息。珍的出离状况如常，双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔，停顿很多次。她打开了测试信封。
(The reference to a waterfall puzzled us. Jane then noted that we live on Water St. This may be the connection with this impression, along with Jane's memory of our old camping place.The money order has no connection with camping that I know of. It lay in my drawer, and was not next to or near any other photographs, for instance.(有关瀑布的讯息让我们不解，珍提到我们就住在水街(Water St.)，可能跟这个印象有关，同时也跟珍的旧营地记忆有关。汇票跟我所知道的露营并不相关，它就摆在我的抽屉里，旁边并没有像是其他照片的东西。
(The large numeral TWO is stamped in red on the money order, as the upper limit of its worth.Since it is for 25 ¢, there is ample room therefor “something two times, in duplicate, or as twins.” Two people involved could be Jane and me; she purchased it, filled it out and mailed it for me, along with a note to the paper company that I wrote.“It's a duplicate [mentioned in test] of a money order, ”Jane wrote later.The paper company is located in New York City.Both of us have been to New York City, and felt that it contained too many people for comfort.The money order has no border.Multiplicity of design, a very general appellation, could refer to the many numbers on the money order I suppose.Jane wrote my name on the order, but it does not bear my handwriting on either side.(汇票上盖了大大的红色数字2，做为金额的上限。由于汇票金额是25分，所以有很多的空间可用来解释“某个两倍的东西，一式两份，或是成对的东西”。测试中提到的两个人可能是我和珍；汇票是她替我买的，填写后替我寄出，并附上一张我写给造纸厂的便条纸。珍随后也写着“它是汇票一式两份的复本[测试中提过]”。这家造纸厂位于纽约市，我们两人都曾经到过纽约市，觉得那里住了太多追求舒适的人。这张汇票并没有什么边框。多样化的设计，一种非常普通的描述，我认为可能是指汇票上很多的数字。珍在汇票上写了我的名字，但两面都没有我的笔迹。
(Jane interprets “a familiar place” as Elmira.Since the paper samples I requested were for watercolor paper, I can see where many colors and “a landscape of a landscape” can enter in, since I wanted to test the paper by doing some small landscapes at our landlord’s farm.In 1963 we borrowed from our landlord, Jimmy Spaziani, the Ouija board that led to the sessions.See my Introduction, plus various sessions, in Volume 1.(珍把“一个熟悉的地点”解释成埃尔迈拉。由于我索取的纸张样本是水彩画纸，我想要借由为我们房东的农场画些小幅的风景画来试用画纸，所以我可以想见纸张上会有许多的色彩和“一幅风景画”。1963年我们跟房东吉米·史帕日尼借了灵应盘，才有了赛斯课。见我第一册里面的介绍以及各节课内容。
(I regard the test as quite good at this stage, especially the reference to me via initials, and the note, something two times, and a landscape of a landscape.Jane as usual was disappointed.(我认为这个阶段的测试相当好，尤其是那些开头字母、便条纸，两倍的东西、一幅风景画跟我有关的资料。不过珍仍跟平常一样对结果感到失望。
(Jane resumed in the same quiet voice, and with her eyes closed, at 10:42.)(10:42分珍闭着眼睛继续口述，声音依然相当轻柔。)
Since we had an impromptu meeting last evening, we will close our session.由于我们已有个临时的聚会，所以现在就要结束本节课。
However, we will even out so that each session includes the material with which we are concerned, as well as our other data.不过，我们要平均分配，让每节课都能涵盖我们关注的资料以及其他资料。
The exercise involved here will also help Ruburt in giving the material, and it will help in understanding the operation of the self under such conditions.As such these tests may be considered quite practical portions of the material itself, and we shall use them on various occasions to make certain points.这里的练习可以帮助鲁柏提供资料，也可以帮助他了解在这种情况下自己是如何运作。像这些测试可以视为资料本身中相当实际的部分，我们会在各种不同场合中以此为例，加以阐述。
(Now Jane opened her eyes and looked at me.But they did not stay open for more than a sentence or two.)(这时珍张开眼睛看着我，但持续不到一、两句话的时间。)
I could indeed speak longer, but I will not keep you.I regret causing you any embarrassment, Joseph, despite my humorous remarks to the contrary, and I bid you a fond good evening.我真的可以继续讲下去，但我不想再留你们。约瑟，尽管我的言词幽默，但对你带来的尴尬，谨致上我的歉意，并祝你们有个美好的夜晚。
The material which Ruburt sent to Cosmopolitan will be remembered, upon a later occasion, to his benefit there.鲁伯寄给《时尙杂志》的资料不会被遗忘，往后对他有好处。
My fondest regards to you both.送上我最深情的祝福给你们俩。
Ruburt’s book will work out very well. And I believe it likely that you will get your kitchen extension.鲁柏的书进行得非常顺利，而且我也认为你们可能会扩建厨房。
There is some difficulty, I believe, possible for Ruburts friend, Blanche Price, in the nature of health.我相信，鲁伯的朋友，布兰琪∙普来丝(Blanche Price)在健康上可能有些麻烦。
(“Good night, Seth.”“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:48.Jane was dissociated as usual.(10:48分结束。珍的出离状况如常。
(The loud voice during the unscheduled session last night did embarrass me at times.(昨晚临时课里，那种高分贝的声音有时真的让我很尴尬。)
(I believe the book of Jane's that Seth refers to here is her new project, dealing with the Seth material itself.Jane has been casting about for a good way to present the material, and has about decided upon her approach. She is not quite sure of it however as yet.(我相信赛斯这里提到珍的书，是指珍的新计划，内容在探讨赛斯资料本身。珍想方设法，要好好呈现这些资料，也大致决定了她的走向，不过还没有完全确定。
(The reference to a kitchen extension concerns our efforts to get our landlord to enlarge our very small kitchen. The house is having a new roof put on now, and the man doing the job is going to speak to our landlord about the kitchen project when the roof is finished.We had about given up on the kitchen idea for this year, but now our hopes rise again.Jane has been focusing on our landlord, whom we like very much incidentally, each day concerning the kitchen.It will be interesting to see the results.(厨房扩建指的是我们努力让房东扩建那个小厨房，房子目前正重新盖屋顶，施工师傅在屋顶完工后，会向房东谈到厨房计划。我们这一年来几乎已经放弃厨房扩建的念头，可是现在又重燃希望。珍为了厨房，每天都将焦点放在房东上，顺带一提，我们非常喜欢他。我们倒很想知道结果。
(Blanche Price is an old friend of Jane’s, living in Baltimore.The two women have not met often in recent years; Blanche was Janes instructor in French at Skidmore College, in Saratoga Springs, NY.Last year while visiting in France Blanche suffered a rather severe stroke, but seems to have emerged without permanent paralysis.We would say she is in her mid-or-late fifties.A few days ago Jane received a copy of a book of poetry of Blanches that has just been published.Blanche knows about Seth, but little about the material itself.(布兰琪∙普来丝是珍的一位老朋友，住在马里兰州的巴尔的摩。近几年两人不常碰面；布兰琪是珍当时在纽约萨拉托加温泉市斯基德莫尔学院的法文老师。布兰琪去年造访法国时中风，相当严重，不过好像控制得宜，不至于永久瘫痪。我们猜她大概是介于55到60岁之间。几天前，珍接到布兰琪刚出版的一本诗集。布兰琪知道赛斯，但对赛斯资料本身几乎不了解。
(Jane plans to copy the excerpts dealing with Dr. Instream weekly or perhaps bimonthly, to send to him.If Seth’s prediction, made in the last session, to the effect that Dr. Instream will help us out in the matter of copying the material, works out, then perhaps other arrangements will be made.)(珍计划每一、两周就将与殷斯翠姆博士实验的摘录资料影本寄给他。赛斯上节课预言说，殷斯翠姆博士在复印资料这件事上会帮我们的忙，如果预言成真，那么或许还会有其他安排。)

SESSION 192 第192节 湖底青铜器　临时课


SEPTEMBER 25, 1965 11:45 PM SATURDAY UNSCHEDULED1965年9月25日 星期六 晚上11:45 临时课
(This session was entirely unplanned. It was also not consciously expected on my part, although checking over my predictions for Friday and today I discovered that I had unwittingly made several correct notes concerning it.These correct predictions were quite specific, and included such words as “cave” and “long swim. ”(举行这节课纯属意外，意识上，也不在我的预期当中，不过检查了我星期五和今天的预测后，发现不经意做的一些关于这节课的记录都蛮准确的。这些准确的预测相当特别，包括了“洞穴”、“长冰”这类的词。
(Jane and I went dancing as usual this evening.At one of our favorite spots we met the Gallaghers, Bill and Peggy.It ended up that the four of us returned to our apartment by about 11:15 PM.Jane said she felt Seth “buzzing around”, but since I had just caught up on my notes for the three other sessions this week, I begged off. Jane agreed.The Gallaghers were tired and planned to leave soon also.(今晚我和珍一如往常去跳舞。在一个我们很喜欢的地点，遇到了加拉格夫妇比尔和蓓。结果我们4个人大约在晚上11:15分回到我们的公寓。珍说，她觉得赛斯“在附近嗡嗡叫”，不过由于我刚赶上这个礼拜另外三堂课的笔记进度，所以我央求不要举行临时课，珍同意了。而加拉格夫妇也累了，打算很快离开。
