(Seth announced his presence as the four of us sat quietly talking, at approximately 11:45 PM.Bill and Peggy share the cost of a cottage on Seneca Lake with other members of Peggy’s family, and had been taking steps to sell the cottage this fall.Bill dislikes seeing it go, since he uses it as a base for his skin-diving expeditions in the lake, which is one of New York State's famous Finger Lakes.(大概在11:45分，我们4个人坐着轻声聊天，此时赛斯来到现场。比尔与蓓以及蓓的家人在塞尔内卡湖[Seneca Lake]合买一间小别墅，今年秋天已准备求售。比尔不愿意卖掉，因为这是他用来当做在湖中浮潜探险的基地，这个湖是纽约州有名的五指湖[Finger Lake]之一。
(Seth promised to keep his voice quiet, which he did throughout the session.Jane sat with her eyes closed for the most part. Specifically Seth asked that none of us take notes, and I was happy to agree. Thus the first half of this session is summarized from memory, with no particular effort made to remember every point covered.I will try to recall just enough to lead into the second half of the session, which I recorded verbatim in my homemade shorthand.(赛斯答应音量要保持小声，整节课的确都信守承诺。珍大部分时间都闭上眼睛坐着，赛斯特别要求我们都不要做笔记，我当然乐得同意，因此这节课的前半部是靠记忆整理出来的摘要，并没有特别努力去忆起每个提到的要点。我会试着回想，只要涵盖本节课后半部之前的内容就已足够，因为到了后半部，我就以自己的速记方式逐字记录。
(The first point I would like to make is that Seth told us enough of the clairvoyant material involving Dr. Instream is valid; this will keep up the doctor’s interest.The second point concerns the main subject matter of the session, which evolved from a question I asked Seth about the Gallagher’s cottage on Seneca Lake.Bill was inspired to ask Seth whether it would be possible to locate Indian artifacts on the lake bottom; he had long been curious about this.(我要指出的第一个要点是，赛斯告诉我们，有关殷斯翠姆博士的千里眼资料很多都是准确的；足以让博士继续保持兴趣。第二个要点是有关这节课的主题，那是因为我问了赛斯有关加拉格夫妇在塞尔内卡湖别墅的问题。比尔灵感一来也问赛斯说，湖底是否可能有印第安手工艺品；他长久以来一直对这个问题感到好奇。
(By this, Bill meant American Indian artifacts, and had in mind stone tools, etc. Seth surprised us by telling us this was quite possible.Then he added that in a certain location could be found bronze artifacts in the lake.There was much here, including some generalized locations and descriptions, that is not recorded.Suffice it to say that Seth made no error in using the word bronze. He also said these artifacts would date from either the 7th century, or the 17th century.(有关这一部分，比尔是指美国印第安人的手工艺品，以及他心中的石制器具等东西。令我们惊讶的是，赛斯告诉我们相当有可能，接着补充说，会在湖中的某个地点发现青铜艺品。这方面赛斯提供了很多资料，包括一些大致的地点和描述，但我们没有记录下来。可以这么说，赛斯正确地使用青铜这个字眼，他还说这些手工艺品的日期可以追溯至第7世纪或第17世纪。
(A break came at about 12:45.During it, Bill said he thought the information from Seth was sure to be pretty fragmented. Either that, or such artifacts were not Indian at all.Bill knows something of local history. He told us the 7th century reference would be correct if the Vikings were to be involved, since, he said, this date in history finds Viking evidence in the Great Lakes to the west.As far as he knew, there is no record of Viking activity in this part of the northeast, in New York State.(12:45分左右休息。休息时，比尔说他认为赛斯提供的讯息相当片段，要不然就是这种手工艺品根本不属于印第安人。比尔对当地历史有一些了解，他告诉我们，如果涉及了北欧海盗的话，那第7世纪的说法就是正确的，因为从历史角度来看，这段时间内从北美五大湖到西部，都可以发现北欧海盗的行迹。就他所知，在纽约州东北这一带并没有北欧海盗的活动记录。
(Bill also said the 17th century date could be correct if bronze artifacts were shown to be related to the Jesuit missionaries, who were known to be in this section of the country then.Bill has done extensive skin diving in Seneca Lake. Jane and I had heard him mention this rather casually, but knew nothing of the extent of his explorations or deep interest.We had not discussed the subject. Nor has either of us ever done any skin diving.(比尔也说，如果能证明青铜艺品跟耶稣会传教士有关的话，那17世纪的日期可能就是正确的，因为耶稣会传教士当时就在国内那个区域活动，这一点众所周知。比尔在塞尔内卡湖到处浮潜，我和珍早就常听他提及此事，但并不知道他探险或感兴趣的程度。我们没讨论过这个话题，我们两人也不曾浮潜过。
(Bill was by now so interested that both he and I began to take verbatim notes when Seth resumed, since Bill planned to go diving Sunday.The hour was already late. Jane spoke while sitting down. Her eyes opened occasionally, her voice remained quiet.She smoked.She resumed at 12:55.)(比尔此时兴致高昂，因此当赛斯继续说的时候，我和他就开始逐字记录，因为他还打算星期天去潜水。时间已经很晚了，珍坐着说话，眼睛偶尔张开，声音保持轻柔，抽着烟。12:55继续口述。)
A cove in water, at right angles to a gasoline station. I believe approximately 55 feet, and some boulders beneath here.There is a small object in this cave, but 15 feet approximately beneath to the left are many plants, with strange shaped blossoms; and in the roots, intertwined with the roots of these plants, are some objects of interest to you.水里的一个小湾(cove)，在右边90度往一个加油站的方向，我觉得大概有55尺，底下有一些巨大的圆石。这个洞穴(cave)里有个小东西，但左边约15尺底下有许多植物，开了奇形怪状的花；在底下被这些植物根部所盘绕的地方，有一些你们感兴趣的东西。
They can only be seen however between I believe three o’clock and dusk.不过我觉得只能在3点到黄昏之间可以看到它们。
([Bill:] “At what time of the year?")([比尔：]“在一年之中的什么时节？”)
October and March, for if the light is not right you will not see them. October 12 to 15 is the best time.They are sunken however, and only portions, very small portions, protrude.One is bronze, one is iron. One is a dagger.10月到3月之间，因为如果光线不对，你们就没办法看到，10月12日到15日是最佳时间。不过它们是沉下去的，只有一部分，非常小的部分突出来。一个是青铜器、一个是铁器、一个是匕首。
(As she talked, Jane used many gestures. She seemed to try to supplement her verbal descriptions by outlining objects with her hands, as though she was seeing things somewhat difficult to put into words specifically enough.This applied particularly when she was trying to voice descriptions of the geography of the lake bottom.Her pace was comfortably fast.)(珍在讲的时候，用了很多手势，似乎想借由双手比出轮廓，以补充口语描述的内容，仿佛她看到一些不太容易能诉诸文字清楚表达的东西。她尝试以口头方式描述湖底地理景观时，特别会出现这种状况。她的节奏轻松而快速。)
They will not be seen looking forward, but looking from the corner of the eye.One has something to do with rubber, though I do not now see the connection.One has something to do with a female, and has a symbol; and the date may be ascertained from it.用直观的方式无法看到它们，而必须从眼角看出去。一个与橡胶有关，虽然我现在不知道是什么关联。一个与一位女性有关，也有一个标志；日期或许可从它上面得到确认。
The symbol has to do with the moon rather than the sun. I can only see two numbers as far as the date is concerned, and both numbers are 1—one, one.The foliage is waving, and there is a current.The current is a strong and cold one, and becomes colder by the cove.这个标志与月亮有关，而不是太阳。在日期上我只看到两个数字，两个数字都是一，也就是一、一。叶子在飘动，有水流，水流强劲寒冷，小湾旁边变得更冷。
([Bill:] “Yes, yes.That’s just the way they are.”)([比尔：]“对，没错。它们就是这样子的。”)
There is some air in the cove.小湾[cove]里有一些空气。
([Bill:] “Do you mean cove, or cave?”)([比尔：]“你说的是小湾[cove]还是洞穴[cave]？”)
I use cove.我说的是小湾。
(Note the confusion here with the words cove and cave.As nearly as I can recall, I recorded them accurately.As the session continued we felt that Seth was saying cave, but that Jane's lack of marine knowledge could lead her to say cove, for cave.At times of course she distinctly said cave.(请注意这里小湾(cove)和洞穴(cave)两个词有点混淆。就我回忆所及，记录得很精确。课继续进行时，我们发现赛斯是讲洞穴[cave]，可是由于珍欠缺航海知识，可能让她把“cave”讲成“cove”。当然，她有时候确实是说“cave”。
([Myself: “Can you give us the location of the gasoline station?”)([我自己：“你可以告诉我们加油站的位置吗？”)
I believe there is an “M” in connection with the station, and perhaps an “A” and a “C”.Perhaps something to do with Mack.我觉得有一个字母“M”跟加油站有关，也可能还有“A”和“C”。或许跟麦克(Mack)有关。
Either the man is called Mack—I do not know, or there are Mack trucks.要么就是有个人叫做麦克——我不知道，要不然就是有几辆麦克卡车，
I do not know.But there is a Mack somehow connected with a station, and a child, a female child.我不知道。但就是有个麦克跟加油站有关，有一个小孩，那是个女孩。
(Jane's eyes now opened. She looked at Bill and me, scribbling away and smiled.Her voice remained quiet.)(珍这时候张开眼睛，面带微笑，视线快速扫过我和比尔，声音保持轻柔。)
I remember saying most clearly nothing about notes.我记得我说得很清楚不要做笔记。
([Bill, laughing:] “Well, I can always tear these up.We want to make use of the information if we can, though.”)([比尔大笑：]“好啊，我可以撕掉。不过，如果可以的话，我们想使用这些讯息。”)
I’m simply trying to save Joseph work. The month of May is a good one, but not in connection with these objects.There is a silt that covers much, but because of the currents in May, and sometimes in October, the silt—我只是想让约瑟省点麻烦，5月份是个好时间，但跟这些东西无关。淤泥盖住很多东西，不过由于5月，有时是10月，水流的关系，这些淤泥——
(Jane, her eyes closed, made gestures with her hands, as if to indicate a current or wave that swept clean.(珍闭着眼睛，做了一些手势，好像表示水流或波浪把淤泥冲得一干二净的样子。
([Bill:] “That’s right.”)([比尔：]“对。”)
—and then you can discover more.The silt is a mineral deposit that gathers because of a collection of nitrogen.The composition of the air has much to do with this, and when the seasons change there is a change in the disposition of the silt.——之后你就可以发现更多东西。这些淤泥是矿物质的沉淀物，是由氮聚积而成。空气的成分与这个密切相关，季节变化时，淤泥的分布状况也会跟着改变。
([Bill:] “Yes, that’s right.I’ve seen those deposits change many times.”)([比尔：]“对，没错。这些沉积物的改变我看过好多次了。”)
Objects hidden then are easier to see.I am on to something else, but I suggest that you take a break.潜藏在里面的东西就更容易看到了。我还要谈其他事情，我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 1:15.Jane was well dissociated, she said. Her voice had remained quiet, her pace had been good.Bill Gallagher was quite excited.Both he and Peggy verified Seth’s information about the changes in silting on the lake bottom; Jane was highly gratified to learn that Seth was correct.As far as I know neither Jane or I have come across such specific information; certainly we have never discussed it with the Gallaghers.(1:15分休息。珍说自己出离得很好，声音维持轻柔，速度也很恰当。比尔·加拉格相当兴奋，他和蓓两人都证实了赛斯说的湖底淤沙变化；珍知道赛斯说得正确后，异常高兴。就我所知，我和珍都没听过这么明确的讯息；当然也不曾跟加拉格夫妇讨论过这些东西。
(Bill now told us that he waits until certain times of the year, when the silt clears up, to go diving.He knows that the formation of nitrogen is somehow related to the dying of algae in the lake, but could not explain it exactly to us.(比尔这时告诉我们，他每年都会等到某些时间淤泥排空后，才去潜水。他知道湖里氮的形成跟藻类的死亡有些关系，但无法跟我们解释得很清楚。
(Jane resumed while sitting down and with her eyes closed. But she was smoking as she spoke, and her eyes opened occasionally.Her voice remained quiet.Resume at 1:25.)(珍闭着眼睛坐着继续口述，但边讲边抽烟，偶尔张开眼睛，声音维持轻柔。1:25分继续。)
There is also a spot, and a very important one, that I cannot locate except for the moon position.The rays of the moon in May and/or October, 13 to 15, fall directly above a position in which important artifacts can be found, for there are many artifacts buried within the lake.有一个地点，非常重要的地点，只能在月光下我才有办法定位。5月和/或10月的13日至15日之间，月光会直接照到一个可发现重要手工艺品的位置，许多手工艺品埋在湖底。
This one to which I refer has definitely to do with the 17th century. It is to be found directly beneath the moon’s rays at a time when Venus is in the ascendancy, and forms on the surface of the lake an acute angle.我说的这个地方确定跟17世纪有关，当时金星上升，在直射的月光下发现这个地方，而且月光在湖的表面形成一个锐角。
It is however very far down, and to the right of a plane.不过，它在很往下的下面，在平台的右边。
(Here, Jane gestured to show that she meant a long flat level of land under water.)(这时珍做了手势，表示她指的是水里一处狭长的平坦台地。)
This surface is the home of a rather unusual variety of, I presume you say, fish. But they are different than the fish near the surface, and there is algae here that exudes nitrogen, which is not usual.在表面上有各种非常奇特的东西栖息着，我猜你们大概会说是鱼，但是它们跟靠近表面的鱼不同，而且这里有藻类会释放出氮气，这并不常见。
This has to do with a chest, and it is of gold.It was a religious rather than a romantic pirate’s chest.It had to do with a king, and the death of a queen, and belonged to a royal family, though they never missed it.这跟一个箱子有关，是金制的。它是海盗的箱子，跟宗教有关，跟浪漫的恋情无关。牵涉到一位国王，也涉及一位皇后之死，箱子属于皇室，不过他们从未因为失去箱子而感到惋惜。
(“Can you tell us the country of the royal family?”)(“你可以告诉我们是哪一国的皇室吗？”)
I have the impression of France.我有个印象，是法国。
This was however religious, and intimate to some extent.Personal. I believe you say.这跟宗教有关，而且某程度密切相关。我相信你们的说法是，与个人相关。
The royal family had many offspring, and there is a connection with a pope, and a bible with gold covers, and a crest.It is however sunken in silt, behind a warm current, and very concealed.这个皇室有好多子孙，与教皇有关，也有一本金色封面的圣经及一枚徽章。不过已沉到淤泥里，在一道暖流后面，非常隐密。
There is a spring here which may serve as a guiding post, if you could find the spring, which is warm.这里有一股泉水，是温的，如果你找得到，就可以将它做为指示路标。
(“Has Bill ever been near any of these locations on his swims?”)(“比尔游泳时曾靠近这些地点吗？”)
One only, and not close.只有一个，但没有很靠近。
(“Which one?”)(“哪一个？”)
There are dangers connected with the last one mentioned, and treacherous currents near the chest.But ways of getting through them which involve two turns to the left, a going-along with the current, a right turn of 23 degrees.But a left turn could cause serious trouble.最后提到的那个地方危机四伏，箱子附近的水流变化莫测。要经过它们必须左转两次，再顺着水流走，再右转23度。可是其中一次左转可能会带来严重的问题。
([Bill:] “I can smell the trouble already.”)([比尔：]“我已经可以嗅到问题。”)
You have a good nose indeed.你的鼻子确实很灵敏。
([Bill:] “I’d better get myself a good set of fins.”)([比尔：]“我自己最好有一对很好的鳍。”)
These artifacts are there.I am not predicting necessarily that they will be found, and I advise caution in any case.The silt can rise—这些手工艺品就在那里。我并不是预测说一定能找得到，我奉劝你无论如何都要小心。那些淤泥可能会引发——
([Bill:] “Yes, it can”)([比尔：]“对，它有可能。”)
—like a sandstorm.——就沙尘暴的现象。
([Bill:] “Oh yes it can.It certainly can.”)([比尔：]“哦，没错。有可能，的确如此。”)
If you are beneath it you are safe.If you are amid it, in the middle of it or above it, you are in danger.Its flow is often significant—如果你在它底下，那很安全。如果你被它包围，在它里面或上面，那就危险了。它的流动往往有其意义——
([Bill:] “Yes, I’ll say.”)([比尔：]“对，我也这么认为。”)
—its ways are wise, and if followed can lead to discoveries.——它的动线很有智慧，跟随它就能引导你发现东西。
I suggest a break.我建议休息一下。
(End at 2:35 AM.This proved to be the end of the session even though Seth called it a break.The Gallaghers wanted to have energy for diving later in the day, so called it quits.Before leaving, Bill told us how right Seth was about silt storms; he related a terrifying incident in which he had become involved in a silt storm, and lost his sense of orientation.(凌晨2:35分结束。虽然赛斯称此为休息，但后来证实是结束。加拉格夫妇那天稍后要去潜水，希望保有体力，所以要求到此为止。离去前比尔告诉我们，赛斯对沙尘暴的事说得非常正确；他举例说，自己有过一次很恐怖的经验，卷入了沙尘暴之中，接着就失去了方向感。
(Jane said she had been really dissociated.All of this material about the strange underwater world was new to both of us, and Jane felt particularly good about having it verified so enthusiastically by Bill. It appeared to be at least an excellent example of telepathy, surpassing even the unscheduled 182nd session.It will be remembered that in that one, which the Gallaghers also witnessed, Seth delivered facts about Bill’s deceased mother that neither Jane or I were familiar with.(珍说她真的完全出离了。有关这些奇妙水中世界的所有资料，对我们两人来讲都很新鲜，而且比尔这么热切地证实资料的正确性，让珍觉得特别棒。这起码是一次极佳的心电感应，甚至超越第182节的临时课。大家应该记得，那一次加拉格夫妇也参与见证，赛斯传递了比尔已故母亲的相关讯息，我和珍跟她母亲不熟。
(After the Gallaghers had left, Jane told me that whatever ability she possesses certainly operates at its best when there are witnesses.She also said that a few drinks before a session seem to help a great deal.Counting back, we decided she had had three beers in the course of the evening before the session, although they had been spaced out.Jane feels that alcohol somehow promotes a very beneficial relaxation on her part, for sessions.(加拉格夫妇离开后，珍告诉我说，每当有证人在场见证，她所有的能力一定都能发挥到淋漓尽致。她还说，课前喝点酒好像很有帮助。我们算了一下，发现今晚课前她一共喝了三瓶啤酒，但不是一口气全部喝完。珍觉得就自己来说，不知怎地酒可以让她在赛斯课里非常容易放松，这对赛斯课有帮助。
(Bill told us that later today Sunday, while at the lake, he would try to check upon some locations as defined rather poorly by Seth. Both Jane and I urged caution.The turn the material took this evening surprised us. We didn’t know what to make of gold chests, Venus in the ascendancy, etc.(比尔告诉我们说今天，也就是星期天稍后，他到湖边时会勘查一下那些赛斯描述的相当模糊的地点，我和珍都提醒他要小心。今晚的资料让我们感到惊讶，我们本来不知道黄金徽章、金星上升是指什么。
(Tracing of the Ballantine Ale label used in the 10th envelope test, in the 193rd session, September 27,1965. )百龄坛啤酒标签描摹图，使用于1965年9月27日第193节第10次信封测试

SESSION 193 第193节 心灵感应和化学反应 信封10


SEPTEMBER 27, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年9月27日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(Lorraine Shafer witnessed tonight’s session.We hadn't seen her for several weeks.Lorraine now told us that she too had been in York Beach, ME, during the same week that Dr. Instream had been there.Dr. Instream had stayed overnight in York Beach on Monday, August 23; Lorraine had visited the town on Saturday afternoon, August 28.(洛琳∙雪佛见证了今晚的课。我们好几个礼拜没看到她。洛琳现在告诉我们，殷斯翠姆博士在缅因州约克海滩的那个礼拜，她也在那里。殷斯翠姆博士8月23日星期一在约克海滩过夜；洛琳则是在8月28日星期六下午造访那个城镇。
(It will be remembered that our 2nd envelope test, held during the 180th session, was held on August 23, and that it featured a photograph of Jane at York Beach.Now checking our records, we saw that an unscheduled session was held on August 28. Can this be coincidence?(大家应该记得，第180节里我们做了第二次信封测试，那一天正是8月23日，那张测试照片就是珍在约克海滩拍的。我们检视了一下记录，发现8月28日举行了一次临时课，这会是一种巧合吗？
(The Gallaghers witnessed the unscheduled session, the 182nd. Lorraine knows them superficially, having witnessed a few sessions with them.We find no reference to either Lorraine or York Beach in the 182nd session.It happens that this session was reconstructed from memory; since it was unscheduled I had not been prepared to take formal notes.Jane and I did our best, recalling it.(加拉格夫妇见证了第182节临时课，洛琳跟他们一起见证过几次，但对他们不太了解。我们发现第182节的课里，并没有洛琳或约克海滩的资料。刚好那节课是透过回忆重建出来；由于是临时课的关系，我并没有做正式记录的准备，内容是由我和珍尽我们所能努力回想出来的。
(For the 10th envelope test I used a label from a bottle of Ballantine Ale.See the tracing on page 289.Jane and I met the Gallaghers accidentally at a dancing establishment last Saturday evening.I absent-mindedly peeled the label from a bottle as we sat talking in the darkened room, then decided on the spur of the moment to use it for a test.I wondered if friendly impressions might attach themselves to the label.I took care to slip the wet label in a coat pocket when neither Jane or the Gallaghers were looking, and as it developed Jane had no idea of the test object for the session.(我用了百龄坛啤酒瓶上的标签，来做第10次信封测试。见上图。上周末，我和珍在舞会上巧遇加拉格夫妇。我们坐在一个昏暗的房间里讲话，当时我无意间把这个标签从瓶身剥了下来，灵机一动，决定拿来当测试之用。我在想，不知道这种和睦融洽的印象是否会跟这张标签连结在一起。于是我趁珍和加拉格夫妇都没在看的时候，小心地将这张湿标签塞进外套口袋，因此珍对这节课的测试物品毫无所悉。
(Our encountering the Gallaghers last Saturday evening led to the strange unscheduled 192nd session, incidentally.In that session Bill Gallagher asked Seth about the possibility of locating artifacts in the waters of Seneca Lake.Describing the location of a certain cove, and underwater cave, Seth used as a starting point a gasoline station and the letters M, A, and C. Seth told us these could be part of the name Mack, or were involved with a Mack truck; he was not sure.(上周末晚上巧遇加拉格夫妇，意外导致了奇妙的第192节课。在那节课里比尔问赛斯，塞内卡湖里是否可能埋藏手工艺品，赛斯以加油站和M、A、C等字母起头，接着描述了某个水湾和水底洞穴的位置。赛斯告诉我们，那几个字母可能是麦克(Mack)这个名字的一部分，或是与麦克卡车有关；他不确定。
(To our surprise Lorraine told us this evening that she is quite familiar with Seneca Lake.She said that in spite of its size there are relatively few gasoline stations on the lake.She also told us that she knows of a Mack’s boat livery on Seneca Lake.This livery of course has a gasoline station with it.She gave the location of this station as about 5 miles north of Himrod, on Route 14, on the west side of the lake.Jane and I will relay this information to the Gallaghers.(令我们惊讶的是，洛琳今晚告诉我们，她对塞内卡湖相当熟悉。她说，尽管那个湖很大，但加油站却非常少。她还告诉我们，她知道塞内卡湖那里有一家麦克小船出租店。这家出租店当然附设了加油站。她也给了加油站的位置，是在塞内卡湖西侧14号公路希姆劳德[Himrod]北边约5英里的地方。我和珍会将这个讯息传达给加拉格夫妇。
(The session was held in our large font room.Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her voice was a bit stronger than usual, her pace faster.Much of the time she sat leaning forward with her head down somewhat.Her glasses were on when she began speaking, actually at 8:58, but she soon removed them.)(这节课是在我们前面的大房间举行。珍闭上眼睛坐下来开始讲话。声音比平常稍微强烈一些，速度也比较快。大部分时间都坐着，身子往前倾，微微低着头。她实际上在8:58分说话，刚开始戴着眼镜，但很快就拿下来。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.’’)(“晚安，赛斯。” )
May I welcome Marleno to our circle.我欢迎玛蕾诺加入我们的行列。
It seems that our friends are congregating about York Beach, does it not?好像我们的朋友都聚集在约克海滩附近，是吧？
(“Yes.”)(“对啊。”)
I will discuss our dream material for a short while, for it is important that you understand it.For in the same way that dream images are projected outward from the personality, so also are thoughts projected, and all influences that extend from one personality to another.我要稍微讨论一下我们的梦资料，因为这方面你们应该要了解，这很重要。梦影像是从人格往外投射出去，同样地，思想也是如此投射出去，人格与人格之间所有影响力的扩展也都一样。
All such projections have an electromagnetic and chemical reality that has its origin within the field of the given personality.This projection of energy is one of the main characteristics of your kind. Dreams and dream images are then projected by the individual in sleep, and also in the waking state, although on a subconscious basis.So are thoughts constantly sent outward, and other projections which we have not yet discussed.Therefore as the individual sends out these projections, so does he receive the projections of others.As you know, telepathy operates constantly beneath the dictates of the ego, and so is your intellectual climate formed.所有这些投射，皆有源自于该人格领域内的电磁实相与化学实相。能量的投射是你们族类的主要特征，个体在睡觉时会投射出梦和梦影像，醒时状态中也会，不过是在潜意识基础上投射的。思想就是这样持续地放送出去，其他我们尚未讨论的投射也是如此。因此，一个个体怎么将这些投射放送出去，就怎么接收到来自其他人的投射。如你们所知，心电感应经常在自我的支配之下运作，于是形成你们的智性气氛(intellectual climate)。
It is well known that emotions have a chemical reality, but it is not generally realized that dreams also have the same sort of property.Telepathy is indeed affected by chemical reactions, as dreams are.众所周知，情感有其化学实相，但一般人不了解的是，梦也有同类的特性。心电感应确实会受到化学反应影响，而梦也会。
(Jane now took a long pause.)(珍这时停顿较久。)
If physical laws were the only basis for actuality, then telepathy would be impossible.But then, dreams would be equally impossible.For in the dream state the personality is molded and changed through actions that do not exist within the physical universe.The personality reacts to dream experiences as it reacts to any other experience.It does not discriminate, as the ego does, between one kind of experience and another.如果物质定律是现实的唯一基础，那么心电感应就不可能存在。但如此一来，梦也一样不可能存在。因为在梦境里，人格是被不存在于物质宇宙的行动所形塑与改变。人格对梦经验所做的反应，就跟对其他经验的反应一样。人格就像自我一样，无法分辨不同类别的经验。
It is formed equally by those experiences which are purely subjective, and which exist only within the psychological time framework.The subjective experiences therefore result in definite changes within the physical body framework. These changes are not caused because of a physical event, but because of an event occurring within a dream condition which has no reality in your physical universe.梦一样是由那些全然主观、只存在于心理时间架构中的经验所形成。因此主观的经验会在肉体架构里产生明确的改变，这些改变并不是由物质事件所造成，而是由发生在梦境里的事件所产生，而这个梦境里的事件在你们物质宇宙里并没有实相。
Such subjective events therefore manipulate physical matter through the personality who experiences them.The field of reality for any given personality must and does include all these areas of activity, for they give form and dimension to his existence.I have said earlier that the individual could not exist in a physical universe if he did not also exist in the dream universe.Again, there are chemical and electromagnetic connections that cannot be severed between all these states of consciousness.因此这类主观的事件，会透过经验它们的人格来操纵实体物质。对任何人格而言，实相的领域必须也确实包含了所有这些活动的领域，因为它们为他的存在提供了形式和维度。我之前提过，除非个体也同时存在于梦宇宙，否则他无法存在于物质宇宙。再说一次，在所有这些意识状况之间，有一些化学和电磁上的连结无法切割。
If they are severed you would not have a sane unit, but a disjointed pattern not capable of maintaining balance.如果切割了这些连结，那你们就不会有神智清楚的个体，而只是一种彼此分离、无法维持平衡的形态。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:16.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first break. Her eyes remained closed. Her pace was good, her voice a little stronger than usual, and with a trace of her brogue.Lorraine was also taking shorthand notes.(9:16分休息。珍第一次休息的出离状况跟平时一样，双眼一直闭着，速度不急不徐，声音比平常稍微强烈一点，还带了些许爱尔兰口音。洛琳也以速记方式做笔记。
(Jane resumed in the same manner at 9:27.)(珍以同样的方式，9:27分继续口述。)
Now.Any form, even an imaginary form, exists in some dimension as a form.现在。任何形式，甚至是想象的形式，都以一种形式存在于某个维度。
It may not exist in space but it exists in some dimension as a form, and all forms have structure; and so dream images have structure and form, although they do not exist in your space.And so I have a structure and a form, although I do not exist in your space.它在空间上或许不存在，但却以一种形式存在于某个维度之中，而且所有的形式皆有其结构；所以梦影像虽然不存在于你们的空间当中，但也有其结构与形式。同理，我虽然不存在于你们的空间之内，但我也有结构和形式。
My form may be changed, but so do you change the form of your own thoughts.When you dream of a particular location, that location does then exist in fact. It has a definite reality, although it may not have a physical reality.Because you experience it, and you are partially physical, it does have some basis of reality in physical terms, even though it may not exist full-blown in physical terms.我的形式可能会改变，但是你们也一样可以改变自己的思想形式。当你们梦见某个特定的地点，事实上那个地点就真的存在了，虽然它或许没有物质实相，但却有一个明确的实相。由于你经验了这个地点，而你某部分也是物质性的，因此这个地点的确有一些物质实相基础，即使在物质上它可能尚未完全存在。
The connections between dream images and the physical body are always maintained. There is a difference in mass, and a difference in thickness of molecules.Nevertheless the dream location does exist in its own legitimate reality, and its reality is to some extent dependent upon physical reality.梦影像与肉体之间一直都保持着连结关系，但在质量上和分子密度上会有差异。然而，这个梦中地点在其合理实相内，的确存在，它的实相或多或少取决于物质实相。
There is a chemical necessity, as I have said, that makes dreaming inevitable.But then these dreams in turn affect the personality in general, and affect the actions of that personality in a physical universe.It goes without saying that telepathy operates within the dreaming state quite as effectively as it operates while the individual is awake.In the waking state it operates subconsciously.But in all times there is no boundary, generally speaking, that exists to separate one psychological unit from another.There are differences between psychological units, and you concentrate upon these differences.Nevertheless one man’s dreams affect another’s, and that man is in turn affected by the dreams of his neighbor.如我之前所说，有一个化学上的必然性，让做梦变成无可避免。不过一般而言，这些梦接着会反过来全面影响人格，也影响该人格在物质宇宙之内的行动。心电感应在梦境里运作的效果，跟在个体醒时运作的效果完全一样，这一点不必多说。在醒时状态下，心电感应在潜意识层面上运作。但一般来说，始终不会有任何的界限，能将一个心理个体与另一个心理个体分隔开来。不同的心理个体之间会有差异，你们就将注意力专注在这些差异上面。然而一个人的梦会影响到另一个人的梦，他旁边人的梦反过来也会影响到他。
I am not speaking, now, of some nebulous indirect fashion.A man is affected by the dreams of his fellows in quite definite, realistic and practical ways.He is affected by them both chemically and electromagnetically, and he in turn also affects others in the same manner.我现在这种说法，一点都不模棱两可。一个人的伙伴所做的梦，会以相当明确、真实与实际的方式，影响到这一个人。这些梦会在化学层面与电磁层面上影响到他，他也会以相同的方式反过来影响其他人。
It goes without saying, again, that these communications follow in the lines of emotional attraction.For one thing, there are also individual differences which operate, so that any given personality will be more open to particular influences, and will tend to ignore others.For while there are no boundaries as such about the self, for practical purposes the self is a core of characteristic actions and reactions with which all environment is manipulated and handled.同样地，这些沟通都是跟着情感吸引力在定。首先，也有个别差异的现象存在，因此任何人格都会对某些特定的影响力持较为开放的态度，而易于忽视其他影响力。不过，由于自己(self)的周围并没有像这样的界限，实际上自己就是独特的行动与反应的一个核心，借此，得以操纵与掌握所有的环境。
These characteristic responses have been built up through past existences, and because the self is not limited the core can at any time expand and project.这些独特的反应是经由过去的存在而建立，由于自己并未受到限制，因此这个核心随时都可以扩展与投射。
I am going to give you a break, so that we shall be in an advantageous position for our Dr. Instream material.我先让你们休息一下，我们待会儿要讨论殷斯翠姆博士的资料。
(Break at 9:44.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed. Her voice continued to display its peculiar brogue occasionally. Her pace had been good.(9:44分休息。珍的出离状况如常，一直闭着眼睛，声音依然偶尔会出现奇特的爱尔兰口音，速度维持得很不错。
(Up until now, although the session was being held in our front room, none of us had given a thought to traffic noise.It is interesting to note that when Jane resumed with the Dr. Instream material, we immediately became conscious of the traffic noise.I was of course aware of my own irritation; Jane concurred at the end of the session.(这节课虽然在我们前面的房间举行，但一直到现在，我们没有任何人会把车子噪音放在心上。蛮有意思的是，当珍继续讨论殷斯翠姆博士的资料，我们马上意识到这个问题。我当然觉察到自己的焦躁不安；而珍在这节课快结束时也出现同样的情形。
(When Jane resumed, still seated and with her eyes closed, her pace was somewhat faster than it had been in previous tests. She used some pauses however, and I will indicate a few of them along with a couple of strategic times.She sat quietly with her head tipped back as she spoke.Resume at 10:05 )(珍依然闭着眼睛，坐着继续口述，速度比先前做测试时还快了一些，而过程中停顿几次，我会适时标明其中一部分。她静静坐着，讲话时头往后抬。10:05分继续口述。)
We will now see what we can do.Give us a moment.现在就看看我们可以做些什么。请稍候。
There is an impression of an incident that occurred, of interest to Dr. Instream, in the middle of this week, possibly around Wednesday, that was unpleasant.(Pause.) Involving someone else, but with some connection to Dr. Instream.我有一个印象，在过去这一周里，可能是星期三，发生了一件事引起殷斯翠姆博士的注意，让人不太愉快。(停顿)与另一人有关，但跟殷斯翠姆博士也有一些关联。
As to now, I see him in connection with a railing, of steel or wood.A letter of interest to him that arrived yesterday or today, from a place with high grasses.(Pause.)至于现在，我看到他与一道钢制或木制栏杆有关。有一封他感兴趣的信，是昨天或今天寄来的，来自一个草长得很高的地方。(停顿)
A variety of shapes such as packages.String of a twine type.I believe he received some bad news this week, and suffered some indisposition.A telephone may be ringing at this moment (pause, at 10:10) in his immediate environment.各种不同的形状，像是包裹类的东西。缠绕成团的绳子。我觉得他这个礼拜得知不好的消息，身体有点不适。此刻身旁正传来电话铃声。(停顿，时间是10:10分)
There is a conversation concerning a schedule, and an automobile ride.He is I believe also thinking of an incident in his past.(Pause.)有一段对话，谈到时程表和搭乘汽车的问题。我觉得他也正想到自己过去的一个事件。(停顿)
Do you have a test for me this evening, Joseph ?约瑟，你今晚要测试我吗?
(“Yes, just a minute.”(“对，等一下。”
(It was 10:12.I had to leave my desk to hand Jane the test envelope.She took it without opening her eyes.)(时间是10:12分。我得离开桌子，把测试信封交给珍。她拿了过去，但眼睛并未张开。)
Again, give us a moment.同样地，等我们一会儿。
(As before, Jane's “moment” was actually very brief, much shorter than many of her routine pauses.It was now that I was quite conscious of traffic noise.Janes voice remained quiet.)(跟之前一样，珍的“一会儿”其实非常短暂，比她平常许多的停顿短很多。我这时清楚意识到车子的噪音，珍维持轻声细语。)
These are impressions.我的印象如下。
A variety of shapes and designs.A connection with a fabric, and something to do with wood, and a house.An impression of several people.各种不同的形式与图案。与织品有关，与木材与房子也有关。有几个人的印象。
A design repeated, as of blocks.An impression of a journey by automobile.(Pause) A date, perhaps 1965.(Pause.) R.B. And another, and the impression of a road or a path, or of lines suggesting a road or a path.一种重复的图案，像块状的。有个汽车旅行的印象。(停顿)一个日期，也许是1965年(停顿)。R.B.，还有一个男人，有一条道路或小径的印象，不然就是可以联想到道路或小径的线条。
Black and white (pause) having to do with a particular circumstance, and initials and many designs.A fuzzy sort of paper, and a smooth one.黑色与白色(停顿)，与某个状况、开头字母和许多图案有关。一张毛绒绒的纸，和一张光滑的纸。
I seem to pick up a connection with Christmas or Christmas tree, though I believe this is indirectly connected rather than directly; and something dark of rectangular shape, and also again of a border (pause) and something shady, and a sky symbol.我似乎抓到一个与圣诞树或圣诞节有关的连结，不过我觉得这个连结是间接而非直接的；某个深色、长方形的东西，这次还是有边框，(停顿)以及某个阴暗的东西，和天空的符号。
You may as always after our tests take a break.我们测试完后，你们可以按惯例休息一下。
(Break at 10:20.Jane was dissociated as usual, she said. She now said the traffic bothered her also.She was not nervous in giving the data on Dr. Instream, or on our own test object.Suffice it to note here that this was Jane's third test before witnesses.An analysis of the test follows the end of the session.(10:20分休息。珍说自己的出离状况一如平常，这时又说，车子噪音也干扰到她。珍在提供有关殷斯翠姆博士的资料或我们自己测试物品的资料时，并不会紧张。简单说明一下，这是珍第三次在见证人面前做测试。本节课的结尾是有关这次测试的分析。
(Jane resumed, again with her eyes closed and in a quiet voice, at 10:33.)(10:33分，珍同样闭着眼睛轻声细语地继续口述。)
We will now end our session, since we have indeed kept you busy of late.我现在就要结束我们的课，因为我们最近真的让你们太忙了。
I am using fine manners this evening, Marleno, and I have not raised my voice—马蕾诺，我今晚风度优雅，都没有拉高噪音喔——
(Except now.Seth/Jane's voice suddenly climbed a great deal in volume, very briefly, before subsiding.)(但此时例外，赛斯/珍的音量突然又大幅拉高，但很快就降下来。)
—since we have had difficulties in that direction.I will indeed therefore close our session out of due regard, although I could indeed continue it indefinitely; and am sometimes tempted to do so.My heartiest wishes to you both.——因为那样让我们惹出了一些麻烦。出于应有的尊重，我真的要结束这节课了，不过我的确可以一直继续下去；而有时候也真的想这么做。衷心祝福各位。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:35.Jane was dissociated as usual.Her eyes remained closed.Marleno is of course Lorraine Shafer’s entity name.(10:35分结束。珍出离的状况如常。双眼一直闭着。玛蕾诺当然是洛琳∙雪佛的存有名字。
(The label contains a variety of shapes and designs.See the tracing on page 289.The connection with a fabric can be the coat pocket in which I carried the label home.Our table at the dancing establishment Saturday night had a top of simulated wood grain.The house can be our own, the several people of course Jane and me and Bill and Peggy Gallagher; the Gallaghers were with us Saturday night when I picked the label as a test object.(测试的标签纸上有各种不同的形状和图案。见上图。跟织品有关的东西可能是我的外套口袋，那天我将标签放进口袋里带回家。在星期六晚上舞会中，我们的桌子就是仿木材纹路的桌面。房子指的可能是我们自己的房子，几个人当然就是我和珍、还有比尔和蓓·加拉格；星期六晚上我拿了这张标签要当测试物品时，加拉格夫妇跟我们在一起。
(Designs are repeated in the label, but no blocks appear.The journey by automobile can refer to our driving home Saturday evening.There is an 1840 date on the label, but not 1965.I was of course involved with the test object, and my initials are R.B., but this can apply to any test object.We don’t know which “another” Seth refers to.The label bears parallel oval lines which can suggest a road or a path.(标签上是有重复的图案，但没有看到块状的东西。汽车旅行可能是指星期六晚上我们开车返家这件事。标签上有个日期是1804年，而不是1965年。我当然与这张测试标签有关，而我的名字开头字母就是R.B.，不过这一部分可以套用于任何测试物品。我不知道赛斯说的“另一个人”是指谁。这张标签上面印有可以“联想到”道路或小径的椭圆形线条。
(Neither Jane or I understand the reference to black and white.Having to do with a particular circumstance, initials and many designs, can apply to many things, including the test object.The label is fuzzy on the edges that were torn as I peeled it from the bottle, yet it is printed on a peculiarly smooth paper.(珍和我都不了解黑色与白色指的是什么。至于与某个状况、开头字母和许多图案有关，可以套用到许多事物，包括这张测试物品。这张标签纸在我从瓶子上撕下来时起了毛边，而它原本是印在一张特别光滑的纸上。
(The Christmas reference is an interesting one, and can be seen when one notes that the label is printed in red and green, on yellow stock.Jane said also that to her the XXX symbol on the label means Christmas.We do not know to what “something dark of rectangular shape” refers to, unless it’s the shape of the table we sat at in the dancing establishment.(圣诞节的说法很有意思，如果注意到标签纸是在黄色纸张印上红色与绿色，那就看得出来了。珍也说，对她而言，标签上XXX的符号就代表圣诞节的意思。我们不晓得“某个深色、长方形的东西”所指为何，除非是舞会中我们坐的那张桌子的形状。
(The label has a dark green border.Jane suggested that the “something shady” reference can be the dimly-lit room in which we sat Saturday evening.Jane also said the sky symbol, to her, is quite definitely the circles used in the Ballantine trademark, the three-ring sign.She relates these circles to symbols for the sun, moon, the planets, etc.(这张标签有深绿色的边框。珍提到“某个阴暗的东西”可能是星期六晚上我们坐在昏暗的房间里。珍也说，天空的符号，对她而言很明确就是百龄坛商标使用的圆圈、三个环状标志。她把这些圆圈联想成是太阳、月亮和行星等象征。)
(Tracing of the black and white photograph used in the 11th envelope test, September 29,1965, in the 194th session.)黑白相片描摹图，使用于1965年9月29日第194节第11次信封测试

SESSION 194 第194节 快速动眼睡眠 信封11


SEPTEMBER 29, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年9月29日 星期三晚上9点 定期课
(We have been reading the article on sleep in the September 18th issue of the New Yorker. Called “A Third Stage of Existence”, it deals with REM sleep, or the rapid eye movements that have been shown to occur during dreaming.Since Seth has dealt with dreams to some extent Jane and I have a somewhat different slant on sleep and dreaming, and what is involved.(我们目前在读9月份第18期的《纽约客》[New Yorker]杂志，其中一篇关于睡眠的文章〈第三阶段的存在〉，讨论到睡眠时的快速动眼期[REM,Rapid Eye Movement],也就是指做梦时眼睛会快速移动。由于赛斯已多多少少讨论过梦的问题，因此引发了我和珍对于睡眠、做梦及其相关问题的一些不同观点。
(For the test object I picked a black and white photograph of a dog Jane had owned when I married her.The dog, Mischa, is now dead.Jane took the picture before I met her, some 11 years ago.See the tracing on page 295.I slipped the photo between two pieces of Bristol, then into the usual double envelopes; the Bristol board prevented identification of the photo’s serrated edges by touch.(这一次测试物品我选了一张黑白照片，里面是珍跟我结婚前她所饲养的一只狗。这只狗米夏[Mischa]已经去世。我大约11年遇见珍之前，她就拍了这张照片。见上图。我把它夹在两张纸卡中间，再放入平常用的双层信封袋里；纸卡的用意是要防止她摸出照片的锯齿状边缘。
(The session was held in our back room, and was a quiet one.Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was average. Her pace was slow at the beginning but soon picked up speed.She began speaking at 9:01.)(这节课在我们后面的房间举行，是一节安静的课。珍坐了下来，闭上眼睛开始说话，音量适中，刚开始口述时慢条斯理，但不一会儿就加快速度。9:01分开始讲话。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
With yourself and Ruburt, I was amused to think that a scientist was conducting experiments on a serious level in order to discover whether or not dreams actually exist.光想到有位科学家为了发现梦是否实际存在，而严谨地做实验，我跟你自己以及鲁柏都感到很好玩。
This is indeed an example of an endeavor of the sort that is too often carried on, with energy expended in a search for a reality that is known by any nincompoop to exist.有的人就是会竭尽心力，寻求任何一个傻瓜都知道的事，这种情形司空见惯，这次实验的确就是个例子。
The reality of dreams themselves can only be investigated through direct contact. Their reality cannot be probed by scientific devices, for dreams in this respect are as nebulous as the spirit, or soul, or inner self.Dreams are directly experienced. They have no meaning outside of their relationship with the personality.梦的实相本身只能透过直接接触来研究，它们的实相无法以科学仪器来探查，因为在这方面梦就像心灵、灵魂或内我一样不可捉摸。梦要直接来经验，要是梦与人格脱离关系，就失去了意义。
As far as your system is concerned, they cannot be suddenly made flesh, to dwell among you.REM sleep or no REM sleep, your dreams exist constantly, beneath consciousness, even in the waking state. The personality is constantly affected by them.Their existence has its own dimension which is connected to the physical organism.It is impossible to deprive a human being of dreams, for even though you deprive him of sleep, this necessary mental function will be carried on subconsciously.就你们的系统而言，梦无法突然活生生地出现在你们生活中。快速动眼睡眠也好，非快速动眼睡眠也罢，你们的梦始终存在于意识之下，甚至存在于醒时状态中，人格时时刻刻都受到梦的影响。梦的存在有自己的维度，与肉体组织相连。就算你可以剥夺一个人的睡眠，但不可能剥夺他的梦，这种必要的精神功能会在潜意识层面运作。
Dreams are an example of Mental activity that has its origin within the physical organism, but exists in a dimension which is not mainly physical.Dreams are an example of the inner self’s basically independent nature.梦是精神活动(Mental activity)的一种，这种精神活动有其肉体组织上的根源，不过却存在于一种不是以物质为主的维度之中。内在自我的基本特质是独立，而梦就是一个例子。
The eye movements noted in the beginning of REM sleep are only indications of dream activity that is closely connected to the physical layers of the self.These periods mark not the onset of dreams, but the return of the personality from deeper layers of dream awareness to more surface areas.快速动眼睡眠，在开始出现眼球运动时，只是表示这时的梦活动与自己(self)肉体层次密切相关。这些阶段并不是表示梦才刚开始，而是代表人格正从意识中较深的层面回到较表浅的区域。
The self is actually returning to more surface levels of consciousness, to check upon its environment.There is a transference of main energy in deeper dream states, from physical concentration to a mental concentration, actually quite separated from physical connections.实际上，这个自己正返回意识较为表浅的层面，来检查环境。在较深层的梦境当中，主要能量会从物质层面转移到精神层面，与物质的连结其实已分开得很彻底。
Quite simply, the self travels to levels of awareness, and to layers of the self that are far divorced from the physical areas of mobility.The muscles are lax because activity of a physical nature is not required for the physical organism.Actions are indeed being carried on, and actions which would be considered physical if the body was moving, and if the individual were awake.These actions, walking, talking, working, any conceivable dream action, these require energy.The energy that is not being expended within the physical system is used to sustain these mental actions.很简单，自己旅行到意识的各层面，进入了远离肉体范围的自己层面里。由于肉体组织不需要实质的活动，所以肌肉很放松。行动确实持续进行，如果身体真的在移动，而且如果这个人是在清醒状态，那么这些行动就会被视为实质的行动。这些行动、走路、说话、工作，任何想像出来的梦行动，都需要能量。在物质系统中没有消耗掉的能量，就会用来支撑这些精神行动。
The chemical excesses built up in the waking state are automatically changed as they are drained off, into electrical energy, which also helps to form and sustain dream images.Your scientists would learn more about the nature of dreams if they would but train themselves to recall their own dreams, and then study them in relation to their own normal activities and physical events.一旦醒时状态累积的过量化学成分被排掉时，会自动转变成电子能量，而有助于梦影像的形成与维持。只要你们的科学家能自我训练，回想自己的梦，并研究这些梦与自己日常活动和物质事件的关联，就会更加了解梦的本质。
I suggest a brief break.我建议休息一下。
(Break at 9:28.Jane had been dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been good, her voice average.She resumed in the same manner at 9:29.)(9:28分休息。珍第一阶段口述的出离状况一如平常，双眼一直闭着，速度掌握得不错，声音适中。9:29分以同样的方式继续口述。)
The scientist of whom you have read, in his experiments attempts to deprive the individual of sleep.你们读到的那位科学家，试图在他的实验中拿掉人的睡眠。
He has worked with human beings and cats.The very attempt to deprive an individual of sleep, however, will automatically set into mechanism subconscious dream activity.The tampering will then change the conditions. The direct experience of the developing dream is what they should be concerned with.他曾做过人类和猫的实验。不过，这种拿掉人睡眠的企图，会不知不觉影响到潜意识梦活动的机制。这样的干预会改变情境，他们应该关注的是直接体验梦的形成过程。
This could be studied to some degree if proper suggestions were given to the individual that he would awaken at the exact point when a dream ends.The dream state and dream conditions could also be studied quite legitimately, and to more purpose, using hypnosis.Here you are working with the mind itself as your material, and merely suggesting that it operate in a certain fashion. You are not tampering with the mechanics of its operation, and therefore automatically altering the conditions.这一部分或多或少可以加以研究，前提是向受试者适度暗示说：他要梦结束的那一刻会清醒过来。利用催眠也可以来研究梦中状态和梦的情境，这样的方式相当合理，也可以达到更多目的。这时你是把精神本身当成资料的处理，而且只暗示它会以某种方式运作，你不会干预它的运作机制，也不会在不知不觉中改变情境。
Dr. Instream might find such a study would bring him much satisfaction.Through hypnosis you can get complete dream recall, with a good operator.You can suggest ordinary sleep, and then suggest that the subject, in his sleep and without waking, give a verbal description of his dream or dreams.殷斯翠姆博士或许会发现，这样子的研究他非常满意。透过催眠，再加上优秀的执行者，你就可以完全记起梦的内容。你可以先暗示会有个平常的睡眠，然后再暗示受试者在睡觉未醒的状况下，口头描述自己做的梦。
This however would involve many a nightly vigil.A better procedure would be to hypnotize a subject, and you would need a good one, and suggest that under hypnosis he repeat the dreams of the night before.There are many opportunities for an investigation of dreams along these lines, and the results would yield more legitimate information.The dreams of the mentally ill, using these methods, could also be studied if the affliction, of course, was not too severe. The dreams of children could be investigated in this manner without too much difficulty, and these could be compared, generally speaking, with the dreams of adults. Many differences between the two would be noted.不过，这得花上好几个不眠不休的夜晚。比较好的方式，是找一个不错的受试者来催眠，暗示他在催眠的状态下，复述前一晚做的梦。按照这样做就会有许多研究梦的机会，最后又可以得到更多合理的讯息。也可以用这些方法来研究精神病患的梦，当然，前提是他们的病症不太严重。
Children dream more vividly and more often.They return more frequently however to periods of near wakefulness, in order to check their physical environment, since they are not as sure of it as adults are.In deep periods of sleep children range further away, as far as their dream activities are concerned.小孩子的梦可以用这种方式审视，一点也不难，一般而言，可以拿小孩子的梦跟大人的梦比较，从中能看出两者间很多的差异。小孩子做梦的频率比较高，内容也比较生动。不过，由于他们对于物质环境不像大人那么确认，所以为了检视物质环境状况，他们更常回到接近清醒的阶段。就小孩子的梦中行动来说，处在深层睡眠阶段时，他们会漫游得更远。
The ego, not yet fully formed, allows them more freedom.For this reason also they have more telepathic and clairvoyant dreams than do adults.They also have more psychic energy, practically speaking.That is, they are able to draw upon energy more easily.Because of the intenseness of their waking existence, the chemical excesses build up at a faster rate.Therefore children actually have more of this chemical propellant to use in the formation of dreams.小孩子的自我，尚未完全形成。会容许他们更多自由。也基于这个原因，他们心电感应与千里眼的梦比大人多。事实上，他们拥有较多的心灵能量，也就是说，他们可以更轻易地利用能量。由于他们醒时存在的强度很高，所以过量的化学物质会累积得更快。因此小孩子其实会拥有更多这种化学促动力量，可用来形成他们的梦。
They are actually more conscious of their dreams, for the ego does not prevent awareness at this stage to the same degree that it will do later.实际上，他们更能意识到自己的梦，因为在这个阶段中，自我还不太会阻止梦的觉察，等到后面阶段，自我阻止的力道会比较强。
I will suggest another brief break, as I am keeping the 10 o’clock hour in mind, and would like to start again shortly before the hour.我建议再休息一下，因为我记得10点这个时刻，很快会在10点继续。
(Break at 9:50.Jane was dissociated as usual.Her eyes remained closed, her voice average, her pace quite fast.She also remembered some of the material in a general way.(9:50分休息。珍的出离状况如常。双眼一直闭着，声音适中，速度相当快。她也大致记得部分资料。
(She resumed in the same manner at 9:58.)(9:58分，珍以相同的方式继续口述。)
I have said often that any action changes that which acts, and that which is acted upon; and so in the sort of experiments that are now being carried on to study dreams.The acts of the investigators are changing the conditions in such a way it is easy to find that which you are looking for.我经常说，任何行动都会改变行动者，也会改变接受行动的对象；现在针对梦进行的这类研究实验，也是如此。由于研究人员的行动同时也正在改变情境，因此你可以轻易地找到你想要的结果。
For the investigator himself, through his actions, inadvertently brings about, in specific instances, those results for which he looks. The particular experiment may then seem to suggest conditions which are by no means general ones, but which may appear so.In hypnosis the subject is not as much on guard as a subject of an experiment when the subject knows in advance that he will be awakened by the experimenter, when electrodes are attached to the physical organism, when the conditions of the sleep laboratory are substituted for his ordinary nightly environment.It is impossible to study dreams when an attempt is made to isolate the dreamer from his own personality, to treat dreams as if they were physical or mechanical.The only laboratory for a study of dreams is the laboratory of the personality.因为研究人员本身，在某些特定的时机，会透过自己的行动而无意间带来他想看到的结果，导致这个特定的实验情境，虽然看起来像是一般常态，实际上却非如此。在催眠状态下，受试者不像在实验情境下受到那么多监控，因为在实验中，受试者事先就知道自己会被研究人员叫醒，受试者的身体会接上各种电极，睡眠实验室的环境也取代了他平常的夜间环境。不可能将做梦者与做梦者的人格独立分开，而进行梦的研究，也不可能把梦当成物质或机械来看待。若要研究梦，唯一的实验室就是人格实验室。
This is not as difficult as it might sound, and I have indeed suggested experiments that would be most effective.Now, give us a moment and we will see if we can find our Dr. Instream.听起来可能很难，其实不然，事实上我已经暗示过这样的实验会非常成功。现在，稍候一会儿，看看能不能找到我们的殷斯翠姆博士。
(It was 10:06.Jane settled herself in her rocker. Her eyes were closed, her head down, a hand to her face.Her voice was quiet and remained so.She used pauses but they were usually brief.)(时间是10:06分。珍坐在摇椅上，闭着双眼，低着头，一手托腮。声音保持轻柔，停顿几次，但通常都很短暂。)
These are impressions.(Pause briefly.)有几个印象。(停顿一下)
I believe that he has left some people, and is alone in what would appear to be some sort of alleyway, perhaps between high buildings, fairly dark with lights nearby.我觉得他已经离开了一些人，独自在一个看起来好像是小巷子的地方，也许是在两栋高耸的建筑物之间，相当阴暗，但附近有灯光。
(Pause at 10:09.) Impressions again, perhaps a round object in his hand.He thinks of papers on a desk, or in a briefcase, that seem to have to do with a particular plan.(10:09分停顿)又有一个印象，他手上可能有个圆的东西。他想到桌上或公事包里的一些文件，似乎与某个特别计划案有关。
Something with checks, perhaps a jacket.And a package which he has received today, or will receive shortly, tomorrow.(Pause.)里面有支票的东西，或许是件夹克。还有一个包裹，他今天已收到或明天很快会收到。(停顿)
I believe he has been irritated by a particular person, a male.I do not know... There is a connection, something to do with lights.Perhaps in connection with the man. Does he perhaps live on Light Street?Or his name {Jane gestured, her eyes still closed) Light Man—Light man, or something of that sort.(Pause.)我觉得有个人让他感到很烦，是个男的。我不知道……，有一种连结，跟灯光有关的某个东西，或许跟这个男人有关。也许他就住在灯街(Light Street)？要不然就是他的名字(珍做个手势，眼睛仍然闭着)叫莱特·曼(Light Man)——莱特曼(Lightman)或这类的名字。(停顿)
Also something to do with a federal matter.Dr. Instream is thinking philosophically now.Perhaps the round object in his hands has something to do with lights, as a bulb.{Gesture, and pause at 10:15.)也有一件事跟联邦事务相关。殷斯翠姆博士正在冷静地思考。他手上圆圆的东西也许跟灯或灯泡有关。(比出手势，10:15分停顿。)
Do you have a test for me, Joseph ?约瑟，你要测试我吗，？
("Yes.”(“对。”
(I handed Jane the envelope.She took it without opening her eyes, then sat quietly, holding it in both hands.Her pause was brief.)(我把信封递给珍。她接了过去，眼睛并未张开，双手拿着信封安静坐着，短暂停顿一会儿。)
Again, please give us a moment.请再等我们一下。
Dr. Instream should if possible read the data on your private tests, for on occasion it is possible that some of the Instream material may bleed through, so to speak.This is merely a possibility at times.如果可以的话，殷斯翠姆博士应该读一读你们私下做的测试资料，因为有时候这里面可能会出现一部分他要的资料。这有时候只是一种可能性而已。
These are impressions.以下这些是我得到的印象。
The color purple.(Pause.) Something rather neutral, rather than of intimate personal nature.Something partially blank, dots, an assemblage of something, it seems of shadowy form. But vertical and perhaps cone shaped.紫色。(停顿)相当中性的东西，而不是相当具个人性的东西。某个部分空白的东西，许多小圆点，由某些东西组合而成，形状似乎模糊不清，但外形是垂直的，也可能是圆锥状。
Not a photograph.Some kind of lettering (pause) and design.Joseph's initials have to do with it, but it is not an object with which he has great personal concern; though there may be a wallet connection, I doubt it.不是照片。某种文字(停顿)和图案。跟约瑟的开头字母有关，但不是他个人很关注的东西；不过我认为可能牵涉到一个钱包。
Perhaps something to do with neighbors indirectly.Mostly design, but with bare portions, and originals rather than exact duplicates.(Pause.) A fencelike shape.可能和邻居有间接的关系。主要是图案，但有一些空白部分，是原作而非精确的复制品。(停顿)像栅栏的形状。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:24.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed, her voice quiet.She said that right after she had delivered the material on Dr. Instream she felt quite tired.She realized she was tired as she heard herself asking me if I had a test for her.When I asked if it was possible for her to change her mind and postpone a test under such circumstances, she said she did not know.Jane regarded tonight’s envelope test as pretty much of a failure.(10:24分休息。珍的出离状况如常，双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔。她说，传述完殷斯翠姆博士的资料之后，感觉非常疲累。在听到自己问我是否要测试她时，她就意识到觉得累了。我问她在这样的情况下是否可能改变主意，把这次测试延后，她说她也不知道。珍认为今晚的信封测试一败涂地。
(See the tracing of the test photo on page 295. Jane felt the test data contained but few correct impressions.She said the color purple could apply to the brick facing depicted in the photograph.Jane remembered this quite well even though the photo was taken some years ago.Our dog sits before the Bronx, NY, house of Janes aunt; Jane said she well remembers the peculiar blue and red cast of the bricks.I saw the house once some years ago but have no conscious memory of the brick color.(见上面描摹图，珍觉得这些测试资料是有正确的印象，不过非常少。她说，紫色可能指照片里砖块表面的颜色。即使这张照片是在好多年前拍的，但珍仍牢牢记得这一点。我们的狗坐在珍的伯母家前面，那间房子位于布朗克斯[Bronx]；珍说，她记得很清楚，砖块的色调是很罕见的蓝色和红色。我几年前看过那间房子一次，但不记得砖块的颜色。
(The photo does have verticals in it, and the dog's form can be seen as cone shaped.Our dog was certainly of personal concern to us, the test object is a photogaph, my initials are not directly connected with it as far as being visible, and as far as we know there is no wallet connection with the photo, etc. Thus most of the rest of the data appear as opposite or reverse impressions.(照片里的确有垂直线，狗的外形也可以看成是圆锥状。我们个人对我们的狗当然很关注；测试物品是一张照片，就眼见所及，我的开头字母并没有直接关系；就我们所知，这张照片跟钱包也无关。因此，其余的资料大部分显然跟印象相反或颠倒。
(Jane resumed with her eyes again closed, her voice quiet, at 10:29.)(10:29分，珍再度闭上眼睛，轻声细语继续口述。)
We will shortly end our session.我们很快就会结束这节课。
Now in regard to our own test this evening: Ruburt, at this stage, should not work on our own test results as he has been doing. He has been concentrating too much on grading our tests.现在，有关今晚我们自己的测试方面：鲁柏现阶段，不应该像往常一样看待我们自己的测试结果，他一直都太在意我们测试的成效好坏。
He has worked at this several hours daily. This is not his job, and it will work against our results.His job is to remain as spontaneous as possible.His work in attempting to tabulize the test results thus far, will only hamper our results.He should be in no way connected with that endeavor.他每天在这方面的工作已长达好几个钟头，这并不是他的工作，而且这么做对我们的结果会有不利的影响。他该做的是尽可能顺其自然。他一直努力想让测试结果表格化(tabulize，译注：英文并无此字，但有 tabulate及tabularize两个接近的字，均为列成表格或表格化的意思，后面约瑟会再说明。)这只会妨碍我们的结果。他绝对没必要在这方面过度努力。
I cannot repeat this too strongly.He should dismiss the tests entirely from his mind. The tests in the sessions have not bothered him at all to any important degree, except for a natural initial nervousness, and all in all we have been coming along well enough.But at this stage he simply should leave the grading and so forth to you.Of course he may make suggestions as he reads the sessions, but that is all.这一点我再怎么强调也不为过。他应该完全摆脱掉对这些测试的挂心，我们课堂上的这些测试，除了他一开始自然会紧张之外，对他造成的干扰程度一点都不大，而且整体来说，我们也进展得够好了。但就现阶段来说，他只要将测试的好坏评价等事情完全交给你。当然他在阅读课堂资料时，也可以提出一些建议，但这样就够了。
I will have more to say concerning this sort of thing briefly at our next session.有关这一方面的事，下一堂课我还会简要地补充。
(For the last two days Jane had been trying to work out a system whereby the test results, both hits and misses, could be read more or less at a glance, as opposed to my rather rambling subjective treatment.I think Jane meant tabulate, above.(这两天珍一直努力想设计一套系统，以便一眼可以看出测试结果说中的与未说中的大概情形，而不要用我那种相当主观也漫无标准的叙述方式。我想珍上面那个英文字“tabulize”，应该是指表格化[tabulate]的意思。
(She had worked out a two-column system that seemed rather good to us, but neither of us had realized the very intense effort involved would be detrimental.Since Jane's idea would involve listing the material in such a fashion twice a week, and thus keep her involved, we decided to drop the idea, at least for the moment.(她已经设计出一套两个栏位的系统，对我们而言看来相当不错，但我们两人都不知道，如此集中火力所付出的努力，竟然会有害。由于珍的点子是要以这样的方式，每周列出资料两次，而且她也必须参与其中，不能置身事外，所以我们听了赛斯说的话后，就决定放弃这个念头，至少目前先这样。
(I had planned to ask Seth a few questions at the end of the session. I now realized that Jane was tired, but decided to see what developed.For material connected with the first question, see my notes on Lorraine Shafer, York Beach, and Dr. Instream on pages 289. 90, preceding the 193rd session.(我原本预计在这节课快结束前，问赛斯一些问题，我现在知道珍累了，但仍决定看看事情会如何发展。至于第一个问题的相关资料，可参看第193节开头中，我对洛琳·雪佛、约克海滩和殷斯翠姆博士的说明。
(“Do you want to say a few words about Lorraine Shafer being in York Beach the same week in August that Dr. Instream was there?Is there any connection at all between the two visits?”)(“洛琳·雪佛跟殷斯翠姆博士，都有8月的同一周到过约克海滩，有关这一点你要不要说几句话？这两人的造访彼此之间有没有一点关联呢？”)
A tenuous one. Marleno knew about your experience at York Beach, and because of circumstances in her own life she visited the general territory.An emotional connection with the sessions did have quite a bit to do with her particular visit to York Beach, however, and there was on her part a subconscious knowledge that Dr. Instream had been there also.I have told you that telepathy operates continually, and has strong emotional connections, so this should be no surprise.关联不大，玛蕾诺知道你们去过那里，就她自己的生活状况来说，她只不过是造访一个普普通通的地方。不过，她知道这些课的情感连结，与她这次造访约克海滩，实际上有相当大的关系，而且她的潜意识也知道殷斯翠姆博士在那里。我告诉过你们，心电感应一直持续在运作，也有强烈的情感连结，所以这件事应该不用大惊小怪。
(See the 9th, 15th, 17th, 69th and 80th sessions for material on our York Beach experiences. I believe that above Seth refers to the first three named sessions.These deal with events involving Jane and me at York Beach in August of1963, preceding the beginning of these sessions by several months.(见第9、15、17、69和80节课中，我们在约克海滩的资料，我觉得赛斯上面指的是最前面那三节课。这几节课都讨论到1963年8月，也就是我们这些课开始前的几个月，我和珍在约克海滩的事。
(Marleno is Lorraine Shafers entity name.(玛蕾诺是洛琳·雪佛的存有名。
(“Why has our cat Willy been sick so often lately?”)(“我们的猫威立最近为什么常常生病？”)
I suggest that you hold this question until our next session, as Ruburt is tired this evening because of his concentration upon the work which I have mentioned.There is nothing serious here, or I would discuss it this evening in any case, since you asked.I will answer specifically at our next session.我建议你下次上课再问这个问题，因为鲁柏把精神关注在我们提过的工作上，所以今晚太累了。这部分并没有太大的问题，否则既然你都问了，我今晚无论如何一定会讨论的。我下节课再特别回答你。
My heartiest regards to you both.送上我最深情的祝福给你们俩。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:40.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed, her voice quiet. Her pace had been good for the most part during the session.(10:40分结束。珍的出离状况如常，眼睛一直闭着，声音轻柔，整节课的速度多半维持得不错。
(I had intended asking one more question, concerning the source of the material Jane gave on the envelope test. So much of it appeared to be of opposite or reverse nature to the test object that it seemed to fit a pattern.(我原本打算多问一个问题，是关于珍在信封测试上给的资料来源，因为资料里面出现太多跟测试物品相反或颠倒的地方，似乎符合某种形态。
(We were relieved to learn our cat’s trouble was not serious.Willy had been sick rather often during the past weeks.We were puzzled by this, since according to Seth the owners of a pet contribute much to the pet’s health through use of their own psychic energy.Since we were so fond of Willy, we had thought we were contributing adequately before the sick spell.)(我们听到猫的问题不大，就放心了。过去这几个礼拜，威立生病的次数相当频繁，这个现象让我们感到不解，因为根据赛斯的说法，宠物主人会透过自己心灵能量的使用，而大大促进宠物健康。我们非常喜爱威立。所以在它发病前，我们一直都认为它应该得到了我们充分的帮助。)

SESSION 195 第195节 情感与梦人格 洛琳•谢佛


OCTOBER 4, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年10月4日 星期一 晚上9点 定期课
(This afternoon Jane called her publisher, Frederick Fell, and was pleased to learn that he liked her ESP book very much.The decks are now cleared for publication next April.Jane was also curious to hear Mr. Fell’s voice, to see what impressions she might pick up.(今天下午珍打电话给出版商佛德瑞克•费尔先生，很高兴得知他非常喜欢那本ESP的书。目前准备工作已经就绪，打算在明年4月出版。珍听到费尔先生的声音也很好奇，想看看她可以从中得到什么印象。
(I planned no envelope test for this session. Not because of the poor results of the last test in the 194th session, but to vary the steady test diet.I thought Jane might come to feel under pressure without a break occasionally.I expected the data on Dr. Instream to come through as usual, however.(我这节课不打算做信封测试，并不是因为上次第194节的测试结束不理想，而是想让一成不变的测试惯例来点变化。我认为持续了那么多次的测试，如果不偶尔休息一次，珍可能会有压力。不过，我期望有关殷斯翠姆博士的资料可以像往常一样传递过来。
(Lorraine Shafer was a witness for the session. She had witnessed the 193rd session also.The session was held in our font room, and was not interrupted.Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was quiet for the most part.She began rather slowly, then picked up some speed.)(洛琳•雪佛见证了这节课，她也见证第193节。这节课在我们前面的房间举行，并没有遭到干扰。珍坐下来，闭着眼睛开始讲话，声音大部分都很轻柔，刚开始速度相当慢，后来就加快了一些。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I am pleased that Ruburts mood has somewhat improved. I told him that the affair would work out to his advantage, but again patience is not one of his virtues.很高兴看到鲁柏的心情好了一些，我告诉过他，这件事最后对他有利，不过还是老话一句，耐心并不是他的强项。
(The last sessions in which Seth dealt with Jane 's ESP book were the 178th and the 180th.In both of these sessions, as well as many others, he stated the book would be a success, financially and otherwise.All of his statements concerning Jane's writing sales have proved out so far.Seth first mentioned the sale of the ESP book by name in the 92nd session. See Volume 3.)(赛斯上次讨论珍的ESP书，是在第178节和180节课里面。在这两节以及其他许多章节中，赛斯都表示，这本书无论在财务上或其他方面都会很成功。关于他对珍著作销售的所有陈述，到目前为止都证实是对的。赛斯在第92节课中，首次提到ESP书会出版，见第三册。)
Now.First of all, my greeting to Marleno. She is always welcome.There is on her part a block, that operates in much the same manner as Ruburt’s ego on occasion, as far as our sessions are concerned.This is caused by an inner willingness to believe, though this is a bad word, in the legitimate nature of my existence; a willingness however that is sometimes so desperate, if you will forgive the term, and so wholehearted, that it sets up automatic barriers on the part of other portions of the personality.现在。我先来向玛蕾诺问候一下，一直都很欢迎大架光临。就我们的课来说，她也有一种阻碍，其影响方式跟鲁柏的自我状况有时候非常雷同。这是因为她内在有一种意愿，想相信我的存在本质上是合理的，不过相信一词在这里不太恰当；然而有时候她有一种极度渴望(如果你容我用这个词的话)非常全心全意，以至于不知不觉中在这个人格的其他部分形成了阻碍。
If she were to accept the real validity of the sessions, then she would feel obligated to enter into the affair.She feels too deeply, and so sometimes she backs away, and sometimes she does not.This makes it difficult for me to speak to her specifically, for it is not easy for me then to look into her circumstances.要是她感觉这些课真的有效，她就会觉得应该要投入这件事。她的感觉太深刻了，所以有时会退开，有时又不会。这让我很难特别针对她说话，因为我不容易深入探查她的情境。
I say this because I would indeed, Marleno, be more helpful, as I have tried to be with the Jesuit and the cat lover.But so far, while you are interested, you have not quite allowed me to probe into your circumstances easily.玛蕾诺，我这么说是因为我真的会很有帮助，就像我之前试着帮助耶稣会信徒和爱猫人一样。不过，目前虽然你有兴趣，但你还没有完全容许我轻易探查你的状况。
(Jane smiled as she spoke. By the Jesuit and the cat lover Seth meant of course Bill and Peggy Gallagher, who have witnessed quite a few sessions.Jane and I soon noticed that Seth did not refer to Lorraine very often, even when she was a witness, and have speculated about the reasons for this.By contrast we have obtained a good deal more information about the Gallaghers, and Jane has been aware of better “contacts ”somehow in relation to them.Our thought has been that if Lorraine kept coming to sessions, sooner or later Seth would speak to her.)(珍讲话时面带微笑，赛斯说的耶稣会信徒和爱猫人当然是指比尔和蓓•加拉格，他们曾见证过很多节课。我和珍很快就注意到赛斯很少提到洛琳，即便她参与见证时也一样，我们也思索过其中的原因。相较之下，我们得到了很多关于加拉格夫妇的资料，而珍也感觉到与他们之间有比较好的“接触”。我们的想法是，假如洛琳继续来上课，那么迟早会对她说话。)
I am speaking of these matters since I have intended to do so personally to you, and also because they tie in very well, as you will see, with some of our own discussions.For emotional contacts are what we are working with, and when you block off the contact from your end, then I would not presume, you see, to attempt to break it. My own code of ethics would not allow it.我现在提这些事情，是因为我已打算针对你个人这样做，而且就如你即将看到的，也因为这些事情与我们的一些讨论内容搭配得非常好。正是由于情感的联系，才让我们能一起合作，当你阻断了你那一端的联系管道，你也知道，我就不会想捞过界，我的伦理规范不允许我这么做。
I do think that these sessions have helped you, generally speaking.The very fact of their existence has been an advantage to you, though you may not know it, and I have hinted at this before.You are wishing for many answers from me, and I have always felt the pull of your inquiries.However at the same time you do set up these blocks; for you are not afraid of the answers, but you are afraid basically that they could be given in this manner.我真的认为，大致上来说这些课已经帮了你。这些课的存在对你有利，虽然你可能还不知道，而我之前曾暗示过这一点。你希望能从我这边得到许多答案，而我也一直感受到你提出问题的牵引力量。不过，在此同时，你真的设置了这些障碍；因为你怕的不是答案，基本上你怕的是这些答案可能会以这种方式提供给你。
You may consciously think differently.You want so badly, you see, that the very power of your own desire in these circumstances frightens you off.你在意识上也许有不同的想法。你瞧，因为你太想要得到，所以在这些情境下，你自己的欲望所产生的力量，反而把你给吓坏跑了。
(Jane had been speaking rather quietly if rapidly, with her eyes closed. Lorraine, who was also taking shorthand notes, sat close by.Now Jane, her eyes still closed, leaned rather quickly toward Lorraine and her voice boomed out briefly.I confess that I jumped. I didn’t have time to observe Lorraine's reaction.)(珍闭着眼睛，一直讲得相当轻柔快速，洛琳坐在一旁，也以速记在做笔记。这时珍仍然闭着双眼，猛然倾身朝向洛琳，声音轰然而出，不过只有一下子。我得承认真的吓我一大跳，我没有时间观察洛琳的反应。
I am not frightening now, am I?I am indeed as peaceful as a tired old dove with battered wings, and a beak smoothed down.This does not mean that in time you cannot yourself knock down this particular barrier.我现在不吓人，对吗？我其实就像一双疲惫的老鸽子，温驯平和，翅膀无力，嘴尖也磨平了。这并不意味说，你未来无法自己消除这个特定的障碍。
Strangely enough, it can be knocked down most easily, if you can think of me in terms in no way occult or mysterious, but simply as a personality engaged in an endeavor which science will soon come to accept, as simply one of the many facts of existence of which they have previously known but little.奇怪的是，这个障碍很容易就可以消除，前提是你不要把这想得那么神秘诡异，而是把我看成一个努力工作的人格，而我的这些努力很快就会得到科学的认可，这就像是科学对许多之前已存在的事实虽有帮助，但仅知道皮毛而已。
Now generally speaking, such emotional responses set up electromagnetic forces. These forces in a large measure form boundaries inside which is a general, or generalized, field or system to which the individual will respond.The emotional blockage sets up barriers however whose main purpose is to protect the individual from anything that he considers at all unsafe or threatening, or simply unpleasant.现在，一般而言，这样的情感反应会产生电磁力量，这些力量会大幅度形成一些界限，在界限之内有一种普通或普遍化的场域或系统，而个体会对其起反应。情感的阻塞会障碍，不过这障碍的主要目的是要保护个体，让他免于遭遇到他认为不安全、威胁或纯粹是不愉快的事情。
It is not a simple question that may be summed up in a statement, such as “attitudes regulate behavior.”What is not understood is that emotional attitudes, conscious and subconscious, have an electromagnetic reality that operates very efficiently, either as an open system which attracts new stimuli, or as a closed electric force that is supercharged.这并不是一个简单的问题，可以用“态度规范行为”这样一句为总结。大家不了解的是，情感态度、意识和潜意识都有一个电磁实相，非常有效运作，可以是一种吸引刺激的开放系统，也可以是一种充饱电力的封闭系统。
You may now take your first break, and we shall consider these emotional systems in the relation to the personality in the dream state.你们现在可以第一次休息，我们待会儿就来探讨在梦里面，人格跟这些情感系统之间的关系。
(Break at 9:22.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her voice had been mostly even, her pace rather fast toward the end. A trace of her peculiar brogue had been apparent also, and usually when the brogue revealed itself the voice grew a bit in strength.(9:22分休息。珍第一阶段的出离状况如常，声音大都很平稳，速度到最后则变得相当快，显然还带了一些爱尔兰特殊腔调，而且每当这种腔调出现时，声音总会变得强烈一些。
(Sessions 120. 127 deal extensively with the electromagnetic field and related phenomena. See Volume 3.(第120节到127节间，大幅讨论电磁场及其相关现象，见第三册。
(One of the questions Lorraine had at break, in relation to Seth’s statement about helping her, was whether Seth would help through Jane, or through Lorraine herself directly.(洛琳休息时提到的其中一个问题是，赛斯前面说要帮她，那他是会透过珍还是直接透过洛琳本人来提供协助。
(Janes voice was a bit deeper and stronger when she began speaking again. Again her eyes were closed, her pace fast, her brogue more often apparent.Resume at 9:35.)(珍再度开始说话时，声音比较低沉、强烈，眼睛依然闭上，节奏快速，爱尔兰腔调常常更明显。9:35分继续口述。)
First of all, I spoke in terms of helping you through Ruburt.For many reasons too numerous to discuss this evening, I will be working through him only, for I have been working with him for longer than he knows.首先，我是指透过鲁柏说话来帮你。原因很多，但我今晚无法详述，总之我只会透过他来做这样的工作，因为我一直都是跟他合作，时间比他所知道的还要久。
There is much preparation necessary for such work.Various kinds of conditions must be exactly met, between those such as myself, and those through whom we speak. Not only general conditions but personal conditions.I meant, very simply, that since you have not been able to be emotionally open, you have often closed up tightly in the sessions.It is not that I could not reach you through Ruburt, and answer some of your questions. In any case it is simply that the answers would do you no good under such circumstances.这样的工作需要做很多准备。在像我自己这样的人以及我们借以讲话的人身上，各式各样的条件都必须确实符合，不只是一般条件，也包括个人的条件。简单来说，我的意思是由于你在情感上还无法开放，所以你在课堂上经常把自己紧紧封闭起来。我并不是不能透过鲁柏接触到你，回答你的一些问题，而是在这种情况下，不管是什么答案，对你完全帮不上忙。
Now these same sort of emotional systems operate under all conditions, and they regulate the kinds of experience to which an individual is susceptible or open, and they close out from his awareness those experiences which he has already decided he will not accept.Again, the emotional attitudes have their own electromagnetic reality. This field or system will therefore attract certain experiences, close out others, allow others to come so close and no closer, as is the case with Marleno and our sessions.这一类的情感系统随时随地都在运作，这些系统会管理个体愿意接受或开放的经验，也会在意识中关闭个体已决定要拒绝的那些经验。再说一次，情感态度有自己的电磁实相，因此，这个场域或系统会吸引特定的经验，排除别的经验，会让其他经验靠得非常近或保持距离，就像玛蕾诺在我们课堂上的情形那样。
Now, this same sort of emotional system operates in the sleeping state as well as in the waking state, though there are differences in that the personality will allow greater leeway in the dream state.But even in the sleeping condition, as should be obvious, the individual accepts and attracts certain experiences and blocks out others.You know that telepathy and clairvoyance operate rather freely in the dream state.However the nature of such experiences is strongly dependent upon the particular emotional system that is characteristic of any given personality.现在，这种情感系统在睡梦中的运作与醒时状态一样，而差别只在于人格在梦境中，会容许较大的自由空间。即便在睡梦中，个体也一样会接受或吸引某些经验，排除其他经验，这应该显而易见。他也知道，心电感应和千里眼在梦境中的运作相当自由。不过，这种经验的本质大幅取决于每个人格特有的情感系统。
Dreamer “A” for example may pick up telepathically a small but particular portion of a dream by dreamer “B”.Dreamer “A” need not necessarily have an emotional connection with dreamer “B”. However there will be at the very least an emotional connection between the event within dreamer “B’s” dream, that has strong meaning for dreamer “A”.A man may dream of a childhood experience in which he was bitten by a dog. Another man who was also bitten by a dog, may then for example telepathically pick up the original dream.Not because he is necessarily connected with the dreamer, but because the experience will strike at him emotionally, and he will then attract the dream.举例来说，做梦者A或许会以心电感应方式，捕捉到做梦者B梦境中一小部分但很特别的内容。做梦者A不一定跟做梦者B有情感连结，然而，最起码他跟做梦者B的梦中事件会有情感连结，因为这个事件对做梦者A有重大意义。或许某甲梦到小时候被狗咬的经验，另一个也被狗咬过的某乙，可能会以心电感应的方式捕捉到那个梦。并不是因为某乙跟这个做梦者某甲有关，而是因为这个经验会冲击到他的情感，于是他就会吸引到这个梦。
Definite electromagnetic actions will therefore occur between the two dreamers, and there may be a spilling over of data, or dream information, before the circuit is closed.You must realize that I am not speaking symbolically. I am speaking in very practical terms.The electromagnetic systems do indeed exist, and when they are open telepathic communications can travel through.因此，这两个做梦的人之间的确会产生电磁行动，在这个回路关闭之间，都可能会释出各种资料或梦的讯息。你们必须了解，我不是象征性地说说，我是以非常实际的用语在讲。电磁系统的的确确存在，这些系统开放时，心电感应方式的沟通就可以畅行无阻。
The same also applies to clairvoyance, or to be more precise, precognition, although here we are involved with something more.I have explained how dream images are constructed. You realize that they also have an electromagnetic reality, so there is no difficulty in their transmission from one dreamer to another.这种情形也适用于千里眼，或更精确地说，适用于预知，不过我们这里还牵涉到其他事情。我解释过梦影响如何形成，你们知道梦影像也具有电磁实相，因此这些影像在不同做梦者之间传递并不困难。
All of these reality systems of which we have been speaking are closely connected. Every thought has this same electric potential.Thoughts are often translated into dream images by a simple transformation.There is little difference indeed, basically, between physical images and dream images, and apparitions, and very little difference between these and thoughts and emotions.所有我们一直在讨论的这些实相系统，彼此都密切相关，每个思想都有这个相同的电位(electric potential)。思想经过简单的变换，往往就会转译为梦影像。基本上，物质影像、梦影像和幽灵(apparition)之间几乎没有差别，而这些东西跟思想和情感之间的差异则又更小。
I am keeping our 10 o’clock date in mind, so I will suggest a very brief break.Incidentally, I depend upon you, Joseph , now, to watch the volume of the voice.Do not wait until it becomes too loud. Watch for tendencies, and then we can control it better.我心理一直记着10点这个时间，所以我建议你们稍微休息就好。对了，约瑟，我都得靠你注意我的音量，不要等到太大声才告诉我喔！注意一下音量的变化，我们就可以控制得更恰当。
(“All right.”(“好。”
(Break at 9:55.Jane had been dissociated as usual. A bedroom.These are impressions for Dr. Instream.The bedroom is neater than his office.一间卧房。这些是殷斯翠姆博士的印象。卧房比他的办公室干净。
He is sitting down with his eyes closed.His head is reflected in something oval.(Pause) There is a piece of carpet or rug, and a small black book. He may be using self-hypnosis.他正闭上眼睛坐着。他的头映照在某个椭圆形东西上面。(停顿)有一张地毯或小毛毯，一本黑色小书，他可能在做自我催眠。

The word maple comes to mind.I do not know to what this refers... Now I pick up the word whiskey, as applying to a later period, and another circumstance involving a man and a late hour, and a dwelling place with a front door precisely in the middle of a front room, and a porch that is shadowed, and back bedrooms with children.But they are not all asleep, and one overhears an argument.现在我又捕捉到“威士忌”这个词，适用于比较后面阶段与另一个情境，这个情境包含一个男子与一个很晚的时刻；一个住处，前面房间正中间有一扇前门；一处有遮荫的门廊；以及有小孩子在内的后面房间。但小孩并没有全部睡着，其中一个无意间听到了吵架的声音。

Lorraine then began to recall bits and pieces of events which, she thought, might fall within the pattern Seth had been producing in the rest of the data.(随后我们有一段跟上面资料相关的对话，不过由于速度太快，情况太混乱，所以我就无法完整记录下来。洛琳相当讶异，需要一些时间来思考，以回忆往事。一开始，她完全想不起来15岁时的任何事，接着就开始回想起一些零零碎碎的事件，她认为这些事件或许就符合赛斯在其余资料中提到的形态。
