We will shortly end our session.我们很快就会结束这节课。
The situation to which I referred did occur in the South.我提到的这个情况的确发生在南方。
With all due respects to Ruburt, he was right in one respect and wrong in another.The porch to the front was shadowed.He correctly picked up the leaf images; however it was not the first floor.The door was in the center. However, my viewpoint is not precise enough perhaps, but I have the picture of a door precisely centered, leading outward.And I am working here despite the unwitting blocks that are erected. I see something yellow and something rose; and voices rising, and something broken.This is on my part an emotional breakage.我要对鲁柏致上敬意，他有一个地方是对的，另一个则是错的。前面的门廊有遮荫，他正确捕捉到了叶子的影像；不过并不是一楼。门是在中间位置，然而我的角度或许不够精确，不过我倒是有一扇门的画面，就在正中间，出去就到外面了。尽管有一些无意间形成的阻碍，但此时我仍在努力，我看到一些黄色和玫瑰色的东西；还有拉高的噪音，有东西破掉了。对我来说，这就是一种情感的破裂。
I give my impressions as I receive them, sometimes with connections, and sometimes the impressions are solitary.A mailbox. Black. A rear entry.Something to do with a party, and one child listens, a boy.我给出的印象就是我接收到的印象，有时候有些印象彼此相关，有时候则是各自独立。一个信箱，黑色的，一个后面的出口。跟派对相关的事物，还有一个小孩在倾听，是个男孩。
Now I have the feeling of a funeral, though this may be symbolic.But there is a connection with a car, perhaps a black one. This could explain the funeral impression.A disturbed afternoon, and an argument, and the strong impression, again, of a breakage.我现在感觉到有场葬礼，虽然可能只是一种象征。但跟一辆汽车有关，或许是辆黑色的车，这个可以解释丧礼的印象。一个心神不宁的下午，一场争辩，再度有很强烈的破裂印象。
I believe the breakage was emotional, and yet I somehow connect it with the sound of glasses, whether the man had been drinking strongly or not; this could explain the glasses, which are strongly connected to me here.我相信这个破裂是情绪性的，而且不知怎的，我觉得跟玻璃杯声音有关，不知道是不是这个男子已经喝得烂醉；正好可以解释玻璃杯，我认为在这里跟高度相关。
You may all take a break or we will end the session.你们可以休息一下，要不然我们就结束这节课。
("I guess well end it then.”)(“我想我们就结束这节好了。”)
We will then wish you all a fond and hearty good evening.My best regards to all of you, and all in all we have done well, and I am pleased.我们希望大家有个开心美好的夜晚。送上我最深情的祝福给各位，整体而言，我们做得很不错，我很高兴。
("Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:43.Jane was again well dissociated, as she had been during the previous delivery. Her eyes had remained closed, her pace had been good, her voice average.(10:43分结束。珍还是出离得很好，就如前一段口述结束后一样，眼睛仍然闭着，速度掌握得不错，音量适中。
(Lorraine thought the date of the incident she had in mind could be interpreted as early in April, probably in 1944, in Asheville, NC.It would, she said, be in the springtime however, rather than in winter or autumn. She said her family had lived on the second floor rather than the first, and agreed with Seth’s description, now, of the placement of the font, or porch, door.Seth mentioned “something yellow and something rose. ’’Lorraine told us the walls of the apartment were painted yellow, and that the furniture was of the old-fashioned kind with large rose decorations.(洛琳认为她心中想到的那个事件，或许可说是发生在1944年早春，地点在北卡罗来纳州阿卡什维尔市。她说应该是在春天，而不是冬天或秋天，说她家人当时是住在二楼，而不是一楼，她这时也同意赛斯对前门或走廊大门配置的描述。至于赛斯提到的“一些黄色和玫瑰色的东西”，洛琳告诉我们，公寓墙壁是漆成黄色，而家具是老式风格，上面有大玫瑰花作为装饰。
(Lorraine is separated from her husband.Seth’s whiskey connection arises from the fact that he was drinking heavily at that time in Asheville; the only time he did so.There were arguments, Lorraine said.If her youngest child, a boy, had listened, he did so at the age of one.Lorraine remembers a black mailbox; the apartment of course had a rear entry also.Lorraine described a party to us.(洛琳目前已跟先生分居，赛斯提到威士忌的连结，是因为她先生当时住在阿什维尔市酗酒很严重；这是他唯一酗酒的时候。洛琳说，那时候发生了一些争吵。要是她最小的儿子在听大人争吵，那他一岁时就这样做了。洛琳记得有个黑色信箱；公寓当然也有后面的出入口。洛琳也跟我们描述了一场派对。
(There was no black car connected with her during the stay in Asheville, Lorraine said.But she owned a black car in I960, while living in Elmira, several years before we met her.This is the only black car she has had, or been closely associated with.She did not own it when we met her a few months ago.(洛琳说，她待在阿什维尔市时，并没有什么事情与黑色汽车有关。不过，她1960年住在埃尔迈拉时，有一辆黑色汽车，那是在我们认识她的几年前。这是她唯一拥有或唯一跟她关系密切的黑色汽车。我们几个月前认识她时，她已不再拥有那辆车了。
(These notes are my interpretation of what was said about Seth's data.I asked Lorraine to make up her own notes for later insertion in the record.She took shorthand notes of tonight’s session.(这些笔记是听了洛琳补充说明赛斯提供的资料后，经由我个人的诠释而整理出来。我请洛琳也将她自己的笔记整理好，之后可以放入记录里。她用速记方式为今晚的课做笔记。
(Tracing of the fragment of the old furniture label used in the 12th envelope test, in Session 196, October 6,1965.)一小张旧家具标签描摹图，使用于1965年10月6日第196节第12次信封测试

SESSION 196 第196节 电磁系统的实相 信封12


OCTOBER 6, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年10月6日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(For the envelope test this evening I chose a piece of an old furniture label that Jane and I had peeled from the back of a bureau a couple of weeks ago.See the tracing above. I found the label, or rather part of it, in my studio this afternoon and decided to use it for the test.Since it was lying unobtrusively among my things on a shelf I thought Jane had not been aware of it.She later confirmed this, saying she thought I had thrown it out at the time we removed it.(今晚的测试我选了一小张旧家具标签，那是几周前我和珍从一个柜子背面撕下来的，请见描摹图。今天下午我在工作室里发现了这张标签，或者可以说是其中的一小部分，就决定拿来作为测试之用。由于它就夹在我书架上的东西之间，看起来并不起眼，所以我认为珍应该不曾注意过。后来她也证实这一点，说她以为我撕下来就扔掉了。
(The label was brittle and quite brown with age, and broke apart when removed. There was nothing on its reverse side.I thought such an old object might have some interesting impressions attached to it.The bureau it came from is an old- fashioned one that had sat in the garage of “our” apartment house for some years.Our landlord gave it to us, and we fixed it up and repainted it.(这张标签年久泛黄，纸张也已脆化，撕下来时就裂掉，背面没有任何东西。我想这种年代久远的物品或许会伴随着一些有趣的印象。贴上标签的那个柜子，款式古老，摆在“我们”公寓房子的车库里好多年。那是房东送给我们的，我们稍微修理一下，然后重新上漆。
(It will be remembered that in the 194th session Seth promised to discuss in the 195th session our cat’s rather frequent if brief bouts of illness.Since this was not done however, I mentioned it to Jane before this evenings session. Jane said she had also thought of it.To avoid interruptions we used the back room, although Jane prefers the larger font room.She began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her voice was average in strength, her pace rather fast although interspersed with pauses.)(还记得赛斯在第194节里曾答应，要在195节中讨论我们的猫经常短暂发病的问题。由于这一部分还没谈到，所以今晚上课前我就跟珍提起，珍说她也想到这件事。虽然珍比较喜欢前面那个大房间，但为了避免干扰，我们用后面的房间。珍坐下来，闭着眼睛开始讲话，声音强弱适中，虽然中间停顿几次，但速度还算相当快。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
It is rather important that the reality of these electromagnetic systems be understood, as they are so important in the construction of physical images and dream images, and since they are responsible for the inner communication which takes place beneath consciousness.了解这些电磁系统的实相非常重要，因为它们在身体形象和梦影像的建构上也相当重要，而且还负责发生在意识底下的内在沟通。
These systems are affected by the weather, and they also affect the weather. There is a constant inflow and outflow.The dream, any dream, fits neatly within certain and definite electromagnetic boundaries, and at the same time helps to form the electromagnetic field itself.这些系统会受到天气影响，也会影响天气，两者之间持续不断流出与流入。梦，任何的梦，都刚好符合某个适合的电磁范围，这些梦同时也有助于电磁场本身的形成。
No physical matter is without this electromagnetic reality, and no thought exists which does not exist within this reality.Again, I am not speaking symbolically, but quite practically.Emotions, having their own reality within this system, do not affect physical matter indirectly, but cause specific electromagnetic changes within the physical organism.所有的实体物质都具有这种电磁实相，所有的思想都必须在这个实相之内才能存在。同样地，我不是象征性说说，而是很实际地讲。情感在这个系统内有自己的实相，并不是间接影响实体物质，而是在肉体组织内造成所有具体的电磁变化。
This, and all such effects, represent one of the most basic ways in which one action causes another action to change.These definite fields operate as channels for inner communications. They may be formed instantly, sweeping out into other directions.They open through attraction. This attraction may originate as an emotional one, but the emotional feeling has its own electromagnetism, and the attraction is in direct proportion to the force of the emotion itself, or to the charge that the emotion may carry.这一部分以及所有这类的影响，代表着一个行动引发另一个行动改变的最基本方式。这些明确的电磁场扮演着内在沟通管道的角色，它们可以瞬间形成，快速进入其他方向。它们透过吸引力来开放，这种吸引力可能来自于情感上的吸引力，不过情感的感觉有自己的电磁原理，而吸引力的大小，就与情感本身的力量或情感可能携带的电荷直接成正比。
Briefly, I explained the way in which a dreamer may be telepathically in communication with another man’s dream. Not necessarily because he is aware of the man, for in many cases he is not.The telepathic communication arises as a result of an attraction, a personal emotional charge on the part of the second dreamer that allows him to open these channels of communication.我之前概略解释过做梦的人可能会以心电感应的方式，与另一人的梦沟通的方法，但不见得是因为他认识那个人，在很多状况下他们互不相识。两人间的心电感应之所以会出现，是由于吸引力，也就是第二个做梦者散发出个人情感电荷，让这些沟通管道得以开放。
Any experience at all, whether mental or physical, also carries an electric and magnetic reality, so that the experience of any given individual is held in a sort of electric code within the cells.On a subconscious basis the individual is drawn to others who have had similar experiences to his own.He will be more attracted to the various field boundaries to which he himself has been accustomed.任何一点点的经验，不管是精神上或物质上的，也都带有电和磁的实相，让任何个体的经验都能以一种电码(electric code)的方式留在细胞里。在潜意识的基础上，一个个体会受到跟自己具有类似经验的其他个体所吸引。那些他自己早已习惯的各种电磁场范围，对他而言更具吸引力。
His unconscious communications will also follow this same pattern. This of course includes his dreams.It may be well to remember here that dreams exist even for an individual in the waking state, though he is not aware of them.His mind continues this activity even while the conscious self goes about its daily chores.他无意识的沟通也是遵循这样的模式，这当然包括他的梦。大家应该记得很清楚，梦甚至可以存在于清醒状态的个休，即便他自己并不知道。就算是有意识的自己正忙于日常琐事，他的心也一样会持续做梦的这个活动。
These dreams go unrecognized by the conscious ego; but they do not go unrecorded by the inner self, and they therefore exist, and they form electromagnetic channels of their own to which—make that by which—the physical body itself is affected.The physical organism is constantly changed by all stimuli, whether or not the ego is aware of the stimuli. And it is affected by stimuli, whether or not science realizes that the particular stimuli even exists.Therefore, the physical organism reacts to this continuous unconscious Mental activity in the form of continuing dream experiences, whether or not the individual is awake or asleep.All of these realities go into the formation of the personality, and unless they are all understood the personality itself will remain a mystery.有意识的自我不认得这些梦，但内我不会忘了要记录下来，因此梦得以存在，而且会形成自己的电磁管道(electromagnetic channel), 借此影响肉体本身。不管自我是否意识到这些刺激，肉体组织经常受到所有的刺激而改变，不管科学界是否了解到这些特定的刺激存在与否，肉体组织仍会受到这些刺激影响。因此，不管个体是否处于清醒或睡眠状态，肉体组织在连续的梦经验形成的过程当中，都会对这个无意识且持续不断的精神活动起反应。所有这些实相进而形成了人格，而且除非能完全了解这些实相，否则这个人格本身仍是一个谜团。
You may take your first break, and I have not forgotten the question that you asked me concerning the health of your cat.你们可以第一次休息，我还记得你们问我的猫咪健康问题。
(Break at 9:21.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first break. Her eyes remained closed, her voice even and rather fast, even with some pauses.For much of the delivery she sat leaning forward in her rocker, her head tipped down somewhat, and with her hands clasped as her elbows rested upon her knees.This has come to be something of a characteristic pose for her lately during the sessions; I do not recall seeing Jane ever use it outside of a session.(9:21分休息。珍第一阶段的出离状态如常，眼睛一直闭着，声音平稳，即使中间停顿几次，速度仍相当快。口述时坐在椅子上，身体前倾，多半微低着头，双手紧张，两肘放在膝上，这是她最近上课时比较特殊的姿势；在课堂外我好像从没看过她这个姿势。
(Jane again sat leaning forward when she resumed speaking, in the same even voice, and with her eyes closed, at 9:30.)(9:30分，珍仍然坐在椅子上，身子往前倾，闭着眼睛，以同样平稳的声音继续口述。)
Now.We shall speak briefly concerning the health of your cat, and Dr. Instream may skip this paragraph if he prefers.现在。我们就简单扼要谈一下你们那只猫生病的问题。殷斯翠姆博士可以略过这一段。
There is a particular type of food that does not set well with him [Willy], although he likes it, strangely enough.Ruburt knows which food it is, for he has suspected it for quite a while.很奇怪，虽然有个特定种类的食物他[威立]很喜欢，但不适合他食用。鲁柏知道是哪一种食物，因为他已经怀疑它一段时间了。
The pet also sensed Ruburts own upset when he was, when Ruburt was, worried, and this also contributed.The cat is generally in good health. You are also both in good health at this time.And you, Joseph , should escape your December doldrums this year, and I thoroughly expect that you shall.当鲁柏担心时，这只宠物也会感觉到鲁柏自己的心情低落，这部分也是原因之一。这只猫的健康状况良好，你们两人目前的健康也不错。而你，约瑟，应该能逃过今年12月的低潮期，我全然相信你可以逃过。
(Jane, as Seth, smiled as she referred to Dr. Instream.Jane does know the suspected cat food, which is a combination of liver and fish.The worry referred to above concerns Jane's interest in her ESP book; it took her publisher some time to let her know he was reading it, and as seen in the 195th session Jane finally telephoned the publisher to get the final okay on the book.Many sessions ago, as many as a hundred or more, Seth told us that animal pets would reflect the psychic health and concerns of their owners.(身为赛斯的珍提到殷斯翠姆博士时面露微笑。珍的确知道猫的可疑食物，就是肝和鱼搅拌在一起的食物。上面提到的担心，是指珍对ESP书的关注；她的出版商花了一些时间，才让珍知道他正在看她的书，请见第195节，后来是珍打电话给出版商，终于得到这本书没问题的回应。在好多节之前，至少是一百多节以前，赛斯告诉我们说，宠物会反映出主人的精神健康状况和担忧。
(Many sessions ago also, Seth told me that my Christmas doldrums stemmed from something that happened to me many years ago.I have forgotten the incident, he said.Seth promised to go into it but we became sidetracked on other matters last year.This fall I will make an effort to clear up the matter up before December.)(在很多节之前，赛斯也曾说过，我圣诞节的低潮期是源自于很多年前发生在我身上的某件事。他说，我自己都忘了这个事件。去年赛斯答应要细谈这部分，不过后来我们的话题转到别的事情。今年秋天，我要在12月前努力理清这件事。)
Ruburt will find that his own work will now improve. Indeed the improvement has begun.He simply needed a rest, creatively speaking, and the change of seasons will exhilarate him.鲁伯将发现自己的工作现在会进步，实际上这个进步已经开始了。比较有创造性的说法是，他纯粹只是需要休息，而季节改变会让他心旷神怡。
Returning to a previous discussion, I would like to make it plain once more that dream images are not pseudo realities. They exist as fact, though in a different dimension from physical reality.Again, no one would deny the reality of psychological experience when it is felt by the waking personality. Yet such experience also does not have a physical reality, to the same degree that a definite physical object has.回到之前的讨论，我要再次说明清楚，梦影像并不是虚假的实相，它们确实存在，只是存在于一个不同于物质实相的维度当中。没有人会去否认醒时人格感觉到的心理经验实相，然而这类经验也没有物质实相，不像实质物体那样明确。
It should be emphasized however that dream experiences can have a more lasting and vital effect upon the personality than many so-called physical experiences, for the dream experiences are not blocked nearly as much as waking experience is blocked.The suggestion that also occurs within the dream state works even more effectively upon the whole personality than any suggestion works under ordinary circumstances.And dreams certainly do contain suggestions, and they are reacted to by the personality, not only on a subconscious basis and a psychological basis, but they affect the whole system.然而，有一点必须强调的是，梦经验对人格造成的影响，可以比许多所谓物质经验的影响更重要、更持久，因为梦经验被阻塞的程度并不像醒时经验那么大。梦境里产生的暗示，对整体人格的效果会比任何普通情境下的暗示更好。梦里面的确包含了暗示，人格不仅在潜意识和心理基础上对其起反应，而且暗示也会影响整个系统。
Dream experiences often, very often, change the course of human events.Again, all this takes place through the operation of electromagnetic systems.There is a definite connection between this constant dream activity undertaken by the unconscious self, and what you call inspiration or creative activity.梦经验常常，而且是非常频繁地改变人类的发展方向。同样地，所有这些现象都是透过电磁系统的运作而产生。无意识的自己经常参与的这种梦活动，确实会与你们所谓的灵感或创造性活动相关。
These apparent inspirations from nowhere definitely come from somewhere, and this somewhere is that inner dreaming condition, which is a necessity on the part of every consciousness, human or otherwise.Here I am using the word consciousness to cover all organisms with awareness.This dream activity seems divorced from the conscious state itself, and came before the conscious state within your physical system.It cannot be turned off, and it will not cease.It will only be noticed, as a rule, when the aware portions of the personality are disconnected from their physical stimulations to some considerable degree.这些不知来自何处但清晰可见的灵感的确来自某处，这个某处就是那个内在的做梦情境，对于每个意识、人类或其他物种而言，这种做梦情境不可或缺。这里我用意识一词，涵盖全部有觉知(awareness)的生物。这个梦活动似乎与意识状态本身分离，而且比你们物质系统里的意识状态先来到。你们无法中止梦活动，它自己也永不会停止。一般而言，唯一要注意的就是，人格有意识的部分何时会与物质刺激大幅脱离。
These dream activities have a pulsing quality that could be compared with the pulsing of heartbeat, and that are quite as vital to the human system.So much telepathic communication is received at this level that the lines of individuality are not as brilliant.Yet individuality does exist here, but it takes a strong organizing system, with amazing powers of discrimination, to handle such data; and it takes the human personality to stand firm upon its own identity while it is, on this other dreaming level, open to so many communications that are not its own.It is the ego, practically speaking, who attempts to do the distinguishing here; but the inner core of the self, the inner ego of which we have spoken, manages the basic chore.The setting up of the ego represented at once the necessity of boundaries, represented a cutting apart from, a divorcing, and a rigid limiting function.Initially this was necessary while this new sort of creature learned to maintain itself as a separate unit.这些梦活动有一种脉动的特质，就好比心跳的脉动一样，对人类系统极其重要。由于在这个层次接收到如此多的心电感应讯息，所以在个别性(individuality)方面就变得不明显。不过个别性的确还在，只不过若要掌握好这样的资料，就必须有个强大的组织系统，且具备惊人的分辨能力；而人类人格在这种不同于一般的做梦层次上，不但要面对那么多不属于自己的沟通讯息门户大开，同时也要坚守住自己的本体性。实际上，是自我想要做出区别；但是自己的内在核心，也就是我们说的内在自我，会掌理基本的日常琐事。自我的设立，立即代表了界限的必要性，代表了一种切割、分离、以及严格的限制功能。一种新生物刚开始学习保持自己的独立个体时，这种做法的确有必要。
But the ego also grows and learns and evolves, and it can assimilate more and more, and accept more, as a portion of its own identity.It is only because your scientists overestimate the physical that it seems to them that man has not evolved to any great degree in the last million years.不过自我也会学习、成长与进化，它可以同化(assimilate)越来越多的东西，接受更多的事物，并将其视为自己本体的一部分。你们的科学家之所以认为，人类最近100万年以来似乎没有重大的进化，纯粹是因为他们过度重视物质层面。
I will continue with this later in the session.Now I suggest your break, so that we can keep our appointment with Dr. Instream.待会儿我还会在课上继续谈这部分。现在我建议你们休息一下，我们才能遵守与殷斯翠姆博士的约定。
(Break at 9:55.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed. Her pace had been quite fast and sure, with the result that my writing hand was quite tired.Her voice had been average.(9:55分休息。珍的出离状况如常，眼睛闭着，速度一直很快很稳定，结果让我写字的手疲累不堪。她的声音适中。
(As usual when giving the Dr. Instream material Jane spoke at a slower pace.By now however the pace was not as slow as it had been during the first few such tests.I will indicate a few pauses and some strategic times.Jane resumed while sitting down and with her eyes closed, and in an average voice, at 10:05.)(一如往常，珍在给出殷斯翠姆博士的资料时，说话速度就变得较慢。不过现在的速度并没有像刚开始那几次测试时那么慢。缺10:05分，珍坐下来闭着眼睛继续口述，声音一样适中。)
Please give us a moment.请稍等我们一会儿。
These are impressions. He is, or has been, or is thinking of, a gathering of people.Perhaps a faculty affair. A woman close to him in a yellow dress. A clock on a mantel, 4 PM.(Pause at 10:06.)我有几个印象，他已想到或正想到一次聚会，或许是教职员的事。一个穿黄色的女人在他旁边，壁炉上的时钟指着下午4点钟。(10:06分停顿)
A disturbance of sorts occurred today. He received a letter from a person whose name begins with M. There was a phone call at dinnertime—that is, the night meal.I believe that his office is going to be changed or redecorated or perhaps repainted; some change of this sort in the near future, if it has not already been done.But this is a rearrangement of some sort, that could involve furniture arrangement.今天有件事造成一些小小的打扰，他收到某人的来信，寄件人的名字开头字母是M。晚餐时间有一通来信。我觉得他的办公室即将整修或重新装潢，也可能是重新粉刷；如果现在还没有这类的改变，那么不久的将来就会有。不过这是某种的重新调整，可能涉及家具配置。
But the office is not the same now, or very shortly will not be as it was when we were there. The change may also involve another person.Dr. Instream may grumble about being routed out, though this might be only temporarily while the rearrangement is being done.(Pause at 10:11.)但是，这间办公室现在已经不一样了，或是很快会不同于我们当初造访时的样貌，这个改变也可能跟另一个人有关。殷斯翠姆博士可能会因为被赶出去而发牢骚，虽然这只是重整工程进行当中的临时状况而已。(10:11分停顿)
He stands at this moment against a piece of wooden furniture, and he is drinking from a glass. I believe he is drinking liquor, and he is smiling.This is tonight at this hour, I believe. There are people about.(Pause.)他此刻站在一组木制家具前面，喝着杯中的饮料，我认为是在喝酒，他在微笑。我相信，这都是今晚这时候的事，旁边还有其他人。(停顿)
This is in his living room, or one very much like it, with the same view from the windows.The people are dressed formally, comparatively speaking.这是在他的客厅里面，或是非常像客厅的地方，从窗户看出去都是同样的景观。这些人的穿着相对正式。
Men mainly.He is smiling and chatting.(Pause at 10:14.) He has been calking about politics, though this may be university politics. I do not know.He says: “There are large areas of improvement.There are large areas in which improvement can be made.”大部分是男性。他正在微笑闲聊。(10:14分停顿)一直在谈论政治，可能是大学里的政治运作，我不知道。他说：“有很大的进步空间。可以改进的地方还很多。”
Someone says, a male: “I’ll go along with you on that, George.”And I hear someone laugh, this time I think a woman.(Pause at 10:15. )有个人说话了，是个男的：“乔治，那件事我同意你的看法”。我也听到有个人在笑，这次我觉得是个女的。(10:15分停顿)
Do you have a test for me?你要测试我吗？
("Yes."(“是的。”
(I handed Jane the usual double envelope.She took it without opening her eyes, then sat quietly for a moment while holding it in her right hand.)(我把惯用的双层信封递给了珍。她拿了过去，眼睛并未张开，接着就拿在右手中，安静地坐了一会儿。)
These are impressions.我有一些印象。
A foundation of sorts. A path or road shape not directly centered, with an upward incline.An initial, an area of color, window shapes having to do with two people, but connected with several circumstances, and with a package, perhaps sent from this address.有点像地基的东西，像一条小径或马路的形状，不是直接在正中央，有点向上弯的样子。一个开头字母、一个色块、窗户的形状，跟两个人有关，但也牵涉到几种情况，一个包裹，可能是从这个地址寄过来的。
A diamond shape and crisscross lines, and a voice connected with the item.It seems as if someone stood and spoke outside of what is depicted here.I pick up a connection with a pair of shoes, though I do not know to what this refers, and a fence or border; an enclosure of that kind.Also a departure having to do with an automobile, and perhaps a place with much water.钻石的形状和十字状的线，以及与这个东西相关的一种声音。好像有一个人站在这里所描述的东西外面讲话。我发现跟一双鞋有关，但我不知道鞋子是指什么，还有一道栅栏或边界；一块圈起来的地。还有一次启程，跟汽车有关，也或许跟一个水很多的地方有关。
Ruburt thinks of a photograph taken in Marathon.鲁伯想到一张在马拉松市(Marathon)拍的照片。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:22.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice average.Her pace had been a little slow. She was not, she said, nervous while giving the Dr. Instream data.She said: “I did seem to see him standing with his mouth open in a characteristic pose, with a drink in his hand.” Jane said the impression was not too clear, and that she also had some impression of the living room and terrace of the Instream apartment, which we had seen in July 1965.(10:22分休息。珍的出离状况如常，眼睛一直闭着，声音维持适中，速度有点慢。她说，在传递殷斯翠姆博士的资料时并不会紧张。她说：“我真的好像看到他站着，嘴巴张得开开的，以他特有的姿势，手里还拿着一杯酒。”珍说这个印象不是很清楚，她也有一些殷斯翠姆博士家里客厅和露台的印象，我们在1965年6月时看过这些地方。
(Jane told me she was nervous, however, when it came to our own envelope test. She did not think I had a test for her.She said it was hard to say exactly when she became nervous, but that it was probably as I handed her the test envelope.(不过，珍告诉我说，课程一进行到我们自己的信封测试，就感到紧张了，原本以为我今天不会测试。她说，很难明确说出是从哪时候开始紧张，不过大概是在我把测试信封交给她时。
(Marathon is in the Florida Keys, perhaps 40 miles north of Key West.It is a beautiful place and Jane and I spent a winter there several years ago.We do have photographs of the place.(马拉松市在佛罗里达礁岛群[Florida Keys]，大约是在西礁岛[Key West]北方40里处。那里很漂亮，我和珍几年前曾在那边过冬。我们的确有那边的照片。
(Seth's impressions do appear to be far-ranging, in connection with the old bureau and its label.Jane and I can make some connection with some of the material, but in the light of what follows we decided to wait.We will also try to verify some of the impressions through our landlord, Jimmy Spaziani. We do not know how much he can help, since he has owned our apartment house but a few years.(赛斯的印象要跟旧柜子和上头的标签连结是有点牵强。我和珍可以稍微连结部分的资料，但考虑到接下来的发展，我们就决定再等等看。我们也会试着透过房东詹姆斯·史帕日尼来验证其中一部分的印象是否正确，但不确定他能帮上多少忙，因为他持有我们这间公寓只不过几年。
(Jane resumed with her eyes closed and in a quiet voice at 10:31.)(10:31分，珍闭着眼睛轻声细语继续口述。)
We will speak but briefly. Originally the bureau belonged to a woman to whom it was delivered at this address. She left your town and went to Florida, and left the chest.我们简单扼要来谈一下，这个柜子原本属于一个女人所有，别人送到这个地址给她，她离开你们的城镇去了佛罗里达州，而留下这个柜子。
Ruburt picked up the Florida connection, and this led him to think of his photograph.I always distinguish between our lines of thought when this happens.We will perhaps discuss this sort of test at our next session.鲁伯抓到与佛罗里达州的连结，让他想到他的照片。碰到这种情形时，我都会区分我们的思考路线。下一节课我们或许会讨论这种测试。
Now however I will end tonight’s session. My heartiest regards to you both.不过我现在就要结束今晚的课，衷心祝福二位。
I believe that the woman lived in your apartment, and that the chest was used by others after the woman left, and before you obtained it.我相信这个女人住过你们的公寓，而这个柜子在她离开后，一直到你们拿到之前，中间还有其他人使用过。
(“Good night, Seth. ’’(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:34.Jane was dissociated as usual.Her eyes remained closed, her voice quiet.)(10:34分结束。珍的出离状况如常，一直闭着眼睛，声音轻柔。)
OCTOBER 8, 1965 FRIDAY REPORT BY JANE BUTTS1965年10月8日 星期五 内容由珍·柏兹执笔
(Tonight Bill and Peggy Gallagher came to visit us. Bill told us that he would have to leave for a few minutes to pick up an advertisement at the bus terminal and take it to the newspaper office, the Star-Gazette, where he works.On the spur of the moment Peggy suggested that we all try to pick up impressions concerning the ad, while Bill was gone.Bill himself would not know the contents of the ad, which was in an envelope, until he opened it at the paper.(今晚，比尔和蓓来找我们，比尔说，他得离开一会儿去公车总站拿一则广告，然后带到《埃尔迈拉星报》办公室，那是他上班的地方。蓓心血来潮，建议我们大家在比尔离开时，试试看能抓到哪些跟那则广告有关的印象。因为广告放在信封袋里，所以比尔自己要等到了报社打开后，才会知道广告内容。
(Bill said that he would try to think strongly of the ad.He left here at approximately 10 PM and returned about 10:35.Rob, Peg and I had all written down our impressions, and none of us knew what the others had written.None of Pegs were correct. Many of mine, about 11 impressions, were correct, and some of Rob’s.(比尔说，他会试着努力来想想这则广告。他大约晚上10点离开这里，10:35分回来。我、罗和蓓都各自写下印象，但我们不知道别人写什么。蓓写的没有一个正确，而我写下的许多印象中，大约有11个对，罗也写对了一些。
(My score would seem to be above chance. I did not seem to pick up impressions about the ad itself, however. I seemed to pick up impressions of Bill at the newspaper office, and follow him as he went about his chores.I had no idea at the time that any of my impressions were correct. Indeed I suspected that they were all wrong.I seem to work with words rather than images, that is, I pick up word impressions, I guess, rather than pictures.(我的猜中率几乎很高，不过，我得到的印象好像不是跟广告本身相关，而比较像是跟在比尔身边，看着他在报社办公室里处理日常事务。我当时并不知道这些印象是否正确，我确实还怀疑是不是全都错了。我似乎是以文字而非影像来进行，也就是说，我想我得到的是文字印象，而非画面印象。
(The following is an exact copy of the impressions as I wrote them on my slip of paper.The impressions themselves are in caps, and directly beneath the correctness or incorrectness is noted.(下面就是我写在纸条上的印象，印象本身以粗体字呈现，底下再注明正确或不正确。)缺
1.A SUDDEN TURN1.一个突然的转身。
(Correct.On entering the newspaper building Bill went into one particular office and left, making a sudden and sharp turn to go upstairs.)(正确。进到报社大楼后，比尔走进一间特别的办公室，离开时突然一个大转身，然后到楼上去。)
2.FEELING HE STARTS TO GO UPSTAIRS2. 感觉到他开始上楼
3.OR STOPS TO TALK TO SOMEONE THERE3. 或停在那里与某人说话
(Correct on both points.Bill went upstairs to talk to the men in the Ad department.Though I have been in the newspaper building, I did not know that these offices were upstairs.Bill’s own office is downstairs, as I knew, and if I thought about it at all I assumed that all his business took place there. I had no idea that Bill had any connection with the upstairs offices at all, since the editorial work is done there, and he has nothing to do with that at all.Peg, who works up there, has told me often that she never sees him upstairs.)(两点都正确。比尔上楼跟广告部的人说话。虽然我曾去过这栋报社大楼，但并不知道这些办公室在楼上。我原本就知道比尔的办公室在楼下，但如果我想得到这一点，就会假设他全部的业务都在楼下进行，我一点都不晓得比尔跟楼上的办公室会有什么瓜葛，因为楼上是编辑部门，他的工作跟这个部门毫不相干。蓓在楼上上班，经常跟我说从未在楼上看过他。)
4．THREE PEOPLE IN PARTICULAR IN HIS OFFICE4. 有3个特定人士在他的办公室里
(Correct, though this was the upstairs office.The three people were a Mr. Connor, who Bill definitely did not expect to see, and his two children.)(正确。虽然这是在楼上的办公室。这三个人是康诺(Mr.Connor)先生和他的两个小孩，比尔根本没有预期会见到康诺先生。
5.THE THREE PEOPLE IN THIS POSITION:5. 这3个人的位置如下：
(Correct, They stood speaking in the given position.)(正确，他们就是以这样的位置站着讲话。)
6.SOMETHING TO DO WITH THE SEASONS6. 跟季节有关的一些事情
(Correct.Bill spoke about the “sunny climes” in particular in contrast to our autumn weather, as he intends to go to Puerto Rico for his vacation and the discussion had to do with the differences in weather this time of year.)(正确。比尔特别提到“阳光充足的地区”，并以我们秋天的气候作为对比，因为他打算去波多黎各度假，而谈话内容论及每年这个时节的气候差异。)
7.THE AD BLOCKED, FIRST LINE FOUR WORDS, THE WAY IT WILL BE ARRANGED ACTUALLY IN THE PAPER (?The ad hasn’t appeared in the paper yet.)7.广告被挡住了，第一行有4个字，这是到时候报纸上实际的排版方式
8.CIG8. CIG
(Correct.Bill insists this is a direct hit. He said that the term sig is always used in the ads, and is part of the language of the ad department.They discussed which “sig” to use, and the word “sig” was inserted, though no signature was then written in.Though sig means signature, the word signature itself is never used Bill said.Phonetically the words are the same, cig and sig, though mine begins with a C.)(正确。比尔肯定表示这个答案完全正确，他说，“sig”经常用在广告上，属于广告部门用语的一部分。他们讨论到要用哪一个“sig”以及如何插入“sig”这个字，即使当时尚未签上任何名字。比尔说，虽然“sig”代表签名[signature]的意思，不过后来都不使用签名一词。尽管我写的字开头是C，但“cig”和“sig”的音其实相同。

18.SUDDENLY UNDER TENSION18. 突然绷紧神经

19.USES WORD PADRE19. 使用了PADRE这个字
(Near-correct.Before Mr. Connor’s entrance, Bill was joking with another man.On purpose he pronounced the word Ponce as P O N KA Y, which sounds very much like padre.)(几乎正确。在康诺先生进来之前，比尔正与另一个人在开玩笑。他故意把庞塞(译注：ponce波多黎各第二大城)念成PONKAY，听起来非常像PADRE这个字的声音。

(While Bill Gallagher was putting on his hat and coat at 10 PM tonight, preparatory to leaving our apartment for the bus terminal, I wrote down two impressions of headlines.I was not in a trance state. Bill did not see these until he returned at 10:35 PM; he told me both of them were incorrect.(今晚10点，就在比尔穿衣戴帽准备离开我们公寓到公车总站时，我写下了广告标题的两个印象，我那时并不是在出神状态。比尔晚上10:35分回来后，才看到我写的内容：他告诉我说都不正确。
(After Bill left Jane and Peggy sat talking while I read.As she talked Jane jotted down her impressions.I interrupted my reading to put myself into a light trance state, and then wrote down four more impressions. Three of these proved to be correct.I used the trance state rather casually, and later wished I had written down more impressions; but I was interested in getting back to my reading。(比尔离开后，珍和蓓坐着聊天，而我则是在看书。珍在讲话时，就草草写下印象。后来我停下来不再看书，让自己进入轻微的出神状态，接着又写下4个印象，其中3个证实是正确的。我非常随兴地利用出神状态，事后回想还真希望当时能趁机多写下一些印象；只是那时我比较想回头继续阅读。
(My impressions follow just as I wrote them down.They are in caps, followed by interpretations.(我写下的印象如下，以粗体字表示，接着是每个印象的说明。)

2.NOW IS THE TIME, DON’T DELAY2. 把握机会趁现在，不要犹豫
(Both incorrect.I made these before Bill left the apartment. The ad was printed on Tuesday, October 12, 1965.The actual headline consisted of the single word NOW!)(两个都不对。我在比尔离开公寓前写了这两则，实际上的广告是在1965年10月12日星期二刊出，标题只有“趁现在”三个字！)
3.HANDLED BY A LARGE FAT MAN3. 由一个圆滚滚的高大男子处理
(Correct.The above impression and the following three were made in the light trance state.Bill said the description fits the stereotyper at the newspaper, and that the two of them discussed the ad this evening.Murphy the stereotyper, whom I have never met, is according to Bill a large, rotund fat man.I have not been inside the newspaper building since Jane and I moved here five years ago.)(正确。这个印象和下面三个印象是在轻微的出神状态写下。比尔说，这些描述符合那个报社排字工人的模样，他还说他们两个人那天晚上在讨论那则广告。根据比尔所说，这个我没见过的排字工人叫墨菲(Murphy)，长得高高大大，身材圆滚滚。我和珍5年前就搬来这里，但至今我仍不曾踏进报社大楼。

(With this impression, as I sat with closed eyes, I seemed to receive a picture.I saw fairly clearly a four-column layout set in type; at the top was a plate for printing a photograph, with headline lettering on either side of the photo.I could not distinguish the subject matter of the photo. When Bill returned he asked me to diagram what I had seen.To the viewer’s left on page 321 is a copy of the drawing I made for him, to the right is a sketch of the actual ad as printed.On Friday night Bill told me my sketch was pretty close to the layout he finally decided upon at the office, and talked over with the stereotyper.My impression was of the metal printing plate, not the final printed ad. OCTOBER 11, 1965 9 PM MONDAY AS SCHEDULED我笔记本中某一页的描摹图，内容是我们针对珍那一本讨论ESP与赛斯资料的书提出来的建议书名
(Today Jane was quite upset because she still hasn't received a letter from her publisher, Frederick Fell, even though Mr. Fell reassured her about the ESP book when she telephoned him last Monday, October 5, the day of the 195th session.In that session Seth also offered reassurance to Jane.(虽然在10月4日[译注：原著误写成10月5日]上周一，也就是我们第195节课那天，珍打电话给出版商佛德瑞克·费尔时，费尔先生跟她再度确认ESP新书的事，但是因为珍仍未收到他的来信，所以今天心里非常烦乱不安。那节课里赛斯也向珍保证事情会顺利。
