See the tracing on page 322.The page is on white paper, and the uniting on the tracing is done with the same pen I used to make the original notes.I sealed the folded page in the usual double envelopes, also inserting two pieces of Bristol board for stiffeners.It’s our 13th envelope test.(我从笔记本选了一页当作今晚的测试物品。自从珍开始动工撰写赛斯及其相关的书以来，我和珍就一直尝试为这本书想出一个不错的书名，见上面的描摹图。这是一张白纸，上面的文字跟原本的笔记都是用同一枝笔写的。我把折叠后的纸张放在平常使用的双层信封内密封，里面也放了两片厚纸板当内衬。这是我们第13次信封测试。
(The session this evening was held in our back room and was quite peaceful.Jane spoke while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her voice was average, her pace rather slow in the beginning.)(今晚这节课在我们后面的房间举行，整节课都非常平静。珍坐下来闭着眼睛开始讲话，刚开始时声音适中，速度相当缓慢。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ’’)(“晚安，赛斯。” )
Now. These electromagnetic changes form their own kind of pattern, which has mass but no weight, or weight so slight as to be indistinguishable.现在，这些电磁变化自成一类的形式，这类形式具有质量(mass)，但并没有重量(weight)，或是说重量轻到感觉不出来。
The mass, generally speaking, is a denseness formed by the varying intensities. There are mathematical precisions and formulas here.There is a ratio between the mass, which is usually considerable, and the weight, which is barely noticeable.These electromagnetic frameworks could be considered as skeleton forms within physical matter.一般来说，质量是由各种不同强度(intensities)形成的一种密度(denseness)，这当中有数学上的精确性和方程式存在。在通常很可观的质量以及很难觉察得到的重量之间，有一个比例存在。这些电磁架构可以看成是实体物质里面的骨架形式。
The electromagnetic reality within the human organism has considerable mass, but the entire physical weight amounts to 3 to 6 ounces at the very most.Again, the mass is composed of electrical intensities.I have told you that all experience is basically psychological, and that it is held in coded form within the cells.One electrical pulsation can represent an emotional experience.The importance of the experience to the individual will be responsible for the intensity with which it is recorded.人类有机体内的电磁实相，具有相当大的质量，但整个物理重量最多只能到3到6盎司(注：1盎司等于28.35克)。再说一次，质量是由电性强度所构组成。我告诉过你们，所有的经验基本上都是心理性的，以编码形式放在细胞里。每个电子脉冲都代表了一个情感体验。经验对个体的重要性，会决定经验被记录的强度。
(Again, see sessions 120. 127, in Volume 3, for material on the electromagnetic field and related subjects.)(有关电磁场及其相关主题，可参考第三册第120至127节课的内容。)
All of an individual’s experiences, even those of which he is not aware on a conscious basis, therefore are part of the electromagnetic reality that forms this particular individual’s electromagnetic identity.It exists within the physical matter of the organism during existence within the physical system.While the experiences which form this framework and compose this individual's identity are obtained through his interaction with the physical system, his electromagnetic identity is not dependent upon the physical field.因此，个体的全部经验，即使是那些他在意识基础上并未觉察到的经验，都属于电磁实相的一部分，而电磁实相又形成了该个体的电磁本体。只要有机体存在于物质系统的这段时间内，电磁本体就存在于有机体的实际物质里面。虽然个体是透过与物质系统的互动，而得到了形成这个架构且组成该个体本体的经验，但是他的电磁本体并不依赖物质场域。
During his life within the physical system attractions with it are of course maintained.At physical death this connection is severed. Polarities are changed in reverse fashion.The individual identity, composed of its electrically and magnetically coded experiences, is therefore intact. I say intact, for to all purposes this is so.When the polarities are changed however in reverse fashion, the present ego follows its attraction to the subconscious, and the two are more or less united.在物质系统里的生命期间内，电磁本体具有的吸引力当然一直都在。但是在肉体死亡时，这个连结就切断了，这时情况截然相反。由于个体的本体是由电子和磁力的编码经验所组成，因此完整无缺，我之所以说完整无缺，是因为实际上就是如此。一旦情况截然相反，现在的自我就会跟随着潜意识的吸引力走，此时这两者或多或少就会结合在一起。
It goes without saying that there are electromagnetic connections between the ego and the subconscious, within the physical system.Again, we speak of the ego and the subconscious as separate merely for the sake of convenience.They merely are interchanges and mass identity centers where highly intricate self-translations take place, and where various transformations occur.在物质系统内，自我和潜意识之间具有电磁上的连结，这一点无须赘述。我们之所以把自我和潜意识分开，只是为了方便说明。它们只是交换中心和群体本体的中心，相当复杂的自我转译现象会在那里发生，也会产生各种不同的转换现象。
In the past we have spoken briefly concerning a tricky subject, the relationship of intensity and the nature of distance.The electromagnetic identity of any given individual contains the past identity systems, again in coded form.In other words, the previous personalities of past lives.我们过去曾经简短谈到一个微妙的主题，就是强度与距离的本质之间的关系。任何一个个体的电磁本体，都包含了过去的本体系统，而且一样是以编码形式。换言之，就是那些过去累世的人格。
(See the 125th session in Volume 3, among others.)(除此之外，可参考第三册第125节的内容。)
They are only available however under certain circumstances, for each of them is coded within a specific intensity range. They exist simultaneously with the present personality, but the present personality as a rule cannot pick them up, so to speak. Sometimes there is a bleed through however.Also, the chemical nature of certain emotional experiences may cause a freak electrical storm within the identity system, so that a past life may suddenly be recalled.然而，只有在某些情况下才能触及这些过去的人格，因为每个人格都在某种特定的强度范围内被编码了，它们与现在的人格同时存在，但是现在的人格通常无法接收到，不过有时候会渗漏过来。或许，某些情感经验的化学属性，可能会在本体系统之内莫名其妙地引发电子上的强烈冲击，而突然浮出过去世的记忆。
I have mentioned that any action has an electromagnetic reality, and so thoughts and dreams as well form this identity system.我曾提过，任何行动都有一个电磁实相，所以思想和梦也会形成这个本体系统。
I suggest a brief break and we shall continue.You should get a charge out of this material, if you will excuse a poor pun.我建议休息一下后我们再继续。这些资料应该可以让你们充饱电，请别介意这个不太理想的俏皮话。
(Break at 9:26.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. She ended the delivery with a smile. Her eyes remained closed, her voice quiet. Her pace was fast after a rather slow start.(9:26分休息。珍第一阶段的出离状况如常，面带笑容结束这一段口述，双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔，刚开始时速度非常慢，但后来就变快了。
(Her voice was a bit stronger when she resumed, again with her eyes closed, at 9:32.)(9:32分，珍继续口述，声音变得强烈一些，双眼依然闭着。)
In telepathic and clairvoyant experiences, the electromagnetic reality pattern is what is transmitted.It must then be transformed into a pattern that will be distinguished by ego awareness, if the individual is to be consciously aware of having received such a message.在心灵感应和千里眼的经验中，传送的就是电磁实相形式的讯息。如果个体要在意识上觉察到接收了这样的讯息，那么电磁实相的形式必须转换成自我意识能辨别的形式。
Often such messages are picked up and translated by the subconscious. The information is used and acted upon without conscious approval or recognition.In almost all cases however, there must be an emotional attraction, for this is what allows for the transmission.Indeed, this is what makes the transmission possible.这种讯息常常被潜意识接收到并加以转译，不需经过意识上的同意或认可，就能使用和执行这些讯息。不过，情感吸引力几乎会存在于所有情况下，因为正是这股情感吸引力容许讯息传送。事实上，这就是讯息得以传送的最大功臣。
The ego chooses channels of reception with great discrimination; and, again, it censors anything which it feels is a threat to its own dominance.In sleep however many dreams are of a telepathic nature, with strong clairvoyant overtones.It is the ego’s persistent discrimination in choosing the stimuli to which it will react that in a large measure determines the nature of physical time as it appears to the personality.The ego, because of its function and basic characteristics, cannot make swift decisions as can the intuitive self.Therefore it perceives events in a peculiar manner, almost in slow motion, so that the whole effect is of a series of separate events, one happening before or after the other.自我会以很强的辨识力，选择接收的管道；也会检查任何它觉得对自己的主控权带来威胁的事物。然而，在睡眠中许多的梦都具有心电感应的特质，也强烈带有千里眼的意味。自我在选择要对何种刺激予以回应时，会采行一贯的辨识标准，正是这种辨识标准，大幅决定了呈现在人格面前的物理时间本质。由于自我的功能和基本特质，所以无法像直觉的自己(intuitive self)那样可以即使做决定。因此，它以一种特别的方式感知事件，几乎是用慢动作，于是整体效果变成是一连串彼此分开的事件，按先后顺序一件一件发生。
The intellect is a part of the ego, and its development is important. Therefore the appearance of separate events trains the intellect. Otherwise full use of the intuitions would be relied upon and the intellect would not develop, for the intellect is an important feature in the further specialization of individual consciousness and identity.理性(intellect)是自我的一部分，它的发展很重要，而各自分开的独立事件会让理性得到训练，否则全部都依赖直觉，那理性就不会发展，因为在个体意识与本体更进一步的特别化上面，理性是个重点特征。
You are midway here.In the future the ego and the intellect will expand sufficiently so that they can contain and use and appreciate all the other functions and portions of the self which they now mistrust.Individual identity will then expand to include a greater variety of impulses and stimuli, which do not necessarily come from the self, and yet maintain specialized identity.你们现在正在发展之中。未来，自我和理性会充分扩展，才能涵盖、使用和体会自己的所有其他功能，以及目前尚无法信任的其他部分。接着个人的本体就会扩充发展，以纳入更多不同种类的脉冲与刺激，而这些脉冲与刺激不一定都是来自于自己，不过却都保有特别化的本体。
The ego will become more of an organizer in general, letting in literally a barrage of experiences, and organizing them into meaningful patterns.Now the ego fears such experiences, and censors them and holds them out because it is not certain of its strength, or its ability to mold them into significant patterns.一般而言，自我会变得更像是个组织者，确切地说，它会让大量的经验进来，然后组织成有意义的形式。目前自我会害怕这样的经验，对它们加以盘查，并留置在外，因为自我对自身的力量没有把握，也不确定是否有能力将这样的经验组织成有意义的形式。
As the ego becomes certain of its strength, then it will allow the self to expand.I mentioned in our last session that the scientists did not realize that man has indeed evolved since the development of the human brain. For it has learned to form literally millions of new connections, meanings and concepts, new gestalts that have indeed made man something quite different than he was.All of these are new electromagnetic patterns which are now indelibly a part of the race.一旦自我对本身的力量有把握，就会允许自己扩展开来。我上一节提过，科学家并不知道，人类的大脑发展了之后，其实真的又朝进化迈一大步，因为大脑学会如何精确形成无数的新连结、意义、概念以及新的完形，这些真的都让人类的某些方面与过去的状况大不相同。所有这一切都是新的电磁形式，是目前人类不可磨灭的一部分。
The size of the brain has little to do with any of this beyond a certain point. The number of electrical connections are important however, and even old portions of the brain are affected by them.The old portions of the brain are not the same as they were. Physical examination of them only discloses their condition in the present. The growth of the cortex greatly affected the more primitive portions.大脑的大小与这部分并没有什么重要关系，不过电子连结的数量有其重要性，即使是大脑里原有的那部分也会受其影响。大脑原有的那部分跟过去已有所不同，对它们做身体探查只能揭露当下的状况，大脑皮层的成长大幅影响了那些较原始的部分。
I am keeping our date in mind, and therefore suggest a brief break.(Break at 9:54.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed, her pace fast, her voice good.She resumed in the same manner at 10:01.)我心理一直挂记着我们的约定，因此建议休息一下。(9:54分休息。珍的出离状况如常，眼睛一直闭着，节奏快速，声音适中。10:01分以同样的方式继续口述。)
I would like to remind Ruburt, again, that I told him that Peggy Gallagher would be of help in our sessions, long before she was a friend.我想再次提醒鲁伯，早在很久以前，他还没跟蓓•加拉格成为朋友，我就说过她对我们的课会有帮助。
The affair the other evening worked out well. It was spontaneous, the atmosphere was friendly, and the Gallaghers’ attitude is an excellent one.There will be other and better such communications between the four of you.那一个晚上的测试状况好极了，过程自然而然发生，气氛很友善，加拉格夫妇的态度也相当好。你们4个之间还会有其他这类更好的沟通。
(See the report by Jane and me at the end of the last session.Bill and Peggy will be leaving next week for a vacation in Puerto Rico, and the four of us have already made plans to try some telepathic/clairvoyant communications.The plans are simple; at session times next week Bill and Peggy will attempt to concentrate on Jane, Seth and me, with a view to seeing what Seth can pick up.(参看我和珍上一节课末尾的报告。比尔和蓓下周将动身前往波多黎各度假，而我们4个人也计划好要试试一些心电感应/千里眼的沟通。计划很简单；就是到了下周上课时间，比尔和蓓会努力将注意力放在我、珍和赛斯上面，看看赛斯能获得什么讯息。
(In the 63rd session of June 17,1964, Seth said that Peggy Gallagher's subconscious abilities were well developed.Peggy is a feature writer for the local paper. Jane was working at the Arnot Art Gallery then, and the two became casual acquaintances.However the friendship between the four of us did not begin to develop until early this year.(在1964年6月17日第63节课里，赛斯说蓓•加拉格的潜意识能力发展得很好。蓓目前是地方报社的专栏作家，珍那时候在阿诺画廊上班，两人成了点头之交。不过，一直到今年年初，我们4人之间的友谊才开始发展。
(It might be interesting to note here that Peggy was hypnotized by Dr. Milton Erickson in late March of 1959, during a meeting of the Finger Lakes Clinical Hypnosis Association at the Mark Twain Hotel in Elmira.Peggy attended the meeting in her role of reporter, and volunteered as a subject.Before about twenty people Dr. Erickson put her into a deep trance quite easily, with the result that Peggy had complete amnesia for a ten-minute period.After she learned of the Seth sessions Peggy searched the files of the newspaper for a copy of her article on the experience.It was printed on April 2,1959.)(有件事蛮有意思，在这里值得一提，1959年3月底，指状湖临床催眠师协会在埃尔迈拉的马克•吐温酒店举办了一场会议，蓓曾在会议中被米尔顿•埃里克森博士催眠。蓓是以记者身分出席这次会议，自愿当受试者。埃里克森博士在大约24个人面前，轻而易举就让蓓深度出神，结果造成蓓长达10分钟完全失忆。蓓在得知有赛斯课之后，就开始寻找报纸档案，要把她自己先前撰写描述这段经验的文章找出来，那篇文章是在1959年4月2日刊登。)
When Ruburt learns a few lessons, he will be able to tell when his impressions are correct.Most of the wrong ones are not necessarily errors, but he has not made the proper connections, or gone far enough, but stopped short in processes of association.For the basic valid impressions are not picked up by the ego; and, again, must be properly transformed into data that can be understood.And this often emerges as associative material, that must then be deciphered.He is in training, so to speak.鲁柏学了几节课后，就能分辨他的印象何时才是正确的。多数错误的印象未必是错的，可能只是他没有做过适当的连结，或是连结得够远，但在过程中却又突然终止。因为基本上正确的印象并不是透过自我来获得；而是要经过适当的转译，才能成为能了解的资料。而这一部分往往会以联想资料的样貌出现，接着还必须经过解码的程序。可以这么说，他仍在训练阶段当中。
Now, give us a moment, and we will contact Dr. Instream.现在，请稍等我们一会儿，我们马上要联系殷斯翠姆博士。
(Jane paused at 10:07. She sat quietly with her eyes closed.Her head was tipped down, her hands to her face.)(10:07分珍暂停下来，闭着双眼安静坐着，低着头，双手托腮。)
These are impressions.Mud, and water, and umbrellas.An inkwell. He may be writing.He has been concerned with a schedule.(Pause.)我得到以下的印象。泥巴，水，雨伞。墨水池，或许他在写字。他一直关心一个行程。(停顿)
Five objects in particular, and one of them is a gift, or was a gift to him.A cluster of events he considers too many.The number 12.He is very cautious this evening.特别有5样东西，其中一样是礼物，或人家给他的礼物。他日夜苦思的一连串事情。数字12。今晚他相当小心。
He thinks of someone whom he considers in the same light as a daughter.His wife may be allergic to dogs or hair.I think of a dog with wet hair, a shaggy one.(Paused)他想到一个人，他将这个人视为女儿般看待。他太太对于狗或毛发可能会过敏。我想到一只湿透了的狗，毛发蓬乱。(停顿)
There was a 4 o’clock appointment today, or he thinks of a 4 o’clock appointment for tomorrow.His hypnosis experiments have a snag that will be overcome.今天4点与人有约，要不然就是他想到明天4点与人有约。他的催眠实际碰到一个小问题，不过可以克服。
He has walked outside, and it is rainy and dark.He smokes outside as he walks.Tomorrow is a special day for him in some manner.(Pause at 10:16.)他走到室外，天色昏暗，下着雨。他在外面边抽烟边散步。明天对他而言，在某方面是个特别的日子。(10:16分停顿)
Do you have a test for me?你要测试我吗？
(“Yes.”(“是啊。”
(As usual I handed Jane the double test envelope.She took it while her eyes remained closed.)(一如往常，我把双层测试信封递给珍，她闭着眼睛拿了过去。)
These are impressions.我有以下的印象。
Five.An afternoon.The color yellow.An unusual circumstance.Something to do with two people who have a dog.5。一个午后。黄色。一种不寻常的状况。跟两个人有关，他们养了一只狗。
An arch shape.Designs that go in one direction, diagonals.The number 4, or four numbers.(Long pause at 10:19.) White.An F and a W, and a table and chairs.一个拱门的形状。一些图案都朝同一个方向，斜线。数字4或4个数字。(10:19停顿较久)白色的。字母F和W，还有一张桌子和几张椅子。
A time several years ago.Something hot, that is a warmth, as of a hot day.几年前的某个时间。某个热的东西，很温暖，就像大热天。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:20.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet, her pace rather slow.(10:20分休息。珍的出离状况如常，双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔，速度相当慢。
(Once again Jane considered the test a failure, and attributed it to her being upset today.As it developed we did not ask Seth for specific information on the impressions, so I do not know whether they were merely too far-ranging for our purposes, or simply errors.I saw possible connections with a few of them, and will note them for the record.(珍再度认为这次测试失败，并归咎于她今天的情绪烦乱不安。后来我们并没有和赛斯询问印象的细节，所以我不知道这些印象究竟是扯太远了，或单纯只是错误。我看到其中一些印象的可能连结，我会加以注明做为记录。
(The room, my studio, in which I wrote the suggestions for Janes new book title, has yellow painted walls. The notepaper is white.(我当时是在我的工作室里，为珍的新书写下建议书名，那个房间的墙壁是漆上黄色，而那张笔记纸是白色。
(The material on a dog reminded me that the Bristol stiffeners I enclosed tonight’s test paper in were the same two in which I had enclosed the test photo for the 11th envelope test, in the 194th session.The photo was of our dog, Mischa, now dead.It was taken several years ago or more, on a hot day in the summer; Jane was also with a man whose first initial was W on that day.(有关狗的资料我回想到，夹住今晚测试纸张的那两片厚纸板，正好就是我用来夹住第194节第11次信封测试照片的厚纸板。而那张照片的主角，就是我们家已经去世的狗米夏。照片是在多年前某个夏季炎热的日子所拍摄；珍那天也跟一个名字开头为W的男子一起。
(If impressions can attach themselves to the test object itself, they can attach themselves to any other object; so once again it appears that the problem for Jane is one of discrimination.She was disappointed at the results of this evenings test especially when comparing it with the good results of last Friday's spontaneous affair with the Gallaghers.See pages 316. 321.(如果印象本身可以依附到测试物品，那么就可以依附到其他任何物品；所以这再度显示，珍的问题是辨识度。她对今晚的测试结果并不满意，尤其是与上周五加拉格夫妇来访时那种自然而然得来的好成绩相比，更觉得失望。
(Jane resumed in a quiet voice, with her eyes closed, at 10:30.)(10:30分，珍闭着眼睛继续口述，声音轻柔。)
I do have a few suggestions, though Ruburt may not particularly approve of them.我真的有几个建议，虽然鲁柏可能不会特别同意。
I will no longer ask you if you have a test. You will simply at your leisure hand me a test when you have one for me, at any time in the session.You may, in other words, interrupt. Do not tell Ruburt the results of the test immediately.以后我不会再主动问你是否要测试我，如果你准备了信封要做测试，那只要你方便，随时都可以在课中任何时间交给我。换句话说，你可以打断我，还有，不要马上告诉鲁柏测试结果。
He may read them when they are written up.I believe this will be of benefit, at least for the present. In fact, this is an excellent suggestion, and will aid in achieving greater spontaneity for us.这些测试结果马上写下来之后，他一样看得到。我相信这么做有好处，至少现阶段是如此，事实上，这是相当好的建议，也可以帮助我们达到更具自发性的境界。
He has been upset, but this situation will soon be taken care of.It is this, plus the fact that he worries about his score, that is bothering us now. It has not bothered us to any great degree in the Instream material.Though all the connections have not been hits, enough has come through to show validity; though with training Ruburt will improve in allowing me to come through more specifically.他一直感到沮丧，但这个情况很快就会改善。目前干扰我们的就是这部分，再加上他担心测试结果的正确率，而在殷斯翠姆博士的资料方面，还不至于对我们造成很大的困扰。虽然并不是所有的连结都说中，但传过来的资料也够多了，足以证明可信度；不过话说回来，针对让我可以更容易穿透过来的这方面而言，鲁柏经由训练倒还是有进步的空间。
We will now end our session. My heartiest regards to you both.I believe a rather bizarre event will occur, regarding the Gallaghers, at approximately five o’clock during their vacation.我现在就结束我们的课，送上我最深情的祝福给二位。我觉得加拉格夫妇在假期中的某天下午5点，会发生一件相当离奇的事。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:37.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet. Her pace had been average.(10:37分结束。珍的出离状况如常，双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔，速度维持适中。
(It will be recalled that Seth himself [or Jane?] initiated the idea of asking me if I had an envelope test at each session.The first such test was held in the 179th session, and Jane knew about it before the session began.In that session however Seth also said it would be better if Jane did not know whether I planned a test before any particular session.(还记得每节课问我是否安排信封测试的点子，是赛斯自己[或是珍？]先提出的，第1次这样的测试是在第179节，那次珍在课开始前就知道了。不过，赛斯在那节课也说过，最好不要让珍在任何特定的课开始之前，事先知道我是否安排测试。
(In the 180th session however, Seth’s comments led into the second envelope test, and in the 183rd session Seth queried me outright as to whether I had a third test for him.This process set up a pattern which we have followed ever since.(而在第180节课中，赛斯的评论就巧妙地带到第2次信封测试；第183节课则是赛斯当场问我是否为他安排第3次测试。从那时起到现在，这种过程就成为我们遵循的模式。
(As stated before, the Gallaghers leave for a vacation in Puerto Rico next week; the four of us have planned some clairvoyant tests.Perhaps Seth will be able to tune in on the bizarre event involving the Gallaghers before they return home.(如前所述，加拉格夫妇下周要动身前往波多黎各度假；我们4个人已计划好要做些千里眼实验。赛斯或许在加拉格夫妇回家之前，就能接收到那个跟他们有关的离奇事件。
(Tracing of the photograph used in the 14th envelope test, in Session 198, October 13,1965.)照片描摹图，使用于1965年10月13日第198节第14次信封测试

SESSION 198 第198节 ▲思想改变细胞结构 疾病的治疗 信封14


OCTOBER 13, 1965 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS SCHEDULED1965年10月13日 星期三 晚上9点 定期课
(Yesterday we received Dr. Instreams letter of October 11, in which he asked that Seth try giving data on one location and one object in the clairvoyant tests.(昨天，我们接到殷斯翠姆博士10月11日的来信，信中要求赛斯在千里眼测试中尝试提供一个地点和一个物品的资料。
(Not having heard from her publisher yet, as he had promised she would by now, Jane wrote and mailed to him a pretty stiff letter.However, she did not appear to be in the upset mood she had been in prior to the last session.(由于出版商答应今天要给珍回复，但却食言，所以她写了一封口气相当强硬的信寄给他。不过她的心情看起来并不像上次上课前那么烦乱不安。
(This afternoon I made up the usual double test envelope, including a pair of Bristol stiffeners.The envelopes contained a black and white photo of York Beach, ME, taken there last summer, that is the summer of1964.It is of a view I scouted from our motel window. I took it for reference for a future painting and consists mainly of a mass of tangled marsh grass in the foreground; in the background rise a couple of average-looking houses, a telephone pole and some wires.I obtained excellent detail in the rhythmic pattern of the waist-high grasses, which was what I wanted.(今天下午，我准备了平常使用的双层测试信封，里面也放了两片厚纸板当衬垫。信封内装了一张黑白照片，于去年1964年夏天在缅因州约克海滩拍摄。这张照片是我从我们的汽车旅馆窗户看出去的景象，我拍下来想当成未来做画的参考，照片的前景主要是一片湿地杂草；背景则是两栋看起来普普通通的房子、一根电线杆和一些电线。那片绿草高度及腰，层次分明，我拍得非常细致清楚，因为那就是我要的效果。
(I wasn't decided whether to ask Jane to hold an envelope test.On the one hand I didn’t want her to feel I was pressuring her for a test every session; on the other hand I wondered whether she would think I was taking it easy on her if I skipped the test.So I thought I would see what developed in the session.(我尚未决定是否该请珍做信封测试，一方面是我不想让她觉得我每堂课都会强迫她做测试；另一方面是因为我担心如果没做测试，那她会不会认为我故意便宜了她。所以我想我就在课堂中视情况而定。
(The session was held in our back room and was not interrupted.Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed.Her voice was quiet, her pace slow at the beginning, with pauses.)(这一节课在我们后面的小房间举行，没有受到干扰。珍坐下来闭上眼睛开始说话，声音轻柔，刚开始时速度并不快，中间停顿几次。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ’’)(“晚安，赛斯。” )
We have not discussed the inner senses in some time.我们已经有一段时间没有讨论内在感官了。
You should by now realize that they have an electric, magnetic reality also, and that the mental enzymes act as sparks, setting off these inner reactions.你们现在应该已经明白，它们也有电子和磁性的实相，也该了解精神酵素(mental enzymes)的角色有如火花，会引发这些内在反应。
In the dream state these reactions are more easily triggered. This is the result of a lowering of egotistic guards, for the ego sets up controls that act as resistance to various channels, so that many connections are closed.All of these systems are interconnected. They all operate simultaneously.However, the personality is certainly not aware of their existence on a conscious level a good deal of the time.在梦境里这些反应更容易发动，这是自我防卫降低形成的结果，因为自我会设定一些管制，以拒绝各种不同的管道，导致许多的连结都被封锁住。其实所有这些系统相互连结，全都会同时运作。不过，人格在意识层次上，绝大部分的时间必然都不会觉察到它们的存在。
The inner senses are connected then to the physical mechanism.Sometimes inner perceptions may be touched off as a result of stimuli received through the outer senses.In many cases however the stimulus comes from the deeper levels of the self, where however it may be translated into terms that the personal subconscious can use.内在感官与肉体结构相连。有时候内在觉知之所以被触动，是由于外在感官接受到刺激的结果。不过在许多状况下，刺激是来自于自己更深的层面，这时刺激就可能要转译成个人潜意识可以使用的用语。
In such circumstances these perceptions may find their way to the ego, appearing as inspirations or intuitive thought.It is obvious that many such intuitions appear when the personality is in a dreaming state or in states of dissociation.The intuitions themselves, while seemingly mental, are action, and as such they produce changes in the physical organism, both chemical and electromagnetic.在这样的情况下，这些觉知可能会以灵感或直觉的思想出现，而找到通往自我的方法。人格在梦境或出离的状况下，显然会出现许多这类的直觉。虽然直觉本身看起来像是精神性的，其实也是行动，而且就其本身而论，也会造成肉体结构化学及电磁层面的改变。
The reality of such intuitive thoughts as electromagnetic actions has not been understood, and is quite vital to any comprehension of the human system.这类直觉的思想本身就是一种电磁行动，大家对于它们的实相尚不了解，不过这部分对于人类系统的理解来说却极其重要。
I have said before that thoughts exist in such a dimension.Constructive thoughts do not simply affect the system for good in some sort of a generalized fashion, nor do destructive thoughts simply happen to affect the system directly.我以前说过，思想就存在于这样的一个维度里。建设性的思想不会以某种一般的方式，对系统造成永久的影响，破坏性的思想也不会直接影响到系统。
The effect of any thought is a quite precise and definite one, that is set into motion specifically because of the nature of its own electromagnetic identity.The physical system operates best within certain electromagnetic patterns, and is adversely affected by others.These effects change the actual molecular structure of the physical cells of the organism, for better or for worse, and because of certain laws of attraction a habitual pattern will operate.A destructive type of thought, then, is dangerous not only for the present state of the organism, but dangerous in terms of the future.任何思想的影响都相当精确与肯定，由于思想本身电磁本体性质的关系，所以思想会成为特有的行动。物质系统在某些电磁形态中会有最佳的运作效能，但也会受到其他电磁形态不利的影响。这些影响会实质改变有机体细胞的分子结构，不管结果是好是坏，而且由于某些吸引力法则的关系，习惯性的模式会运作。因此，破坏性的思想模式不仅危害到有机体当下的情况，也会危害到未来。
Poor health is indeed caused mainly by habitual destructive thought patterns which directly affect the physical system, because of the particular range within the electromagnetic system in which they fall; and despite any objections I will stick by this statement.The bad health, for example, does not occur first, resulting in unhealthy thoughts.It is indeed the other way around.实际上，不良的健康状况主要是由一些习惯性的消极思想模式所引起，它们会直接影响物质系统，因为这些思想模式都落入了电磁系统中的某个特定范围内；我就是坚信这一句话，不管其他人是否有任何的反对意见。举例来说，并不是不良的健康状况发生在先，然后引发不健康的思想，其实情况截然相反。
For such habits operate not only in the waking state but in the sleeping state also, where the personality is even more open to suggestion. A vicious circle is therefore formed.It is often broken however, and in many ways.因为这样的习惯不仅在醒时状况会运作，在睡眠时也会运作，那时的人格更容易接受暗示，恶性循环于焉产生。不过，这样的状况通常也有很多破解方法。
I suggest a break and we shall continue.我建议你们休息一下，然后我们再继续。
(Break at 9:20.Jane was dissociated as usual for a first delivery. Her eyes remained closed. Her voice grew somewhat heavier and stronger as the delivery progressed, and her pace speeded up.(9:20分休息。第一阶段珍的出离状况如常，眼睛一直闭着，在继续口述的过程中，声音变得稍微低沉、强烈一些，速度也加快了起来。
(Seth began talking about the inner senses almost as soon as the sessions began, in December of1963.By the 20th session he had mentioned many of them. By the 60th session he had gone into some detail on 9 inner senses, 11 basic laws of the inner universe, and 3 properties of physical matter, along with the many other subjects included in the sessions.Check Volumes I and 2.(几乎在1963年12月我们的课刚开始时，赛斯就讲到内在感官。到了第20节时，提供了很多相关资料，到第60节时，已详细探讨过9种内在感官、11个内在感官基本定律、实体物质的3种特性，以及课中包含的其他许多主题。详见第一册与第二册。
(More inner-sense delineations are to come, according to Seth.With a list of the above categories in mind however, it is clear which senses and laws apply to the material in the sessions following, up until now.I have often meant to remind Seth to mention the specific senses along with the material under discussion but have not done so.(根据赛斯当时所说，后面还会更详细解释内在感官。不过，只要对上述分类项目了然于心，就很清楚哪些感官和法则适用于接下来各节的资料内容。我一直想要提醒赛斯在讨论资料时也一并提一下特定的感官，但尚未付诸行动。
(Jane resumed in the same fast manner, with her eyes closed and in a good voice, at 9:30.)(9:30分，珍闭着眼睛以同样快的速度及不错的声音继续口述。)
For these thoughts set up charges that oftentimes cannot be used effectively by the physical organism, and when excesses of such charges occur an illness develops.This is not to say however that illness can be treated using electromagnetics though in the future, the distant future, this may be practical.因为这些思想会形成肉体组织通常无法有效利用的电荷，一旦这样的电荷累积越多，就会产生疾病。然而，意思不是说疾病可以运用电磁原理来治疗，不过在未来、在遥远的未来，这或许可行。
Illnesses must be treated primarily however by changing the basic mental habits, for unless this is done the trouble will erupt time and time again in different guises.However, the system obviously has the ability to heal itself, and every opportunity should be given so that it is allowed to do so.To my knowledge nothing is known about the healing effect that often occurs in dreams themselves. For a wholly destructive attitude of mind has been changed overnight in the dream state to a constructive condition, and the whole electromagnetic balance has been changed.疾病主要的治疗方法，必须借由改变基本的精神习惯，因为除非做好这部分，否则问题就会一而再、再而三以各种不同样貌爆发出来。然而，系统本身显然有自我疗愈的能力，每一次都应该给它机会，让它可以这么做。据我所知，大家都还不了解梦本身常常会产生疗愈效果，因为在梦境里，一种全然消极的精神态度，会在一夜之间变成建设性的态度，整个电磁平衡改变了。
(“Not too fast.”(“不要太快。”
(Jane's dictation was quite fast along in here, and I finally had to ask for relief.This is the first time such a situation has developed in some time.Usually it takes place when witnesses are present.)(这时候珍的传述速度相当快，我最后只好请她放慢了下来。这段时间以来，还是头一遭碰到这种状况，通常是有见证人在场时才会如此。)
Surely investigation should be done to probe into this matter.In such a case negative ions form an electrical framework in which healing is possible.Such healing dreams come most often when the inner self deeply feels a sense of desperation, and automatically opens up channels from deeper layers of the self, that have been closed for all effective purposes.这个问题确实有必要深入研究探讨。在这种情况下，负离子会形成一个可能具有疗愈作用的电子架构。如果内我深感绝望，那么这种具有疗愈作用的梦就会出现得极为频繁，如此一来，就能自动打开来自于自己更深层次的通道，这些通道之前为了实际的目的而遭到封闭。
We find here an almost instant regeneration, a seemingly instant cure, a point from which the organism almost miraculously begins to improve.The same happens however in less startling cases where, for example, a merely annoying condition of health will suddenly disappear.这时我们可以看到一种几乎是即刻再生的现象，仿佛是瞬间的疗愈，会看到身体几乎在一个时间点之后，就奇迹似地开始改善。而这也发生在一些比较不令人吃惊的状况，比方说，一个令人困扰的健康问题就突然消失了。
Now we come to see one of the main points of this discussion.These therapeutic dreams, with practice, can be brought about through self-suggestion.To some extent this is not unknown. Various old cults have used this method, but it can be quite practical in modern life.现在我们就来看看这部分讨论的一个主要重点。透过练习，可以经由自我暗示带出这些疗愈的梦。这一部分或多或少已不再是未知，各个不同的古老教派都曾使用过这种方法，不过在现代的生活中也相当实用。
(Jane's voice now hovered on the edge of loudness.Her pace was still good, her eyes closed.)(珍这时的声音相当响亮，速度仍然维持不错，双眼闭着。)
The suggestion itself, you see, being action, has its own electromagnetic reality, and since the suggestion would be a constructive one, it would already begin to set certain healing processes into motion, and spark the formation of others. This can be used to your advantage in daily life.要知道，暗示本身也是一种行动，暗示有自己的电磁实相，而且由于暗示是建设性的，所以会开启特定的疗愈过程，并激发出其他的疗愈方式，如果这部分应用在日常生活中，会对你们有好处。
Such inner therapeutics also occur however at various levels of consciousness where they may be sparked by exterior stimuli of an esthetic or pleasing nature.Other exterior conditions have also their effect. To involve oneself in large groups, for example, is beneficial often, not simply to take attention away from the self, but because a larger range of electromagnetic realities are easily available.然而，像这样的内在疗愈法也可以在各个不同的意识层次中产生，在那里由具有美感或愉悦本质的外在刺激而激发出来。其他的外在情境也有效用，比方说，参与大型群体往往有益，因为身在其中不仅可以将注意力从自己身上移开，也很容易接触到范围更大的电磁实相。
It is obvious that some individuals seem to have a better effect upon oilier individuals, and what we have said should explain the reasons for the differences.显然，某些人对其他人似乎会有更好的影响，我们上述的内容应该也解释了为什么会有这样的差异。
The overall health of the individual and the delicate balance of electromagnetic properties are important, for when the organism is set deeply in destructive patterns, then this may be also felt in the dream state, so that destructive dreams add to the overall unfortunate state.个人整体的健康以及电磁性的微妙平衡都很重要，因为如果身体深处在负面模式里，那么连在梦境里也会感觉到这种情形，结果负面的梦就会加强了整个不幸的状况。
Dreams are indeed symptomatic of the personality’s overall condition at any given time, but they also help form that condition.The connections here are extremely complicated, and yet use of suggestion in bringing about constructive changes through dreams can be of great benefit.实际上，梦在任何时间都显示出人格整体的状况，但梦也有助于形成该状况。这中间的关联极其复杂，而透过梦使用暗示以带来建设性的改变，则会相当有利。
We shall have more to say concerning this subject, for practically it is of considerable importance. I will now suggest a break, and we shall have a try with our Dr. Instream.关于这个主题，我们还有更多的内容要说，因为它真的相当重要，我建议现在休息一下，然后再跟我们的殷斯翠姆博士做实验。
(Break at 9:50.Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes remained closed. Her voice had been good, her pace quite fast at times.She had been aware of the deeper and stronger quality of her voice.(9:50分休息。珍的出离状况如常，眼睛一直闭着，声音维持得很好，速度有时候很快。她早就意识到自己较低沉、强烈的声音特质。
(Jane said she hadn’t been in a poor or depressed mood lately so much as a period of transition.Having finished one project, the ESP book, she was beginning a new venture, the book on the Seth material itself.At the same time she was casting about for another endeavor. Whether it would prove to be short stories, a novel or poetry, she did not yet know.(珍说，她最近的情绪没像过渡时期那样糟糕或低落。完成这个ESP书的计划后，她准备开始一项新的冒险，也就是一本针对赛斯资料本身而写的书。在这同时，她也在构思另一项计划，至于这项计划到最后会是短篇故事、小说或诗集，她目前还不知道。
(Jane now resumed at a slower rate, in a quiet voice and with her eyes closed, at 10:01.)(10:01分，珍闭着眼睛，声音轻柔，以较慢的速度继续口述。)
Dr. Instream understands, I am sure, that we are not only involved here with inner perceptions, and with translations that must be made as data is given by me to Ruburt, but we are also working within human limitations, and of course with human potentialities.我确定殷斯翠姆博士了解，我们在这里不仅涉及内在的感知，以及我传资料给鲁柏时必须做的转译工作，而且也正在人类的限制下工作，当然也同时运用了人类的潜能。
This is all fairly new to Ruburt, and he is doing very well.We shall make an effort to be more specific.But one must always read large print as a training before small print can be read with care or precision.这种工作对鲁柏来说相当新鲜，而他也做得非常好。我们会朝更具体明确的方向努力。不过大家总得先阅读大字当作事先的训练，之后才能仔细精确地阅读小字。
Ruburt is extremely cautious. This will not work to our disadvantage however, for his cautiousness in these matters acts as a strong balancing mechanism, so that he learns to deal with inner perceptions stage by stage.His personality is not overwhelmed therefore. We have taken his ego into consideration at all times, so that he can consciously assimilate what he has learned, as is preferable.At times this may mean that we progress slowly, but the progression is steady and firm.鲁伯极其小心，不过这对我们并不会造成不利的影响，因为他在这些事情上的谨慎小心，扮演有力的平衡制角色，如此一来，他便可以按部就班，一步一步学习如何处理内在的感知。因此他的人格并没有完全被覆盖，我们随时都考量到他的自我，好让他尽可能有意识地吸收学到的东西，因为这样比较好。不过有时候这可能就代表我们进展的速度较缓慢，但这种进展却是稳固而坚实。
Now give us a moment.现在稍等我们一会儿。
(This is the eighth Dr. Instream clairvoyant test.(这是第8次殷斯翠姆博士千里眼测试。
(Jane paused at 10:07.She sat with her eyes closed, her head down and her hands to her eyes.Her voice was quiet and she used pauses, a few of them long.)(珍10:07分停顿。低着头，双手挡住眼睛，闭眼坐着，声音轻柔，中间停顿几次，其中有些停顿的时间比较久。)
A blue vase (long pause) of glass on a stand or table in a smallish room.I will give this as the particular object.(Pause.)一个蓝色的玻璃花瓶(停顿许久)，摆在小房间的架子或桌子上。我会把这个当成特别的物品来传达。(停顿)
Here are some given impressions. A hat on a tall rack, a single rack with offshoots on it. A message having to do with a boy. The message directed to Dr. Instream.Perhaps the initials B. M.(Pause.)以下是我得到的一些印象，高高的挂衣架上挂了一顶帽子，这个挂衣架上有分枝，还可以挂其他物品，一个跟男孩有关的讯息，这个讯息指向殷斯翠姆博士。开头字母也许是B.M.。(停顿)
The boy either 12 or 22 years old, with a farm somehow connected with his family or the message.男孩不是12岁就是22岁，还有一个家场，跟他的家庭或这个讯息有点关系。
A chip on the blue vase, on the left and toward the bottom.(A long pause at 10:13.) An indelible pencil in Dr. Instream’s pocket, with black lead.The pencil with a brand name on it, something like Connecticut.花瓶左侧接近底部的地方有一个小瑕疵。(10:13分停顿许久)殷斯翠姆博士的口袋里有一支铅笔，写字后笔迹很难擦掉，笔芯是黑色的。铅笔上面有品牌名称，好像是康乃狄克(Connecticut)。
Do you have a test?I will ask you.你准备了测试吗？我要问你。
(“Yes."(“对。”
(I handed Jane the double test envelope at 10:15.I had decided to pass up the test for this session, and certainly had no thought that Seth would ask me for one.(10:15分，我把双层测试信封递给珍。我本来决定这节课要略过测试，当然没想到赛斯会要求我做测试。
(This is the 14th envelope test.Jane took the envelope without opening her eyes, as usual, and sat quietly for a moment while holding it in both hands, without bending it, etc. She used pauses while delivering the test data, yet spoke confidently.(这是第14次信封测试。珍一如往常闭着眼睛接过去，双手拿着信封，也没有将它折弯，静静坐了一会儿。她传述测试资料时停顿了几次，不过说话充满自信。
(As she delivered the first phrase below, I had the rather strong impression that it referred to the Dr. Instream test material, but I cannot say why I felt this.)(当她传述下面第一段话时，我有一种相当强烈的感觉，它指的是殷斯翠姆博士的测试资料，但我说不出为什么会有这种感觉。)
Also a connection with a message, and the color green.也跟一则讯息有关，还有绿色。
The impression of a framework of thin lines, with some cube formations.The mass rising vertically mainly.(Pause.)细线条的架构和一些立方体造型的印象。主要是垂直而立的一堆东西。(停顿)
A photograph this time, without a border.(A long pause.)这是一张没有边框的照片。(停顿许久)
Something to do with a circle, and white and leaves.Dark leaves against white. Afternoon.(Pause.) A place which you have both visited, and water nearby.跟圆形、白色和树叶有关。深色叶子对比于白色，下午。(停顿)一个你们俩曾造访过的地方，附近有水。
A mistake of sorts connected here somewhere.Two people, and a look out.这里有某个地方出了差错。两个人。往外看。
I suggest a break, and Ruburt may open the envelope.我建议休息一下，鲁伯可以打开信封了。
(Break at 10:20.Jane was dissociated as usual.Her eyes had remained closed her voice quiet.She said that when she heard Seth ask me for the envelope test, she became nervous, for as Jane she had no intention of asking for a test.Then, Jane said, when she realized she did feel nervous, and that she was sitting stiffly, she relaxed and let Seth take over.(10:20分休息。珍的出离状况如常。眼睛一直闭着，声音轻柔。她说，一听到赛斯要求我做信封测试时，就变得很紧张，因为身为珍的她并没有打算做测试。珍接着又说，当她发现自己真的很紧张，而且坐姿僵硬，就放轻松由赛斯接管。
(See the tracing of the test photograph on page 329.Most of Janes impressions can apply to the photo.A “framework of thin lines" is an apt description of the patterns formed by the high marsh grasses in the foreground of the photo, with the houses rising in the background as “cube formations... rising vertically.”(见上面测试照片的描摹图。珍大部分的印象都跟照片相符。“细线条的架构”贴切描述了照片前景中高高的湿地杂草形成的样子，而背景中耸立的房子就如她说的“一些立方体造形……垂直而立。”
(The test object is a photograph, but with the standard white border.(这次的测试物品是一张照片，但是有标准的白色边框。
(“Something to do with a circle” is interesting, in that our motel at York Beach, where this photo was taken, is situated on a circular driveway in back of the beach hotel that fronts on the ocean.In the photo the marsh grass comes out as “dark leaves against white, ’’and the photo was taken in the afternoon of a bright day.I recall this easily enough because I had to wait until the sun was in the correct position to give a good contrasting result in the black and white photo that I wanted to use for reference.(“跟圆形有关”蛮有意思的，因为我们在约克海滩住的汽车旅馆，也就是照片拍摄的地方，正位于海滩旅馆后面的一个圆形车道旁，海滩旅馆面向大海。那张照片是在一个天气晴朗的下午拍的，照片中湿地杂草的样子就如“深色叶子对比于白色”。这一点我相当容易就可以回想起来，因为我必须等到太阳来到正确的位置，才可以在黑白照片中获得想要的那种良好的对比效果，以做为之后画画参考之用。
(“A place which you have both visited” is of course York Beach where the photo was taken, and “water nearby” is the ocean perhaps 75yards away.(“一个你们曾造访过的地方”，当然是照片的拍摄地点约克海滩，而“附近有水”就是离它大约75码远的大海。
(Jane tells me that “a mistake of sorts connected here somewhere” could refer to a mix-up concerning the room we had rented at the motel, but I do not recall this personally.It was nothing serious, Jane said, but a bookkeeping error on the part of the motel room clerk, to the effect that our room had been reserved for someone else, in advance; we were to be moved to another room, she said, but the transfer never took place.There was no unpleasantness involved.(珍告诉我说，“这里有某个地方出了差错”，可能是指跟我们汽车旅馆房间有关的一个乌龙事件，但我自己不记得了。珍说那是件小事，只是旅馆房间工作人员在住宿登记上的疏失，也就是我们住的房间事先已经保留给别人；她说，我们原本应该要搬到另一个房间，但最后没有搬过去，也没有造成什么不愉快的事。
(“Two people” can be Jane and me, just as I recall that in the second envelope test, which also concerned a photograph of York Beach, the two people mentioned could be us. See page 206.(“两个人”可能是我和珍，因为我想到在第2次信封测试当中，也是一张约克海滩的照片，提到的两个人可能就是我们。
(“And a look out” is interesting to us, because I spent some time for a couple of days looking out our back motel room window, studying this particular view before finally taking a picture of it.This involved checking the appearance of the marsh grass at various times of the day to see when the light would be best, then waiting for a sunny day to increase contrast, etc.(我们觉得“往外看”很有趣，因为我那几天每天都花一些时间，从旅馆房间后面的窗户往外看，仔细端详这个特殊的景色，最后才拍照。这包括每天检视不同时段湿地杂草的样貌，看看什么时候光线最佳，然后等待晴天以增加明暗对比。
(Jane said she felt she had learned several things at once during this test.While Seth was giving his data on the photograph, she said, she was also aware of several images of her own.It was as though she heard what Seth was saying, then conjured up her own separate set of visual images.Jane said she is particularly aware of this because as a rule she does not see images at any other time.(珍说，她觉得在测试时自己立刻就知道了一些事情。她说，在赛斯给出照片的资料时，她也觉察到了自己的一些影像。那种情形就好像她听到了赛斯说的话之后，就召唤出自己的另一套视觉影像。珍说她特别记得这部分，因为其他时候她通常都不会看到影像。
(Jane said the key point here is that although she had these images of her own, she did not give voice to them as part of Seth’s data; she was able to appreciate the difference.She said it is difficult for her to learn to use herself to the proper degree in interpreting Seth's material, without interfering with it.(珍说，这里的重点是，虽然她有自己的一些影像，但她并没有把它们当成是赛斯的资料讲出来；她可以分辨这中间的不同。她说，学习适度利用她自己来诠释赛斯资料，而且又不能妨碍到资料本身，这对她并不容易。
(While she was giving Seth’s data, Jane said she had images of a childhood playground in Saratoga Springs, NY, with houses nearby, but recognized this as her own data and did not give it as Seth’s.She felt sure the test object had a northern, as versus a southern, background, but did not say so because Seth did not say so.(珍说正在传递赛斯的资料时，也有她孩提时代在纽约撒拉托加温泉市游乐场的影像，附近有一些房子，不过她认为这部分是属于她自己的资料，并没有当成赛斯的资料讲出来。她确信这个测试物品的背景是美国北方，不是南方，但是因为赛斯并没有这样讲，所以她也就没说。
(All in all, Jane was pleased with the results of the test. Much of the time in the past she had been quite critical about test results.She now resumed in a quiet voice, and with her eyes closed, at 10:30.)(整体来说，珍对这次的测试结果感到欣慰，过去她对测试结果大多不甚满意。10:30分，她闭着眼睛轻声细语继续口述。)
We will shortly close our session.我们很快就会结束这节课。
A note here to Dr. Instream.This material is more illuminating because Ruburt is in training, so to speak; because the ways in which the personality receives, interprets and translates inner perceptions are more obvious now than they will be at a later date.这里要给殷斯翠姆博士说明一下。这一部分的资料具有更大的启发性，因为可以这么说，鲁柏正在接受训练；跟未来相比，这个人格目前接收、诠释和转译内在感知的方式更加显而易见。
The development will make obvious certain stages by which the personality approaches such material, and this should be valuable simply from a psychological viewpoint.这个发展会建立起一些明显的平台，让人格得以接近这类资料，单就心理层面来说，应该很有价值。
I realized that Ruburt would do fairly well this evening on our own test, which is why I suggested the test, and also suggested that Ruburt open the envelope.我早就知道鲁柏今晚在我们自己的测试中会有很好的表现，所以才会建议做测试，也建议鲁柏打开信封。
My heartiest regards to all.送上我最深情的祝福给各位。
Ruburt will be in fine fettle by Saturday in regards to financial matters, and his kitchen. Both affairs will be settled by then.在星期六之前，鲁柏的财务和厨房问题都会迎刃而解，到时候两件事都可以搞定。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:34.Jane was dissociated as usual.Her eyes had remained closed, her voice quiet.)(10:34分结束。珍的出离状况如常，双眼一直闭着，声音轻柔。)
(Since Seth gave us the material on therapeutic dreams last Wednesday, I began suggesting that I would experience one, as I was in a bad mood generally speaking and had been for a week; also I felt poorly with aches and pains etc.; nothing serious but annoying.1965年10月15日星期五 珍·柏兹做的两个梦(自从赛斯星期三给了我们有关疗愈梦的资料之后，我就开始暗示自己会经验到这样的梦，因为最近一个礼拜以来，我的心情大体而言并不好；而且也饱受各种疼痛之苦，虽然无大碍，但很恼人。
(Friday morning after writing for two hours, suddenly I felt very sleepy and could hardly hold my eyes open. Since I never take naps in the morning I tried to continue working but finally gave up, and went to bed. At the time I wondered about the peculiar sleepiness, wondering if it had any connection with a trance state.(星期五早上，我写了两小时的稿子后，突然觉得非常想睡，眼皮几乎撑不开。由于我早上从来不会打盹，所以试着继续工作，可是到最后终于放弃，就躺到床上睡。这时我对这次奇特的睡意感到很好奇，怀疑这跟出神状态是否相关。
(At 10:30 AM, I checked the clock and I awoke at 11 AM, so the following two dreams took place within the half-hour period. The first dream was entirely forgotten until I had completed writing my notes on the second dream, then I recalled the first one.(早上10:30分时，我看了一下时钟，然后在11点醒来，所以下面两个梦就是在这半个钟头内做的。本来我完全记不得第一个梦，一直等到写完第二个梦的说明之后，才慢慢回想起来。
(The first one was not pleasant. The second one left me with strong feelingsof joy and discovery, seemingly out of all proportion to the dream itself.(第一个梦令人不舒服，第二个梦则留给我强烈的愉悦和新鲜感，似乎与梦本身的比例不相称。
(This is the first dream. I was in bed, and then I realized that I heard voices in my head; was not at all sure that this was a dream. The voices were very loud, independent, each quite different from the others, and I believe, all male voices. I was frightened because I couldn't turn them off and they seemed to go on as if the people they belonged to had no idea that I could hear so clearly. However, I do not remember what they said. The volume was startling in itself. Finally I shook my head and yelled out. It was as if there was a radio in my head that kept switching from station to station.(第一个梦如下：我躺在床上，知道脑海里听到一些声音；但一点都不敢确定这是一个梦。那些声音非常大，各自独立，彼此有很大的差异，但我认为都是男人的声音。我很害怕，因为我没办法关掉这些声音，而且它们似乎会继续下去，仿佛这些讲话的人都不知道我可以听得这么清楚。不过我并不记得他们说些什么，那音量真的很吓人，最后我甩头大叫，那种状况就好像我脑袋里有台收音机，一直不停转台。
(The voices continued. Then I realized that my small transistor radio was at the head of the bed, that the voices were coming out of two speakers on it. I switched it off, relieved to find such a simple solution. But the voices kept on. Now I got out of bed [in the dream], went into Robs room and found that another radio sat on the bookcase where the Seth material is kept, and that the voices were coming from this radio also. As I reached out to turn the radio off, I received quite a severe, though harmless shock. As a result I was afraid to touch the radio again, or yank the cord, so I left it and went into my room, the living room. Here the dream becomes unclear. Perhaps there was an electric storm outside, and electricity of some sort in my room. I don’t recall that the voices bothered me now or if I heard them, though I had not turned the back radio off. From this scene I went directly into the second dream. The earlier fear was gone.)(声音持续着。后来我发现我的小型电晶体收音机就在床头，而这些声音是来自收音机上的两颗喇叭。我关掉收音机，发现解决方式就这么简单，让我松了一口气，可是声音还在。这时我走出卧室[梦里]，到罗的房间，发现摆放赛斯资料的书柜上有另一台收音机，也在播送那些声音。我正要伸手关掉收音机时，被重重电击了一下，但是并没有受伤。结果我再也不敢去碰收音机或拉扯电线，就掉头走到我的房间。这时梦开始变得模糊，也许外头有电子风暴，而我房间里也有某种电流存在。我并不记得这些声音是否干扰到我，还是我只是听到这些声音，虽然我还没将后面的收音机关掉。这个场景之后，我就直接进入了第二个梦，之前的恐惧也烟消云散。
(I am in our living room. It seems very dark, with two rather than three windows, and the middle one is blocked partially. I look again and now it is bigger and brighter than it ever was; the third window is back, but now it is moved out further, extending the room several feet. [Actually this must have to do with our hopes of having our kitchen enlarged.](我在客厅里。光线仿佛非常暗，客厅的窗户有两扇，而不是三扇，靠近中间那扇窗有部分被堵住了。我再看了一眼，发现它比之前更大、更明亮；第三扇窗在后面，但现在往外移出去，凸出房间好几尺远。[事实上，这一定与我们期望扩建厨房有关]
(Then at this end of the room I discover heavy dark wooden doors. Opening them, I find a lovely table-and-chair set of simulated wood, and I tell Rob that we can use them in our new kitchen.(接着我在房间的尾端发现几扇深色厚重的木门。打开之后，我发现有一套可爱的桌椅，由人造木组合而成，我告诉罗说，我们可以拿来做为新厨房之用。
(A noise catches my attention. Investigating I see that new people are moving into a back apartment in our apartment house. [There is no such apartment.] I remember that I had forgotten the existence of this apartment and am angry with myself. The apartment is very large, about 10 rooms, lovely dark woodwork. I am doubly angry at myself when I discover a lovely kitchen and bath between this apartment and our own, since we could have used these rooms ourselves, paying extra rent for them.(一些噪音吸引了我的注意。仔细察看后，我发现有人正搬进我们公寓住宅后面的那间公寓。[事实上并没有这样的一间公寓]我想到我早就忘了这间公寓的存在，就很气自己。这间公寓相当大，大概有10个房间，都是深色的木作装潢，非常漂亮。后来我又发现这间公寓和我们的公寓中间有一间可爱的厨房和浴室，当下我加倍气自己，因为要是我们多付些租金，或许早就可以使用这些房间了。
(The new family is large. The members operate an excellent clothing store inside the apartment, in the center. There is a staircase leading down to a side street. Clothing is arranged on shelves, and so forth. A sale is planned. Then I realize that I did know the people who lived in this apartment before also, and had forgotten. I am aware that I knew them in a dream, rather than in normal waking life.(这个新搬来的家庭人数很多。他们在公寓里面，就在中间的地方，经营一家高档服饰店。那里有楼梯通到了下面的小巷子，服饰摆放在架子上。他们筹划销售事宜。后来我明白，事实上我以前就认识住在这间公寓的那些人，但又忘记了。我知道我是在梦里，而不是正常的醒时生活中认识他们的。
(The men in the family are dark-completed, handsome men, olive skin. We all get along well and like each other very much. We stand laughing by the staircase. I’m curious about some other apartments, also in this building, and owned by our landlord also. I am happy and anticipatory, looking forward to seeing these apartments. Then on the staircase, in a pile of neatly-stacked clothing I discover a lovely dark green jacket with fur collar and zipper that is mine, and I remember now that I put it away last year for the season and forgot it until now. Another article of clothing catches my eye. I think it is mine for a moment and realize it is not.(这一家的几个男人都是帅哥，有着橄榄般深沉的肤色。我们大家相处得非常融洽，也非常喜欢彼此，我们笑笑地站在楼梯旁。对于我们房东在这栋建筑物里拥有的其他公寓，我也感到很好奇，我乐意也期待能看看这些房间。后来我在楼梯上面一叠摆放整齐的衣服中，发现一件可爱的墨绿色夹克，有毛领和拉链，那是我的衣服，我到现在才想起来是去年换季时扔掉的。另外还有一件衣服也吸引了我的目光，一时之间以为是我的，但后来知道并不是。
(I laugh. These people all like me very much. I leap with more than normal grace down from the banister. One man puts an arm out to assist me. Again, full of joy great joy, it seems, I look forward to looking at the other apartments. Then I remember that it is nearly lunchtime, and Rob will be home. I decide to go home myself and then return to look at these apartments.(我笑了笑，这些人都很喜欢我，我非常开心地从楼梯扶手上跳了下来，这时有个男人伸手帮助我。再次地，我满怀欣喜，似乎高兴至极。我期待能去看看其他公寓，后来想到已接近中午用餐时刻，罗快要回家了，所以决定先回家后再回来看看这些公寓。
(Outside there is still another apartment house that belongs to our landlord. A door is open. I look inside, see furniture, and know it is not vacant. Now it is raining slightly. I drop my cigarettes, pick them up, then discover that I also have an extra pack I did not know about. One pack is wet, but will dry. The other pack is only slightly wet.(那间公寓外面还有另一间公寓，是我们房东的，有一扇门开着，我往内瞧瞧，结果看到了家具，发现它并不是空屋。这时候天空下起小雨，我掉了几根烟，捡起来后才发现另外还有一包，自己竟然不知道。这包烟已经湿了，但很快就会干，另一包只湿了一点点。
(A paperboy comes across the yard and calk me by name. I do not know who he is, but think that I must have known him sometime in the past. Now I begin to realize that the whole thing is a dream. I think of looking at the other apartments now, before the dream is over, but realize that if I do I run the chance of forgetting this part of the dream, and I want to write it down.(一位送报生经过院子叫我的名字。我不知道他是谁，不过我想我之前一定在什么时候认识他。这时候我开始了解，所有这一切都只是一场梦。我打算在梦结束之前，再看看其他公寓，不过我也明白，如果这样做，可能会忘掉这一部分的梦，而我也想把梦记下来。
(Someplace in here I dance quite happily, am filled with the joy of discovery, and am quite as happy as I have ever been in my life. In the dream I also know that this dream is like another I had previously and had forgotten.(这时我在某个地方快乐地跳舞，心中满怀着新鲜感与乐趣，仿佛这是我这辈子最快乐的时光。在梦中我也知道，这个梦就像我之前做过的另一个梦一样，但我已经忘了那个梦。(我醒过来，精神仍然愉快饱满，之前的情绪完全消失。一直到我写下这个梦之后，才忆起第一个梦。第二个梦的情绪余韵犹存，令人再三回味。)第四册结束。
(I awoke, still full of good spirits, my previous mood completely vanished. Until I wrote this dream down, I did not even remember the first one. The mood of the second prevailed.)(我醒过来，精神仍然愉快饱满，之前的情绪完全消失。一直到我写下这个梦之后，才忆起第一个梦。第二个梦的情绪余韵犹存，令人再三回味。)第四册结束。
